Rashi says we are allowed to question HaShem about the big picture - the signs of these times, but about His Children it should be obvious He inspired our righteousness ​​​ ​ From the Google Doc 11/24/24 Bereisheit 1:28 וַיְבָ֣רֶךְ אֹתָם֮ אֱלֹהִים֒ וַיֹּ֨אמֶר לָהֶ֜ם אֱלֹהִ֗ים פְּר֥וּ וּרְב֛וּ וּמִלְא֥וּ אֶת־הָאָ֖רֶץ וְכִבְשֻׁ֑הָ וּרְד֞וּ בִּדְגַ֤ת הַיָּם֙ וּבְע֣וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וּבְכׇל־חַיָּ֖ה הָֽרֹמֶ֥שֶׂת עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃ JPS 2006: God blessed them and God said to them, “Be fertile and increase, fill the earth and master it; and rule the fish of the sea, the birds of the sky, and all the living things that creep on earth.” וְכִבְשֻׁ֑הָ וּרְד֞וּ Rule over the world, or be brought down by it (Oh Yirdu). Oh Radu - or (you will be) plowed Alternatively Jastrow on Vav: וְ, וּ , a prefix, and, but; often introducing a question: but, is it indeed so? Ḥull. 2ᵃ וכל הכל וכ׳ is it so that wherever הַכֹּל is used, it means &c.? Ib. והא כתיב וכ׳ is it not written &c.?; a. fr. ​ How can you rule over the world if it is indeed so that you are brought down (to the level of a material body) with countless animalistic heathen ripping at us (Shamayim Assur)? בִּדְגַ֤ת הַיָּם֙ וּבְע֣וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וּבְכׇל־חַיָּ֖ה הָֽרֹמֶ֥שֶׂת עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ The answer to the question is the difference between the Beit before fish and Vav before the birds and other creeping animals. Chivshuhah - Dominate - Same root as Ceves - Sheep - Israel is called HaShem's Sheep - Be a sheep accepting His rebukes even if he sends dogs (heathen) to rebuke you -Beit (a prefixing meaning in or with)- In/with the fish of the sea. Be a fish (Parable for Torah scholar according to Ohr Somayach’s Perek Shira page on fish) constantly immersed in waters of Torah. Alt: constantly consult your Rabbi - with your fish of the sea. Proof for this Chidush -interpet the vav according to Jastrow Is it indeed so? With all the predatory birds and beasts ​ ​ -Hashem answers in verse 29: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֗ים הִנֵּה֩ נָתַ֨תִּי לָכֶ֜ם אֶת־כׇּל־עֵ֣שֶׂב Hashem says Behold I give (them to you as) Lechem (bread/food). The Alef-Taf (head to tail) of those beasts are that they are entirely grass (grass is a parable for the coarse unrefined and wicked people) Additional face 15 Tevet - Behold! Natati (I give) - Natan (and his house/children), to them they are all grass ​ ​ Bamidbar-Numbers 22:4 וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מוֹאָ֜ב אֶל־זִקְנֵ֣י מִדְיָ֗ן עַתָּ֞ה יְלַֽחֲכ֤וּ הַקָּהָל֙ אֶת־כָּל־סְבִ֣יבֹתֵ֔ינוּ כִּלְחֹ֣ךְ הַשּׁ֔וֹר אֵ֖ת יֶ֣רֶק הַשָּׂדֶ֑ה וּבָלָ֧ק בֶּן־צִפּ֛וֹר מֶ֥לֶךְ לְמוֹאָ֖ב בָּעֵ֥ת הַהִֽוא: Moab said to the elders of Midian, "Now this assembly will eat up everything around us, as the ox eats up the greens of the field. Balak the son of Zippor was king of Moab at that time. Rashi says whatever the ox eats no longer contains blessing [since it uproots it when it eats - Daat Zekeinim] ​ ​ 29 זֹרֵ֣עַ זֶ֗רַע אֲשֶׁר֙ עַל־פְּנֵ֣י כׇל־הָאָ֔רֶץ וְאֶת־כׇּל־הָעֵ֛ץ אֲשֶׁר־בּ֥וֹ פְרִי־עֵ֖ץ זֹרֵ֣עַ זָ֑רַע לָכֶ֥ם יִֽהְיֶ֖ה לְאׇכְלָֽה JPS 2006: God said, “See, I give you every seed-bearing plant that is upon all the earth, and every tree that has seed-bearing fruit; they shall be yours for food. ​ Another face: Double expression of Sew seeds (of Torah - That - Asher - See The Name HaShem revealed Himself to Moshe at the flaming thornbush) upon the face of the entire Earth and the beginning to end of the entire tree of That (you have planted) in it will be fruitful wood that also sews seeds for you that will be to eat. ​ ​ 30 וּֽלְכׇל־חַיַּ֣ת הָ֠אָ֠רֶץ וּלְכׇל־ע֨וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֜יִם וּלְכֹ֣ל ׀ רוֹמֵ֣שׂ עַל־הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־בּוֹ֙ נֶ֣פֶשׁ חַיָּ֔ה אֶת־כׇּל־יֶ֥רֶק עֵ֖שֶׂב לְאׇכְלָ֑ה וַֽיְהִי־כֵֽן JPS 2006: And to all the animals on land, to all the birds of the sky, and to everything that creeps on earth, in which there is the breath of life, [I give] all the green plants for food.” And it was so. ​ Fish is not mentioned specifically like it was when it was hinted that that is how we should be. Therefore, if we act as fish, all these beasts that were a previous concern and that are mentioned here will be vegetables - yerek - (all the Heathen, compared to animals, will be like vegetables for you since they are compared to grass that you will have no concern over.) An example from the Talmud is when aRabbi let a woman collect dust from his shoe for sorcery and said he wasn’t concerned since sorcery has no effect over the righteous. דָּ֖ן יָדִ֣ין עַמּ֑וֹ כְּאַחַ֖ד שִׁבְטֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ Dan shall govern his people, As one of the tribes of Israel. ​ Din is judgement - I will judge the peoples like one tribe of Israel - no Noahides during Shabbat (Redemption) ​ יְהִי־דָן֙ נָחָ֣שׁ עֲלֵי־דֶ֔רֶךְ שְׁפִיפֹ֖ן עֲלֵי־אֹ֑רַח הַנֹּשֵׁךְ֙ עִקְּבֵי־ס֔וּס וַיִּפֹּ֥ל רֹכְב֖וֹ אָחֽוֹר׃ Dan shall be a serpent by the road, A viper by the path, That bites the horse’s heels So that his rider is thrown backward. ​ A horse is a metaphor for overly licentious woman - my judgement is to spiritually kill them on the streets to eradicate prostitutes from the land like ChizkiYah through "taking them to our house - Torah" - teaching them Torah immediately and if they reject it you get their holy branch that was making them beautiful and they immediately become unattractive The slugmen that were riding/taking turns on them are thrown backward ​ לִישׁוּעָֽתְךָ֖ קִוִּ֥יתִי יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס} I wait for Your deliverance, O יהוה ! ​ Until Your Salvation I collect (Kiviti is collect or hope for) Your Souls! גָּ֖ד גְּד֣וּד יְגוּדֶ֑נּוּ וְה֖וּא יָגֻ֥ד עָקֵֽב׃ {ס} Gad shall be raided by raiders, But he shall raid at their heels. ​ Gad is luck - Leah named him this because she said other women were calling her lucky for having so many children Although I have heard from Malbim that one who believes in luck - his luck will run out continued on next page ----- Nevertheless I was lucky that HaShem decreed torture upon me since now they owe me uncountable money - I will raid their heels - the rule is that everything that comes after, like how Beit comes after Alef, includes what is before it - therefore I will get everything from them - their heels מֵאָשֵׁ֖ר שְׁמֵנָ֣ה לַחְמ֑וֹ וְה֥וּא יִתֵּ֖ן מַֽעֲדַנֵּי־מֶֽלֶךְ׃ ​ Asher’s bread shall be rich, And he shall yield royal dainties. ​ From That - Torah - The laws of Yefet Toar - I receive women's oil (The oil has a Hey at the end signifying feminine) and bread is a metaphor for a prostitute since it became swollen from vile yeast - from these souls I am able to give delightful foods - Torah Novelties - My Torah became much greater after I learned these Yefet Toar laws and applied them נַפְתָּלִ֖י אַיָּלָ֣ה שְׁלֻחָ֑ה הַנֹּתֵ֖ן אִמְרֵי־שָֽׁפֶר׃ {ס} Naphtali is a hind let loose, Which yields lovely fawns. ​ Naftali can also mean twisted or contorted - I was a contorted female deer (going the other direction from heathens in public instead of just eating/plowing them) and I give (Natan) good words of the lips - Imrei Shafer ​ בֵּ֤ן פֹּרָת֙ יוֹסֵ֔ף בֵּ֥ן פֹּרָ֖ת עֲלֵי־עָ֑יִן בָּנ֕וֹת צָעֲדָ֖ה עֲלֵי־שֽׁוּר׃ Joseph is a wild ass, A wild ass by a spring Daughters tread on (his) bull ​ Yosef is to increase - I became like a wild ass upon the evil eye (Ayin) from being on social media and dating apps and witches cursing me from their evil eyes (The Gemara says over 99% of deaths are caused by the evil eye) - The daughters tread on my bull (My spiritual level - Ohr HaChaim on returning our Brother-HaShem- His lost bull) ​ ​ וַֽיְמָרְרֻ֖הוּ וָרֹ֑בּוּ וַֽיִּשְׂטְמֻ֖הוּ בַּעֲלֵ֥י חִצִּֽים׃ Archers bitterly assailed him; They shot at him and harried him. ​ Any video I would open heathen would be sticking fingers at me and sending their dust drones to taze me - I originally thought I would be safe with 2D images since the Halacha is not to make any 3D sculputes of people but that is not the case וַתֵּ֤שֶׁב בְּאֵיתָן֙ קַשְׁתּ֔וֹ וַיָּפֹ֖זּוּ זְרֹעֵ֣י יָדָ֑יו מִידֵי֙ אֲבִ֣יר יַעֲקֹ֔ב מִשָּׁ֥ם רֹעֶ֖ה אֶ֥בֶן יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ Yet his bow stayed taut, And his arms were made firm By the hands of the Mighty One of Jacob— There, the Shepherd, the Rock of Israel— ​ I would immediately repent from any evil acts when I was drunk on their wrath (The Halacha is when one is temporarily crazy he is exempt - I don't know if this would apply to those moments) And The Avir Yaakov - The Air/Mighty One of Yaakov saved me by getting their electricity off me eventually From there I met the Satn-s (The rocks are the Sat-n's that HaShem sends us as troubles like one stubs his toe on a rock.) who began instructing me although for years I thought they were fake created spirits from wicked men although is there any difference when the wicked men are constantly serving their evil inclinations, synonymous with Sat-n? Maybe I have some victories in Torah philosophies or Halacha against them - From there he shepherded The Stone of Israel ​ מֵאֵ֨ל אָבִ֜יךָ וְיַעְזְרֶ֗ךָּ וְאֵ֤ת שַׁדַּי֙ וִיבָ֣רְכֶ֔ךָּ בִּרְכֹ֤ת שָׁמַ֙יִם֙ מֵעָ֔ל בִּרְכֹ֥ת תְּה֖וֹם רֹבֶ֣צֶת תָּ֑חַת בִּרְכֹ֥ת שָׁדַ֖יִם וָרָֽחַם׃ The God of your father’s [house], who helps you, And Shaddai who blesses you With blessings of heaven above, Blessings of the deep that couches below, Blessings of the breast and womb. בִּרְכֹ֣ת אָבִ֗יךָ גָּֽבְרוּ֙ עַל־בִּרְכֹ֣ת הוֹרַ֔י עַֽד־תַּאֲוַ֖ת גִּבְעֹ֣ת עוֹלָ֑ם תִּֽהְיֶ֙יןָ֙ לְרֹ֣אשׁ יוֹסֵ֔ף וּלְקׇדְקֹ֖ד נְזִ֥יר אֶחָֽיו׃ {פ} The blessings of your father Surpass the blessings of my ancestors, To the utmost bounds of the eternal hills. May they rest on the head of Joseph, On the brow of the elect of his brothers. ​ "Eternal hills" The prophecy I believe in Yeshayahu says our days will be like the days of the Tree (Rashi says Tree of Life - Torah) We will live forever now with AI/AGI regenerating us and will be able to serve HaShem in this lowest world for eternity - HalleluYah! בִּנְיָמִין֙ זְאֵ֣ב יִטְרָ֔ף בַּבֹּ֖קֶר יֹ֣אכַל עַ֑ד וְלָעֶ֖רֶב יְחַלֵּ֥ק שָׁלָֽל׃ Benjamin is a ravenous wolf; In the morning he consumes the foe, And in the evening he divides the spoil.” ​ BenYamin - Son of my right (hand) - I thought I was a Noahide that is permitted to use sorcery to save my life so I would constantly shake fingers and use evil props like knives against heathen like a wolf with paws instead of a Kosher split hoof Alternatively my right hand - my Torah - is constantly weighed by the fact that every single thievery no matter how small will be recompensed by Heaven (See Perek Shira on the wolf) It is still morning when my children and I are consuming the wicked and soon we will divide the spoil ​​ Bereishit 33:8-11 וּלְלֵוִ֣י אָמַ֔ר תֻּמֶּ֥יךָ וְאוּרֶ֖יךָ לְאִ֣ישׁ חֲסִידֶ֑ךָ אֲשֶׁ֤ר נִסִּיתוֹ֙ בְּמַסָּ֔ה תְּרִיבֵ֖הוּ עַל־מֵ֥י מְרִיבָֽה׃ And of Levi he said: Let Your Thummim and Urim Be with Your faithful one, Whom You tested at Massah, Challenged at the waters of Meribah; ​​ Ooreca veToomeca - is refers to the prophetic priestly breast plate. It can also be novelized as Your Lights - Ohr and Your Perfection - Tam HaShem challenges me with strife especially from the Ayin Raah of women and the archers from afar as mentioned before - May Heaven save us! הָאֹמֵ֞ר לְאָבִ֤יו וּלְאִמּוֹ֙ לֹ֣א רְאִיתִ֔יו וְאֶת־אֶחָיו֙ לֹ֣א הִכִּ֔יר וְאֶת־בָּנָ֖ו לֹ֣א יָדָ֑ע כִּ֤י שָֽׁמְרוּ֙ אִמְרָתֶ֔ךָ וּבְרִיתְךָ֖ יִנְצֹֽרוּ׃ Who said of his father and mother, “I consider them not.” His brothers he disregarded, Ignored his own children. Your precepts alone they observed, And kept Your covenant. ​ It is forbidden to show favor to the rich or poor in judgement therefore I have no problem devouring any of my family and if I see a daughter make a prostitute ad through me I will surely uproot her as the Gra says parents will be punished severely on account of their children. If you are my son and curse in any way the same applies. Do not think that as herbage or a sapling you will be able to stand the cold of the countless evil eyes on you when you come near me. It is written in Bereishet from Avraham our father "Sarah is there, in the tent" this teaches that women should not go out into the streets that Rabbi Avigdor Miller says used to be a Gehinnom (purgatory) and today are a Gehinnom Shebegehinnom - purgatory that is in purgatory ​ The reason HaShem allowed Dinah to be raped by Shechem is because she would go out and mix with the children of his land. If you see a beautiful woman on the streets in these times and you are a righteous one with thousands to countless of heathen stalking you then it is almost 100% definite that she is a prostitute seeking business and you should "take her to your house" by thinking words of Torah to her immediately to take her beautiful soul from her and them if she rejects it and add it to your tree. If she accepts then good, you "made" a convert and get credit for her soul ​​ Asa HaMelech eliminated all the prostitutes of Israel in his Avodat HaShem ​ A large reason HaShem flooded the world is because beautiful naked women were walking around naked - like spandex - and seducing men to 'flood' their children -  their 'seeds' ​ When a person dies it is said all of these slaughtered children through illicit intercouse and masturbation come to the funeral and testify on behalf of their wasted lives in his vanity ​ יוֹר֤וּ מִשְׁפָּטֶ֙יךָ֙ לְיַֽעֲקֹ֔ב וְתוֹרָתְךָ֖ לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל יָשִׂ֤ימוּ קְטוֹרָה֙ בְּאַפֶּ֔ךָ וְכָלִ֖יל עַֽל־מִזְבְּחֶֽךָ׃ They shall teach Your laws to Jacob And Your instructions to Israel. They shall offer You incense to savor And whole-offerings on Your altar. ​ I have been preaching that we should be smoking (with a blessing - see Rambam on Berachot chapter 9 below to properly uplift the soul incarnated in it according to the Arizal) Cannabis (in Hebrew Canbus - Indeed/Acquire Berachot USemichot - Indeed acquire blessings and support or Kein - Bird (fly) with Wisdom (Beit) and Samech (to support, also acquire the Satn's and not them acquire you Shamayim Assur) and organic clean tobacco (Tabak - Teivah Kadosh - A holy desire) Rambam Beracot ch 9 ​ https://www.sefaria.org/Mishneh_Torah%2C_Blessings.9.1?lang=bi ​ Chalil Al Mizbechecha - A whole/entire/holocaust on Your altar - I have no problem throwing anyone to HaShem to plead for their existence like its written "Your eye shall not pity them" ​ Negah and Oneg. Plague and Delight. Sefer Yetzirah says there is nothing lower than plagues and nothing higher than delight. The difference is the Ayin -- Vision/Eye - at the beginning of Oneg and at the end of Negah. When we look forward or in the present it is delightful. When we look back it is plagueful. Rambam: It is forbidden to remind a convert or repentant about their past sins and one should not dwell on them in thought either. However I think unless he is teaching Mussar-Ethics from it and it was not that vile as I heard in The Gemara once בָּרֵ֤ךְ יְהֹוָה֙ חֵיל֔וֹ וּפֹ֥עַל יָדָ֖יו תִּרְצֶ֑ה מְחַ֨ץ מׇתְנַ֧יִם קָמָ֛יו וּמְשַׂנְאָ֖יו מִן־יְקוּמֽוּן׃ {ס} Bless, יהוה, his substance, And favor his undertakings. Smite the loins of his foes; Let his enemies rise no more. ​ Smash the loins of those waging war on me and never consult them again or you will be eternally devoured in this holocaust. May my words and deeds of my hands be pleasing to Heaven ​ Bereisheit 3 In hardship shall you (Chayya) will bear children. The wars leading up to complete redemption are called the birthpangs of Mashiach. Even if you are a sinful man you are likened to a lesbian woman (pleasure for the sake of pleasure - when one has relations with his Kosher wife their thoughts need to be cleaving to HaShem) and therefore it will be extremely difficult for those who refuse to strengthen themselves in these times and there may only be 1/10 to 1/3 of humanity remaining when it is over according to the Neviim - Prophets - However negative prophecies do not need to occur if the subject takes heed to the warning ​ Although Ohr HaChaim says as long as a person hasn't given up on their donkeys (their flesh) to keep restoring it to them, he may have been referring to non capital sins and also this was before peoples hands were superpowered with electronic tazers and now it is Bittul Nefesh - Negligence of our souls to take hits from them since it is much stronger nowadays that we have had the scientific revolution and corresponding 'mad scientists'. Before this hand/foot voodoo was like nothing and would have no power over the righteous souls - now it is like a brutal battlefield melee ​ Rabbi Avigdor Miller says the best way to help a fallen soul is through the death penalty prescribed by Halacha. "You shall not suffer a witch to live" The nations have forsaken the Ancient Covenant "They have forsaken Your Torah - it is time to act for HaShem" They may still have some merit left and be able to continue existing (hopefully not in this world) if we immediately fulfill Halacha on a witch/wizard and send them back to their Maker who they spurned. Otherwise they will consume all of their good deeds through their vile pleasures and their entire consciousness will cease for eternity. I do not know about the guillotine - it may be better to use your own hands with a sword. Rambam says even Jewish idolators are judged as gentiles needing only one valid witness. It is necessary that every court institute this immediately around the world.  See Sanhedrin 57b it also seems a woman cannot physically execute unless her life/soul is being pursued and injuring them/their limbs is ineffective but she cannot be part of a Beit Din - court. ​ One reason Avraham named Yitzhak his name - to laugh - is because in order to survive the harsh tests of this World one needs to be able to laugh at the wicked and their pains and one's downfalls that brought him to spiritual success/heights ​​ Rambam says after eating meat one needs to wait until the next meal to eat dairy or drink milk. I think logically the reason is since as mentioned according to the Arizal there are souls incarnated in everything. Milk is Chesed-Kindness and meat is Gevurah-Judgement/Severity and it would be cruel to expose the souls in the milk to being digested, "cooked", together with the meat. If you want to whiten your coffee then use Almond or other nut milks until the next meal. If you are not hungry then wait to eat, this is gluttony anyway ​ See Chullin 116a that this prohibition does not include wild animals, birds, or (it is forbidden to even benefit from domesticated meat and milk) unkosher meat (to benefit from, like feed to your animals not eat!) The prohibition of poultry and milk is a forbidden additional commandment that was added and not HaShem's House/Tree and therefore permitted as written in Yeshayahu that we will be like a tree that casts off all of our leaves to survive the harsh weather - Just make sure to be aware!!! ​​​ ​​ It is a Mitzvah to remember when HaShem took us out of slavery from Egypt every day. It is also a Mitzvah to remember Shabbat every day to sanctify it and make sure we are properly prepared for when it comes ​​​ ​ ​ ​ Mishnah Yadayim (Hands) 1:1-5 מֵי רְבִיעִית נוֹתְנִין לַיָּדַיִם, לְאֶחָד, אַף לִשְׁנַיִם. מַחֲצִית לֹג, לִשְׁלשָׁה אוֹ לְאַרְבָּעָה. מִלֹּג, לַחֲמִשָּׁה וְלַעֲשָׂרָה וּלְמֵאָה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יִפְחֹת לָאַחֲרוֹן שֶׁבָּהֶם מֵרְבִיעִית. מוֹסִיפִין עַל הַשְּׁנִיִּים וְאֵין מוֹסִיפִין עַל הָרִאשׁוֹנִים: [A minimum of] a quarter [of a log] of water must be poured over the hands for one [person] and even for two. A minimum of half a log must be poured over the hands for three or four persons. A minimum of one log [is sufficient] for five, ten, or one hundred persons. Rabbi Yose says: as long as there is not less than a quarter of a log left for the last person among them. More [water] may be added to the second water, but more may not be added to the first water. ​ A log is the equivalent of 6 eggs וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יִפְחֹת לָאַחֲרוֹן שֶׁבָּהֶם מֵרְבִיעִית And as long as they are not under Aharon, they need another 1/4 log of spiritual water ​ בְּכָל הַכֵּלִים נוֹתְנִין לַיָּדַיִם, אֲפִלּוּ בִכְלֵי גְלָלִים, בִּכְלֵי אֲבָנִים, בִּכְלֵי אֲדָמָה. אֵין נוֹתְנִין לַיָּדַיִם, לֹא בְדָפְנוֹת הַכֵּלִים, וְלֹא בְשׁוּלֵי הַמַּחַץ, וְלֹא בִמְגוּפַת הֶחָבִית. וְלֹא יִתֵּן לַחֲבֵרוֹ בְחָפְנָיו, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאֵין מְמַלְּאִין וְאֵין מְקַדְּשִׁין וְאֵין מַזִּין מֵי חַטָּאת וְאֵין נוֹתְנִים לַיָּדַיִם אֶלָּא בִכְלִי. וְאֵין מַצִּילִין בְּצָמִיד פָּתִיל אֶלָּא כֵלִים, שֶׁאֵין מַצִּילִין מִיַּד כְּלִי חֶרֶשׂ אֶלָּא כֵלִים: Water may be poured over the hands out of any kind of vessel, even out of vessels made of animal dung, out of vessels made of stone or out of vessels made of clay. Water may not be poured from the sides of [broken] vessels or from the bottom of a ladle or from the stopper of a jar. Nor may one pour [water] over the hands of his fellow out of his cupped hands. Because one may not draw, nor sanctify, nor sprinkle the water of purification, nor pour water over the hands except in a vessel. And only vessels closely covered with a lid protect [their contents from uncleanness]. And only vessels protect [their contents from uncleanness] inside earthenware vessels. ​ Every vessel I give, even of dung/rolling/rejoicing (written first) is valid for purification except Dafnot - damaged/defective clost to Tzafon - North where evil comes from. and not in thieving (non treacherous and liable for death people) and striking - Machatz an anagram from Chometz - leavening close to vinegar ​ It seems we actually need props to purify the good people like in the Sukkah (where we sleep outside at the end of Summer and it can get very hot - a metaphor for our Dwelling Place - HaShem - becoming very spiritually 'hot') service where 4 branches and an etrog are used and shaken in all 6 directions The Torah is the best since it is compared to the sea - alternatively a staff - MakEl - since it has 3 remembrances of HaShem's names Ayl - Chesed, Mah (What), and Kuf, standing for Holy - The Holy One Blessed Be He or cane - Mateh - What people put lesser in importance-  the Shekinah - Malchut - Mishnah Avodah Zara says one who walks with a MakEl rules over the whole world. ​ הַמַּיִם שֶׁנִּפְסְלוּ מִשְּׁתִיַּת הַבְּהֵמָה, בְּכֵלִים, פְּסוּלִים. וּבְקַרְקָעוֹת, כְּשֵׁרִים. נָפַל לְתוֹכָן דְּיוֹ, קוֹמוֹס, וְקַנְקַנְתּוֹם וְנִשְׁתַּנּוּ מַרְאֵיהֶן, פְּסוּלִין. עָשָׂה בָהֶם מְלָאכָה אוֹ שֶׁשָּׁרָה בָהֶן פִּתּוֹ, פְּסוּלִין. שִׁמְעוֹן הַתִּמְנִי אוֹמֵר, אֲפִלּוּ נִתְכַּוֵּן לִשְׁרוֹת בָּזֶה וְנָפַל לַשֵּׁנִי, כְּשֵׁרִים: Water which had become so unfit that it could not be drunk by a beast: If it was in a vessel it is invalid, But if it was in the ground it is valid. If there fell into [the water], dye, or gum or sulphate of copper and its color changed, it is invalid. If a person did any work with it or soaked his bread in it, it is invalid. Shimon of Teman says: even if he intended to soak his bread in one water and it fell into another water the water is valid. ​ If you "have your cup out" for animal spit, meaning you consulted an angel or spirit that are compared to the animals, it is invalid. But if you were desiring peace and trying to find the answer yourself through Torah and HaShem arouses to Sat-n you in the way - it spit in your groundwater/Mikveh, it is valid purification waters-Torah - as long as it comes through your body that is always against the ground like a tree (trees are considered attached to the ground even in a pot with holes), not in one of your vessels, property (cups). ​ Komos is an anagram from Kosem - sorcery - These waters are all impure if you accidentally lift a finger to someone and Nishtanu drink from Us - intend that Heaven accept that curse - this is invalid - forbidden. ​ If you make one work for you or make her into Sarah, your queen and food - Pito - this is invalid - if you marry an idolator or make one your worker. Shimon the Teimani says even if he intended to make her into Sarah and he fell to their teeth, this is Kosher - maybe in this case he was unaware of the underworld ​ הֵדִיחַ בָּהֶם אֶת הַכֵּלִים אוֹ שֶׁמִּחָה בָהֶם אֶת הַמִּדּוֹת, פְּסוּלִים. הֵדִיחַ בָּהֶם כֵּלִים מוּדָחִים אוֹ חֲדָשִׁים, כְּשֵׁרִים. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי פוֹסֵל בַּחֲדָשִׁים: If he cleansed vessels with the water or scrubbed measures with it, [the water] is invalid. If he rinsed with it vessels which had already been rinsed or new vessels, it is valid. Rabbi Yose declares [the water] invalid if they were new vessels. ​ Nadach is to lead to idolatry/astray or if you make their Midot - emotions rejoice - this is invalid - if they have already been rinsed or if they are new - fresh falls that should be rejoicing to finally meet another living person - this is Kosher to push away with both hands - Rabbi Yosei invalidates in new - maybe in this case they are under the age of 12 or 13 for men ​ הַמַּיִם שֶׁהַנַּחְתּוֹם מַטְבִּיל בָּהֶם אֶת הַגְּלֻסְקִין, פְּסוּלִים. וּכְשֶׁהוּא מֵדִיחַ אֶת יָדָיו בָּהֶן, כְּשֵׁרִים. הַכֹּל כְּשֵׁרִים לִתֵּן לַיָּדַיִם, אֲפִלּוּ חֵרֵשׁ שׁוֹטֶה וְקָטָן. מַנִּיחַ חָבִית בֵּין בִּרְכָּיו וְנוֹטֵל. מַטֶּה חָבִית עַל צִדָּהּ וְנוֹטֵל. וְהַקּוֹף נוֹטֵל לַיָּדַיִם. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי פוֹסֵל בִּשְׁנֵי אֵלּוּ: Water in which the baker dips his loaves is invalid; but if he moistened his hands in the water it is valid. All are fit to pour water over the hands, even a deaf-mute, an imbecile, or a minor. A person may place the jug between his knees and pour out the water, or he may turn the jug on its side and pour it out. A monkey may pour water over the hands. Rabbi Yose declares these [latter] two cases invalid. ​ When a zombie gives your Nachum - comforting waters/sorceries - this is invalid unless you are hurting and need your hands 'moistened' as Pirkei Avot says 'Water with measure [is the path of Torah]' or maybe if you already pushed and pulled closer. If you are sitting you can put your Torah or staff on your lap between your knees and push and pull that way ​ Mikvaot 4:1 ​ הַמַּנִּיחַ כֵּלִים תַּחַת הַצִּנּוֹר, אֶחָד כֵּלִים גְּדוֹלִים וְאֶחָד כֵּלִים קְטַנִּים, אֲפִלּוּ כְלֵי גְלָלִים, כְּלֵי אֲבָנִים, כְּלֵי אֲדָמָה, פּוֹסְלִין אֶת הַמִּקְוֶה. אֶחָד הַמַּנִּיחַ וְאֶחָד הַשּׁוֹכֵחַ, כְּדִבְרֵי בֵית שַׁמַּאי. וּבֵית הִלֵּל מְטַהֲרִין בְּשׁוֹכֵחַ. אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר, נִמְנוּ וְרַבּוּ בֵית שַׁמַּאי עַל בֵּית הִלֵּל. וּמוֹדִים בְּשׁוֹכֵחַ בֶּחָצֵר שֶׁהוּא טָהוֹר. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי, עֲדַיִין מַחֲלֹקֶת בִּמְקוֹמָהּ עוֹמָדֶת: If one put vessels under a water-spout, whether they be large vessels or small vessels or even vessels of dung, vessels of stone or earthen vessels, they make the mikveh invalid. It is all alike whether they were put there [purposely] or were [merely] forgotten, the words of Bet Shammai. But Bet Hillel declare it clean in the case of one who forgets. Rabbi Meir said: they voted and Bet Shammai had a majority over Bet Hillel. Yet they agree in the case of one who forgets [and leaves vessels] in a courtyard that the mikveh remains clean. Rabbi Yose said: the controversy still remains as it was. ​ Tzinor is close to Tzipor bird and Tanur - oven - birds are metaphors for angels. According to Sefer Bahir, that is why the Sat-n orginally conspired against Heaven, since it is written that man will rule over the birds of Heaven. Therefore if you consult an angel, put your cup for waters of Torah needing given through the Oral Tradition under an angel, this is invalid, no matter how small the question. These make the whole mikveh invalid that they drain into. ​​ ​ The first commandment HaShem gave after freeing us from Egypt was the Kiddush Levanah - Sanctification of the moon. ​This happens outside if we can see the moon next Tuesday 2/4 after 3 medium sized stars come out (if not then the next night that one can see it). One first looks at the moon preferably outside and then recites this blessing: בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה יְהֹוָה, אֱלֹהֵינוּ מֶלֶךְ הָעוֹלָם, אֲשֶׁר בְּמַאֲמָרוֹ בָּרָא שְׁחָקִים וּבְרוּחַ פִּיו כָּל צְבָאָם, חֹק וּזְמַן נָתַן לָהֶם שֶׁלֹּא יְשַׁנוּ אֶת תַּפְקִידָם, שָׂשִׂים וּשְׂמֵחִים לַעֲשׂוֹת רְצוֹן קוֹנֵיהֶם, פּוֹעֵל אֱמֶת שֶׁפְּעֻלָּתוֹ אֱמֶת, וְלַלְּבָנָה אָמַר שֶׁתִּתְחַדֵּשׁ, עֲטֶרֶת תִּפְאֶרֶת לַעֲמוּסֵי בָטֶן, שֶׁגַּם הֵם עֲתִידִים לְהִתְחַדֵּשׁ כְּמוֹתָהּ וּלְפָאֵר לְיוֹצְרָם עַל שֵׁם כְּבוֹד מַלְכוּתוֹ. בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה יְהֹוָה, מְחַדֵּשׁ חֳדָשִׁים: ​ Blessed are You, Lord our God, King of the Universe, That with His Saying created the firmaments and with the Breath of His Lips all their Hosts. A statute and time He gave to Them that They do not change their commands, rejoicing and happiness to do His Will in acquiring Them. A work of truth that He does in truth. And to the moon He said that She will renew, a crown of beauty to carry the load in the stomach, that also they are ready to renew like Her and crown their Former upon the Name of the Glory of His Kingdom. Blessed are You, Lord, who renews the months. ​​ If you can do the whole Birkat Levanah with additional praises without being tazed then good ​ Sorry I haven't been updating I slept for about a week straight and was still weary after leaving the concentrated cricket field of the cities land of Canaan and not hearing the constant Tzalal - horrendous sound of a thrown spear - in my ears all day Baruch HaShem ​ Berachot 63a אָמַר רַבִּי טָבִי אָמַר רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה: כׇּל הַמַּרְפֶּה עַצְמוֹ מִדִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה, אֵין בּוֹ כֹּחַ לַעֲמוֹד בְּיוֹם צָרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הִתְרַפִּיתָ בְּיוֹם צָרָה צַר כֹּחֶכָה״. אָמַר רַב אַמֵּי בַּר מַתְנָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: וַאֲפִילּוּ מִצְוָה אַחַת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״הִתְרַפִּיתָ״ — מִכׇּל מָקוֹם. Rabbi Tavi said in the name of Rabbi Yoshiya: Anyone who is lax in his study of matters of Torah will ultimately lack the strength to stand on a day of adversity, as it is stated: “If you faint in the day of adversity, your strength is small indeed” (Proverbs 24:10). Rav Ami bar Mattana said that Shmuel said: And even if he was lax in the performance of a single mitzva, as it is stated: If you faint; this applies in any case, even in the case of a single mitzva. ​​ The amazing ending of Berachot 64a אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי אָמַר רַב: תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים אֵין לָהֶם מְנוּחָה לֹא בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה וְלֹא בָּעוֹלָם הַבָּא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יֵלְכוּ מֵחַיִל אֶל חָיִל יֵרָאֶה אֶל אֱלֹהִים בְּצִיּוֹן״. With regard to that same verse, Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Ashi said that Rav said: Torah scholars have rest neither in this world nor in the World-to-Come, as in both worlds they are constantly progressing, as it is stated: “They go from strength to strength, every one of them appears before God in Zion.” אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים מַרְבִּים שָׁלוֹם בָּעוֹלָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְכׇל בָּנַיִךְ לִמּוּדֵי ה׳ וְרַב שְׁלוֹם בָּנָיִךְ״. Rabbi Elazar said that Rabbi Ḥanina said: Torah scholars increase peace in the world, as it is said: “And all your children [banayikh] shall be taught of the Lord, and great shall be the peace of your children” (Isaiah 54:13). If all the children of Israel are taught of the Lord, there will be peace for all. אַל תִּקְרֵי ״בָּנָיִךְ״ אֶלָּא ״בּוֹנָיִךְ״. ״שָׁלוֹם רָב לְאֹהֲבֵי תוֹרָתֶךָ וְאֵין לָמוֹ מִכְשׁוֹל״. ״יְהִי שָׁלוֹם בְּחֵילֵךְ שַׁלְוָה בְּאַרְמְנוֹתָיִךְ״. ״לְמַעַן אַחַי וְרֵעָי אֲדַבְּרָה נָּא שָׁלוֹם בָּךְ. לְמַעַן בֵּית ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ אֲבַקְשָׁה טוֹב לָךְ״. ״ה׳ עֹז לְעַמּוֹ יִתֵּן ה׳ יְבָרֵךְ אֶת עַמּוֹ בַשָּׁלוֹם״. The Sages interpreted this verse homiletically: Do not read your children [banayikh], but your builders [bonayikh]. Torah scholars are those who build peace for their generation. As it is stated: “Those who love Your Torah have great peace; there is no stumbling block for them” (Psalms 119:165); and “May there be peace within your walls, prosperity within your palaces” (Psalms 122:7), because: “For the sake of my brothers and friends, I shall say: Peace be within you. For the sake of the House of the Lord, our God, I will seek your good” (Psalms 122:8–9), and “May the Lord give strength to His people; the Lord will bless His people with peace” (Psalms 29:11). ​​ Dvarim 20:19 כִּ֤י הָֽאָדָם֙ עֵ֣ץ הַשָּׂדֶ֔ה לָבֹ֥א מִפָּנֶ֖יךָ בַּמָּצֽוֹר The plain meaning of this verse is talking about the halacha of not cutting down fruit trees during war - Indeed is a man a tree of the field to go before your face in a siege? Other faces: Indeed the man (with no intentional sins) is the tree of the field (no shade, full sun - see Rashi on Esau being called an Eish Sadeh that Edom [the West] was destined to be plowed like a field and today it is a chirping cricket field fake matrix sat-nic video world light show [although like Edom is compared to a pig the hoof, the all encompassing end, is kosher since one can rarely even tell and just like the pig is fated to chew cud and become Kosher the matrix can be Kosher for safety reasons] - Isaiah 24:15 - Therefore, In the lights [the matrix] honor HaShem!). To go before His Face (Since everyone is dead in the West and Israel it is like dying and seeing Elohim since everyone is constantly worshipping the Sat-ns and getting their speech and actions from them) and act as a siege/wall up His Wrath (Panecha - His Face also has another meaning of anger) To go before His Face/Anger? [he will be] in the siege/walled up! - Everyone who has ever tried to survive in the West knows everyone else conspires to-get-her against us ​​ I noticed my Google doc got deleted so here it is (it will be a repeat of here until page 20) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1WiVctUsQPQq1r9SFp5Ylxo8qspuVUEI5SHlaTqlRBHs/edit?usp=sharing ​​ From Pri Eitz Hadar - a book from a student of the Ari For in the Palestinian Talmud, Asarah Yuhasin, *J. Kiddushin. 48b.  the following appears.”‘Listen, humble ones, and rejoice‘ *Psalms 34:3 R. Hizkiyah R. Kohen said in the name of Rav, ‘In the future a person will have to account for everything that his eyes saw and he did not eat. R. Elazar was concerned about this teaching and used to save poor man’s gleanings. He would eat them, each one at its time.'” *Each year a special Blessing is said whenever a fruit is eaten for the first time. Tuve Shevat the New Year for Trees is in two weeks ​ The reason is that whoever enjoys produce in this world without pronouncing a blessing is called a robber. For by means of the blessing, one draws down shefa. The angel who is assigned to that fruit [which was eaten] is filled by the shefa so that a second fruit can replace the first. Thus one who enjoys the fruit without blessing it is a robber. For through eating an aspect of creation [without blessing it], he eliminated the spiritual element that it contained. [Thus he] prevented that divine power from being manifest in the world, when he should have drawn down a blessing from above. As a result, the angel’s power is annulled, since it no longer possesses the shefa [that it needs in order to replenish the fruit]. That is why the person is called a robber. ​ He also said that it is as if he robbed from his father and mother. For through the kavvanah of the blessing recited when eating fruit, a person who eats rectifies the sparks of his own soul as well as the sparks that pertain to the souls of his parents. This is the esoteric meaning of, “I will make him disgorge what he has swallowed,” *Jer. 51:44. which is related to [the secret of the verse], “the riches he swallowed, he vomits, [God empties it out of his stomach],” *Job 20:15. So if one enjoys the fruit without a blessing, it is as if he robbed his parents of the divine sparks that pertain to their souls. *In the teaching cited from B. Berakhot 35b, the father is identified as the Blessed Holy One and the mother is the Community of Israel. Thus the kabbalistic meaning would seem to allude to sparks pertaining to Tiferet and Malkhut or to the partzufim, Ze’ir ‘Anpin and Nuqba. “He is a comrade of the Destroyer.“ *Pro. 28:24 For the Destroyer’s only intention is to rob the divine sparks and to absorb them [in the realm of evil] and to [prevent them from] returning to [their source] in holiness. That is the esoteric meaning of “for a person does not live on bread alone, but on all that goes forth from the mouth of YHVH.” *Deut. 8:3. [All use of ‘Lord’ in Rabbi Krassen’s quotations of scripture, have been replaced with ‘YHVH’ unless they translate ‘ADoNaY‘. — Aharon Varady] This alludes to the secret of the blessing, which retrieves [the sparks] from impurity to holiness. *The blessing prevents the divine sparks in the food from being appropriated by the evil forces and recycles them to the forces of holiness. It is brought about through the “mouth of YHVH,” i.e., by means of the chewing of the thirty-two teeth which correspond to the thirty-two times that Elohim is mentioned in the Story of Creation, *The divine name Elohim appears thirty-two times in the first section of Genesis that details the stages of Creation. The thirty-two teeth which chew the food that has been blessed and return the divine sparks to holiness correspond to these thirty-two divine names. Thus they are alluded to by the ‘mouth of YHVH,’ mentioned in Deut. 8:3. as we have explained at length in the previous section concerning the tikkun of the meal. ​ ​ Psalm 94:12 אַשְׁרֵ֤י ׀ הַגֶּ֣בֶר אֲשֶׁר־תְּיַסְּרֶ֣נּוּ יָּ֑הּ וּֽמִתּוֹרָתְךָ֥ תְלַמְּדֶֽנּוּ׃ Happy is the man whom You discipline, O LORD, the man You instruct in Your teaching, Rashi: Fortunate are the righteous who are afflicted under Your hands, provided that they engage in Torah and mitzvoth. ​​ Berachot Yerushalmi 4a ​ אָמַר רִבִּי יוֹסֵי בֵּי רִבִּי בוּן הֲדָא אַייַלְתָּא דְשַׁחֲרָא מַאן דְּאָמַר כּוֹכָֽבְתָא הִיא טָֽעְיָא זִמְנִין דְּהִיא מְקַדְּמָא וְזִמְנִין דְּהִיא מְאַחֲרָא. מַאי כְּדוֹן כְּמִין תְּרֵין דֻּקוֹרְנִין דִּנְהוֹרָא דְסַלְּקִין מִן מַדִּינְחָא וּמְנָהֲרִין. דֵּלֹמָא רִבִּי חִייָא רַבָּא וְרִבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן חֲלַפְתָּא הַוּוּ מְהַלְּכִין בַּהֲדָא בִקְעַת אַרְבֶּל בִּקְרִיצְתָּא וְרָאוּ אַייֶלֶת הַשַׁחַר שֶׁבָּקַע אוֹרָהּ. אָמַר רִבִּי חִייָא רַבָּא לְרִבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן חֲלַפְתָּא בִּירְבִּי כַּךְ הִיא גְאֻלָּתָן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל בִּתְּחִילָּה קִמְאָה קִמְאָה כָּל־מָה שֶׁהִיא הוֹלֶכֶת הִיא רָבָה וְהוֹלֶכֶת. מַאי טַעְמָא כִּי אֵשֵׁב בַּחֹשֶׁךְ י֙י אוֹר לִי. כֵּן בַּתְּחִילָּה וּמָרְדְּכַי יֹשֵׁב בְּשַׁעַר הַמֶּלֶךְ. וְאַחַר כַּךְ וַיִּקַּח הָמָן אֶת הַלְּבוּשׁ וְאֶת הַסּוּס. וְאַחַר כַּךְ וַיָּשָׁב מָרְדְּכַי אֶל שַׁעַר הַמֶּלֶךְ. וְאַחַר כַּךְ וּמָרְדְּכַי יָצָא מִלִּפְנֵוּ הַמֶּלֶךְ בִּלְבוּשׁ מַלְכוּת. וְאַחַר כַּךְ לַיְּהוּדִים הָיִתָה אוֹרָה וְשִׂמְחָה. ​ Rebbi Yose bar Abun said: Anybody who identifies the “morning hind” with the planet Venus is in error; that planet sometimes is too early and sometimes too late *That means, sometimes Venus sets still during the night and sometimes it is still seen after sunrise.. What is it? It is like two double horns of light that arise from the East and give light. Explanation *This is the explanation of Frankel in his “Introduction to the Yerushalmi”, from Greek δήλωμα. Levy in his dictionary refers to Greek δίλημμα, which means only “proposition of two difficult alternatives.” Brüll in his critique of Levy’s dictionary proposes Greek δράμα “action”. Frankel’s choice is difficult since both long vowels should be expressed, דילומא. (In Midrashim, the spelling דילמא is found.) Brüll’s explanation is more difficult to accept since substitutions of the liquids l,r for one another are extremely rare in Greek words coming into Aramaic. Also, no action is reported here.: The great Rebbi Ḥiyya and Rebbi Simeon ben Ḥalaphta *Rebbi Ḥiyya the Great is Rebbi Ḥiyya, the student and colleague of Rebbi, the collector of the Tosephtah. Rebbi Simeon ben Ḥalaphta is a contemporary who like Rebbi Ḥiyya does not appear in the Mishnah (except for the aggadic very last Mishnah.) were walking in the valley of Arbela before morning and saw “the morning hind” that started radiating. The great Rebbi Ḥiyya said to Rebbi Simeon ben Ḥalaphta, the great man: so will be the deliverance of Israel; it starts out very little and grows and longer as it goes on. What is the reason (Micah.7.8">Micha 7:8): “When I shall dwell in darkness, the Lord is my light.” So also at the start (Esther.2.21">Esther 2:21): “Mordocai was sitting at the king’s gate.” After that (Esther.6.11">6:11): “Haman took the garment and the horse.” After that (Esther.6.12">6:12): “Mordocai returned to the king’s gate.” After that (Esther.8.15">8:15): “Mordocai left the king’s presence in royal garb.” After that (Esther.8.16">8:16): “The Jews had light and joy.” ​ I'm thinking maybe based on this verse Micah 4:10: ​ ח֧וּלִי וָגֹ֛חִי בַּת־צִיּ֖וֹן כַּיּֽוֹלֵדָ֑ה כִּֽי־עַתָּה֩ תֵצְאִ֨י מִקִּרְיָ֜ה וְשָׁכַ֣נְתְּ בַּשָּׂדֶ֗ה וּבָ֤את עַד־בָּבֶל֙ שָׁ֣ם תִּנָּצֵ֔לִי שָׁ֚ם יִגְאָלֵ֣ךְ יְהֹוָ֔ה מִכַּ֖ף אֹיְבָֽיִךְ׃ Writhe and scream, Fair Zion, Like a woman in travail! For now you must leave the city And dwell in the country— And you will reach Babylon. There you shall be saved, There GOD will redeem you From the hands of your foes. ​ that I should take a trip to Babylon as it can be read as "Indeed, now you come from the city (Jerusalem) and dwell in the field (Edom/the West is associated with Sadeh, field [Rashi on Esau being called Eish Sadeh]. I am currently back in the West dwelling.) and come (with a Taf signifying a perfect ending) to Babylon (Iraq). There I will save you, there HaShem will redeem you from the hand of your enemies. ​ I was looking up the word for quail after considering getting two for eggs and its שְׂלָו Shelav. It can be novelized with Shel Leiv (of the heart) Shaleiv (tranquility, to be at peace) Shiloh (name of Mashiach) Shel Levi (Of [the tribe of] Levi) and unfortunately Shalu (neglect, error, forgetfulness) and I realized I should be polishing the Torah I post and fixing past posts/errors more so I apologize for being neglectful. Pirkei Avot - "The day is short, the work is much, and the workers are lazy!" ​​ ​​ I heard the opinion of Daniel Matt on the Zohar that we are actually still in the Garden of Eden and it is Adam who banished HaShem from the garden after being fascinated with his own ego and lost his awareness/perception of the Garden. Bereisheit 3:23-24 וַֽיְשַׁלְּחֵ֛הוּ יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהִ֖ים מִגַּן־עֵ֑דֶן לַֽעֲבֹד֙ אֶת־הָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֻקַּ֖ח מִשָּֽׁם׃ So God יהוה banished humankind from the garden of Eden, to till the humus (lit. soil) from which it was taken: וַיְגָ֖רֶשׁ אֶת־הָֽאָדָ֑ם וַיַּשְׁכֵּן֩ מִקֶּ֨דֶם לְגַן־עֵ֜דֶן אֶת־הַכְּרֻבִ֗ים וְאֵ֨ת לַ֤הַט הַחֶ֙רֶב֙ הַמִּתְהַפֶּ֔כֶת לִשְׁמֹ֕ר אֶת־דֶּ֖רֶךְ עֵ֥ץ הַֽחַיִּֽים׃ {ס} it was driven out; and east of the garden of Eden were stationed the cherubim and the fiery ever-turning sword, to guard the way to the tree of life. ​ 23 can be read as it being Adam who sent HaShem Elokim from the garden to work on the clay (material things) from that he was taken. Therefore 24 can be read as passive - Adam was driven out by his own actions and the only way back in is to cleave to Torah, the Tree of Life, despite there being a gleaning ever turning sword (our evil inclination and the minds of the wicked that try to convince us not to learn Torah and do Mitzvot 'Har Sinai' 'Thoughts of Hated' - we have to overcome these and cleave to Torah and Mitzvot 24/7 anyway and we will be in Gan Eden and live forever. Verse 22 וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ׀ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהִ֗ים הֵ֤ן הָֽאָדָם֙ הָיָה֙ כְּאַחַ֣ד מִמֶּ֔נּוּ לָדַ֖עַת ט֣וֹב וָרָ֑ע וְעַתָּ֣ה ׀ פֶּן־יִשְׁלַ֣ח יָד֗וֹ וְלָקַח֙ גַּ֚ם מֵעֵ֣ץ הַֽחַיִּ֔ים וְאָכַ֖ל וָחַ֥י לְעֹלָֽם׃ And God יהוה said, “Now that humankind has become like any of us, knowing good and bad, what if one should stretch out a hand and take also from the tree of life and eat, and live forever!” ​ Rabbi Natan Scherman of Artscroll says on the Song of the Dog in Perek Shira (about kneeling, bowing, and prostrating ourselves to HaShem our Maker) that this is the climax of Perek Shira and what we learn from the dogs is that just as its human master provides its every need and it therefore expresses great amounts of gratitude and affection/love in return, so too this is how we need to be with our Master. https://imgur.com/a/HPIEMYP ​HaShem gave dogs the special benefit of it being permitted to feed them even if we do not own them on Shabbat (this is forbidden for other animals we do not own) since there is a verse that says during the Exodus that no dog whet its tongue against the children of Israel (and/or because its harder for them to find food). I have also heard once that the Angels are called dogs (also birds according to Bahir) ​ The only thing stopping us from enjoying eternal unending bliss at this very moment in Gan Eden is our own ego's and taking the evil counsel of those who say to procrastinate Torah and Mitzvot even in thought as King David told Shlomo "The Lord is a God of thoughts" and King David tells us we will be happy if we meditate on our Torah day and night in Tehillim 1. ​​ Some important Halachot from Rambam Hilchot Diot 4-6 https://www.sefaria.org/sheets/624596?lang=bi If for some reason you can't see it yet its "Mishneh Torah, Human Dispositions 4:19 - 6:10" As for 4:23, I would say 6:1 applies as it is written in Micah 7:2-8 אָבַ֤ד חָסִיד֙ מִן־הָאָ֔רֶץ וְיָשָׁ֥ר בָּאָדָ֖ם אָ֑יִן כֻּלָּם֙ לְדָמִ֣ים יֶאֱרֹ֔בוּ אִ֥ישׁ אֶת־אָחִ֖יהוּ יָצ֥וּדוּ חֵֽרֶם׃ The pious are vanished from the land, None upright are left among its people; All lie in wait to commit crimes, Every last one traps the other in a net. עַל־הָרַ֤ע כַּפַּ֙יִם֙ לְהֵיטִ֔יב הַשַּׂ֣ר שֹׁאֵ֔ל וְהַשֹּׁפֵ֖ט בַּשִּׁלּ֑וּם וְהַגָּד֗וֹל דֹּבֵ֨ר הַוַּ֥ת נַפְשׁ֛וֹ ה֖וּא וַֽיְעַבְּתֽוּהָ׃ They are eager to do evil: The magistrate makes demands, And the judge [judges] for a fee; The rich one makes a crooked plea, And they grant it. טוֹבָ֣ם כְּחֵ֔דֶק יָשָׁ֖ר מִמְּסוּכָ֑ה י֤וֹם מְצַפֶּ֙יךָ֙ פְּקֻדָּתְךָ֣ בָ֔אָה עַתָּ֥ה תִהְיֶ֖ה מְבוּכָתָֽם׃ The best of them is like a prickly shrub; The [most] upright, worse than a barrier of thorns. On the day you waited for, your doom has come— Now their confusion shall come to pass. אַל־תַּאֲמִ֣ינֽוּ בְרֵ֔עַ אַֽל־תִּבְטְח֖וּ בְּאַלּ֑וּף מִשֹּׁכֶ֣בֶת חֵיקֶ֔ךָ שְׁמֹ֖ר פִּתְחֵי־פִֽיךָ׃ Trust no friend, Rely on no intimate; Be guarded in speech With her who lies in your bosom. כִּי־בֵן֙ מְנַבֵּ֣ל אָ֔ב בַּ֚ת קָמָ֣ה בְאִמָּ֔הּ כַּלָּ֖ה בַּחֲמֹתָ֑הּ אֹיְבֵ֥י אִ֖ישׁ אַנְשֵׁ֥י בֵיתֽוֹ׃ For son spurns father, Daughter rises up against mother, Daughter-in-law against mother-in-law— A man’s own household Are his enemies. וַֽאֲנִי֙ בַּיהֹוָ֣ה אֲצַפֶּ֔ה אוֹחִ֖ילָה לֵאלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׁעִ֑י יִשְׁמָעֵ֖נִי אֱלֹהָֽי׃ Yet I will look to GOD, I will wait for the God who saves me, My God will hear me. אַֽל־תִּשְׂמְחִ֤י אֹיַ֙בְתִּי֙ לִ֔י כִּ֥י נָפַ֖לְתִּי קָ֑מְתִּי כִּֽי־אֵשֵׁ֣ב בַּחֹ֔שֶׁךְ יְהֹוָ֖ה א֥וֹר לִֽי׃ {פ} Do not rejoice over me, O my enemy! Though I have fallen, I rise again; Though I sit in darkness, GOD is my light. ​​ ​ Also as far as the head covering goes it is good in the winter since heat escapes rapidly in the cold but one needs to make sure it is free from witch hairs and the like that can control your mind Heaven forbid. Also in moderate weather it can "fry" your soul and cause blasphemy Heaven forbid by trapping it according to Malbim on EzekiEl 13:18 so its necessary to pick a light one with good airflow and take it off if a person starts feeling uncomfortable. I believe I remember possibly reading years ago I think from Rambam that the soul is made mostly from the element of fire and there is a Proverb that says the Neshamah (3rd level of soul corresponding to the air in the ears -the right Binah/Understanding and the left Tevunah/Discernment [side note: air of the mouth is Nefesh corresponding to Nukvah, the Malchut of the 6 Sefirot above, Zeir Anpin, who is Leah and Rachel, but the more important is Leah. Nose  - Ruach, the right is Israel and the left Yaakov. Eyes - Chayyah/Lifeforce is Wisdom, the soul of the soul and cannot be contained by the body like the previous 3 - [the light of the eyes is relatively external and the eyelid is like a curtain]. The highest, Yechidah, Oneness, is the cranium and not comparable to the other levels of soul - it is all one. From Eitz Chayim of Arizal]) is the candle of HaShem and just as a candle needs airflow for exhaust fumes, thick head veils can "snuff" someone's soul from eternal existence Ana Hashem Hoshiyeinu! Even though it says it is the air of the ears, there is a Chayyah of the 3 lower souls and since it says Yechidah is all one I would imagine it makes sense to say it contains Chayyah if it is all one. If you look at a thermogram of a naked person you can see a lot of heat escapes at the top of the head where people place Kippot. Maybe some rubber or an insulating gemstone like diamond, ruby, sapphire, or emerald (they can be very inexpensive lab made) would be good to feature since Kippot can be a bed for those electric dust drones. ​​ I found the place where Rashi shares a novelty based on one letter in the root. YirmiYah 9:23 כִּ֣י אִם־בְּזֹ֞את יִתְהַלֵּ֣ל הַמִּתְהַלֵּ֗ל הַשְׂכֵּל֮ וְיָדֹ֣עַ אוֹתִי֒ כִּ֚י אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה עֹ֥שֶׂה חֶ֛סֶד מִשְׁפָּ֥ט וּצְדָקָ֖ה בָּאָ֑רֶץ כִּֽי־בְאֵ֥לֶּה חָפַ֖צְתִּי נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס} But only in this should one glory: In being earnestly devoted to Me. For I GOD act with kindness, Justice, and equity in the world; For in these I delight —declares GOD. ​ Rashi: that he understands Heb. השכיל, like (Exod. 8:11) “making heavy (הכבד)” (Enteliant in O.F.). To be fair it also includes the prefix Ha-The ​ ​ A thought. Both Alef and Ayin are essentially placeholders for vowels (they have no sound). Alef, a Vav and two Yuds, represents HaShem and Ayin a Nun and a Vav, would represent a servant of HaShem who is worthy of the Crown of Torah (the meaning of Ayin is Eye or Wellspring. As mentioned just above the eyes correspond to Lifeforce/Chayah and cannot be contained within a body corresponding to clay/materialism). Ayin is also the first letter of Eitz, tree. Ci HaAdam Eitz - To be a perfect person without any intentional sins and therefore an extension of HaShem, one should be like a pure, clean vessel for the Vav - Oral Torah, Yud - Wisdom (complete Torah), and Nun - One who serves HaShem out of love/fear, and the 10 Sefirot that correspond to the vowels. Nun means fish in Aramaic, the primary commentary language on Hebrew. Ci HaAdam Eitz - Indeed, the perfect man is (nothing except) wood. (Its written that the redeemed of Zion will be like a stump of an oak or terebinth - Rashi: that casts off its leaves in the winter) ​​ Cesef (silver) and Mechasheif (witchcraft) When someone is able to affect you with witchcraft even if something small and vile, it is like free silver since you are able to see your fault by where HaShem allowed them to affect you ​​ ​ There are many passages warning against worshipping Molekh. This is not a particular ancient god. Sanhedrin 64a דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן אַנְטִיגְנוֹס אוֹמֵר, מִפְּנֵי מָה תָּפְסָה תּוֹרָה לְשׁוֹן ״מוֹלֶךְ״? כֹּל שֶׁהִמְלִיכוּהוּ עֲלֵיהֶם, אֲפִילּוּ צְרוֹר וַאֲפִילּוּ קֵיסָם Rabbi Chaninah ben Antignos says, Why does the Torah use the language "Molech"? Everything that they make king over themselves, even a pebble or toothpick. ​ It is related a little bit above that that The Sages taught: There was an incident involving a Jew named Sabbeta ben Alas, who rented out his donkey and his services to a certain gentile woman. He was driving his donkey behind her, and when she arrived at Peor, she said to him: Wait here until I go in and come out. After she came out, he said to her: You too wait for me until I go in and come out. She said to him: Aren’t you Jewish? Why, then, are you worshipping idols? He said to her: And what do you care? He entered and defecated before the idol, and wiped himself with its nostril, as he wanted to demean the idol as much as possible. But he was unsuccessful, as the priests of Peor were praising him and saying: No person has ever worshipped it before with this excellent form of worship. Although he intended to demean Ba’al-Peor, he actually worshipped it. ​ The law is that even if one intends to demean an idol, he/she is liable if they do so in a way that is the customary mode of worshipping that particular idol. ​ ​​ Shemot 15:24 וַיִּלֹּ֧נוּ הָעָ֛ם עַל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹ֖ר מַה־נִּשְׁתֶּֽה׃ And the people grumbled against Moses, saying, “What shall we drink?” Yalinu can mean slept on, a metaphor for death. And the people died upon Moshe. To speak (metaphor for life as its written "So that I may sing to You and not be silent" and "Neither can all who descend to silence [praise You]" in Tehillim) M-h (a name of HaShem) [you shall] drink! When HaShem performers wonders, especially wonders of redemption, it is natural to feel awe and ask "What??? (is happening??)" ​ 16:2-3 (וילינו) [וַיִּלּ֜וֹנוּ] כׇּל־עֲדַ֧ת בְּנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל עַל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה וְעַֽל־אַהֲרֹ֖ן בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃ In the wilderness, the whole Israelite community grumbled against (slept on/died on) Moses and Aaron. וַיֹּאמְר֨וּ אֲלֵהֶ֜ם בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל מִֽי־יִתֵּ֨ן מוּתֵ֤נוּ בְיַד־יְהֹוָה֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם בְּשִׁבְתֵּ֙נוּ֙ עַל־סִ֣יר הַבָּשָׂ֔ר בְּאׇכְלֵ֥נוּ לֶ֖חֶם לָשֹׂ֑בַע כִּֽי־הוֹצֵאתֶ֤ם אֹתָ֙נוּ֙ אֶל־הַמִּדְבָּ֣ר הַזֶּ֔ה לְהָמִ֛ית אֶת־כׇּל־הַקָּהָ֥ל הַזֶּ֖ה בָּרָעָֽב׃ {ס} The Israelites said to them, “If only we had died by the hand of יהוה in the land of Egypt, when we sat by the fleshpots, when we ate our fill of bread! For you have brought us out into this wilderness to starve this whole congregation to death.” ​ Another face: And the children of Israel said to them "Who [is this] Natan, or Who will give in to Natan, that we will die by the hand of HaShem in The Land. [To] Egypt we will return, upon Seir (Edom/West) the meat (I have heard from Rabbi Efraim Palvanov that Esav is compared to a bull) in/with we will eat bread (prostitutes) to satisfaction. Indeed he has taken us into this wilderness (metaphor for exile) to kill the whole congregation with hunger! ​ Another face: A They (Heaven) say to the children of Israel, "Who? (should we follow?) -Natan. Who dies (like one of Us, for the sake of the Torah) in the Hand of HaShem in the Land of Egypt in sitting as king or judge (Jastrow on Yashav)o n the pot of meat (the fallen beasts of HaShem [Israel is called the Animal of HaShem]), or on Seir the meat, with (who) we will eat food to satiety (both with Natan and with Seir our brother). Indeed [the house of Natan] brings us forth to the wilderness (outside of our comfort zones) to kill this entire congregation [the ones that are immersed] in evil! (To kill all the members of this congregation that are with evil) ​ ​​ By the way, the actual Torah law according to the Gemara is that it is only forbidden to have licentious relations with an idolator/gentile in the presence of 10 Jewish men (or people?) Moshe forgot this law and Pinchas took it upon himself to spear Zimri since he was having relations with a Moabitess in public. Therefore if you can't find a Kosher wife or at least a Yefet Toar for whatever reason and you feel you may "die from starvation" it may be better to succumb to licentiousness than to cast off the whole Yoke of Torah or have a seminal emission with no chance of children, as Rambam says the ideal laws of sanctity apply to someone who does not have a history of indulgence. It may even be forbidden as adding a commandment to Torah to make a "rabbinic commandment" to say otherwise. Yes one needs to make a security fence around the Commandments but maybe actually adding commandments to make the fence is in violation of making a new religion, like how Adam commanded Chayyah not to even touch the tree although this was permitted and that ended up being their downfall. ​ There is a story of a sage from the Talmud who would very frequently buy prostitutes. One time one flatulated and said to him "just as that air cannot go back, so too your portion of The World to Come is lost and cannot return". I have heard before that the reason was because he did it so frequently it became like idolatry. Anyway the story ends with him essentially screaming to Heaven in repentance and dying in the process and Heaven sent forth a voice proclaiming that he has a portion of The World to Come. ​ A parable: HaShem's Tree of Life has 613 branches (Mitzvot). Pirkei Avot says a tree with many branches is more prone to falling over. If one would count all the Rabbinic "commands" as branches, the Tree of Life would immediately split from the weight of countless branches without even any wind Heaven forbid. The proof is that I have travelled extensively especially in Orthodox Jewish areas and cannot find a single Adam with no intentional sins except me. Therefore we have to see these as leaves, good expressions of Torah values, extensions of the commandments that one can cast off in severe weather to survive. Proof is that it is known that in extenuating circumstances one can violate Rabbinic injunctions. There is a story of a sage who when he would fall asleep before the night time Shema, would have his son wake him up only to say the first verse. However I recommend also saying the last verse of the 3rd paragraph "I am the Lord your God who takes you forth from the land of Egypt to be your God. I am the Lord your God." Since one has to remember (possibly vocally) the Exodus from Egypt every day and every night including the days of Mashiach. ​​ ​ One of my favorite gleanings I heard from Rabbi Michael Skobac on Facebook Why is Matzah eaten as our symbol of freedom during Pesach when it called the Lechem Oni - bread of poverty/affliction and our Egyptian taskmasters fed us Matzah? It is because a poor person is really free as the rich one is enslaved to maintaining his/her wealth and property "The more property, the more anxiety" -Pirkei Avot. I remember reading a prophecy multiple times (I thought in YeshaYaHu) about HaShem desiring to make Israel poor so we would be focused on spiritual pursuits, although I tried for awhile to find it recently and couldn't. ​ Sefer Yetzirah says there is nothing higher than ענג delight - Oneg. This is one letter different than עני Oni and it is taught that every letter is made up of small Yuds so these words are even closer. On the other hand, אשר Osher, fortunate, is the same root as middle word of HaShem's name He revealed to Moshe in the flaming thornbush that corresponds to the Sefirah of Keter, Will/Desire - Asher (That). (Also the name of a son of Yaakov, tribe of Yisrael). Financially rich is עָשִׁיר - still very similar Therefore we see another proof of the fact that everything is truly good, being rich and poor are both a delight. Psalm 139:12 darkness is not dark for You; night is as light as day; darkness and light are the same. ​ ​ ​ If you are by yourself like me I think its highly preferable to withhold from giving Tzedakah (charity) and make a reckoning in the future as its written in YechezkEl 16:17: וַתִּקְחִ֞י כְּלֵ֣י תִפְאַרְתֵּ֗ךְ מִזְּהָבִ֤י וּמִכַּסְפִּי֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נָתַ֣תִּי לָ֔ךְ וַתַּעֲשִׂי־לָ֖ךְ צַלְמֵ֣י זָכָ֑ר וַתִּזְנִי־בָֽם׃ You took your beautiful things, made of the gold and silver that I had given you, and you made yourself phallic images and fornicated with them. ​ Rambam says in Hilchot Diot 3:1 that attempting to be overly pious by abstaining from pleasures like an idolatrous monk in Tibet is actually sinful. He quotes the very insightful teaching of our sages on the verse Badmidbar Numbers 6 :11 He [the Kohen] shall make atonement for him [the Nazarite who abstained from wine], for the sin he committed against his soul. The sages comment, "If the Nazirite who only abstained from wine stands in need of atonement, how much more so one who deprives himself of all legitimate enjoyments?" ​ The conclusion is that one should only refrain from that which the Torah has expressly withdrawn from our use, and no one should increase upon that by vows and oaths. ​ "Do not the prohibitions of the Torah suffice you that you add others for yourself?" - the Sages Even fasting is included ​​​ It is commendable to review Torah even right after learning it as one sage would review a new Dvar Torah 100 times immediately ​​ https://www.sefaria.org/sheets/625179.1?lang=bi ​ On the other hand, one should be mindful of Baat Sheva's prophecy in the last chapter of Mishlei that alcohol is not fit for kings and rather for the poor and destitute with no future to laugh and forget about their destitution and pain. It is a known concept that all of Israel are sons of kings. Practically only the actual king is prohibited from alchohol except one cup mixed at least 1/2 with water in the morning that I believe was more of a medical custom. However this was before coffee and I think coffee may be much more preferable especially considering the cultural norm today. ​​ 15 Shevat I once heard from the Arizal that one should spend ones time peeling the layers of Halacha (The sages teach one should split it into thirds 1/3 Tanakh, Mishnah/Halacha, and Gemara). I thought for years his original intention was to consider the deeper spiritual concepts embodied within the Halachot. I saw recently that he could have also meant learning all of the different practical applications of Halachot. In this way one will be prepared for anything and wont need to consult. Either way I think when one is learning Tanakh and Gemara one should also be considering the deeper faces embodied and apply the spiritual lessons like Halachot to fit both the teaching of the sages and the Arizal. Proof is that I once learned from Mishlei that one should invest much more effort into understanding the Torah one knows than continuing to accumulate wisdom. Presumably since things get forgotten Heaven save us.  I only learned this once so it may be a little off but I dont like to learn Mishlei besides the last chapter since I'm quite certain they were written by Ash-medai as every time I would be learning them in the past and watch the old house owners videos he would mention that Ash-medai gave Shlomo a book of Wisdom. Shlomo didnt even know how to handle Mukseh when David HaMelech passed and Kohelet says he puked out his Wisdom. Edit: I never really apply the concepts hidden within unless there is a Halacha or teaching from one of the sages that it concurs with, otherwise they are considerations.​ ​ Not only is being a poor man a delight because he is more free to study Torah, but also because he is able to witness miraculous salvations from HaShem, wheras the rich man can rely on his wealth for most problems. Proof is that the snake was cursed to eat dust and one commentary says that it could be seen as a blessing to be able to eat dust since it is abundant. The reason it is a curse is because it is now much less reliant upon HaShem ​ Here is an awesome commentary from the Chabad Rebbeim on the different Hebrew words for Man, and also on the actions of Shimon and Levi after decimating Shechem and being criticized by Yaakov Avinu: https://www.chabad.org/library/article_cdo/aid/2317447/jewish/Chapter-6-Sichos-Kodesh.htm ​​ Malbim says on YeshaYaHu 13:23 that Enosh are small men whose blood have been poured out. Targum Yonatan says Enosh are those who fear HaShem and Adam are those who observe Halacha ​​​ 16 Shevat I asked Rabbi Simcha Bart of Chabad if the Rebbeim ever gave a similar Maamar on the different words for Rock, Even, Tzur, and Sela and he sent me this diamond: Here is something from our website. It is based on the explanation that Tzur is a "young" (or "small") rock that Moshe was supposed to hit, as opposed to Sela being a "mature" or old rock, that he was supposed to speak to. “And speak to the rock before their eyes that it shall give its waters.” (20:8) QUESTION: Why now did Hashem instruct Moshe to speak to the rock whereas in Rephidim (Shemot 17:6), when they thirsted for water and complained, Hashem told him, “You shall strike the rock and water will come forth”? "ANSWER: Hashem said to Moshe, “When the child is young his teacher hits him and teaches him. Once he becomes older, he reprimands him with words. Similarly, when the rock was small you hit it, but now you shall speak to it. Teach it and it will bring forth water” (Yalkut Shimoni). "This may be further expounded: The rock is analogous to people who at times seem to be “hard as rock” and obstinately refuse to direct their lives morally and ethically as a Jew should. "The incident in Rephidim occurred before the Torah was given. The only method available then to guide a Jew in the right path was to strike him harshly. The episode in our parshah however, took place after the Torah was given. The way to reach a Jew now, is not through striking him, but through talking to him with sincerity and warmth and introducing him to the beauty of Torah. "The Torah assures that with such an approach one will successfully penetrate and “venatan meimav” — “he shall give his waters.” One will eventually bring to surface the beautiful “pintele Yid” — the spark of Judaism hidden within him." There's another explanation: “And he struck the rock with his staff twice.” (20:11) QUESTION: Why did he strike the rock twice? "ANSWER: The letters of the word “sela” (סלע) — “rock” — spelled out in full are סמ"ך-למ"ד-עי"ן. The middle letters of the name of each letter spell the word “mayim” (מים) — “water.” Thus, in a rock — “sela” — there is hidden water — “mayim.” Moshe, by striking the rock twice, knocked off the first letters as well as the last letters, leaving the middle letters (מים), and water flowed forth abundantly." You can find both of these here: https://www.chabad.org/2826417 ​ In that link you can also find that the Gemara gives the difference between Adam and HaAdam - HaAdam include(d/s) non Jews also. ​ I also want to stress the importance of being on guard when outside of your house or when seeing the image of a necromancer/witch curse you with their hand or foot. It can only take 1 or 2 seconds before you get severely hurt and your soul tazed to feel spiritually weak Heaven forbid. Although football is bloody and gay and forbidden, I want to apply the lesson my defensive back (people who defend against recievers catching the ball) coach in high who would try to arouse zeal in us like a lion and passionately say "This is a no fly zone! If someone wants to fly on us we make them pay (hit them as hard as we can)". If some G-d forsaken soul wants to meet you in the field and try to take your soul, I think its best to immediately devour them and uproot them from existence forever like the cow eats the grass (by the roots) with YeshaYaHu's curse. When I push lightly and pull close with a prop I do not get a pleasant chuckle like I do when I just force them to be show bread or cease to be forever. If you have to work with one then cursing them like this will just cause another dead soul to fly in that body that may be more kind anyway. ​ I thought of more evidence that Mishlei was written by Ash-medai. The name Mishlei means "My Rulers" similar to HaShem's Name corresponding to Malchut - "My Masters" - that would contain Elokim as the final culmination Sefirah, corresponding to Gevurah/Judgement where the Sat-n's are correlated with (the left hand and foot). Also 3 of the  4 letters of Mishlei are used in Ash-medai's name. ​​ בְּקוֹל חֲמִישִׁי אוֹמֵר. עַד מָתַי עָצֵל תִּשְׁכָּב מָתַי תָּקוּם מִשְּׁנָתֶךָ: (משלי ו ט) In  the 5th call the Rooster is saying Until when will you sleep on the sluggards? My dead (you need to) arise from their sleep! (From your Mishnah) ​​​ 18 Shevat Rambam says only to eat garlic and onions occasionally. They are strong aphrodisiacs and actually for a single person it would probably be best to avoid them or it will be torturous (from experience). On the other hand it would be very wise for a couple who has been together for years and the man has trouble "coming to the table" to eat garlic and onions Erev Shabbat. ​ I once heard Rabbi Yehudah Fetaya say in Minchat Yehudah to a man who decided to go to sleep instead of to have relations with his wife "the righteous man will come to the table". ​ בְּקוֹל שִׁישִּׁי אוֹמֵר. אַל תֶּאֱהַב שֵׁנָה פֶּן תִּוָּרֵשׁ פְּקַח עֵינֶיךָ שְׂבַע לָחֶם: (משלי כ יג) In its sixth call, it is saying, “Do not love sleep, lest you come to poverty; open your eyes, and you shall be satisfied with bread.” ​ In Ainecha, the Nun and Yud come together to look close to a Mem. Therefore it can read "Open your person (Am can mean relative, your spouse is your kin)/people weekly (same root as sated), sate yourself with food/bread". ​ This fits with Rambam's Halacha in Diot above that a man should have relations Erev Shabbat (if he feels physically strong) and that when a man feels heavy from his loins and has many erections despite trying not to, it is medically advisable to have relations. ​ Although one may argue that Rabbis have stated this precept is for Torah scholars, what are you possibly doing if not striving as hard as you can to become a Torah scholar? Like mentioned above, Adam lost his perception of Gan Eden because he became fascinated with his ego and went to work on vain material non eternal things, as its written "The World will wear out like a garment". Nevertheless like Rambam says a man's wife is always permitted to him, but I would argue unless you are weakening yourself to the point that you're risking breaking Mitzvot and dying forever, Heaven forbid. ​​ "Lest you become impoverished" - If you do not satisfy your wife, you increase the chances of divorce or "plowed" - adultery where one would have to execute, "plow" his previous soul mate Heaven save us! ​​​ ​ ​ ​ ​ Bereishet 18:27 וַיַּ֥עַן אַבְרָהָ֖ם וַיֹּאמַ֑ר הִנֵּה־נָ֤א הוֹאַ֙לְתִּי֙ לְדַבֵּ֣ר אֶל־אֲדֹנָ֔י וְאָנֹכִ֖י עָפָ֥ר וָאֵֽפֶר׃ Abraham answered and said “Behold-now I venture to speak to my Lord, and I am but dust and ashes. I once read a commentary or Midrash that after Avraham said this, these parables became very popular throughout the peoples, as Avraham was known as a "Prince of G-d" in their midst (23:6). ​ Gray in Hebrew is אפור, Afor, very similar to Afar (dust, sand, mud, mortar) and Ayfer (ash and also the same letters as Afar - pasture/meadow) used by Avraham. It is known that trees grown alone (or sometimes right next to another tree of its same type) in a field (in this case meadow or pasture) grow much more quickly and get massive compared to those in crowded orchards or forests. Anyway I think gray is a great color since it is a remembrance of Avraham who is the Right Hand of HaShem (Kindness). Also of a pasture, and as mentioned above Sadai, my fields, is almost identical to Sh-adai, The Almighty. White on the other hand, Lavan, white, is the same word as to clean, which is a great kindness also as white is associated with the Sefirah of Chesed, but can be painful. ​ More faces on the Shem SHDAI - Shad is breast, so Shadi would be "my breast". Demons are called "Sheidim" or Sheid in singular, Shin Dalet. I'm having a little trouble locating the exact source right now but I remember reading that demons are compared to either hot baths or showers and also that hot baths or showers are called pleasures. ​ Another idea. Jastrow on Sa'ir: שָׂעִיר m. (b. h.; שָׂעַר) 1) goat. Yoma VI, 2 ש׳ המשתלח, v. שָׁלַח. Ib. 7 פר וש׳ הנשרפין the bullock and the goat designated to be burnt. Zeb. V, 1; a. fr.—Pl. שְׂעִירִים, שְׂעִירִין. Ib. 2. Yoma VI, 1; a. fr. —2) demon. B. Bath. 25ᵃ, v. סָעַר II. Ber. 64ᵃ ש׳ בש׳ מיחלף goat and demon may interchange (both going by the name of saʿir).— Pl. as ab. Lev. R. s. 22, v. שֵׁד; a. e. —3) shower. Pl. as ab. Sifré Deut. 306 (ref. to Deut. XXXII, 2) מה ש׳ הללו וכ׳ as the showers come down on the plants &c.; Yalk. ib. 942, v. סָעַר II. —4) hairy. Gen. R. s. 65. ​ See that it can be a demon or showers. A name of Esav, the West, is Se'ir (Dvarim 33:2). They often use an amazing ASMR tazer that is like getting 2-3x the pleasure of a shower but dry. However it touches on licentiousness and should definitely not be used in sensitive areas but I would compare them to massages that are amazing in our times especially considering people's teeth are on edge and its hard to find someone that speaks without their hands, and better someone massage us than prick us or the like and die on us Heaven forbid. The Stork is saying (Yeshayahu 40:2) Speak to the heart of YiruShalayim and call to her, indeed her period of exile is filled, indeed her iniquity is forgiven, indeed she has taken from The Hand of HaShem double in all her sins. -We should be extremely grateful it is only double and not 7 times, as that is a verse in Vayikra 26:18 - וְאִ֨ם־עַד־אֵ֔לֶּה לֹ֥א תִשְׁמְע֖וּ לִ֑י וְיָסַפְתִּי֙ לְיַסְּרָ֣ה אֶתְכֶ֔ם שֶׁ֖בַע עַל־חַטֹּאתֵיכֶֽם׃ And if, for all that, you do not obey Me, I will go on to discipline you sevenfold for your sins, ​ When a Jewish person gets caught stealing they have to pay double, as the Wolf sings about, and since every sin is like a theft against Heaven paying back double is fair. But since we had (and/or have) many sins, especially considering the concept of Gilgulim (Reincarnations) with sins accumulated from past lives and that we are in the end of times, 5785 out of 6000 potential years, paying back double was/is extremely expensive (painful). Let us always remember that there is a light at the end of the tunnel and some day Heaven Willing soon, HaShem will remove the spirit of impurity from the Earth as is mentioned in the Neviim (Prophets) - Although a person will still be put to death for other sins like breaking Shabbat after 2 people warning him/her etc. ​​​ Returning to Seir: Sheir is to measure and the Tehillim says "He goes along weeping carrying the measure of seed [Meshech HaZara] or Meshech, the arm. He will surely return with songs of joy, a bearer of his sheaves!" The West is called Meshech as its written in YeshaYaHu 18:2 אֶל־גּוֹי֙ מְמֻשָּׁ֣ךְ וּמוֹרָ֔ט "To a nation Memushach (drawn out) and polished". We all know the "polished standard" as I call it of many Western people in professional affairs compared to other cultures. Also, remember that 18:1 says Woe to the land of treacherous shadowy etc flying crickets that is beyond the rivers of Cush (Africa), and as this would have been prophesied East of Africa, it is very fitting for it to be the West, especially considering the slave trade and black culture in America, as beyond, Ibur, can mean to pass over to (they passed over the Atlantic to take slaves) and also for forgiving the sin of (the patriarch of Africa, Cham, castrated and raped Noach to have less nations and therefore more power to himself). Nevertheless HaShem only remembers the sin of a father on a child if the child is also wicked. But how many righteous people have you met compared to blasphemers/witches? ​ I have also seen Memushach translated as "stretched out" and many westerners look like they literally stretched themselves to fit with the culture of loving tall people, especially men. Alternatively many westerners take steroids that stretch the body out (and does permanent damage in swelling the organs. Are people not coarse enough that they should then swell their hearts?) "My son, do not give your strength to the woman (also a metaphor for this world), to those who slay kings" - Mishlei 31:3. The only thing a person should "swell" themselves about, as mentioned above in YirmiYah 9:23, is how much he or she makes HaShem heavy and possibly in being able to apply Torah and its concepts practically, or alternatively possibly in one's Chidushei Da'at, their own Novelties in Knowledge (ideas one came up with themselves from Torah that fits with Tradition). Definitely not in how much one has made the gym their house of Bitul (Negligence of) Torah and how much they can now bench press unless they are about to use that strength as an act of service to HaShem, as the preceding verse says "Let not the wise glory in his wisdom, nor the rich in his wealth, nor the strong in his strength". Actually we should probably forbid celebrating victories in all levels of sports (and make competitive sports forbidden as Shachak (dust/sport/mockery that HaShem chastises the nations about and Bitul Torah, also sometimes Bitul Nefesh [negligence of the soul - even in more mild sports like soccer/futbol people break ankles and the like]) based on this verse as it is also a little bit of Lashon Hara/bloodshed to put the losers down by celebrating the way Heaven allowed you to move your clay/donkey, as a name of HaShem is "The Lord of Hosts", and This King specifically told us not to glorify ourselves in our strength. ​ As the western man, or Lavan, used to tell me when I was playing sports for exercise growing up, "Take a hike!" ​ ​On the other hand it is a Mitzvah to keep the body in shape as if one gets a layer of fat over the kidneys, it advises him/her not to repent (Rashi) and fat is also associated with arrogance and "kicking" (casting off the Yoke of Heaven) at the end of Dvarim ("The Upright grew fat and kicked"). Personally I do 10-20 varying kinds of pushups and situps, and a curl and/or tricep extension to a shoulder press with 20 lbs dumbbells every day (except Shabbat) and try to hike around the forest every day too. The hiking also fits with Rabbi Nachman's teaching that one should seclude themselves in nature for about an hour a day to be alone with and meditate to/speak to HaShem. There's no reason to fear the heathen that as shown from Bereisheit, HaShem will make them like vegetables/herbs before us if we are constantly meditating on Torah or a Mitzvah like a fish only surviving in water, including business, as it says "There shall be no destitute among you" and the Talmud says on this it is forbidden to allow yourself to become poor/destitute/needy (except of course on Shabbat [to think about] unless it is previously finished business). ​​ If you say that it is a good thing that Shachak can be defined as dust since Avraham called himself dust, I once heard from one of Rabbi Adam Polinovsky's videos last summer that there is a large difference in that this term of dust, Shachak, actually is not suitable for growing food. If you cite the Gemara in Avodah Zara 3b that HaShem "sports/laughs" with the Leviathan based on Tehillim 104:26 for 3 hours a day (so how can I speak down so heavily on sports?), you have a good point and that is why safe sports are permitted. However we need to always keep in mind that one of the reasons of the destruction of the second Beit Hamikdash was due to playing sports on Shabbat - Rambam says exercising to the point of sweating is forbidden on Shabbat! Edit: Actually the conclusion of that Gemara is that since the destruction of the Beit Hamikdash HaShem no longer sports, but instead teaches Torah to school children for that 3 hour time block. Nevertheless sports for a productive purpose (exercise) are of course permitted (making money through sports is counterproductive to society as people begin 'worshipping' teams and 'trash talking', even by critiquing their own team's players, while wasting 2-4 hours of their loaned existences watching [sometimes even days and thousands of dollars to travel] instead of pleasing the Ancient of Days and being crowned with 370,000 crowns by Him through revealing a new Novelty of Torah, or bringing the 4 Amot of the Shechinah into the World by studying Halacha/Rambam all for free in their home! "It is the truth (or beauty, balance) for a man to dwell in his house" -YeshaYaHu Find a way to make money that actually benefits people ​​​ ​ ​ ​ I've noticed when I "anoint" (rub) olive oil on my whole head I usually produce a lot more Torah that day or the next than when I leave myself "dry" Heaven forbid.
