The final Mem is sufficient (to redeem oneself with speaking and then live forever in bliss revealing the secrets of Torah, the meaning of final Mem as opposed to the open Mem in the beginning and middle of words that alludes to the revealed Torah) ​ -Alef Dy Mem: For Alef (HaShem. He also says that the existence of the Sat-n is the incentive to overcome Him.]) ...it is sufficient to use the power of the final Mem, the teeth (mouth). ​ -Or, to be a master (Aluf), one has to become sufficiently knowledgable in the secrets of Torah Why? However I think according to Rambam even praying in one's mind is sufficient in severe times. ​​ I once saw a western (Esau was a master of knowledge/science -Bereisheit) scientist's video showing his results that speaking positively around open water changed its molecular structure. This was about 7 years ago and back then I saw the reinforcement of the importance of saying Berachot on all food. However I see now that speaking and being around good/evil speech also affects our blood! It is perfect for me - the only maintenance since has been an oil change, it is smooth, and the interior is wood or nice faux wood. I haven't even put it in a garage and this winter has been strong and I haven't noticed any decline. I think I've put about 8k miles on it. I hear older Honda's are like this too (but not new). Researching this before buying saved me many thousands of dollars. Many people were telling me to buy new to avoid maintenance but nevertheless anything can happen and if or when it does, the bill on a new car is multiple times that of an older one. Yet most of the polished people could never fathom not going into 20k of debt in order to be seen with a new car that really brings the evil eye on them and multiplies their troubles. However, in the words of The Living G-d of Life ​ YirmiYah 3:22 שׁ֚וּבוּ בָּנִ֣ים שׁוֹבָבִ֔ים אֶרְפָּ֖ה מְשׁוּבֹתֵיכֶ֑ם הִנְנוּ֙ אָתָ֣נוּ לָ֔ךְ כִּ֥י אַתָּ֖ה יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃ Turn back, O rebellious children, I will heal your afflictions! “Here we are, we come to You, For You, O ETERNAL One, are our God!" ​ YechezkEl 18:23 הֶחָפֹ֤ץ אֶחְפֹּץ֙ מ֣וֹת רָשָׁ֔ע נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה הֲל֛וֹא בְּשׁוּב֥וֹ מִדְּרָכָ֖יו וְחָיָֽה׃ {ס} Is it my desire that the wicked shall die?—says the Sovereign GOD. It is rather that they shall turn back from their ways and live. ​ ​​ 33:11 אֱמֹ֨ר אֲלֵיהֶ֜ם חַי־אָ֣נִי ׀ נְאֻ֣ם ׀ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֗ה אִם־אֶחְפֹּץ֙ בְּמ֣וֹת הָרָשָׁ֔ע כִּ֣י אִם־בְּשׁ֥וּב רָשָׁ֛ע מִדַּרְכּ֖וֹ וְחָיָ֑ה שׁ֣וּבוּ שׁ֜וּבוּ מִדַּרְכֵיכֶ֧ם הָרָעִ֛ים וְלָ֥מָּה תָמ֖וּתוּ בֵּ֥ית יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ} Say to them: As I live—declares the Sovereign GOD—it is not My desire that the wicked shall die, but that the wicked turn from their [evil] ways and live. Turn back, turn back from your evil ways, that you may not die, O House of Israel! ​​ ​ A quick thought: The sages teach, "Ain Kemach Ain Torah" (No flour, no Torah) Instead, read Ayin Kemach, Ayin Torah When one evil eyes the flour (servants of HaShem who cried to Him that are edible/fruitful even if they later withered like wheat), one evil eyes the Torah (Infinite Will and Wisdom of HaShem), essentially an act of blasphemy Heaven forbid ​​ A proof from Chumash "I will bless those that bless you and curse those who curse you" ​​ ​ Socks may be just as deadly as head coverings when inside. Exodus "In every place I allow a remembrance of My Name, I will bless you". There are two Shoham stones on the straps above the rest of the stones of the Choshen Mishpat (Priestly Prophetic Breastplate of the High Priest). There is a Halacha that when stacking Sefarim (books of Torah) one has to put books of Chumash (5 Books of Moshe) on top of Prophets on top of Writings and it may continue with Mishnah then Gemara but all other books, Halacha, Mussar, etc. go underneath those. Therefore we can see that the Shoham in one interpretation is "ruling" over the rest of the stones (including the Diamond, Sapphire, Emerald, and Ruby). I have also seen the sages in Berachot novelize the Torah by ascribing precedence to the first subject in a list. Actually Ohr HaChaim does this in Bereisheit when HaShem lists the sons of Noach "Shem, Cham, and Yafet" - he says they are listed in order of their intelligence. Therefore I like to wear a Shoham necklace and ring. ​ Dvarim 33:25 בַּרְזֶ֥ל וּנְחֹ֖שֶׁת מִנְעָלֶ֑ךָ וּכְיָמֶ֖יךָ דׇּבְאֶֽךָ׃ "[Asher's] borders (lit. doorbolt) will be iron and copper And your security last all your days." ​ Yamecha, days, can be novelized as Yamincha, your right hand. Doorbolt is nearly identical to Naal, Sandal. When a person wears a metal ring they direct all the electricity and electric radiation to their extremity, away from the heart and brain. The Understanding of the Hebrew letters was not even known one generation after Sinai: https://www.sefaria.org/sheets/626676.1?lang=bi&with=all&lang2=en After the initial novel interpretation from Alef to Taf (like A-Z), they use the AT-BASH, where Alef is associated with the last letter Taf, Beit the second to last Shin, and so on, and continue to use other letter combination codes like this you can find in Sefer Yetzirah with Aryeh Kaplan. I dont like the first translation of Alef Beit, Alaf Binah as 'Learn Wisdom', but rather 'Learn/Teach Understanding'. ​​ Shevat 21 I heard an amazing diamond from Rabbi Michael Macks this morning (again don't watch his videos where he quotes external wisdoms - one can lose their portion of Heaven for this.) As mentioned there are 5 levels of the soul, the nefesh corresponding to the the breath of the mouth, blood and centered in the liver. The Ruach, breath of the nose, spirit, and in the heart. The Neshamah, a more intellectual refined level (see that it contains the roots Shemah [hearing, related to understanding something] Shem [name, spiritual mission] and Mah [What, a less known Name of HaShem]), in the air of the ears and based in the brain. The Chayyah, life fore, light of the eyes, immediately surrounds the body. The Yechidah, Oneness, the cranium, actually extends Dalet Amot (~6-7 ft) from the body and actually all throughout one's home. This is why many people say they can feel someone's house's "vibe" when they enter their home. We are actually feeling that person's highest level of soul, Yechidah, Oneness. ​ I thought I had learned years ago from the Arizal that people can lose the upper levels of soul with not good choices. Actually Chabad taught a non religious Jewish person's (I think) Neshamah is not in his body like observant Jews, but rather hovers around his body. ​​ No one donated or visited although I hear people tried and were stopped so I took my address off. I'm thinking since I live in a beautiful place to make a website and start selling photos online. My bills are low so maybe I could get to a point where I could retire from that revenue stream since I could probably swing it on a little over 1k a month (my mortgage is only 600)  It is definitely not pious in my opinion due to the Torah's sentiment on images but since I am using it to support myself and there is no concern for idolatry, and it is nature pictures (HaTeviah, The Nature, has the same numerical value as Elohim) so Torah can be derived through the parables, or at least people will be spiritually inspired, I think it is a great idea. Its still a good novelty even though I prefer the pronunciation of the actual verse in Dvarim and intentded the Hebrew to be אשדת. I have never seen it not called Aysh with a Tzeirei as in fire and JPS agrees with me. I actually usually ignore this dictionary and now I'm glad I do. Anyway the site title AyshDaat draws attention to novelize it with the Seifrah of Da'at, as is mentioned above is the only other thing than making HaShem honored/weighty that we are to glorify ourselves about (YirmiYah 9:23). ​​ 23 Shevat Why are the trees of the forest a metaphor for kings of the nations? Unlike a garden or orchard tree that are intentionally planted and tended to these kings are in battle from the day they germinate in the ground with all of the competing plants. There is much less light and many more animals and pests to eat them. Therefore it is miraculous that out of all the countless seeds spread in the forest the trees that made it to be expressed are and are clearly Divinely chosen. ​ Some may see snowstorms as frightening some as international confetti parties. ​​​ I remembered learning that the Tehillim were written with Ruach HaKodesh (Holy Spirit) not through Elokim so I need to apologize for Lashon Hara ​​ According to Rambam, a person needs to attach fringes to even linen and wool blankets (not cotton or polyester).  A workaround is to round a corner with scissors. ​​ On the argument that the Talmud says the pious throw rocks at one who curses a necromancer and that Elisha HaNavi cursed 20 or so children in the name of HaShem and 2 bears mauled them and he was later punished for this: Elisha had a double portion of AyliYaHu's spirit. He was essentially the real ruler of the Jewish People and his life was far from being threatened, rather the kids just spoke Lashon Hara on him. He was also not living in the end of times when electronic torture toys are available to the masses (same with necromancers back then). Therefore considering that "Indeed, the people are grass" (most people are much more fragile than such a great Prophet) it is much more understandable and actually I would say even the Mitzvah of saving your own life to curse treacherous people in the name of HaShem as we have been. ​ Breishet 49:6 בְּסֹדָם֙ אַל־תָּבֹ֣א נַפְשִׁ֔י בִּקְהָלָ֖ם אַל־תֵּחַ֣ד כְּבֹדִ֑י כִּ֤י בְאַפָּם֙ הָ֣רְגוּ אִ֔ישׁ וּבִרְצֹנָ֖ם עִקְּרוּ־שֽׁוֹר׃ In their counsel let my soul not enter! Into their congregation may my glory not be united! Indeed in their wrath they slew a man ​ According  the Chabad Rebbe's in the article above, a main opinion is that Yaakov was chastising Shimon and Levi for surreptitiously killing Shechem (by telling them to circumcise themselves to marry Dinah and then attacking when they were weak) instead of attacking outright since the whole nation was considered like one "Eish", man, and it would not have been a problem. ​ Breisheit 32:25​ וַיִּוָּתֵ֥ר יַעֲקֹ֖ב לְבַדּ֑וֹ וַיֵּאָבֵ֥ק אִישׁ֙ עִמּ֔וֹ עַ֖ד עֲל֥וֹת הַשָּֽׁחַר׃ And Yaakov was left alone and a man wrestled with him until the rise of dawn. -Rabbi Natan Scherman quotes tradition that this Eish/man was the Sat-n, guarding angel of Esau, the West. ​ See that very nearly the entire world has fallen to Sat-n worship and every person loses their ability to act independently from its commands. Therefore every living Ben Adam should have no fear even if he has to take on the entire world with a donkey skull like Shimshon took on many multitudes of people by himself. "Into their congregation may my glory not be united (Taychad)." Taychad is close to Pachad implying that if you try to defeat your enemies like a snake (surreptitiously like Shimon and Levi) it may be that this brings Pachad - terror/dread upon you in your drawn out conspiracy rather than just plowing the grass (wicked enemies) directly like a bull (Adam and Eish both start with Alef, representing an ox), how Yaakov would have done it to keep his honor. What is there to fear if by fighting in and also by dying in a Milchemet Mitzvah (War obligated by the Torah) there is great sanctification of HaShem and reward? We should be as delighted at such an opportunity as a cow that finds fresh green grass to devour with its roots (Tehillim - When the wicked thrive like grass, and all evildoers prosper, it is in order that they be cut down forever.) ​​​ בְּקוֹל שִׁישִּׁי אוֹמֵר. אַל תֶּאֱהַב שֵׁנָה פֶּן תִּוָּרֵשׁ פְּקַח עֵינֶיךָ שְׂבַע לָחֶם: (משלי כ יג) In its sixth call, it is saying, “Do not love sleep, lest you come to poverty; open your eyes, and you shall be satisfied with bread.” The Rooster is also saying: Do not love sleep (be lazy), lest you and your people become impoverished. Open up your people to the seven (Shabbat, Geulah, Redemption) bread (Torah of Mashiach, Kabbalah/Chassidut) or war, the spiritual war of the end of time occurring right now. BDB says Lachem with a Patach instead of Segol (Lechem) can refer to a war, Milchamah. ​​ Mishlei 23:5 (התעוף) [הֲתָ֤עִיף] עֵינֶ֥יךָ בּ֗וֹ וְֽאֵ֫ינֶ֥נּוּ כִּ֤י עָשֹׂ֣ה יַעֲשֶׂה־לּ֣וֹ כְנָפַ֑יִם כְּ֝נֶ֗שֶׁר (ועיף) [יָע֥וּף] הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃ {פ} Wilt thou set thy eyes upon it? it is already gone: for riches suddenly make themselves wings; they fly away like an eagle towards the sky. ​ I have thought about this verse probably every day since I read years ago in Berachot Bavli the Sages say that this applies to Torah study being very easily forgotten. A more direct translation is: Blink your eyes in It and It is no more, indeed it surely makes wings for Itself like an eagle and flies [to] The Heavens. ​ I realized recently that this also applies to what the Sages teach in Avot 2:15 "The day is short, the work is much, the workers are lazy, the reward is great, and the House Owner is pressing" ​ It is so easy especially when lying in bed when the thought to engage in Torah study enters the mind to "blink your eyes on It" and it becomes no more and flies away - the opportunity to fulfill the Mitzvah of Torah study that stands for one as an eternal light (as opposed to another Mitzvah that is like a temporary candle - Rashi on Mishlei 6:23) is lost to work on vain material things or snooze, like how Adam banished himself from Gan Eden to work on material things. ​​ 26 Shevat Some people say not to do things on a certain day like Monday and one who knows that each day corresponds to a Sefirah knows Monday corresponds to Gevurah, judgement, and may be inclined to wait until Tuesday to do something. About such things its written "You shall not be an observer of the times" and "You shall be wholehearted with The Lord your God". Actually I think Chabad's custom of not saying Kiddush during the hour when Mars is dominant is in direct violation of this, especially when I have heard from Rabbi Yitzhak Ginsburg in the name of the Rebbe that nowadays Edom is ready for Geulah when Israel was not (at that time). The Rambam says a hungry person is like he is sick so it could be additional violations of afflicting oneself especially on Shabbat. The Baal Shem Tov says on the verse "A perpetual fire shall be on the alter, do not extinguish it" Lo Tichbeh - The "no" (negativity) extinguish! In other words always be positive and shine a light on negativity. Instead of seeing Monday as a day of increased judgement see it is a day for rich kings, since Gevurah also represents richness and kingship. Everyone is obligated to have an attribute of Gevurah since we are obligated to be children of HaShem and all of Israel are called children of kings. ​ בְּקוֹל שִׁישִּׁי אוֹמֵר. אַל תֶּאֱהַב שֵׁנָה פֶּן תִּוָּרֵשׁ פְּקַח עֵינֶיךָ שְׂבַע לָחֶם: (משלי כ יג) In its sixth call, the rooster is saying, “Do not love sleep, lest you come to poverty; open your eyes, and you shall be satisfied with bread.” ​ It can also be understood as Upon her [that you] love - [it requires] teeth (metaphor for strength, your relationship requires you to be strong) lest you get plowed/impoverished (divorced/cheated on Heaven forbid). Open up your eye (your desire) and be sated with bread (implying a relationship requires toil like sowing harvesting and making wheat into bread) ​​ Another face: it requires teeth/strength - you need to have some measure of defense like a gun (if you can't buy one a good slingshot with lead ammo is lethal like David and Goliath - just Google the technique and practice it its actually very easy) or dog to protect her from the heathen. So too farmers put up fences, cameras, dogs, and scarecrows for their wheat and before cameras used to actually hire guards. The snake was originally able to kill Eve because Adam was either sleeping (Ohr HaChaim) or HaShem was taking him on a tour of the world and she was alone. If its written "It is not good for man to be alone" how much more so a woman? ​​ Mishlei 23:5 (התעוף) [הֲתָ֤עִיף] עֵינֶ֥יךָ בּ֗וֹ וְֽאֵ֫ינֶ֥נּוּ כִּ֤י עָשֹׂ֣ה יַעֲשֶׂה־לּ֣וֹ כְנָפַ֑יִם כְּ֝נֶ֗שֶׁר (ועיף) [יָע֥וּף] הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃ {פ} Wilt thou set thy eyes upon it? it is already gone: for riches suddenly make themselves wings; they fly away like an eagle towards the sky. ​ Another face: interpret this for one who is overworked or has studied a lot already and who needs to "rest his donkey". "Close your eyes for a moment (blink) and be no more (in the physical world. Tradition teaches when a person sleeps their soul ascends to Heaven to study Torah). Indeed make like wings (Chenafiayim - the Caf is usually used but the Chaf is used here to signify death) to Him like the eagle and fly to The Heavens. Why? Because It flies to the Heavens like an eagle, it takes a lot of exertion to catch Her, as a sage gives a novelty in the Gemara on the verse "It is a Tree of Life for those who cleave to Her" - just like cleaving to a tree makes one exhausted so does Torah study. The Heavens are endless as It is founded with Understanding that is said to have no limit. Therefore take a rest to regain your strength before cleaving to Her again with better results. ​ Alternatively, I have seen Rashi say I think in Mishlei that there is (great?) reward for one who banishes sleep from his eyes to study Torah. Therefore: Blink your eye on It and be no more?!?? Indeed you shall surely make (make novelties and commentaries on Torah - Eishet Chayil: she seeks out wool and linen [garments of Torah from the sheepfold, Oral Tradition, and from flax, the Written Torah unsucceptive to impurity as anything that grows from the ground is not succeptive to impurity until made into a vessel- just an idea] and does it with the desire of her hands) to Him like wings (use your love and fear of HaShem and His Torah to inspire you, in other words, fly) like the Eagle (king of the birds) and fly to the Heavens ​ Interpret the former for a lower level person like how a sapling dies in too much sunlight or a person who is much more exhausted and actually medically needs sleep. The term "make" I think supports this as only a higher level person would be able to make a novelty or commentary on Torah and as mentioned one who reveals a new Face in Torah is crowned with 370,000 crowns by the Ancient of Days, implying this is a very important thing to do for someone who can as it pleases HaShem exceedingly. ​Also even a higher level person should probably not try to make commentaries while exhausted lest he forget things and make mistakes or have parts of his commentary not be as delicious and nutritious Heaven forbid ​​ Alternatively interpret the former for a lower level person that is not that tired and needs to "die for the sake of Torah" and make wings for himself to fly to Heaven (continue studying Torah) ​ I saw recently a video of someone wrapping Jacob Paul with Tefillin. He had Jacob say the first verse of the Shema and then some other good words like Am Yisrael Chai. However if you are ever blessed with such a Kiruv opportunity you should have the person say in addition to the the first and last line of the third paragraph of Shema as these are the actual Biblical obligations (it doesn't have to be the specifc last line but any verse that remembers the Exodus from Egypt) ​ I need to review but Bahir says something like the languages of the 70 root nations are all Names of HaShem, essentially that He is language. In recent English slang it became popular to call opponents "opps" This is alluding to the Rooster's call: "Stand righteous people up so that your portion will be doubled in The World to Come". So too, "The poor will never cease from the land". You should polish your sales skills (A morning blessing included in the Siddur is to bless HaShem for commanding us to "do business in" Torah) to make it a very simple and easy decision for your "opps" to repent, because it is an extremely easy choice especially since Shabbat is here. Then you will get credit for "making" their souls as its written about Avraham and Sarah (B 12:5); וְאֶת־הַנֶּ֖פֶשׁ אֲשֶׁר־עָשׂ֣וּ בְחָרָ֑ן "the soul[s] that he made in Charan" about the idolators they converted. ​​ If a person has the financial and geographical blessing then I think the most preferable way to live is in a Sukkah since it is commonly related to Shalom and as mentioned above the Mishnah says HaShem found no greater blessing for Israel than Shalom based on the verse "HaShem will give strength to His people. Hashem will bless His people with Peace". It will help a person to recognize the temporality and futility of materialism and focus on Torah and Mitzvot. Next would be a house, Bayit, as it corresponds to Binah, Understanding and Heaven, and Berachot, Blessings. The least preferable would be a tent, Ohel, since tents, Ohelim, is an anagram for Elokim, The Name of Gevurah, Judgement/Severity/Kingship The Mishnah says something about being able to make a house into a Sukkah by opening up a hole in the ceiling. However there may be another consideration about taking from the Kiddushah (sanctity) of the Chag (Holiday). A proof for this is the first letter of Torah, Beit, essentially instructing us to live in a Bayit. Another proof: Exodus 3:14: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֶֽהְיֶ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֶֽהְיֶ֑ה וַיֹּ֗אמֶר כֹּ֤ה תֹאמַר֙ לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֶֽהְיֶ֖ה שְׁלָחַ֥נִי אֲלֵיכֶֽם׃ And God said to Moses, “[I] Will Be/Become That [I] Will Be/Become” continuing, “Thus shall you say to the Israelites, ‘[I] Will Be/Become sent me to you.’” As mentioned above Asher, That, can be novelized with Osher, rich/fortunate. This name of HaShem corresponds with the Sefirah of Keter, Crown/Will/Intention, implying a person should desire to be rich/fortunate and only enjoy the Oneg HaOni (Delight of the poor) BeDieved (After the fact that HaShem decreed poverty on a person) Another proof Mishlei 3:16​ אֹ֣רֶךְ יָ֭מִים בִּֽימִינָ֑הּ בִּ֝שְׂמֹאולָ֗הּ עֹ֣שֶׁר וְכָבֽוֹד׃ In her right hand is length of days, In her left, riches and honor. ​​ Had a laugh at this from Taanit 23B Rabbi Mani said to his teacher: The members of my household, i.e., my wife, are not acceptable to me, as she is not beautiful. Rabbi Yitzḥak said: What is her name? Rabbi Mana replied: Ḥana. Rabbi Yitzḥak declared: Let Ḥana grow beautiful, and indeed she grew beautiful. After a while, Rabbi Mani said to Rabbi Yitzḥak: She acts haughtily toward me, due to her great beauty. He said to him: If so, let Ḥana return to her homely appearance, and she returned to her homely appearance. "Grace (Chein) is a lie and beauty is vanity" -Proverbs ​​ I found the place in the Gemara about the man doing sorcery on a woman to turn her into a donkey and Baruch HaShem it is not one of the sages but a random person Sanhedrin 67b The Gemara relates: A man named Yannai arrived at a certain inn. He said to the innkeepers: Give me water to drink. They brought him flour mixed with water. He saw that the lips of the innkeeper woman were moving, and he cast a bit of the drink to the ground, and it turned into scorpions, and he understood that the innkeepers performed sorcery on the drink. Yannai said to them: I drank from yours; you too drink from mine, and he also performed sorcery on the drink. He gave it to her to drink and she turned into a donkey. He rode upon her and went to the marketplace. Her friend came and released her from the sorcery, and people saw him riding on a woman in the marketplace. ​ Pesachim 113a And do not marry two women, as they will likely join forces against you. And if you do marry two, marry a third as well. If two of your wives plot against you, the third will inform you of their plans. Avot - Increase in wives, increase in witchcraft ​​ The Gemara says I think it Ketubot that even if a man has 100 servants he can obligate his wife to do certain tasks because idleness leads to idiocy and licentiousness Pirkei Avot: Rabban Gamliel the son of Rabbi Yehuda the Prince said: Good is Torah study together with a worldly occupation, for the exertion in both makes one forget sin. All Torah study without work will result in waste and will cause sinfulness. Anyone who works for the community should work for the sake of Heaven, for the merit of their [the community members’] forefathers will help him, and their righteousness endures forever. And as for you, [says G-d], I will grant you much reward as if you accomplished it on your own. ​ The sages also teach an idle mind is liable for death in Avot 3:4 רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶן חֲכִינַאי אוֹמֵר, הַנֵּעוֹר בַּלַּיְלָה וְהַמְהַלֵּךְ בַּדֶּרֶךְ יְחִידִי וְהַמְפַנֶּה לִבּוֹ לְבַטָּלָה, הֲרֵי זֶה מִתְחַיֵּב בְּנַפְשׁוֹ: Rabbi Hananiah ben Hakinai said: one who wakes up at night, or walks on the way alone and turns his heart to idle matters, behold, this man is mortally guilty. ​ Employment is not only a means for self sufficiency but also a Kiruv (proselytizing) effort as Jewish people are commanded to be a light for the nations. As mentioned if you successfully sow someone non religious into a fruit tree, you will get unimaginable reward, hinting to how precious such a thing is to HaShem. In my opinion this is one of, if the the primary reason HaShem designed Creation with labor required for our needs after the sins of mankind (The Gemara teaches we would receive our sustenance like the animals without jobs if it were not for our sins) in order to mix people together and have the spiritually larger people bring up the poorer people. I think the Mishnah supports this by saying when working for the community (most if not all jobs have some sort of community involved) it should be for the sake of Heaven. ​​ Ive also learned before that one who supports himself is greater than one who fears HaShem. I think Avot also teaches one who cites his sources in Torah brings redemption on the world so you can find this one deep down on my Facebook page lol sorry for not doing it myself ***Actually I think this is from Living Mussar Everyday by Tzvi Miller (better, MeyE-lOhr, Waters of [The] G-d of Light) ​​ By the way if you are a woman you should definitely look for a man that will support you and in my opinion live with your parents until they can find a fitting man for you (or you if you don't trust them). I remember the Mishnah talking about marriage and saying "if the woman returns to her father's house" implying that would be better than her working and living alone. The marriage contract requires a man to provide the necessities to a woman (food, clothing, and marital relations). A man cannot vow to withhold from relations for over one week or he has to divorce his wife unless his employment demands it. Rambam says the man should also be physically up for it. However, on working, Rabbi Avigdor Miller says if the wife is able to make money not interacting with men to support his Torah study then that is up to her. ​ Why have I not sold the rest of my assets and booked a flight to visit the Meir Tawig synagogue in Baghdad as I have been saying based on Micah 4:10  "...from Babylon HaShem will redeem you..."? It looks like the last Jewish people there no longer attend the synagogue and are probably hiding in crevices or in Ohr Casdim based on Isaiah 24:15 עַל־כֵּ֥ן בָּאֻרִ֖ים כַּבְּד֣וּ יְהֹוָ֑ה בְּאִיֵּ֣י הַיָּ֔ם שֵׁ֥ם יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {ס} Therefore, honor GOD with lights In the coastlands of the sea— The name of the ETERNAL, the God of Israel. Rashi and Radak say Urim is Ohr Casdim in the valleys. Either way its not an enticing idea to spend about 2k to go to Iraq looking for the last 3-4 Jewish people like Isaiah says the remainder of the Jewish people will be like an olive tree after a beating with only a few olives left in a city. Rather maybe Tehillim 110:1 לְדָוִ֗ד מִ֫זְמ֥וֹר נְאֻ֤ם יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ לַֽאדֹנִ֗י שֵׁ֥ב לִֽימִינִ֑י עַד־אָשִׁ֥ית אֹ֝יְבֶ֗יךָ הֲדֹ֣ם לְרַגְלֶֽיךָ׃ Of David. A psalm. The LORD said : to my lord, “Sit at My right hand while I make your enemies your footstool.” ​ Ir Yehochanan (Johnstown) seems like a nice right hand and is the most peaceful place I've lived in the past 8 years ​​ Layers of Understanding on the Rooster standing up righteous people and doing Kiruv: ​ https://www.chabad.org/library/article_cdo/aid/4532/jewish/G-d-Will-Grant-Strength.htm ​ Avot 4:1 Who is mighty? He who subdues his [evil] inclination, as it is said: “He that is slow to anger is better than the mighty; and he that rules his spirit than he that takes a city” (Proverbs 16:32). ​​ Why? The primary motive of the kingdom of Evil/Sat-n is to heat up your evil inclination (also called the Sat-n) against you to anger you at least if not get you to sin and die Heaven forbid Ana!! Therefore if they see they have no power over you they will accept you as their Rabbi and convert as they finally found a fruit tree to sustain them, likely a reason for their death. ​​​ 28 Shevat ​ Indonesian coconut palm trees carry at least dozens of pounds of ripe fruit all the time all year. Is this not extremely inspiring? ​ ​Recently I was debating what looked like one of my gay sons God forbid about Torah trying to trap him by getting him to say "I am completely perfect" and he argued that that is also witchcraft and I think people have thought this to me before as well. I consider it a Mitzvah as its written Bereisheit 17:1 וַיְהִ֣י אַבְרָ֔ם בֶּן־תִּשְׁעִ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה וְתֵ֣שַׁע שָׁנִ֑ים וַיֵּרָ֨א יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־אַבְרָ֗ם וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָיו֙ אֲנִי־אֵ֣ל שַׁדַּ֔י הִתְהַלֵּ֥ךְ לְפָנַ֖י וֶהְיֵ֥ה תָמִֽים׃ "And when Avram was ninety nine years old, the Lord appeared to Avram, and said to him, I am the Almighty God; walk before Me, and be perfect." ​ How else could a person perfect themselves if they have previously spoken evil on themselves in the days of ignorance or evil Heaven forbid ​ If so, blessings, the Sukkah service, Tefillin, Mezuzot etc would all be considered a form of pure sorcery. Therefore it seems more valid to say sorcery is only using one's spiritual knowledge for directly prohibited actions like bloodshed, licentiousness, fortune telling, etc or something not Torah based. Another proof is the Gemara on the verse You shall not make with Me. (Another face is You shall not make Me which is the novelty that prohibits making 3D human like images of people and angels who serve HaShem and are His extensions). The sages say although we can surely make for ourselves. ​ Alternatively if he and they might somehow be right, one could just say such verses as the one just above that includes the phrase "I am the Almighty G-d" that can stand as itsown interpretation, especially since Torah study is a Mitzvah so by doing so you are considered like The Almighty G-d (just a small part) doing it since you are doing it on His behalf. ​​ Another face for the rooster Do not love sleep(ing with your wive[s] or too many wives) (or teeth - eating her/them too much/too many of them) lest you become impoverished or plowed from their increased witchcraft. Or plowed from your lack of strength from losing too much semen, a man's strength and light of his eyes. Take (Lacach instead of Pecach, open) from your people seven (for your) food. ​ Rambam says the king can take up to 18 wives and concubines on top of that. But the sages in the Gemara teach that if a man vows not to have relations with his wife for a week, he must divorce, and the only exceptions given were for employment or Torah study. I have not yet learned of an exception for the king having too many wives to satisfy (although it may make sense) and the dear rooster seems to be warning about this. Especially since that Gemara I think in Kiddushin 42b says a Torah scholar should have relations Erev Shabbat to Erev Shabbat (Rambam adds only if the man is physically up for it), and Rambam says the king must be held to a higher standard of piety. ​​ A proof of this is that Shlomo increased in wives and fell to their idolatry ​ In retrospect even 7 may be way too many so maybe novelize it as "Take from your people (a religious living woman) [and consider] Sheva, (7, the Shabbat day) [for] your food (your wife) (so that you have strength for the ultimate delight, Torah study) In other words consider that you should only have relations Erev Shabbat and even if you are not yet a Torah scholar your goal should be to become one and therefore you should plan for this. Therefore only take one since more than that will require too much energy. ​ Alternatively in defense of the first face, the sages teach that the reason sailors (one time in 6 months) and camel drivers (one time in 30 days) do not have to divorce their wives is because it is different for one with bread in the basket and one with no bread in the basket. In other words she is more understanding if he is not intentionally withholding her food. Therefore the wives of kings would be more understanding and willing to wait considering they get to be queens. Also its written in Tehillim "Happy is he who has sons in his youth. Like arrows in the hand of a warrior, he will not be disappointed when he meets his enemy at the gate" (from memory may be not perfectly accurate). Also the Gemara teaches that David HaMelech's Kingdom rested on the military power of his children he had with beautiful captive women of warfare. Therefore it may be good for a king to have 7 wives to have more children. ​​ I think I have read before that Erev Shabbat is the best time to bring down the holiest soul as your child ​​ Is sleeping on the floor with no mattress better than in a bed? Avot says the way of Torah is to sleep on the floor. I saw someone say people were meant to sleep on the floor instead of beds due to how the pressure gets applied to the skeleton (could definitely be wrong). Also all vessels are succeptive to impurity of the dead and who knows what sort of abominations they are putting in beds and furniture. ​          After trying it I fell asleep at 9 and slept 8 hours straight to 5 and was not as inclined to sleep in and I feel great actually. Also my back cracked once or twice. Eggs are right under meat). Nevertheless Rambam says only to eat meat when one desires it Something I would have wanted someone to tell me: dill weed is by far the best seasoning (except salt). Its the first time I've popped the reducing filter cap off a spice container and I've been dumping it on everything.​ It has great health benefits so maybe it just has a certain nutrient I was lacking if you don't feel the same​ ​​ Why is Nathan called Natan The Prophet and Gad, Gad The Seer? Malbim gives the difference on 1 Shmuel 9:9 ​ אומר כי יש הבדל בין הנביא בדור אחרון ובין הרואה לפנים, שהנביא נקרא שמו על שם דברותיו ותוכחותיו (מלשון ניב שפתים) על כי ה' דבר בו וישלחהו להגיד לעם פשעם ולבית יעקב חטאתם, ולא שלחהו במלאכות ה' רק לצורך עניני הכלל והגוי כולו ולא חל רוח הקודש עליו להראותו דברים פרטיים הנוגעים אל היחידים, אבל הרואה נקרא בשמו על שם שהיה צופה ברוח הקודש השורה עליו כל הדברים ההויים והעתידים וגם עניני היחידים ופרטיהם, ועל כן היו בורחים מן הנביא אשר היה תמיד מגיד פשע ומוכיח עלי עון, ורדפום אחר הרואה באשר כל אחד השיג ממנו מבוקשו על הגניבה ועל האבידה ועל החולה ועל האשה והבנים generated translation: "It is said that there is a difference between the prophet in the last generation and the one who sees ahead. The prophet [Navi] is called by his name because of his words and rebukes (from the root 'niv' meaning speech) because God spoke to him and sent him to declare the people's transgressions and the sins of the house of Jacob. He was not sent to perform the works of God, but only for the needs of the community and the entire nation. The Holy Spirit did not rest upon him to show him private matters related to individuals. However, the one who sees [Roeh and Chozeh] ahead is called by his name because he was able to see through the Holy Spirit all that is happening and all that will happen, including matters concerning individuals and their details. Therefore, people would flee from the prophet, who always declared their sins and reproached them for their transgressions, and they would chase after the seer, since each person obtained from him what they sought—whether it was for theft, lost property, illness, or matters concerning women and children." More: https://ohr.edu/8165 The sages teach that sleep is 1/60 of death and Rabbi Avigdor Miller says sleep is a parable for death. Rashi says on Mishlei that old age is called the days of evil when one has less energy to serve HaShem. Therefore one has to be especially on guard after nightfall. The Mishnah I think Avot says one who stays awake at night is liable for death (Also I think this supports the opinion in the Mishnah that the latest time for the morning Shema is sunrise since that person will inevitably sleep past that). I take inspiration of the most expressed of the animals, the rooster (it has multiple times more songs in Perek Shira than any other animal) and try to sleep as early as possible to wake up as early as possible. A person has to also be on guard in the morning that is compared to the days of youth before one remembers all of his or her Torah and gets the body moving, use the restroom etc. Chumash Bereisheit 8:21 "The inclination of the heart of man (Adam - highest level) are wicked from** his youth!" My point is that I found sleeping on the floor also helped me in my "days of youth" to have a more productive morning. ​​ Mishlei says the way of the righteous is to walk to perfection. If you told someone "this is the path to perfection" would they take any steps backwards? Another proof for not paying attention to auspicious times or saying Mondays aren't good Heaven forbid since every day should be better than the previous day. A proof from nature is how great trees continue to get more and more massive like General Sherman (the largest tree by mass). Although HaShem may cut them back sometimes through storms and fires they never intend to shrink ​ The rooster: Open up your eye (Eye, Ayin, is related to Torah, since Ayin is also wellspring and water is a parable for Torah). The satiation is the bread of war (as mentioned the verse has a patach instead of segol usually used [lachem isntead of lechem] alluding to Milchama) studying Torah is kind of like going to war as its written at the Song of the Sea "HaShem is a man/master (Eish) of war" and a person has to struggle initially to climb Har Sinai (novelized with thoughts of hatred) and then struggle to understand the concepts. But after he gets it it is as satisfying as food. The same way growing and processing and baking wheat is a pain but after the victory it is worth it. Likely a reason Milchama and Lechem share root letters. Rambam says a man first has to find an occupation and get a house before he looks for a wife. Even then he may have to convince the woman he will be a good dwelling place for her. (The Torah teaches the relationship from G-d to man is like from man to his wife and G-d is called HaMacom [The Place]) This is the same concept as toiling for bread. He will probably have to engage in a form of warfare every day in the market or workplace at least a little for the sake of providing for a woman, his food/bread ​​ Another face for the pure vineyard locust: Esa Einai Ay-l HeHarim I uplift [people's] eyes to G-d with the words of His sages (the mountains) Meayin Yavo Ezri From there, their uplifted eyes (aynayim), in the virtue of my Kiruv efforts, my help will come. Also, from them lifting their eye, their minds/thoughts, to Him, He will come to help since the name YH-VH can be vowelized to be pronounced as the same word here Will Come, Ya-vo, with a Yud, Veit Alef. ​​ One of the greatest Mussar lessons I know comes from Nebuchadnezzar, the wicked king of Babylon who ruled over the whole world. He ran outside to chase it down and moved or added HaShem's name to the top. I think the source is the Gemara ​​ Do you really trust the long list of chemicals in regular soap? The point is don't trust anyone or anything like Micah says in chapter 7 - Trust no friend! Your own household is your enemies! Especially when there is a long list of unknown chemicals in your food soap etc as these Northern people are freezing (Evil comes from the North, this is why the Beit is open to the North side). ​Although I have never heard of any of these sages, the author is Rabbi David Cohen that sounds like a very pure soul and since I have not yet learned this myself it seems logical: https://www.crcweb.org/kosher_articles/kosher_body_soap.php#_ftn2 OU's article on soap says the sages compare anointing to drinking and the Gra held strictly against non kosher soap because of this. https://oukosher.org/blog/consumer-kosher/whats-the-truth-aboutkosher-soap/ However the comparison of anointing to drinking is possibly Rabbinic therefore I think the CRC saying if it is marketed to vegetarians that is enough considering it may be hard to find a perfect inexpensive soap with no questionable ingredients. Practically I have found that just rubbing myself with the hot water works just as well and have gone months doing this with not a single perceivable difference. Rambam calls soap Borit, like Brit, covenant, so nevertheless I think it is good especially considering the science of soap being able to bind one end of its molecule to water and the other end to oil to release all of the oils and abominations heathen throw on you G-d forbid. The Arizal teaches that when we bless on food or incense, there are 5 souls involved that are really potentially many many more. He teaches when we consume without blessing, we are stealing from HaShem, our parents that are considered as partners with HaShem in our creation, the soul incarnated in the food, drink, or incense, as well as from our own souls Heaven forbid. The soul that is incarnated in it is relying on you to properly be uplifted by being consumed with proper Berachot. The Gra says the mouth is the holy of holies! Therefore who knows how many potential children that that soul could end up having you would be affecting or delaying Heaven forbid. Ibn Ezra says Racheil died unexpectedly. ​ If Yaakov is the image of the man used on the Divine Chariot in YechezkAyl, and is called a master of perfection, why was he afflicted this way with his beloved wife? ​ Bereisheit 31:32 עִ֠ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר תִּמְצָ֣א אֶת־אֱלֹהֶ֘יךָ֮ לֹ֣א יִֽחְיֶה֒ נֶ֣גֶד אַחֵ֧ינוּ הַֽכֶּר־לְךָ֛ מָ֥ה עִמָּדִ֖י וְקַֽח־לָ֑ךְ וְלֹֽא־יָדַ֣ע יַעֲקֹ֔ב כִּ֥י רָחֵ֖ל גְּנָבָֽתַם׃ But anyone with whom you find your gods shall not remain alive! Wood is semi conductive ​​ Dvarim 33:25 בַּרְזֶ֥ל וּנְחֹ֖שֶׁת מִנְעָלֶ֑ךָ וּכְיָמֶ֖יךָ דׇּבְאֶֽךָ׃ "Iron and copper from your sandal and your right hand for your cleaving/strength." Why the right hand? The anatomy of the body is set up for everyone to be right handed and in fact right handed people live longer (I am in the process of training my right) If you look at a human anatomy diagram you will see that the stomach is on the left side and the colon connects to the anus on the left side. Doctors say the stomach is like another brain. And feces and urine are forces of impurity that act like fuel for the kingdom of evil to upset you with Heaven forbid (another reason why it is so important not to delay the urge to use the restroom based on the verse 'You shall not make yourselves detestable'). Therefore even if you are left handed you still want to wear rings on your right hand to direct all of the electricity sent away from the stomach and waste. ​​ -- I was reading Letters of Light during Shabbat and wanted to share this difference between Anochi and Ani on the letter כּ Caf: ​ Meaning One of the meanings of the letter kaf is “spoon.” The root of the word “spoon” is kafaf—to bend. As we discussed earlier, the kaf is a letter that is bent. It represents the aspect of submitting oneself to a greater power. ​ This notion of submission and humility can be seen clearly in the difference between the words anochi and ani. Both mean “I.” When a person walks around all day and says, “I, I, I,” he has a problem with egotism. How does one over­come this self-inflation? By adding a kaf to the אני (ani), the I, and transforming it into the אנכי ( anochi ). When the “I” submits to G‑d, when it recognizes and bends to the higher power through the kaf, it is no longer the egotistical I. Rather, אנכי (anochi) is the “I” that serves as a channel to do G‑d’s will. 14 ​ There are actually two kafs. There’s the bent kaf (כ), and the straight, or final, kaf (ך). What’s the difference? We explained previously that keter, the king’s crown, comprises two levels: pleasure and desire. It has also been described as representing the internal and external aspects of the king. In this case, internal refers to the king’s relation to himself, while external is his relationship to the world, his kingdom. Regarding the king’s internal aspect—he doesn’t necessarily want to be king, to be under the thumb of the ceaseless demands of his position. He wants to live within the boundaries of his own will, the internal world of study, erudi­tion, spirituality, and family. This is the meaning of the passage, “From his shoulders up he was taller than the rest of his people,” 15 that is, secluded from the people. The king’s crown, however, also demands the straight kaf, which unfurls to reach down to his subjects; the external level of the king’s existence. He’s required to interact, to be responsi­ble and benevolent to his kingdom. ​ The bent kaf therefore represents the introverted or inverted king—who remains isolated within his internalized world. The straight kaf (similar to the vav) represents the king who descends from his high level and reaches down to others in order to communicate with and rule his people. Page  <--click ​​ The gematria of the final Caf can be 500 while the bent Caf is always 20, another example of how heavy Kiruv is. ​ -- The word לא Lo, "No", can be novelized as, Le Alef, To HaShem. This implies when we deny ourselves some sort of forbidden pleasure due to Torah, we are glorifying HaShem. When we tell people who are trying to convince us to do something wrong "no", we are also telling them to go to HaShem and the way of Torah. ​ Also that we are on our way to becoming like HaShem, an Aluf, Master. ​​ Adar 4 ​ In Hilchot Keriat Shema 2:5 Rambam says that if one is studying Torah, he should interrupt for Shema, and if he is involved in community affairs, he should not interrupt even if the time (3 hours into the day) passes. ​ Mishnah Peah 1:1 אֵלּוּ דְבָרִים שֶׁאֵין לָהֶם שִׁעוּר. הַפֵּאָה, וְהַבִּכּוּרִים, וְהָרֵאָיוֹן, וּגְמִילוּת חֲסָדִים, וְתַלְמוּד תּוֹרָה. אֵלּוּ דְבָרִים שֶׁאָדָם אוֹכֵל פֵּרוֹתֵיהֶן בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה וְהַקֶּרֶן קַיֶּמֶת לוֹ לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא. כִּבּוּד אָב וָאֵם, וּגְמִילוּת חֲסָדִים, וַהֲבָאַת שָׁלוֹם בֵּין אָדָם לַחֲבֵרוֹ, וְתַלְמוּד תּוֹרָה כְּנֶגֶד כֻּלָּם: These are the things that have no definite quantity: The corners [of the field]. First-fruits; [The offerings brought] on appearing [at the Temple on the three pilgrimage festivals]. The performance of righteous deeds; And the study of the Torah. The following are the things for which a man enjoys the fruits in this world while the principal remains for him in the world to come: Honoring one’s father and mother; The performance of righteous deeds; And the making of peace between a person and his friend; And the study of the Torah is equal to them all. ​ If Torah is opposite all of these Mitzvot, imagine how heavy Kiruv/community affairs are to HaShem ​ I found a man talking about how the triangle people clone people in test tubes. This is forbidden as its written in Bereisheit 29:21 וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יַעֲקֹ֤ב אֶל־לָבָן֙ הָבָ֣ה אֶת־אִשְׁתִּ֔י כִּ֥י מָלְא֖וּ יָמָ֑י וְאָב֖וֹאָה אֵלֶֽיהָ׃ Then Jacob said to Laban, “Give me my wife, for my time is fulfilled, that I may enter in upon her” Artscroll stone edition says he wouldn't have been so direct if he were not in advanced age (83-86?) Ayleha, the last word, upon her, is spelled with an Alef and vowelized like the divine name Kayl. In Rabbi Kaplan's commentary on Sefer Yetrizah he says when procreating to focus on the fact that the toes allude to the power of the 10 Sefirot. Therefore by actually doing the job one can "Enter in G-d upon her", in other words bring down a much holier soul. ​​ The Arizal says not to even touch the beard lest one knock hairs off since (?
