I personally can't help to caress it (except on Shabbat) ​​ A good argument against xtians: Shemot 33:20 וַיֹּ֕אמֶר לֹ֥א תוּכַ֖ל לִרְאֹ֣ת אֶת־פָּנָ֑י כִּ֛י לֹֽא־יִרְאַ֥נִי הָאָדָ֖ם וָחָֽי׃ and said, “But you cannot see My Face, for a human being may not see Me and live.” ​ If the Omnipotent One could G-d forbid contain Himself in a single human (relatively microscopic) image although He contains many unlimited worlds according to Eytz Chaim by the Arizal's student, anyone looking at Him would immediately die ​​ Adar 7 For soap, there is a website called koshervitamins.com where there is basic ingredient soaps with a Kosher Hechsher. If you struggle with their 'licentious tazer' it may be a good idea to get spearmint gum from them too since it is apparently an anti aphrodisiac. Also they have Kosher deodorants with ingredients more simple than any I've seen ​​ If a plucked western pig asks why you have a beard give they/them a taste of their own medicine, ChatGPT: You said: medical benefits of a beard ChatGPT said: Growing a beard isn’t just a style choice—it actually has several medical benefits backed by science. Here are some of the key advantages: 1. Protection from UV Rays Beards can block up to 95% of harmful UV radiation, reducing the risk of sunburn and skin cancer on the lower face. 2. Prevents Skin Irritation & Acne Shaving can cause razor burn, ingrown hairs, and skin irritation. A beard acts as a natural barrier, preventing these issues. 3. Keeps Skin Moisturized Facial hair helps retain natural oils produced by the skin, preventing dryness and irritation. 4. Traps Allergens & Reduces Asthma Symptoms A thick beard can act as a filter, trapping dust, pollen, and other allergens, preventing them from entering the respiratory system. 5. Helps Regulate Temperature In cold weather, beards provide insulation, keeping the face warm. In hot weather, they help by blocking direct sunlight. 6. Slows Down Aging Protects the skin from wind and environmental damage, helping to prevent wrinkles and premature aging. 7. Reduces Bacterial Infections Beards can act as a protective barrier against bacteria, reducing the chances of infections and breakouts from touching the face too much. Would you like tips on beard care to maximize these benefits? ​ Adar 9 ​ BeRachamim LeChayim on Zohar Bereisheit 47a from Chabad ​- More fundamentals are stressed, namely the importance of the Torah study in general, and the secrets of the Torah in particular, and we will ideally wrestle with the GaN (53) parshiot of the Torah. ​ Man cannot live by bread alone, but rather all that comes from the mouth of G‑d — the Torah messages of all levels of PaRDeS. Just because this selection helps us to satisfy our need to delve into hidden mysteries does not relieve us of our required work to build a vessel to receive such teachings. ​ This "cup" is the Oral Torah, and it is the receptacle of all "Above" it. Just like the Sukkah is a receiver of blessings [Sukkot has the letters Kos (cup) [tiferet], meaning the Sukkah is like a cup that gets filled with blessings from G‑d], so too should we mold ourselves to be Mekubalim, those that receive from sacred sources. ​ As we begin this adventure of learning these important Zohar's, it befits us to prepare the Bride ['HaKalah/the bride' is the same letters as 'Halakhah/law' or legal path to follow] and engage in the learning from the other areas (Scripture, Mishnah, Talmud, Midrash, Musar, Jewish Law] from the wealth of Jewish sources.​ - Hakalah can also be novelized with Hachallah - The Shabbat Bread​ ​ ​ Adar 10 Mussar Bereisheit 2:9 וַיַּצְמַ֞ח יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהִים֙ מִן־הָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה כׇּל־עֵ֛ץ נֶחְמָ֥ד לְמַרְאֶ֖ה וְט֣וֹב לְמַאֲכָ֑ל וְעֵ֤ץ הַֽחַיִּים֙ בְּת֣וֹךְ הַגָּ֔ן וְעֵ֕ץ הַדַּ֖עַת ט֥וֹב וָרָֽע׃ And from the ground God יהוה caused to grow every tree that was pleasing to the sight and good for food, with the tree of life in the middle of the garden, and the tree of knowledge of good and bad. ​ Again, a whole tree is compared to an Adam, highest level of man, wheras a branch is an Eish, master is a branch as its written in Judges 9:49 וַיִּכְרְת֨וּ גַם־כׇּל־הָעָ֜ם אִ֣ישׁ שׂוֹכֹ֗ה וַיֵּ֨לְכ֜וּ אַחֲרֵ֤י אֲבִימֶ֙לֶךְ֙ וַיָּשִׂ֣ימוּ עַֽל־הַצְּרִ֔יחַ And they cut also all the people (related to Chatzir, meadow, as its written in the Song of the Fly "Indeed, the Chatzir HaAm, cut grass/moss is the people. One can cut through a grass field with a branch. Eish also starts with Aluf for master and is a parable for a bull) [Every] man a branch and walked after Avimelech and laid them on the tunnel. ​ Eish Shochah can be novelized on its own - "A man/master is a branch". Also according to Rabbi Simcha B of Chabad, Although Adam is the highest title for man, Eish actually represents mastery over something better, like how a spear is better suited for unexpected combat than having a tree since it is usually hard to find a good spear from a tree. ​ Anyway 8.5 years ago when I turned 20 and became aware of all of the grass people stalking me, my father (Rambam says one has to listen to the Torah approved commands of even wicked parents and uses the word Mimenu 'of Us' rather than Mimenah 'of her') would tell me "just enjoy it". Therefore if you are an Adam and compared to a tree and pleasing to the eyes instead of getting upset about all the grass watching you just appreciate that you are pleasing to look at and be a model citizen as in the verse I think in YeshaYaHu "On that day the stump of Yehudah will become a model citizen" and "stand up Tzadikkim to double your reward in Olam Haba" like the Rooster says. The only time I can remember staring at the grass in my yard not for gardening is when I first moved in after a drought and large patches were dead otherwise I always look at the trees and strawberries. ​​ Etz can also mean wood on its own like the term Celei Eitz, vessels of wood, and therefore the verse in Bereisheit can be seen Etz Nechmad Lemareh, Tree or wood (a branch) that is pleasing/desirable to behold Therefore even a person compared to a "stick" (as in someone who lives 'out in the sticks') will have "followers" - ​ Rambam says in Hilchot Tefilot that the original obligation of prayer was that each person would pray every day according to his ability and Ezra established the fixed prayer. Imagine being able to pray any Tehillim or Pesukei Dezimra every day and on busy or difficult days cut back and then being told you have to pray the same exact 18 paragraphs 3 and sometimes 4 times a day. It becomes impossible to focus every time. About this its written "Shir Chadash! Sing a new song!" and "Their service of me is routine commands of man" and there may be an additional about lip service. The last time and many many times before that I did Shemona Esrei I took a strong tazer so I reverted to before the Shemona Esrei decree because of Bittul Nefesh - Negligence of the soul and I would highly recommend music or at least singing with it as its written "Azi veZimrat Y-h" My strength is hooked on my song [to] Y-h. The Gemara I think in Berachot says the Satin has no power when music is playing. ​ This is a separate obligation from Shema and if you are surrounded by heathen and the thought of a service sickens you I would at least face toward the Beit Hamikdash in Jerusalem with a shirt that is not an undershirt with my right hand over my left on my heart facing a wall in a fixed place of prayer and whisper "Todah Rabbah HaShem - Thank You very much HaShem" and I personally say "Ahavti Ayt Atah HaShem - I love You HaShem", and the Ayt, Alef-Taf again symbolizes everything, beginning to end, like A to Z with the soul of Tzeirei, alluding to Binah, Understanding. I have also heard in Artscroll's Sefer Bereisheit (not Stone Edition) that the Simichut form of a word like the first letter of the Torah, Bereisheit, that ends in Taf, symbolizes "leaning", or relying/depending on the next subject ​ Todah Rabbah HaShem because I have seen someone quote Rabbi Natan who said that one who thanks HaShem gains an additional level of awareness and vice versa. Ahavti Ayt Atah HaShem because Rabbi Avigdor Miller actually says its a Mitzvah to verbally declare ones love of HAShem daily and the final Nun symbolizes serving HaShem out of love as opposed to the regular Nun, serving out of fear, and the final letter contains the original letters. One cannot love something without fear of losing it, or else he or she does not really love it. ​​ - Mishlei 6:26 כִּ֤י בְעַד־אִשָּׁ֥ה זוֹנָ֗ה עַֽד־כִּכַּ֫ר־לָ֥חֶם וְאֵ֥שֶׁת אִ֑ישׁ נֶ֖פֶשׁ יְקָרָ֣ה תָצֽוּד׃ {פ} The last loaf of bread will go for a harlot; A married woman will snare a person of honor. ​ Another face: Indeed a licentious woman will separate herself/turn back/look through the window (different definitions of Vead. The window I think is a parable for light/life) [after] witnessing the bread of war - Cicar Lachem (I have read from one of the Yeshivot websites that women used to beautify themselves before going to war against the Jewish people so that they could entice the soldiers to take them according to the laws of Yefet Toar and give themselves the best chances of "striking root" and living forever as a Jewish wife) and the wife of an Eish  (man/master - someone with some intentional sins but still has his Alef, bull, spiritual level) will snare a precious soul (since he is not an idolator waging war on you you cannot take his wife). The next two verses prove it: הֲיַחְתֶּ֤ה אִ֓ישׁ אֵ֬שׁ בְּחֵיק֑וֹ וּ֝בְגָדָ֗יו לֹ֣א תִשָּׂרַֽפְנָה׃ Can a man rake embers (another man's wife is a half of him and an Eish is compared to Aysh, fire) into his bosom Without burning his clothes? אִם־יְהַלֵּ֣ךְ אִ֭ישׁ עַל־הַגֶּחָלִ֑ים וְ֝רַגְלָ֗יו לֹ֣א תִכָּוֶֽינָה׃ Can a man walk on live coals Without scorching his feet? ​ Another face: Indeed (puke) - [you can] physically lean out the window [that is a] licentious woman temptation (that is actually puke) forever and witness the bread of/during war (Yefet Toar), or have her witness a loaf of bread (teach her Torah - remember that its not necessary to actually have relations, teaching a woman Torah is a metaphor for taking her to your house). And the wife of an Eish, a master of his Nefesh, blood, preciousness she traps (when she forsakes him to whore after an Adam or another precious soul) Heaven forbid! ​​ Adar 11 וְנָתַתִּ֛י עֵ֥שֶׂב בְּשָׂדְךָ֖ לִבְהֶמְתֶּ֑ךָ וְאָכַלְתָּ֖ וְשָׂבָֽעְתָּ׃ I will also provide grass in the fields for your cattle—and thus you shall eat your fill. ​ I will give the West, Esau (like Eisev, grass) the wicked and other coarse and wicked heathen (grass is a parable for this) in your field (your head, your world), or [who is with] your field (what you can see of the underworld of dead plant and animal matter) to be your animal (your servant, your disciple) and you will eat them and be sated, or you will eat together and be sated together. ​​ - ​ In addition to the basic minimal prayer I think a person should say a verse or two containing the idea of each of the 6 remembrances (Exodus of Egypt, Matan (Giving of) Torah, Amalek's attack, the golden calf incident, Miriam's episode, and Shabbat to plan to make it special. I think the Exodus from Egypt also needs to be remembered every night. ​ -- ​ If you are married do not wear your ring on your left ring finger or ever put any metal on your left side. I tried it out for you and got heated for awhile ​ ​An argument for women not wanting to have a child because she has to carry him/her for 9 months and go through childbirth - A woman can eat a lot more food and has an increased appetite when pregnant. ChatGPT says it varies but in the later 6 months its about another meal a day. Isaiah 65(?) - "My servants shall eat" ​​ ​ -- ​ An interesting part of the Pesach Haggadah I think about often: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִן אַתָּה אוֹמֵר שֶׁלָּקוּ הַמִּצְרִים בְּמִצְרַיִם עֶשֶׂר מַכּוֹת וְעַל הַיָּם לָקוּ חֲמִשִּׁים מַכּוֹת? בְּמִצְרַיִם מַה הוּא אוֹמֵר? וַיֹּאמְרוּ הַחַרְטֻמִּם אֶל־פַּרְעֹה, אֶצְבַּע אֱלֹהִים הִוא. וְעַל הַיָּם מָה הוּא אוֹמֵר? וַיַּרְא יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶת־הַיָּד הַגְּדֹלָה אֲשֶׁר עָשָׂה יְיָ בְּמִצְרַיִם, וַיִּירְאוּ הָעָם אֶת־יְיָ, וַיַּאֲמִינוּ בַּייָ וּבְמשֶׁה עַבְדוֹ. כַּמָה לָקוּ בְאֶצְבַּע? עֶשֶׂר מַכּוֹת. אֱמוֹר מֵעַתָּה: בְּמִצְרַים לָקוּ עֶשֶׂר מַכּוֹת וְעַל הַיָּם לָקוּ חֲמִשִּׁים מַכּוֹת. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי RABBI Yossei HaGelili says: How can you know that the Egyptians were struck with ten plagues in Egypt and another fifty at the sea? For in Egypt it is said, “The astrologers said to Pharaoh, ‘This is the finger of God,’” while at the sea it is said, “When Israel saw the great hand the LORD raised against the Egyptians, the people feared the LORD, and they believed in the LORD and in His servant Moses.” If a finger struck them with ten plagues, conclude from this that THEY WERE STRUCK WITH TEN PLAGUES IN EGYPT AND WITH FIFTY PLAGUES AT THE SEA. ​ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִן שֶׁכָּל־מַכָּה וּמַכָּה שֶׁהֵבִיא הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא עַל הַמִּצְרִים בְּמִצְרַיִם הָיְתָה שֶׁל אַרְבַּע מַכּוֹת? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: יְשַׁלַּח־בָּם חֲרוֹן אַפּוֹ, עֶבְרָה וָזַעַם וְצָרָה, מִשְׁלַחַת מַלְאֲכֵי רָעִים. עֶבְרָה – אַחַת, וָזַעַם – שְׁתַּיִם, וְצָרָה – שָׁלֹשׁ, מִשְׁלַחַת מַלְאֲכֵי רָעִים – אַרְבַּע. אֱמוֹר מֵעַתָּה: בְּמִצְרַיִם לָקוּ אַרְבָּעִים מַכּוֹת וְעַל הַיָּם לָקוּ מָאתַיִם מַכּוֹת. Rabbi Eliezer says: How can you know that each and every plague the Holy One brought upon the Egyptians in Egypt was in fact made up of four plagues? For it is said, “His fury was sent down upon them, great anger, rage, and distress, a company of messengers of destruction.” “Great anger” – one, “rage” – two, “distress” – three, “a company of messengers of destruction” – four. Conclude from this that THEY WERE STRUCK WITH FORTY PLAGUES IN EGYPT AND WITH TWO HUNDRED PLAGUES AT THE SEA. ​ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִן שֶׁכָּל־מַכָּה וּמַכָּה שֶהֵבִיא הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא עַל הַמִּצְרִים בְּמִצְרַיִם הָיְתָה שֶׁל חָמֵשׁ מַכּוֹת? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: יְִשַׁלַּח־בָּם חֲרוֹן אַפּוֹ, עֶבְרָה וָזַעַם וְצָרָה, מִשְׁלַחַת מַלְאֲכֵי רָעִים. חֲרוֹן אַפּוֹ – אַחַת, עֶבְרָה – שְׁתַּיִם, וָזַעַם – שָׁלוֹשׁ, וְצָרָה – אַרְבַּע, מִשְׁלַחַת מַלְאֲכֵי רָעִים – חָמֵשׁ. אֱמוֹר מֵעַתָּה: בְּמִצְרַיִם לָקוּ חֲמִשִּׁים מַכּות וְעַל הַיָּם לָקוּ חֲמִשִּׁים וּמָאתַיִם מַכּוֹת. Rabbi Akiva says: How can you know that each and every plague the Holy One brought upon the Egyptians in Egypt was in fact made up of five plagues? For it is said, “His fury was sent down upon them, great anger, rage, and distress, a company of messengers of destruction.” “His fury” – one, “great anger” – two, “rage” – three, “distress” – four, “a company of messengers of destruction” – five. Conclude from this that THEY WERE STRUCK WITH FIFTY PLAGUES IN EGYPT AND WITH TWO HUNDRED AND FIFTY PLAGUES AT THE SEA. ​​ ​ וְהָיָ֞ה כִּֽי־יִשְׁאָלְךָ֥ בִנְךָ֛ מָחָ֖ר לֵאמֹ֣ר מַה־זֹּ֑את וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֵלָ֔יו בְּחֹ֣זֶק יָ֗ד הוֹצִיאָ֧נוּ יְהֹוָ֛ה מִמִּצְרַ֖יִם מִבֵּ֥ית עֲבָדִֽים׃ When your son asks you at a later time saying ‘What is this?’ You should say to him, “With a strong hand Adonoy brought us out of Egypt from the house of slavery. ​​ ​ --- At the fairmount park resevoir in PhiladelphiY-H PA I learned one should put cords in lines on their windows so birds don't try to fly in and hit themselves. Apply this to The Ancient Parable and you can get rolls of Warrior Wrap electrical tape on Amazon for less than 1.50 each and save spiritual and physical birds of pr(a)y and birds and yourself from the horror of the knock. ​Bereisheit 4:7 הֲל֤וֹא אִם־תֵּיטִיב֙ שְׂאֵ֔ת וְאִם֙ לֹ֣א תֵיטִ֔יב לַפֶּ֖תַח חַטָּ֣את רֹבֵ֑ץ וְאֵלֶ֙יךָ֙ תְּשׁ֣וּקָת֔וֹ וְאַתָּ֖ה תִּמְשׇׁל־בּֽוֹ׃ Surely, if you do right, There is uplift. But if you do not do right Sin couches at the door; Its urge is toward you, Yet you can be its master.” ​ לַפֶּ֖תַח חַטָּ֣את רֹבֵ֑ץ can be novelized as "To the opening, sin stretches out and reclines for meals." ​​​ -- The sages teach I think in Shabbat Bavli that after eating anything a person should eat a little salt and after drinking, water. I have found amazing results using celery salt as the song of vegetables is יְרָקוֹת שֶׁבַּשָּׂדֶה אוֹמְרִים. תְּלָמֶיהָ רַוֵּה נַחֵת גְּדוּדֶהָ בִּרְבִיבִים תְּמֹגְגֶנָּה צִמְחָהּ תְּבָרֵךְ: (תהילים סה יא) The Vegetables of the Field are saying, “You water its furrows abundantly; you settle its ridges; you make it soft with showers; You bless its growth.” ​(don't take as much where it doesn't taste good) ​ ​ -- After studying the Avnei Choshen Mishpat (Stones of the Priestly Breastplate) here is my opinion: emerald - topaz - ruby diamond - sapphire - turquoise amethyst - agate - Amber (LeShem - another epic stone as it is a Zicharon/remembrance of HaShem and can be novelized "To HaShem!") jasper - Onyx - beryl ​ I got silver/copper wire and a black leather cord and all these beads (3mm-6mm) on Etsy for around $130 to make a necklace to have these gems in this order over my heart all the time and plan on selling them on Etsy or my business website for maybe around $180 ​​ -- ​ A person can get a Moen shower head on Amazon and with needle nose pliers easily remove the plastic reduction filter on the back and have the best showers ever, I think preferable to a hot tub for a thousandth of the cost. ​​ -- ​ Why is Wisdom compared to water and Understanding to fire? When a person first starts learning Torah, the basic seeds of Wisdom, the new world of parables and mysteries and powers of Kabbalah are sweet like drinking water after being dehydrated or bread and honey when starved. ​ After a person reviews and digests the foods of Torah (burns them) he/she realizes, or Understands that his or her very existence and consciousness and ability to sense pleasures is constantly on the line and also that a rod of fiery rebuke will come even for negligent mistakes and it burns and fuels them like fire. ​ ​Tehillim 73:2 וַאֲנִ֗י כִּ֭מְעַט (נטוי) [נָטָ֣יוּ] רַגְלָ֑י כְּ֝אַ֗יִן (שפכה) [שֻׁפְּכ֥וּ] אֲשֻׁרָֽי And I, in a moment I could have stretched my feet (desires) [for those who are, or and become] like nothing. My steps poured out, or poured out being my happinesses/fortunes. Heaven save us ANA 49:9 and 12 וְ֭יֵקַר פִּדְי֥וֹן נַפְשָׁ֗ם וְחָדַ֥ל לְעוֹלָֽם׃ the price of life is too high; and so one ceases to be, forever.​ קִרְבָּ֤ם בָּתֵּ֨ימוֹ ׀ לְֽעוֹלָ֗ם מִ֭שְׁכְּנֹתָם לְד֣וֹר וָדֹ֑ר קָרְא֥וּ בִ֝שְׁמוֹתָ֗ם עֲלֵ֣י אֲדָמֽוֹת׃ Their grave is their eternal home, the dwelling-place for all generations of those once famous on earth. ---​ ​ ​ The real reason there is a large rubber pad on the left side of the driving pedals of a car is so wise people who wear sandals can put their bare left heel on it --- ​ Adar 13 ​ What is the parable of superheroes wearing capes? Are they aesthetic? Wouldn't they get in the way when fighting crime? ​ Its because when a person is eating or drinking they are compared to a superhero if they make Berachot (blessings) before and after and thereby properly elevate that soul . A person who does this will likely be wearing a Tallit, a 4 cornered garment and if he is pious and it is a Tallit Gadol (big) then he will likely throw it behind his back like a cape so it doesn't get stained (another reason many Orthodox Jews wear black). Stains on our clothing make them testify against us and they actually make a Torah scholar spiritually liable for death for belittling Torah. (I personally wear Techeilet Rambam style)​ ​ -- ​ To finish the parable on Wisdom-water and Understanding-fire a few paragraphs above, Heaven, Shamayim, can be novelized as Aysh Mayim, fire-water. A person who has learned enough Wisdom of Torah and has grown those seeds through meditating and review and has reached the level of Understanding knows that there will come a day when his free will to serve HaShem in this dark world and earn reward and honor HaShem from the depths will end. Therefore the burning fire is worth it to attain the unimaginable pleasures of The World to Come. It is said that in Avot 4:16-17 רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר, הָעוֹלָם הַזֶּה דּוֹמֶה לִפְרוֹזְדוֹר בִּפְנֵי הָעוֹלָם הַבָּא. הַתְקֵן עַצְמְךָ בַפְּרוֹזְדוֹר, כְּדֵי שֶׁתִּכָּנֵס לַטְּרַקְלִין: Rabbi Jacob said: this world is like a vestibule before the world to come; prepare yourself in the vestibule, so that you may enter the banqueting-hall. הוּא הָיָה אוֹמֵר, יָפָה שָׁעָה אַחַת בִּתְשׁוּבָה וּמַעֲשִׂים טוֹבִים בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה, מִכָּל חַיֵּי הָעוֹלָם הַבָּא. וְיָפָה שָׁעָה אַחַת שֶׁל קוֹרַת רוּחַ בָּעוֹלָם הַבָּא, מִכָּל חַיֵּי הָעוֹלָם הַזֶּה: He used to say: more precious is one hour in repentance and good deeds in this world, than all the life of the world to come; And more precious is one hour of the tranquility of the world to come, than all the life of this world. ​ A good way to put it is the Song of the Fish in Perek Shira: The voice of HaShem is upon the waters (the first experience of the sweet waters of Wisdom). The voice of HaShem thunders (the burning realization that HaShem is a "Zealous G-d" and our existence hangs in the balance every day as the sages teach in Avot 'Do not be sure of yourself until the day of your death'). The voice of HaShem is upon many waters (the pleasures of TWTC and the era of Mashiach). ​​ -- ​ Another argument against the brainwashed western theory on 'enjoying being single and travelling when young' ​ Kiddushin 29b רַב הוּנָא לְטַעְמֵיהּ דְּאָמַר: בֶּן עֶשְׂרִים שָׁנָה וְלֹא נָשָׂא אִשָּׁה – כׇּל יָמָיו בַּעֲבֵירָה. בַּעֲבֵירָה סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: כָּל יָמָיו בְּהִרְהוּר עֲבֵירָה. The Gemara notes: Rav Huna conforms to his standard line of reasoning, as he says: If one is twenty years old and has not yet married a woman, all of his days will be in a state of sin concerning sexual matters. The Gemara asks: Can it enter your mind that he will be in a state of sin all of his days? Rather, say that this means the following: All of his days will be in a state of thoughts of sin, i.e., sexual thoughts. One who does not marry in his youth will become accustomed to thoughts of sexual matters, and the habit will remain with him the rest of his life. אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: הַאי דַּעֲדִיפְנָא מֵחַבְרַאי, דִּנְסֵיבְנָא בְּשִׁיתְּסַר, וְאִי הֲוָה נָסֵיבְנָא בְּאַרְבֵּיסַר Rav Ḥisda said: The fact that I am superior to my colleagues is because I married at the age of sixteen, and if I would have married at the age of fourteen, 30a הֲוָה אָמֵינָא לְשָׂטָן: גִּירָא בְּעֵינָיךְ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַבִּי נָתָן בַּר אַמֵּי: אַדִּידָךְ עַל צַוְּארֵי דִּבְרָיךְ. מִשִּׁיתְּסַר וְעַד עֶשְׂרִים וְתַרְתֵּי וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: מִתַּמְנֵי סְרֵי עַד עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה. I would say to the Satan: An arrow in your eye, i.e., I would not be afraid of the evil inclination at all. Rava said to Rabbi Natan bar Ami: While your hand is still on your son’s neck, i.e., while you still have authority and control over him, find him a wife. What is the appropriate age? From sixteen until twenty-two, and some say from eighteen until twenty-four. כְּתַנָּאֵי: ״חֲנֹךְ לַנַּעַר עַל פִּי דַרְכּוֹ״, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה, חַד אָמַר: מִשִּׁיתְּסַר וְעַד עֶשְׂרִים וְתַרְתֵּין, וְחַד אָמַר: מִתַּמְנֵי סְרֵי וְעַד עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבְּעָה. The Gemara notes that this is like a dispute between tanna’im, based on the verse: “Train a child in the way that he should go” (Proverbs 22:6). Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Neḥemya disagreed about the age in which the verse instructs the parent to educate his child: One said that the verse is referring to the ages from sixteen until twenty-two, and one said it is referring to the ages from eighteen until twenty-four. The dispute concerning the correct age for marriage and the dispute about educating a child are the same, as while a father still has a large measure of influence over his son, he must both teach him and find him a wife. I think the education here is referring to Gemara and Midrash since a person is obligated to start teaching his child as soon as he can speak, as Rambam says in Hilchot Talmud Torah: מֵאֵימָתַי אָבִיו חַיָּב לְלַמְּדוֹ תּוֹרָה. מִשֶּׁיַּתְחִיל לְדַבֵּר מְלַמְּדוֹ (דברים לג ד) "תּוֹרָה צִוָּה לָנוּ משֶׁה" וּ(דברים ו ד) "שְׁמַע יִשְׂרָאֵל", וְאַחַר כָּךְ מְלַמְּדוֹ מְעַט מְעַט פְּסוּקִים פְּסוּקִים עַד שֶׁיִּהְיֶה בֶּן שֵׁשׁ אוֹ בֶּן שֶׁבַע הַכּל לְפִי בֻּרְיוֹ. וּמוֹלִיכוֹ אֵצֶל מְלַמֵּד הַתִּינוֹקוֹת: At what age is a father obligated to teach [his son] Torah? When he begins to speak, he should teach him Torah tzivah lanu Moshe... (Deuteronomy 33:4) and Shema Yisrael... (ibid. 6:4). Afterwards, he should teach him [selected verses], little by little, verse by verse, until he is six or seven - depending on his health - [at which time] he should take him to a teacher of young children. ​ Another argument I've seen I think from one of the P'Shat commentaries is for people who say they don't want children, "What will you do in your old age?" Its actually a Halacha to support your parents in their old age I believe (need to review specifics) like its written in Mishlei "Do not forsake your mother in her old age" ​​ Rashi says on Mishlei that old age is also called "The days of evil" since one has less energy to serve HaShem, compared to the end of one's day (every day is a parable for a lifetime) ​​ -- 1 Kings 5:5 וַיֵּ֩שֶׁב֩ יְהוּדָ֨ה וְיִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל לָבֶ֗טַח אִ֣ישׁ תַּ֤חַת גַּפְנוֹ֙ וְתַ֣חַת תְּאֵנָת֔וֹ And Yehudah and Israel dwelt securely, every many under his vine and under his fig tree. ​ Midrash Tanchuma says every place Vayeishev - And he dwelt - is mentioned, it connotes misfortune. Midrash Tehillim said Shlomo had 1000 wives and each one would prepare a royal feast and proclaim he was going to dine with her (it is forbidden to be wasteful) ​ Also the next verse, 5:6 is about Shlomo increasing to 40k stables for his horses and 12k horsemen. Rambam says on Dvarim 17:16 "Only [a king] may not increase for himself horses" in Hilchot Melachim UMilchamot 3:3 He may not accumulate many horses, only what is necessary for his cavalry. It is even forbidden for him to have one additional horse to run before him as is customarily done by other kings. If he adds an additional horse, he is to be lashed. ​ It seems that 40k stables filled with horses would be unnecessary for only 12k calvarymen, alluding to the troubles he brought upon the Kingdom David HaMelech established. ​ A more positive face on this verse: Yehudah and Israel are secure when every man (Eish, master) is under his fig tree (Torah, compared to his wife) and grape vine (wife, as the Song of the Vine in Perek Shira is "Your wife will be a fruitful vine in the inner corners of your house") ​ I think Rashi or Ohr HaChaim say on Bereisheit that HaShem commanded all the trees to be entirely fruitful and the fig was the only tree to fulfill that command and even have edible wood. I have tasted some roots from my fig tree and they are sweet. I even tasted some soil under a fig tree in Tzfat (a person's property is an extension of himself and one can compare a tree's canopy to its real estate) and it was actually sweet like a light sugar. Therefore the fig is one of the major opinions of the fruit of the Tree of Knowledge of Good and Evil (Rabbi Efraim Palvanov says it was a combination of all 4 opinions, grape, fig, wheat, and apple [If I remember correctly]) as since Adam and Chayyah sewed fig leaves to clothe themselves Rashi says by the same tree they sinned with, it was the only one willing to provide them clothing. ​Therefore the fig is a great tree for a Torah parable as Tehillim says "The Torah of HaShem is perfect". ​ Also Ohr Somayach's Perek Shira special on their site says on the Song of the Fig "he who watches the fig will eat of Her fruits" that just like one has to carefully watch a fig from pestillent bugs, dryness, etc to enjoy the best fruit, one has to constantly meditate on his Torah like Tehillim 1 says in order to be happy. ​ They are "under" the trees because like a man is a slave to Torah, Rabbi Avigdor Miller says a man is responsible for the happiness and success of his wife and children, therefore one's security is dependent on being submissive to the Will of HaShem. ​ I think this verse also discourages bee colony-like apartment living since every person should have the joy of tending a garden, like how Adam was originally a gardener. To sprout is Litzmoach - לצמוח and to rejoice is Lismoach - לשמוח As mentioned before Sadai, my fields, can be novelized with HaShem's named Sha-dai, That That is Sufficient. Is apartment living really sufficient? If you are living in an apartment you should know there is free camping outside Boulder CO and I'm sure you can find discreet parking if you look hard enough anywhere, get a planet fitness membership or Mikveh membership for like $20 for deep showers and a fillable shower bag, a portable fillable bidet (alternatively find a spot by a stream, a metaphor for kings) and survive on delivery driving apps in order to have your own 4 walls and peace anywhere in America and maybe Israel (not sure about other places). If you do this you will need a reliable car with decent MPGs like a Toyota or older Honda or the repair expenses could make you desolate Heaven forbid (My '04 Camry was $~3k on FB Marketplace after repairs and has had no issue for almost a year of having it). ​ ​Beware of Kold Kricket Klub Kops trying to finance more members by harpooning you in the streets and piling unnecessary charges on you Heaven save us (like mentioned above the US flag bumper sticker has worked wonders for me, maybe a blue line flag would be even better lol). You can find very cheap plots of land to park on outside cities on Land.com especially out West. If you can find a remote job you can get Starlink and solar panels and have your own world on 100+ acres somewhere ​ Also once we get purified with the ashes of the red heifer from the impurity of the dead, if one person spiritually falls and dies and brings the Tumat Meit (death impurity) into a building, it will transfer to everyone under that roof. ​​ --- ​ ​Vayikra /Leviticus 6:5 אֵ֗שׁ תָּמִ֛יד תּוּקַ֥ד עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ לֹ֥א תִכְבֶּֽה׃ {ס} "A perpetual fire shall be kept burning on the altar, do not extinguish [it]" ​ When the sun, the free daily fire, is up, I think one should ideally put off having relations if he can until dark since the sun provides energy to be more productive, and one loses a lot of energy after ejaculating. Also one is punished for looking at his wife naked which is hard to avoid in daylight, yet people are supposed to have relations naked to have skin to skin contact. I have heard of a man having to be reincarnated (maybe from Minchat Yehudah?) as a sheep for having relations with his wife by candlelight. This is probably another reason why the sages teach that Erev (Eve of, instead of during the day of) Shabbat after digesting dinner is the best time. ​​ "[When the] continuous fire is upon the alter (the sun, trustworthy to continue illuminating the world every morning and is always burning on some part of Earth), do not extinguish [your fire, masters (by giving it to the woman)]" ​​ -- ​ Saying "Heaven/G-d forbid" is like your eraser or delete button for your programming interface if you ever need to say anything that can be understood in a negative context. Therefore in Orthodox communities you will hear people say it all the time. Also "Bli Neder" - "Without a vow". It is common to say we will do things for people like have a meal, do a favor, etc at some time and then we get discouraged when the time comes or something else happens. When we make an agreement (if they are not a treacherous cricket or ravaging boar in order to appease them to their face) then that counts as an oath and obligates us in that action. Therefore Orthodox people always say Bli Neder when making plans to exempt ourselves from any judgements. ​​ By the way Rambam says not to eat in public (I think unless necessary) because it incurs contempt from people and it was the way of the previous generations that people would only ever eat in their houses. Like its written I think in Tehillim if not Mishlei "Their (the wickeds') souls loathe food". Therefore when they see a servant of HaShem who has given him/her an appetite enjoying food they will likely cast an evil eye on you Heaven save us. When Balaam saw that Israel's tents were faces opposite each other so as not to gaze into each others' houses, he said "How goodly are your tents, oh Yaakov" (Bamidbar /Numbers). Based on this it is actually a Halacha to not gaze into people's private property/windows etc without a valid reason and also I only learned this once (its always necessary to review) but after neighboring houses are established one cannot open another window facing his neighbors house (or something like that) with specifics/exceptions. ​​ ---- ​ When I was researching the LeShem stone that I decided that I think is Amber, I saw a Rabbinical insight that it is made of Lynx urine. 'Although they line up at your door.." Since the Songs of the Cat in Perek Shira are about taking down those who make their homes with the stars like a vulture and not turning back from pursuit of our enemies until we destroy them: ​ חָתוּל אוֹמֵר. אִם־תַּגְבִּיהַּ כַּנֶּשֶׁר וְאִם־בֵּין כּֽוֹכָבִים שִׂים קִנֶּךָ מִשָּׁם אוֹרִֽידְךָ נְאֻם־יְיָ׃ (עובדיה א ד) The Cat is saying, “If you rise up like a vulture, and place your nest among the stars, from there I shall bring you down, says YHVH.” וּכְשֶׁמַגִיעוֹ אוֹמֵר. אֶרְדּוֹף אוֹיְבַי וְאַשִּׂיגֵם וְלֹא־אָשׁוּב עַד־כַּלּוֹתָם׃ (תהלים יח לח) And when the cat catches it (the mouse), the cat says, “I have pursued my enemies and overtaken them, and I did not return until they were destroyed.” ​ therefore I think it is a great idea to get an Amber bracelet for like $10-$20 on Etsy also again considering it can be novelized LeHaShem! As in the Prophecy "Shuvu Banim Shovavim' - 'Return, backsliding children!' ​ Also when a person wakes up, they have a ton of impurity on them from evil spirits entering their empty body overnight. Therefore the Zohar teaches to reduce this and have a much better day, right after getting out of bed or even better while still in bed wash the hands with a cup alternating 3 times right then left (that is why Jewish houses have large 2 handled cups. Other than this I don't think one needs to wash this way since the impurity is at the highest level of Death and is irrelevant. Before eating one should always clean the hands but as mentioned I have trust issues with the public water supply since they can stream unseen things in any time, unless you have a private well. Maybe alcohol or homemade hand sanitizer would be good but then you run the risk of weakening your immune system. Personally I rinse the fingers after using the restroom and use that water to rub the rest of my hands and immediately dry it and since I usually never leave my house my hands are clean for meals and I don't trust it right before eating unless my hands are dirty since I suspect it as a primary source of western affliction - as mentioned anointing is compared to drinking. For the morning washing water, you can collect this in a bucket and dump this water outside your doors (I have heard a story of someone dumping this water on plants and they all died). I did this last Friday and heard someone gasp in horror maybe 400 feet away. This is preferable to urine as that gets messy and is vile. ​​ Another idea is that Ive seen a home (maybe multiple) in Tzfat with a large bulb of garlic outside their door. Therefore I also have some garlic hanging up (I think bloody bloodless people hate the smell) ​​ If necessary when the heathen start h eat en you Heaven forbid, a good way to cut the grass is by throwing your strong hand like a baseball outfielder with a "crow hop" (like a single skip/gallop or two) and take your stronger hand from your stronger thigh behind you and launch it with a full circular motion, all fingers Heavenwards and outwards and down, like an outfielder throwing down someone at home Beis. ** Do not extend two fingers like baseball players do when they actually throw a baseball, again that would be witchcraft. (remember that sports are Shachak/dust, mockery and only permitted for exercise - nevertheless like Avot says "Who is wise? Who learns from every person". One should never embarrass their future selves by paying to attend and spectate a dusty mockery or workout session with all of the wild animals screaming profanities and Lashon Hara on the players) ​​ -- ​ Returning to the verse about the fire continuously being on the alter and comparing it to not to extinguish one's strength during the day (a few paragraphs up). עבר עין אור איבר From right to left --> Ever (To make pregnant), Ayin (eye, wellspring), Ohr (light), Ayvar (male organ). Ohr can actually be read with a Tzeireih and Patach to be Ayvar phonetically exactly. ​​ These words being similar allude to the fact that while it is day and 'the lights are on', it is like being a woman and having relations with HaShem, who has unlimited strength (it is known that the amount/length of pleasure that can be had in marital relations is dependent on the man's strength). The word day, יום Yom, can be novelized as Y-o (HaShem) and a Final Mem, Hidden Torah. It is saying it is the time for HaShem! Ideally to study the heavier aspects of Torah if one can. Also the final letters contain the first letters so it is saying study all aspects of Torah. Remember that studying Torah is compared to sexual relations. The name Y-o is an allusion to YH-VH, the name of Tiferet, Middle, Beauty, Truth, copper, Balance, the torso, and is more of a masculine and all inclusive name as opposed to Elokim, Gods associated with Gevurah, Judgement, Severity, Blood, Kingship, Riches, the left hand, and Ado-nai My Masters, associated with Malchut, Kingdom, Culmination Vessel, This World, the bottom Sefirah, the mouth and female organ ​ As opposed to night, לילה, Lailah, that can be novelized Li Lah - to me is her (your time to be a man and have relations with a woman). Its letters are also all used in the name Elok(h)im. ​ I recently came across a post on reddit/r/Judaism of a traditional Yemenite wedding ring that was on the right index finger that concurs with the logic of anatomy and electricity written about above.
