(We will return to you) ​ ​I decided that since Redemption is already upon us one should ideally invest in gold silver (bolted down fire proof safe) or commodities like real estate and slowly sell them off as they increase in price rather than strengthen the Kingdom of Evil since hopefully any day the gates of technology will be opened for everyone and almost all work will be unnecessary. ​​ --- ​ The stories in the Gemara of JC ​ Gittin 57a אוּנְקְלוֹס בַּר קְלוֹנִיקוּס בַּר אֲחָתֵיהּ דְּטִיטוּס הֲוָה. בָּעֵי לְאִיגַּיּוֹרֵי, אֲזַל אַסְּקֵיהּ לְטִיטוּס בִּנְגִידָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאן חֲשִׁיב בְּהָהוּא עָלְמָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: יִשְׂרָאֵל. מַהוּ לְאִידַּבּוֹקֵי בְּהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִילַּיְיהוּ נְפִישִׁין, וְלָא מָצֵית לְקַיּוֹמִינְהוּ. זִיל אִיגָּרִי בְּהוּ בְּהָהוּא עָלְמָא וְהָוֵית רֵישָׁא, דִּכְתִיב: ״הָיוּ צָרֶיהָ לְרֹאשׁ וְגוֹ׳״ – כׇּל הַמֵּיצַר לְיִשְׂרָאֵל נַעֲשָׂה רֹאשׁ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דִּינֵיהּ דְּהָהוּא גַּבְרָא בְּמַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: § The Gemara relates: Onkelos bar Kalonikos, the son of Titus’s sister, wanted to convert to Judaism. He went and raised Titus (*Titus destroyed the second Beit HaMikdash) from the grave through necromancy, and said to him: Who is most important in that world where you are now? Titus said to him: The Jewish people. Onkelos asked him: Should I then attach myself to them here in this world? Titus said to him: Their commandments are numerous, and you will not be able to fulfill them. It is best that you do as follows: Go out and battle against them in that world, and you will become the chief, as it is written: “Her adversaries [tzareha] have become the chief” (Lamentations 1:5), which means: Anyone who distresses [meitzer] Israel will become the chief. Onkelos said to him: What is the punishment of that man, a euphemism for Titus himself, in the next world? Titus said to him: 57a בְּמַאי דִּפְסַיק אַנַּפְשֵׁיהּ – כֹּל יוֹמָא מְכַנְּשִׁי לֵיהּ לְקִיטְמֵיהּ וְדָיְינִי לֵיהּ, וְקָלוּ לֵיהּ וּמְבַדְּרוּ [לֵיהּ] אַשַּׁב יַמֵּי. That which he decreed against himself, as he undergoes the following: Every day his ashes are gathered, and they judge him, and they burn him, and they scatter him over the seven seas. אֲזַל אַסְּקֵיהּ לְבִלְעָם בִּנְגִידָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאן חֲשִׁיב בְּהָהוּא עָלְמָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: יִשְׂרָאֵל. מַהוּ לְאִידַּבּוֹקֵי בְּהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״לֹא תִדְרוֹשׁ שְׁלוֹמָם וְטוֹבָתָם כׇּל הַיָּמִים״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דִּינֵיהּ דְּהָהוּא גַּבְרָא בְּמַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּשִׁכְבַת זֶרַע רוֹתַחַת. Onkelos then went and raised Balaam from the grave through necromancy. He said to him: Who is most important in that world where you are now? Balaam said to him: The Jewish people. Onkelos asked him: Should I then attach myself to them here in this world? Balaam said to him: You shall not seek their peace or their welfare all the days (see Deuteronomy 23:7). Onkelos said to him: What is the punishment of that man, a euphemism for Balaam himself, in the next world? Balaam said to him: He is cooked in boiling semen, as he caused Israel to engage in licentious behavior with the daughters of Moab. אֲזַל אַסְּקֵיהּ בִּנְגִידָא לְיֵשׁוּ הַנּוֹצְרִי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאן חֲשִׁיב בְּהָהוּא עָלְמָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: יִשְׂרָאֵל. מַהוּ לְאִדַּבּוֹקֵי בְּהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: טוֹבָתָם דְּרוֹשׁ, רָעָתָם לֹא תִּדְרוֹשׁ, כׇּל הַנּוֹגֵעַ בָּהֶן כְּאִילּוּ נוֹגֵעַ בְּבָבַת עֵינוֹ. Onkelos then went and raised J-sus the Nazarene from the grave through necromancy. Onkelos said to him: Who is most important in that world where you are now? J-sus said to him: The Jewish people. Onkelos asked him: Should I then attach myself to them in this world? J-sus said to him: Their welfare you shall seek, their misfortune you shall not seek, for anyone who touches them is regarded as if he were touching the apple of his eye (see Zechariah 2:12). אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דִּינֵיהּ דְּהָהוּא גַּבְרָא בְּמַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּצוֹאָה רוֹתַחַת. דְּאָמַר מָר: כׇּל הַמַּלְעִיג עַל דִּבְרֵי חֲכָמִים נִידּוֹן בְּצוֹאָה רוֹתַחַת. תָּא חֲזִי מָה בֵּין פּוֹשְׁעֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לִנְבִיאֵי אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם. Onkelos said to him: What is the punishment of that man, a euphemism for Jesus himself, in the next world? J-sus said to him: He is punished with boiling excrement. As the Master said: Anyone who mocks the words of the Sages will be sentenced to boiling excrement. And this was his sin, as he mocked the words of the Sages. The Gemara comments: Come and see the difference between the sinners of Israel and the prophets of the nations of the world. As Balaam, who was a prophet, wished Israel harm, whereas J-sus the Nazarene, who was a Jewish sinner, sought their well-being. ​​ ​ ​ Sotah 47a ​ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: לְעוֹלָם תְּהֵא שְׂמֹאל דּוֹחָה וְיָמִין מְקָרֶבֶת, לֹא כֶּאֱלִישָׁע שֶׁדְּחָפוֹ לְגֵחֲזִי בִּשְׁתֵּי יָדָיו, וְלֹא כִּיהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן פְּרַחְיָה שֶׁדְּחָפוֹ לְיֵשׁוּ הַנּוֹצְרִי מִתַּלְמִידָיו בִּשְׁתֵּי יָדָיו. The Sages taught: It should always be the left, weaker, hand that pushes another away and the right, stronger, hand that draws him near. In other words, even when a student is rebuffed, he should be given the opportunity to return. This is not like Elisha, who pushed Gehazi away with both hands, and not like Yehoshua ben Peraḥya, who pushed J-sus the Nazarene, one of his students, away with both hands. ​ ... ​ ​ יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן פְּרַחְיָה מַאי הִיא — כְּדַהֲוָה קָא קָטֵיל יַנַּאי מַלְכָּא לְרַבָּנַן, שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן שָׁטַח (אַטְמִינֵהוּ) [אַטְמַרְתֵּיהּ] אֲחָתֵיהּ, רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן פְּרַחְיָה אֲזַל עֲרַק לַאֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרִיָּא שֶׁל מִצְרַיִם. כִּי הֲוָה שְׁלָמָא, שְׁלַח לֵיהּ שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן שָׁטַח: מִנַּי יְרוּשָׁלַיִם עִיר הַקּוֹדֶשׁ לִךְ אֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרִיָּא שֶׁל מִצְרַיִם: אֲחוֹתִי! בַּעֲלִי שָׁרוּי בְּתוֹכֵךְ, וַאֲנִי יוֹשֶׁבֶת שׁוֹמֵמָה! אֲמַר: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ הֲוָה לֵיהּ שְׁלָמָא. The Gemara returns to the incident in which Yehoshua ben Peraḥya turned away J-sus the Nazarene: What is this incident? When King Yannai was killing the Sages, Shimon ben Shataḥ was hidden by his sister, Yannai’s wife, while Rabbi Yehoshua ben Peraḥya went and fled to Alexandria of Egypt. When peace was made between Yannai and the Sages, Shimon ben Shataḥ sent him the following letter: From myself, Jerusalem the holy city, to you, Alexandria of Egypt. My sister, my husband dwells within you, and I am sitting desolate. Rabbi Yehoshua ben Peraḥya said: I can learn from it that there is peace, and I can return. ​ כִּי אֲתָא, אִקְּלַע לְהָהוּא אוּשְׁפִּיזָא, קָם קַמַּיְיהוּ בִּיקָרָא שַׁפִּיר, עָבְדִי לֵיהּ יְקָרָא טוּבָא, יָתֵיב וְקָא מִשְׁתַּבַּח: כַּמָּה נָאָה אַכְסַנְיָא זוֹ! אֲמַר לֵיהּ יֵשׁוּ הַנּוֹצְרִי: רַבִּי, עֵינֶיהָ טְרוּטוֹת. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: רָשָׁע, בְּכָךְ אַתָּה עוֹסֵק? אַפֵּיק אַרְבַּע מְאָה שִׁפּוּרֵי וְשַׁמְּתֵיהּ. כׇּל יוֹמָא אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ וְלָא קַבְּלֵיהּ. When he came back to Eretz Yisrael, Rabbi Yehoshua arrived at a certain inn. The innkeeper stood before him, honoring him considerably, and overall they accorded him great honor. Rabbi Yehoshua ben Peraḥya then sat and was praising them by saying: How beautiful is this inn. J-sus the Nazarene, one of his students, said to him: My teacher, but the eyes of the innkeeper’s wife are narrow [terutot]. Rabbi Yehoshua ben Peraḥya said to him: Wicked one, is this what you are engaged in, gazing at women? He brought out four hundred shofarot and excommunicated him. Every day J-sus would come before him, but he would not accept his wish to return. ​ יוֹמָא חַד הֲוָה קָרֵי קְרִיַּת שְׁמַע, אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ. הֲוָה בְּדַעְתֵּיהּ לְקַבּוֹלֵיהּ, אַחְוִי לֵיהּ בִּידֵיהּ, סְבַר מִדְחָא דָּחֵי לֵיהּ, אֲזַל זְקַף לְבֵינְתָּא פַּלְחַאּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲזוֹר בָּךְ! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כָּךְ מְקוּבְּלַנִי מִמְּךָ, כׇּל הַחוֹטֵא וּמַחְטִיא אֶת הָרַבִּים — אֵין מַסְפִּיקִין בְּיָדוֹ לַעֲשׂוֹת תְּשׁוּבָה. דְּאָמַר מָר: יֵשׁוּ הַנּוֹצְרִי כִּישֵּׁף וְהִסִּית וְהִדִּיחַ וְהֶחְטִיא אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל. One day, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Peraḥya was reciting Shema when J-sus came before him. He intended to accept him on this occasion, so he signaled to him with his hand to wait. J-sus thought he was rejecting him entirely. He therefore went and stood up a brick (object of idolatry) and worshipped it as an idol. Rabbi Yehoshua ben Peraḥya said to him: Return from your sins. J-sus said to him: This is the tradition that I received from you: Anyone who sins and causes the masses to sin is not given the opportunity to repent. The Gemara explains how he caused the masses to sin: For the Master said: J-sus the Nazarene performed sorcery, and he incited the masses, and subverted the masses, and caused the Jewish people to sin. ​ תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: יֵצֶר, תִּינוֹק, וְאִשָּׁה — תְּהֵא שְׂמֹאל דּוֹחָה וְיָמִין מְקָרֶבֶת. It is taught in a baraita that Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: With regard to the evil inclination, to a child, and to a woman, the left hand should reject and the right hand should welcome. If one pushes too forcefully, the damage might be irreversible. ​​ ​ ​ - ​ “With what does one delight in the day of Shabbat?” the Talmud asks, recording an answer provided by Rav Yehuda, son of Rav Shmuel bar Sheilat, who recalled the words of his teacher Rav: “With a dish of beetroot, and a large fish, and heads of garlic” ( Talmud Shabbat 11b ). ​​ -- ​ Adar 14 Purim Somayach ​ If you have an extra $70 bucks or so you can go to a plumbing store and get a copper pipe a little taller than you and stuff it full of rocks gems and rubber bands and you can use it as the best body pillow ever ​​ Also I cant remember if I ever said this but the wrist is a vital point so wearing some rubber bands on them is inexpensive and who knows how great the benefit is. So too why not a few on the ankles? ​​ --- ​ Since planting season is here for many people it is important to know the basic laws of Kilayim, mixed planting, especially grapes: https://aish.com/planting-different-species-together-kilayim/ ​ ​***I have been trying to make everywhere "Tzion" as in the land of Israel as its written in Tehillim "Indeed from Tzion comes forth the Torah and the word of HaShem from YiruShalayim." Honestly I'm not sure about contested lands but I put a row of bricks (need a fence of at least of Tefach, 4 fingers) between my sown vegetables ​​​ The Aish Rabbi quotes Rambam Hilchot Kilayim 1 and 7 and you can click it for more in depth learning. ​ הַתַּפּוּחַ וְהַחַזְרָד HaTapuach and HaChazrad The apple and the crabapple (it is forbidden to graft these as according to Rambam they are separate species). I had a good laugh at the word Chazrad, very similar to Chazir, pig, the main animal representing Esav, the West, Rome. It is a good commentary on them as it looks like a polished sweet apple on the outside but then you realize it tastes like vinegar. ​ In a more positive face, there are many varieties of crabapples, some very sweet. The Wickson crabapple might even be the sweetest overall apple (I've never tasted it but it has the highest sugar content). Therefore it fits that tradition says the pig, Chazir will chew its cud in the End of Days and be Kosher/Pure, as Chazir can also mean return (repent). ​ Also crab apples are great universal apple pollinators (regular apple trees usually need specific other kinds to pollinate, and you can't even use the same variety [e.g. growing an orchard of all honeycrisps with no other apple varieties within ~a half mile will leave a fruitless orchard]). The reasons are because they are very genetically variant as "wild" trees, have a long blooming period and a lot of sweet pollen. So too the West knows a lot of Biblical stories from their years in catholic schools and Torah from cricketing me for the past 8 years that they can "pollinate" other fruit trees and vegetables (children of Torah) with. ​​ ​ Mishnah Yadayim 1 הַמַּיִם שֶׁנִּפְסְלוּ מִשְּׁתִיַּת הַבְּהֵמָה, בְּכֵלִים, פְּסוּלִים. וּבְקַרְקָעוֹת, כְּשֵׁרִים Water that animal spit fell into, vessels, impure, ground waters, Kosher/pure. If a random voice coming from your property, your vessels, instructs you just ignore it. But if it able to "break through the gates of your house" and speak from within you, you should probably listen to it. ​​ End of Bereisheit: יְהִי־דָן֙ נָחָ֣שׁ עֲלֵי־דֶ֔רֶךְ שְׁפִיפֹ֖ן עֲלֵי־אֹ֑רַח הַנֹּשֵׁךְ֙ עִקְּבֵי־ס֔וּס וַיִּפֹּ֥ל רֹכְב֖וֹ אָחֽוֹר׃ Dan shall be a serpent by the road, A viper by the path, That bites the horse’s heels So that his rider is thrown backward. ​ "A viper by the path" - like known from Mishnah Shabbat 1:1 about the house owner reaching his hand outside his house to the poor person and dropping it into his hand while the poor person is on public property to avoid breaking the Melacha (forbidden labor) of carrying/transporting, there are other ways to circumvent Melachot like if you run out of pre ripped toilet paper you can rip more in an abnormal way (with your knees and wrists and between the pre ripped lines for example). ​ It is known that (originally before electric dust drones etc) sorcery would only have an effect on a person if that person also believed in sorcery. Therefore if you want to get a good core workout in your yard or a park with a metal or wooden bat and get some swings in, the heathen whose teeth are all constantly chomping will think you're cursing them and therefore curse themselves. Maybe you want to face different directions after a little to see more nature scenery while you're outside for awhile. ​ This is like reaching a cup of poison from your property into the public domain for your enemies and having them take it themselves and drink on Shabbat. Do not pretend to do sorcery but like I said do productive things for yourself. ​ Soon after I got my driver's license at 16 my good high school friend Nick Miller drove with me with his shotgun deep into the forest and we shot it in random directions. I see now he was teaching me a good milling method (practicing some long range shots ideally towards a patch of rocks or something lifeless since its prohibited to hurt plants without need or be destructive unnecessarily at all, and make sure the gun works consistently without unnecessary excess) ​ Also this gives new light to enjoying gum ​ --- ​ Maybe 5 hours ago one of the salty crickets creeping on me didn't approve of one of my actions and banged on my house and tried to yell something at me but "Memulach!" got transposed over it and I may have laughed harder than I ever have in my life (probably the celery salt - its been doing that). ​ Memulach, like "From salt", Mimelach, as a commentary on what the West is called in Yeshayahu 18, "Am Memushach Umorat" - A people stretched out/trail seed and polished/smooth. ​ Also the Tehillim "He goes along weeping carrying Meshech the seed. He will surely return in song, a bearer of his sheaves." ​ And YechezkEl 38 about this war "Gog king of Meshech" ​ Fitting with the commentary with bitter crab apples and everyone I can find worshipping rocks. ​​ ​ --- ​ Adar 16 ​ Bereisheit 40:9-13 וַיְסַפֵּ֧ר שַֽׂר־הַמַּשְׁקִ֛ים אֶת־חֲלֹמ֖וֹ לְיוֹסֵ֑ף וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֔וֹ בַּחֲלוֹמִ֕י וְהִנֵּה־גֶ֖פֶן לְפָנָֽי׃ Then the chief cupbearer told his dream to Joseph. He said to him, “In my dream, there was a vine in front of me. וּבַגֶּ֖פֶן שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה שָׂרִיגִ֑ם וְהִ֤וא כְפֹרַ֙חַת֙ עָלְתָ֣ה נִצָּ֔הּ הִבְשִׁ֥ילוּ אַשְׁכְּלֹתֶ֖יהָ עֲנָבִֽים׃ On the vine were three branches. It had barely budded, when out came its blossoms and its clusters ripened into grapes. וְכ֥וֹס פַּרְעֹ֖ה בְּיָדִ֑י וָאֶקַּ֣ח אֶת־הָֽעֲנָבִ֗ים וָֽאֶשְׂחַ֤ט אֹתָם֙ אֶל־כּ֣וֹס פַּרְעֹ֔ה וָאֶתֵּ֥ן אֶת־הַכּ֖וֹס עַל־כַּ֥ף פַּרְעֹֽה׃ Pharaoh’s cup was in my hand, and I took the grapes, pressed them into Pharaoh’s cup, and placed the cup in Pharaoh’s hand.” וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לוֹ֙ יוֹסֵ֔ף זֶ֖ה פִּתְרֹנ֑וֹ שְׁלֹ֙שֶׁת֙ הַשָּׂ֣רִגִ֔ים שְׁלֹ֥שֶׁת יָמִ֖ים הֵֽם׃ Joseph said to him, “This is its interpretation: The three branches are three days. בְּע֣וֹד ׀ שְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת יָמִ֗ים יִשָּׂ֤א פַרְעֹה֙ אֶת־רֹאשֶׁ֔ךָ וַהֲשִֽׁיבְךָ֖ עַל־כַּנֶּ֑ךָ וְנָתַתָּ֤ כוֹס־פַּרְעֹה֙ בְּיָד֔וֹ כַּמִּשְׁפָּט֙ הָֽרִאשׁ֔וֹן אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָיִ֖יתָ מַשְׁקֵֽהוּ׃ In three days Pharaoh will pardon you and restore you to your post; you will place Pharaoh’s cup in his hand, as was your custom formerly when you were his cupbearer. ​ 16-19 וַיַּ֥רְא שַׂר־הָאֹפִ֖ים כִּ֣י ט֣וֹב פָּתָ֑ר וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־יוֹסֵ֔ף אַף־אֲנִי֙ בַּחֲלוֹמִ֔י וְהִנֵּ֗ה שְׁלֹשָׁ֛ה סַלֵּ֥י חֹרִ֖י עַל־רֹאשִֽׁי׃ When the chief baker saw how favorably he had interpreted, he said to Joseph, “In my dream, similarly, there were three openwork baskets on my head. וּבַסַּ֣ל הָֽעֶלְי֗וֹן מִכֹּ֛ל מַאֲכַ֥ל פַּרְעֹ֖ה מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה אֹפֶ֑ה וְהָע֗וֹף אֹכֵ֥ל אֹתָ֛ם מִן־הַסַּ֖ל מֵעַ֥ל רֹאשִֽׁי׃ In the uppermost basket were all kinds of food for Pharaoh that a baker prepares; and the birds were eating it out of the basket above my head.” וַיַּ֤עַן יוֹסֵף֙ וַיֹּ֔אמֶר זֶ֖ה פִּתְרֹנ֑וֹ שְׁלֹ֙שֶׁת֙ הַסַּלִּ֔ים שְׁלֹ֥שֶׁת יָמִ֖ים הֵֽם׃ Joseph answered, “This is its interpretation: The three baskets are three days. בְּע֣וֹד ׀ שְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת יָמִ֗ים יִשָּׂ֨א פַרְעֹ֤ה אֶת־רֹֽאשְׁךָ֙ מֵֽעָלֶ֔יךָ וְתָלָ֥ה אוֹתְךָ֖ עַל־עֵ֑ץ וְאָכַ֥ל הָע֛וֹף אֶת־בְּשָׂרְךָ֖ מֵעָלֶֽיךָ׃ In three days Pharaoh will lift off your head and impale you upon a pole; and the birds will pick off your flesh.” ​ With our knowledge on The Parable we can clearly see the Face of Mussar here. If one has "the vine", a fruitful Torah scholar, "The judge in your day", Lefanai, in front of his/her face, HaShem will deal kindly with you (It is known that HaShem inspires the kings of the nations). ​ On the contrary if your will (the top of your head) is to share loaves of cakes (bubbled over [the leavening] licentious people) with the king and the birds, the sat-ns, angels, Elokim Acheirim, other gods, or birds of prey, the wicked ruling class, like how all the idolators have grass like orgies and take turns on each other, then HaShem will lift your head from upon you, impale you on a pole, and the angels will eat you, torture you in the afterlife. ​​ Verse 13 וְנָתַתָּ֤ כוֹס־פַּרְעֹה֙ בְּיָד֔וֹ כַּמִּשְׁפָּט֙ הָֽרִאשׁ֔וֹן אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָיִ֖יתָ מַשְׁקֵֽהוּ And you will give the up of Pharoah in his hand (or with His Hand) like the Judgement of the Rishon (same word used in Mishnah Yadayim for how to purify people who aren't very dangerous, see above closer to the top or type CTRL+F or use the find feature on your phone's browser and type "Yadayim" if you didn't read that) - the First (people who only need one rinsing and they repent). That, you shall drink (remember when we find pricks of sorcery on our fingers we don't drink it, intend for it to have a spiritual effect). ​ --- **Pesach is approaching and its important to learn the necessary Biblically commanded laws at least Mishnah Pesachim 3:1 אֵלּוּ עוֹבְרִין בְּפֶסַח, כֻּתָּח הַבַּבְלִי, וְשֵׁכָר הַמָּדִי, וְחֹמֶץ הָאֲדוֹמִי, וְזֵתוֹם הַמִּצְרִי, וְזוֹמָן שֶׁל צַבָּעִים, וַעֲמִילָן שֶׁל טַבָּחִים, וְקוֹלָן שֶׁל סוֹפְרִים. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר, אַף תַּכְשִׁיטֵי נָשִׁים. זֶה הַכְּלָל, כָּל שֶׁהוּא מִמִּין דָּגָן, הֲרֵי זֶה עוֹבֵר בְּפֶסַח. הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ בְאַזְהָרָה, וְאֵין בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם כָּרֵת: And for possessing these one transgresses [overin] the prohibitions of: It shall not be seen, and: It shall not be found, on Passover, although not all of them are considered food: Babylonian kutaḥ, a dip with a sharp flavor that contains flour; Median beer; Edomite vinegar; Egyptian zitom, a type of beer; dyers’ broth [zoman]; bakers’ well-worked dough; and kolan of soferim. Rabbi Eliezer says: The same prohibition also applies to women’s adornments, i.e., cosmetics, that contain leaven. This is the principle: If one possesses any substance that is derived from a type of grain that became leavened, although it is not actually bread, one transgresses the prohibitions of: It shall not be seen, and: It shall not be found, on Passover. These substances are included in the warning, i.e., the biblical prohibition of possessing leaven, but there is no element of karet if one eats them. ​​ I like how וְחֹמֶץ הָאֲדוֹמִי "And Edomite vinegar" can be novelized on its own as "And vinegar, [that is] the Edomite." ​​ Basic laws of the Seder https://outorah.org/p/149094/ ​ Remember that for the Rabbinic Mitzvot in times of distress like now if it is difficult one can drop them. Also according to the last chapter of Mishlei/Proverbs that was actually a Prophecy righteous people with portions of The World to Come should not drink alcohol, but those who are spiritually desolate to use up all of their good merit in joy before ceasing to be. Does the Rabbinic Mitzvah to drink 4 cups of wine in one night not seem treacherous? Is it not written YeshaYaHu/Isaiah 5:11 ה֛וֹי מַשְׁכִּימֵ֥י בַבֹּ֖קֶר שֵׁכָ֣ר יִרְדֹּ֑פוּ מְאַחֲרֵ֣י בַנֶּ֔שֶׁף יַ֖יִן יַדְלִיקֵֽם׃ Ah, Those who chase liquor From early in the morning, And till late in the evening Are inflamed by wine! ​ It can be interpreted not as from early in morning until late in evening, but each on its own, Woe to those who drink in the morning strong drink. They pursue from after twilight wine and get inflamed. ​ Therefore I also saw on Ohr Somayach's page here (click) that if one has difficulty with wine he can use grape juice and since its Rabbinic I think its preferable to use grape juice or at least mixed half/half. Can anyone not accustomed to alcohol drink 4 cups of wine in one night without trouble? Does wine not taste like death and grape juice like life? ​ ​It would also be a great idea to see Ohr's Pesach page by clicking the underlined words to see how to properly get all the leavening out of your house on Erev Pesach on Nissan 14 (April 12) especially since that day is Shabbat. Don't worry about Kitniyot (bean products, corn, rice, mustard, peas, and other grains), Sephardim have the most pure Masorah (Tradition). ​ ​Why? Consider this parable: There was a pious Jewish family with a few brothers. Some of them got kidnapped and imprisoned (to other nations) while one remained at home (in the land of Israel). The exiled brothers were eventually released, but when they came back they had variations in some of their Hebrew letters and Halachot. A Ger (convert/traveller) finds them and asks them to convert him, but there are a few very variant traditions. If you are the Ger, are you choosing the brother's tradition who stayed at home all those years or those with Goyim (nations) influences? ​ Nevertheless Sephardim accepted the Shulchan Aruch despite what seems like Yosef Caro having his cup out for animal spit (his Maggid, familiar spirit) to compose it therefore Yemenite Jews have the best Halacha since they completely accepted Rambam who is clearly an apple tree. For example, the maggid promised Yosef Caro a martyr's death that never happened. HaShem's words are always fulfilled. Also the Maggid spoke by moving Yosef's mouth. Was this a Holy Spirit of HaShem or a Dybbuk test trap? Since we remove ourselves from doubt Rambam seems like the obvious choice. HaShem says in YeshaYaHu "Upon my children will you ask me?"(?) that one can only ask HaShem about the signs of the times, not about His Children since it should be obvious He inspired their righteousness, yet it is not obvious to me when someone provides food from a Maggid and not through his own strenuous labor, as in the song of the Donkey ​ בְּהֵמָה גַּסָּה טְמֵאָה אוֹמֶרֶת. יְגִיעַ כַּפֶּיךָ כִּי תֹאכֵל אַשְׁרֶיךָ וְטוֹב לָךְ: (תהילים קכח ב) The Working Animal is saying: “When you eat the fruit of your strenuous labors, happy are you and good is your lot.” ​ Again its Anochi, Ana Nafshi Cetavit Yehavit - Oh! I pray, My Soul (Blood) in Writing is given. Implying HaShem doesn't just send spirits to pour our water for us through our mouths like a necromancer. (again unless you were working on your own and HaShem sent a Sat-n in your way to talk through your mouth or nose, your ground waters, not your property, your vessels) ​ Kitzur SA 151:4 בִּסְעוּדַת הַלַּיְלָה, לֹא יַרְבֶּה בַאֲכִילָה וּבִשְׁתִיָה, וְלֹא יֹאכַל דְּבָרִים הַמְחַמְּמִים אֶת הַגוּף, כְּגוֹן בָּשָׂר שָׁמֵן וְכָל מַאַכְלֵי חָלָב וּגְבִינָה וּבֵיצִים וָשׁוּם. גַּם לֹא יִשְׁתֶּה מַשְׁקֶה הַמְחַמֵם, כִּי דְבָרִים אֵלּוּ גּוֹרְמִים לְחֵטְא זֶה. At supper you should not eat or drink excessively nor eat any foods that tend to heat the body, such as fat meats, all milk products, cheese, eggs, and garlic. Neither should you drink a beverage that tends to heat the body, for these things cause the committing of this sin. ​ He's essentially saying to have a Parve (no meat or milk) dinner every night while HaShem "sells" the Land of Israel to us in the Torah as a "land of milk and honey". Bread and butter or cheese is a staple for many poor people ​​ Pleasures are referred to as "His Staff" in the Tehillim that the fallen world desperately needs to stand (Like my Rosh Yeshivah in Dvar Yirushalayim Baruch Horowitz was telling me) ​ Nevertheless a man having seminal omissions should take note and cut back on aphrodisiac foods during dinner to save the souls of his children incarnated in his sperm cells. ​ ---- ​ Something important to know Malachai 2:3 הִנְנִ֨י גֹעֵ֤ר לָכֶם֙ אֶת־הַזֶּ֔רַע וְזֵרִ֤יתִי פֶ֙רֶשׁ֙ עַל־פְּנֵיכֶ֔ם פֶּ֖רֶשׁ חַגֵּיכֶ֑ם וְנָשָׂ֥א אֶתְכֶ֖ם אֵלָֽיו׃ I will put your seed under a ban, and I will strew dung upon your faces, the dung of your festal sacrifices, and you shall be carried out to its [heap]. ​ Rambam says this verse, specifically "I will strew dung upon your faces" apply to people who eat until the belly swells after already being satisfied. At this point you are no longer uplifting the souls within the food since they are not beneficial for your body, and "making dung" out of them. HaShem deals with us measure for measure. ​ --- ​ Although the spiritual Shabbat is here, the consensus I hear is that since we still have to pay taxes and avoid being arrested by the evil regimes, we still need to do 2 days of Yom Tovim outside of Israel. This may even always continue to be the case, as there are opinions that this was instituted by the Neviim (Prophets) or by Yehoshua Bin Nun because according to the Arizal one can only absorb all of the holiness of the Holy Day in one day in the land of Israel, whereas outside The Land it requires two days (like a simile of how a torch provides the most light to those right next to it). ​​ ​​ If you have a job at least in the US they are obligated to religiously accomodate you and you are obligated to have no fear of a person whose blood has been poured out or who has no free choice, HaShem, Elokim Tzevaot, (The Hosts of Gods, the Name associated with the Sefirah of Hod, Splendor, Concealment, the left leg) will surely bless you for working for Him. The worst that can happen is that you enjoy a year of unemployment check funded retirement. ​​ After reconsidering that nowadays the multitudes of grass people are much more powerful and load up torture dust drones on our bodies G-d save us, I would say it is a medical necessity to wash the entire body at least once every two days if not more considering the build up of heathen torture toys on the body so I would say everyone can take hot showers as necessary for themselves (like after being in public for awhile). Too often is also not good because it dries the body out ​​ Like the sages say, better to extinguish a flame on Shabbat than a person's soul G-d forbid and it only takes one unchecked hand or foot "curse" (more like a video game controller attack button) to ruin one's day with electricity, may Heaven please swiftly uproot such people forever. ​​ My father (again even wicked parents are called Mimenu, From Us as opposed to from her, Mimenah) used to implore me to take showers after times when being in public for awhile.​ ​ We are actually obligated to break Shabbat and Yom Tov Melachot (forbidden labors) if there is any question about saving a life or only a chance that a life will be saved/lengthened and I believe hot showers can definitely save lives (from a spiritual blasphemic eternal death H'F', infinitely worse than a physical death) in these dusty times. ​​ Some context for a Gezeirah Shavah (like-decree) comparison from Steinsaltz' Mishnah Shabbat 2:5: ​ הַמְכַבֶּה אֶת הַנֵּר מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא מִתְיָרֵא מִפְּנֵי גוֹיִם, מִפְּנֵי לִסְטִים, מִפְּנֵי רוּחַ רָעָה, וְאִם בִּשְׁבִיל הַחוֹלֶה שֶׁיִּישַׁן, פָּטוּר. כְּחָס עַל הַנֵּר, כְּחָס עַל הַשֶּׁמֶן, כְּחָס עַל הַפְּתִילָה, חַיָּב. וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי פּוֹטֵר בְּכֻלָּן חוּץ מִן הַפְּתִילָה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא עוֹשָׂהּ פֶּחָם: One who extinguishes the lamp on Shabbat because he is afraid due to gentiles, from whom he is hiding in his home, and due to thieves, or if one is afraid due to an evil spirit, i.e., he is depressed and prefers sitting in the dark, or if he extinguished the flame due to the sick person so that he will sleep, he is exempt. However, in a case where he extinguishes the flame in order to spare the lamp, spare the oil, or spare the wick, he is liable. Rabbi Yosei exempts him in all of those cases, as in his opinion no labor prohibited by Torah law is being performed by extinguishing the flame, except for the case where he seeks to spare the wick. Only in that case is extinguishing a creative action because he makes the wick into charcoal by extinguishing the flame. ​​ ​**Not saying one should rely on their own opinion in doubt but sometimes you have to until you can ask someone who has studied the topic ​ --- ​ ​ Since I made light of Edomites with the novelty on the Mishnah calling them vinegar, its Yehudah's turn ​ Mishnah Demai 1:1 וּבִיהוּדָה, הָאוֹג, וְהַחֹמֶץ שֶׁבִּיהוּדָה And in Yehudah, [specifically] the Og (like Gog, those who have assimilated to the Goyim and are like a body now instead of a head. Og is a red sumac berry), and the vinegar that is in Yehudah (from mixing with the nations)  -  [are all dealt with leniently with the Demai tithe] ​ Maasrot 1:2 הָאוֹג וְהַתּוּתִים, מִשֶּׁיַּאְדִּימוּ. וְכָל הָאֲדֻמִּים, מִשֶּׁיַּאְדִּימוּ The Sumac and the Mulberries/Strawberries, when they become red (root ADM, like Edom), and so too all red (ADM) fruits, when they redden (they become liable to tithing). ​ Therefore see that Og, Sumac, is associated with Edom. There are Sumac and Mulberry trees everywhere in PinaShalomYah (PA) (at least, but the ecosystem is similar along the whole NE US, the original main part of it) as opposed to mostly Olives Figs and Date Palms in Yisrael ​ Chabad's definition of Demai Demai is produce which is forbidden by rabbinic law due to the uncertainty of whether the necessary tithes were separated. ​ It is the produce given from what the Mishnah calls "Am HaAretz" - People of the Land (simple people, like modern day Reform/Conservative Jews). ​ Therefore it is more of a positive face as its saying although Yehudah has become vinegar like from eating Gogot (heathens), it isn't necessary to tithe it again. This is either because he is still trusted or in the face of Steinsaltz Berachot Bavli 40B, because they are of inferior quality. ​ Maybe interpret the Og in Yehudah as those still trustworthy as a living tree fruit (or since no one really eats Sumac its also inferior) and the vinegar as not liable because it's less in quality, the grapes that got pressed and left to age and get aerated (air-o-gant) and became vile. ​​ Back to Am HaAretz Bereisheit 34:1 וַתֵּצֵ֤א דִינָה֙ בַּת־לֵאָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָלְדָ֖ה לְיַעֲקֹ֑ב לִרְא֖וֹת בִּבְנ֥וֹת הָאָֽרֶץ׃ Now Dinah, the daughter whom Leah had borne to Jacob, went out to visit the daughters of the land. ​​ It was for this reason that Shechem ended up raping Dinah and the episode with Shimon and Levi happened where they desecrated the whole city as the next verse says: ​ וַיַּ֨רְא אֹתָ֜הּ שְׁכֶ֧ם בֶּן־חֲמ֛וֹר הַֽחִוִּ֖י נְשִׂ֣יא הָאָ֑רֶץ וַיִּקַּ֥ח אֹתָ֛הּ וַיִּשְׁכַּ֥ב אֹתָ֖הּ וַיְעַנֶּֽהָ׃ Shechem son of Hamor the Hivite, chief of the country, saw her, and took her and lay with her and disgraced her. ​ It is extremely important not to go out to visit the "daughters of the land" Ohr HaChaim says based on the extra words "In the land of Canaan" in Bereisheit, that another name for this world is the Sat-n. Therefore see that the verse is saying Dinah went to "hang out" or "chill" with idolatrous women. Remember that the Gra says one loses his or her spiritual level on account of going out among the people. ​ Mishlei Eishet Chayil, the Prophecy chapter from Baat Sheva, in one face is about Sarah, who was greater in prophecy than Avraham. ​ Bereisheit 18:9 וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֵׄלָ֔יׄוׄ אַיֵּ֖ה שָׂרָ֣ה אִשְׁתֶּ֑ךָ וַיֹּ֖אמֶר הִנֵּ֥ה בָאֹֽהֶל׃ They said to him, “Where is your wife Sarah?” And he replied, “There, in the tent.” ​ Rashi comments that she was a modest women. ​ Tehillim/Psalms 45:13 כׇּל־כְּבוּדָּ֣ה בַת־מֶ֣לֶךְ פְּנִ֑ימָה מִֽמִּשְׁבְּצ֖וֹת זָהָ֣ב לְבוּשָֽׁהּ All of her glory, the daughter of The King, is within. Her clothes are chequered with gold. ​​ Would anyone wear gold chequered clothing in public replete with vicious animals? ​ If "The beauty/truth/balance of a man is to dwell in his house" (Isaiah) and the Gra says to pay a messenger 2-3x the price for one's needs and begs Heaven that a man should not leave his home, how much more so a woman? ​​ -- ​ A good question for those with "large families" - are you a star wars clone drone or a cutting from a fig tree? ​ -- ​ Tehillim 94:3 עַד־מָתַ֖י רְשָׁעִ֥ים ׀ יְהֹוָ֑ה עַד־מָ֝תַ֗י רְשָׁעִ֥ים יַעֲלֹֽזוּ׃ How long shall the wicked, O LORD, how long shall the wicked exult, ​ Another novelty: Until when will the wicked be HaShem (will HaShem be the wicked) and He exalt Himself through the wicked? (by enacting retribution through them for the sins of those He plans to keep) ​ Verse 12 אַשְׁרֵ֤י ׀ הַגֶּ֣בֶר אֲשֶׁר־תְּיַסְּרֶ֣נּוּ יָּ֑הּ וּֽמִתּוֹרָתְךָ֥ תְלַמְּדֶֽנּוּ׃ Happy is the man whom You discipline, O LORD, the man You instruct in Your teaching, ​ Rashi: אשרי הגבר. אשריהם הצדיקי' המעוני' תחת ידיכם ובלבד שיהו עוסקין בתורה ובמצות: Fortunate is the man: Fortunate are the righteous who are afflicted under Your hands, provided that they engage in Torah and Mitzvoth. ​​ 13 לְהַשְׁקִ֣יט ל֭וֹ מִ֣ימֵי רָ֑ע עַ֤ד יִכָּרֶ֖ה לָרָשָׁ֣ע שָֽׁחַת׃ to give him tranquillity in times of misfortune, until a pit be dug for the wicked. ​ Rashi: להשקיט לו מימי רע. כי היסורין גורמין לו להשקיט להם מימי דין גיהנם עד שיראה שיכרה לרשע שחת: To grant him peace from days of evil: For the chastisements cause him to have peace from the days of the judgment of Gehinnom. while he sees that a pit is dug for the wicked man. ​ Its really an amazing Tehillim/Psalm from Moshe if you want to read the rest here is quick access (click) ​ --- ​ Another layer to add to the severity of the Brit BeSefat (Covenant with the lips) Bereisheit 34:2-3 וַתִּקַּ֨ח צִפֹּרָ֜ה צֹ֗ר וַתִּכְרֹת֙ אֶת־עׇרְלַ֣ת בְּנָ֔הּ וַתַּגַּ֖ע לְרַגְלָ֑יו וַתֹּ֕אמֶר כִּ֧י חֲתַן־דָּמִ֛ים אַתָּ֖ה לִֽי׃ So Zipporah took a flint and cut off her son’s foreskin, and touched his legs with it, saying, “You are truly a bridegroom of blood to me!” וַיִּ֖רֶף מִמֶּ֑נּוּ אָ֚ז אָֽמְרָ֔ה חֲתַ֥ן דָּמִ֖ים לַמּוּלֹֽת׃ {פ} And when [God] let him alone, she added, “A bridegroom of blood because of the circumcisions.” ​ Verse 3 says as "And she sank down From Us at that time. She said a bridegroom of blood because of the circumcisions. ​ At first if one heard her say only verse 2, one would wonder whether she was planning on "eating" Moshe's child as heathens do (convert him to star worship and have incest or actually eat, as in "the bloods of my husband to me [to consume, or for an idol offering]" H'F'). Especially considering her name is Tziporah, female bird, similar to Balak ben Tzipor, King of the Moabites who hired Balaam's counsel against Israel and caused the giant public orgy. His name translates to "Devastator, son of Bird" ​ Therefore all of the underworld spectators that HaShem inspires judged her and "brought her low" and she realized the mistake in her speech (as is easy to do) and the seed it was sowing and corrected herself, she "brought herself low" From Us, and "pursued" (Yirdof, a novelty on Yiref) Us by "fixing" the covenant she made in her speech by adding "The Covenants (of Torah)" to it. ​​ Sefer HaYashar by Rebbeinu Tam compares Tzipporah's righteousness to the Matriarchs. ​ I should note that when I was in Yeshivat Hadar HaTorah in Crown Heights, one of the teachers told me a story that Rashi (Rebbeinu Tam's grandfather) said to Rebbeinu Tam after Rebbeinu Tam formed his alternative opinion on the order of the parchments of Tefillin: "Ever since you were little I knew you would come to argue with my opinions." Therefore if I understand what Rashi was saying correctly, I personally only wear Rashi's Tefillin (remember ideally Sefardi/Yemenite [if you can find] script - I've never even found a Yemenite Jew and the only synagogue I can find online didn't answer my message) as opposed to some's custom to also put on Rebbeinu Tam Tefillin, as its written "Dominate the world and rule over it with the fish of the sea" Singular fish (Rabbi), Dag haYam, not plural, Dagim (ideally). As much as I love the Arizal I don't like the idea of Chassidic scripts since they aren't attached to any Mesorah/Tradition, rather intentionally made, and HaShem is called in Isaiah 45:11 כֹּֽה־אָמַ֧ר יְהֹוָ֛ה קְד֥וֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וְיֹצְר֑וֹ הָאֹתִיּ֣וֹת the "HaShem - The Holy One of Israel and Former of the Letters" ​ Does it not seem like a not good idea to intentionally alter letters when its written Dvarim/Deut 13:1 אֵ֣ת כׇּל־הַדָּבָ֗ר אֲשֶׁ֤ר אָנֹכִי֙ מְצַוֶּ֣ה אֶתְכֶ֔ם אֹת֥וֹ תִשְׁמְר֖וּ לַעֲשׂ֑וֹת לֹא־תֹסֵ֣ף עָלָ֔יו וְלֹ֥א תִגְרַ֖ע מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃ {פ} Be careful to observe only every word I enjoin upon you: neither add upon It nor take away from Us. ? ​​ As implied by Adam keeping the name Adam after unintentionally sinning, even the greatest men among us can still have unintentional errors, potentially deadly. ​​ When looking up Davar (word/speech) I saw the Gra proven when he said the mouth is the Kadosh Kadashim - Holy of Holies when I saw the innermost sanctuary is called Devir. Also plague is Dever as the Sages teach "All of man's toil is for his mouth" (from speaking negative things on himself and others H'F'). Dever is also pasture since your mouth is like a field that you can plant anything. By the way the best way to trap people so no one accuses you of a form of witchcraft. Mishnah Sanhedrin 10:1 says one who whispers over a wound the verse "I am The Lord your Physician" has no place in The World to Come (since he/she shows contempt for HaShem's name). I figured this was different since in that case one should be glad like mentioned in Tehillim 94 a few paragraphs above that they were afflicted and their pain is paying off their spiritual debts, or that like the Prophecy "We considered him hated but it was our sins he was bearing to make us whole"(?) that they are helping out the whole world (Tikkun Olam) in an epic act of Tzedakkah (Charity). Whereas when one intentionally "programs" themselves with their speech, it is because everyone's right to exist hangs in the balance as the Adams of the field are being sieged against by The Master of War every day and in this case we are ensuring the survival of our souls. ​ Anyway like the Shabbat 1:1 novelty the best way to avoid the argument is to read the last verse of the 3rd paragraph of the Shema after saying the actual verse every morning and every night as the Mitzvah of remembering the Exodus from Egypt - it is like HaShem already has his hand outside The House into the public domain, begging us to take Eternal Infinite bliss this way. ​ BaMidbar Numbers 15:41 אֲנִ֞י יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֗ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר הוֹצֵ֤אתִי אֶתְכֶם֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם לִהְי֥וֹת לָכֶ֖ם לֵאלֹהִ֑ים אֲנִ֖י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃ {פ} I Am The Lord you God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt to be your God: I Am The Lord your God. ​ The Torah is filled with the words "I Am The Lord your God" (Vayikra 19:2-3, 23:22, 19:34, 23:43, etc..) so having someone read any of those to you would work. If you see a Jew (even the simple conservative/reform ones went to Herbew school and can read) maybe ask them to read it in Hebrew for you to hear how it sounds, specifically the remembrance of the Exodus to get them to fulfill that Mitzvah. ​ Or just learn any verses like these for the sake of Torah study (one is obligated to read verbally when its Hebrew) and then maybe learn a commentary or analyze the letters or see if you can find any novel faces, or just study the Hebrew if you are a sapling: ​ Bereisheit/Genesis 17:1 וַיְהִ֣י אַבְרָ֔ם בֶּן־תִּשְׁעִ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה וְתֵ֣שַׁע שָׁנִ֑ים וַיֵּרָ֨א יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־אַבְרָ֗ם וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָיו֙ אֲנִי־אֵ֣ל שַׁדַּ֔י הִתְהַלֵּ֥ךְ לְפָנַ֖י וֶהְיֵ֥ה תָמִֽים׃ When Abram was ninety-nine years old, יהוה appeared to Abram and said to him, “I am Ayl Shaddai (Almighty G-d). Walk in My ways and be blameless. ​ Hosea 14:9 אֶפְרַ֕יִם מַה־לִּ֥י ע֖וֹד לָעֲצַבִּ֑ים אֲנִ֧י עָנִ֣יתִי וַאֲשׁוּרֶ֗נּוּ אֲנִי֙ כִּבְר֣וֹשׁ רַעֲנָ֔ן מִמֶּ֖נִּי פֶּרְיְךָ֥ נִמְצָֽא׃ Ephraim [shall say]: “What more have I to do with idols? When I respond and look to [God], I become like a verdant cypress.” Your fruit is provided by Me. (JPS '23) ​ Chabad's translation: Ephraim; What more do I need the images? I will answer him and I will look upon him: I am like a leafy cypress tree; from Me your fruit is found. ​ (The Syrian Juniper is a type of leafy cypress native to Israel with berry-cones with high sugar content) ​ Probably by far the best one: Shemot/Exodus 3:14 וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֶֽהְיֶ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֶֽהְיֶ֑ה וַיֹּ֗אמֶר כֹּ֤ה תֹאמַר֙ לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֶֽהְיֶ֖ה שְׁלָחַ֥נִי אֲלֵיכֶֽם׃ And God said to Moses, “Ehyeh-Asher-Ehyeh,” *Meaning of Heb. uncertain; variously translated: “I Am That I Am”; “I Am Who I Am”; “I Will Be What I Will Be”; etc. continuing, “Thus shall you say to the Israelites, ‘Ehyeh *Others “I Am” or “I Will Be.” sent me to you.’” (JPS '06 w/ footnotes) ​ - I personally like "I Will Become" according to one of Jastrow's terms on the word "Ehyeh" instead of "I am" which is 'Ani' and "That" (Asher, that is written) instead of "What" (I Will Become) since What is 'Mah' -also a less Holy Divine Name on its own) ​ -This name corresponds to the Sefirah of Keter (Crown), Will/Desire, Infinity, Pure Goodness/Kindness, the highest Sefirah, the crown of the head and the right thumb/big toe ​ Click this to see the Divine Names corresponding to the Sefirot ​ --- ​ If you ever read my Google doc you saw that I once talked about one of my high school friend's father who was a Gibor Meod (Extreme warrior) teach me that if you want to immediately knock someone out in a fight, hook them right under the ear. If you feel your fist to this spot, it is where the head connects to the neck. The sat-n people have weak heads and the gog people have weak necks for some reason if you didn't know. Therefore this covers both and you won't have to guess what evil shade tree they live under if you ever have to fight one. ​ -Also be careful if they are much taller than you you don't throw your shoulder out with a strong handed haymaker (I did this once). The proper stance I was taught is to be sideways with your weak foot in front and to jab and hook with your weak hand. If you train for a little the hook can get very good and its much faster than taking your strong hand in a full circle. The only punches I was taught with the strong hand is a straight line to the nose and an uppercut. You should be on the balls of your feet with your fists protecting your face and elbows in to protect your body (body shots are worse than face shots except the nose) and light, moving around bobbing and weaving your head unpredictably, and throwing jabs to establish your range, like 'calibrating' (like checking Google maps to see what way Jerusalem is to pray to). It is much harder to land punches in an actual fight than you think, considering the other person has their guard up, is bobbing and weaving, and throwing punches (and is probably on steroids H'F'). Therefore this helps with accuracy. And when you punch you twist your ankle of the hand you are throwing with outwards while on the balls of your feet and breathe out so you don't get the wind knocked out of you while unprotected H'F' ​ Also when you punch you throw with (from/using) your shoulder muscles, not your hand and you should extend it quickly to make it snap. I was told the snap is key to a good punch. ​ If you need to knock an attacking animal heathen out while wrestling if H'F' you ever encounter such a scenario, if you can get behind them put their Adam's apple (or where it would be) in the crevice of your elbow and grab the bicep of your other arm. Its easy to do it either way. Put the second hand not on a bicep on the back of the head and squeeze (your first arm in front of their neck with their adams apple in your elbow crevice and your second hand pushing the back of their head into it). This will cut their blood off and knock them out in seconds. ​ It says the chokehold cuts off air instead of blood so the picture on the left is better (the chokehold would be extremely painful and take longer and lead to panic fueled flailing resistance): ​**On the mobile version for some reason its at the bottom of the page​ ​ ​ ​ ​​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​​ ​ ​ ​ ​​ ​​ If you are on the ground wrap your legs over (on top of) and within the other person's legs, called "hooks", so they can't reverse you H'F' like this: ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​​ It works in any position on the ground ​​​​ Mishlei/Proverbs Eishet Chayil 31:17 "She girds her loins with strength and strengthens her arms" ​ This is another reason why one should have a staff in the forest/nature or cane (in questionable public scenarios), not only to purify by pushing and pulling with it, but to use it as a baseball bat against a salt brined vicious heathens' head if necessary H'F' ​ The Alter Rebbe says one who wrestles with a dirty person always becomes dirty. [You mix souls with them, get their oils and dusts etc. on you and have to eat through all their curses H'F'.] ​ I remember reading I think in the Gemara/Talmud David HaMelech saying that its very important to train the army in archery, I assume for this reason. The best way I've found to get a good accurate slingshot shot off is to hold it sideways (my left hand is stronger and I hold the slingshot with my left, not sure of the proper hand for people whose right is stronger). My thumb extends to the bottom fork of the slingshot, I load the clay/stone into the pocket and pinch it with my right thumb over the curled fingers. ​ **Very important - I then bend the wrist forward (its uncomfortable at first) to make my right thumb parallel to my left thumb, holding the pouch from the inner side. I then bend it back looking through my right eye to a strong restraint and its actually impressively accurate and quick. (careful you don't hit your face on the release) ​ For David HaMelech this was enough to take down the Nephillim (if I remember correctly) Goliath meaning a fallen angel/human hybrid that are giants (he was over 10 feet tall). ​ Nevertheless David HaMelech was "different" as they say. Come and see 1 Shmuel 17 34-37 וַיֹּ֤אמֶר דָּוִד֙ אֶל־שָׁא֔וּל רֹעֶ֨ה הָיָ֧ה עַבְדְּךָ֛ לְאָבִ֖יו בַּצֹּ֑אן וּבָ֤א הָאֲרִי֙ וְאֶת־הַדּ֔וֹב וְנָשָׂ֥א שֶׂ֖ה מֵהָעֵֽדֶר׃ David replied to Saul, “Your servant has been tending his father’s sheep, and if a lion or a bear came and carried off an animal from the flock, וְיָצָ֧אתִי אַחֲרָ֛יו וְהִכִּתִ֖יו וְהִצַּ֣לְתִּי מִפִּ֑יו וַיָּ֣קׇם עָלַ֔י וְהֶחֱזַ֙קְתִּי֙ בִּזְקָנ֔וֹ וְהִכִּתִ֖יו וַהֲמִיתִּֽיו׃ I would go after it and fight it and rescue it from its mouth. And if it attacked me, I would seize it by the beard and strike it down and kill it. גַּ֧ם אֶֽת־הָאֲרִ֛י גַּם־הַדֹּ֖ב הִכָּ֣ה עַבְדֶּ֑ךָ וְֽ֠הָיָ֠ה הַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֨י הֶעָרֵ֤ל הַזֶּה֙ כְּאַחַ֣ד מֵהֶ֔ם כִּ֣י חֵרֵ֔ף מַעַרְכֹ֖ת אֱלֹהִ֥ים חַיִּֽים׃ {ס} Your servant has killed both lion and bear; and that uncircumcised Philistine shall end up like one of them, for he has defied the ranks of the living God. וַיֹּאמֶר֮ דָּוִד֒ יְהֹוָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר הִצִּלַ֜נִי מִיַּ֤ד הָֽאֲרִי֙ וּמִיַּ֣ד הַדֹּ֔ב ה֣וּא יַצִּילֵ֔נִי מִיַּ֥ד הַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֖י הַזֶּ֑ה {ס}        וַיֹּ֨אמֶר שָׁא֤וּל אֶל־דָּוִד֙ לֵ֔ךְ וַיהֹוָ֖ה יִהְיֶ֥ה עִמָּֽךְ׃ The LORD,” David went on, “who saved me from lion and bear will also save me from that Philistine.” “Then go,” Saul said to David, “and may The LORD be with you!” ​​​ According to Google the lions that were native to Israel and went extinct ~800 years ago are the Asiatic lions (click) , not cougars/mountain lions or other big cats. ​​ --- ​ For the Choshen Mishpat stones I listed a few days ago I like Rashi's opinion that they go in order of descending birth (top right and across) ​ Reuben - Ruby - אֹ֤דֶם - Odem (like Adam or Edom) ​ Shimon - Topaz - פִּטְדָה֙ - Pitdah (Pat Dai, bread/food is sufficient) ​ Levi - Emerald -  בָּרֶֽקֶת - Bareket (like Birkat, Blessing [of]) ​ Yehudah - Turquoise - נֹ֥פֶךְ - Nofech (close to Nafal, to fall or Nashach, to bite. Better Hafoch, to turn over like Pirkei Avot 5:22 says בֶּן בַּג בַּג אוֹמֵר, הֲפֹךְ בָּהּ וַהֲפֹךְ בָּהּ, דְּכֹלָּא בָהּ. וּבָהּ תֶּחֱזֵי, וְסִיב וּבְלֵה בָהּ, וּמִנַּהּ לֹא תָזוּעַ, שֶׁאֵין לְךָ מִדָּה טוֹבָה הֵימֶנָּה: Ben Bag Bag said: Turn it over, and [again] turn it over, for all is therein. And look into it; And become gray and old therein; And do not move away from it, for you have no better portion than it.) ​ Dan - Sapphire - סַפִּ֖יר - Sapir (Lesaper is to relate, making sense why Heaven is made of Sapphire bricks in the visions of the Torah, since we relate Torah Wisdom Understanding and Knowledge to experience Heaven. BDB says Sapir can also be Lapis Lazuli) ​ Naphtali - Diamond - יָהֲלֹֽם - YAHalom (Chalom, חלום, is a dream. So its like having a blessed dream) ​ Gad - Amber - לֶ֥שֶׁם - Leshem (To HaShem! Alternatively close to Lashon, 'tongue') ​ Asher - Agate - שְׁב֖וֹ - Shevo (Sh-kai Comes - Shin Bo) ​ Yissachar - Amethyst - אַחְלָֽמָה - AchlaMah (To wish for Mah [What, a name of HaShem] or OchelMah - to eat What. Or Ohel Mah, Tent of What) ​ Zevulun - Beryl - תַּרְשִׁ֥ישׁ - Tarshish ​ Yosef - Onyx - שֹׁ֖הַם - Shoham (anagram for HaShem) ​ BenYamin - Jasper - יָשְׁפֵ֑ה - YAHShfay (Y-H is Al-mighty (Shin) in the World, the Peh, mouth, alluding to this lowest world. Or, Yesh Peh, there is a Malchut, Kingdom) ​​ -- ​ Here (click) is a great resource for learning about the different Hebrew scripts. You can see that the Sephardi and Ashkenazi scripts come from Masorah while the Chassidic scripts were innovations. (Although it says there is no written tradition for the Sephardic script, the fact that Sephardim all over the world have adopted it and there is no tradition that anything was intentionally altered means we can assume it was received). Nevertheless according to Footnote 3, our great fish of the sea, the Rambam seems to be very lenient with the letters and says they are valid as long as a child can read them (sorry about that). ​​ ​ --- ​ Once a few years ago I was emailing Rabbi Michael Schulman of AskNoah telling him about my distresses and he told me to recite Tehillim/Psalms 109 and it actually worked very well. I see now that he knew it was about me and the evil house owner of Yehudah. I also see that Bowser from Mario is about him since he hides behind the Magen (shield) of David, his bloodline. Anyway praying this Psalm should help you and everyone good a great deal. ​Link to Psalm 109 on Chabad ​ Bereisheit 49:19 ​גָּ֖ד גְּד֣וּד יְגוּדֶ֑נּוּ וְה֖וּא יָגֻ֥ד עָקֵֽב׃ He will form a large troop and raid the heels ​ Please muster the strength to at least pray it in your mind even in English or your native tongue its only 31 sentences and will speed things along. (Rambam says one can pray in the mind during distressing times) ​​ -- ​ Why do I say (Genesis) Chivshuhah Ordu Bidgat HaYam - "Dominate over the world and rule over it with the fish of the sea (singular Torah scholar, Dag)" and ideally not ask other fish (Dagim or I think the Hebrew would read Bidgei or Bidgatei)? Like the Mitzvah of not grafting different species of fruit trees, I have heard once from Rabbi Chaim Coffman that it is forbidden for Jews to go "Rabbi shopping" and get different opinions for convenience sake unless he really believes his Rabbi is wrong about something (as you have seen I definitely can be as I am called the "poor man" by Torah and don't have a religious family or community since everyone I have met is too dangerous to consistently be around, like the "daughters of the land" spoken about above H'F' and like Rambam Hilchot Diot 6 says to stay to oneself in such generations). Ideally you should first try to find it yourself in Rambam's Mishneh Torah. I like to use Google and the AI's (the Rabbi AI's started off great and got increasingly more inaccurate) as a sort of 'Table of Contents' to find sources, or the Sefaria search bar and filters (the problem with Sefaria is the different English translations on different words). Right now ChatGPT is working the best. If not then usually Google will bring up articles from Chabad, OU, Aish, etc etc (ideally use the main ones like the Yeshivot, Chabad, and Kosher Certifying sites like OU and CRC. If not, dig around and make sure it is an Orthodox website, not anything less like conservative/dox, messianic or anything secular and make sure they quote sources/explain their logic) that will usually quote their sources on the topic. As you can see Tehillim 109 calls me the Eish-Oni, "Master of being a poor man." ​Or as you know how I like to novelize it, Eish-Oneg, "Master of delights" lol ​​ Bereisheit 49:14 יִשָּׂשכָ֖ר חֲמֹ֣ר גָּ֑רֶם רֹבֵ֖ץ בֵּ֥ין הַֽמִּשְׁפְּתָֽיִם׃ He wins the clay (bodies) and bones,  (or of Geirim [converts]) crouching between the sheepfolds, or instead read Bein Hamishpachot, between families ​ -- ​ To add to the Mishnah Yadayim about animal spit falling in your ground water, this may only be true if you are electrically grounded (people used to have dirt floors for most of history and I'm guessing everyone used to carry sticks/staffs to ground themselves to the floor since leather shoes are insulators)​​​ ​ --- ​ In my first few months of Yeshiva at Hadar HaTorah in Brooklyn, I remember feeling overwhelmed with how vast the Torah is and telling my teacher YirmiYah "its like chipping away at an ice berg." His response was "Yes, but its all water." ​ In the words of the sages, "There is no water other than Torah." Even if it seems like a giant ice berg you can survive on the melted ice chips that you come pick at if you have the vessel of the fear of HaShem to hold it, like the parable of the Bahir and one needing this vessel to carry honey otherwise he gets punished for carrying it in his clothes and ruining the clothes and honey. In this case wasting the water you needed in treacherous freezing conditions. ​ Ice bergs are made of freshwater floating on saltwater oceans ​ -- ​ Back to the "Crouching between the families" novelty. The Bahir says something about "If you didn't know how to properly do something, you should have looked around you to see how everyone else is doing it." Although its written YirmiYah 50:6 צֹ֤אן אֹֽבְדוֹת֙ (היה) [הָי֣וּ] עַמִּ֔י רֹעֵיהֶ֣ם הִתְע֔וּם הָרִ֖ים (שובבים) [שׁוֹבְב֑וּם] מֵהַ֤ר אֶל־גִּבְעָה֙ הָלָ֔כוּ שָׁכְח֖וּ רִבְצָֽם׃ My people were lost sheep: their shepherds led them astray, they drove them out to the mountains, ​ it is still better than acting blind and ignoring Torah obligations. ​ If you need to escape zombies and want to fulfill Rambam Hilchot Diot 6 and flee to nature, I think it is much more advisable to find a field or desert than a mountain with trees as this provides many hiding places for the "creepers" and bird drones. Although this is very dusty and forbidden when I was young I used to watch this ninja anime called Naruto that is actually very insightful into how the warlocks are fighting each other and they were always hiding behind trees stalking each other in the forests (they just use guns instead of throwing knives) ​ "Indeed the Adam is a tree of the field" ​ Forests are associated with the Sefirah of Gevurah, (Severity, blood, judgement, richness) whereas fields are associated with Yesod (I assume based on the Divine Name Sh-dai being associated with it and Sadai is "my fields") that is the Foundation (culmination) ​ --- ​ How to not get pulled over and tortured by Kold Krickets in the US ​ My grandfather is a mason (the upper illuminati triangle people) and he told me when I was young to always set the cruise control on no more than 9 mph over on the highways and you will be fine. When I was older my father's friend was a retired state kop and confirmed. However out of state you should set it to no more than 4 mph over (my father told me he was recently pulled over in WV going less than 10 over..). If not its easy to zone out and hit 15+ over where you become a harpooning wing spearing target H'F'. ​ Be especially careful when having an out of state license plate and always come to a complete stop at stop signs and red lights where you can turn right (unless you look for kops first). Always use your turn signals and if a cop is ever going extremely slow on a one way passable highway, better to just tough it out and set cruise control and enjoy the ride because if you don't give him enough space (3 car lengths?) he will pull you over and fund more Krickets etc H'F'. Maybe take the next exit for a few minute break and get back on. ​ In more suspect situations better to just keep your hands at 10 o'clock and 2 o'clock like they teach (top left and top right of the wheel). Make sure your inspection stickers are always up to date as I've been pulled over for this before in the middle of my home town. ​ Again the US flag bumper sticker has been the Rosh Pina (cornerstone) ​​ Also for parking avoid private lots where you are sitting ducks H'F'. You can go to freecampsites.net  to avoid any liability ​ Otherwise you will have to be cunning and blend in somewhere ​​ If you respect the "smooth" fake pureness of the pig and how it likes to display its pure part, the split hooves by looking like a perfect citizen, you will have smooth sailing on these Memulach (more than salty) seas. ​ If you own your own 4 walls unattached to someone else better to just stay in your house like HaShem through YeshaYaHu and the Vilna Gaon say and you can ground yourself in your basement whenever you want ​ --- ​ Bereisheit 27:40 וְעַל־חַרְבְּךָ֣ תִֽחְיֶ֔ה וְאֶת־אָחִ֖יךָ תַּעֲבֹ֑ד וְהָיָה֙ כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר תָּרִ֔יד וּפָרַקְתָּ֥ עֻלּ֖וֹ מֵעַ֥ל צַוָּארֶֽךָ׃ Yet by your sword you shall live, And you shall serve your brother; But when you grow restive, You shall break his yoke from your neck.” ​ It is said (I think in Artscroll Stone Edition) that Esau's weapon is the sword but for Yaakov/Yisrael its the Kol, voice, as in the voice of prayer. ​ --- ​ *** Important ​ I once read from a book called The Wisdom of the Zohar Vol 2 or 3 that the dirt under the fingernails is associated with or is the form(?) of evil. Chat GPT concurred that the Zohar says this and elaborated but it seems the source may have been inaccurate. Either way it definitely make sense. I learned in Yeshiva Temimi Derech in Tzfat years ago from the book Ayin Beit (A Chabad Chassidic Sefer/book) that the hair comes from impurity because it is a "Yeish Meiayin" - a something from nothing as it grows from your head, and the same can apply to fingernails. Rambam says kings are required to cut their hair every day. ​ It is very important to keep the fingernails trimmed as soon as you notice some dirt is accumulating especially considering the gates of technology being opened for most people (who knows what could be under there Heaven save us!). ​ My mother (remember parents are From Us) had a vial of tea tree oil in the living room when I was young and Chat GPT says that it has antimicrobial/antifungal properties and if you apply it below the nail it can prevent dirt build up. Also its good for inflammation, ingrown, brittle nails, and yellow nails as it strengthens the nails. ​ Here is a great article on the best practices for cutting the nails and disposing of them by burning (if you live in an apartment H'F' I have heard flushing is the next best option). This will also be great incense for your "neighbors" Article link Although it says to cut from Wed to Fri for Shabbat and the closer the better, if you were forgetful and notice a dirt buildup I think it would make sense that the danger existing would require you to cut them ASAP and maybe see if you can give them another trimming Erev Shabbat ​ The last paragraph is especially amazing: The Zohar explains that the forces of impurity are very much connected to the part of the fingernails that protrude above our fingers and are cut off.21 The Lubavitcher Rebbe explains that, on a personal level, the “fingernails” represent the part of us that can be used to prick and scratch someone. Thus, the importance of cutting our nails teaches us that before we interact with others, and specifically before rebuking someone, we need to “pare our own nails first.” We must ensure that any rebuke is given not to satisfy our own urge to criticize or belittle, but solely with the benefit of the person in mind.22 ​ - ​ My college Biology professor at Dickinson College taught me this government website of science experiments, PubMed, and they are actually admitting that miswak sticks are better than toothbrushes at this link here ​​​ Nevertheless it seems my toothbrush brushes better although it doesn't have the natural antimicrobial effect. I think I have had much thicker sticks in the past though. ​ Here is the main ingredient from a"Kosher" toothpaste called Supersmile: Sodium Monoflurorophosphate ​ Does anyone want to rub this inorganic compound into their mouth two times a day for the rest of their lives? ​ Does anyone want to do or have the sterile tools to do all of the science experiments themselves to see if its actually safe to consume even in this dose being the number one ingredient listed? What about the other inorganic chemicals listed? Remember even anointing is like drinking and this is inside the mouth, the Holy of Holies. ​ Remember Rabbi Avigdor Miller suggests one may be able to clean just as well with water and not expose oneself to chemicals. ​ Remember Micah HaNavi warns in Chapter 7 אַל־תַּאֲמִ֣ינֽוּ בְרֵ֔עַ אַֽל־תִּבְטְח֖וּ בְּאַלּ֑וּף מִשֹּׁכֶ֣בֶת חֵיקֶ֔ךָ שְׁמֹ֖ר פִּתְחֵי־פִֽיךָ׃ Trust no friend (This can also be novelized "Do not trust in the evil", Rely on no intimate (Intimate here can be novelized as Elef, thousand, instead of Aluf, Friend/Master/Champion as in do not follow the masses); Be guarded in speech With her who lies in your bosom. ​​ Shemot 23:2 לֹֽא־תִהְיֶ֥ה אַחֲרֵֽי־רַבִּ֖ים לְרָעֹ֑ת "Do not be (Follow. The Taf is a feminine future plural prefix) after the multitudes to evil." ​​ Or you can choose to do it and share cakes with Pharaoh and the birds for a little while longer and then die forever God Willing. ​ -- ​ I once tested the water with strips on an Hskyhan filter that also removes the Flouride and my tap water had a ton of microplastics and other impurities whereas the Hskyhan was almost, if not then perfect, I think identical to bottled water. So I think with no microplastics it is probably good for washing the hands before eating. Ideally one should wash with a cup 3 times like the sages say, one reason is because the vessel poured water comes out much stronger than most taps and get all the Shachak dust demons off you. Its not necessary to wash like a Kohen for no reason. This was instituted by shlomo who we know was not a valid witness (intentionally breaking Mitzvot) ​ Shabbat Bavli 14b-15a וְאַכַּתִּי, שְׁלֹמֹה גְּזַר! דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁתִּיקֵּן שְׁלֹמֹה עֵירוּבִין וּנְטִילַת יָדַיִם, יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה: ״בְּנִי אִם חָכַם לִבֶּךָ יִשְׂמַח לִבִּי גַם אָנִי״, ״חֲכַם בְּנִי וְשַׂמַּח לִבִּי וְאָשִׁיבָה חוֹרְפִי דָבָר״! — אֲתָא The Gemara asks further: Still, the matter is not clear, as the decree of hands was issued by King Solomon. As Rav Yehuda said that Shmuel said: At the time that Solomon instituted the ordinances of eiruv and of washing hands to purify them from their impurity, a Divine Voice emerged and said: “My son, if your heart is wise my heart will be glad, even mine” (Proverbs 23:15), and so too: “My son, be wise and make my heart glad, that I may respond to those who taunt me” (Proverbs 27: 11). The Gemara responds: Came 15a שְׁלֹמֹה גְּזַר לְקׇדָשִׁים, וַאֲתוֹ אִינְהוּ וּגְזוּר אַף לִתְרוּמָה. Solomon and decreed impurity on hands to prohibit contact with consecrated items, ​ Does it not seem like Heaven is telling shlomo to go back on his added commandments and then He will be glad? Then shlomo blasphemed? ​​ For example by starting with "If your heart will be wise" implying it is not acting wisely since He could have stated a non ambiguous verse. ​​ --- ​ If you don't have Kosher restaurants or grocery stores near you like me, grocery stores in the US (at least in the NE) have tons of Kosher foods. I got an electric griddle for like $20 from Walmart (since its electric it doesn't need dipped in a Mikveh whereas metal and glass utensils usually need dipped 3 times in a stream or pure body of water). It can be used as a Blech on Shabbat once it is covered in metal foil. ​ I once said based on Moshe's words Chazak Veematz to Yehoshua, "Be strong and resolute" that I thought it was a great idea to quickly make and eat Matzah fried in oil, but Rambam says not to do this often. There are many Kosher breads, a main one is Dave's. ​ Also the Starkist flavoured tuna packets are amazing. I like to fry some slices of bread and the tuna packet in butter and it makes an amazing sandwich. ​ The Morningstar Farms buffalo chicken patties taste exactly like real buffalo chicken sandwiches. ​ There is one brand of cheese called Cabot I can find in my local grocery stores that has the Tablets K Hechsher but apparently this is actually not reliable according to many opinions. There is a website I just found called Kosh.com where you can find Kosher meats and cheeses with only $25 shipping. ​ Alternatively many grocery stores sell Hebrew National hotdogs and if you only bought one electric plate for dairy, you can roast it on a stick with a propane torch (to not cook meat and milk together). ​ Also Eggo waffles (especially the blueberry and chocolate chip) fried in butter with syrup are amazing. ​ The best idea when the waters get a little warmer is to stock up on Kosher wild fish (with scales) like sunfish, crappie, perch etc. ​ Another idea is to get a deep freezer and take a road trip to the nearest Kosher grocery store and stock up. ​ Rabbi Avigdor Miller says bread gets sweeter the more you chew it and break it down into sugar. ​Honestly bread fried in butter with salt is tastier than most of the restaurant dishes I have ever had ​ Pirkei Avot 6:4 כַּךְ הִיא דַּרְכָּהּ שֶׁל תּוֹרָה, פַּת בְּמֶלַח תֹּאכַל, וּמַיִם בִּמְשׂוּרָה תִשְׁתֶּה, וְעַל הָאָרֶץ תִּישַׁן, וְחַיֵּי צַעַר תִּחְיֶה, וּבַתּוֹרָה אַתָּה עָמֵל, אִם אַתָּה עֹשֶׂה כֵן, (תהלים קכח) אַשְׁרֶיךָ וְטוֹב לָךְ. אַשְׁרֶיךָ בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה וְטוֹב לָךְ לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא: Such is the way [of a life] of Torah: you shall eat bread with salt, and rationed water shall you drink; you shall sleep on the ground, your life will be one of privation, and in Torah shall you labor. If you do this, “Happy shall you be and it shall be good for you” (Psalms 128:2): “Happy shall you be” in this world, “and it shall be good for you” in the world to come. ​ This implies that if you accept the Yoke of Heaven then everything in your universe will be good. Whereas if you fulfill Tehillim 2:1-6 H'F' ​ לָ֭מָּה רָגְשׁ֣וּ גוֹיִ֑ם וּ֝לְאֻמִּ֗ים יֶהְגּוּ־רִֽיק׃ Why do nations assemble, and peoples plot vain things; יִ֥תְיַצְּב֨וּ ׀ מַלְכֵי־אֶ֗רֶץ וְרוֹזְנִ֥ים נֽוֹסְדוּ־יָ֑חַד עַל־יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה וְעַל־מְשִׁיחֽוֹ׃ kings of the earth take their stand, and regents intrigue together against the LORD and against His anointed? נְֽ֭נַתְּקָה אֶת־מֽוֹסְרוֹתֵ֑ימוֹ וְנַשְׁלִ֖יכָה מִמֶּ֣נּוּ עֲבֹתֵֽימוֹ׃ “Let us break the cords of their yoke, shake off their ropes from us!” יוֹשֵׁ֣ב בַּשָּׁמַ֣יִם יִשְׂחָ֑ק אֲ֝דֹנָ֗י יִלְעַג־לָֽמוֹ׃ He who is enthroned in heaven laughs; the Lord mocks at them. אָ֤ז יְדַבֵּ֣ר אֵלֵ֣ימוֹ בְאַפּ֑וֹ וּֽבַחֲרוֹנ֥וֹ יְבַהֲלֵֽמוֹ׃ Then He speaks to them in anger, terrifying them in His rage, וַ֭אֲנִי נָסַ֣כְתִּי מַלְכִּ֑י עַל־צִ֝יּ֗וֹן הַר־קׇדְשִֽׁי׃ “But I have installed My king on Zion, My holy mountain!” ​ I guarantee you you will get plowed. ​​​​ I once read from Living Mussar Everyday by Rabbi Tzvi Miller that a trait of arrogant people is that they often eat rich foods. ​​ 1 Kings 5 23 וַיְהִ֥י לֶֽחֶם־שְׁלֹמֹ֖ה לְי֣וֹם אֶחָ֑ד שְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים כֹּר֙ סֹ֔לֶת וְשִׁשִּׁ֥ים כֹּ֖ר קָֽמַח׃ Solomon’s daily provisions consisted of 30 kors of semolina, and 60 kors of [ordinary] flour, עֲשָׂרָ֨ה בָקָ֜ר בְּרִאִ֗ים וְעֶשְׂרִ֥ים בָּקָ֛ר רְעִ֖י וּמֵ֣אָה צֹ֑אן לְ֠בַ֠ד מֵאַיָּ֤ל וּצְבִי֙ וְיַחְמ֔וּר וּבַרְבֻּרִ֖ים אֲבוּסִֽים׃ 10 fattened oxen, 20 pasture-fed oxen, and 100 sheep and goats, besides deer and gazelles, roebucks and fatted geese. ​ Remember that Rambam says one should only eat meat every once in awhile when he or she desires it... ​​ --- ​ When putting on head Tefillin it seems many people misplace it so I think it is wise when putting it on in the morning that you get a small mirror, line the box up in the middle of the head and rub it up and down in a straight line in the middle a few times right above the hairline so that it will have been in the proper place for at least a moment. **Remember when being harassed or in distress one can pray in the mind ​ For prayers, Rambam says (Berachot 24b) to pray in a whisper that is only audible to himself unless he or she is alone and can't hear themselves and needs to raise it a little. However I have learned in Yeshivat Dvar YiruShalayim from Rabbi David Gilberg that when one is making a Berachah/Blessing around other people he needs to make it audible so they can answer "Amen" that is even greater than the blessing because it was witnessed and accepted. ​ When it comes to the Mitzvah of studying Torah when its written in Hebrew out loud, Rambam says in Hilchot Talmud Torah 3:12 "And he who audibly recites the words in his studies, will retain them, but he who studies in a whisper is liable soon to forget." ​ I have also heard before from Bnei Torah that its kind of like the "louder the better" (up to a certain point - don't make it obnoxious) ​ -- ​ As for cooking dairy and chicken or other Kosher birds, chicken and cheese is absolutely delicious and again we do not add to HaShem's Torah and make service of Him routine commands of man. The verse says "Do not seethe a kid in its mother's milk" that exludes birds according to the sages because they obviously don't have milk. Better to fulfill the Scriptural Mitzvah of not adding or subtracting to the Torah than whoever made the freezing "mitzvah" to prohibit to our palates what the Torah permits. Yes, the valid judge in our day is all that we have and we cannot go right or left from what he says, but if he tells us to violate a Torah prohibition we need to make tree war "it is time to act for HaShem, they have made void His Torah". As is known through the Tanach the spiritual state of the Jewish people was not very great even after witnessing the miracles of HaShem in the wilderness as in the words of Moshe Dvarim (the final Book of Moses) 9:24 מַמְרִ֥ים הֱיִיתֶ֖ם עִם־יְהֹוָ֑ה מִיּ֖וֹם דַּעְתִּ֥י אֶתְכֶֽם׃ As long as I have known you, you have been defiant toward יהוה. ​ Therefore I think the safer path is to not add a commandment rather than obey a strange command of men that HaShem did not speak. As is known, Eve originally fell because Adam added the extra commandment to her to not even touch the Tree of Knowledge although that was fine (HaShem's command was not to eat from it) and didn't explain to her that that was extra. Then when the snake pushed Eve into the Tree and nothing happened this fueled her evil inclination H'F'. ​ Is everyone completely conscious of when they are choosing to buy, prepare and eat white chicken meat as opposed to bloody red meat/beef? I have never confused them in my 28 years of life and my mind gets pulled in different directions all the time Heaven save us. ​ Especially the "Memulach" saltier than salt Western cultured people being extremely sensitive to everything and very very particular about what they touch and look at, even every body movement! How much more so what they eat! ​ Darim 34:2 הַצּוּר֙ תָּמִ֣ים פׇּֽעֳל֔וֹ The Rock, Perfections is His Works. Instead see The Rock (Halachah)​ and read Tamim, perfections, as טעמים Ta'amim - Logical reasoning foundation/tastes The Rock[s of Halacha], work logic/reasoning into them for a good flavor. ​ See that logically the Torah never prohibited birds and dairy so work that flavor into and enjoy the taste in your Rock House (your Torah). ​ YeshaYaHu/Isaiah 29:13 וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲדֹנָ֗י יַ֚עַן כִּ֤י נִגַּשׁ֙ הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה בְּפִ֤יו וּבִשְׂפָתָיו֙ כִּבְּד֔וּנִי וְלִבּ֖וֹ רִחַ֣ק מִמֶּ֑נִּי וַתְּהִ֤י יִרְאָתָם֙ אֹתִ֔י מִצְוַ֥ת אֲנָשִׁ֖ים מְלֻמָּדָֽה׃ My Sovereign said: Because that people has approached [Me] with its mouth And honored Me with its lips, But has kept its heart far from Me, And its worship of Me has been A social obligation, *social obligation Lit. “commandment of men.” learned by rote— ​(JPS '23) ​ Alternatively since everyone is embittered and blassy H'F' permit birds and dairy as a "staff of pleasure" to use for the Mitzvah of loving HaShem and not spiritually dying through rebellion H'F'. ​​ See that we are still largely unredeemed without our Kingdom and Beit HaMikdash and many Jewish people are still split trees in the winter exile from keeping all of their leaves of Rabbinic obligations on during the snowstorm H'F'. ​​ YeshaYaHu 6:13 (intentionally, as in the 613 Torah Mitzvot) וְע֥וֹד בָּהּ֙ עֲשִׂ֣רִיָּ֔ה וְשָׁ֖בָה וְהָיְתָ֣ה לְבָעֵ֑ר כָּאֵלָ֣ה וְכָאַלּ֗וֹן אֲשֶׁ֤ר בְּשַׁלֶּ֙כֶת֙ מַצֶּ֣בֶת בָּ֔ם זֶ֥רַע קֹ֖דֶשׁ מַצַּבְתָּֽהּ׃ {פ} “But while a tenth part yet remains in it, it shall repent. It shall be ravaged like the terebinth and the oak, of which stumps are left even when they are felled: its stump shall be a holy seed.” ​ Rashi: ​like the terebinth and like the oak which, at the time of their casting, when they cast off their leaves during the fall, one casting after another casting, until nothing is left in it except the trunk, they too, the holy seed found in its midst, adhering to their holiness, they will be to Me as the trunk; another explanation of מַצַּבְתָּהּ is: its planting. Therefore, I will not destroy them, for I planted them as holy seed. Some explain that there was a Shallecheth Gate in Jerusalem, as it is stated in Ezra (I Chron. 26:16, written by Ezra), and there, terebinths and oaks were planted. ​ As I have heard from the sheepfold, "We do not forbid what the Torah permits" ​ Even shlomo himself (alternatively he was just pointing Ash-medai to talk for him) after making the mistakes of adding prohibitions said in Kohelet/Ecclesiastes 7:16 אַל־תְּהִ֤י צַדִּיק֙ הַרְבֵּ֔ה וְאַל־תִּתְחַכַּ֖ם יוֹתֵ֑ר לָ֖מָּה תִּשּׁוֹמֵֽם׃ Do not be overly righteous and don’t act the wise man to excess, why become desolate/appalled? ​ Appalled from the Torah after all of the extra unnecessary obligations sicken you and desolate when you spiritually die from it and cease to be Heaven save us! ​​ A better source from Nedarim YiruShalmi 9:1 רִבִּי דִימִי בְשֵׁם רִבִּי יִצְחָק. לֹא דַייֵךְ מַה שֶׁאָֽסְרָה לָךְ הַתּוֹרָה אֶלָּא שֶּׁאַתָה מְבַקֵּשׁ לֶאֱסוֹר עָלֶיךָ דְבָרִים אֲחֵרִים. לֶאֱסוֹר אִסָּר Rebbe Dimi in the name of Rebbe Yitzhak: Is the judgements of what the Torah forbids to you not sufficient, but that you seek to prohibit upon yourself other things? To prohibit is prohibited. ​​ Tehillim/Psalms 127 שִׁ֥יר הַֽמַּעֲל֗וֹת לִשְׁלֹ֫מֹ֥ה אִם־יְהֹוָ֤ה ׀ לֹא־יִבְנֶ֬ה בַ֗יִת שָׁ֤וְא עָמְל֣וּ בוֹנָ֣יו בּ֑וֹ אִם־יְהֹוָ֥ה לֹא־יִשְׁמׇר־עִ֝֗יר שָׁ֤וְא ׀ שָׁקַ֬ד שׁוֹמֵֽר׃ A Song of Ascents; of Solomon. Except the LORD build the house, They labour in vain that build it; Except the LORD keep the city, The watchman waketh but in vain. ​ A song of ascents to shlomo (from the Ruach HaKodesh/Holy Spirit - according to Mesorah the Tehillim were all written with Ruach HaKodesh that is a lesser revelation of Heaven than prophecies). There is a break after HaShem asking us to ask why or look at why its there. "To shlomo, if [you will be with] HaShem, (Eem can also mean with), or "If you will be a mother (Aym, the same letters) for HaShem", as in feminine/submissive to Him to raise His Children properly. ​ Then interpret the rest from the break - ​ Do not build [My] House (Halachot), in vain do your people build in it. (Do not add or subtract from Torah) ​ If HaShem will not guard the city (people's bodies are like cities where the Good inclination and the Evil inclination wage war over its control according to the Alter Rebbe in Tanya), in vain does your guardian watch (the extra Mitzvah you added as a 'fence around the Torah' Heaven save us) ​​​ --- ​ Chullin 89a אמר רבי יצחק מאי דכתיב (תהלים נח, ב) האמנם אלם צדק תדברון מישרים תשפטו בני אדם מה אומנותו של אדם בעולם הזה ישים עצמו כאלם יכול אף לדברי תורה תלמוד לומר צדק תדברון יכול יגיס דעתו ת"ל מישרים תשפטו בני אדם Rabbi Yitzḥak says: What is the meaning of that which is written: “Do you indeed [ha’umnam] speak as a righteous company [elem]? Do you judge with equity [meisharim] the sons of men” (Psalms 58:2)? The verse is interpreted as follows: What should be a person’s occupation [umanut] in this world? He should render himself silent as a mute [ilem]. If so, one might have thought that he should render himself as a mute even with regard to words of Torah. Therefore, the verse states: “Speak as a righteous company,” indicating that one should speak the righteous words of Torah. If so, he might have thought that one who speaks words of Torah has the right to become arrogant. Therefore, the verse states: “Judge with equity [meisharim] the sons of men.” Even a learned judge must take extra care to judge with equity, and not assume that he will immediately arrive at the correct understanding. ​ This may be my most thought about Fig of Torah since I learned it maybe 4-5 years ago considering the "yapping" epidemic and Esau the master of knowledge of trapping and master of the field (Bereisheit 25:27) trying to hunt our souls by getting us to speak evil things H'F' ​​ Here is what our master, the Vilna Gaon says on this in his Letter for the Ages: ​ "What should be a man's pursuit in this world? He should be silent" (Chullin 89a). One must seal his lips as tight as two millstones. Idle words are like powerful weapons which can reach from one end of the world to the other. Now this is true concerning mere excessive speech. Where forbidden speech is concerned - e.g. lashon hara, mocking, swearing, vowing, fighting and cursing - especially in the synagogue, and on Shabbat and Yom Tov - for every utterance of this type it is impossible to imagine the pain and suffering one will receive (Zohar)! No word is lost; everything is recorded. ​ --- ​ If you made your own Choshen Mishpat replica necklace there is an opinion that one should not take it into the restroom and it isn't pious to make.
