I will return about making them into a single row instead of having a breastplate replica. ​​ Even if it is not pious we are using it in severe times as reminders and inspirations to HaShem to save souls and as possible electrical protection as people will be discouraged from tazing your heart directly H'F' to save your own soul since the zombies worship "the Rock (gods that HaShem sends as troubles upon us like how one stubs his or her toe on a rock)" so I like the latter opinion if you prefer ​ --- ​ YechezkEl 1:27 וָאֵ֣רֶא ׀ כְּעֵ֣ין חַשְׁמַ֗ל כְּמַרְאֵה־אֵ֤שׁ בֵּֽית־לָהּ֙ סָבִ֔יב מִמַּרְאֵ֥ה מׇתְנָ֖יו וּלְמָ֑עְלָה וּמִמַּרְאֵ֤ה מׇתְנָיו֙ וּלְמַ֔טָּה רָאִ֙יתִי֙ כְּמַרְאֵה־אֵ֔שׁ וְנֹ֥גַֽהּ ל֖וֹ סָבִֽיב׃ From what appeared as the loins up, I saw a gleam as of electrum—what looked like a fire encased in a house; and from what appeared as the loins down, I saw what looked like fire. There was a surrounding radiance. ​ (One face is that the grassy people that eat with their sexual organs primarily have no house - are stealthy homeless people or live underground lol. The people on HaShem's body from the waist up have gold, silver, and copper and a house 'Yesh, substance' as in the Mishnah - I will endow My Lovers with Yesh [numerical value of 310 worlds, I have heard as in 310 times all the pleasures of this world].) ​ Electrum is a natural alloy of gold, silver, and copper ​ According to science, one way silver, gold, and copper form is by being in a liquid state in a superheated fluid (remember demons are like hot waters) from magma underground (hell) and they precipitate (form into a solid) into cracks in rocks (they try to make teeth, idolotrous rock worshippers into Sarah) ​ Mishnah Yadayim 1:3 שִׁמְעוֹן הַתִּמְנִי אוֹמֵר, אֲפִלּוּ נִתְכַּוֵּן לִשְׁרוֹת בָּזֶה וְנָפַל לַשֵּׁנִי, כְּשֵׁרִים: Shimon HaTimni says, even if he intended to make his princess out of her(s) and fell to their teeth, it is valid (the water for purification). (One can only take one Yefet Toar at a time) ​ Dr. Joshua Kulp's translation: Shimon of Teman says: even if he intended to soak his bread in one water and it fell into another water the water is valid. ​ (His bread, "Sarah" or in this call we will call her "Shaiynah" as in Shaiyn, tooth, got her water from another (sexually) as I have been warning us as the people have been warning me, or she drank [accepted] from the Wisdom of idolators/atheists or conservative/reform Jewish "Am HaAretz, people of the land". Or, she was playing two real men [pure cups of water] at the same time H'F') ​ Interpret it the same way for a woman and Sar (Sarat - the prince of [her]), instead of Sarah, princess ​ ChatGPT says gold forms in quartz (a semi-precious(?) light giving stone) whereas silver and copper usually form in alloyed rocks with Ag or Cu in them. ​ In this way, Shane or Shainah exposes the previously hidden "fish", pure people in the waters to the world when they were inspired to get a job and house for them (See Ohr Somayach's special on Perek Shira Song of the Fish) or when she lives in his/their (remember they are bloodless flying soul specks that take and switch control of each others' bodies) house and they fall back to their rocky ways. (The solid gold/silver/copper is found in fractures in ( cleaving to ) less precious rocks. Silver mines are stuffed with quartz and they get kicked around (disregarded, according to my brother BenYamin who worked in one) ​ Bereisheit 2:24 עַל־כֵּן֙ יַֽעֲזׇב־אִ֔ישׁ אֶת־אָבִ֖יו וְאֶת־אִמּ֑וֹ וְדָבַ֣ק בְּאִשְׁתּ֔וֹ וְהָי֖וּ לְבָשָׂ֥ר אֶחָֽד Therefore, a man will leave his father (Alef-Taf, all of them) and his mother (all of them) and cleave in his wife and they will be one flesh. ​ Don't cleave to non precious rocks kings and queens. ​ Be like the gold that settles in riverbeds (remember Rashi says rivers are metaphors for kings) ​ ChatGPT: 🔹 Placer Deposits Over time, weathering and erosion break gold from rocks, and rivers carry the heavy gold particles downstream. Gold settles in riverbeds and forms placer deposits, which people pan for. ​ Or like the strong copper that separates itself out from hell: 🔹 Magmatic Deposits When magma cools underground, it crystallizes, and copper separates out into concentrated deposits. This happens in porphyry copper deposits, which are major sources of copper worldwide. ​ Apparently Chashmal/electrum forms this way as well and seems to be HaShem's choice. It also forms like gold in quartz veins and riverbeds. Quartz does give off a beautiful light and is useful for clocks and is still considered a "gem" ​ Nevertheless does anyone want to cleave to someone compared to quartz for the rest of eternity when they could have had an emerald , turquoise, ruby, onyx, sapphire or diamond or another of the Mishpat stones set in them? Proof of this is ruby is Odem, same root as Adam. Or someone else compared to the electrum metals? ​ Unless it is a large and beautiful specimen apparently the quartz is either ground to dust or the gold dissolved out by The Prospector ​ Like Mishlei 6:26 says, וְאֵ֥שֶׁת אִ֑ישׁ נֶ֖פֶשׁ יְקָרָ֣ה תָצֽוּד The wife of an Eish-man/master (in this case like a quartz), a precious soul she will trap (she will divorce after she finds and flirts with and "traps" an Adam - electrum, precious stones). ​ Traps because the Adam is either unaware she is married or because he is aware and she is conflicting him with flirtation as he cannot flirt with a non idolatrous owner-of-his-flesh man's wife (who is not part of the war on him), and is already obligated to keep speech to the bare minimum (Pirkei Avot). ​ When giving Tzedakah (charity), one's family comes before others and one's community comes before further away places. ​ --- Adar 19 ​ ​Update on the breastplate wire-bead pendant - it is completely fine even in the restroom ​ --- ​ Berachot 51b אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין פְּרִי בִטְנָהּ שֶׁל אִשָּׁה מִתְבָּרֵךְ אֶלָּא מִפְּרִי בִּטְנוֹ שֶׁל אִישׁ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״וּבֵרַךְ פְּרִי בִטְנְךָ״. ״פְּרִי בִטְנָהּ״ לֹא נֶאֱמַר, אֶלָּא ״פְּרִי בִטְנְךָ״ Rabbi Yoḥanan said as follows: The fruit of a woman’s body is blessed only from the fruit of a man’s body, as it is stated: “And He will love you, and bless you, and make you numerous, and He will bless the fruit of your body” (Deuteronomy 7:13). The Gemara infers: “He will bless the fruit of her body” was not stated. Rather, “He will bless the fruit of your [masculine singular] body.” ​ --- ​ Pesachim 110a-b ​ וְאִי אִישְׁתְּלִי וְאִיקְּרִי וּנְפַק, מַאי תַּקַּנְתֵּיהּ? לִינְקוֹט זַקְפָּא דִידֵיהּ דְּיַמִּינֵיהּ בִּידָא דִשְׂמָאלֵיהּ וְזַקְפָּא דִשְׂמָאלֵיהּ בִּידָא דְיַמִּינֵיהּ, וְנֵימָא הָכִי: ״אַתּוּן וַאֲנָא — הָא תְּלָתָא״. וְאִי שְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ דְּאָמַר: ״אַתּוּן וַאֲנָא — הָא אַרְבְּעָה״, נֵימָא לֵיהּ: ״אַתּוּן וַאֲנָא — הָא חַמְשָׁה״. וְאִי שְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ דְּאָמַר: ״אַתּוּן וַאֲנָא — הָא שִׁיתָּא״, נֵימָא לֵיהּ: ״אַתּוּן וַאֲנָא — הָא שִׁבְעָה״. הֲוָה עוֹבָדָא עַד מְאָה וְחַד, וּפְקַע שֵׁידָא. The Gemara asks: And if one forgets and it happens that he goes outside after having drunk an even number of cups, what is his solution? The Gemara answers: He should take his right thumb in his left hand, and his left thumb in his right hand, and say as follows: You, my thumbs, and I are three, which is not a pair. And if he hears a voice that says: You and I are four, which makes a pair, he should say to it: You and I are five. And if he hears it say: You and I are six, he should say to it: You and I are seven. The Gemara relates that there was an incident in which someone kept counting after the demon until he reached a hundred and one, and the demon burst in anger. ​ אָמַר אַמֵּימָר: אֲמַרָה לִי רֵישָׁתִינְהִי דְּנָשִׁים כַּשְׁפָנִיּוֹת: הַאי מַאן דְּפָגַע בְּהוּ בְּנָשִׁים כַּשְׁפָנִיּוֹת, נֵימָא הָכִי: ״חָרֵי חַמִּימֵי בְּדִיקּוּלָא בַּזְיָיא לְפוּמַּיְיכוּ נְשֵׁי דְּחָרָשַׁיָּיא, קָרַח קָרְחַיְיכִי, פָּרַח פָּרְחַיְיכִי, Ameimar said: The chief of witches said to me: One who encounters witches should say this [to them]: Hot feces in torn date baskets in your mouth, witches; may your hairs fall out [to expose your baldness - Artscroll]; your crumbs should scatter ​ 110b אִיבַּדּוּר תַּבְלוּנַיְיכִי, פָּרְחָא זִיקָא לְמוֹרִיקָא חַדְתָּא דְּנָקְטִיתוּ נָשִׁים כַּשְׁפָנִיּוֹת, אַדְּחַנַּנִּי וְחַנַּנְכִי לָא אֲתֵיתִי לְגוֹ, הַשְׁתָּא דַּאֲתֵיתִי לְגוֹ — קַרְחַנְנִי וַחֲנַנְכִי״. your spices, [which you use for your witchcraft], should scatter; the wind should carry away the fresh saffron [that you witches hold to perform your witchcraft]. As long as I was shown favor from Heaven and you showed me favor, I did not come here. Now that I have come here, your favor toward me has cooled and you should find favor. ​ בְּמַעְרְבָא לָא קָפְדִי אַזּוּגֵי. רַב דִּימִי מִנְּהַרְדְּעָא קָפֵיד אֲפִילּוּ אַרוּשְׁמָא דְחָבִיתָא. הֲוָה עוֹבָדָא וּפְקַע חָבִיתָא. כְּלָלָא דְמִילְּתָא, כׇּל דְּקָפֵיד — קָפְדִי בַּהֲדֵיהּ, וּדְלָא קָפֵיד — לָא קָפְדִי בַּהֲדֵיהּ, וּמִיהוּ לְמֵיחַשׁ מִיבְּעֵי. The Gemara relates that in the West, Eretz Yisrael, they were not particular with regard to pairs. Rav Dimi from Neharde’a was particular about pairs even with regard to the signs on a barrel; he would not write pairs of symbols on a barrel. There was an incident in which there were pairs of symbols on a barrel and the barrel burst. The Gemara concludes: The rule of the matter is that all who are particular about pairs, the demons are particular with him; and if one is not particular, they are not particular with him. However, one is required to be concerned about the harm that might result from purposely performing actions in pairs. ​ כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר: שְׁתֵּי בֵיצִים, וּשְׁתֵּי אֱגוֹזִין, שְׁתֵּי קִישּׁוּאִין, וְדָבָר אַחֵר — הֲלָכָה לְמֹשֶׁה מִסִּינַי. וּמִסְתַּפְּקָא לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן מַאי נִיהוּ דָּבָר אַחֵר, וּגְזוּר רַבָּנַן בְּכוּלְּהוּ זוּגֵי מִשּׁוּם דָּבָר אַחֵר. When Rav Dimi came from Eretz Yisrael to Babylonia, he said: With regard to two eggs, two nuts, two cucumbers, and another matter, there is a halakha transmitted to Moses from Sinai [that they are dangerous in pairs.] But the Sages are uncertain about what the other matter is, and therefore the Sages decreed that all pairs are prohibited due to that other matter. ​ וְהָא דַּאֲמַרַן עֲשָׂרָה, תְּמָנְיָא, שִׁיתָּא, אַרְבְּעָה אֵין בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם זוּגֵי, לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא לְעִנְיַן מַזִּיקִין. אֲבָל לְעִנְיַן כְּשָׁפִים — אֲפִילּוּ טוּבָא נָמֵי חָיְישִׁינַן. And the Gemara notes that that which we said above, that the numbers ten, eight, six, and four do not cause the danger associated with pairs, we said only with regard to harmful spirits. However, with regard to witchcraft, we are concerned even with regard to one who performed an activity a greater number of times. ​​ ' This in my opinion is a good example of a proper fence around the Torah since it is a Halacha from Moshe from HaShem making it good reasoning, unlike an unnecessary added yoke. Although the sheepfolds today aren't observant of this, I think everyone should be as the Gemara says we are required to be and it is a Torah Dorita - Mitzvah from the Torah, not an invention. ​ --- ​ Although most of the numerous Berachot/Blessings were instituted by Ezra and you can see above about that and one would have Achum (Avodat Cochavim - star worshippers) speakers in his or her mouth all day H'F', I suggest that although human waste has toxins and the like, it is also mainly water and has things that have helped you and excess nutrients. Since it feels amazing to use the facilities (גַּל Gal is a heap of stones or ruins, Galah is to remove or uncover nakedness, and Galil is to rejoice) in a way it is like consuming (pleasure) and perhaps one can finish elevating the souls. Just a thought but it may be good to at least say the blessing Baruch Atah HaShem Elokeinu Melech HaOlam Rofey Chol Basar Umafli Laasot - The standard beginning and then "Who heals all flesh and performs wonders". The full paragraph would be torturous to speak and put yourself on the crickets' altar in the field all day as its written "Sit alone and be silent, indeed HaShem has laid it upon him". Nevertheless blessing before and after consuming food and maybe before incense since one tastes some of it is a Torah Mitzvah in my opinion as its written Dvarim 8:9-10 אֶ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר לֹ֤א בְמִסְכֵּנֻת֙ תֹּֽאכַל־בָּ֣הּ לֶ֔חֶם לֹֽא־תֶחְסַ֥ר כֹּ֖ל בָּ֑הּ אֶ֚רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֲבָנֶ֣יהָ בַרְזֶ֔ל וּמֵהֲרָרֶ֖יהָ תַּחְצֹ֥ב נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃ a land where you may eat food without stint, where you will lack nothing; a land whose rocks are iron and from whose hills you can mine copper. וְאָכַלְתָּ֖ וְשָׂבָ֑עְתָּ וּבֵֽרַכְתָּ֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ עַל־הָאָ֥רֶץ הַטֹּבָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָֽתַן־לָֽךְ׃ And after you eat/consume and are sated, and bless your God יהוה for the good land He gave to you. ​ One can interpret "And you will eat" as the Berachah before and "And you will be satisfied" as the Berachah after (incense isn't sating, for example when people get "stoned" they get hungry) ​ Or also "And after you have eaten and are sated" implying also before. " And you will bless HaShem" is written when the and is unnecessary. The "and" implies a multiplicity, as in both times before and after. ​ Also derive it from the Kabbalah of the Arizal who says when one doesn't properly bless before and after the foods, he doesn't uplift the soul as he could have (I think getting tazed H'F' trying to pay attention to all the paragraphs of Birkat Hamazon/Grace after meals and possibly even Mezonot/7 Israeli fruits is definitely not a good idea). He says not blessing is like stealing from HaShem (this is also said in Berachot Bavli), your parents' souls (that are connected to yours), that soul, and your own soul, and we know clearly stealing is one of the Eser Dibrot (10 Commandments lit. Speeches) ​ ---- ​ Here is more context for zugot. It seems if you like 2 eggs you could make them scrambled: ​ 110b cont. כִּי הָא דְּהָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּגָרְשַׁהּ לִדְבֵיתְהוּ. (אֲזִיל) אִינַּסְבָה לְחַנְוָאָה. כׇּל יוֹמָא הֲוָה אָזֵיל וְשָׁתֵי חַמְרָא. הֲוָה קָא עָבְדָא לֵיהּ כְּשָׁפִים וְלָא קָא מַהְנְיָא לַהּ בֵּיהּ, מִשּׁוּם דַּהֲוָה מִזְדְּהַר בְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ בְּזוּגָא. This is like that incident involving a certain man who divorced his wife. She went and married a shopkeeper who sold wine in his store. Every day, the first husband would go and drink wine in that shop. His ex-wife would perform witchcraft upon him, and it would not be effective for her in her attempts to harm him because he was careful with regard to pairs. יוֹמָא חַד אִשְׁתִּי טוּבָא, וְלָא הֲוָה יָדַע כַּמָּה שָׁתֵי. עַד שִׁיתְּסַר הֲוָה צְיִיל וְאִיזְדְּהַר בְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ לָא הֲוָה צְיִיל וְלָא אִיזְדְּהַר בְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ, אַפֵּיקְתֵּיהּ בְּזוּגָא. כִּי הֲוָה אָזֵיל, גָּס בֵּיהּ הָהוּא טַיָּיעָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: גַּבְרָא קְטִילָא הוּא דְּאָזֵיל הָכָא. אָזֵיל חַבְּקֵיהּ לְדִיקְלָא, צְוַוח דִּיקְלָא וּפְקַע הוּא. One day he drank a lot, and he did not know how much he drank. Until he drank sixteen cups, he was lucid and was careful with regard to himself, to keep track of how many cups he had drunk. From here onward he was not lucid and was not careful to watch himself, and she caused him to leave after having consumed a pair, i.e., an even number of cups. As he walked, a certain Arab met him and, noticing that he was bewitched, said to him: It is a dead man who walks here. He went and hugged a palm tree for support; the palm tree dried out due to the witchcraft, and he burst. אָמַר רַב עַוִּירָא: קְעָרוֹת וְכִכָּרוֹת אֵין בָּהֶם מִשּׁוּם זוּגוֹת. כְּלָלָא דְּמִילְּתָא: כׇּל שֶׁגְּמָרוֹ בִּידֵי אָדָם — אֵין בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם זוּגוֹת. גְּמָרוֹ בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם — בְּמִילֵּי מִינֵי דְמֵיכַל חָיְישִׁינַן. Rav Avira said: Plates and loaves do not contain the element of danger associated with pairs. The Gemara elaborates upon this point: The rule of the matter is that anything whose production was completed by people, they do not contain the element of danger associated with pairs. Conversely, if the object was completed by Heaven, e.g., with regard to types of food, we are concerned. חֲנוּת — אֵין בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם זוּגוֹת. נִמְלָךְ — אֵין בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם זוּגוֹת. אוֹרֵחַ — אֵין בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם זוּגוֹת. אִשָּׁה — אֵין בָּהּ מִשּׁוּם זוּגוֹת. וְאִי אִשָּׁה חֲשׁוּבָה, חָיְישִׁינַן. Furthermore, a store does not contain the element of danger associated with pairs. If one eats there, there is no danger, as this is not his regular place. If one changed one’s mind after drinking an odd number of cups and added one more, his drinking does not contain the element of danger associated with pairs, as he did not initially intend to drink an even number. The behavior of a guest who eats or drinks in someone else’s house does not contain the element of danger associated with pairs, as his host determines how much he will eat and drink. The behavior of a woman does not contain the element of danger associated with pairs, as demons are not particular with regard to how much a woman eats or drinks. But if she is an important woman, we are concerned. אָמַר רַב חִינָּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: אִיסְפָּרָגוֹס — מִצְטָרֵף לְטוֹבָה, וְאֵין מִצְטָרֵף לְרָעָה. Rav Ḥinnana, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: Isparegus, a wine-based drink with added spices that people would regularly consume in the morning, combines with the number of cups of wine one has already consumed for the good, to raise the total to an odd number, and does not combine for the bad, to bring the sum to an even number. אָמַר רָבִינָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: זוּגֵי — לְחוּמְרָא. וְאָמְרִי לֵיהּ: זוּגֵי — לְקוּלָּא. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: תְּרֵי דְחַמְרָא וְחַד דְּשִׁיכְרָא — לָא מִצְטָרֵף, תְּרֵי דְשִׁיכְרָא וְחַד דְּחַמְרָא — מִצְטָרֵף. Ravina said in the name of Rava: If one is in doubt as to whether he has drunk in pairs, he should be stringent and drink another cup. And some say that one who is uncertain with regard to pairs should be lenient and not drink an additional cup, lest the additional cup be the even number. Rav Yosef said: Two cups of wine and one cup of beer do not combine; two cups of beer and one cup of wine do combine. ​ ** Personally I have found the best way to make eggs is by cracking them directly into a lightly heated pan with melted butter and scrambling them in the pan (also saves dishes and water). When they start thickening then delicately fold them until they are lightly cooked (still wet, too dry gets vile and they give off an unpleasant odor and too wet is also vile since you can see the membranes). I have heard to add the salt after because it breaks the eggs down when cooking if not, but I like using salted butter because I have also heard from a chef that instead of one big salting at the beginning or end of cooking, one should salt a little before and after or very little 3 times, once in the middle. ​ -- ​ It seems I originally misjudged Rambam and we both agree on the Da'at/Reasonings of the BESHT and Rabbi Avigdor Miller Hilchot Avoda Zara 11:5 מִי שֶׁאָמַר דִּירָה זוֹ שֶׁבָּנִיתִי סִימָן טוֹב הָיְתָה עָלַי. אִשָּׁה זוֹ שֶׁנָּשָׂאתִי וּבְהֵמָה זוֹ שֶׁקָּנִיתִי מְבֹרֶכֶת הָיְתָה מֵעֵת שֶׁקְּנִיתִיהָ עָשַׁרְתִּי. וְכֵן הַשּׁוֹאֵל לְתִינוֹק אֵי זֶה פָּסוּק אַתָּה לוֹמֵד אִם אָמַר לוֹ פָּסוּק מִן הַבְּרָכוֹת יִשְׂמַח וְיֹאמַר זֶה סִימָן טוֹב כָּל אֵלּוּ וְכַיּוֹצֵא בָּהֶן מֻתָּר הוֹאִיל וְלֹא כִּוֵּן מַעֲשָׂיו וְלֹא נִמְנַע מִלַּעֲשׂוֹת אֶלָּא עָשָׂה זֶה סִימָן לְעַצְמוֹ לְדָבָר שֶׁכְּבָר הָיָה הֲרֵי זֶה מֻתָּר: [A different ruling applies when] a person says, "This dwelling which I built will be a good omen for me"; "This woman whom I married or this animal that I purchased was blessed. From the time I purchased it onward, I have become rich." The same applies to a person who rejoices and exclaims, "This is a good omen" when he asks a child, "Which verse are you studying?" and the child reads him a verse of blessing. This and the like are permitted, since the person did not perform an act or hold himself back from performing an act [because of the omen]. All he did was consider something that had already happened as a sign. ​ ​' It is like Mishnah Yadayim says, not to have a vessel, a cup out for animal (angel or star worshipper) spit, yet after the fact of one spitting on you you can consider it as a message from HaShem to consider in your Avodah (service). Yet again since it says groundwater and the world is essentially on fire with electric radiation H'F' you may want to ignore every voice that isn't painful unless you are grounded and it makes its way into your body (2/3 water). ​ A plant in a non perforated pot outside on the ground is subject to impurity, but if the pot has holes then it is considered connected to the ground and cannot become impure (one source example is Shabbat 10:6). ​ Here is some additional understanding from Shulchan Aruch HaRav (clickable) Shabbat laws. ​ 3. Laws relating to Pot Plants: Moving a pot plant from one place to another: [6] It is forbidden to move a pot plant that contains a breathing hole from on top of a peg, and place it directly on the earth [7] , or from on the earth and place it onto a peg [8] [or to lift it from the earth and place it in another area of the earth [9] ]. If the pot does not contain any holes, then if its pot is made of earthenware or wood, it likewise may not be moved from a peg to the earth or vice versa. [10] [If, however, the pot does not have a breathing hole, and is made of metal or glass, then it may be moved from one area to another. [11] If a pot that does not have a hole contains a plant which hovers over the earth, past the boundary of the pot, then the entire pot is considered as if it is attached to the ground and may not be moved just like a pot which has a hole. [12] ] ​ As you can see electrical conductivity is heavily considered in this Halacha of whether a potted plant is considered planted when placed on the Earth. ​ Mishnah Sukkah 1:4 זֶה הַכְּלָל, כֹּל שֶׁהוּא מְקַבֵּל טֻמְאָה וְאֵין גִּדּוּלוֹ מִן הָאָרֶץ, אֵין מְסַכְּכִין בּוֹ. וְכָל דָּבָר שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְקַבֵּל טֻמְאָה וְגִדּוּלוֹ מִן הָאָרֶץ, מְסַכְּכִין בּוֹ This is the general principle: Anything that is susceptible to ritual impurity, e.g., vessels, or its growth is not from the ground, e.g., animal hides, one may not roof his sukka with it. And anything that is not susceptible to ritual impurity and its growth is from the ground, one may roof his Sukka with it. ​ Remember the Sukkah is a Parable for HaShem ​ -- ​ Although some people say there are Torah opinions the Earth is flat, in Rambam's Foundations of the Torah, he gives a very impressively accurate description of our solar system in ch. 3 although there may be some errors but who knows. Also I have seen Ibn Ezra comment on Tanakh that the Earth is spherical. This would make sense with the Mishnah in Avodat Cochavim that a 3D image of one who holds a ball/orb in his hand is forbidden since it represents one who rules over the whole world. This is probably why Memulachim (Westerners) are always talking about people "losing their marbles" meaning going insane lol. ​ Here is an interesting excerpt: ​All the stars and spheres possess a soul, knowledge, and intellect. They are alive and stand in recognition of the One who spoke and [thus brought] the world into being. According to their size and level, each one praises and glorifies their Creator as the angels do. Just as they are aware of the Holy One, blessed be He, they are also aware of themselves and of the angels which surpass them. The knowledge of the stars and the spheres is less than the knowledge of the angels, but greater than that of men. ​ ​ ​​​ ​ ​ ​ ​ Hilchot Avodat Cochavim 7:6: ​ צוּרוֹת שֶׁעֲשָׂאוּם עוֹבְדֵי כּוֹכָבִים לְנוֹי מֻתָּרִין בַּהֲנָאָה וְצוּרוֹת שֶׁעֲשָׂאוּם לַעֲבוֹדַת כּוֹכָבִים אֲסוּרִין. כֵּיצַד. כָּל הַצּוּרוֹת הַנִּמְצָאִים בַּכְּפָרִים אֲסוּרִים בַּהֲנָאָה מִפְּנֵי שֶׁחֶזְקָתָן שֶׁלַּעֲבוֹדַת כּוֹכָבִים הֵן עֲשׂוּיִין, וְהַנִּמְצָאוֹת בַּמְּדִינָה אִם הָיוּ עוֹמְדִין עַל פֶּתַח הַמְּדִינָה וְהָיָה בְּיַד הַצּוּרָה צוּרַת מַקֵּל אוֹ צִפּוֹר אוֹ כַּדּוּר אוֹ סַיִף אוֹ עֲטָרָה וְטַבַּעַת חֶזְקָתוֹ שֶׁהוּא לַעֲבוֹדַת כּוֹכָבִים וְאָסוּר בַּהֲנָאָה. וְאִם לָאו הֲרֵי הוּא בְּחֶזְקַת לְנוֹי וּמֻתָּר: ​ Figures made by gentiles as ornaments are permitted to be used, but those which they made for worship are forbidden. For example, all figures found in villages are forbidden, on the presumption that they were made for worship. But as for those in a city, if they are placed at the city gates, and the hand of the figure holds the form of a staff, bird, globe, sword, crown or ring, the presumption is that such a figure was erected for worship, and its use is forbidden (One should not even gaze at and appreciate it). Otherwise, the figure is presumed to be ornamental and its use is permitted. ​ Here is the Mishnah itself from Avodah Zara 3:1 ​ וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ אָסוּר אֶלָּא כֹּל שֶׁיֵּשׁ בְּיָדוֹ מַקֵּל אוֹ צִפּוֹר אוֹ כַדּוּר. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אַף כֹּל שֶׁיֵּשׁ בְּיָדוֹ כׇּל דָּבָר. And the Rabbis say: The only type of statue that is forbidden is any statue that has in its hand a staff, or a bird, or an orb. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: It is prohibited to derive benefit even from any statue that has any item whatsoever in its hand. ​ The Gemara says one needs to disfigure such images. Here is an example from Avodah Zarah 43b ​ וְהָא רַב יְהוּדָה, דַּאֲחֵרִים עָשׂוּ לוֹ, וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ שְׁמוּאֵל לְרַב יְהוּדָה: שִׁינָּנָא, סַמִּי עֵינֵיהּ דְּדֵין! The Gemara asks: But there is the case of Rav Yehuda, where others (idolators/gentiles) fashioned for him a seal with a figure of a person on it, and Shmuel said to Rav Yehuda, who was his student: Sharp-witted one [shinnana], destroy this one’s eyes, i.e., disfigure it, as it is prohibited even to have a figure of a human being in one’s possession. ​ וּמִי חָיְישִׁינַן לַחֲשָׁדָא? וְהָא בֵּי כְנִישְׁתָּא דְּשַׁף וִיתֵיב בִּנְהַרְדְּעָא, (דְּאוֹקְמִי) [דְּאוֹקִימוּ] בֵּיהּ אִנְדְּרָטָא, וַהֲווֹ עָיְילִי בֵּיהּ אֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל וְלֵוִי וּמְצַלּוּ בְּגַוֵּיהּ, וְלָא חָיְישִׁי לַחֲשָׁדָא! רַבִּים שָׁאנֵי. The Gemara asks: And are we concerned about arousing suspicion due to the use of a human figure? But what about that synagogue that had been destroyed in Eretz Yisrael and was reestablished in Neharde’a, and they erected a statue of the king in it? And nevertheless, Shmuel’s father and Levi would enter and pray in it, and they were not concerned about arousing suspicion. The Gemara answers: A public institution is different; the public is not suspected of having idolatrous intentions. Rather, it is assumed that the statue is there exclusively for ornamental purposes. ​ ' It would still definitely be pious to disfigure such an image. ​ Jastrow says כַדּוּר is a ball or globe. ​ --- ​ Although I have been talking about how farmers and gardeners used to taste dirt to test its quality and how I have found the dirt under fig trees is sweet, Rambam implies in Laws of Forbidden Foods 17:30 that eating dirt is a Torah prohibition under the verse (ויקרא יא מג) "אַל תְּשַׁקְּצוּ אֶת נַפְשֹׁתֵיכֶם" Vayikra/Leviticus 11 43 do not make your souls (fleshes/bloods) detestable. (Sorry) ​ --- ​ If you have been deemed "crazy" by society and forced to take tranquilizer "medication", get off of it immediately by any means necessary. It causes overeating and lack of energy to exercise and subjects people to getting overweight H'F'. Remember that Rashi tells us the layer of fat over the kidneys advises people not to repent so it is really a sick conspiracy H'F'. ​ Remember a man on the level of master is called Eish like Aysh, fire, as in the verse Vayikra 6:6 אֵ֗שׁ תָּמִ֛יד תּוּקַ֥ד עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ לֹ֥א תִכְבֶּֽה "A man (lit. fire) is constantly burning on the Mizbeach (Altar) - Do not extinguish [him]!" ​ Maybe the woman equivalent would be Eisha, as in Eishet Chayil Mi Yimtzah? - A woman of valor (close to Chai, living, owner of her blood), who has found one? (Mishlei) ​ Remember, again there is no marriage to bloodless idolaters, only the proper laws of Yefet Toar with such people. And that Yaakov waited until his 80's to get married. Also the laws of Yefet Toar are discouraged unless a man very much desires it. ​ -- ​ Apparently concrete basement floors do provide grounding but not as much as an actual grounding rod. Also if you have metal radiators and copper pipes you may be able to connect a copper wire or chain to the basement floor from it or to a grounding rod and make the radiator grounding. --- Adar 20 Crickets have been telling me that I didn't know the rules about forest warlock warfare and that guns are forbidden. Anyway if you used to enjoy action movies and the like maybe set up a camera to record two fruit trees or mighty chestnuts/oaks etc next to each other in their years of strong growth during a storm after a long period of showers and sun. This represents two Torah scholars battling in Halacha when the mighty "cold winds" of HaShem blow as the last branches standing represent the interpretations of the Mitzvot (Commandments) that will stand as practical Halacha when it is time to act. Shade trees that provide no posterity (portion of TWTC) like the elm and terebinth represent this world, the Sat-n, like how Balaam the wizard had greater potential than Moshe. Apparently elms have weak wood and don't stand well in Eitz Milchama. If you only had an elm tree to dwell under, in order to survive you would have to eat the young leaves and then the wood of the tree, like its written Job 18:13 יֹ֭אכַל בַּדֵּ֣י עוֹר֑וֹ יֹאכַ֥ל בַּ֝דָּ֗יו בְּכ֣וֹר מָֽוֶת׃ He will consume the branches of his skin [(his sons and daughters -Rashi)]. The prince of death will consume his branches. Watching animals battle to the death or injury may be a little intense and vile. Or much better read the Halachic battles in the Gemara and Mishnah or the Zohar portion or study Rambam (or H'W' any day the rulings of the Sanhedrin) to prepare yourself for your days of the storm winds. Bereishet 1:28 וַיְבָ֣רֶךְ אֹתָם֮ אֱלֹהִים֒ וַיֹּ֨אמֶר לָהֶ֜ם אֱלֹהִ֗ים פְּר֥וּ וּרְב֛וּ וּמִלְא֥וּ אֶת־הָאָ֖רֶץ וְכִבְשֻׁ֑הָ וּרְד֞וּ בִּדְגַ֤ת הַיָּם֙ וּבְע֣וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וּבְכׇל־חַיָּ֖ה הָֽרֹמֶ֥שֶׂת עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃ Elohim blessed them, and Elohim said to them, Be fruitful and multiply, fill the earth and subdue it, and dominate the fish of the sea, the birds of the heaven, and every living thing that moves upon the earth. וְכִבְשֻׁ֑הָ Vechivshuhah - and dominate וּרְד֞וּ Urdu - and dominate Rabbi Simcha B of Chabad told me that the difference is Chivshuhah is pure domination and Urdu is to rule over. If you want to straight plow someone keep your hands like a sheep hoof (Ceves), 4 fingers together on one side, and an airspace (Avir - Mighty One) between the thumb. In a sheep pen, as in a servant growing garments (Ohr HaChaim says holy souls are like clean garments) for HaShem, the grass quickly gets trampled to mud. If you want to raise people as children, disciples, and "rule" over them, you can keep your entire hand together as one like a fish fin, spread out like a bird wing, or every animal that walks or creeps on the earth, as in not intentionally extending fingers or "drinking", accepting such waters if your finger ever extends itself, without doing something constructive for yourself. For example I have never seen a raccoon, that has hands like humans point at someone like witches and wizards do H'F'. Again so that they don't despair of repentance you will need to bring them close with more effort than you push in order to "rule over" them, as in be their Rabbi. drink wisely  (Use your discretion) -- ​ Is anyone sickened by the excessive "clothes of Esav" as in acting or dressing like a 'femer to get the crickets and boars off you? It is only permitted as little as necessary and one can't transgress sins like shedding other people's bloods because of the concept of the Torah, "Is your blood more red than your brothers'?" In the words of HaShem in Job 38:3 אֱזׇר־נָ֣א כְגֶ֣בֶר "Gird yourself with might like a warrior (Gever)" Again Gever is the second level of the titles of man out of 4 so it is still not very impressive. ​ Yes you may say my last name is HarShin that can be novelized "Mountain of the Almighty", "Tooth Mountain" or "Fire Mountain", but I answer that I told you an opinion out of 3 in the Mishnah says that a sapling becomes a tree "according to its name". Therefore what is stopping you from changing your name to something that praises HaShem and strengthens you into a real tree too since the name we call ourselves is the most spiritually significant? אֱזׇר־נָ֣א כְגֶ֣בֶר ​ In truth I have heard from Chabad that the last name isn't nearly as significant as the first and middle names as they are a recent invention. (I asked my grandmother to give me a new middle name from Louis and she gave me AyliYaHu, "My G-d is Y-H, He", after a family member but I accept it as after HaNavi (The Prophet) since I don't know if he even existed or if it was "wine" (alcohol is a metaphor for lies since it is "Sheichar" and lie is "Sheker"). This name is especially epic since I can't think of anyone from Tanakh with the glory of AyliYaHu who ascended in a chariot of fire and never tasted death ​ 2 Kings 2:11 וַיְהִ֗י הֵ֣מָּה הֹלְכִ֤ים הָלוֹךְ֙ וְדַבֵּ֔ר וְהִנֵּ֤ה רֶֽכֶב־אֵשׁ֙ וְס֣וּסֵי אֵ֔שׁ וַיַּפְרִ֖דוּ בֵּ֣ין שְׁנֵיהֶ֑ם וַיַּ֙עַל֙ אֵ֣לִיָּ֔הוּ בַּֽסְעָרָ֖ה הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃ And it came to pass, as they still went on, and talked, that, behold, there appeared a chariot of fire, and horses of fire, which parted them both asunder; and Elijah went up by a whirlwind into Heaven. ​ וֶאֱלִישָׁ֣ע רֹאֶ֗ה וְה֤וּא מְצַעֵק֙ אָבִ֣י ׀ אָבִ֗י רֶ֤כֶב יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וּפָ֣רָשָׁ֔יו And Elisha saw it, and he cried: ‘My father, my father, the chariot of Israel and its horsemen!’ ​ ***Very important Do not name yourself after someone wicked! If you have a deceased family member with the name you want of a righteous person and that family member was wicked, intend that you are naming yourself after the original righteous person. ​ Tehillim 3:8 ק֘וּמָ֤ה יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ הוֹשִׁ֘יעֵ֤נִי אֱלֹהַ֗י כִּֽי־הִכִּ֣יתָ אֶת־כׇּל־אֹיְבַ֣י לֶ֑חִי שִׁנֵּ֖י רְשָׁעִ֣ים שִׁבַּֽרְתָּ׃ Rise, O LORD! Deliver me, O my God! For You strike all my enemies in the cheek (Rashi: with strangling); You break the teeth of the wicked (Rashi: their strength). ​ Therefore its necessary to "HarShen" up about protecting your donkey and bull (body and spiritual level) so no one shatters your expensive fake teeth and chokes you out, (or in the more likely case interpret it metaphorically as Rashi interprets YeshaYaHu 63 in terms of wars of nations), when you fall on them "taking orders" from birds of prey so they share cakes with you etc H'F'. אֱזׇר־נָ֣א כְגֶ֣בֶר ​ --- ​ One should avoid polyester clothing as I have never seen standards of certification advertised (unless you can see one) since then they can add their own "flavors/reasonings" H'F'. It seems cotton is the best option since its the least conductive. Rambam says only wool and linen garments qualify for Tzitzit so wool seems like the better option but it has a static electricity issue. One can reduce this apparently with some white vinegar or baking soda in the wash and a ball of aluminum foil rolled up in the dryer. ​ There is a Jewish Dr. named Heidi Yellen that did an experiment (rejected by Western science) about the different vibrational frequencies of different fabrics. Organic (not like you find on Amazon or Instacart) cotton had a score of 100 like the human body. Linen and wool both had scores of 5000 but dropped to 0 when worn together (it is a Halacha not to wear such clothing). ​ ChatGPT will tell you wool actually has the lowest frequency. In support of Dr. Yellen I find it very hard to fall asleep with TzitTzit on or using a wool blanket as opposed to falling asleep very quickly with cotton. ​ ​ --- ​ YeshaYahu/Isaiah 63:1-4 ​ מִי־זֶ֣ה ׀ בָּ֣א מֵאֱד֗וֹם חֲמ֤וּץ בְּגָדִים֙ מִבׇּצְרָ֔ה זֶ֚ה הָד֣וּר בִּלְבוּשׁ֔וֹ צֹעֶ֖ה בְּרֹ֣ב כֹּח֑וֹ אֲנִ֛י מְדַבֵּ֥ר בִּצְדָקָ֖ה רַ֥ב לְהוֹשִֽׁיעַ׃ Who is this coming from Edom (from Edom, [the] vinegar clothing) In crimsoned garments from Bozrah— Who is this, majestic in attire, Pressing forward with great might? “It is I, who contend victoriously, Powerful to give triumph.” ​ Rashi: Who is this coming from Edom The prophet prophesies concerning what the Holy One, blessed be He, said that He is destined to wreak vengeance upon Edom, and He, personally, will slay their heavenly prince, like the matter that is said (supra 34:5), “For My sword has become sated in the heaven.” And afterward, (ibid.) “it shall descend upon Edom,” and it is recognizable by the wrath of His face that He has slain [them with] a great massacre, and the prophet is speaking in the expression of the wars of human beings, dressed in clothes, and when they slay a slaying, the blood spatters on their garments, for so is the custom of Scripture; it speaks of the Shechinah anthropomorphically, to convey to the ear what it can hear. Comp. (Ezek. 43:2) “His voice is like the voice of many waters.” The prophet compares His mighty voice to the voice of many waters to convey to the ear according to what it is possible to hear, for one cannot understand and hearken to the magnitude of the mighty of our God to let us hear it as it is. ​ ​ מַדּ֥וּעַ אָדֹ֖ם לִלְבוּשֶׁ֑ךָ וּבְגָדֶ֖יךָ כְּדֹרֵ֥ךְ בְּגַֽת׃ Why is Your clothing so red, Your garments like those of someone who treads grapes? ​ פּוּרָ֣ה ׀ דָּרַ֣כְתִּי לְבַדִּ֗י וּמֵֽעַמִּים֙ אֵֽין־אִ֣ישׁ אִתִּ֔י וְאֶדְרְכֵ֣ם בְּאַפִּ֔י וְאֶרְמְסֵ֖ם בַּחֲמָתִ֑י וְיֵ֤ז נִצְחָם֙ עַל־בְּגָדַ֔י וְכׇל־מַלְבּוּשַׁ֖י אֶגְאָֽלְתִּי׃ “I trod out a vintage alone; Of the peoples nobody was with Me. I trod them down in My anger, Trampled them in My rage; Their life-blood bespattered My garments, And all My clothing was stained. ​ כִּ֛י י֥וֹם נָקָ֖ם בְּלִבִּ֑י וּשְׁנַ֥ת גְּאוּלַ֖י בָּֽאָה׃ For I had planned a day of vengeance, And My year of redemption arrived. ​ וְאַבִּיט֙ וְאֵ֣ין עֹזֵ֔ר וְאֶשְׁתּוֹמֵ֖ם וְאֵ֣ין סוֹמֵ֑ךְ וַתּ֤וֹשַֽׁע־לִי֙ זְרֹעִ֔י וַחֲמָתִ֖י הִ֥יא סְמָכָֽתְנִי׃ Then I looked, but there was none to help; I stared, but there was none to aid— So My own arm wrought the triumph, And My own rage was My aid. ​ וְאָב֤וּס עַמִּים֙ בְּאַפִּ֔י וַאֲשַׁכְּרֵ֖ם בַּחֲמָתִ֑י וְאוֹרִ֥יד לָאָ֖רֶץ נִצְחָֽם׃ {ס} I trampled peoples in My anger, I made them drunk with My rage, And I hurled their glory to the ground.” ​ חַֽסְדֵ֨י יְהֹוָ֤ה ׀ אַזְכִּיר֙ תְּהִלֹּ֣ת יְהֹוָ֔ה כְּעַ֕ל כֹּ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־גְּמָלָ֖נוּ יְהֹוָ֑ה וְרַב־טוּב֙ לְבֵ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁר־גְּמָלָ֥ם כְּֽרַחֲמָ֖יו וּכְרֹ֥ב חֲסָדָֽיו׃ I will recount GOD’s kind acts, GOD’s praises— For all that GOD has wrought for us, The vast bounty to the House of Israel That was bestowed upon them According to God’s mercy and great kindness. ​ ' You may think of vinegar as the cooking kind good on fries, but pure vinegar is extremely dangerous. One couldn't even open it in front of the face. I cleaned some mold in my basement with the diluted cleaning kind last summer and it was extremely intense and horrible to breathe around. -to be fair vinegar is produced naturally in a very highly diluted form. However with the steroid epidemic they are at least like cleaning vinegar lol ​ The Artscroll Stone Edition by Rabbi Scherman says that Yaakov was punished in his encounter with Esav for "taking the dog by the ears" instead of doing his best to avoid conflict and not to rely on miracles. ​ -- ​ Apples were originally cultivated from wild crab apples according to historysites.nc.gov and ChatGPT. ChatGPT also says crabapple sized apples could be lethal in a slingshot. In the Appalachian forests one mostly finds crab apples or granny smiths. Therefore this fits with the Song of the Apple in Perek Shira (this version has Tapuach as apricot, also fitting [and other stone fruits like plums] although it is mostly translated as apple): ​ תַּפּוּחַ אוֹמֵר. כְּתַפּוּחַ בַּעֲצֵי הַיַּעַר כֵּן דּוֹדִי בֵּין הַבָּנִים בְּצִלּוֹ חִמַּדְתִּי וְיָשַׁבְתִּי וּפִרְיוֹ מָתוֹק לְחִכִּי: (שיר השירים ב ג) The Apricot is saying, “Like the apricot tree among the trees of the wood, so is my beloved among the sons. I sat down under his shadow with delight, and his fruit was sweet to my taste.” (Rashi: All flee from The Apple as it provides no shade) ​ If two opposing men met in the forest and only had a sling (maybe more powerful -ChatGPT) or a slingshot, the one next to the wild apple tree would win over the one who would have to break a spear. ChatGPT says acorns would not be lethal (we know it is not 100% but it makes sense to me). ​ Therefore we see Apples truly are Almighty in the forest (representing the kings and gods of the nations -Rashi) ​ 1 Samuel 17:40 וַיִּקַּ֨ח מַקְל֜וֹ בְּיָד֗וֹ וַיִּבְחַר־ל֣וֹ חֲמִשָּׁ֣ה חַלֻּקֵֽי־אֲבָנִ֣ים ׀ מִן־הַנַּ֡חַל וַיָּ֣שֶׂם אֹ֠תָ֠ם בִּכְלִ֨י הָרֹעִ֧ים אֲשֶׁר־ל֛וֹ וּבַיַּלְק֖וּט וְקַלְע֣וֹ בְיָד֑וֹ וַיִּגַּ֖שׁ אֶל־הַפְּלִשְׁתִּֽי׃ He took his staff, picked a few smooth stones from the wadi, put them in the pocket of his shepherd’s bag and, sling in hand, he went toward the Philistine. קַלְע֣ The dictionaries actually have this as sling and not slingshot like I thought originally. I forgot these existed This would be wise to have if you are a hiker to take with you in case  mountain lions, bears or boars come across you H'F'. Actually deer kill the most people in the forest. You can get one (not sure about quality) inexpensively for $12 in a few days if you have Amazon prime and every wise person should see the value in getting anything they need in ~2 days for such a low price. Its like an artificial Eliezer for $10 a month instead of looking at people curse you in purgatory that's in purgatory (the streets -Rabbi Avigdor Miller) to get your needs H'F'. Or if you are skilled you can craft one or get an expensive one for more protection. Here is the link ​ Nevertheless the Torah says that for righteous people, HaShem will put the fear of them upon the animals. However we are not supposed to rely on miracles. ​ Therefore all you need is to "sling" your "Apple" at your right (or strong) side as its written Tehillim 121:5 ​ יְהֹוָ֥ה שֹׁמְרֶ֑ךָ יְהֹוָ֥ה צִ֝לְּךָ֗ עַל־יַ֥ד יְמִינֶֽךָ׃ The LORD is your guardian, the LORD is your protection at your right hand. ​ and 21:8-end: ​ כִּֽי־הַ֭מֶּלֶךְ בֹּטֵ֣חַ בַּיהֹוָ֑ה וּבְחֶ֥סֶד עֶ֝לְי֗וֹן בַּל־יִמּֽוֹט׃ For the king trusts in the LORD; Through the faithfulness of the Most High he will not be shaken. ​ תִּמְצָ֣א יָ֭דְךָ לְכׇל־אֹיְבֶ֑יךָ יְ֝מִֽינְךָ֗ תִּמְצָ֥א שֹׂנְאֶֽיךָ׃ Your Hand will find all Your enemies; Your Right Hand finds those who hate You. ​ תְּשִׁיתֵ֤מוֹ ׀ כְּתַנּ֥וּר אֵשׁ֮ לְעֵ֢ת פָּ֫נֶ֥יךָ יְ֭הֹוָה בְּאַפּ֣וֹ יְבַלְּעֵ֑ם וְֽתֹאכְלֵ֥ם אֵֽשׁ׃ You set them ablaze like a furnace when You show Your presence.-a The LORD in anger destroys them; fire consumes them. ​ פִּ֭רְיָמוֹ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ תְּאַבֵּ֑ד וְ֝זַרְעָ֗ם מִבְּנֵ֥י אָדָֽם׃ You wipe their offspring from the earth, their issue from among men. ​ כִּי־נָט֣וּ עָלֶ֣יךָ רָעָ֑ה חָֽשְׁב֥וּ מְ֝זִמָּ֗ה בַּל־יוּכָֽלוּ׃ For they schemed evil against You; they laid plans, but could not succeed. ​ כִּ֭י תְּשִׁיתֵ֣מוֹ שֶׁ֑כֶם בְּ֝מֵֽיתָרֶ֗יךָ תְּכוֹנֵ֥ן עַל־פְּנֵיהֶֽם׃ For You make them turn back-b by Your bows aimed at their face. ​ ר֣וּמָה יְהֹוָ֣ה בְּעֻזֶּ֑ךָ נָשִׁ֥ירָה וּֽ֝נְזַמְּרָ֗ה גְּבוּרָתֶֽךָ׃ {פ} Be exalted, O LORD, through Your strength; we will sing and chant the praises of Your mighty deeds. ​ ' The Zohar says everything depends on the right hand based on Tehillim. If you type "right hand" into Sefaria and filter for Psalms there are 179 results.. Nevertheless when I was in 9th grade Biology class I learned about biomechanical engineering where scientists are able to control animals through electrically manipulating their brains. That was 13 years ago and technology has been growing greater and greater. This is exactly what the wicked are doing to us H'F' and therefore one should still take some protection in nature with vicious beasts. Mace spray is another option since many people can't buy guns. I don't like to stray too far off the paths either. You should still be able to wave your hand especially if 'upset' to make them turn back anyway. Isaiah 19:6 בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא יִהְיֶ֥ה מִצְרַ֖יִם כַּנָּשִׁ֑ים וְחָרַ֣ד ׀ וּפָחַ֗ד מִפְּנֵי֙ תְּנוּפַת֙ יַד־יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֔וֹת אֲשֶׁר־ה֖וּא מֵנִ֥יף עָלָֽיו׃ In that day, the Egyptians shall be like women, trembling and terrified because of the waving of the Hand of HaShem of Hosts that He will wave upon them. ​ **The left hand is called "Yad" (Hand) while the right hand is I think always specified with "Yamin" (Right) or "Yamincha" (His Right). In this case Yad is written so if you are not upset, the left hand may be better to plow with by waving. ​ -- ​ If you live in proximity to a church etc (excluding mosques since they are monotheists) you should face South or East rather than towards Jerusalem if their building is in the way Also I once said strawberries are great to eat for strength as they are called "Tooth" in Hebrew but in recent years more bugs have been found in them so you need to be very careful. You might be able to juice them and not worry about bugs. -- To continue the novelty above about the wild apple being Almighty in the forest due to its 'arching' ability; There is a concept in Torah called the "Caf haKalah", puch of the sling, that when people die and are paying their dues (sin guilts), they have no body and no "house" as in protection from harmful spirits. I think this is what happens when we send the zombies souls flying out of their bodies. You can read about it in "Minchat Yehudah" by Rabbi Yehudah Fetaya ​ 1 Samuel 25:29 וַיָּ֤קׇם אָדָם֙ לִרְדׇפְךָ֔ וּלְבַקֵּ֖שׁ אֶת־נַפְשֶׁ֑ךָ וְֽהָיְתָה֩ נֶ֨פֶשׁ אֲדֹנִ֜י צְרוּרָ֣ה ׀ בִּצְר֣וֹר הַחַיִּ֗ים אֵ֚ת יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ וְאֵ֨ת נֶ֤פֶשׁ אֹיְבֶ֙יךָ֙ יְקַלְּעֶ֔נָּה בְּת֖וֹךְ כַּ֥ף הַקָּֽלַע׃ And if anyone sets out to pursue you and seek your life, the life of my lord will be bound up in the bundle of life in the care of the LORD; but He will fling away the lives of your enemies as from the hollow of a sling. ​ Why is someone compared to an apple, a perfect child of HaShem, being exposed to the "Caf haKalah? ​ The reason is because the apple is not being launched to random exposed wildernesses to be pursued, but is being used as HaShem's Arrow to defeat His enemy, "Goliath". Also it is very likely that the apple will still be perfectly fine to eat, you can still plant the seeds (it has posterity, eternal portion of Heaven), and if you are not a Cohen due to corpse impurity (I think!) you would be able to eat the apple sauce off your enemies' temple and fulfill the verse, yum! (**This was a joke and probably forbidden under the verse "Do not make yourself detestable" unless it was the dead of winter and the only food source) ​ HaShem originally gave the children of Yaakov the land of Israel on condition that they wage war in order to conquer it from the Canaanites. YeshaYaHu 49:2 וַיָּ֤שֶׂם פִּי֙ כְּחֶ֣רֶב חַדָּ֔ה בְּצֵ֥ל יָד֖וֹ הֶחְבִּיאָ֑נִי וַיְשִׂימֵ֙נִי֙ לְחֵ֣ץ בָּר֔וּר בְּאַשְׁפָּת֖וֹ הִסְתִּירָֽנִי׃ He made my mouth like a sharpened blade, He hid me in the shadow of His hand, And He made me like a polished arrow; He concealed me in His quiver. ​ Perek Shirah song of the Sun שֶׁמֶשׁ אוֹמֵר. שֶׁמֶשׁ יָרֵחַ עָמַד זְבֻלָה לְאוֹר חִצֶּיךָ יְהַלֵּכוּ לְנֹגַהּ בְּרַק חֲנִיתֶּךָ: (חבקוק ג יא) The Sun is saying: “The sun, [when covered by] the moon, stood in its abode; to the light of your arrow, they walk/go. To the shining of your glittering spear.” ​ As you can see arrow is written first (given precedence) proving this novelty I was right about non-Cohen Jewish people being able to touch corpses ( this Chabad article is my witness [click]) Therefore if someone attacked you in the forest H'F' and you wanted to use his/her/it's/them's temple as a bowl of applesauce you would fulfill the verse Dvarim 7:16 וְאָכַלְתָּ֣ אֶת־כׇּל־הָֽעַמִּ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ נֹתֵ֣ן לָ֔ךְ לֹא־תָח֥וֹס עֵֽינְךָ֖ עֲלֵיהֶ֑ם וְלֹ֤א תַעֲבֹד֙ אֶת־אֱלֹ֣הֵיהֶ֔ם כִּֽי־מוֹקֵ֥שׁ ה֖וּא לָֽךְ׃ {ס} And you will eat all the peoples that your God יהוה delivers (lit. he gives, 'NTN') to you , your eye shall not pity upon them. And you shall not worship their gods, for that would be a snare to you. ​ It can be novelized as "you will eat every last one (Alef-Taf) of all the peoples (that rise against you) that are actually an illusion and just HaShem commanding them through the Sat-ns. Natan (someone's students and servants are like the branches of a tree), [that is] to you! (as in your job). Don't let your eye pity them and don't serve their idols in your forbidden excessive 'clothes of esav' to protect yourself" ​ --- ​ 23 Adar ​ 1 Samuel 23:22 לְכוּ־נָ֞א הָכִ֣ינוּ ע֗וֹד וּדְע֤וּ וּרְאוּ֙ אֶת־מְקוֹמוֹ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּֽהְיֶ֣ה רַגְל֔וֹ מִ֥י רָאָ֖הוּ שָׁ֑ם כִּ֚י אָמַ֣ר אֵלַ֔י עָר֥וֹם יַעְרִ֖ם הֽוּא׃ Now go, be determined once-again, know and take-note of his place where his foot is [now and] who has seen him there, for they have said to me that he acts-shrewdly, yes, shrewdly. ​ ' This is Shaul HaMelech talking about David HaMelech. At this point Shaul knew David was going to take the kingdom and was pursuing him to kill him as its written in 1 Samuel 19:9-10 וַתְּהִי֩ ר֨וּחַ יְהֹוָ֤ה ׀ רָעָה֙ אֶל־שָׁא֔וּל וְהוּא֙ בְּבֵית֣וֹ יֹשֵׁ֔ב וַחֲנִית֖וֹ בְּיָד֑וֹ וְדָוִ֖ד מְנַגֵּ֥ן בְּיָֽד׃ Then an evil spirit of the LORD came upon Saul while he was sitting in his house with his spear in his hand, and David was playing [the lyre]. וַיְבַקֵּ֨שׁ שָׁא֜וּל לְהַכּ֤וֹת בַּֽחֲנִית֙ בְּדָוִ֣ד וּבַקִּ֔יר וַיִּפְטַר֙ מִפְּנֵ֣י שָׁא֔וּל וַיַּ֥ךְ אֶֽת־הַחֲנִ֖ית בַּקִּ֑יר וְדָוִ֛ד נָ֥ס וַיִּמָּלֵ֖ט בַּלַּ֥יְלָה הֽוּא׃ {פ} Saul tried to pin David to the wall with the spear, but he eluded Saul, so that he drove the spear into the wall. David fled and got away. That night ​ Therefore Shaul was acting as the "Eish Sadeh", master of the field, the dead kingdom of Evil. We can see an insight into how they stalk the righteous and watch what substances we walk on to properly electrocute us H'F' ​ -- It seems the Amazon link was a great benefit and less people knew about it than I thought so here are more useful sites. ​ Ebay.com is like Amazon and more useful for builders/mechanics and a lot of times has free 2 day shipping from the right vendor. Also good for gems ​ Etsy.com is a small business website and good for gemstones and all plants (by far the least expensive fruit trees) ​ Aliexpress.com is good for inexpensive wholesale products if you need a lot of something or you want to buy and sell from them (for example my father did this with vaporizer pens) ​ --- ​ Perek Shira דְּשָׁאִים אוֹמְרִים. יְהִי כְבוֹד יי לְעוֹלָם יִשְׂמַח יי בְּמַעֲשָׂיו: (תהילים קד לא) The Grasses are saying, “May the kavod of YHVH endure forever; may YHVH rejoice in his works.” ​ דֶּשֶׁא (Deshe) m. (b. h.) tender grass, herbage.—Pl. דְּשָׁאִים, דְּשָׁאִין herbs. ​ דַּשָּׁא, (דַּשָׁא, דָּ׳)  (Dasha) m. (= דרשא, Sam. דרשה; דרש, cmp. also דּוּשׁ) entrance, door-way (v. דְּרִיסָה); door. (Jastrow) ​ This teaches that after a person gets "plowed" H'F', the door-way back to life is by drawing inspiration from the lowest level of plants that appear first in a plowed field, the tender herbage who is reminding us that HaShem and His Kindnesses live forever and may we too rejoice in creation forever rather than ever get plowed again H'F'. ​ -- ​ Bereisheit 1:28 וְכִבְשֻׁ֑הָ וּרְד֞וּ בִּדְגַ֤ת הַיָּם֙ וּבְע֣וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וּבְכׇל־חַיָּ֖ה הָֽרֹמֶ֥שֶׂת עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ And dominate and rule over with the fish of the sea and bird of the Heavens and with every living beast creeping (Romeset, like Remez - hinting) upon the Earth. ​ I said a few days ago to plow with a sheep hoof but actually part of ruling over the world is to plow the wicked so as long as you are not extending fingers and are waving your hands naturally (Remember the Mishnah that when a tree is cut if it is greater than a Tefach [a handbreadth, that is 4 fingers] high, it is still considered a tree and if not, a sapling) you should be fine to just wave your hands at someone trying to kill you H'F'. ​ When the "Baal Habayit Lamed Toch HaYad"ed me as in Shabbat 1:1 "The owner of the house extends his hand to the public domain to teach the inside of the hand to Natan, the poor man" he said the front of the hand is called Toch and the back Gav. I originally thought the front would be better to plow with but now I realize Toch is like Mitoch, sweetness, and Gav like Gavir, strength. Therefore it may be best to have a "shadow boxing cardio workout" where you just crush heathen's souls by practicing boxing. Also I believe you can kick since at least my foot is about exactly the same width as my hand and the concept is something that comes after something else has everything before it, like how at the end of a story of Torah you remember and learned from everything that happened before it, and our foot is like our "ending". Also to support this from Mishnah I remember reading years ago there being opinions on something like maybe when a boy is considered a man and one opinion said something about when he has four posts. I couldn't find it by searching but I will try again. ​ Maybe I remembered it wrong but I did find this idea from Ervuvin 4:5 מִי שֶׁיָּשֵׁן בַּדֶּרֶךְ וְלֹא יָדַע שֶׁחֲשֵׁכָה, יֵשׁ לוֹ אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה לְכָל רוּחַ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים, אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר, וְהוּא בְאֶמְצָעָן. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר, לְאֵיזֶה רוּחַ שֶׁיִּרְצֶה יֵלֵךְ. וּמוֹדֶה רַבִּי יְהוּדָה שֶׁאִם בֵּרֵר לוֹ, שֶׁאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לַחֲזֹר בּוֹ: He who fell asleep on the road [towards dusk on the Shabbat-eve], and did not know that it had become dark [night had set in], has [the right to move] two thousand amot in any direction. - so says Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri. The Sages say, "He only has [the right to move within] four amot." Rabbi Eliezer says, "And he is in [forms] the center [of these four amot]." Rabbi Yehuda says, "He can go [four amot] in whichever direction he pleases." But Rabbi Yehuda conceded, that if he [that person] chose [a direction] for himself, he may not [afterwards] go back upon it [and change his mind]. An Amah is an arm length from the elbow to the tip of the middle finger, about 18 inches. Also the leg is similar in length to the arm and some people naturally even have longer arms. (In war or in danger a person can break Shabbat and go any necessary distance) ​ Another face is like a coarse "grassy" person who wakes up to the Truth of Torah and the underworld: מִי שֶׁיָּשֵׁן בַּדֶּרֶךְ וְלֹא יָדַע שֶׁחֲשֵׁכָה "Who that was a lazy idle tooth in the road" (like a sheep. In Jewish communities they say someone who cast off The Yoke is "Off the Derech [road]) probably in college or something like I was. -"And did not know that (there was) darkness" יֵשׁ לוֹ אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה לְכָל רוּחַ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי. There is to him 2000 arm lengths (or bulls) in every direction, the words of Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri. Tehillim 22:13 סְ֭בָבוּנִי פָּרִ֣ים רַבִּ֑ים אַבִּירֵ֖י בָשָׁ֣ן כִּתְּרֽוּנִי׃ Many bulls surround me, mighty ones of Bashan encircle me. ​ Ezekial 39:18 about the final (this) war of Gog and Magog (the 70 nations) בְּשַׂ֤ר גִּבּוֹרִים֙ תֹּאכֵ֔לוּ וְדַם־נְשִׂיאֵ֥י הָאָ֖רֶץ תִּשְׁתּ֑וּ אֵילִ֨ים כָּרִ֤ים וְעַתּוּדִים֙ פָּרִ֔ים מְרִיאֵ֥י בָשָׁ֖ן כֻּלָּֽם׃ You shall eat the flesh of warriors and drink the blood of the princes of the earth: rams, lambs, he-goats, and bulls—fatlings of Bashan all of them. ​ So we see Rabbi Yochanan is warning us about the kingdom of Evil. Alternatively the people around you when you wake up are going to on a relatively better spiritual level since they knew you were a sleeping fish and are extremely rich to afford you. After that people know that you are going to watch them fall on you with witchcraft in their hand and may not do that to you. ​ Or if you see the kingdom of Evil know that HaShem, The Alef, Bull, has thousands of Angels around you protecting you in every direction. ​ וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים, אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר, וְהוּא בְאֶמְצָעָן. "And the sages say there is nothing to him but four armlengths" (him and his branches, Mitzvot/Commandments). "And he is in the middle between two extremes", the good and evil inclinations, the minds of the idolators cleaving to him trying to get him blassy to snuff his existence H'F' and the sweet waters of Torah and fruits of the Sages drawing him close to eternal life. **Maybe it would be a good idea to sit on the ground (to electrically ground yourself and use your four limbs to push away the zombies in all 4 directions lol) ​ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר, לְאֵיזֶה רוּחַ שֶׁיִּרְצֶה יֵלֵךְ. וּמוֹדֶה רַבִּי יְהוּדָה שֶׁאִם בֵּרֵר לוֹ, שֶׁאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לַחֲזֹר בּוֹ: "Rabbi Yehudah says, To whose direction he desires, he will walk" (Remember that the Sefirah of Keter-Crown is desire, will, or pleasure) If he thinks sharing cakes with Pharoah and birds will be better for him than infinite eternal unimaginable bliss, he will go to the evil inclination and soon cease to be. "And Rabbi Yehudah admits, that if he chose a place for himself (the good or evil side) that he will not be able to go back upon it." As the Proverb says, "Neither do they return to the paths of life" Rashi: It is extremely hard for the wicked to repent after succumbing. Therefore almost virtually everyone who has fallen to the other side is very likely no longer existent. ​ That is why the final Tzadi ץ represents a Baal Teshuvah, owner of repentance, and has the highest Gematria (numerical value) of 900 representing the heaviest letter. As the Sages in the Gemara say, someone who was constantly righteous cannot sit in the place of a Baal Teshuvah. ​ -- ​ When a person throws a hook, it's always with the weak hand that should be closer to the opponent since your strong hand and foot should be back. One does not extend their elbow, keep the elbow at a 90 degree (right) angle the whole time, turning the heel about 90 degrees outwards in a circular motion when one throws, and again from the shoulder muscles not the arm or hand muscles. Also for a hook I was taught to keep the palm towards the ground (some trees grow out of cliffs like the fig I ate on the night on the Tzfat cliff) Again aiming like my high school friend's father taught me, right below the ear (where the head connects to the neck), is the most effective rather than trying to identify who they are and if they have a weak head or neck. ​ If you are interested in my boxing coach's name it was Johnathan Robertson and his disciple Tommy Wilt (My perfection has wilted or My perfection is to wilt [and/or wilt others lol]) Isaiah 64:5 וַנָּ֤בֶל כֶּֽעָלֶה֙ כֻּלָּ֔נוּ וַעֲוֺנֵ֖נוּ כָּר֥וּחַ יִשָּׂאֻֽנוּ And all of us grow vile like a leaf, and our transgressions, like wind, carry us off. ​ 6:13 וְהָיְתָ֣ה לְבָעֵ֑ר כָּאֵלָ֣ה וְכָאַלּ֗וֹן אֲשֶׁ֤ר בְּשַׁלֶּ֙כֶת֙ מַצֶּ֣בֶת בָּ֔ם זֶ֥רַע קֹ֖דֶשׁ מַצַּבְתָּֽהּ And it will be, [the remainder of Tzion] will be consumed like an oak or terebinth that when it is felled the pillar remains in it. (Rashi: Like how they wither their leaves in the winter) ​ Even quicker is this method: Bereisheit 3:15 וְאֵיבָ֣ה ׀ אָשִׁ֗ית בֵּֽינְךָ֙ וּבֵ֣ין הָֽאִשָּׁ֔ה וּבֵ֥ין זַרְעֲךָ֖ וּבֵ֣ין זַרְעָ֑הּ ה֚וּא יְשׁוּפְךָ֣ רֹ֔אשׁ וְאַתָּ֖ה תְּשׁוּפֶ֥נּוּ עָקֵֽב׃ {ס} and I will put enmity between thee [the snake] and the woman, and between thy seed and her seed; he shall pound thy head, and thou shalt bruise his heel. ​ Since they are all being controlled by "the snake" you may be able to just stomp at their heads, if not the same method of right below the ear for everyone like a football or futbol (airhead pigskin) kickoff ​ ***If you are a fragile elderly woman and did not like the crab applesauce joke you may want to skip to the next fig leaves (asterisks) ​ I realized since we have learned that the Gemara says anointing is like drinking and the Vilna Gaon says this is a Torah concept not Rabbinic, if you were doing your Hitbonenut (nature meditation) like Rebbe Nachman recommends every day, and a heathen wizard tried your hand and you hooked him below the ear like I taught a few times you would likely get his blood on your hand at least and "eat your enemy" ​ *** ​ Habbakuk 3:4 וְנֹ֙גַהּ֙ כָּא֣וֹר תִּֽהְיֶ֔ה קַרְנַ֥יִם מִיָּד֖וֹ ל֑וֹ וְשָׁ֖ם חֶבְי֥וֹן עֻזֹּֽה׃ And a brightness like light there is [lit. will be] horns from His Hand (left hand, the Sat-n [meaning To Oppose]) for Him; And there is the concealment of Her (but vowelized His, the soul of the body [that is the letter]) Force. (Since the Angels including the Sat-ns are like Mothers to us for HaShem) ​ This teaches that someone's wisdom, their light, of how strong they are in combat and how many "branches", people that will back them up as servants is hidden from the eye. When I wrestled in high school (this is forbidden to be in a singlet in front of women and may be forbidden since the crotch gets touched accidentally which causes erections, even if it's later on. It would be good to learn grappling basics to protect yourself and family/future family from the wicked though. Like Yaakov had his fight with the Sat-n when he was left alone, everyone will likely have to go through such an episode) it was common that some of the stronger people would lose to the less impressive looking people if he knew what he was doing, as in the physics and dynamics of how to grapple somebody. ​ -- Adar 24 ​ Although I once reposted an opinion on Facebook that one should not let their dog(s) into the house since an evil spirit named Celev rests on one who plays with a dog that makes him lax in fear of HaShem and Torah study H'F', after my father let me borrow his golden retriever, I think they are extremely priceless to have near you at all times (just don't play games/wrestle with them). It is like having a hardened navy SEAL or green beret be your personal body guard 24/7 (anyone who thinks goldens would be 'easy prey' to battle since they are very loving according to the internet is extremely mistaken, they are much tougher than 99.9% of people) and it is socially acceptable for them to act/"bark" obnoxiously to scare heathen away in purgatory x2 (the streets) or from our doors. If you are always alone like me it is also an amazing companion and if a heathen hijacks her you can wave/curse them away immediately and after a few times they stop doing it often. ​ --- ​ The Roosters' 6th call: בְּקוֹל שִׁישִּׁי אוֹמֵר. אַל תֶּאֱהַב שֵׁנָה פֶּן תִּוָּרֵשׁ פְּקַח עֵינֶיךָ שְׂבַע לָחֶם: (משלי כ יג) In its sixth call, it is saying, “Do not love sleep, lest you come to poverty; open your eyes, and you shall be satisfied with bread.” ​ Instead see the face that it is telling us in these times to invest in some books of Torah for Shabbat ​ "Do not love teeth (see shaynim [teeth] instead of shayna [sleep], like how the male member is like a 'horn' or 'tooth' that we 'eat' our wives with and how the Sages compare studying Torah to your betrothed maiden [hopefully]. When learning on a laptop or electronic device it is much brighter, stronger, than looking at [especially old yellowed] paper) Lest you get plowed (breaking Shabbat to open your laptop to enjoy Waters of Wisdom much more easily from the "stronger Torah" online. The word Mishnah [the Oral Torah] has the same root for sleep and it is much easier to dream in the world of Understanding online than finding related concepts in books). (Physically) open your Wellspring (your Torah library) (during the) Shabbat War Bread - while you are struggling with the Shabbat Melachot/Forbidden labors, open up a physical book of Torah and soothe yourself. ​ **Make sure to invest in at least a few books of Torah for this. It is forbidden to charge more than the cost to print Hebrew books (not English translations). If you can't afford then you need to start writing down notes or printing pages from here and Sefaria, Chabad, etc for Shabbat. ​ I was able to get to the level of Understanding because I acquired a lot of "Earth, dirt" by first reading the whole Tanakh in English and Halachot I need to get a general idea of things, then returning to study in depth the interesting/questionable parts I remembered. Shabbat is a great day to expand the boundaries of your "field" since most of the time concepts of Understanding, related to Heaven, are posted here. ​ For example it is a Halacha that every man has to write a personal Torah and according to this Chabad article Rambam says its the whole Torah. Another reason for this Mitzvah is that it strengthens our right hands, or enrichens our scribes (that is not a high income profession). It is important to consult a knowledgeable fish (Torah scholar) in Rambam before starting or at least read and review Hilchot Sefer Torah as there are details to be aware of. Here is chapter 7 and the link to it (click) 7:1 ​ מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה עַל כָּל אִישׁ וְאִישׁ מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל לִכְתֹּב סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה לְעַצְמוֹ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר (דברים לא יט) ״וְעַתָּה כִּתְבוּ לָכֶם אֶת הַשִּׁירָה״. כְּלוֹמַר כִּתְבוּ לָכֶם תּוֹרָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ שִׁירָה זוֹ, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין כּוֹתְבִין אֶת הַתּוֹרָה פָּרָשִׁיּוֹת פָּרָשִׁיּוֹת. וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהִנִּיחוּ לוֹ אֲבוֹתָיו סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה מִצְוָה לִכְתֹּב מִשֶּׁלּוֹ. ואִם כְּתָבוֹ בְּיָדוֹ הֲרֵי הוּא כְּאִלּוּ קִבְּלָהּ מֵהַר סִינַי. וְאִם אֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ לִכְתֹּב אֲחֵרִים כּוֹתְבִין לוֹ. וְכָל הַמַּגִּיהַּ סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה וַאֲפִלּוּ אוֹת אַחַת הֲרֵי הוּא כְּאִלּוּ כְּתָבוֹ כֻּלּוֹ: ​ It is a positive commandment for each and every Jewish man to write a Torah scroll for himself, as [implied by the commandment (Deuteronomy 31:19)]: "And now, write down this song for yourselves," i.e., write down the [entire] Torah which contains this song. [The basis for this interpretation is] that the Torah should not be written passage by passage. Even if a person's ancestors left him a Torah scroll, it is a mitzvah to write one himself. If a person writes the scroll by hand, it is considered as if he received it on Mount Sinai. If he does not know how to write himself, [he should have] others write it for him. Anyone who checks even a single letter of a Torah scroll is considered as if he wrote the entire scroll. ​ Forget those who disagree with our Fish (Rambam) and obligate women in this (at least for now before the Sanhedrin) ​ --- ​ Crickets have been chirping "heathen little", like 'chicken little' at me since I didn't know the rules of heathen forest warfare. Doesn't having rules defeat the purpose? Apparently its either forbidden to sling crab apples or people just bring actual bow and arrows. Therefore this proves the novelty that if someone is an "Apple shade dweller" as in accepts the yoke of Torah instead of a Sat-nic "shade tree dweller", he could just bring a gun like a hunter and Shimshon the people with "The Rock [lead bullets]" (Like how Shimshon [Samson] and some other remarkable people like one of David HaMelech's brothers were able to slay multitudes of people on their own). Judges 15:13-17 וַיֹּ֧אמְרוּ ל֣וֹ לֵאמֹ֗ר לֹ֚א כִּֽי־אָסֹ֤ר נֶאֱסׇרְךָ֙ וּנְתַנּ֣וּךָ בְיָדָ֔ם וְהָמֵ֖ת לֹ֣א נְמִיתֶ֑ךָ וַיַּאַסְרֻ֗הוּ בִּשְׁנַ֙יִם֙ עֲבֹתִ֣ים חֲדָשִׁ֔ים וַֽיַּעֲל֖וּהוּ מִן־הַסָּֽלַע׃ “We won’t,” they replied. “We will only take you prisoner and hand you over to them; we will not slay you.” So they bound him with two new ropes and brought him up from the rock. הוּא־בָ֣א עַד־לֶ֔חִי וּפְלִשְׁתִּ֖ים הֵרִ֣יעוּ לִקְרָאת֑וֹ וַתִּצְלַ֨ח עָלָ֜יו ר֣וּחַ יְהֹוָ֗ה וַתִּהְיֶ֨ינָה הָעֲבֹתִ֜ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־זְרוֹעוֹתָ֗יו כַּפִּשְׁתִּים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בָּעֲר֣וּ בָאֵ֔שׁ וַיִּמַּ֥סּוּ אֱסוּרָ֖יו מֵעַ֥ל יָדָֽיו׃ When he reached Lehi, the Philistines came shouting to meet him. Thereupon the spirit of GOD gripped him, and the ropes on his arms became like flax that catches fire; the bonds melted off his hands. וַיִּמְצָ֥א לְחִי־חֲמ֖וֹר טְרִיָּ֑ה וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח יָדוֹ֙ וַיִּקָּחֶ֔הָ וַיַּךְ־בָּ֖הּ אֶ֥לֶף אִֽישׁ׃ He came upon a fresh jawbone of a donkey and he picked it up; and with it he killed a thousand men. וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שִׁמְשׁ֔וֹן בִּלְחִ֣י הַחֲמ֔וֹר חֲמ֖וֹר חֲמֹרָתָ֑יִם בִּלְחִ֣י הַחֲמ֔וֹר הִכֵּ֖יתִי אֶ֥לֶף אִֽישׁ׃ Then Samson said: “With the jaw of an ass, Mass upon mass! With the jaw of an ass I have slain a thousand men.” ***(With the jaw of your donkey, [the mouth of your clay body], you can slay any Eish [man with intentional sins even if he possesses his flesh] that rises against you, and even make a massive [same root, even vowels here in Hebrew as donkey] pile of donkey carcasses) וַֽיְהִי֙ כְּכַלֹּת֣וֹ לְדַבֵּ֔ר וַיַּשְׁלֵ֥ךְ הַלְּחִ֖י מִיָּד֑וֹ וַיִּקְרָ֛א לַמָּק֥וֹם הַה֖וּא רָ֥מַת לֶֽחִי׃ As he finished speaking, he threw the jawbone away; hence that place was called Ramath-lehi. *Ramath-lechi I.e., “Jawbone Heights.” ' וַיִּמְצָ֥א לְחִי־חֲמ֖וֹר טְרִיָּ֑ה וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח יָדוֹ֙ וַיִּקָּחֶ֔הָ וַיַּךְ־בָּ֖הּ אֶ֥לֶף אִֽישׁ׃ He came upon a fresh jawbone of a donkey and he picked it up; and with it he killed a thousand men. ' This verse makes me wonder about the parable of "catching pokemon" and the reason I still am alone H'F'. There is a Halacha that when a person comes across a birds nest, he or she has to send the mother bird off before taking the eggs, like beating the Sat-n or chief wizard away and taking the Enosh or Gibor (smaller men) that still fear HaShem as your student/servant. When I have been in religious communities and experimented breaking, "squeezing" eggs with my hand, they say "that's how you do it". Nevertheless this is how alon anava may the name of the wicked rot pushed me off a cliff at sunset and fulfilled the verse about the sun setting and a great dark drunken terror falling upon Avraham. As I was fleeing into the forest I felt him calling me asking for mercy and for me to "take" him and I decided to. ​ YeshaYaHu/Isaiah 59:5 בֵּיצֵ֤י צִפְעוֹנִי֙ בִּקֵּ֔עוּ וְקוּרֵ֥י עַכָּבִ֖ישׁ יֶאֱרֹ֑גוּ הָאֹכֵ֤ל מִבֵּֽיצֵיהֶם֙ יָמ֔וּת וְהַזּוּרֶ֖ה תִּבָּקַ֥ע אֶפְעֶֽה׃ They hatch adder’s eggs And weave spider webs; Whoever eats of those eggs will die, And if one is crushed, it hatches out a viper. ​ Tehillim Hallel "Indeed He saves my soul from death! My foot from faltering, my eyes from tears!" Although I may have been bitter soaked from drinking the cliff water sleeping after front flipping off of it and almost dying in the mountains in the winter had HaShem not responded and saved me B'H'. Although after the first nap the moon and stars were bright and I should've just walked back up. ​ Anyway the point is if you see a "strong donkey" you want to try this on, be extremely extremely careful he is not a snake that will kill you H'F' especially considering this verse. Maybe much better that if you are like me and never was formally taught this to not attempt such a thing but if you are a more knowledgeable person I think the best way to do it is to lightly squeeze with either hand after purifying him by pushing lightly and pulling close strong (ideally with a vessel like a staff or a book of Torah) until there are no more "bites", or "teeth" (he/she submits to you). ​ -- ​ As for the "clothes of Esav", there are 3 sins that one cannot transgress and need to submit to death, or if they plan on making you into a "wooden dildo", you should "Shaul HaMelech" yourself, as in maybe move to liberal Canada and Euthanize yourself rather than be a public blasphemy to the entire underworld. This is idolatry/blasphemy, sexual sins like incest, homosexuality, adultery, and beastiality, and bloodshed/murder. Other than this it is only in the presence of 10 Jews (remember idol worshippers are judged as gentiles), then one should consider "moving to Canada" rather than be forced to transgress any sin.
