HaShem does it. ​ Let's just say my carobs are too gnarly on this matter to feed anybody.. ​ Mishnah Maasarot 3:4 וְהֶחָרוּבִין, עַד שֶׁלֹּא כְנָסָן לְרֹאשׁ הַגַּג, מוֹרִיד מֵהֶם לִבְהֵמָה, פָּטוּר, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא מַחֲזִיר אֶת הַמּוֹתָר: With carobs, if they had not yet been on the top of the roof, he may take some down for his animals and be exempt [from tithe] since he returns that which is left over (the Mussar, Ethics). Repenting boars (Charuvin, carobs is plural combination of Chazir, meaning both pig and to return, and Eruv, as in the Shabbat city 'bor'der), as long as they did not try to kill Natan/Nasan at the top of the roof, or to the Rosh HaGog (head of the idolatrous nations), he may bring them down for his beasts (friends/students that are not on the level of Adam) and be exempt from tithing (paying with his flesh, it is Kosher) because he makes the remaining boars repent. -- If a witch-wizard were to try your hand to take your soul H'F' and realized you were strong from the "Lechem Mah (Milchamah)" - the Bread of What? (HaShem, Torah), and that they are a pig caught in a cage like Yaakov had Esav to get the birthright, a better catch phrase before cursing them to cease to be and sending their soul in the pouch of the sling than the famous evil "any last words" or a US elementary teacher's "what do you have to say for yourself" so that you don't have to hear mein kampf or another blassy complaint is YirmiYah 3:5 כֹּ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה מַה־מָּצְא֨וּ אֲבוֹתֵיכֶ֥ם בִּי֙ עָ֔וֶל כִּ֥י רָחֲק֖וּ מֵעָלָ֑י וַיֵּ֥לְכ֛וּ אַחֲרֵ֥י הַהֶ֖בֶל וַיֶּהְבָּֽלוּ׃ Thus said GOD: What wrong did your fathers (or you) find in Me That they abandoned Me And went after delusion and were deluded? ​ It seems the answers are that everyone is a boar so they also became one. A light, dusty, headless, eternally lifeless answer as like Moshe says Deut 32:29 ל֥וּ חָכְמ֖וּ יַשְׂכִּ֣ילוּ זֹ֑את יָבִ֖ינוּ לְאַחֲרִיתָֽם׃ O that they were wise, that they contemplate this, that they would consider their latter end! ​ This world is compared to one night (Rashi on one of Moshe's Psalms) and they traded their existence to break the Mitzvah about not following after a multitude to evil and became a field ravaging soul snuffing sick boar rather than toughed it out for one night and enjoyed eternal unimaginable bliss. ​ In the words of our Rooster, "Open up your eye, your wellspring of Torah, and be sated with food!" [or die forever] ​ --- ​ I forgot to mention that another benefit of having dogs (and other pets) is that you can touch or hold them to combine your electrical torments (animals are also electrically conductive despite all the fur) since like how the West is compared to a pig that has pure parts and impure parts, many Western vinegar torturers have compassion on animals (although they would point their finger at you in a second to end your existence H'F'). For example there is a large vegan movement. On Shabbat one should not stroke them to not knock their hairs out but just lightly touch or hold them to relieve yourself. ​ --- ​ When I was in Yeshivat Dvar YiruShalayim, one of my roommates, Asher, was very studious and upright. He told me that anything that you don't remember is liable to get "treacherous winged" as in stolen or changed. Another thing he did when a child came into our room was give him a toy army soldier. It may be wise to place these in your windows (without one of the facial organs like ears and also to be sure scratch the eyes out) as decorations and warnings that you will fight back to intruders to deter heathen crickets from eating you while still enjoying the beautiful skies and nature in the way of Mishnah Shabbat 1:1 above. ​ The Arizal says one should have many windows in ones house so he can see the world and praise HaShem. ​ Another idea - the bear is the strongest natural predator to the boar of the forest (Esav the West) and almost all of them are spiritually fat heathen who may relent of their ravaging attempt if you have bear statues displayed. Also crows, robins, sparrows and other birds that eat the field cricket for the alphabet people who are not boarish klansmen 2 Kings 3:22-end וַיֵּרָפ֣וּ הַמַּ֔יִם עַ֖ד הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה כִּדְבַ֥ר אֱלִישָׁ֖ע אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבֵּֽר׃ {פ} The water has remained wholesome to this day, in accordance with the word spoken by Elisha. ​ וַיַּ֥עַל מִשָּׁ֖ם בֵּֽית־אֵ֑ל וְה֣וּא ׀ עֹלֶ֣ה בַדֶּ֗רֶךְ וּנְעָרִ֤ים קְטַנִּים֙ יָצְא֣וּ מִן־הָעִ֔יר וַיִּתְקַלְּסוּ־בוֹ֙ וַיֹּ֣אמְרוּ ל֔וֹ עֲלֵ֥ה קֵרֵ֖חַ עֲלֵ֥ה קֵרֵֽחַ׃ ​ From there he went up to Bethel. As he was going up the road, some little boys came out of the town and jeered at him, saying, “Go away, baldhead! Go away, baldhead!” ​ וַיִּ֤פֶן אַֽחֲרָיו֙ וַיִּרְאֵ֔ם וַֽיְקַלְלֵ֖ם בְּשֵׁ֣ם יְהֹוָ֑ה וַתֵּצֶ֜אנָה שְׁתַּ֤יִם דֻּבִּים֙ מִן־הַיַּ֔עַר וַתְּבַקַּ֣עְנָה מֵהֶ֔ם אַרְבָּעִ֥ים וּשְׁנֵ֖י יְלָדִֽים׃ He turned around and looked at them and cursed them in the name of GOD. Thereupon, two she-bears came out of the woods and mangled forty-two of the children. ​ וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ מִשָּׁ֖ם אֶל־הַ֣ר הַכַּרְמֶ֑ל וּמִשָּׁ֖ם שָׁ֥ב שֹׁמְרֽוֹן׃ {פ} He went on from there to Mount Carmel, and from there he returned to Samaria. ​ Since before AyliYaHu ascended to Heaven there was both him and Aylisha (meaning G-d is Salvation), Aylisha was given a double portion of AyliYaHu's spirit. I have heard I think in the Gemara or from a Chabad Rabbi that the reason he did this was because he saw through his prophetic spirit that they had no "juice" in them, as in no merit in their future. Nevertheless he was punished and had to go to Gehinnom (Purgatory). Don't worry about the curse from YeshaYaHu 65 because Aylisha was an accepted and respected Navi/Prophet in the Kingdom of Israel when there were purification waters and his life was not on the line from 42 children to invoke the Name of HaShem in a curse. (Tazers were not commonplace) Maybe we can also learn from this if you look at the person before cursing him/her in your moment of anger, your evil eye increases the power of the curse. ​ A proof of this is that the Gemara says when Rabbi Shimon Bar Yochai came out of the cave he was hiding in from the Roman government with his son learning the Wisdom of the Zohar, at first everyone he looked at he would evil eye for their sins and they would immediately burst into flames. I will get the source ​ Shabbat 33b Rabbi Shimon bar Yoḥai and his son, Rabbi Elazar, went and hid in the study hall. Every day Rabbi Shimon’s wife would bring them bread and a jug of water and they would eat. When the decree intensified, Rabbi Shimon said to his son: Women are easily impressionable and, therefore, there is room for concern lest the authorities torture her and she reveal our whereabouts. They went and they hid in a cave. A miracle occurred and a carob tree was created for them as well as a spring of water. They would remove their clothes and sit covered in sand up to their necks. They would study Torah all day in that manner. At the time of prayer, they would dress, cover themselves, and pray, and they would again remove their clothes afterward so that they would not become tattered. They sat in the cave for twelve years. Elijah the Prophet came and stood at the entrance to the cave and said: Who will inform bar Yoḥai that the emperor died and his decree has been abrogated? They emerged from the cave, and saw people who were plowing and sowing. Rabbi Shimon bar Yoḥai said: These people abandon eternal life of Torah study and engage in temporal life for their own sustenance. The Gemara relates that every place that Rabbi Shimon and his son Rabbi Elazar directed their eyes was immediately burned. **The Aramaic used here is Saraf that can also mean consume A Divine Voice emerged and said to them: Did you emerge from the cave in order to destroy My world? Return to your cave. They again went and sat there for twelve months. They said: The judgment of the wicked in Gehenna lasts for twelve months. Surely their sin was atoned in that time. A Divine Voice emerged and said to them: Emerge from your cave. They emerged. Everywhere that Rabbi Elazar would strike, Rabbi Shimon would heal. Rabbi Shimon said to Rabbi Elazar: My son, you and I suffice for the entire world, as the two of us are engaged in the proper study of Torah. As the sun was setting on Shabbat eve, they saw an elderly man who was holding two bundles of myrtle branches and running at twilight. They said to him: Why do you have these? He said to them: In honor of Shabbat. They said to him: And let one suffice. He answered them: One is corresponding to: “Remember the Shabbat day, to keep it holy” (Exodus 20:8), and one is corresponding to: “Observe the Shabbat day, to keep it holy” (Deuteronomy 5:12). Rabbi Shimon said to his son: See how beloved the mitzvot are to Israel. Their minds were put at ease and they were no longer as upset that people were not engaged in Torah study. Rabbi Pineḥas ben Ya’ir, Rabbi Shimon’s son-in-law, heard and went out to greet him. He brought him into the bathhouse and began tending to his flesh. He saw that Rabbi Shimon had cracks in the skin on his body. He was crying, and the tears fell from his eyes and caused Rabbi Shimon pain. Rabbi Pineḥas said to Rabbi Shimon, his father-in-law: Woe is me, that I have seen you like this. Rabbi Shimon said to him: Happy are you that you have seen me like this, as had you not seen me like this, you would not have found in me this prominence in Torah, as the Gemara relates: At first, when Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai would raise a difficulty, Rabbi Pineḥas ben Ya’ir would respond to his question with twelve answers. Ultimately, when Rabbi Pineḥas ben Ya’ir would raise a difficulty, Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai would respond with twenty-four answers. Rabbi Shimon said: Since a miracle transpired for me, I will go and repair something for the sake of others in gratitude for God’s kindness, as it is written: “And Jacob came whole to the city of Shechem, which is in the land of Canaan, when he came from Paddan-aram; and he graced the countenance of the city” (Genesis 33:18). Rav said, the meaning of: And Jacob came whole, is: Whole in his body, whole in his money, whole in his Torah. And what did he do? And he graced the countenance of the city; he performed gracious acts to benefit the city. Rav said: Jacob established a currency for them. And Shmuel said: He established marketplaces for them. And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: He established bathhouses for them. In any event, clearly one for whom a miracle transpires should perform an act of kindness for his neighbors as a sign of gratitude. He said: Is there something that needs repair? (it continues at 34a) Zechariah 9:15-17 יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָאוֹת֮ יָגֵ֣ן עֲלֵיהֶם֒ וְאָכְל֗וּ וְכָֽבְשׁוּ֙ אַבְנֵי־קֶ֔לַע וְשָׁת֥וּ הָמ֖וּ כְּמוֹ־יָ֑יִן וּמָֽלְאוּ֙ כַּמִּזְרָ֔ק כְּזָוִיּ֖וֹת מִזְבֵּֽחַ׃ GOD of Hosts will protect them With slingstones that eat and conquer; They shall drink, shall rage as with wine, And be filled [with it] like a dashing bowl, Like the corners of an altar. ​ וְֽהוֹשִׁיעָ֞ם יְהֹוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֛ם בַּיּ֥וֹם הַה֖וּא כְּצֹ֣אן עַמּ֑וֹ כִּ֚י אַבְנֵי־נֵ֔זֶר מִֽתְנוֹסְס֖וֹת עַל־אַדְמָתֽוֹ׃ The ETERNAL their God shall make them prosper On that day, [Pasturing] this covenanted people like sheep. [They shall be] like crown jewels glittering on God’s soil. ​ כִּ֥י מַה־טּוּב֖וֹ וּמַה־יׇּפְי֑וֹ דָּגָן֙ בַּחוּרִ֔ים וְתִיר֖וֹשׁ יְנוֹבֵ֥ב בְּתֻלֽוֹת׃ How lovely, how beautiful they shall be, Producing young men like new grain, New wine making fruitful virgins! ​ 11 15:17 - apply this to the wicked one on the mountain in Tzfat ​ וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלָ֑י ע֣וֹד קַח־לְךָ֔ כְּלִ֖י רֹעֶ֥ה אֱוִלִֽי׃ GOD said to me further: Get yourself the gear of a foolish shepherd. ​ כִּ֣י הִנֵּֽה־אָנֹכִי֩ מֵקִ֨ים רֹעֶ֜ה בָּאָ֗רֶץ הַנִּכְחָד֤וֹת לֹֽא־יִפְקֹד֙ הַנַּ֣עַר לֹֽא־יְבַקֵּ֔שׁ וְהַנִּשְׁבֶּ֖רֶת לֹ֣א יְרַפֵּ֑א הַנִּצָּבָה֙ לֹ֣א יְכַלְכֵּ֔ל וּבְשַׂ֤ר הַבְּרִיאָה֙ יֹאכַ֔ל וּפַרְסֵיהֶ֖ן יְפָרֵֽק׃ For I am going to raise up in the land a shepherd who will neither miss the lost [sheep], nor seek the strayed, nor heal the injured, nor sustain the frail, but will feast on the flesh of the fat ones and tear off their hoofs. ​ ה֣וֹי רֹעִ֤י הָאֱלִיל֙ עֹזְבִ֣י הַצֹּ֔אן חֶ֥רֶב עַל־זְרוֹע֖וֹ וְעַל־עֵ֣ין יְמִינ֑וֹ זְרֹעוֹ֙ יָב֣וֹשׁ תִּיבָ֔שׁ וְעֵ֥ין יְמִינ֖וֹ כָּהֹ֥ה תִכְהֶֽה׃ {פ} Oh, the worthless shepherd Who abandons the flock! Let a sword descend upon his arm And upon his right eye! His arm shall shrivel up; His right eye shall go blind. ​ 9:9-11 - see that this is me גִּילִ֨י מְאֹ֜ד בַּת־צִיּ֗וֹן הָרִ֙יעִי֙ בַּ֣ת יְרוּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם הִנֵּ֤ה מַלְכֵּךְ֙ יָ֣בוֹא לָ֔ךְ צַדִּ֥יק וְנוֹשָׁ֖ע ה֑וּא עָנִי֙ וְרֹכֵ֣ב עַל־חֲמ֔וֹר וְעַל־עַ֖יִר בֶּן־אֲתֹנֽוֹת׃ Rejoice greatly, Fair Zion; Raise a shout, Fair Jerusalem! Lo, your king is coming to you. He is victorious, triumphant, Yet humble, riding on a donkey, On a jackass foaled by a jenny. וְהִכְרַתִּי־רֶ֣כֶב מֵאֶפְרַ֗יִם וְסוּס֙ מִיר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם וְנִכְרְתָה֙ קֶ֣שֶׁת מִלְחָמָ֔ה וְדִבֶּ֥ר שָׁל֖וֹם לַגּוֹיִ֑ם וּמׇשְׁלוֹ֙ מִיָּ֣ם עַד־יָ֔ם וּמִנָּהָ֖ר עַד־אַפְסֵי־אָֽרֶץ׃ He shall banish chariots from Ephraim And horses from Jerusalem; The warrior’s bow shall be banished. He shall speak peace to the nations (to surrender), And his rule shall extend from sea to sea And from ocean to land’s end. גַּם־אַ֣תְּ בְּדַם־בְּרִיתֵ֗ךְ שִׁלַּ֤חְתִּי אֲסִירַ֙יִךְ֙ מִבּ֔וֹר אֵ֥ין מַ֖יִם בּֽוֹ׃ You, for your part, have released Your prisoners from the dry pit, For the sake of the blood of your covenant, ​ -- ​​ Adar 25 ​ As we have learned a man on the level of Adam is compared to a tree and Eish is compared to a branch. When a deer has "spikes" as in small antlers, I heard from a Laban Chaveir that this can actually sometimes be more deadly when deer fight than a full rack. This makes sense since there are more end points on the full rack, surface area to distribute the force (like how pushing someone with your hand doesn't hurt as much as poking with a finger or two). I found a spike in the forest last week and it could easily rip flesh to shreds especially on a large beast like a deer. Shemot/Exodus "The Lord is an Eish (master) of war, The Lord is His Name" It seems some people were interested so here is how I found it: ​ ​ Bereishet 27:39 וַיַּ֛עַן יִצְחָ֥ק אָבִ֖יו וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֑יו הִנֵּ֞ה מִשְׁמַנֵּ֤י הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה מֽוֹשָׁבֶ֔ךָ וּמִטַּ֥ל הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם מֵעָֽל׃ Then Yitzhak his father answered, saying to him [Esav]: Here, from the fat of the earth must be your dwelling-place, from the dew of the heavens above. ​ The spikes fit perfectly between my fingers to act as a puncturing weapon where as if I had found a rack I don't know if I would even use it in such a circumstance ​ -- ​ For our boxing/self defense lessons, truly I only boxed for a few months before an older man broke my nose and (after it breaks a good time once its very easy to break again) I had to retire before losing too many brain cells Thank G-d. Anyway my coaches were always saying I didn't have enough head movement, as in not bobbing and weaving enough to defend myself. I found that if you start by moving your hands around, "bobbing and weaving" them, it makes your actual bobbing and weaving much smoother. Remember that body shots, especially under the arms/kidneys, hurt much worse than most face shots unless you can land the rare nose shot. In the words of coach John Robertson, "you can eat face shots but body shots break people down." Therefore make sure any time you get close to strike your elbows are tucked in and forearms up, slightly inverted, protecting both your face and body (not too close) ​ -- ​ Hosea 14:9 וַאֲשׁוּרֶ֗נּוּ אֲנִי֙ כִּבְר֣וֹשׁ רַעֲנָ֔ן מִמֶּ֖נִּי פֶּרְיְךָ֥ נִמְצָֽא "And We will observe that I Am like a Leafy Cypress. From Me, your fruit is found." ​ If a man feels "overwatered" and doesn't have the strength for Torah and there is no other pressing Mitzvah, then instead of succumbing to old dusty habits, he should draw inspiration from the tree that also has leaves to cool us off and fruit to enjoy. According to the Lubavitcher Rebbe, roots correspond to faith (Pirkei Avot: deeds), the trunk is Torah study, branches Mitzvot (Avot: Wisdom), leaves expressions of Torah values, and fruit is our interactions with family and society, the ultimate fulfillment. ​ Therefore maybe go on a hike for exercise, plant a garden or some indoor bonsai fruit trees to improve your air quality, if you still have to make money then business tasks, learn a new recipe or how chefs make their foods tastier, or do Kiruv (bringing close) to your family or community, or teach your children a skill or way to make money etc. The Gemara says a man is obligated to teach his son a trade/skill for money and find him a wife. -- If you are laughing at my 4 and 20 high school wrestling record and therefore not taking this advice seriously, here are my excuses. The Jr. high wrestling coach was a heavy weight who didn't know technique so my first 3 years were using very simple moves, mainly the "cement job" and I had a decent winning record in 9th grade. For example if you have some knowledge, I didn't even know how to properly shoot a single leg until high school. In 10th I beat all of the upperclassmen in wrestle-offs and PinaShalomYah (Pennsylvania) is for some reason the #1 state for wrestling difficulty. Also this was after I broke my nose in the previous summer so I had to wear a thick mask that was hard to breathe in and I would often just give up since I didn't care enough to torture myself trying to breathe through a battle that was actually a meaningless sport. In 11th I tried not wearing the mask and broke my nose again early on so I gave it up. Who knows how much of it was real and who was demonically possessed and who was an iRobot like that Will Smith movie anyway. Also I was blind weak grass back then flooding my strength all over the place as coarse and wicked people do H'F' -- Rambam writes that it is forbidden to delay using the restroom, large or small, but does not provide layers of detail. Here is a Q&A with many very valuable insights. Remember that Gal can mean rejoicing or pile of rocks so this Mitzvah is very important to staying happy. Shulchan Aruch HaRav Article (it only goes to less than half the page and then its citations) ​ --- ​ After I posted the Zugot laws from Pesachim, one of my coworkers posted in the work chat a gif of a fat blonde person looking surprised and taking the shades off his glasses and it inspired me to "peel the layers" of this halacha and see the "fatness" hidden in it. ​ I think the reason for it is because the soul of Mashiach includes all of the other souls of mankind therefore eating two of these foods will make you think you are separate from me and possibly rebel H'F'. For example the song of the Chicken is "He gives (NoTeiN) food to all flesh, indeed His Kindness is Eternal", so you see it can be novelized Natan is food to all flesh. For the nuts, when there was a rebellion against the authority of Aharon my forefather, Aharon's staff and the rebels' staffs were cast together and Aharon's grew ripe almonds. For the cucumbers I'm not yet exactly fully aware but they are called Kishuin and my name shares most of the letters. Actually bread and butter pickles are some of the only vegetables I eat. ​ -- ​ Adar 26 I had said about artwork of bears and birds to ward off boars and cericket people, but actually a more inclusive piece would be a cat. Ohr Somayach's Perek Shira special on the cat used to say how it is describing the downfall of Edom. It sings two songs and it took that song out, it is: חָתוּל אוֹמֵר. אִם־תַּגְבִּיהַּ כַּנֶּשֶׁר וְאִם־בֵּין כּֽוֹכָבִים שִׂים קִנֶּךָ מִשָּׁם אוֹרִֽידְךָ נְאֻם־יְיָ׃ (עובדיה א ד) The Cat is saying, “If you rise up like a vulture, and place your nest among the stars, from there I shall bring you down, says YHVH.” ​ " Perhaps they started taking some fire and decided to cast some leaves down (teaching us epic fiery Torah that isn't really essential like Halachot) ​ I bought a 2 year old cat on Craigslist for $50 dollars yesterday and she has been delightfully sweet and hunts down heathen souls with her evil eye. A golden retriever puppy is ~$1,500 or more for context. ​ However beware that heathen don't like looking at cats as much as dogs so they hijack her soul more often H'F'! ​ Also the sages warn against a white cat in the Gemara, specifically one that was the offspring of another white (or black?) cat (you can look it up it gets confusing). But I don't think one should worry about that as if you commit yourself to righteousness it will be written about you Bereisheit 9:2 וּמוֹרַאֲכֶ֤ם וְחִתְּכֶם֙ יִֽהְיֶ֔ה עַ֚ל כׇּל־חַיַּ֣ת הָאָ֔רֶץ וְעַ֖ל כׇּל־ע֣וֹף הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם בְּכֹל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר תִּרְמֹ֧שׂ הָֽאֲדָמָ֛ה וּֽבְכׇל־דְּגֵ֥י הַיָּ֖ם בְּיֶדְכֶ֥ם נִתָּֽנוּ׃ The fear and the dread of you shall be upon all the beasts of the earth and upon all the birds of the sky—everything with which the earth is astir—and upon all the fish of the sea; they are given into your hand. ​ (apply this also to idolators, compared to vicious forest animals while pure people are "beasts of the field/pen", as in playing a purpose for The Farmer, HaShem. Therefore apply it to other pure sheep/goats/cows etc. - the more righteous and devoted scholar will "conquer" the other bulls like the "studs" of the pen) ​ YeshaYaHu 56:9 כֹּ֖ל חַיְת֣וֹ שָׂדָ֑י אֵתָ֕יוּ לֶאֱכֹ֥ל כׇּל־חַיְת֖וֹ בַּיָּֽעַר׃ {פ} All the beasts of the field, come to devour all the beasts in the forest. ​ Rashi: כֹּל חַיְתוֹ שָׂדָי. כָּל גֵּרֵי הָאֻמּוֹת, אֵתָיוּ וְהִתְקָרְבוּ אֵלַי, וְתֹאכְלוּ אֶת כָּל חַיְתוֹ בַּיַּעַר, אֶת גִּבּוֹרֵי הָאֻמּוֹת שֶׁאִמְּצוּ אֶת לִבָּם מִלְּהִתְגַּיֵּר: All the beasts of the field All the proselytes of the heathens ([Mss. and K’li Paz:] All the nations) come and draw near to Me, and you shall devour all the beasts in the forest, the mighty [Giborai] of the heathens ([Mss. and K’li Paz:] the mighty of the nations) who hardened their heart and refrained from converting. חַיְתוֹ שָׂדָי. חַיַּת הַשָּׂדֶה אֵין כֹּחָהּ רַב כְּחַיַּת הַיַּעַר, חַיַּת הַשָּׂדֶה חֲלָשָׁה וְתַשּׁוּשַׁת כֹּחַ מֵחַיַּת הַיַּעַר, וְעַל שֶׁאָמַר עוֹד אֲקַבֵּץ עָלָיו אָמַר הַמִּקְרָא הַזֶּה: the beasts of the field [The beast of the field is not as strong as the beast of the forest.] The beast of the field is weaker and of weaker strength than the beast of the forest. Since he stated, “I will yet gather others to him,” he stated this verse. ​ -- ​ A dried out tree branch is much much more easily snapped and burned than a juicy one. As we have learned anointing is like drinking and therefore I want to reiterate how important it is to always have some sort of oil on your head and face at least. Olive oil is a poor conductor of electricity and I find a day and night difference from when I get too lazy to anoint myself H'F'. In the words of shlomo who "dried out" or alternatively Ash-medai, Ecclesiastes 9:8 בְּכׇל־עֵ֕ת יִהְי֥וּ בְגָדֶ֖יךָ לְבָנִ֑ים וְשֶׁ֖מֶן עַל־רֹאשְׁךָ֥ אַל־יֶחְסָֽר׃ In all times may your clothes be freshly washed, and oil upon your head not be lacking. ​ --- ​ If you are one of those complaining against how dark and vile some of my teachings are, ן the final Nun of my name, I have heard from a student-teacher at Yeshivat Temimi Darech in Tzfat years ago in the name of the Alter Rebbe in one of his works, the final Nun descends below the Teivah, the letter box, to the world of impurity. ​ The final letters can all have very large, heavy, Gematriot, numerical values. The final letter of the Alef-Beit, ת Taf, is 400, then ך, final Caf is 500, ם final Mem is 600 (although it does not descend it is the entire square boundary of the Teivah, like an alter or table that comes from Gevurah/Severity since food, souls, are being consumed on them. Also we all know the severity of the Hidden Torah (Final Mem) when a field person points at us or tries to trap our souls with our mouths/speech H'F'. Then ן final Nun is 700. Therefore the name Natan can have the Gematria of 1150 putting it in the world of Chochmah, Wisdom according to Rabbi Aryeh Kaplan's commentary on Sefer Bahir. (hundreds would be Binah/Understanding, tens Zeir Anpin, the emotions, and singles would be Malchut, the physical world, action, that is a culmination of the upper worlds) ​ This is another thing to consider when naming yourself or children or pets (I named my cat תותי Tuthi, "My Berry".) ​ ***if you are past your days of potentially being put to a test with a physical fight H'F' you may want to skip to the next fig leaves (asteriks) ​ If H'F' you ever find yourself in a fight for your life against one of the Sat-n's many hosts and you are wrestling on the ground, squirm, kick, and flail (unless you know what you are doing) like a big cat until you find yourself on top, put all your weight on him/her from the side to prevent them from standing. If you find the opportunity you can fulfill the Tehillim Psalm 10:15: שְׁ֭בֹר זְר֣וֹעַ רָשָׁ֑ע וָ֝רָ֗ע תִּֽדְרוֹשׁ־רִשְׁע֥וֹ בַל־תִּמְצָֽא׃ Break Thou the arm of the wicked; And as for the evil man, search out his wickedness, till none be found. ​ by putting your knee opposite the side you are on (if you are on his left use your right knee) on top of their shoulder/armpit. Then you wind their arm upward and away from you to break it. This is extremely cruel and vile to even think about so only do this if necessary to save your soul. ​ Another tip, when bobbing and weaving in the 'striking stage' of the fight, you can leverage your punches by timing them with your head movement. For example you can lean to the bottom left from your stance and then throw a huge strong hook with your left hand (if your right hand is stronger and your stance is with your left foot in front). I said your throwing foot should rotate outwards about ~90 degrees but with a large hook (to their earlobe! or kidney!) it could be more like ~180 degrees​ ​ Alternatively you can just chomp their neck as hard as you can as soon as you are able, as Rashi says teeth are a parable for strength. ​ *** ​​ I once reposted a story about the Gra that on his deathbed he cried or was sad that in this world, he was able to fulfill the Mitzvah of TziTzit (women are not obligated as it is time bound) for only a couple coins (today maybe ~$10-20 and even free at a Gemach). This was before Techeilet (the blue winding string) was rediscovered and therefore today it costs around ~$70 at least. I think I got mine here at Tekhelet.com ​ If we combine our wisdom of Rambam saying only wool or linen 4 cornered garments are Biblically mandated in fringes, and that wool and linen had scores of 5000 for their energy frequency levels relative to the baseline level of 100 for the human body and organic cotton, and that this Mitzvah does not apply during the day we can see that HaShem wants us to wear linen and wool and maybe there is even more energy (a mystery for the scientists to find) in the blue Tekhelet dye to have a lot of energy in the day for Torah study and the "bread", labor to support it (as in the saying of the Sages - 'No flour, no Torah'). ​ If you argue that Google says this study was psuedoscience I challenge you to sleep tonight in a wool blanket (unless you fulfill the verse Isaiah 49:22 אֵ֣ין שָׁל֔וֹם אָמַ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה לָרְשָׁעִֽים׃ " There is no safety [lit. peace]—said GOD—for the wicked." then maybe creep on someone as you people do trying out a wool or linen blanket or even a thin Tallit Katan-[this was a joke as its forbidden to look through people's private windows or even gaze in their gardens]) ​ Vayikra Leviticus 6:6 אֵ֗שׁ תָּמִ֛יד תּוּקַ֥ד עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ לֹ֥א תִכְבֶּֽה׃ "A[n Eish, man/master] fire is to continuously be kindled/burning upon the altar, not to be extinguished" ​ Wool and linen garments, especially when bestowing upon you the merit of Tzitzit if they are 4 cornered, are like your kindling to keep you burning, as in zealous/passionate. ​ -- ​ Something else to consider about YechezkEl EzekiEl 13:18 is that for women, bras may act in the same way as head coverings socks and shoes to overheat people and cause them to despair of their souls by trapping it H'F'. It may be much better to wear loose and maybe thick clothing like a sweatshirt than a bra. ​ Therefore if you have a brother like "my brother" that lives in a demon-cratic city and pushes (as in supports and 'sells' to people) their evil concepts like plowing/suffocating women's "fields", their breasts that support their children (through unnecessary abortions), you could call him a lib-bra. (remember that "my breasts" and HaShem's Almighty Name "Sha-dai" are almost identical) ​ Why do I put parentheses around "my brother"? It seems very obvious to me that its either a new person every time we talk or a new soul flown into his body. ​ --- ​ Pesachim 111b from Steinsaltz "Bread crumbs in the house cause poverty. If these crumbs are spread throughout the house on Shabbat nights, i.e., Friday nights, or on Tuesday nights, when demons are present, harmful spirits rest on them." ​ When I started putting all my kitchen scraps into a biodegradable bag and burying them in my garden, I saw a lot more Berachot of Chochmah (Blessings of Wisdom). When I spent Shabbat at my teacher in Dvar YeruShalayim's apartment, Rabbi David Gilberg, he used to collect all of his bread crumbs and make pie crusts with them. Even if you live in an apartment you can mix some scraps like crumbs and coffee grounds into your potted plants. ​ If you are more "crunchy" you can also urinate in a bucket and fill it 10:1 or 20:1 (for younger/more sensitive plants) water to urine and apparently this makes the plants very leafy. Maybe leave it out in the next rainfall or filling it with water would defeat the purpose of conserving water/energy unless you live in a place that is 100% renewable powered. Edit: considering all the water saved from not flushing it should be good anyway. ​ Why would this be beneficial? If you are like me then everyone you have ever met and continue to meet is compared to "waste", urine and feces since the Arizal says humans are the "food" of creation, the final product that all of the hosts of Heaven watch for entertainment since we are the only ones with free choice (and the only choice we have is how much we decide to fear Heaven). Therefore since this final Roman exile is alluded to in the Torah by the words "fell upon", the Sat-ns and chief wizards are most often sending "fresh falls" that were recently living "food" and are now "urine and feces." Therefore since your garden is an extension of you, it is a way to "consume" them and elevate (making them into fertilizer) them rather than flush them to a sewage treatment facility where they have to waste energy treating it and are likely spirit cooking with it or eating it etc H'F'. ​ By the way the Arizal made it customary to not pronounce the word "sat-n" or their names, i.e. Sama-El, Li-lith (His female counterpart that is apparently much stronger) and Ash-medai, their offspring and the King of demons. I assume unless you are reading Torah about them. ​ Nevertheless one should view all creations as friends in the service of HaShem. For example, the Ari said one should not pronounce holy names unless he is on friendly terms with the Sat-n. ​ Nevertheless I used to go to Shabbat meals at a Chassid's apartment in Har Nof Jerusalem when I was studying in Yeshiva there. He once told a story that there was a Tzaddik running from a government of some yoke-casting-off country. He came to a river where he was cornered, and pronounced a holy name and his staff turned into a bridge and he escaped. It happened a second time where he was being pursued and was cornered by a river. This time he decided to trust in HaShem and threw down his staff without wasting any words, and it miraculously turned into a bridge for him to escape anyway. ​ -- ​ Since many of you may not have fathers that have taught you trades, and we do not know how soon the Keitz (ending) will be when I Robots handle all of our work for everyone, I am going to give you tips on how to succeed in sales. Please don't evil eye me because I started off for about 2 and a half years of my sales career working over 8 hours a day, most of the time in a  store or office. However if you can get a fully remote SaaS (Software as a Service, like how you have to pay monthly for Netflix H'F' or Youtube Premium for adless music), it is like more than semi-retirement (I only have to work about maybe 2 hours a day. The hardest part is spreading the calls out and answering random messages to pretend) ​ The main advice from my father who had a career as a shoe salesman and his grandfather opened the shoe store in Ayltovnu (Altoona), PA: ​ Most people only care about themselves [we all live in our own heads]. Therefore ask them questions about themselves and seem interested in them. ​ How to get a tech SaaS sales job: Make a professional looking LinkedIn [click] (since the West is a lie and we are prisoners for their spectating pleasure like how actual dead people and angels watch us in the parable of the movie The Truman Show, you could just bluff some experience from maybe some random tech startups [they make them up anyway] in order to get some space from the zombies while still giving yourself freedom with an income) ​ Search in LinkedIn Jobs "Business (or) Sales Development Representative or BDR or SDR" and the location "Remote USA" or "Remote EMEA" in Europe/Israel. I recommend selecting the "Easy Apply" filter. You will need to make a decent resume. Here is mine for example: ​​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​​​ Remember, the Sages teach "All beginnings are hard". ​ Also I had a 9 year old photo of me for my LinkedIn profile photo (Every cell in the body regenerates every few weeks or months and people look different over time) with my eyes looking away (at a guitar) to minimize witch curses by I think 90% based on the logic that the only free choice we have is how much we fear Heaven (based in Gevurah that are correlated to the eyes) and that every Sefirah contains every of the other 9 Sefirot. ​ However actually my hands were revealed and David HaMelech has a Tehillim about the heathen attacking his hands. The hands are also related to Gevurot as its written in Shemot "Behold, the hand of HaShem hits!" ​ This is the most important step! After getting the interview, just be very charismatic and try your best during their questions. Much more important is when they ask you for your questions. This is what separates the candidates. ​ Ask at least 4-5 of these: ​ What kind of training do you provide to your salespeople? ​ How do you see B/SDRs fail in this role? ​ What does the path to progression to Account Executive (full cycle/closers) or Management look like? (Even if you have no intention of working that hard to get promoted, its important to ask this!) ​ What percentage of your S/BDRs are achieving quota? ​ Why do you like working at this company? ​ What sets this product apart from competitors? ​ What does the future of the company look like, let's say in 3-5 years? ​​​ ​ My advice for setting meetings over the phone when a random person picks up: ​ Seem exceedingly friendly with the opening "Heeyyy" [a normal person wouldn't just spit out a mulberry] and keep this very jubilant tone throughout the call. Unless they seem upset, then tone it back but still try to perk them up with some positivity. If they seem a little irritated or rushed then you can pick up the pace so they don't hang up on you. ​ Actually the training is pretty detailed but basically get any information your employer asks, then just direct them to accept the meeting and if they give any push back, give an "agreeable statement" then ask why? like "I completely understand, but can I ask why [you aren't interested]?" another  example if they say they like using Microsoft say Understandable! What do you like about it? Oh I see, if we are able to offer better security/performance/price etc. would you consider us? Great I am going to schedule a quick call with a Specialist to get you an apples to apples comparison, how about later today at 4 ET? Busy? Now worries, how about tomorrow morning at 10? Great sending the invite now, looking forward. ​ Don't worry about undercutting business, the West is a plowed field directed by the Erev Rav (Great Evening, the band of wicked idolators controlling the world. Just look at the dollar bill with the the pyramid and triangle eye constantly creeping on us, enrichening us by stealing from us and owing us money) and again everyone is fake anyway and this is mostly a Kiruv effort. Plow the wicked and coarse people, the thistles and tender herbage/grass for our fruit tree orchards!! ​ אֲוַז הַבָּר הַמְּשׁוֹטֶטֶת בַּמִּדְבָּר. כְּשֶׁרוֹאֵה אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל עוֹסְקִים בַּתּוֹרָה אוֹמֶרֶת. קוֹל קוֹרֵא בַּמִּדְבָּר, פָּנוּ דֶּרֶךְ יי, יַשְׁרוּ בַּעֲרָבָה מְסִלָּה לֶאֱלֹהֵינוּ, וְעַל מְצִיאוּת מְזוֹנוֹתֶיהָ בַּמִּדְבָּר אוֹמֶרֶת. אָרוּר הַגֶּבֶר אַשֵּׁר יִבְטַח בָּאָדָם, בָּרוּךְ הַגֶּבֶר אֲשֶׁר יִבְטַח בְּיי וְהָיָה יי מִבְטָחוֹ: The Wild Goose flying in the wilderness, when it sees Yisra’el busy with Torah, is saying “A voice cries, Prepare in the wilderness the way of YHVH, make straight in the desert a path for our Elo’ah. I remember the coaches telling me "head-body-head", as in you want to go back and forth from kidney and stomach shots to nose (maybe if you know they are gog, Adam's apple/neck shots would be better) and earlobe shots to move their guard around and hopefully slip a large shot through unblocked. Also after you are done with a combo you should duck, cover your face, and "slip" by rotating your whole body on your forward weak foot about 90 degrees to the right or left (or in between, or less than 90 degrees, make it random) and stepping back to avoid any counter punches. By the same logic you should avoid combos that are too long. Generally about 2-4 maybe 5 punches max (unless you have him/her "on the ropes," then just "tee off," as in keep them coming as hard as you can) but most will realistically be 2-3. ​ Another good defense is to hide your face behind your left (if your strong hand is the right) shoulder and slip/block punches this way ​ Here's a good example: A quick jab to the nose to get the guard up then a straight right hand or a hook to the stomach or side of it or kidney, then a large knockout hook to the earlobe. ​ Another: A jab to the face/upper throat, then/or just a jab to the stomach to bend them forward, then a knockout strong handed uppercut (rotate your wrist so that your palm is towards you while punching upwards - again never throw a strong handed hook/haymaker!) to where the throat connects to the head for extra leverage (since they are bent) like teeing off on a bloody (red) souls-stitched-together baseball lobbed to you or on a tee. ​ (side note: Perhaps this represents the fallen soul-bundled people of Laban coming to you. Since its a ball maybe its women and the bat represents Torah and you have to make it to Home Beit [Ashkenazim say Beis] without "falling to Shaynah", getting out of life H'F'. For women and since the ball is larger apply it to "Shane" acting "round", "soft" with you lol ​ Hiking, Holech, like Melech, king, in nature, HaTeivah, (Gematria of Elokim), is the best way to get exercise. And the verse: "Yet if you warn the wicked... you have delivered your soul," ( Ezekiel 3:19) is applied to him. From this we learn that whoever warns the wicked — even if the wicked do not heed him — that person saves himself, while the wicked are punished according to their sins. How far should he go in warning them? And he answered: Until he hits them. This issue has already been explained by our colleagues." ​ -- ​ About getting a job to support Torah and do Kiruv to hasten Redemption, we can apply the Roosters' very popular sixth call: בְּקוֹל שִׁישִּׁי אוֹמֵר. אַל תֶּאֱהַב שֵׁנָה פֶּן תִּוָּרֵשׁ פְּקַח עֵינֶיךָ שְׂבַע לָחֶם: (משלי כ יג) In its sixth call, it is saying, “Do not love sleep, lest you come to poverty; open your eyes, and you shall be satisfied with bread.” ​ See, "Do not love strength (teeth, Sheinim, as in living out in nature or hiding from society to preserve your strength) (or also sleep, as in hiding from people to have more sleep and rest) lest you become impoverished (and not be able to afford grape juice and hot food for Shabbat and other Mitzvot H'F'). Open up your people (with Torah, Wisdom through Kiruv - Yisrael is an anagram for Li Rosh, 'My Head', therefore in the words of Isaiah we are responsible for being "a light to the nations") during the week and be sated with bread/food (including herbs and vegetables) from your war efforts. ​ Direct support from Pirkei Avot 2:2 רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הַנָּשִׂיא אוֹמֵר, יָפֶה תַלְמוּד תּוֹרָה עִם דֶּרֶךְ אֶרֶץ, שֶׁיְּגִיעַת שְׁנֵיהֶם מְשַׁכַּחַת עָוֹן. וְכָל תּוֹרָה שֶׁאֵין עִמָּהּ מְלָאכָה, סוֹפָהּ בְּטֵלָה וְגוֹרֶרֶת עָוֹן. וְכָל הָעֲמֵלִים עִם הַצִּבּוּר, יִהְיוּ עֲמֵלִים עִמָּהֶם לְשֵׁם שָׁמַיִם, שֶׁזְּכוּת אֲבוֹתָם מְסַיַּעְתָּן וְצִדְקָתָם עוֹמֶדֶת לָעַד. וְאַתֶּם, מַעֲלֶה אֲנִי עֲלֵיכֶם שָׂכָר הַרְבֵּה כְּאִלּוּ עֲשִׂיתֶם: Rabban Gamaliel the son of Rabbi Judah Hanasi said: excellent is the study of the Torah when combined with a worldly occupation, for toil in them both keeps sin out of one’s mind; But [study of the] Torah which is not combined with a worldly occupation, in the end comes to be neglected and becomes the cause of sin. And all who labor with the community, should labor with them for the sake of Heaven, for the merit of their forefathers sustains them (the community), and their (the forefather’s) righteousness endures for ever; And as for you, [God in such case says] I credit you with a rich reward, as if you [yourselves] had [actually] accomplished [it all]. ​ About 5 years ago I emailed Rabbi HarGanim (Ginsburg) telling him about all the spiritual troubles etc. and he told me what I needed to do was as much Chesed (Kindness) / Tzedakah (Charity) as possible. ​ If you are making excuses that everyone is dangerous, if you haven't figured it out, they always have been and its your responsibility as wood to propagate the meadow with trees. They have the technology to track us down and find us wherever we are with nano drones anyway so we may as well face it and clean up the mess. ​ --- Science lesson: Yesterday I found this American Chestnut (left) in the local park near me, probably protected from the blight since its surrounded by the town: ​​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​​ ​ ​ ​ ​​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​This is an extremely inspirational tree as redwoods and sequoias don't have fruit, and oaks and beeches only fruit every few years (I don't know yet for sure but am doubting that they are included in the Halacha not to cut down fruit trees for use during war because of this). Am. Chestnuts were called the redwoods of the East. ​ This tree is arguably one of, if not the most valuable trees in the world. Why? ​ The American chestnut has the sweetest flavor out of the Chinese and European (can't even eat this one), and grows taller (~100ft) and straighter than the Chinese making it more valuable for lumber. The wood is also rot resistant. I learned somewhere that it used to be that any Appalachian (NE US) landowner could become rich from these trees. The government brought the Chinese chestnut over in 1911 to combat the blight but it exacerbated it and nearly decimated the Americans. The root system is there however most trees die in the forest from blight in their early years H'F'. ​ Now there are ~95% American blight free hybrids that will Heaven Willing, restore this mighty fruit tree to dominate our forests in the coming years. ​ If you live in its native region and own land or would be willing to do some "sales efforts" in calling and asking parks and field owners to plant them there, you can email 1Allen Nichols for saplings or seeds. ​ My coworker at GoTo after I gave this speech to my team a few months ago alluded to the verse Dvarim 32:17 יִזְבְּח֗וּ לַשֵּׁדִים֙ לֹ֣א אֱלֹ֔הַּ אֱלֹהִ֖ים לֹ֣א יְדָע֑וּם        חֲדָשִׁים֙ מִקָּרֹ֣ב בָּ֔אוּ לֹ֥א שְׂעָר֖וּם אֲבֹתֵיכֶֽם׃ They sacrificed to demons, no-gods, Gods they had never known, New ones, who came but lately, Who stirred not your forebears’ fears. ​ By saying "its a shame they brought something new over" and made this novelty that since the forest trees represent the kings and gods of the nations, one should not bring different species to different non native places like the verse "He has established the borders of nations that they shall not falter" ​ **the previous wicked baal habayit alon anava was telling everyone this person was a Chitzon (alien) or demon or not human somehow but who knows. Possibly he/Ash-medai was alluding that she was Jewish, as Moshe named his child Gersham 'Alien there (in this world)' and it was forbidden unrecognized relations (she was the significant other or something of a manager and it was mormon-run) ​ Actually I had to girdle and salt a beautiful Norway Maple someone planted years ago(?) in my front yard that provides cover and shade since its invasive here and has a unique feature that it poisons or suffocates the soil and prevents native species from growing. ​ (Don't worry I planted some native plums and a honeycrisp/fuji apple hybrid to take its place and remind people of the Song of the Apple about being a deer in the forest [when fleeing or forced among heathen] and not a boar or cricket etc. under a shade tree) ​ -- ​ Mishnah Kelim 17:13 כֹּל שֶׁבַּיָּם טָהוֹר, חוּץ מִכֶּלֶב הַמַּיִם, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא בוֹרֵחַ לַיַּבָּשָׁה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. הָעוֹשֶׂה כֵלִים מִן הַגָּדֵל בַּיָּם וְחִבֵּר לָהֶם מִן הַגָּדֵל בָּאָרֶץ, אֲפִלּוּ חוּט, אֲפִלּוּ מְשִׁיחָה, דָּבָר שֶׁהוּא מְקַבֵּל טֻמְאָה, טָמֵא: All that live in the sea are clean, except the sea-dog (lit. "the water dog") because it seeks refuge on dry land, the words of Rabbi Akiba. If one made vessels from what grows in the sea and joined to them anything that grows on land, even if only a thread or a cord, if it is susceptible to uncleanness, they are unclean. ​​​ -Vessels made solely from fish parts are not succeptive to impurity as long as they are not made with animal or plant threads/parts. Therefore if one is skilled and rich, fish leather sandals, clothes (HaShem clothed Adam and Chavah in leather after the sin), and maybe even a tent, etc would be the best material for all vessels. ​ -- ​ When I was researching eating dirt I saw that apparently the Sages say in the Gemara that eating the dirt of Babylon is like eating ones ancestors. Also if you are a male I heard maybe get a female and vice versa so they like you more ​ -- ​ *** elderly ladies may want to skip ​ If you ever find yourself in a struggle against a Gibor H'F' and he/she is guarding their neck and you want to flatten them to break the arm like described above, the basic way to do this is by "chopping" with a closed fist as hard as you can at the elbow to which side you are on applying pressure. When the elbow gives, you should grab that wrist with your opposite hand, which should be wrapped around the body at their side and stomach. Wrist control is always very important. Now it will be easy to flatten him/her by wedging your knee/shin to make a sort of "stumbling block" on the side you are on. If you are on their left side, your left knee gets wedged and your right knee should knee them in the lower spine/bottom to push them over your left knee. Some balance is required to readjust your left knee after they fall and make sure they don't roll you over H'F'. But when they are flat it will be easy to choke them out or break their arm first if needed. ​ Therefore if you are on the bottom H'F' immediately get off your stomach and up to your knees, called getting to your "base", again always struggling for wrist control. If they are a regular person with no experience you can easily reverse them by reaching back with your elbow, hooking their elbow on the far side that they wrapped around you, and then rolling to that side. Otherwise stand up as soon as possible leaning your upper back into them and prying their hold on you off with your thumbs. As soon as it breaks, turn around by swinging your elbow at their earlobe. **Also, when you are on your "Base" (knees), make sure your hands are outwards when using them to support yourself or if they chop hard they could seriously hurt your elbow H'F'. ​ If you are on your back you can intersect your feet behind their body and squeeze his/her sides as hard as you can with your knees, the "scissor lock", and strike from there. ​ At least knowing this is important to discourage people from trying you in the first place H'F'. Being a Gibor (warrior/mighty one) is the next step up from having one's blood poured out but still fearing H', called being an Enosh, and I imagine it may be hard to jump directly from Enosh to Eish. ​ ** Taking my cat's collars (she also had a flea one) off really helped strengthen her to stay in her body and hunt heathen souls that break in fyi Just like a person taking their hat/Kippah, briefs/boxer briefs (instead regular boxers are decent), socks and shoes, (and probably bra - maybe one could hole punch it lol) off ​ -- Laws of Rosh Chodesh Chabad OU Kosher Shulchan Aruch HaRav ​ It seems the only Torah obligation is not to fast and to remember to do Kiddush Levanah in 7 days and the rest would be good to do if there is no electricity. ​ -- ​ I recently saw Rabbi Adam Yitzhak post these novelties on the Chashmal (electrum) metals: Gold (Zahav) represents our plea for divine bestowal [as in Zeh Hav; this to me], silver (Cesef) symbolizes our soul’s longings [Cosef], and copper (Nechoshet) signifies the ego we must transmute [as in Nachash, snake]. In darkness, we fulfill The Creator’s ultimate will and awaken our co-creative power. ​ I have once heard that silver (Chesed/Kindness) is actually greater than gold (Severity, judgements) since silver is less expensive and more readily available for everyone. By the same logic maybe we can say copper (Tiferet, beauty/balance/truth) is greater than both silver and gold since it is by far the least expensive and I think the Arizal puts the Sefirah of Tiferet 4th in front of Chesed. Copper does not tarnish as easily as silver and is stronger  (despite silver being more conductive) and actually copper wires are powering our Messianic luxuries (lights, heat, hot water). ​ The sages in the Gemara teach that it is a great shame the snake conspired against us or it would have been an amazing servant. Hamitzvot (Aseh 155) היא שצונו לקדש את השבת ולאמר דברים בכניסתו וביציאתו וקדוש היום ומעלתו והבדלו משאר הימים הקודמים ממנו והבאים אחריו, We are commanded to make a verbal declaration when Shabbat enters and when it leaves We must mention the greatness and exalted character of this day and how it is distinct from the other days of the week ​​ According to a portion of Zohar in Chok LeYisrael, very severe negative things happen when people break Melachot after Shabbat without first reciting the Shema (and possibly remembrance of the Exodus) at least, and then doing the Havdalah, the ending sanctification of Shabbat where we bless on the juice/wine, light of a candle fire, and incense and then the final sanctification blessing before drinking the juice and extinguishing the flame with the remainder onto a plate or bowl. ​ Here is an article from Chabad ​ It seems the only necessary things to say are the three blessings on the juice, fire, and incense, and then this final "goodbye" blessing to "Shabbat" and the extra soul we merit during it while observing: ​ Blessed are You, L‑rd our G‑d, King of the universe, who makes a distinction between sacred and mundane, between light and darkness, between Israel and the nations, between the Seventh Day and the six workdays. Blessed are You, L‑rd, who makes a distinction between sacred and mundane. ​​ -- ​ Since Pesach is in almost 2 weeks one needs to either plan to Kasher his/her vessels or buy new ones (from the Chametz/Leavening in them). They are: the Paschal sacrifice, matzah, and maror. The Paschal sacrifice: [It is eaten] because the Omnipresent passed over the houses of our ancestors in Egypt as [Exodus 12:27] states: "And you shall say: 'It is the Paschal sacrifice to God.' The bitter herbs: [They are eaten] because the Egyptians embittered the lives of our ancestors in Egypt. The matzah: [It is eaten] because of the redemption. These statements are all referred to as the Haggadah. ​​ He says above this should be done in question-and-answer format even if one is by him/herself. As for the other requirement of bitter herbs, Chabad says this: ​ The Mishnah lists five herbs that fit the bill. 8 There is some discussion as to how to translate the Hebrew/Aramaic words of the Mishnah , 9 but it is generally accepted that romaine lettuce, horseradish and endives (escarole) are included in the list. 10 The Chabad custom is to use romaine lettuce and horseradish together. 11 ​ Be careful because that Mishnah, Pesachim 2:6 says that they cannot be pickled like a lot of horseradishes are. ​ Pesachim 2:6: וְאֵלּוּ יְרָקוֹת שֶׁאָדָם יוֹצֵא בָהֶן יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ בְּפֶסַח, בַּחֲזֶרֶת וּבְעֻלָשִׁין וּבְתַמְכָא וּבְחַרְחֲבִינָה וּבְמָרוֹר. יוֹצְאִין בָּהֶן בֵּין לַחִין בֵּין יְבֵשִׁין, אֲבָל לֹא כְבוּשִׁין וְלֹא שְׁלוּקִין וְלֹא מְבֻשָּׁלִין. וּמִצְטָרְפִין לְכַזָּיִת. וְיוֹצְאִין בַּקֶּלַח שֶׁלָּהֶן, וּבִדְמַאי, וּבְמַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן שֶׁנִּטְּלָה תְרוּמָתוֹ, וּבְמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי וְהֶקְדֵּשׁ שֶׁנִּפְדּוּ: ​ And these are the vegetables with which a person can fulfill his obligation to eat bitter herbs on Passover: One can fulfill his obligation with ḥazeret, with chervil [tamkha], and with field eryngo [ḥarḥavina], and with endives [olashin], and with maror. One fulfills his obligation with them whether they are fresh or whether they are dry. However, one does not fulfill his obligation if they are pickled in water or vinegar, nor if they are over-boiled [shaluk] in hot water, nor if they are boiled [mevushal]. The mishna adds: And all these different types of vegetables join together to the measure of an olive-bulk. ​ You can get 5 pounds of Yehudah Matzah's on Ebay for ~$27 or Amazon for ~$22 with Prime. ​ Also one should ​ Other than that its just observing the two days of Yom Tov at the beginning and end and not eating any leavening during that week. ​ For the sink one can clean it and cover it in foil and use cold water ​ -- ​ Although many opinions argue with Rambam about him saying sorcery is not real and all lies and a conspiracy from the generation of Enosh, he is at least right in that it is all lies and this is why every person you will find in your day-to-day is a sick savage. "He gives"] food to all flesh, and milk/dairy represents Chesed-Kindness, I implore you to please not refrain from cooking chicken or any Kosher bird and milk any time you desire it. ​ It seems obvious to me that the wise Jewish men who still have the tradition know that Natan is a potential name of the Mashiach. However since the "house owner" was the head snake of Yehudah for the past ~2500+ years, you see that I was conspired against as in the words of Rabbi Yehudah in the Mishnah in Eruvin 4:5, וּמוֹדֶה רַבִּי יְהוּדָה שֶׁאִם בֵּרֵר לוֹ, שֶׁאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לַחֲזֹר בּוֹ: he was trying to choose the crown for himself but was unable because of the pig in him. ​ By the way Rambam says one should always eat in his house (if possible) as to not to incur contempt (I was just picking it up there and taking it back to my room in the evil snake king's hotel lol) since wicked people hate eating and have trouble sleeping and will evil eye us and play vile "sports" (as in throw things on our food like scoring a goal or hoop) for enjoying food in public H'F'. ​ -- Someone posted a picture of a grasshopper hole in their garden in the gardening subreddit with massive black grasshoppers. Someone commented that they were more like "stormhoopers", like how the gog people are all stretched and steroided out and fight for the kingdom of evil and many are clones (its a star wars clone wars reference if you are pure and clueless) and most worship basketball and other sports. I have been laughing about it since and wanted to share ​ ​The wisdom from it: people were saying to stomp on them all before they spawn/breed and devour his whole field. Take note and be wise kings and queens and remember the second song of the Cat: וּכְשֶׁמַגִיעוֹ אוֹמֵר. אֶרְדּוֹף אוֹיְבַי וְאַשִּׂיגֵם וְלֹא־אָשׁוּב עַד־כַּלּוֹתָם׃ (תהלים יח לח) And when the cat catches it [the mouse], the cat says, “I have pursued my enemies and overtaken them, and I did not return until they were destroyed. ” ​ The Israelites were originally punished for not completely destroying the Caananite nations upon occupying the Land and growing complacent. That's why the wars with the surrounding nations continued on throughout the entire Tanakh. -- ​ Another conspiracy in modern day Judaism I believe is the fact that many Rabbis outright prohibit eating certain foods like mulberries and blackberries due to bug concerns. ​ Bereisheit 1:29 וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֗ים הִנֵּה֩ נָתַ֨תִּי לָכֶ֜ם אֶת־כׇּל־עֵ֣שֶׂב ׀ זֹרֵ֣עַ זֶ֗רַע אֲשֶׁר֙ עַל־פְּנֵ֣י כׇל־הָאָ֔רֶץ וְאֶת־כׇּל־הָעֵ֛ץ אֲשֶׁר־בּ֥וֹ פְרִי־עֵ֖ץ זֹרֵ֣עַ זָ֑רַע לָכֶ֥ם יִֽהְיֶ֖ה לְאׇכְלָֽה׃ And God said, Behold I have given you every herb bearing seed , which is upon the face of all the earth, and every tree , on which is the fruit yielding seed; to you it shall be for food. ​ The vast majority of Jewish people are currently exiled to the NE US where mulberries, blackberries and many other berries are native. These are one of the only "perfect" fruits with no peel or pit, and I once posted about how their name, Tuthim, has a Taf and a Thaf, Metaphors for perfect beauty and perfect ugliness and how it can be novelized "Tot", to get under, like how one uproots an evil plant like a thistle (side note, the thistle is also a metaphor for Shechem according to the Midrash). ​ Nevertheless they do have a point about bug concerns but obviously there has to be a simple sensible method to remove them in HaShem's Perfect Creation. However this quest is currently beyond me for now as I never finished my science degree and remember the Prophet tells us not to rely on a master.. ​ Also I think Mulberries are the largest (physically) sized trees with perfect fruit, representing quite an epic and strong Torah scholar. They are also one of the most powerfully sweet and delicious foods if you have ever picked a native one off a tree or had a freshly fallen one (when you were unaware of bug concerns or were a gentile before 'Shabbat' started) ​ I have heard before that in the Messianic era, all trees will be fruit trees so maybe one way to start this is to replace the shady fruitless elms and tulip trees with purple mulberries and persimmons in Appalachia (just a thought, this may have some unforeseen negatives) ​​ -- The American conspiracy: Back when we had American Chestnuts, the Americans had the Salem Witch Trials - how awesome is that? ​ I found a school near me called Westmont that has tons of acres of grass fields. May they soon all be eternally extinguished and may every such person suffer incomprehensible tortures as its written in Mishlei "Give her of the fruit of her hands" now please at least think "Amen!" ​ -- ​ 1 Shmuel 1:9-11 וַתָּ֣קׇם חַנָּ֔ה אַחֲרֵ֛י אׇכְלָ֥הֿ בְשִׁלֹ֖ה וְאַחֲרֵ֣י שָׁתֹ֑ה וְעֵלִ֣י הַכֹּהֵ֗ן יֹשֵׁב֙ עַל־הַכִּסֵּ֔א עַל־מְזוּזַ֖ת הֵיכַ֥ל יְהֹוָֽה׃ After they had eaten and drunk at Shiloh, Hannah rose. The priest Eli was sitting on the seat near the doorpost of the temple of the LORD.— ​ וְהִ֖יא מָ֣רַת נָ֑פֶשׁ וַתִּתְפַּלֵּ֥ל עַל־יְהֹוָ֖ה וּבָכֹ֥ה תִבְכֶּֽה׃ In her wretchedness, she prayed to the LORD, weeping all the while. ​ וַתִּדֹּ֨ר נֶ֜דֶר וַתֹּאמַ֗ר יְהֹוָ֨ה צְבָא֜וֹת אִם־רָאֹ֥ה תִרְאֶ֣ה ׀ בׇּעֳנִ֣י אֲמָתֶ֗ךָ וּזְכַרְתַּ֙נִי֙ וְלֹא־תִשְׁכַּ֣ח אֶת־אֲמָתֶ֔ךָ וְנָתַתָּ֥ה לַאֲמָתְךָ֖ זֶ֣רַע אֲנָשִׁ֑ים וּנְתַתִּ֤יו לַֽיהֹוָה֙ כׇּל־יְמֵ֣י חַיָּ֔יו וּמוֹרָ֖ה לֹא־יַעֲלֶ֥ה עַל־רֹאשֽׁוֹ׃ And she made this vow: “O LORD of Hosts, if You will look upon the suffering of Your maidservant and will remember me and not forget Your maidservant, and if You will grant Your maidservant a male child, I will dedicate him to the LORD for all the days of his life; and no razor shall ever touch his head.” ​ If one probes a little, he/she can see the deeper story alluded to by the Hebrew. תָּ֣קׇם חַנָּ֔ה אַחֲרֵ֛י אׇכְלָ֥הֿ בְשִׁלֹ֖ה וְאַחֲרֵ֣י שָׁתֹ֑ה Chanah rose after (realizing everyone or almost everyone she knew) is eating Vet (metaphor for folly vowelized with Sh'va, Gevurah where Evil exists) Shiloh (name of Mashiach, as in mocking HaShem and His anointed) and after they drank (remember Mishlei says alcohol is for the desolate wicked to occupy themselves happily and enjoy the reward for their good before HaShem snuffs their existences forever. Also alcohol is a metaphor for lies, as in they are all speaking false Lashon Hara on the priestly house on HaShem's throne - וְעֵלִ֣י הַכֹּהֵ֗ן יֹשֵׁב֙ עַל־הַכִּסֵּ֔א eand Ayli [lit. upon me, alt. My G-d] the Priest was sitting upon the Throne) ​​ The word מחנה Machaneh, camp, as in one's war encampment,  can be novelized MiChanah, "from Chanah", as in the best Yefet Toar on the battlefield to win as a wife are the ones that make "bread" of themselves as  in Perek Shira שִׁבֹּלֶת חִטִּים אוֹמֶרֶת. שִׁיר הַמַּעֲלוֹת מִמַּעֲמַקִּים קְרָאתִיךָ יי (תהילים קל א) The Sheaves of Wheat are saying (Psalm 130:1), “A song of ascents: Out of the depths have I cried to you, YH-VH.” ​ and call out to and serve Heaven on their own accord without going through the Yefet Toar 30 days to 1 year procedure to convert them. ​ Chanah can also be noveled "Chet Ana" - "Marriage, Oh I pray!" (the letter Chet is a metaphor for a Chuppah, a marriage canopy) as in HaShem is praying for us to marry such a valiant woman ​ Also the command to love a convert is repeated and emphasized many more times in Torah than the command to love one's native Jewish family. One reason is since converts are easily looked down upon since most don't know as much Torah from not having such an upbringing and community, and they have a harder history making it easier to revert to sins H'F' ​ I have also heard before, maybe from Rabbi Michael Skobac, that converts are more precious than native born Jews. Why? Although it is written about the acceptance of the Torah that the Jewish people enthusiastically said "We will do [all of the Torah obligations immediately] and we will hear [afterwards we will seek to understand the reasonings since we trust that they are all logical and perfect], this is in regards to the Written Law. ​ To accept the Oral Law, HaShem had to hold Mount Sinai over the people and threaten to bury them under it. Converts however (at least before 'Shabbat') came and accepted on their own accord. ​ - ​ I have been trying to probe the Halacha that when a Cohen takes a Yefet Toar he has to send her out of his house afterwards since she is a convert and they cannot marry. It comes from Yevamot 6:5 כֹּהֵן הֶדְיוֹט לֹא יִשָּׂא אַיְלוֹנִית, אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן יֶשׁ לוֹ אִשָּׁה וּבָנִים. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁיֶּשׁ לוֹ אִשָּׁה וּבָנִים, לֹא יִשָּׂא אַיְלוֹנִית, שֶׁהִיא זוֹנָה הָאֲמוּרָה בַתּוֹרָה. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים, אֵין זוֹנָה אֶלָּא גִיּוֹרֶת וּמְשֻׁחְרֶרֶת וְשֶׁנִּבְעֲלָה בְעִילַת זְנוּת: An ordinary priest shall not marry a woman incapable of procreation, unless he already has a wife or children. Rabbi Judah said: even though he has a wife and children he shall not marry a woman incapable of procreation, since she is a zonah, as mentioned in the Torah. But the Sages said: the term zonah implies only a female convert, freed slavewoman and one who has been subjected to illicit intercourse. ​ We cannot agree with Rabbi Yehudah because one of the proofs of the Sages' opinion is from YechezkEl 44:22 וְאַלְמָנָה֙ וּגְרוּשָׁ֔ה לֹא־יִקְח֥וּ לָהֶ֖ם לְנָשִׁ֑ים כִּ֣י אִם־בְּתוּלֹ֗ת מִזֶּ֙רַע֙ בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְהָֽאַלְמָנָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּֽהְיֶ֣ה אַלְמָנָ֔ה מִכֹּהֵ֖ן יִקָּֽחוּ׃ They shall not marry widows or divorced women of the stock of the House of Israel, but only virgins; of the stock of the House of Israel, or they may marry widows who are widows of priests. ​ Although I saw one wise Rabbi argue that converts are considered from the seed of Avraham and are considered new born babies after conversion, there is still a concept of some of the specific nations retaining their "seed" identities even after converting. For example, Kiddushin 74b ​ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בֶּן תֵּשַׁע שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד גֵּר עַמּוֹנִי וּמוֹאָבִי, מִצְרִי וַאֲדוֹמִי, כּוּתִי וְנָתִין, חָלָל וּמַמְזֵר שֶׁבָּאוּ עַל הַכֹּהֶנֶת וְעַל הַלְוִיָּה וְעַל בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל – [פְּסָלוּהָ]. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁזַּרְעוֹ פָּסוּל – פּוֹסֵל, וְכֹל שֶׁאֵין זַרְעוֹ פָּסוּל – אֵינוֹ פּוֹסֵל. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: ​ The Sages taught (Tosefta, Yevamot 8:1): A boy nine years and one day old, whose sexual intercourse is considered an act of intercourse with regard to sexual transgressions, who was an Ammonite or Moabite convert, or an Egyptian or Edomite convert, or a Samaritan, or a Gibeonite, a ḥalal, or a mamzer, and who engaged in sexual intercourse with the daughter of a priest, or the daughter of a Levite, or an Israelite woman, has thereby disqualified her from the priesthood. Rabbi Yosei says: Anyone whose offspring is unfit to marry a priest disqualifies a woman with whom he engages in intercourse from marrying a priest; and anyone whose offspring is not unfit does not disqualify her. ​ **As a side note elsewhere the sages teach that one of the powerful kings of the nations mixed all of the nations' seed identities together. For example, Europe was originally the inheritance of Yefet [according to Artscroll Stone Edition Chumash], and then Esav (Rome/Christianity) who descended from Shem [his portion was Asia including the Middle East, Israel. That's why its written "The Caananite was Gibor, Mighty in the Land", the Chamites, who were apportioned Africa, conquered it from the Shemites and that's why HaShem allowed Israel to reconquer the Land with Yehoshua Bin Nun according to Ohr HaChaim I think. Anyway Rome conquered nearly all of Yefet's Europe and definitely influenced/mixed with all of it. ​ However, when a person has a Jewish father and non Jewish mother they are said to have "Zera Yisrael", Seeds of Israel, the same words used in YechezkEl (also they were more encouraged to convert). Therefore it would only make sense in my opinion for a Kohen to marry a convert like the opinion of Rabbi Yehudah that she be a true virgin (not a spiritual new born) and have a Jewish father or possibly close ancestor(?), but this is speculation and clearly I would not want to battle our Rambam here without pollen. ​ Another factor is that he would have to convert her before having relations since they wouldn't be able to marry until she converts, and after relations she would no longer be a virgin. (***elderly sensitive people maybe look away - it takes a few "pounds of the hammer" to shatter their spiritual rock [as in hardened peel against Heaven] and to accept Us from my experience. Obviously one should not be aggressive at all in relations but the sages teach to take lessons from the rooster and be extremely sweet and gentle. Also before a battle and territory is won, Rambam says its forbidden to be sharp like a palm leaf [as in to aggressively convince or force one.]) ​ Since people seem interested, according to the Stone Edition Chumash by Rabbi Natan Scherman (Ox Heaven-bread), Shem was the greatest of Noach's three sons and was apportioned the Priesthood and Divine Mission of Redemption that started with Adam. Yefet was second, as he also helped cover Noach's nakedness after Cham's sin (Although according to Ohr HaChaim, Cham is second in intelligence). Yefet was blessed with beauty and sensitivity (think of Swedish and Danish people) and its written that "Yefet will dwell in the tents of Shem." The Sages teach one way this was fulfilled was in the Beit Hamikdash when one of Yefet's more beautiful languages (I think it was Greek) were used on a vessel (maybe the charity box?). Cham was blessed with strength (Black athletes disproportionately dominated pro sports). Cham also means "warm" or "hot" and all who brave the world know how charismatic, "warm", African descended people can be and also how "hot" as in severe as well. The whole draw of (t)rap music was the 'hot', fun beat. ​ Although on one hand I said all the nations were mixed and on the other I gave modern day examples, consider that the Sefirah of Tiferet, Truth/Beauty/Balance-Copper is represented by the body between the two hands (Kindness-Silver and Severity-Gold) and that copper is the "hardest" metal of the 3. The true Halacha and Knowledge of Creation is 'hard' to attain at first but is extremely beautiful and increases in beauty over time. When copper gets old and changes colors like the statue of liberty did, it becomes less conductive of electricity (Divine Wrath), as in you become more insulated from the "children of demons" that fly on high (Job) and wicked people that are "all kindlers of fires" (Isaiah?) that surreptitiously taze us like snakes or treacherous double-shady crickets (cricket is TzLTzL, and shadow/shade is TzL) H'F'!!! ​ Copper is also basically free as anyone could walk around a city and find some pennies (I think 1984 and before are mostly copper and even new pennies have a little) and stores used to have take-or-leave-a-penny bins until the upright Edomites started getting off to '(t)rap' music and things became crazy here after all of those evil words, "spell"igs, being uttered with the mouth, the Holy of Holies. ​ -- Another consideration.
