When they have announced to you the verdict in the case, ​​ Rashi: ואל השפט אשר יהיה בימים ההם [AND THOU SHALT COME UNTO THE PRIESTS …] AND UNTO THE JUDGE THAT SHALL BE IN THOSE DAYS — The last apparently redundant words suggest: and even though he is not as eminent as other judges that have been before him, you must obey him — you have none else but the judge that lives in your days (i.e. you are only concerned with him) (Rosh Hashanah 25b). ​ Yes my Tree of Torah may only be 8 years old and I may not have as much wisdom as some sages H'F' yet I am likely the only non intentional sinner (anyone that does a single intentional sin is disqualified as a valid witness) that is a Torah scholar that you know and therefore all that you have ​ Actually I'm obligating anyone that won't fall on me with my glasses on H'F' to come to my house to study Torah with me and be like Eliezer for me (I have 2 extra rooms an attic and basement and can support you) ​ -- ​ Nissan 12 ​ Mishnah Berachot 1:1 מֵאֵימָתַי קוֹרִין אֶת שְׁמַע בְּעַרְבִית. מִשָּׁעָה שֶׁהַכֹּהֲנִים נִכְנָסִים לֶאֱכֹל בִּתְרוּמָתָן, עַד סוֹף הָאַשְׁמוּרָה הָרִאשׁוֹנָה From when do we call the Shema in the evening? From the hour that the Kohanim enter to eat of the sacrificial meat, until the end of the first watch. ​ Another face on this is that when a person recognizes that it is nightfall (everyone is fallen except him/her H'F'), the Saar, hair (instead of Shaah, hour) meaning the Crown, HaShem's Will, are those that enter to eat of Torah (even real Noahides were compared to High Priests according to the Gemara), until the end, the tail/bottom - those that call Ash-medai (instead of Ashmorah, watch) at once H'F'. ​ Anyway I brought this up because I think right around nightfall is a great time to shower. I usually shower in the morning or early afternoon but today I got a ton done (in addition to all written from Nissan 11 to today) and didn't shower until 22:00. ​ Maybe since anointing is like drinking, its like drinking too much water and then getting "bed rot" as the Western kids say (when you just lie in bed despite it being long past the point of being pleasurable) H'F' ​ Vayikra (Leviticus) 6:5 וְהָאֵ֨שׁ עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֤חַ תּֽוּקַד־בּוֹ֙ לֹ֣א תִכְבֶּ֔ה "And the fire/Eish shall perpetually be upon on the altar - Do not extinguish it/him!" ​ Sorry I forgot to give context. Here is Bartenura on Mishnah Berachot 1:1, the Crown of the Mishnah: ​ Kohanim (Priests) who became defiled and immersed [in the Mikveh/Ritual Bath] are not able to eat of the Terumah/heave offering (2% of a yield that a person initially tithes for a Kohen), until after sunset, which is, (at the time) when the stars appear. ​ Rambam's commentary: ורצה לומר במה שאמר משעה שהכהנים נכנסין לאכול בתרומתן משעה שיכנסו כהנים טמאים שטבלו לאכול בתרומתן וזה לא יהיה אלא אחר כלות היום ​ He is saying Nichnasin, enter, is referring to dipping in the Mikvah, as opposed to entering a place to eat the meat. ​ -- ​ I was looking to share Rabbi Avigdor Miller's words on weeds where he says they provide the service of water retention in the soil and came across this gem that is either sweet wine of the times or referring to my hometown of Altoona - All too Na(tan). The letter Nun can be novelized as Nachash, snake, and Mashiach has the same gematria as Nachash (358). ​ Growing up everyone was very hostile and criminal. For example my friend Nick Miller I mentioned above once took me out at night (we were around 14) and stole a bunch of barely valuable objects from people's yards like solar lights and he told me to sell them. That's just how he rebels against the cricket field I guess - like a "snake upon the way" (Genesis 49:17). And as in Numbers: "Behold! I arise to Sat-in (the snake), indeed the way is obnoxious before Me" ​ The Song of the Mouse: ​ וְעַכְבָּר אוֹמֵר. וְאַתָּה צַדִּיק עַל כׇּל־הַבָּא עָלַי כִּי־אֱמֶת עָשִׂיתָ וַאֲנִי הִרְשָֽׁעְתִּי׃ (ע"פ נחמיה ט לג) And the Mouse concedes, “You are just for all that comes upon me, for you have acted truthfully, and I have been wicked.” ​ Either Ohr Somayach's special or Artscroll says on this that mice are considered a wicked animal (maybe quoting the Gemara) since they chew peoples clothes without any benefit. Ohr HaChaim says clean garments are a metaphor for holy souls. So its like people that get off to lashon hara and such vile things H'F' ​ The snake at least had spiritual pursuits in taking down Adam, that is to become king of the world according to Bahir based on the verse of Adam ruling over the birds, a metaphor for the angels that HaShem made the Sat-n upset about. ​ -- ​ In celebration of how epic this eBay sword is I want to post the rest of the Psalm 149 from v 5 ​ יַעְלְז֣וּ חֲסִידִ֣ים בְּכָב֑וֹד יְ֝רַנְּנ֗וּ עַל־מִשְׁכְּבוֹתָֽם׃ Let the faithful exult in glory; let them shout for joy upon their couches/beds, ​ רוֹמְמ֣וֹת אֵ֭ל בִּגְרוֹנָ֑ם וְחֶ֖רֶב פִּיפִיּ֣וֹת בְּיָדָֽם׃ with paeans to God in their throats and double-edged swords in their hands, ​ לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת נְ֭קָמָה בַּגּוֹיִ֑ם תּ֝וֹכֵח֗וֹת בַּלְאֻמִּֽים׃ to impose retribution upon the nations, punishment upon the peoples, ​ לֶאְסֹ֣ר מַלְכֵיהֶ֣ם בְּזִקִּ֑ים וְ֝נִכְבְּדֵיהֶ֗ם בְּכַבְלֵ֥י בַרְזֶֽל׃ binding their kings with shackles, their nobles with chains of iron, ​ לַעֲשׂ֤וֹת בָּהֶ֨ם ׀ מִשְׁפָּ֬ט כָּת֗וּב הָדָ֣ר ה֭וּא לְכׇל־חֲסִידָ֗יו הַֽלְלוּ־יָֽהּ׃ {פ} executing the doom decreed against them. This is the glory of all His faithful. Hallelujah. ​ The last verse supports my logic that "sword" is listed first in the Shabbat war instruments Mishnah on carrying them out since it is the prescribed decree for their deaths. ​ Some relevant important learning from Mishnah Sanhedren 7 (remember Rambam says all idolators are judged as gentiles where they are almost always judged to be decapitated) ​ אַרְבַּע מִיתוֹת נִמְסְרוּ לְבֵית דִּין, סְקִילָה, שְׂרֵפָה, הֶרֶג, וָחֶנֶק. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר, שְׂרֵפָה, סְקִילָה, חֶנֶק, וָהֶרֶג. זוֹ מִצְוַת הַנִּסְקָלִין: ​ Four deaths have been entrusted to the court: stoning, burning, slaying [by the sword] and strangulation. R. Simeon says: “burning, stoning, strangulation and slaying.” That (the previous chapter) is the manner of stoning. ​ ​ מִצְוַת הַנִּשְׂרָפִין, הָיוּ מְשַׁקְּעִין אוֹתוֹ בַזֶּבֶל עַד אַרְכֻּבּוֹתָיו וְנוֹתְנִין סוּדָר קָשָׁה לְתוֹךְ הָרַכָּה וְכוֹרֵךְ עַל צַוָּארוֹ. זֶה מוֹשֵׁךְ אֶצְלוֹ וְזֶה מוֹשֵׁךְ אֶצְלוֹ עַד שֶׁפּוֹתֵחַ אֶת פִּיו, וּמַדְלִיק אֶת הַפְּתִילָה וְזוֹרְקָהּ לְתוֹךְ פִּיו וְיוֹרֶדֶת לְתוֹךְ מֵעָיו וְחוֹמֶרֶת אֶת בְּנֵי מֵעָיו. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר, אַף הוּא אִם מֵת בְּיָדָם לֹא הָיוּ מְקַיְּמִין בּוֹ מִצְוַת שְׂרֵפָה, אֶלָּא פוֹתְחִין אֶת פִּיו בִּצְבָת שֶׁלֹּא בְטוֹבָתוֹ וּמַדְלִיק אֶת הַפְּתִילָה וְזוֹרְקָהּ לְתוֹךְ פִּיו וְיוֹרֶדֶת לְתוֹךְ מֵעָיו וְחוֹמֶרֶת אֶת בְּנֵי מֵעָיו. אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן צָדוֹק, מַעֲשֶׂה בְּבַת כֹּהֵן אַחַת שֶׁזִּנְּתָה, וְהִקִּיפוּהָ חֲבִילֵי זְמוֹרוֹת וּשְׂרָפוּהָ. אָמְרוּ לוֹ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה בֵית דִּין שֶׁל אוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה בָּקִי: ​ The manner in which burning is executed is as follows: They would lower him into dung up to his armpits, then a hard cloth was placed within a soft one, wound round his neck, and the two loose ends pulled in opposite directions, forcing him to open his mouth. A wick (of molten lead) was then lit, and thrown into his mouth, so that it descended into his body and burned his bowels. R. Judah says: “Should he have died at their hands [being strangled by the bandage before the wick was thrown into his mouth], they would not have fulfilled the requirements of execution by fire. Rather his mouth was forced open with pincers against his wish, the wick lit and thrown into his mouth, so that it descended into his body and burned his bowels. Rabbi Eleazar ben Zadok said: “It once happened that a priest’s daughter committed adultery, whereupon bundles of sticks were placed around her and she was burnt. The Sages said to him: “That was because the court at that time was not well learned in law. ​ ​ מִצְוַת הַנֶּהֱרָגִים, הָיוּ מַתִּיזִין אֶת רֹאשׁוֹ בְסַיִף כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁהַמַּלְכוּת עוֹשָׂה. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר, נִוּוּל הוּא זֶה, אֶלָּא מַנִּיחִין אֶת רֹאשׁוֹ עַל הַסַּדָּן וְקוֹצֵץ בְּקוֹפִיץ. אָמְרוּ לוֹ, אֵין מִיתָה מְנֻוֶּלֶת מִזּוֹ. מִצְוַת הַנֶּחֱנָקִין, הָיוּ מְשַׁקְּעִין אוֹתוֹ בַזֶּבֶל עַד אַרְכֻּבּוֹתָיו וְנוֹתְנִין סוּדָר קָשָׁה לְתוֹךְ הָרַכָּה וְכוֹרֵךְ עַל צַוָּארוֹ, זֶה מוֹשֵׁךְ אֶצְלוֹ וְזֶה מוֹשֵׁךְ אֶצְלוֹ, עַד שֶׁנַּפְשׁוֹ יוֹצְאָה: ​ Slaying by the sword was performed thus: they would cut off his head by the sword, as is done by the civil authorities. R. Judah says: “This is a disgrace! Rather his head was laid on a block and severed with an axe. They said to him: “No death is more vile than this.” Strangulation was performed thus: the condemned man was lowered into dung up to his armpits, then a hard cloth was placed within a soft one, wound round his neck, and the two ends pulled in opposite directions until his Nefesh (soul in his blood) becomes Yotzei, goes out. ​ ​ אֵלּוּ הֵן הַנִּסְקָלִין, הַבָּא עַל הָאֵם, וְעַל אֵשֶׁת הָאָב, וְעַל הַכַּלָּה, וְעַל הַזְּכוּר, וְעַל הַבְּהֵמָה, וְהָאִשָּׁה הַמְבִיאָה אֶת הַבְּהֵמָה, וְהַמְגַדֵּף, וְהָעוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, וְהַנּוֹתֵן מִזַּרְעוֹ לַמֹּלֶךְ, וּבַעַל אוֹב וְיִדְּעוֹנִי, וְהַמְחַלֵּל אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת, וְהַמְקַלֵּל אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ, וְהַבָּא עַל נַעֲרָה הַמְאֹרָסָה, וְהַמֵּסִית, וְהַמַּדִּיחַ, וְהַמְכַשֵּׁף, וּבֵן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה. הַבָּא עַל הָאֵם, חַיָּב עָלֶיהָ מִשּׁוּם אֵם וּמִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אָב. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר, אֵינוֹ חַיָּב אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם הָאֵם בִּלְבָד. הַבָּא עַל אֵשֶׁת אָב חַיָּב עָלֶיהָ מִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אָב וּמִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, בֵּין בְּחַיֵּי אָבִיו בֵּין לְאַחַר מִיתַת אָבִיו, בֵּין מִן הָאֵרוּסִין בֵּין מִן הַנִּשּׂוּאִין. הַבָּא עַל כַּלָּתוֹ, חַיָּב עָלֶיהָ מִשּׁוּם כַּלָּתוֹ וּמִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, בֵּין בְּחַיֵּי בְנוֹ בֵּין לְאַחַר מִיתַת בְּנוֹ, בֵּין מִן הָאֵרוּסִין בֵּין מִן הַנִּשּׂוּאִין. הַבָּא עַל הַזְּכוּר וְעַל הַבְּהֵמָה, וְהָאִשָּׁה הַמְבִיאָה אֶת הַבְּהֵמָה, אִם אָדָם חָטָא, בְּהֵמָה מֶה חָטָאת, אֶלָּא לְפִי שֶׁבָּאת לָאָדָם תַּקָּלָה עַל יָדָהּ, לְפִיכָךְ אָמַר הַכָּתוּב תִּסָּקֵל. דָּבָר אַחֵר, שֶׁלֹּא תְהֵא בְּ הֵמָה עוֹבֶרֶת בַּשּׁוּק וְיֹאמְרוּ זוֹ הִיא שֶׁנִּסְקַל פְּלוֹנִי עַל יָדָהּ: ​ The following are stoned: He who has sexual relations with his mother, with his father’s wife, with his daughter-in-law, with a male; with a beast; a woman who commits bestiality with a beast; a blasphemer; an idolater; one who gives of his seed to molech; a necromancer or a wizard; one who desecrates the Sabbath; he who curses his father or mother; he who commits adultery with a betrothed woman; one who incites [individuals to idolatry]; one who seduces [a whole town to idolatry]; a sorcerer; and a wayward and rebellious son. He who has sexual relations with his mother incurs a penalty in respect of her both as his mother and as his father’s wife. R. Judah says: “He is liable in respect of her as his mother only.” He who has sexual relations with his father’s wife incurs a penalty in respect of her both as his father’s wife, and as a married woman, both during his father’s lifetime and after his death, whether she was widowed from betrothal or from marriage. He who has sexual relations with his daughter-in-law incurs a penalty in respect of her both as his daughter-in-law and as a married woman, both during his son’s lifetime and after his death, whether she was widowed from betrothal or from marriage. He who has sexual relations with a male or a beast, and a woman that commits bestiality: if the man has sinned, how has the animal sinned? But because the human was enticed to sin by the animal, therefore scripture ordered that it should be stoned. Another reason is that the animal should not pass through the market, and people say, this is the animal on account of which so and so was stoned. ​ ​ הַמְגַדֵּף אֵינוֹ חַיָּב עַד שֶׁיְּפָרֵשׁ הַשֵּׁם. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קָרְחָה, בְּכָל יוֹם דָּנִין אֶת הָעֵדִים בְּכִנּוּי יַכֶּה יוֹסֵי אֶת יוֹסֵי. נִגְמַר הַדִּין, לֹא הוֹרְגִים בְּכִנּוּי, אֶלָּא מוֹצִיאִים כָּל אָדָם לַחוּץ וְשׁוֹאֲלִים אֶת הַגָּדוֹל שֶׁבָּהֶן וְאוֹמְרִים לוֹ אֱמֹר מַה שֶּׁשָּׁמַעְתָּ בְּפֵרוּשׁ, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר, וְהַדַּיָּנִים עוֹמְדִין עַל רַגְלֵיהֶן וְקוֹרְעִין וְלֹא מְאַחִין. וְהַשֵּׁנִי אוֹמֵר אַף אֲנִי כָּמוֹהוּ, וְהַשְּׁלִישִׁי אוֹמֵר אַף אֲנִי כָּמוֹהוּ: ​ The blasphemer is punished only if he utters [the divine] name. Rabbi Joshua b. Korcha said: “The whole day [of the trial] the witnesses are examined by means of a substitute for the divine name: ‘may Yose smite Yose.’” When the trial was finished, the accused was not executed on this evidence, but all persons were removed [from court], and the chief witness was told, ‘State literally what you heard.’ Thereupon he did so, [using the divine name]. The judges then arose and tore their garments, which were not to be resewn. The second witness stated: “I too have heard thus” [but not uttering the divine name], and the third says: “I too heard thus.” ​ ​ הָעוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, אֶחָד הָעוֹבֵד, וְאֶחָד הַזּוֹבֵחַ, וְאֶחָד הַמְקַטֵּר, וְאֶחָד הַמְנַסֵּךְ, וְאֶחָד הַמִּשְׁתַּחֲוֶה, וְאֶחָד הַמְקַבְּלוֹ עָלָיו לֶאֱלוֹהַּ, וְהָאוֹמֵר לוֹ אֵלִי אָתָּה. אֲבָל הַמְגַפֵּף וְהַמְנַשֵּׁק וְהַמְכַבֵּד וְהַמְּרַבֵּץ וְהַמַּרְחִיץ, הַסָּךְ, הַמַּלְבִּישׁ וְהַמַּנְעִיל, עוֹבֵר בְּלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה. הַנּוֹדֵר בִּשְׁמוֹ וְהַמְקַיֵּם בִּשְׁמוֹ, עוֹבֵר בְּלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה. הַפּוֹעֵר עַצְמוֹ לְבַעַל פְּעוֹר, זוֹ הִיא עֲבוֹדָתוֹ. הַזּוֹרֵק אֶבֶן לְמַרְקוּלִיס, זוֹ הִיא עֲבוֹדָתוֹ: ​ He who engages in idol-worship [is executed]. This includes the one who serves it, sacrifices, offers incense, makes libations, bows to it, accepts it as a god, or says to it, “You are my god.” But he who embraces, kisses it, sweeps or sprinkles the ground before it, washes it, anoints it, clothes it, or puts shoes on it, he transgresses a negative commandment [but is not executed]. He who vows or swears by its name, violates a negative commandment. He who uncovers himself before Baal-Peor [is guilty and is to be stoned for] this is how it is worshipped. He who casts a stone on Merculis [is guilty and is to be stoned for] this is how it is worshipped. ​ ​ Now here is all of chapter 6 about the stoning procedure: ​ נִגְמַר הַדִּין, מוֹצִיאִין אוֹתוֹ לְסָקְלוֹ. בֵּית הַסְּקִילָה הָיָה חוּץ לְבֵית דִּין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר (ויקרא כד) הוֹצֵא אֶת הַמְקַלֵּל. אֶחָד עוֹמֵד עַל פֶּתַח בֵּית דִּין וְהַסּוּדָרִין בְּיָדוֹ, וְאָדָם אֶחָד רוֹכֵב הַסּוּס רָחוֹק מִמֶּנּוּ כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּהֵא רוֹאֵהוּ. אוֹמֵר אֶחָד יֶשׁ לִי לְלַמֵּד עָלָיו זְכוּת, הַלָּה מֵנִיף בַּסּוּדָרִין וְהַסּוּס רָץ וּמַעֲמִידוֹ. וַאֲפִלּוּ הוּא אוֹמֵר יֶשׁ לִי לְלַמֵּד עַל עַצְמִי זְכוּת, מַחֲזִירִין אוֹתוֹ אֲפִלּוּ אַרְבָּעָה וַחֲמִשָּׁה פְעָמִים, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁיֵּשׁ מַמָּשׁ בִּדְבָרָיו. מָצְאוּ לוֹ זְכוּת, פְּטָרוּהוּ, וְאִם לָאו, יוֹצֵא לִסָּקֵל. וְכָרוֹז יוֹצֵא לְפָנָיו, אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי בֶּן פְּלוֹנִי יוֹצֵא לִסָּקֵל עַל שֶׁעָבַר עֲבֵרָה פְלוֹנִית, וּפְלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי עֵדָיו, כָּל מִי שֶׁיּוֹדֵעַ לוֹ זְכוּת יָבֹא וִילַמֵּד עָלָיו: ​ When the trial is completed he [the condemned] is led forth to be stoned. The place of stoning was outside of the court, as it is says, “Bring out him that has cursed” (Lev. 24:14). A man was stationed at the door of the court with the handkerchiefs in his hand, and a man on a horse was stationed at a distance yet within sight of him. If one says, ‘I have something [further] to state in his favor’, he [the signaler] waves the handkerchief, and the man on the horse runs and stops them. And even if he [the convict] himself says, ‘I have something to plead in my own favor’, he is brought back, even four or five times, providing, however, that there is substance in his assertion. If then they find him innocent, they discharge him. But if not, he goes forth to be stoned, and a herald precedes him [crying]: so and so, the son of so and so, is going forth to be stoned because he committed such and such an offense, and so and so are his witnesses. Whoever knows anything in his favor, let him come and state it.” ​ ​ הָיָה רָחוֹק מִבֵּית הַסְּקִילָה כְּעֶשֶׂר אַמּוֹת, אוֹמְרִים לוֹ הִתְוַדֵּה, שֶׁכֵּן דֶּרֶךְ הַמּוּמָתִין מִתְוַדִּין, שֶׁכָּל הַמִּתְוַדֶּה יֶשׁ לוֹ חֵלֶק לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא. שֶׁכֵּן מָצִינוּ בְעָכָן שֶׁאָמַר לוֹ יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, בְּנִי שִׂים נָא כָבוֹד לַה' אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְתֶן לוֹ תוֹדָה וְגוֹ' וַיַּעַן עָכָן אֶת יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וַיֹּאמַר אָמְנָה אָנֹכִי חָטָאתִי לַה' אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְכָזֹאת וְגוֹ' (יהושע ז). וּמִנַּיִן שֶׁכִּפֶּר לוֹ וִדּוּיוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר (שם) וַיֹּאמֶר יְהוֹשֻׁעַ מֶה עֲכַרְתָּנוּ יַעְכָּרְךָ ה' בַּיּוֹם הַזֶּה. הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה אַתָּה עָכוּר, וְאִי אַתָּה עָכוּר לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא. וְאִם אֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ לְהִתְוַדּוֹת, אוֹמְרִים לוֹ, אֱמֹר תְּהֵא מִיתָתִי כַפָּרָה עַל כָּל עֲוֹנוֹתָי. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר, אִם הָיָה יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁהוּא מְזֻמָּם, אוֹמֵר תְּהֵא מִיתָתִי כַּפָּרָה עַל כָּל עֲוֹנוֹתַי חוּץ מֵעָוֹן זֶה. אָמְרוּ לוֹ, אִם כֵּן, יְהוּ כָל אָדָם אוֹמְרִים כָּךְ כְּדֵי לְנַקּוֹת אֶת עַצְמָן: ​ When he is about ten cubits away from the place of stoning, they say to him, ‘confess’, for such is the practice of all who are executed, that they [first] confess, for he who confesses has a portion in the world to come. For so we find in the case of Achan, that Joshua said to him, “My son, pay honor to the Lord, the God of Israel, and make confession to him. [Tell me what you have done, do not hold anything back from me.]” And Achan answered Joshua and said, “It is true, I have sinned against the Lord the God of Israel, and this is what I have done” (Josh. 7:19-20). And how do we know that his confessions made atonement for him? As it says, “And Joshua said, “What calamity have you brought upon us! The Lord will bring calamity upon you this day” (Josh. 7:35), [meaning] this day you are a calamity, but you are not to be a calamity in the next world. And if he does not know how to confess, they say to him, “Say, may my death be an expiation for all my sins.” Rabbi Judah said: “If he knows that he is a victim of false evidence, he can say: may my death be an expiation for all my sins but this.” They [the sages] said to him: “If so, everyone will speak likewise in order to clear himself.” ​ הָיָה רָחוֹק מִבֵּית הַסְּקִילָה אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, מַפְשִׁיטִין אוֹתוֹ אֶת בְּגָדָיו. הָאִישׁ, מְכַסִּין אוֹתוֹ מִלְּפָנָיו. וְהָאִשָּׁה, מִלְּפָנֶיהָ וּמֵאַחֲרֶיהָ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים, הָאִישׁ נִסְקָל עָרֹם וְאֵין הָאִשָּׁה נִסְקֶלֶת עֲרֻמָּה: ​ ​ When he is about four cubits distant from the place of stoning, he is stripped of his clothing. A man is covered in front and a woman both in front and behind, according to Rabbi Judah. But the Sages say: “A man is to be stoned naked and a woman is not to be stoned naked. ​ ​ בֵּית הַסְּקִילָה הָיָה גָבוֹהַּ שְׁתֵּי קוֹמוֹת. אֶחָד מִן הָעֵדִים דּוֹחֲפוֹ עַל מָתְנָיו. נֶהְפַּךְ עַל לִבּוֹ, הוֹפְכוֹ עַל מָתְנָיו. אִם מֵת בָּהּ, יָצָא. וְאִם לָאו, הַשֵּׁנִי נוֹטֵל אֶת הָאֶבֶן וְנוֹתְנָהּ עַל לִבּוֹ. אִם מֵת בָּהּ, יָצָא. וְאִם לָאו, רְגִימָתוֹ בְכָל יִשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר (דברים יז) יַד הָעֵדִים תִּהְיֶה בּוֹ בָרִאשֹׁנָה לַהֲמִיתוֹ וְיַד כָּל הָעָם בָּאַחֲרֹנָה. כָּל הַנִּסְקָלִין נִתְלִין, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים, אֵינוֹ נִתְלֶה אֶלָּא הַמְגַדֵּף וְהָעוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה. הָאִישׁ תּוֹלִין אוֹתוֹ פָּנָיו כְּלַפֵּי הָעָם, וְהָאִשָּׁה פָּנֶיהָ כְלַפֵּי הָעֵץ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים, הָאִישׁ נִתְלֶה וְאֵין הָאִשָּׁה נִתְלֵית. אָמַר לָהֶן רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, וַהֲלֹא שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן שָׁטָח תָּלָה נָשִׁים בְּאַשְׁקְלוֹן. אָמְרוּ לוֹ, שְׁמֹנִים נָשִׁים תָּלָה, וְאֵין דָּנִין שְׁנַיִם בְּיוֹם אֶחָד. כֵּיצַד תּוֹלִין אוֹתוֹ, מְשַׁקְּעִין אֶת הַקּוֹרָה בָאָרֶץ וְהָעֵץ יוֹצֵא מִמֶּנָּה, וּמַקִּיף שְׁתֵּי יָדָיו זוֹ עַל גַּבֵּי זוֹ וְתוֹלֶה אוֹתוֹ. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר, הַקּוֹרָה מֻטָּה עַל הַכֹּתֶל, וְתוֹלֶה אוֹתוֹ כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁהַטַּבָּחִין עוֹשִׂין. וּמַתִּירִין אוֹתוֹ מִיָּד. וְאִם לָן, עוֹבֵר עָלָיו בְּלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר (דברים כא) לֹא תָלִין נִבְלָתוֹ עַל הָעֵץ כִּי קָבוֹר תִּקְבְּרֶנּוּ כִּי קִלְלַת אֱלֹהִים תָּלוּי וְגוֹ'. כְּלוֹמַר, מִפְּנֵי מָה זֶה תָלוּי, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁבֵּרַךְ אֶת הַשֵּׁם, וְנִמְצָא שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם מִתְחַלֵּל: ​ The place of stoning was twice a man’s height. One of the witnesses pushed him by the hips, [so that] he was overturned on his heart. He was then turned on his back. If that caused his death, he had fulfilled [his duty]; but if not, the second witness took a stone and threw it on his chest. If he died thereby, he had done [his duty]; but if not, he [the criminal] was stoned by all Israel, for it is says: “The hand of the witnesses shall be first upon him to put him to death, and afterwards the hand of all the people” (Deut. 17:7). All who are stoned are [afterwards] hanged, according to Rabbi Eliezer. But the sages say: “Only the blasphemer and the idolater are hanged.” A man is hanged with his face towards the spectators, but a woman with her face towards the gallows, according to Rabbi Eliezer. But the sages say: a man is hanged, but not a woman. Rabbi Eliezer said to them: “But did not Shimon ben Shetah hang women at ashkelon?” They said: “[On that occasion] he hanged eighty women, even though two must not be tried on the same day. How is he hanged? The post is sunk into the ground with a [cross-] piece branching off [at the top] and he brings his hands together one over the other and hangs him up [thereby]. R. Jose said: the post is leaned against the wall, and he hangs him up the way butchers do. He is immediately let down. If he is left [hanging] over night, a negative command is thereby transgressed, for it says, “You shall not let his corpse remain all night upon the tree, but you must bury him the same day because a hanged body is a curse against god” (Deut. 21:23). As if to say why was he hanged? because he cursed the name [of god]; and so the name of Heaven [God] is profaned. אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר, בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁאָדָם מִצְטַעֵר, שְׁכִינָה מַה הַלָּשׁוֹן אוֹמֶרֶת כִּבְיָכוֹל, קַלַּנִי מֵרֹאשִׁי, קַלַּנִי מִזְּרוֹעִי. אִם כֵּן הַמָּקוֹם מִצְטַעֵר עַל דָּמָם שֶׁל רְשָׁעִים שֶׁנִּשְׁפַּךְ, קַל וָחֹמֶר עַל דָּמָם שֶׁל צַדִּיקִים. וְלֹא זוֹ בִלְבַד, אֶלָּא כָּל הַמֵּלִין אֶת מֵתוֹ, עוֹבֵר בְּלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה. הֱלִינוֹ לִכְבוֹדוֹ לְהָבִיא לוֹ אָרוֹן וְתַכְרִיכִים, אֵינוֹ עוֹבֵר עָלָיו. וְלֹא הָיוּ קוֹבְרִין אוֹתוֹ בְּקִבְרוֹת אֲבוֹתָיו, אֶלָּא שְׁתֵּי בָתֵּי קְבָרוֹת הָיוּ מְתֻקָּנִין לְבֵית דִּין, אַחַת לַנֶּהֱרָגִין וְלַנֶּחֱנָקִין וְאַחַת לַנִּסְקָלִין וְלַנִּשְׂרָפִין: ​ R. Meir said: “When man suffers, what expression does the Shechinah (God’s presence) use? “My head is too light (a euphemism for heavy) for me, my arm is too light (a euphemism for heavy) for me.” If God is so grieved over the blood of the wicked that is shed, how much more so over the blood of the righteous! And not only of this one [a criminal did the sages not to leave him overnight] but whosoever lets his dead lie over night transgresses a negative commandment. If he kept him over night for the sake of his honor, to procure for him a coffin or a shroud, he does not transgress. And they did not bury him [the executed person] in his ancestral tomb, but two burial places were prepared by the court, one for those who were decapitated or strangled, and the other for those who were stoned or burned. ​ ​ נִתְעַכֵּל הַבָּשָׂר, מְלַקְּטִין אֶת הָעֲצָמוֹת וְקוֹבְרִין אוֹתָן בִּמְקוֹמָן. וְהַקְּרוֹבִים בָּאִים וְשׁוֹאֲלִין בִּשְׁלוֹם הַדַּיָּנִים וּבִשְׁלוֹם הָעֵדִים, כְּלוֹמַר שֶׁאֵין בְּלִבֵּנוּ עֲלֵיכֶם כְּלוּם, שֶׁדִּין אֱמֶת דַּנְתֶּם. וְלֹא הָיוּ מִתְאַבְּלִין, אֲבָל אוֹנְנִין, שֶׁאֵין אֲנִינוּת אֶלָּא בַלֵּב: ​ When the flesh was completely decomposed, the bones were gathered and buried in their proper place. The relatives then came and greeted the judges and witnesses, as if to say, we have no [ill feelings] against you, for you gave a true judgment. And they observed no mourning rites but grieved [for him], for grief is in the heart alone. ​ Let this be fire to fuel our only free choice, how much we decide to fear Heaven and may Heaven never let any of these examples unfold upon us ​ ' ​ "When he is about ten cubits away from the place of stoning, they say to him, ‘confess’, for such is the practice of all who are executed, that they [first] confess, for he who confesses has a portion in the world to come ." ​ What a powerful consideration. A witchard etc. that gets caught can easily get a portion of Infinite Life whereas one who does not get caught lives his/her life out doing dusty things (think of playing Runescape or Maplestory [online videogames] if you used to as a kid and get the reference. If not, they are just out learning magic and doing strange related things and fighting each other in the "wilderness" H'F') as their reward and then very commonly cease to be forever (Psalm 49). ​ Why do I say almost all the time we execute gentiles/idolators by the sword and not all the time? ​ I remember reading in the book "The Noahide Laws" (that usually quoted Rambam) that there is one other method of execution for gentiles that is a result of some specific sin, maybe it was adultery with a Jewish woman ​ -- ​ As for showering on Shabbat and Yom Tov, Rambam says this in Hilchot Shabbat 22:2 ​ מִפְּנֵי מָה אָסְרוּ חֲכָמִים לִכָּנֵס בַּמֶּרְחָץ בְּשַׁבָּת. מִפְּנֵי הַבַּלָּנִין שֶׁהָיוּ מְחִמִּין חַמִּין בְּשַׁבָּת וְאוֹמְרִין מֵעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת הוּחַמּוּ. לְפִיכָךְ גָּזְרוּ שֶׁלֹּא יִכָּנֵס אָדָם לַמֶּרְחָץ בְּשַׁבָּת אֲפִלּוּ לְהַזִּיעַ. וְגָזְרוּ שֶׁלֹּא יִשְׁתַּטֵּף כָּל גּוּפוֹ בְּחַמִּין וַאֲפִלּוּ בְּחַמִּין שֶׁהוּחַמּוּ מֵעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת. אֲבָל פָּנָיו יָדָיו וְרַגְלָיו מֻתָּר. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים בְּחַמֵּי הָאוּר גְּזֵרָה מִשּׁוּם מֶרְחָץ. אֲבָל בְּחַמֵּי טְבֶרְיָא וְכַיּוֹצֵא בָּהֶן מֻתָּר לְהִשְׁתַּטֵּף בָּהֶן כָּל גּוּפוֹ. וְאָסוּר לִרְחֹץ בְּמַיִם חַמִּין שֶׁבַּמְּעָרוֹת מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהַמְּעָרָה יֵשׁ בָּהּ הֶבֶל וְיָבוֹא לִידֵי זֵעָה וְנִמְצֵאת כְּמֶרְחָץ: ​ Why did the Sages forbid entering a bathhouse on the Sabbath? Because the attendants would heat up water on the Sabbath, and say that it has been heated before the commencement of the Sabbath. For this reason, our Sages decreed that one should not enter a bathhouse on the Sabbath, even to use [merely] as a steam bath. Similarly, they decreed that a person should not rinse his entire body with hot water - even if the water was heated on Friday. One may, however, wash one's face, hands, and feet [with hot water that was heated before the commencement of the Sabbath]. When do the above [restrictions] apply? To water that is heated by fire. One may, however, rinse one's entire body in the hot springs of Tiberias and the like. It is forbidden to bathe in hot springs located in caves, for the cave is filled with hot air, and one will sweat [as in a steam bath]. Thus, it resembles a bathhouse. ​ In Hilchot Yom Tov 1:16 he says: ​ רְחִיצָה וְסִיכָה הֲרֵי הֵן בִּכְלַל אֲכִילָה וּשְׁתִיָּה וְעוֹשִׂין אוֹתָן בְּיוֹם טוֹב שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר (שמות יב טז) "אַךְ אֲשֶׁר יֵאָכֵל לְכָל נֶפֶשׁ" לְכָל שֶׁצָּרִיךְ הַגּוּף. לְפִיכָךְ מְחִמִּין חַמִּין בְּיוֹם טוֹב וְרוֹחֵץ בָּהֶן פָּנָיו יָדָיו וְרַגְלָיו. אֲבָל כָּל גּוּפוֹ אָסוּר מִשּׁוּם גְּזֵרַת מֶרְחָץ. וְחַמִּין שֶׁהוּחַמּוּ מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב רוֹחֵץ בָּהֶן כָּל גּוּפוֹ בְּיוֹם טוֹב שֶׁלֹּא גָּזְרוּ עַל דָּבָר זֶה אֶלָּא בְּשַׁבָּת בִּלְבַד: ​ Bathing and anointing oneself are considered in the general category of eating and drinking . They are permitted on a holiday [as indicated by Exodus 12:16]: "Only that [labor] from which all souls will eat [may you perform]" - i.e., all the needs of the body [are permitted]. Therefore, one may heat water on a holiday and wash his hands and feet. It is, however, forbidden to wash one's entire body. This is a decree,  *As the Rambam explains in Hilchot Shabbat 22:2, our Sages instituted restrictions against bathing on the Sabbath because the attendants would heat up the water on the Sabbath and claim that they had done so on the preceding day. On holidays, although the rules are more lenient, certain restrictions remain. For a discussion concerning the laws of ritual immersion on a holiday, see the notes on Hilchot Shabbat 23:8. When water was heated before the commencement of a holiday, one may wash one's entire body with it on the holiday. This was prohibited only on the Sabbath. ​ Therefore since it is Rabbinic and Rambam says one has to shower once every other day at least (and we are about to enter a Shabbat then 2-day Yom Tov rest), don't worry about not showering on Yom Tov (just don't squeeze any water out of your hair or the towel). Also since Rambam agrees with the Gra about bathing and anointing being like drinking and eating even, one is allowed to cook food from a pre existing flame (you can increase it into a fire - not an electric plate though) during Yom Tov. See this Aish article for more details ​ Actually if you have a standard hot water tank even with a constant pilot light, I think one should only take one shower (and as needed if one is worried of idolators) on Yom Rishon, Sunday (make sure to get one Friday afternoon in) in order to fulfill the Mitzvah of not becoming vile by not being able to shower for 3 full days H'F' since the pilot light lights a larger fire that actually will definitely extinguish itself. ​ When a Mitzvah is constant, is overrules a Mitzvah that is less often. Therefore I think the obligation is Biblical from Rambam to bathe or shower at least every other day based on the verse "You shall not make yourselves detestable". If not you become extremely offensive to people's (and your own) noses - it could even be like assault to force someone to smell your body odor H'F'. ​ G-d Willing soon we will all have Shabbat and Yom Tov hot tubs with the abundance of wealth and technology creating free labor through solar powered (or other free energy) humanoid robots. ​ -- ​ Berakchot 64a ​ וְאָמַר רַבִּי אָבִין הַלֵּוִי: הַנִּפְטָר מֵחֲבֵרוֹ אַל יֹאמַר לוֹ ״לֵךְ בְּשָׁלוֹם״, אֶלָּא ״לֵךְ לְשָׁלוֹם״, שֶׁהֲרֵי יִתְרוֹ שֶׁאָמַר לוֹ לְמֹשֶׁה ״לֵךְ לְשָׁלוֹם״, עָלָה וְהִצְלִיחַ. דָּוִד שֶׁאָמַר לוֹ לְאַבְשָׁלוֹם ״לֵךְ בְּשָׁלוֹם״, הָלַךְ וְנִתְלָה. ​ And Rabbi Avin HaLevi said: One who takes leave from another should not say to him: Go in peace, but rather, he should say: Go to peace. As we see that, on the one hand, Jethro said to Moses: “Go to peace” (Exodus 4:18), and Moses ascended and was successful. On the other hand, David said to his son, Absalom: “Go in peace” (II Samuel 15:9), and Absalom went and was ultimately hanged. ​ Although before GoDaddy took down my old site AishDaat I wrote based on Tehillim not to greet sinners in HaShem's name, I think this is the best way to help people repent when departing since it can be novelized Go [back] to Peace! (a Name of HaShem) Repent! ​​​ -- ​ I saw one man a few days ago say on MiYodea that the Biblical prohibition only applies to like a sourdough starter since todays leavening agents aren't made from the 5 grains (although I saw one of the more authentic sites [Chabad or Aish etc] say that since the verse is repeated, all leavening is Biblical) ​ It made me think of those people that have decade or generations old sourdough starters. Since the spiritual reason is to get rid of our arrogance, (a metaphor for "swelling" up like bread opposed to Matzah), they are probably holding on to many years of spiritual arrogance they will hopefully soon free themselves of if they haven't already. I also saw one person quote Rashi who holds by Rabbi Yehudah who apparently says it has to be burnt (although we saw Rambam does not hold this way as he said as long as it is inedible even to a dog). Therefore I think its extremely important to follow the custom of keeping at least 10 pieces (metaphor for wholeness, completion, all 10 Sefirot of Creation) to burn tomorrow before Shabbat if one can. ​ Also I said about making juice Matzot during Pesach but the flour would also need to be Shemurah, guarded. ​ Here is a guide from OU of what you need to burn, make vile and bury, flush, or dispose in a public trash can ​ -- ​ Nissan 13 ​ I read in the Gemara yesterday that one has to make sure one's water kettle is cleaned for Shabbat so that the old food/residue doesn't turn into coals and cook. ​ Also if you didn't know, if you didn't prepare coffee before Shabbat for the kettle and only have hot water, the proper way to brew it is to use instant coffee and first put the hot water in a cup by itself and then pour it into the cup with coffee half/half honey etc. In this way, by pouring the water into a Kli Rishon (first vessel) and then Kli Sheni (second), it cools the hot water enough to where it isn't considered cooking the coffee, just dissolving it. ​ **Make sure the cups do not have leftover water from previous times. ​ Here is a website (added to list at top) to convert Youtube videos to mp3 and download them to not have to see any images and also to repeat a playlist on Shabbat instead of a single video: https://cnvmp3.com/v23 ​​ -- ​ It is said that shungite is a "grounding stone" although Western science again says this is pseudoscience. I tested the Ohms (electrical resistance) of different gemstones, metals, and shungite. The metals had no resistance as expected and the resistance of the other ~10 random gemstones was too high to measure (even quartz). The shungite, though, gives random measurements of Ohms (the more or bigger the rocks the higher the resistance) until it becomes perfectly conductive like metal. ​ Therefore wearing shungite jewelry or having these stones in your pockets (maybe not polyester or other artificial materials) will give you a few seconds of warning as the wizards calibrate to your energy/electrical field that includes the shungites. -the more and larger the better. ​ (maybe after Pesach I will upload a video) ​ The richer heathens can taze us more directly so this is more for "long range attacks" from the more desolate ones. However I've found that the more desolate ones are much more brutal in their witchcraft since the richer ones are sweetened with their possessions etc. ​ ​ -- ​ ​ Pirkei Avot gives the proper learning schedule for children - 5:20-22 ​ יְהוּדָה בֶן תֵּימָא אוֹמֵר, הֱוֵי עַז כַּנָּמֵר, וְקַל כַּנֶּשֶׁר, וְרָץ כַּצְּבִי, וְגִבּוֹר כָּאֲרִי, לַעֲשׂוֹת רְצוֹן אָבִיךָ שֶׁבַּשָּׁמָיִם. הוּא הָיָה אוֹמֵר, עַז פָּנִים לְגֵיהִנֹּם, וּבֹשֶׁת פָּנִים לְגַן עֵדֶן. יְהִי רָצוֹן מִלְּפָנֶיךָ יְיָ אֱלֹהֵינוּ שֶׁתִּבְנֶה עִירְךָ בִּמְהֵרָה בְיָמֵינוּ וְתֵן חֶלְקֵנוּ בְתוֹרָתֶךָ: ​ Judah ben Tema said: Be strong as a leopard, and swift as an eagle, and fleet as a gazelle, and brave as a lion, to do the will of your Father who is in heaven. He used to say: the arrogant is headed for Gehinnom and the blushing for the garden of Eden. May it be the will, O Lord our God, that your city be rebuilt speedily in our days and set our portion in the studying of your Torah. ​ הוּא הָיָה אוֹמֵר, בֶּן חָמֵשׁ שָׁנִים לַמִּקְרָא, בֶּן עֶשֶׂר לַמִּשְׁנָה, בֶּן שְׁלשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה לַמִּצְוֹת, בֶּן חֲמֵשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה לַתַּלְמוּד, בֶּן שְׁמֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה לַחֻפָּה, בֶּן עֶשְׂרִים לִרְדֹּף, בֶּן שְׁלשִׁים לַכֹּחַ, בֶּן אַרְבָּעִים לַבִּינָה, בֶּן חֲמִשִּׁים לָעֵצָה, בֶּן שִׁשִּׁים לַזִּקְנָה, בֶּן שִׁבְעִים לַשֵּׂיבָה, בֶּן שְׁמֹנִים לַגְּבוּרָה, בֶּן תִּשְׁעִים לָשׁוּחַ, בֶּן מֵאָה כְּאִלּוּ מֵת וְעָבַר וּבָטֵל מִן הָעוֹלָם: ​ He used to say: At five years of age the study of Scripture; At ten the study of Mishnah; At thirteen subject to the commandments; At fifteen the study of Talmud; At eighteen the bridal canopy; At twenty for pursuit [of livelihood]; At thirty the peak of strength; At forty wisdom; At fifty able to give counsel; At sixty old age; At seventy fullness of years; At eighty the age of “strength”; At ninety a bent body; At one hundred, as good as dead and gone completely out of the world. ​ ​ בֶּן בַּג בַּג אוֹמֵר, הֲפֹךְ בָּהּ וַהֲפֹךְ בָּהּ, דְּכֹלָּא בָהּ. וּבָהּ תֶּחֱזֵי, וְסִיב וּבְלֵה בָהּ, וּמִנַּהּ לֹא תָזוּעַ, שֶׁאֵין לְךָ מִדָּה טוֹבָה הֵימֶנָּה: ​ Ben Bag Bag said: Turn it over, and [again] turn it over, for all is therein. And look into it; And become gray and old therein; And do not move away from it, for you have no better portion than it. ​ ​'​ ​ It seems the Mishnah disagrees with Rambam who says a man should get a job, then house, based on interpreting a verse in reverse order (I will come back and get the source) ​ When I was in a religious community in Har Nof, Jerusalem in Yeshivah, I learned that after a marriage, the husband and wife should stay home together for a year and the family or community should support them. Therefore I would guess that the family or otherwise community should ideally support them for two years (and these are financially unabundant times H'F') if he isn't supposed to get a job until 20. ​ **Its also important to note that women are obligated in their Mitzvot a year earlier at 12. ​​ --- ​ Rambam rules that the principle of nullification of 1 in 60 does not apply to Chametz on Pesach because it falls under the principle in the Gemara in Beitzah 3b that something that will become permitted later but is currently prohibited is therefore prohibited until it will become permitted. The example here is if your chicken lays an egg on Yom Tov you have to wait until the next day to eat it (since you were not prepared for it before the Holy Day), but it will always be permitted then. ​ אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא סָפֵק יוֹם טוֹב סָפֵק חוֹל, הָוֵי דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ מַתִּירִין, וְכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ מַתִּירִין — אֲפִילּוּ בְּאֶלֶף לֹא בָּטֵיל ​ "...it is a thing that there is to it permittance, and any thing that there is to it permittance, even in a thousand it is not nullified." ​ I prefer Rabbi Mordechai ben Hillel's seasoning (logic) [see OU's article here] that since the Chametz will become prohibited next Pesach, it does not fall under Mashehu (the small amount not being nullified). ​ Why? ​ The later part of the statement from the Gemara can be understood as "and when there is permittance to the entire thing, even in a thousand it is not nullified" ​ or "And [when] the entire thing (forbidden mixture) will be permitted" ​ Therefore the >1/60 Chametz mixture accidentally added on Pesach, although indeed it will be permitted in the next week, it will be prohibited in 51 more weeks at the start of the next Pesach, and especially since 1 in 51 is less than 1 in 60 and therefore considered significant, we cannot say that there is permittance to the entire thing [mixture] - it has its stringencies still. ​ ​--- ​ Dvarim 33:20 ​ וּלְגָ֣ד אָמַ֔ר בָּר֖וּךְ מַרְחִ֣יב גָּ֑ד כְּלָבִ֣יא שָׁכֵ֔ן וְטָרַ֥ף זְר֖וֹעַ אַף־קׇדְקֹֽד׃ ​ "And of Gad he said: Blessed be the One who enlarges Gad! Poised is he like a lion To tear off arm and head [in one swing]." ​ After swinging my sword around for a few days now, I've realized that the best method (if someone is fighting back) is to swing with diagonal dashes (/ \ / \) like a figure 8. A vertical strike could be side stepped and a horizontal can be dodged by thrusting the torso back like the letter C or Chaf (C---) like you saw in cartoon sword fights. Therefore you would cut off a person's head and arm at once like this verse. ​ According to ChatGPT the "Figure 8 Sword Technique" is a real authentic style where one just keeps swinging in a figure 8. Another hint to this is the letter אָ Alef. Its saying: Use the figure 8 sword technique and/or strike to kill diagonally, the same message as the letter "X". ​ -- ​ YirimiY-h 8:11 ​ וַיְרַפּ֞וּ אֶת־שֶׁ֤בֶר בַּת־עַמִּי֙ עַל־נְקַלָּ֔ה לֵאמֹ֖ר שָׁל֣וֹם ׀ שָׁל֑וֹם וְאֵ֖ין שָׁלֽוֹם׃ ​ "And they offer false healing to the hurt of the daughter of My people lightly, Saying: ‘Peace, peace’, when there is no peace." ​ This can be applied to the "rabbis" that focus on rabbinic injunctions, the same message as YeshaY-Hu 29:13 ​ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲדֹנָ֗י יַ֚עַן כִּ֤י נִגַּשׁ֙ הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה בְּפִ֤יו וּבִשְׂפָתָיו֙ כִּבְּד֔וּנִי וְלִבּ֖וֹ רִחַ֣ק מִמֶּ֑נִּי וַתְּהִ֤י יִרְאָתָם֙ אֹתִ֔י מִצְוַ֥ת אֲנָשִׁ֖ים מְלֻמָּדָֽה׃ ​ "My Sovereign said: Because that people has approached [Me] with its mouth And honored Me with its lips, But has kept its heart far from Me, And its worship of Me has been A social obligation, *social obligation Lit. “commandment of men.” learned by rote—" ​ This generation is 5785 years from Adam and is swallowed in darkness. The people need to focus on the actual Biblical Mitzvot and not leave their homes 3 times a day every day to get eaten like bread in a zombie "Minyan" ​ -- ​ Why do I skip around the Torah instead of stick to a daily learning schedule? Once in Yeshivat Dvar YiruShalayim, I was wondering what to learn and an older Chasid told me to learn whatever my heart was drawing me towards. I have tried sticking to the Daf Yomi schedule and even learned all of Bavli Berachot this way, but I find it makes learning more into a chore like going to the gym and makes my "Har Sinai", as in Thoughts of Hatred to climb in order to enjoy Torah, or the Cherubim with the ever turning sword in the way of Gan Eden (see the beginning of Bereisheit) much stronger. ​ Additionally, I often see Bavli Berachot quoted and even go back to it myself to see things I completely forgot or maybe read without absorbing H'F'. On the other hand, the Torah that I learned from my own curiosity sticks with me much better. Nevertheless I still try to equally pull from Tanakh, Mishnah/Halacha, and Gemara like the Torah instructs. ​ -- ​ Considering The Mordechai's superior logic (in my opinion) to the Rambam on 1 in 60 being nullified even in Chametz, and also the fact that it costs additional money for companies to be Kosher for Pesach certified that they can only profit on for one week out of the year, I think it is reasonable to use one's judgement for groceries as long as only basic ingredients are listed ("natural flavors" could be anything including the 5 species of grain and would probably need a phone or email inquiry) and its not specified that it may contain wheat etc., since then it would be intentionally/knowingly added (although according to this Star-K article it wouldn't matter even if they intentionally added 1/60 of wheat since they are gentile owned companies)​ ​ --- ​ If you are a JAP (Jewish-American-Prince or Princess) and wondering why you never found your Prince/Princess (including me), maybe its since we weren't following the stringencies of Guarded Matzah according to Rambam H'F' and HaShem didn't want our Bread of Salvation, where we leave an unjoyful life as in Yevamot 62B; ​ Rabbi Tanḥum said that Rabbi Ḥanilai said: Any man who does not have a wife is left without joy, without blessing, without goodness. He proceeds to quote verses to support each part of his statement. He is without joy, as it is written: “And you shall rejoice, you and your household” (Deuteronomy 14:26), which indicates that a man is in a joyful state only when he is with his household, i.e., his wife. He is without blessing, as it is written: “To cause a blessing to rest in your house” (Ezekiel 44:30), which indicates that blessing comes through one’s house, i.e., one’s wife. He is without goodness, as it is written: “It is not good that man should be alone” (Genesis 2:18), i.e., without a wife. [How much more so a woman? Since the Bahir says a woman is naturally colder and warmed up by the man] ​ Therefore HaShem did not want to give us yeast-water (a metaphor for wisdoms from the vile kingdom of evil) infected bread as our eternal food. ​ Fortunately, since "the end of a matter is everything", if you didn't hear me and didn't order Shmurah Matzah there is still almost a week to order it. ​ Why do I assume it got wet if not guarded according to the verse "You shall guard the Matzot" like Rambam? As mentioned many times the West is called the "land of the flying treacherous shadow" in Isaiah 18:1. As soon as you turn your back even in your own house one is likely there conspiring H'F' if you haven't noticed, may G-d quickly save us! ​ Fortunately since nowadays the Matzot are thin crackers, the modern sages teach that it is very unlikely that there is any unbaked flour in them that could become leavened when exposed to water. And you, be an artisan (in Torah) and be mute and deaf like an earthenware vessel, and you will plow this way ​ About this verse (because it is 14:14, as in "strong hand" since both hands are included in the right) we can apply Shemot (Exodus [from slavery]) 13:14 ​ בְּחֹ֣זֶק יָ֗ד הוֹצִיאָ֧נוּ יְהֹוָ֛ה מִמִּצְרַ֖יִם מִבֵּ֥ית עֲבָדִֽים "With the power of the hand HaShem brings us forth from Egypt, from the house of slavery"​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​ TheMercifulOne.net בְּרֵאשִׁ֖ית בָּרָ֣א אֱלֹהִ֑ים אֵ֥ת הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם וְאֵ֥ת הָאָֽרֶץ ׃ Elokim is Everything (Alef-Taf), The Heavens and all of The Earth. יברכך השם וישמרך Bless You HaShem and safeguard You. ​ ​​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​​ ​​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​​ ​ ​ ​ ​​​​ ​​​ AyshDaat.com continued **updated date and time moved to bottom​​​​ The Merciful One project below updated Nissan 24 20:53 ​​ Psalm 50:16 "And to the wicked G-d says What is it for you to relate My Decrees?" -Get out of here and cease to be. You know better ​**Remember Sefirat HaOmer ​ *There is no using or downloading anything here without a Mitzvah ​ נָפַל כִּכָּר שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה, טָהוֹר. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי מְטַמֵּא: Mishnah Yadayim 2:1 If a loaf of Terumah (Kohen entitled-bread from Beit HaMikdash service) fell into one's cup of purification waters, it is valid (Tahor). Rabbi Yosei makes it invalid. ​ It can be read on its own - A loaf of Terumah fell - it is pure. Therefore use the loaf of Terumah as a parable for a Kohen. If he falls to buying a prostitute, it is valid, since she is almost 100% recently fallen to satinism. Why? The Mishnah is a response to the Roman exile, that is alluded to in scripture by the words "fell upon (Avraham)". In the words of Mishlei/Proverbs, the falling woman prostitute is the eternal loaf of bread. Since the Romans keep the people on the level of Adam (non intentional sinners, both wise and clueless) separated H'F', and the Kohen has to marry a virgin Jewish woman, the Kohen is trapped and should therefore take counsel from the rooster "Do not love sleep/keeping your strength lest you get plowed/impoverished (with a seminal emission). Open up your people (since the Kohen's are the spiritual leaders of the world) or "your nothing - Ainecha" (since they lost their right to exist recently and are metaphorically called "dead" since once a person falls to idolatry there are very likely not going to exist after death Heaven save us! Also they live secretive horrible lives and only display their pure "pig hoofs" to the world) to the Shabbat bread! (Sheva Lachem) or be sated with bread! (Seva Lachem). ***Do not take a woman that's blood had been poured out (she is a "ghost in the shell") or your offspring will be doomed as you will see later according to Sefer Daniel. ​ That is unless he is on the level of Yaakov and has never emitted a drop in his life. ​ Why does Rabbi Yosei make invalid? In my opinion this is a case where he ejaculates multiple times since the Gemara says he can only one time and then she is a convert so they cannot get married and she should go find a non Kohein to marry. Even if she was a virgin with a Jewish mother since she was likely an idolator until he had relations for a little first, he still cannot marry her since she is not a virgin unless you convert her before and give her something (there is a minimum limit on value but it is not a lot, maybe a buck or a few and by the other opinion, I think Beit Hillel, its about a real copper penny) for the sake of marriage or both agree that the relations will marry you. ​ The Rooster is saying do it weekly, Shavua, lest you get impoverished monetarily or plowed from lack of strength in one's bones from losing too much semen H'F'. ​ Also consider the parable of the pool table and that there are many similar looking people (assuming clones based on star wars 2 [make sure not to take your own clown as there is a nazi/grass movement that pushes this H'F']) in the West. Avraham didn't even look at Sarah until he spoke the verse ~"Now I see you are very beautiful" and you are likely blind like me as its written "who is blind but My servant?" and your glasses, phone, mirrors, and contacts will all open up the underworld to them (freshly withered plants that don't need that H'F') so consider what I said, see it for yourself, and make a large and comfortable pool table. ​ Hopefully this will reach another "HaAdam Eitz HaSadeh" through the method of bee pollination. ​ Also this is a way to sincerely give charity since you will see her relent of her strength against Heaven and convert before your eyes so you have a sincere poor person to give Tzedakah to. Maybe give as little as possible before and then 10-20 percent of your salary (the Gra says 20 minimum) afterwards in case somehow she denies Us H'F' and you graft her holy branch (her beautiful soul) onto yourself (Ohr HaChaim). ​ - ​ I think I will likely shower on Yom Rishon (Sunday) at least for fear of gentiles torturing us H'F' unless there is significant repetitive satin garments in the way. However maybe one could make an argument based on the obligation to bathe/shower once every two days since Shabbat + Yom Tov (outside Israel) is over two days. ​ Important Halacha article from Chabad about placing 1 day orders and 2 day not from Amazon to arrive on Shabbat/Yom Tov ​​ ​ Since Rambam says one should only eat large fish once in awhile and the sages say for Shabbat, maybe if you find that my Torah is too "large/heavy" you should start with Artscroll and maybe print out all the weekly updates for Shabbat and Yom Tov or if not then save for Friday morning ​ -- Nissan 23 ​ Tehillim 137 ​ עַ֥ל־נַהֲר֨וֹת ׀ בָּבֶ֗ל שָׁ֣ם יָ֭שַׁבְנוּ גַּם־בָּכִ֑ינוּ בְּ֝זׇכְרֵ֗נוּ אֶת־צִיּֽוֹן׃ By the rivers [the ordinances of the kings] of Babylon, There we sat down, yea, we wept, When we remembered Zion. ​ ​ עַֽל־עֲרָבִ֥ים בְּתוֹכָ֑הּ תָּ֝לִ֗ינוּ כִּנֹּרוֹתֵֽינוּ׃ Upon the willows [Aravim, another face is Erevim - the multiple "evenings", exiles that began] in the midst thereof We hanged up our harps. ​ כִּ֤י שָׁ֨ם שְֽׁאֵל֪וּנוּ שׁוֹבֵ֡ינוּ דִּבְרֵי־שִׁ֭יר וְתוֹלָלֵ֣ינוּ שִׂמְחָ֑ה שִׁ֥ירוּ לָ֝֗נוּ מִשִּׁ֥יר צִיּֽוֹן׃ For there they that led us captive asked of us words of song, And our tormentors asked of us mirth: ‘Sing us one of the songs of Zion.' [like how the erev rabbis force people to pray at length despite the torture] ​ אֵ֗יךְ נָשִׁ֥יר אֶת־שִׁיר־יְהֹוָ֑ה עַ֝֗ל אַדְמַ֥ת נֵכָֽר׃ How shall we sing [Nashir, like Nesher, eagle. How can we soar in Torah on foreign land? As Mishlei says She makes wings for Herself like the Nesher and flies Heavenward] the LORD’S song In a foreign land? ​ אִֽם־אֶשְׁכָּחֵ֥ךְ יְֽרוּשָׁלָ֗͏ִם תִּשְׁכַּ֥ח יְמִינִֽי׃ If I forget thee, O Jerusalem, Let my right hand forget her cunning. [Those who do not pay heed to YiruShalayim likely do not pay heed to the Avir Yaakov] ​ תִּדְבַּֽק־לְשׁוֹנִ֨י ׀ לְחִכִּי֮ אִם־לֹ֢א אֶ֫זְכְּרֵ֥כִי אִם־לֹ֣א אַ֭עֲלֶה אֶת־יְרוּשָׁלַ֑͏ִם עַ֝֗ל רֹ֣אשׁ שִׂמְחָתִֽי׃ Let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth, [so that one does not spiritually kill herself like what just happened with gangster rap and lust pop Heaven save us Ana!] If I remember thee not; If I set not Jerusalem Above my chiefest joy. [Since the body is compared to a city, Ir, in Tanya, and Shalom is a Holy Name, a face on this is if one does not make proper Berachot he will be completely unaware or completely disregard the Brit BeSefat - Covenant with the Lips and that the mouth is the Holy of Holies] ​ זְכֹ֤ר יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ לִבְנֵ֬י אֱד֗וֹם אֵת֮ י֤וֹם יְֽר֫וּשָׁלָ֥͏ִם הָ֭אֹ֣מְרִים עָ֤רוּ ׀ עָ֑רוּ עַ֝֗ד הַיְס֥וֹד בָּֽהּ׃ Remember, O LORD, against the children of Edom The day of Jerusalem; Who said: 'Rase it, rase it, Even to the foundation thereof.' ​ '-, Why is Edom mentioned when we started with Babylon? We will come back at the end. ​ בַּת־בָּבֶ֗ל הַשְּׁד֫וּדָ֥ה אַשְׁרֵ֥י שֶׁיְשַׁלֶּם־לָ֑ךְ אֶת־גְּ֝מוּלֵ֗ךְ שֶׁגָּמַ֥לְתְּ לָֽנוּ׃ O daughter of Babylon, that art to be destroyed [or the devastator, the ruiner, like how they eat their children may HaGevurot SheBaElohim pursue and eternally torture and slay them all]; Happy shall he be, that repayeth thee As thou hast served us. ​ אַשְׁרֵ֤י ׀ שֶׁיֹּאחֵ֓ז וְנִפֵּ֬ץ אֶֽת־עֹלָלַ֗יִךְ אֶל־הַסָּֽלַע׃ {פ} Happy shall he be, that taketh and dasheth thy little ones Against the rock. -If the West wants to stop being bitter blasphemers they will reinstate the witch trials (we once had the " Salem witch trials" -Amazing!) and "rid the land of vicious beasts" so we can grow fruit trees Ana instead of satin shade trees H'F'. ​ ​ ' ​ Daniel 2:32-46 ​ ה֣וּא צַלְמָ֗א רֵאשֵׁהּ֙ דִּֽי־דְהַ֣ב טָ֔ב חֲד֥וֹהִי וּדְרָע֖וֹהִי דִּ֣י כְסַ֑ף מְע֥וֹהִי וְיַרְכָתֵ֖הּ דִּ֥י נְחָֽשׁ׃ The head of that statue was of fine gold; its breast and arms were of silver; its belly and thighs, of bronze; ​ שָׁק֖וֹהִי דִּ֣י פַרְזֶ֑ל רַגְל֕וֹהִי (מנהון) [מִנְּהֵין֙] דִּ֣י פַרְזֶ֔ל (ומנהון) [וּמִנְּהֵ֖ין] דִּ֥י חֲסַֽף׃ its legs were of iron, and its feet part iron and part clay. ​ חָזֵ֣ה הֲוַ֗יְתָ עַ֠ד דִּ֣י הִתְגְּזֶ֤רֶת אֶ֙בֶן֙ דִּי־לָ֣א בִידַ֔יִן וּמְחָ֤ת לְצַלְמָא֙ עַל־רַגְל֔וֹהִי דִּ֥י פַרְזְלָ֖א וְחַסְפָּ֑א וְהַדֵּ֖קֶת הִמּֽוֹן׃ As you looked on, a stone was hewn out, not by hands, and struck the statue on its feet of iron and clay and crushed them. ​ בֵּאדַ֣יִן דָּ֣קוּ כַחֲדָ֡ה פַּרְזְלָא֩ חַסְפָּ֨א נְחָשָׁ֜א כַּסְפָּ֣א וְדַהֲבָ֗א וַהֲווֹ֙ כְּע֣וּר מִן־אִדְּרֵי־קַ֔יִט וּנְשָׂ֤א הִמּוֹן֙ רוּחָ֔א וְכׇל־אֲתַ֖ר לָא־הִשְׁתְּכַ֣ח לְה֑וֹן וְאַבְנָ֣א ׀ דִּֽי־מְחָ֣ת לְצַלְמָ֗א הֲוָ֛ת לְט֥וּר רַ֖ב וּמְלָ֥את כׇּל־אַרְעָֽא׃ All at once, the iron, clay, bronze, silver, and gold were crushed, and became like chaff of the threshing floors of summer; a wind carried them off until no trace of them was left. But the stone that struck the statue became a great mountain and filled the whole earth. [Interpret this as me, HarShin, Mountain of The Almighty] ​ דְּנָ֣ה חֶלְמָ֔א וּפִשְׁרֵ֖הּ נֵאמַ֥ר קֳדָם־מַלְכָּֽא׃ “Such was the dream, and we will now tell the king its meaning. ​ (אנתה) [אַ֣נְתְּ] מַלְכָּ֔א מֶ֖לֶךְ מַלְכַיָּ֑א דִּ֚י אֱלָ֣הּ שְׁמַיָּ֔א מַלְכוּתָ֥א חִסְנָ֛א וְתׇקְפָּ֥א וִֽיקָרָ֖א יְהַב־לָֽךְ׃ You, O king—king of kings, to whom the God of Heaven has given kingdom, power, might, and glory; ​ וּבְכׇל־דִּ֣י (דארין) [דָֽיְרִ֣ין] בְּֽנֵי־אֲ֠נָשָׁ֠א חֵיוַ֨ת בָּרָ֤א וְעוֹף־שְׁמַיָּא֙ יְהַ֣ב בִּידָ֔ךְ וְהַשְׁלְטָ֖ךְ בְּכׇלְּה֑וֹן (אנתה) [אַ֨נְתְּ־]ה֔וּא רֵאשָׁ֖ה דִּ֥י דַהֲבָֽא׃ into whose hands He has given men, wild beasts, and the fowl of heaven, wherever they may dwell; and to whom He has given dominion over them all—you are the head of gold. ​ וּבָתְרָ֗ךְ תְּק֛וּם מַלְכ֥וּ אׇחֳרִ֖י (ארעא) [אֲרַ֣ע] מִנָּ֑ךְ וּמַלְכ֨וּ (תליתיא) [תְלִיתָאָ֤ה] אׇחֳרִי֙ דִּ֣י נְחָשָׁ֔א דִּ֥י תִשְׁלַ֖ט בְּכׇל־אַרְעָֽא׃ But another kingdom will arise after you, inferior to yours; then yet a third kingdom, of bronze, which will rule over the whole earth. ​ וּמַלְכוּ֙ (רביעיה) [רְבִ֣יעָאָ֔ה] תֶּהֱוֵ֥א תַקִּיפָ֖ה כְּפַרְזְלָ֑א כׇּל־קֳבֵ֗ל דִּ֤י פַרְזְלָא֙ מְהַדֵּ֤ק וְחָשֵׁל֙ כֹּ֔לָּא וּֽכְפַרְזְלָ֛א דִּֽי־מְרָעַ֥ע כׇּל־אִלֵּ֖ן תַּדִּ֥ק וְתֵרֹֽעַ׃ But the fourth kingdom will be as strong as iron; just as iron crushes and shatters everything—and like iron that smashes—so will it crush and smash all these. ​ וְדִֽי־חֲזַ֜יְתָה רַגְלַיָּ֣א וְאֶצְבְּעָתָ֗א (מנהון) [מִנְּהֵ֞ן] חֲסַ֤ף דִּֽי־פֶחָר֙ (ומנהון) [וּמִנְּהֵ֣ין] פַּרְזֶ֔ל מַלְכ֤וּ פְלִיגָה֙ תֶּהֱוֵ֔ה וּמִן־נִצְבְּתָ֥א דִֽי־פַרְזְלָ֖א לֶֽהֱוֵא־בַ֑הּ כׇּל־קֳבֵל֙ דִּ֣י חֲזַ֔יְתָה פַּ֨רְזְלָ֔א מְעָרַ֖ב בַּחֲסַ֥ף טִינָֽא׃ You saw the feet and the toes, part potter’s clay and part iron; that means it will be a divided kingdom; it will have only some of the stability of iron, inasmuch as you saw iron mixed with common clay. ​ וְאֶצְבְּעָת֙ רַגְלַיָּ֔א (מנהון) [מִנְּהֵ֥ין] פַּרְזֶ֖ל (ומנהון) [וּמִנְּהֵ֣ין] חֲסַ֑ף מִן־קְצָ֤ת מַלְכוּתָא֙ תֶּהֱוֵ֣ה תַקִּיפָ֔ה וּמִנַּ֖הּ תֶּהֱוֵ֥א תְבִירָֽה׃ And the toes were part iron and part clay; that [means] the kingdom will be in part strong and in part brittle. ​ (די) [וְדִ֣י] חֲזַ֗יְתָ פַּרְזְלָא֙ מְעָרַב֙ בַּחֲסַ֣ף טִינָ֔א מִתְעָרְבִ֤ין לֶהֱוֺן֙ בִּזְרַ֣ע אֲנָשָׁ֔א וְלָֽא־לֶהֱוֺ֥ן דָּבְקִ֖ין דְּנָ֣ה עִם־דְּנָ֑ה הֵֽא־כְדִ֣י פַרְזְלָ֔א לָ֥א מִתְעָרַ֖ב עִם־חַסְפָּֽא׃ You saw iron mixed with common clay; that means: they shall intermingle with the offspring of men,-e [Enosh, people with their bloods poured out that are walking multiple ghost-filled people H'F'] but shall not hold together, just as iron does not mix with clay. ​ וּֽבְיוֹמֵיה֞וֹן דִּ֧י מַלְכַיָּ֣א אִנּ֗וּן יְקִים֩ אֱלָ֨הּ שְׁמַיָּ֤א מַלְכוּ֙ דִּ֤י לְעָלְמִין֙ לָ֣א תִתְחַבַּ֔ל וּמַ֨לְכוּתָ֔ה לְעַ֥ם אׇחֳרָ֖ן לָ֣א תִשְׁתְּבִ֑ק תַּדִּ֤ק וְתָסֵיף֙ כׇּל־אִלֵּ֣ין מַלְכְוָתָ֔א וְהִ֖יא תְּק֥וּם לְעָלְמַיָּֽא׃ And in the time of those kings, the God of Heaven will establish a kingdom that shall never be destroyed, a kingdom that shall not be transferred to another people. It will crush and wipe out all these kingdoms, but shall itself last forever— ​ כׇּל־קֳבֵ֣ל דִּֽי־חֲזַ֡יְתָ דִּ֣י מִטּוּרָא֩ אִתְגְּזֶ֨רֶת אֶ֜בֶן דִּי־לָ֣א בִידַ֗יִן וְ֠הַדֵּ֠קֶת פַּרְזְלָ֨א נְחָשָׁ֤א חַסְפָּא֙ כַּסְפָּ֣א וְדַהֲבָ֔א אֱלָ֥הּ רַב֙ הוֹדַ֣ע לְמַלְכָּ֔א מָ֛ה דִּ֥י לֶהֱוֵ֖א אַחֲרֵ֣י דְנָ֑ה וְיַצִּ֥יב חֶלְמָ֖א וּמְהֵימַ֥ן פִּשְׁרֵֽהּ׃ {ס} just as you saw how a stone was hewn from the mountain, not by hands, and crushed the iron, bronze, clay, silver, and gold. The great God has made known to the king what will happen in the future. The dream is sure and its interpretation reliable.” ​ בֵּ֠אדַ֠יִן מַלְכָּ֤א נְבֽוּכַדְנֶצַּר֙ נְפַ֣ל עַל־אַנְפּ֔וֹהִי וּלְדָנִיֵּ֖אל סְגִ֑ד וּמִנְחָה֙ וְנִ֣יחֹחִ֔ין אֲמַ֖ר לְנַסָּ֥כָה לֵֽהּ׃ Then King Nebuchadnezzar prostrated himself and paid homage to Daniel and ordered that a meal offering and pleasing offerings be made to him. ​ ' ​ Rashi on verse 39 explains that this idol is symbolizing the multiples exiles. Babylon is the head of gold, Media-Persia the silver upper body, and Rome the copper lower body. He does not specify on the iron kingdom, maybe we can apply this to European history. The last kingdom of verse 41 he says this: ​ מלכו פליגה תהוה. מלכות חלוקה תהיה שני מלכים יהיו ממנה כאחד חזק וחלש כמו שמפורש למטה מן קצת מלכותא תהוה תקיפא: it will be a divided kingdom It will be a divided kingdom; two kings will rise from it at once, strong and weak, as explained below (verse 42): “part of the kingdom will be strong.” ​ ומן נצבתא די פרזלא להוא בה. אף החלש יהא חזק על אחרים ע"י חוזק חברו שיראו מפניו וזה מן נצבתא די פרזלא להוי בה, מן חוזק מצב הברזל, יהיה במלך החלש: and in it will be some of the strength of iron Even the weak one will be stronger than the other nations through the strength of his fellow, for they will fear him. And this is the meaning of וּמִן נִצְבְּתָא דִּי פַרְזְלָא לֶהֶוֵא בָהּ ; some of the strength of the stability of iron will be in the weak king. ​ כל קבל די חזיתה. כל עומת שראית ברזל מעורב בחרסית הטיט: in view of what you saw in view of what you saw—iron mixed with clay. According to ChatGPT the pig pen is specifically more vile for these reasons: ​ Why pigs can be smellier: High waste output: Pigs eat a lot and produce a lot of waste. Pound for pound, they produce more manure than chickens, goats, or sheep. Wet environment: Pigs don’t sweat, so they wallow in mud or water to cool off—which can mix with their waste and create a swampy mess if not managed. Omnivorous diet: Pigs eat a broader range of food, including food scraps and even meat, which can make their waste more pungent compared to strictly herbivorous animals like cows or sheep. Ammonia: Pig urine breaks down into ammonia, which has a sharp, pungent smell and can be irritating to the eyes and lungs. ​ Compared to other animals: Cows: Cow manure smells strong, but it’s more earthy and consistent. Plus, cows are usually out grazing, so their waste is spread over a large area. Chickens: Chicken coops can get really stinky too—especially from the high ammonia content in their droppings. A poorly managed coop might even out-stink a pig pen. Goats/sheep: These are typically the least smelly—pellet-style droppings, and they stay cleaner in general. ​ ​ The crickets that have stolen glances of my private property know that I indeed can be competitive in physical cleanliness Heaven save us! as I prefer to "graze and fly" than do manual labor and I think having the interior of my house photos on real estate websites was contributing to dust buildups (through witches cursing me through the evil eye-voodoo and/or being able to find me) that made it seem like an endless battle H'F'! ​ -- ​ A great visual example of where to put Tefillin shel Rosh and how to tighten it, ironically from AishDas.org: Link (click) ​ -- ​ Why do I put the Rooster and Chicken above the Ox and Cow in spiritual hierarchies other than the 9 songs in Perek Shirah compared to 2? I realized he wanted a Kiruv effort so I signaled to a cardboard sign with"AyshDaat.com" written in thick sharpie that I keep in my front and back windows and said here is the link to my novelties in Torah for free and he immediately fled from my apple tree and told me I should move from in front of the boat landing so the wardens don't Chassle (as in hassle mixed with the impure locust, Chasil, that Artscroll says on its Song in Perek Shira that it devastates the last remaining produce of a field) me H'F'. ​ Anyway my father told me I needed to cut the extra line after sending the photo. I was about to give up after 10-15 minutes and immediately after thinking that, this perfect one hit my worm I dug up across the road in the forest (One shovel lift got me two earthworms and its very consistent, even in the winter I got one on the first shoveling, although no bites). I buried the guts and carcass next to my apple trees in my front and side so they can enjoy her too. I feel amazing now, as the Sages teach in the Gemara that "small fish are great for the body" and it was very likely much cleaner than any store-bought fish. ​ It was the first time I've ever done a solo catch and cook and if you're worried about the cleaning, it was very simple. I unalived her with my pocket knife so she wasn't flopping around in my backpack and splashed up some water to clean (most of the) blood off the dock. When I got home I cut a slit from the bottom of the stomach to under the mouth and tried to use a knife first to pull the guts out, but it actually smelled pure so I wasn't disgusted and thought a good way to "drink" her would be to do it by hand and it was a lot easier. I think I hit a bladder or something that I've heard a person needs to be careful of since a bunch of bile came out that was hard to get clean (I needed a knife to scrape open the ridges they got stuck in). Anyway then I rinsed her with my filtered water and fried her in butter with dill and a paper plate bent over her to retain some moisture, head, tail, fins, scales and all. I should've given her a pre salting because she was better with a lot of salt (I did use salted butter). I found it easier to eat with my hands or a spoon/fork in my left. ​ Also a novelty that came to me is that the Song of the Donkey is "When you eat of your strenuous labor [in] your palms of your hands, fortunate are you and it is good for you" ​ Therefore if one puts his food on his palm he can bend his fingers, representing horns, Judgements, Severities, below his palm and eat that will very likely result in great benefits in one's life since everything with borders has a corresponding spiritual attendant in the World Above. (don't worry you will not be crammed into an apartment G-d forbid) ​ Once you reach a level of Torah study where you understand the reasons for the Mitzvot it is inevitable that you would soon take it upon  yourself especially considering its written "Their days will be like the days of the tree (Rashi: of Life [that lives forever])". ​ Would it be fair to indulge in the sweet honeys of Kabbalah that were forbidden to Noahides while the rest of the world works for HaShem every day and restrains ourselves on Shabbat and Yom Tov while you lie around like a dog? You would likely soon get wood-rot and fall on us G-d forbid. As I have been saying you can even "drop the leaves and extra branches" like the Prophecy of the "Redeemed of Tzion will be like the stump of an oak (lit Aylon, a large[?] unfruitful forest tree) and shorten your divine service to a very light daily yoke. ​ Ohr HaChaim teaches that the lion and eagle aren't Kosher and were "forced out of Gan Eden" since they reached too high of a spiritual level meant for them, like the parable of a blown electrical outlet from using too much power at once. Therefore we can assume that the dog is also impure and forced out of the Garden since they are lazy and arrogant (Kabbalah teaches that dogs are extremely judgemental). If you want to have no/very minimal free choice all day we can send you back up to Heaven and you can ask HaShem to be a dog. Isaiah 56:10-12 (JPS '23) ​ צֹפָ֞ו עִוְרִ֤ים כֻּלָּם֙ לֹ֣א יָדָ֔עוּ כֻּלָּם֙ כְּלָבִ֣ים אִלְּמִ֔ים לֹ֥א יוּכְל֖וּ לִנְבֹּ֑חַ הֹזִים֙ שֹֽׁכְבִ֔ים אֹהֲבֵ֖י לָנֽוּם׃ The lookouts are blind, all of them, They perceive nothing. They are all dumb dogs That cannot bark; They lie sprawling, They love to drowse. ​ וְהַכְּלָבִ֣ים עַזֵּי־נֶ֗פֶשׁ לֹ֤א יָֽדְעוּ֙ שׇׂבְעָ֔ה וְהֵ֣מָּה רֹעִ֔ים לֹ֥א יָדְע֖וּ הָבִ֑ין כֻּלָּם֙ לְדַרְכָּ֣ם פָּנ֔וּ אִ֥ישׁ לְבִצְע֖וֹ מִקָּצֵֽהוּ׃ Moreover, the dogs are greedy; They never know satiety. As for the shepherds, they know not What it is to give heed. Everyone has turned their own way, Every last one seeks their own advantage. ​ אֵתָ֥יוּ אֶקְחָה־יַ֖יִן וְנִסְבְּאָ֣ה שֵׁכָ֑ר וְהָיָ֤ה כָזֶה֙ י֣וֹם מָחָ֔ר גָּד֖וֹל יֶ֥תֶר מְאֹֽד׃ “Come, I’ll get some wine; Let us swill liquor. And tomorrow will be just the same, Or even much grander!” ​​ ​ Here is an Apple Peel from ChatGPT for you on this: ​ Dogs 12–14 hours (up to 18 for puppies or older dogs) Dogs are flexible sleepers—they nap a lot, especially when bore d or relaxed [from not engaged in Torah]. ​ Sheep 4–5 hours Light sleepers; they often rest while lying down but sleep in short bursts. ​ Goats 5–6 hours Similar to sheep; they take short sleeps and are alert most of the time. ​ Cows 4 hours (actual sleep); up to 8 hours resting/lying down Cows spend a lot of time lying down and chewing cud, but actual deep sleep is short. ​ Shemot (Exodus) 22:30 וְאַנְשֵׁי־קֹ֖דֶשׁ תִּהְי֣וּן לִ֑י וּבָשָׂ֨ר בַּשָּׂדֶ֤ה טְרֵפָה֙ לֹ֣א תֹאכֵ֔לוּ לַכֶּ֖לֶב תַּשְׁלִכ֥וּן אֹתֽוֹ׃ {ס} And men (ANSHei - even if you died G'F') of Holiness you will be to Me. Meat in the field (the West) that is animal torn (freshly fallen Shaynah's and Shane's) you will not be able to eat (other than through Yefet Toar laws unless they are "clay", that is bloodless and will not mix with your iron). To the dog you shall cast her (plural) off of you. ​ Rashi: לכלב תשלכון אתו. אַף הַגּוֹי כַּכֶּלֶב; אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא כֶּלֶב כְּמַשְׁמָעוֹ? תַּ"לֹ בִּנְבֵלָה אוֹ מָכֹר לְנָכְרִי (שם י"ד), קַ"וָ לִטְרֵפָה שֶׁמֻּתֶּרֶת בְּכָל הֲנָאוֹת. אִם כֵּן מַה תַּ"לֹ לַכֶּלֶב? לְלַמֶּדְךָ שֶׁהַכֶּלֶב נִכְבָּד מִמֶּנּוּ, וְלִמֶּדְךָ הַכָּתוּב שֶׁאֵין הַקָּבָּ"ה מְקַפֵּחַ שְׂכַר כָּל בְּרִיָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וּלְכָל בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לֹא יֶחֱרַץ כֶּלֶב לְשֹׁנוֹ (שמות י"א), אָמַר הַקָּבָּ"ה תְּנוּ לוֹ שְׂכָרוֹ (מכילתא): לכלב תשלכון אתו YE SHALL CAST IT TO THE DOGS — You may give it to a heathen as well as to the dog [Literally: Even the Goy is like the dog]. Or, perhaps this is not so, but כלב is to be taken literally? Scripture, however, states with regard to carrion, (Deuteronomy 14:21) “Thou shalt give it to a stranger or sell it unto an alien”, from which it follows by a conclusion à fortiori that you may derive whatever benefit you like from the Trefa (and so you also may give it to heathen). But if this be so, what is the force of Scripture expressly saying “to the dog”? It is to teach you that the dog is to be given preference in this respect and Scripture tells you at the same time that God does not withhold the reward due to any of His creatures. The dog is entitled to reward because it is stated, (Exodus 11:7) “But against the children of Israel shall not a dog move its tongue”, and this happened. The Holy One, blessed be He, said: Give it the reward it deserves (Mekhilta). ​ A Torah proof that heathens are below the level of animals. So again, yes heathens, I don't think I am much greater than all of you combined, I know so as a proven fact from Heaven. ​ Berachot 58a ​ וְאָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא: הָרוֹאֶה אוּכְלוּסֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ … חֲכַם הָרָזִים״. אוּכְלוּסֵי גּוֹיִם, אוֹמֵר: ״בּוֹשָׁה אִמְּכֶם וְגוֹ׳״. ​ And Rav Hamnuna said: One who sees multitudes of Israel, six hundred thousand Jews, recites: Blessed…Who knows all secrets. One who sees multitudes of gentiles recites: “Your mother shall be sore shamed, she that bore you shall be disgraced; behold, the ending of the nations shall be a wilderness, a dry land, and a desert” (Jeremiah 50:12). ​ -- ​ Avot "An idle mind is liable for death" ​ An Apple Peel example: If you pass your finger slowly over a flame (not torch), it will get a little warm and if you go too slowly it will be hot (your Sukkah, Place, Omnipresent Existence will be uncomfortable). Rambam only makes certain logical actions Halacha like touching something disgusting/wiping with the left and therefore eating with the right and certain Mitzvot like Tefillin going on the left arm of right handed and ambidextrous people, although again I think there are amazing electric and likely spiritual benefits (Rashi says a left handed person "lacks a right hand", as in Kindness and Wisdom) to becoming ambidextrous and then right handed. ​ However if you were inspecting raspberries for bugs, pulling them apart, and ended up with a bunch of juice and jam on your left fingers, are you going to let those souls go to waste when we have to clean our hands before we eat (I use the city water right now H'F') and you were already touching all of the berries with your juice-wet left? Heaven forbid! Those berries are more finger-lickin-good than KFC. ​ I believe this is why my Torah is on a much "higher" level of Understanding, the left thumb, than most other Jewish people who know a lot more Halachot, dirt, real estate. We can say both since I was left handed until recently and didn't think to develop my right. ​ --- ​ I've been thinking about an episode at the Yeshivah of Shem and Ever in Tzfat a week or two after going to visit zanavah in Tzfat. However we did have to write extensively in school back then assuming he was actually in another class[?]), and you have an eternity so let "HaShem wage war for you and be silent and mute". Either way you are allowed to use your left for everything else non Mitzvah related for convenience sake, as it is "blessing" yourself, and the Zohar says "anyone who [intentionally] lifts his (left) hand without intention to bless has lifted it to curse, and the angels say May he who loves to curse be cursed" ​ ​ ​ I found a proof from Tanakh that this is an ancient conspiracy ​ 2 Samuel 2:17-23 וַתְּהִ֧י הַמִּלְחָמָ֛ה קָשָׁ֥ה עַד־מְאֹ֖ד בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֑וּא וַיִּנָּ֤גֶף אַבְנֵר֙ וְאַנְשֵׁ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לִפְנֵ֖י עַבְדֵ֥י דָוִֽד׃ A fierce battle ensued that day, and Abner and the men of Israel were routed by David’s soldiers. ​ וַיִּֽהְיוּ־שָׁ֗ם שְׁלֹשָׁה֙ בְּנֵ֣י צְרוּיָ֔ה יוֹאָ֥ב וַאֲבִישַׁ֖י וַעֲשָׂהאֵ֑ל וַֽעֲשָׂהאֵל֙ קַ֣ל בְּרַגְלָ֔יו כְּאַחַ֥ד הַצְּבָיִ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר בַּשָּׂדֶֽה׃ The three sons of Zeruiah were there—Joab, Abishai, and Asahel. Asahel was swift of foot, like a [lit. one of using Achad that is used to describe HaShem meaning Majestic/Mysterious] gazelle in the open field [the zombie kingdom]. ​ וַיִּרְדֹּ֥ף עֲשָׂהאֵ֖ל אַחֲרֵ֣י אַבְנֵ֑ר וְלֹא־נָטָ֣ה לָלֶ֗כֶת עַל־הַיָּמִין֙ וְעַֽל־הַשְּׂמֹ֔אול מֵאַחֲרֵ֖י אַבְנֵֽר׃ And Asahel ran after Abner, swerving neither right nor left in his pursuit of (lit "from After" like the bottom/tail) Abner. ​ וַיִּ֤פֶן אַבְנֵר֙ אַֽחֲרָ֔יו וַיֹּ֕אמֶר הַאַתָּ֥ה זֶ֖ה עֲשָׂהאֵ֑ל וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אָנֹֽכִי׃ Abner looked back and shouted, “Is that you, Asahel?” “Yes, it is,” (using Anochi including the Caf of Cetavit, writing) he called back. ​ וַיֹּ֧אמֶר ל֣וֹ אַבְנֵ֗ר נְטֵ֤ה לְךָ֙ עַל־יְמִֽינְךָ֙ א֣וֹ עַל־שְׂמֹאלֶ֔ךָ וֶאֱחֹ֣ז לְךָ֗ אֶחָד֙ מֵֽהַנְּעָרִ֔ים וְקַח־לְךָ֖ אֶת־חֲלִצָת֑וֹ וְלֹא־אָבָ֣ה עֲשָׂהאֵ֔ל לָס֖וּר מֵאַחֲרָֽיו׃ Abner said to him, “Turn to the right or to the left, and seize one of our boys and strip off his tunic.” [it can also be read and you will be grabbed like one of the youths and your holy soul (clean clothes) stripped] But Asahel would not leave off. ​ וַיֹּ֧סֶף ע֣וֹד אַבְנֵ֗ר לֵאמֹר֙ אֶל־עֲשָׂהאֵ֔ל ס֥וּר לְךָ֖ מֵאַֽחֲרָ֑י לָ֤מָּה אַכֶּ֙כָּה֙ אַ֔רְצָה וְאֵיךְ֙ אֶשָּׂ֣א פָנַ֔י אֶל־יוֹאָ֖ב אָחִֽיךָ׃ Abner again begged Asahel, “Stop pursuing me (the tails, since you can't defeat a field of dirt without cursing them to cease to be as we have seen from the Tibetan Book of the dead), or I’ll have to strike you down. How will I look your brother Joab in the face?” ​ וַיְמָאֵ֣ן לָס֗וּר וַיַּכֵּ֣הוּ אַבְנֵר֩ בְּאַחֲרֵ֨י הַחֲנִ֜ית אֶל־הַחֹ֗מֶשׁ וַתֵּצֵ֤א הַֽחֲנִית֙ מֵֽאַחֲרָ֔יו וַיִּפׇּל־שָׁ֖ם וַיָּ֣מׇת תַּחְתָּ֑ו וַיְהִ֡י כׇּל־הַבָּ֣א אֶל־הַמָּקוֹם֩ אֲשֶׁר־נָ֨פַל שָׁ֧ם עֲשָׂהאֵ֛ל וַיָּמֹ֖ת וַֽיַּעֲמֹֽדוּ׃ When he refused to desist, Abner struck him in the belly with a backward thrust-b of his spear and the spear protruded from his back. He fell there and died on the spot (Tachtayv can also mean "for the sake of" like Rabbi Akiva and the Martys of the romans that merits them great reward. A novel face is Matnayv, loins.
