And all who came to the place where Asahel fell and died halted (hopefully meaning repented); ​ Ending of Dvarim: "Smash the loins of Levi's enemies" - Curse them with YeshaYaHu (Isaiah) 65:15 to cease to be ANA ​ If you are sensitive consider that they either smashed your loins/ovaries or everyone you know and made a donkey out of you and are still perpetually pursuing your spiritual loins H'F' ​ -- ​ When I was in 5th or 6th grade bark obamanation campaigned in my hometown and said "they cleave to their Bibles and guns" and people were and still are upset. I think that's a strong compliment as I cleave to Torah all day and sleep with my 12 gage shot gun I bought from a flea market for $140 last Summer. ​ If you're wondering how with my criminal record, the man sitting outside said explained that its legal (US law is a joke and intentionally complex to make sheeple) and sold me one for cash with no paper involved. ​ Tehillim "Your Rod (Rashi: Rebukes [even up to guns and nukes]) and Your Staff (Pleasures, [His Living Waters of Torah]) - They shall comfort me. ​ -- ​ I've been thinking about "teasing" the worm for fish and its like a Gibor/Giborah (compared to a stick, someone small that still lasts the cold/heat) taking gym selfies or licentious photos or back in the day a prostitute on the corner at night etc. ​ Even an Adam can be compared to an Eish when he goes to war, a Gever, a worm when he has to brave the streets for his Mitzvot like food and house and Mitzvah supplies (Tehillim: I am a worm and not a man), and an Enosh when he is constantly fearing HaShem, the foundation of being a real "man". ​ Not to brag but very often beautiful women come whoring me in the streets since they see I'm on the Tzadi, the fishhook. However for some reason I find it impossible in the public eye to be smooth enough to eat one as a Yefet Toar let alone approach one, especially since everyone almost always withers when I look at them through my glasses and I need them H'F'. ​ ​ -- ​ Rambam Hilchot Avoda Zara 3:10-11 ​ אָסוּר לַעֲשׂוֹת צוּרוֹת לְנוֹי וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינָהּ עֲבוֹדַת כּוֹכָבִים שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר (שמות כ כ) "לֹא תַעֲשׂוּן אִתִּי" כְּלוֹמַר צוּרוֹת שֶׁל כֶּסֶף וְזָהָב שֶׁאֵינָם אֶלָּא לְנוֹי כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יִטְּעוּ בָּהֶן הַטּוֹעִים וִידַמּוּ שֶׁהֵם לַעֲבוֹדַת כּוֹכָבִים. וְאֵין אִסּוּר לָצוּר לְנוֹי אֶלָּא צוּרַת הָאָדָם בִּלְבַד. לְפִיכָךְ אֵין מְצַיְּרִים לֹא בְּעֵץ וְלֹא בְּסִיד וְלֹא בְּאֶבֶן צוּרַת הָאָדָם. וְהוּא שֶׁתִּהְיֶה הַצּוּרָה בּוֹלֶטֶת כְּגוֹן הַצִּיּוּר וְהַכִּיּוּר שֶׁבַּטְּרַקְלִין וְכַיּוֹצֵא בָּהֶן וְאִם צָר לוֹקֵה. אֲבָל אִם הָיִתָה הַצּוּרָה מֻשְׁקַעַת אוֹ צוּרָה שֶׁל סַמָּנִין כְּגוֹן הַצּוּרוֹת שֵׁעַל גַּבֵּי הַלּוּחוֹת וִהַטַּבְלִיּוֹת אוֹ צוּרוֹת שֶׁרוֹקְמִין בָּאָרִיג הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ מֻתָּרוֹת: It is prohibited to make images for decorative purposes, even though they do not represent false deities, as [implied by Exodus 20:20]: "Do not make with Me [gods of silver and gods of gold]." This refers even to images of gold and silver which are intended only for decorative purposes, lest others err and view them as deities. It is forbidden to make decorative images of the human form alone. Therefore, it is forbidden to make human images with wood, cement, or stone. This [prohibition] applies when the image is protruding - for example, images and sculptures made in a hallway and the like. A person who makes such an image is [liable for] lashes. In contrast, it is permitted to make human images that are engraved or painted - e.g., portraits, whether on wood or on stone - or that are part of a tapestry. ​ טַבַּעַת שֶׁיֵּשׁ עָלֶיהָ חוֹתָם שֶׁהוּא צוּרַת אָדָם אִם הָיְתָה הַצּוּרָה בּוֹלֶטֶת אָסוּר לְהַנִּיחָהּ וּמֻתָּר לַחְתֹּם בָּהּ. וְאִם הָיְתָה הַצּוּרָה שׁוֹקַעַת מֻתָּר לְהַנִּיחָהּ וְאָסוּר לַחְתֹּם בָּהּ מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהַנָּחָתָם תַּעֲשֶׂה בּוֹ הַצּוּרָה בּוֹלֶטֶת. וְכֵן אָסוּר לָצוּר דְּמוּת חַמָּה וּלְבָנָה כּוֹכָבִים מַזָּלוֹת וּמַלְאָכִים שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר (שמות כ כ) "לֹא תַעֲשׂוּן אִתִּי" (גמרא ראש השנה כד ב) "לֹא תַעֲשׂוּן כִּדְמוּת שְׁמָשַׁי הַמְשַׁמְּשִׁין לְפָנַי בַּמָּרוֹם" וַאֲפִלּוּ עַל הַלּוּחַ. צוּרוֹת הַבְּהֵמוֹת וּשְׁאָר נֶפֶשׁ חַיָּה חוּץ מִן הָאָדָם וְצוּרוֹת הָאִילָנוֹת וּדְשָׁאִים וְכַיּוֹצֵא בָּהֶן מֻתָּר לָצוּר אוֹתָם וַאֲפִלּוּ הָיְתָה הַצּוּרָה בּוֹלֶטֶת: [The following rules apply regarding] a signet ring which bears a human image: If the image is protruding, it is forbidden to wear it, but it is permitted to use it as a seal. If the image is an impression, it is permitted to wear it, but it is forbidden to use it as a seal, because it will create an image which protrudes. Similarly, it is forbidden to make an image of the sun, the moon, the stars, the constellations, or the angels, as [implied by Exodus, ibid.]: "Do not make with Me [gods of silver...]" - i.e., do not make images of My servants, those who serve before Me on high. This [prohibition] applies even [to pictures] on tablets. The images of animals and other living beings - with the exception of men - and similarly, the images of trees, grasses, and the like may be fashioned. This applies even to images which protrude. ​​ ​ For general knowledge and also it seems Rambam is implying/hinting at the top that a perfect Adam will refrain from all images until we are redeemed from Egypt ​ לְפִיכָךְ אֵין מְצַיְּרִים לֹא בְּעֵץ וְלֹא בְּסִיד וְלֹא בְּאֶבֶן צוּרַת הָאָדָם ​ Therefore (to the mouth[/Malchut/Kingdom that includes Evil]) [until there is] (no Egypt lit. Metzayrim. Egypt is Mitzrayim), HaAdam, a perfect man, will not form [images] in wood, clay, or stone. ​ Why? Since saltier than salt heathens will be suspect and also make strange cricket scenes upon them. ​ As we know I've been trying to use them to scare them off with a funny parable but maybe the key to Peace and silence is to go imageless. ​ YeshaYaHu 18:2 הַשֹּׁלֵ֨חַ בַּיָּ֜ם צִירִ֗ים וּבִכְלֵי־גֹ֘מֶא֮ עַל־פְּנֵי־מַ֒יִם֒ לְכ֣וּ Who sends by the sea (the entire world through the internet) images (to curse us H'F') and in reed/papyrus/rush (paper) vessels upon the faces of the waters (stuffing irrelevant mail with images in your mailbox with trap curses H'F') ​ -- ​ An important step I forgot to mention when cooking chicken low and slow in a ton of butter is that you need to poke some holes so hot air doesn't build up in the meat. ​ -- ​ Nissan 26 ​ When HaShem makes your Sukkah hot with heathens vomit, I like to stand up and do a Sukkah service (not with the actual 4 species as that would be "strange worship" but with a sword, knife etc.) ​ There are different customs on how to shake the species in all the directions, but here is the Arizal's from Chabad: ​ You’ve now fulfilled the mitzvah! But the sages instituted the custom to wave the lulav set in all directions at this point (and again during the Hallel prayer, see below). Wave in the following directions, rustling it when your arms are extended and then returning it to your heart after each motion: 28 Note: There are various customs on how to wave the lulav and etrog. We have described the Chabad custom, which is based on the Arizal. See Siddur Im Piskei Admur Hazaken - Hilchot Lulav; Sefer Minhagim - Chabad, p. 66. ​ Three times to the right (southeast). Three times to the left (northeast). Three times forward (east). Three times upward—raising the lulav, then lowering it slightly below chest level (symbolizing drawing divine influence into the world) before returning it to the heart. Three times downward—lowering the lulav, then raising it slightly above chest level (symbolizing the elevation of the world) before returning it to the heart. Three times over your right shoulder (twice to the southwest, once due west). ​ I have been doing what I (think I remember) was taught in Ashkenazi Yeshiva, that is 7 times East, up, down, then turn South, West, and finish with 7 shakes North. Also I don't bring them close I just plow the whole treacherous abomination ​ Its said that if the nations knew how much benefit they get from Israel offering the 70 bulls during Sukkot, the world would immediately be redeemed. However I've never read the reasoning exactly. I would propose that since a bull is a metaphor for one's spiritual level, it inspires HaShem to lift the heathens from their natural materialistic donkey/horse innards (overly sexual) state into bulls that live forever. ​ EzeikiEl 24:20 וַֽתַּעְגְּבָ֔ה עַ֖ל פִּֽלַגְשֵׁיהֶ֑ם אֲשֶׁ֤ר בְּשַׂר־חֲמוֹרִים֙ בְּשָׂרָ֔ם וְזִרְמַ֥ת סוּסִ֖ים זִרְמָתָֽם׃ she lusted for concubinage with them, whose members were like those of donkeys and whose organs  were like those of stallions. ​​​ Rashi: אשר בשר חמורים בשרם. אבר תשמיש: those whose flesh is the flesh of donkeys [i.e.,] the phallus. וזרמת סוסים. לשון רבוי תשמיש שמרבים תשמיש יותר משאר כל הזכרים שבבהמה: and...is the issue of horses An expression of a profusion of sexual intercourse, for they engage in sexual intercourse more than any other male animals. זרמת. קלוח הזרע כמו זרם מים עבר (חבקוק ג׳:י׳): זִרְמַת refers to the stream of semen, like (Habakkuk 3:10): “A stream (זֶרֶם) of water passed.” ​ See that all you people care about is money and possessions so you can pour your guts out (hundreds of millions to billions of your children that will testify against you) like a horse more often with vile people Heaven save us and "give her (them) of the fruit of her hands" ​ -- ​ When a heathen falls on you and says "they torture me" H'F', say "Gird your loins like a warrior or cease to be forever" as you wave them away with your fist or whatever you feel like doing, even YeshaYaHu 65:15 ​ The Torah teaches its forbidden to even hit another person on threat of death by the concept, "Is your blood redder than your brothers?" ShuGar can be novelized the almighty convert (converts are like scabs/vegetables for 7 years or until they change their whole name or work hard enough on themselves that their "tree fruits are permitted for the public"). In Hebrew, Sugar is Sucar with a Samech ("S") instead of a Shin ("Sh"). Coffee is Cafe, representing Caf, Ceter, The Crown of HaShem, and Fi, like Pi, mouth, the Malchut, Kingdom, the two Highest Sefirot (since "the end is rooted in the beginning" like a fire is connected to a hot coal). ​ In Hebrew CoFfee would be Coh-Fi; Thus [is the] Malchut ​ A practical proof is that we can replace sugar with bee honey or maple syrup, but I have not found anything like coffee. ​ -- ​ Back to seeing the traditional Yemenite wedding ring on /r/Judaism. It was on the right index finger representing ChochMah, Wisdom, and I think I've read before that only Keter and ChochMah are unsucceptive to impurity. Therefore it makes sense a person would want all of the electricity sent at him/her H'F' to be directed to the attribute of Wisdom that can't be disgraced. ​ Now that I think about it I think I have read that Yesod, the classic left "ring finger" is also insucceptive to impurity. However having a metal ring on it will also cause the electricity to touch your Malchut, Everything! I think hash oil is the best form of Kanbus (cannabis) according to Shabbat Laws (metaphorically and practically) since you only have to light it once and can keep puffing and enjoying a continuous cloud without extinguishing ever. Also like the Beit HaMikdash incense (starting with Nataf that means pressed oils), the oils are more pure and refined than the grasses. ​ - ​ I called that rainbow trout I caught a small fish but I was thinking relative to tuna or salmon. Especially considering it came from landlocked mountains I think it would be considered a large (maybe giant) fish or at least a medium sized according to the Sages. ​ -- ​ Exodus 29:40 וְעִשָּׂרֹ֨ן סֹ֜לֶת בָּל֨וּל בְּשֶׁ֤מֶן כָּתִית֙ רֶ֣בַע הַהִ֔ין וְנֵ֕סֶךְ רְבִיעִ֥ת הַהִ֖ין יָ֑יִן לַכֶּ֖בֶשׂ הָאֶחָֽד׃ There shall be a tenth of a measure [Isaron, like Sarah, "The Princess, or Hair, one's Crown, Desires" of choice flour with a quarter of a hin of beaten oil mixed in [a man teaching her his illuminating Torah], and a libation [Naysech, like Nashuch, snake bite, or Neshech, loan interest -see Ohr HaChaim on the verse 'Do not give your brother a loan at interest'] of a quarter hin of wine for one lamb; ​ Since wine is a metaphor for lies and it "makes the heart rejoice" (Tehillim/Psalms), maybe we can apply this to the matrix since it is actually a 2D screen (hopefully) with perfect "intoxicating" graphics and senses, for the sheep that are not Achad, majestic/mysterious, but Echad (Segol for Kindness instead of Kamatz for Keter/Crown), "One (with HaShem)" through verbally articulating Torah and the Shema twice a day.​ ​ Rashi says the quarter hin of wine is three logs. This is 18 eggs worth according to this Halachapedia acrticle that quotes Rashbam and Tosafot (A Kezayit is an olive and a Kebaytzah is a chicken egg. However They teach in Yeshivot that in Biblical times, the olives were the size of eggs today and the eggs double.) ​ The Gemara says that in Mishnaic times, Tirosh meant juice with no alcohol, but in Biblical times it meant fresh light sweet wine. Here "YAYin" is used, that is stronger wine. ​ Mishlei 31:4-7 אַ֤ל לַֽמְלָכִ֨ים ׀ לְֽמוֹאֵ֗ל אַ֣ל לַֽמְלָכִ֣ים שְׁתוֹ־יָ֑יִן וּ֝לְרוֹזְנִ֗ים (או) [אֵ֣י] שֵׁכָֽר׃ Wine (YAYin) is not for kings, O Lemuel; Not for kings to drink, Nor any strong drink for princes, ​ פֶּן־יִ֭שְׁתֶּה וְיִשְׁכַּ֣ח מְחֻקָּ֑ק וִ֝ישַׁנֶּ֗ה דִּ֣ין כׇּל־בְּנֵי־עֹֽנִי׃ Lest they drink and forget what has been ordained, And infringe on the rights of the poor. ​ [Like an ox is the king of the beasts of the pen and not a sheep that likes getting drunk for fun] ​ תְּנוּ־שֵׁכָ֥ר לְאוֹבֵ֑ד וְ֝יַ֗יִן לְמָ֣רֵי נָֽפֶשׁ׃ Give strong drink to the hapless And wine (YAYin) to the embittered. ​ Rashi to those of bitter soul Who suffer pain because of their poverty and their mourning. To give them pleasure in this world, so that they receive the reward for the precepts they kept, in this world, [leaving them with nothing in the hereafter.] ​ Here we see that even sheep that are Pure/Kosher should not drink stronger wine, but rather the desolates that don't truly exist since they will soon be gone and forgotten. ​ יִ֭שְׁתֶּה וְיִשְׁכַּ֣ח רִישׁ֑וֹ וַ֝עֲמָל֗וֹ לֹ֣א יִזְכׇּר־עֽוֹד׃ {פ} Let them drink and forget their poverty, And put their troubles out of mind. ​ -- ​​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ CHagigah 15b (Steinsatlz ​ וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, הֵיכִי גְּמַר תּוֹרָה מִפּוּמֵּיהּ דְּאַחֵר? וְהָאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי שִׂפְתֵי כֹהֵן יִשְׁמְרוּ דַעַת וְתוֹרָה יְבַקְשׁוּ מִפִּיהוּ כִּי מַלְאַךְ ה׳ צְבָאוֹת הוּא״. אִם דּוֹמֶה הָרַב לְמַלְאַךְ ה׳ צְבָאוֹת — יְבַקְּשׁוּ תּוֹרָה מִפִּיהוּ, וְאִם לָאו — אַל יְבַקְּשׁוּ תּוֹרָה מִפִּיהוּ! The Gemara poses a question: And Rabbi Meir, how could he learn Torah from the mouth of Aḥer? But didn’t Rabba bar bar Ḥana say that Rabbi Yoḥanan said: What is the meaning of that which is written: “For the priest’s lips should keep knowledge, and they should seek Torah from his mouth; for he is an angel of the Lord of hosts” (Malachi 2:7)? The verse teaches: If the rabbi is similar to an angel of the Lord of hosts, perfect in his ways, they should seek Torah from his mouth; but if not, they should not seek Torah from his mouth. ​ אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: רַבִּי מֵאִיר — קְרָא אַשְׁכַּח וּדְרַשׁ: ״הַט אׇזְנְךָ וּשְׁמַע דִּבְרֵי חֲכָמִים וְלִבְּךָ תָּשִׁית לְדַעְתִּי״, ״לְדַעְתָּם״ לֹא נֶאֱמַר, אֶלָּא ״לְדַעְתִּי״. Reish Lakish said: Rabbi Meir found a verse and interpreted it homiletically: “Incline your ear, and hear the words of the wise, and apply your heart to My knowledge” (Proverbs 22:17). It does not state “to their knowledge,” but “to My knowledge.” In other words, one must listen to the words of the Sages, despite their flaws, provided that their opinion concurs with that of God. ​ רַב חֲנִינָא אָמַר מֵהָכָא: ״שִׁמְעִי בַת וּרְאִי וְהַטִּי אׇזְנֵךְ וְשִׁכְחִי עַמֵּךְ וּבֵית אָבִיךְ וְגוֹ׳״. Rav Ḥanina said that one can find support for this idea from here: “Listen, daughter and consider, and incline your ear; forget also your own people and your father’s house” (Psalms 45:11), which likewise indicates that one must listen to the words of a Sage while forgetting, i.e., ignoring, the faulty aspects of his teachings. ​ קָשׁוּ קְרָאֵי אַהֲדָדֵי? לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בְּגָדוֹל, הָא בְּקָטָן. The Gemara asks: If so, the verses contradict each other, for one source states that one may learn only from a scholar who is perfect in his ways, while the other indicates that it is permitted even to learn from one whose character is flawed. The Gemara answers: This is not difficult. This case, in which it is permitted to learn from a flawed scholar, is referring to an adult; whereas that case, which prohibits doing so, is referring to a minor, who should learn only from a righteous person, so that his ways are not corrupted by a teacher with flawed character. ​ כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אֲמַר, אָמְרִי בְּמַעְרְבָא: רַבִּי מֵאִיר אֲכַל תַּחְלָא, וּשְׁדָא שִׁיחְלָא לְבָרָא. דָּרֵשׁ רָבָא: מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״אֶל גִּנַּת אֱגוֹז יָרַדְתִּי לִרְאוֹת בְּאִבֵּי הַנָּחַל וְגוֹ׳״, לָמָּה נִמְשְׁלוּ תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים לֶאֱגוֹז — לוֹמַר לָךְ: מָה אֱגוֹז זֶה, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁמְּלוּכְלָךְ בְּטִיט וּבְצוֹאָה — אֵין מַה שֶּׁבְּתוֹכוֹ נִמְאָס; אַף תַּלְמִיד חָכָם, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁסָּרַח — אֵין תּוֹרָתוֹ נִמְאֶסֶת. When Rav Dimi came from Eretz Yisrael to Babylonia, he said: In the West, Eretz Yisrael, they say: Rabbi Meir ate a half-ripe date and threw the peel away. In other words, he was able to extract the important content from the inedible shell. Rava taught: What is the meaning of that which is written: “I went down into the garden of nuts, to look at the green plants of the valley” (Song of Songs 6:11)? Why are Torah scholars compared to nuts? To tell you: Just as this nut, despite being soiled with mud and excrement, its content is not made repulsive, as only its shell is soiled; so too a Torah scholar, although he has sinned, his Torah is not made repulsive. [essentially a nut from Shlomo in his youth] ​ אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ רַבָּה בַּר שֵׁילָא לְאֵלִיָּהוּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי קָא עָבֵיד הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: קָאָמַר שְׁמַעְתָּא מִפּוּמַּיְיהוּ דְּכוּלְּהוּ רַבָּנַן, וּמִפּוּמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר לָא קָאָמַר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַמַּאי? מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא גָמַר שְׁמַעְתָּא מִפּוּמֵּיהּ דְּאַחֵר. אָמַר לֵיהּ: אַמַּאי? רַבִּי מֵאִיר רִמּוֹן מָצָא, תּוֹכוֹ אָכַל, קְלִיפָּתוֹ זָרַק. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַשְׁתָּא קָאָמַר, מֵאִיר בְּנִי אוֹמֵר: בִּזְמַן שֶׁאָדָם מִצְטַעֵר, שְׁכִינָה מָה לָשׁוֹן אוֹמֶרֶת: קַלַּנִי מֵרֹאשִׁי, קַלַּנִי מִזְּרוֹעִי. אִם כָּךְ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מִצְטַעֵר עַל דָּמָן שֶׁל רְשָׁעִים — קַל וָחוֹמֶר עַל דָּמָן שֶׁל צַדִּיקִים שֶׁנִּשְׁפַּךְ. The Gemara relates: Rabba bar Sheila found Elijah the prophet, who had appeared to him. He said to Elijah: What is the Holy One, Blessed be He, doing? Elijah said to him: He is stating halakhot transmitted by all of the Sages, but in the name of Rabbi Meir He will not speak. He said to him: Why? He replied: Because he learned halakhot from the mouth of Aḥer. He said to him: Why should he be judged unfavorably for that? Rabbi Meir found a pomegranate and ate its contents while throwing away its peel. He said to him: Indeed, your defense has been heard above. Now God is saying: My son, Meir, says: When a person (SheAdam) suffers, e.g., by receiving lashes or the death penalty at the hands of the court, how does the Divine Presence express itself? Woe is Me from My head, woe is Me from My arm, as God empathizes with the sufferer. If the Holy One, Blessed be He, suffers to such an extent over the blood of the wicked, how much more so does He suffer over the blood of the righteous that is spilled. ​ See that even a non-intentional sinner can be a Rasha, a Reish ר that bends his intentions like grass all over the place H'F' ​ -- ​ By the way, fish is much better with squeezed lemon. Maybe even double. Unfortunately I forgot to get them in my last instacart order. My mother (passed away from cancer in '15) used to make almond crusted tilapia with lemon squeezed on it and it was phenominal. ​ Once in Yeshivat Hadar HaTorah, Rabbi Osdoba (I think "Strong Bear") would give a Halacha Shiur (class) before lunch. One I remember is that although squeezing liquids is forbidden on Shabbat, if one squeezes it directly into food like salad or fish (I forget about drinks ++ <-- to Ctrl+F to return) it is Kosher since it is going from food directly to food. ​ I see now that I was the lemon getting squeezed onto salads (we used to study from before sunrise to after dark with maybe 2-3 hours of breaks. I think 12 or 13 hours a day) and we were having a Shabbat Tamim. ​ Another Dvar Torah from Rabbi Osdoba from a large Ferbrengen (light Torah-study night meal ideally with Tirosh and not YAYin+ as we have learned) is that when the Alter Rebbe was imprisoned in Russia, he would not eat the non Kosher food for I think 3 days. Eventually an attendant asked if they could arrange Kosher food and something acceptable was done. The messenger (I think Jewish) asked him what his Novelty on the verse in Bereisheit 3:9 וַיִּקְרָ֛א יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶל־הָֽאָדָ֑ם וַיֹּ֥אמֶר ל֖וֹ אַיֶּֽכָּה׃ God יהוה called out to the Human and said to him, “Where are you?” ​ "Where are you?" when HaShem is asking Adam where he is after Adam was hiding with Chava after the sin. The Altar Rebbe started giving him Rashi:​ ​ איכה WHERE ART THOU — He knew where he was, but He asked this in order to open up a conversation with him that he should not become confused in his reply, if He were to pronounce punishment against him all of a sudden. Similarly in the case of Cain, He said to him, (4:9) “where is Abel thy brother?” Similarly with Balaam, (Numbers 22:9) “what men are these with thee?” — to open up a conversation with them; so, also, in the case of Hezekiah with reference to the messengers of Merodach-baladan (Isaiah 39:3). ​ The messenger said he knew Rashi but he wanted his personal Novel Face. The Rebbe said HaShem wanted Adam to notice how far he had fallen from being king of the world and going on a tour of it with HaShem to now hiding from Him in shame. ​ ' Don't love to give an ugly novelty but the famous picture of the Alter Rebbe looking upwards is the only picture he ever allowed anyone to take of him in his life. This was while he was in prison, and maybe since he didn't seek to find Kosher food for himself, The Lord of Hosts forced him to drop his beautiful "crown/view" of leaves and be subject to witchcraft from voodoo on it and its copies for the rest of his life Heaven save us! ​​ גד We learn from the Dalet, the "poor king" (Bahir), that since there is a vessel built into its back facing the Gimmel, the "rich man running to give Tzedakah", one needs to make himself available for charity in a discreet, honorable manor. ​​ I learned from a Chabad Rabbi once a Baal Shem Tov story that he once needed charity and went and knocked on one door and walked away. The people came running and asked why he essentially ding dong ditched them. He said only a single effort is required for charity and HaShem will fulfill the rest (he was a man on an extremely high level, not average grass that will first likely be repaid by the Anger of HaShem that they've credited up). ​ He ended up getting the charity he needed. ​ -- ​ צִפֹּרֶת כְּרָמִים אוֹמֶרֶת. אֶשָּׂא עֵינַי אֵל הֶהָרִים מֵאַיִן יָבֹא עֶזְרִי: (תהילים קכא א) The [pure] Locust of the Vineyard is saying: “I lift my eyes up to the mountains, wherefrom shall my help come?” ​ חָסִיל אוֹמֵר. יי אֱלֹהַי אַתָּה אֲרוֹמִמְךָ אוֹדֶה שִׁמְךָ כִּי עָשִׂיתָ פֶּלֶא עֵצוֹת מֵרָחוֹק אֱמוּנָה אֹמֶן: (ישעיה כה א) The [Devastating impure] Locust is saying, “YHVH, you are my Elo’ah; I will exalt you, I will praise your Name; for you have done wondrous things; Your counsels of old are faithfulness and truth.” ​ Why is the pure one distressed and the impure one, that Rabbi Scherman says eats the last remaining produce of a field and thereby completely devastates it? Side note, one Chassid in Hadar HaTorah was once learning Bava Kamma with me and we learned that when a pit is 9 Amot (Elbow to finger) lengths and someone falls in and dies, whoever dug it is not liable. However if someones comes and deepens it one Amah, the one who deepens it is liable. I asked him the spiritual lesson and he said whoever finishes a deed [if others relented] is liable for everyone before's actions ​ Its because its written in I think Isaiah "We considered him a criminal". Therefore all of the people that think they are pure are listening to Lashon Hara without proving it about me, according to AskNoah, the "vine" as the Song of the Grape about HaShem not destroying the sweet new wine in the vile cluster is applied to Noah according to Rashi's Face. Therefore the people that found the Beginning of Shabbat are the one's that decided against maybe some "Adam's" opinions not to go here Heaven save us. ​ פֶּלֶא עֵצוֹת Pele Aytzot - Wondrous counsels, a form of a name of Mashiach, Pele Yoaytz. Aytzot is a form of plural, "Smichot" (leaning form) of Tree and Yoaytz is Tree with the masculine half of HaShem's name in front, the "Crown" of the word. ​ -- ​ Nissan 27 ​ בְּקוֹל שִׁישִּׁי אוֹמֵר. אַל תֶּאֱהַב שֵׁנָה פֶּן תִּוָּרֵשׁ פְּקַח עֵינֶיךָ שְׂבַע לָחֶם: (משלי כ יג) In its sixth call, it is saying, “Do not love sleep, lest you come to poverty; open your eyes, and you shall be satisfied with bread.” ​ Or ​ The Rooster is Singing, "Do not love eating [Har]Shin, lest you get plowed/impoverished. Open up your [all-inclusive] people-person weekly to be sated with bread. ​ You people have always been greedy like the dog, as its said the face of the Messianic generation will be the face of a dog and there is a verse about it: "The dogs are greedy, they never know satiation." You've forced me to do Kiruv efforts all the time maybe 6 days a week or so considering some light "apple shade" and I end up getting disgusted being force fed vegetables and start cursing and plowing all of you H'F'. ​ Since we all agree I am like a quail/rooster-chicken, this is like an Adam who reaches the level of Understanding and can "Fly Heavenward, who can catch Her?" ​ Without Sefaria and cross searching with the internet I couldn't imagine how long it would take to reach the level I (we?) are now at. ​ My father told me quail eggs are a delicacy. Better to take a lesson from the Fruit of the Dog if you do this and go full in; ​ כְּלָבִים אוֹמְרִים. בֹּאוּ נִשְׁתַּחֲוֶה וְנִכְרָעָה נִבְרְכָה לִפְנֵי יְיָ עֹשֵׂנוּ: (תהילים צה ו) The Dogs are saying, “Come all, let us worship and bow down; let us kneel before YHVH our Maker.” ​ You can lie flat and prostrate yourself (if your are "sensitive" lift your member off the ground a little) as long as you are not on polished/smoothed stone (this is a Halacha directly from a Torah verse). If so you can put a towel or something down and prostrate on it. This should have instant Perfections of an effect on you B'H' ​ ​The dog sings the last song of Perek Shira and Natan Scherman calls it the "Pinnacle" of the Sefer. This is the concluding paragraph: ​ (ילקוט שמעוני פרשת בא רמז קפז) רַבִּי יְשַׁעְיָה תַּלְמִידוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן דּוֹסָא הִתְעַנָּה חָמֵשׁ וּשְׁמוֹנִים תַּעֲנִיּוֹת. אָמַר כְּלָבִים שֶׁכָּתוּב בָּהֶם (ישעיה נו יא) וְהַכְּלָבִים עַזֵּי נֶפֶשׁ לֹא יָדְעוּ שָׂבְעָה, יִזְכּוּ לוֹמַר שִׁירָה. עָנָה לוֹ מַלְאָךְ מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם וְאָמַר לוֹ יְשַעְיָה עַד מָתַי אַתָּה מִתְעַנֶּה עַל זֶה הַדָּבָר. שְׁבוּעָה הִיא מִלִּפְנֵי הַמָּקוֹם בָּרוּךְ הוּא מִיּוֹם שֶׁגִּילָּה סוֹדוֹ לַחֲבַקּוּק הַנָּבִיא לֹא גִלָּה דָבָר זֶה לְשׁוּם בְּרִיאָה בָּעוֹלָם. אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִיל שֶׁתַּלְמִידוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם גָּדוֹל אַתָּה שְׁלָחוּנִי מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם לִזְדַקֵּק אֵלֶיךָ לְהַגִיד לְךָ בַּמֶה זָכוּ הַכְּלָבִים לוֹמַר שִׁירָה. לְפִי שֶׁכָּתוּב בָּהֶם (שמות יא ז) וּלְכֹל בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לֹא יֶחֱרַץ כֶּלֶב לְשׁוֹנוֹ. וְלֹא עוֹד אֶלָּא שֶׁזָכוּ לְעַבֵּד עוֹרוֹת מִצּוֹאָתָם שֶׁכּוֹתְבִים בָּהֶם תְּפִילִּין וּמְזוּזוֹת וְסִפְרֵי תּוֹרָה. עַל כֵּן זָכוּ לוֹמַר שִׁירָה. וּלְעִנְיַן הַשְׁאֵלָה שֶּׁשָּׁאַלְתָּ חֲזוֹר לַאֲחֹרֶיךָ וְאַל תּוֹסִיף בַּדָּבָר הַזֶּה עוֹד, כְּמוֹ שֶׁכָּתוּב (משלי כא כג) שׁוֹמֵר פִּיו וּלְשׁוֹנוֹ שׁוֹמֵר מִצָּרוֹת נַפְשׁוֹ. בָּרוּךְ יְיָ לְעוֹלָם אָמֵן וְאָמֵן׃ [Yalkut Shimoni, Bo 187:] Rabbi Yeshayah, student of Rabbi Ḥanina ben Dosa, fasted eighty-five fasts. He said, “Dogs, about which it is written, ‘the dogs are brazen of spirit; they do not know satisfaction' — shall they merit saying a song?” An angel answered him from Heaven and said to him, “Yeshayah, until when will you fast over this? It is an oath from the blessed Holy One; from the day that he revealed his secret to Havakuk the prophet, he has not revealed this matter to anyone in the world. But because you are the student of a great man, I have been sent from Heaven to assist you. They said that dogs have written about them, ‘No dog sharpened its tongue against any of the children of Yisra’el'. Furthermore, they merited that hides are tanned with their excrement, on which Tefillin, Mezuzot, and Torah scrolls are written. For this reason they merited saying a song. And regarding what you asked, take back your word and do not continue in this way, as it is written, ‘He that guards his mouth and tongue, guards from afflictions of his soul.’” Blessed is YHVH forever, Amen and Amen. ​ נִשְׁתַּחֲוֶ֣ה can also mean to prostrate oneself. ​ - ​ If you are drinking the kool aid vinegrr and think I should do more Kiruv even every day like a dog, here is a proof from Berachot 2:6 רָחַץ לַיְלָה הָרִאשׁוֹן שֶׁמֵּתָה אִשְׁתּוֹ. אָמְרוּ לוֹ תַלְמִידָיו, לֹא לִמַּדְתָּנוּ, רַבֵּנוּ, שֶׁאָבֵל אָסוּר לִרְחֹץ. אָמַר לָהֶם, אֵינִי כִשְׁאָר כָּל אָדָם, אִסְטְנִיס אָנִי: The mishna relates another episode portraying unusual conduct by Rabban Gamliel. He bathed on the first night after his wife died. His students said to him: Have you not taught us, our teacher, that a mourner is prohibited to bathe? He answered them: I am not like other people, I am delicate [istenis]. For me, not bathing causes actual physical distress, and even a mourner need not suffer physical distress as part of his mourning. ​ I once heard from Rabbi Chaim Coffman (Crown Heaven-bread) who's Rabbi is Moshe Sternbach (Maybe SeiterBach - I think "Dwelling in It(??)") based on the verse "She is a Tree of Life to those who cleave to Her" that the more Torah one learns, the physically weaker one gets.. Maybe like how a large Aylon (oak/beech etc) doesn't sway nearly as much as a young tree or sapling. ​ Therefore a person needs to be a bull to be strong enough for the Torah study to then become a rooster/quail or other Kosher bird and reach Heaven. ​ -- ​ Bereisheit 3:24 ​ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ׀ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהִ֗ים הֵ֤ן הָֽאָדָם֙ הָיָה֙ כְּאַחַ֣ד מִמֶּ֔נּוּ לָדַ֖עַת ט֣וֹב וָרָ֑ע וְעַתָּ֣ה ׀ פֶּן־יִשְׁלַ֣ח יָד֗וֹ וְלָקַח֙ גַּ֚ם מֵעֵ֣ץ הַֽחַיִּ֔ים וְאָכַ֖ל וָחַ֥י לְעֹלָֽם׃ And God יהוה said, “Now that humankind has become like any of us [Lit. CeAchad, like The Majestic/Mysterious One from Us], knowing good and bad, what if one should stretch out a hand and take also from the tree of life and eat, and live forever!” ​ וַֽיְשַׁלְּחֵ֛הוּ יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהִ֖ים מִגַּן־עֵ֑דֶן לַֽעֲבֹד֙ אֶת־הָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֻקַּ֖ח מִשָּֽׁם׃ So God יהוה banished humankind from the garden of Eden, to till the soil from which he had taken: [He חשך Chuppah Shkach, married (The Mishnah calls marrying "taking" a woman) dead/fallen plant parts and is now in Choshech, darkness for it Heaven save us from such fates forever! ​ וַיְגָ֖רֶשׁ אֶת־הָֽאָדָ֑ם וַיַּשְׁכֵּן֩ מִקֶּ֨דֶם לְגַן־עֵ֜דֶן אֶת־הַכְּרֻבִ֗ים וְאֵ֨ת לַ֤הַט הַחֶ֙רֶב֙ הַמִּתְהַפֶּ֔כֶת לִשְׁמֹ֕ר אֶת־דֶּ֖רֶךְ עֵ֥ץ הַֽחַיִּֽים׃ {ס} it was driven out; and east of the garden of Eden were stationed the cherubim and the fiery ever-turning sword, to guard the way to the tree of life. ​ Cherubim are the two I think 2 year old golden angels made on the Ark in the Holy of Holies. If you want access to the Torah, you need to be simple and innocent like a 2(?) year old made of pure gold (the Fear of HaShem, see the verse on Enosh being as rare as fine gold and Adam the gold of Ophir) ​ Then, the Satin(s) will be like a 2 year old golden child to you as well and teach you Torah by "spitting" in your ground waters. ​ ChatGPT: Yeah, actually — most people do release a tiny bit of saliva when they speak, even if it’s not noticeable. It’s totally normal and usually happens in tiny droplets called "aerosols." It depends on how loudly you're talking, how clearly you're enunciating, and which sounds you're making (like "P" and "T" sounds tend to produce more). ​ Therefore interpret this Mishnah from Yadayim 1 on normal speech instead of actual spit in disgust H'F' ​ Funny that Pay is Dominance and Tet is a Pay with a Zayin (a sword/other instrument of war, a crown) after it. Rashi: ואורח צדיקים כאור נוגה. שהולך ומאיר מעמוד השחר: But the way of the righteous is like the light of dawn which shines and illuminates from the first ray of dawn. עד נכון היום. עד חצות היום שהוא בירורו של יום: until the day is perfect Until midday, which is the brightest time of day. ​ I used to rush in the morning to drink coffee and clear my bowels out to get Tefillin on and say the Shema and the brief prayer and remembrances but I was taking hits every time from rushing. Remember we learned that the High Priest is liable for death for rushing in his service. ​ I say the Shema without Tzitzit and/or Tefillin first to get it in before sunrise. Chabad learns in the mornings for an hour before their torturous repetitive Shacharit (morning service) according to the words of the Rebbe. Today I didn't get Tefillin on until around 12 and had the merit of all this Torah and had maybe one very light rose thorn. ​ -- ​ Hilchot Aydut (Testimony 9:1) עֲשָׂרָה מִינֵי פַּסְלוּת הֵם כָּל מִי שֶׁנִּמְצָא בּוֹ אֶחָד מֵהֶן הֲרֵי הוּא פָּסוּל לְעֵדוּת. וְאֵלּוּ הֵן. הַנָּשִׁים. וְהָעֲבָדִים. וְהַקְּטַנִּים. וְהַשּׁוֹטִים. וְהַחֵרְשִׁים. וְהַסּוּמִים. וְהָרְשָׁעִים. וְהַבְּזוּיִין. וְהַקְּרוֹבִין. וְהַנּוֹגְעִין בְּעֵדוּתָן. הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ עֲשָׂרָה: There are ten categories of disqualifications. Any person belonging to one of them is not acceptable as a witness. They are: a) women; b) servants; c) minors; (from 9:8 If he does not manifest the upper signs of maturity at 13, we do not accept him as a witness until he is inspected [his lower body].) d) mentally or emotionally unstable individuals; (from 9:10) People who are very feeble-witted who do not understand that matters contradict each other and are incapable of comprehending a concept as it would be comprehended by people at large are considered among those mentally unstable. This also applies to the people who are continually unsettled, tumultuous, and deranged. This matter is dependent on the judgment of the judge. It is impossible to describe the mental and emotional states of people in a text. e) deaf-mutes; (9:11: Similarly, if a person loses the ability to speak, even though his intellectual faculties have been checked as a husband is checked with regard to a bill of divorce, he testifies in writing, and his testimony is to the point, it is not accepted at all, except with regard to releasing a women from marriage, for leniency was granted so that women will not be forced to live alone.) f) the blind; g) the wicked; ( 10:2: The important one!) What is meant by "a wicked person"? Anyone who violates a prohibition punishable by lashes is considered wicked and is unacceptable as a witness. For the Torah referred to a person obligated to receive lashes with the term "wicked," as Deuteronomy 25:2 states: "If the wicked person is liable to be beaten." Needless to say, a person who is obligated to be executed by the court is unacceptable, for Numbers 35:31 states: "He is a wicked person who is sentenced to die." ​ h) debased individuals; (10:4) There are other wicked persons who are not acceptable as witnesses even though they are required to make financial restitution and are not punished by lashes. Since they take money that does not belong to them lawlessly, they are unacceptable, as Deuteronomy 19:16 states: "When a lawless witness rises up against a person...." For example, thieves and people who seize property, even though they make restitution, they are no longer acceptable as witnesses from the time they stole or robbed onward. Similarly, a lying witness, even though his testimony was disproved with regard to financial matters and he made restitution, he is still unacceptable as a witness according to Scriptural Law for all matters. From when is he disqualified? From the time he testified falsely in court, even though his testimony was not disproved until several days later. Similarly, when people are involved with loans at interest - both the borrower and the lender - if fixed interest is involved, both are disqualified according to Scriptural Law. [There are more examples given] i) relatives [not the case for conversion witnesses at least according to the SA]; j) people who have a vested interest in the matter; a total of ten. ​ **If you "Eat of the strenuous labor of your own hands" to be "fortunate and good for you", remember to take the Rabbinic prohibitions with sea-salt of the times. ​ -- ​ Maybe another reason I have a high level of Binah is because in elementary school (ironically called the Baker Lions) they used to make us do crossword and word finding anagram puzzles. Rabbi Yehuda bar Simon interpreted the verses regarding the generations. “The earth was emptiness and disorder” – this is Adam the first man, who became oblivion and nothingness. “And disorder” – this is Cain, who sought to restore the world to emptiness and disorder. “And darkness” – this is the generation of Enosh, based on the verse: “Their actions are in the dark and they say: Who sees us and who knows of us?” (Isaiah 29:15). “Upon the face of the depths” – this is the generation of the Flood, as it is stated: “On that day all the wellsprings of the great depths were breached” (Genesis 7:11). “And the spirit [ruaḥ] of God was hovering over the surface of the water” – based on the verse: “God passed a wind [ruaḥ] over the earth” (Genesis 8:1). The Holy One blessed be He said: ‘Until when will the world conduct itself in darkness? Let some light come.’ “God said: Let there be light” (Genesis 1:3) – this is Abraham. That is what is written [regarding Abraham]: “Who roused [he’ir] righteousness from the east?” (Isaiah 41:2). Do not read it as he’ir, but rather, he’ir. “God called the light, Day, and the darkness, He called Night. It was evening and it was morning, one day” (Genesis 1:5). “God called the light, Day” – this is Jacob. “And the darkness, He called Night” – this is Esau. “It was evening” – this is Esau; “and it was morning” – this is Jacob. “It was evening” – the evening of Esau; “and it was morning” – the morning of Jacob. “One day” – as it is stated: “There will be one day, it will be known to the Lord, that is not day and not night…” (Zechariah 14:7). Alternatively, “one day” – which the Holy One blessed be He provided him. Which is that? It is Yom Kippur. ​ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ פָּתַר קְרָיָא בַּגָּלֻיּוֹת, וְהָאָרֶץ הָיְתָה תֹהוּ, זֶה גָּלוּת בָּבֶל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר (ירמיה ד, כט): רָאִיתִי אֶת הָאָרֶץ וְהִנֵּה תֹהוּ. וָבֹהוּ, זֶה גָּלוּת מָדַי (אסתר ו, יד): וַיַּבְהִלוּ לְהָבִיא אֶת הָמָן. וְחשֶׁךְ, זֶה גָּלוּת יָוָן, שֶׁהֶחֱשִׁיכָה עֵינֵיהֶם שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל בִּגְזֵרוֹתֵיהֶן, שֶׁהָיְתָה אוֹמֶרֶת לָהֶם, כִּתְבוּ עַל קֶרֶן הַשּׁוֹר שֶׁאֵין לָכֶם חֵלֶק בֵּאלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל. עַל פְּנֵי תְהוֹם, זֶה גָּלוּת מַמְלֶכֶת הָרְשָׁעָה, שֶׁאֵין לָהֶם חֵקֶר כְּמוֹ הַתְּהוֹם, מַה הַתְּהוֹם הַזֶּה אֵין לוֹ חֵקֶר, אַף הָרְשָׁעִים כֵּן. וְרוּחַ אֱלֹהִים מְרַחֶפֶת, זֶה רוּחוֹ שֶׁל מֶלֶךְ הַמָּשִׁיחַ, הֵיאַךְ מָה דְאַתְּ אָמַר (ישעיה יא, ב): וְנָחָה עָלָיו רוּחַ ה', בְּאֵיזוֹ זְכוּת מְמַשְׁמֶשֶׁת וּבָאָה, הַמְרַחֶפֶת עַל פְּנֵי הַמָּיִם, בִּזְכוּת הַתְּשׁוּבָה שֶׁנִּמְשְׁלָה כַּמַּיִם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר (איכה ב, יט): שִׁפְכִי כַמַּיִם לִבֵּךְ. רַבִּי חַגַּי בְּשֵׁם רַבִּי פְּדָת אָמַר, בְּרִית כְּרוּתָה לַמַּיִם שֶׁאֲפִלּוּ בִּשְׁעַת שָׁרָב רוּחָה שַׁיְיפָה, וּכְבָר הָיָה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן זוֹמָא יוֹשֵׁב וְתוֹהֶא, וְעָבַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וְשָׁאַל בִּשְׁלוֹמוֹ, פַּעַם וּשְׁתַּיִם וְלֹא הֵשִׁיבוֹ, בַּשְׁלִישִׁית הֵשִׁיבוֹ בִּבְהִילוּת, אָמַר לוֹ בֶּן זוֹמָא מֵאַיִן הָרַגְלַיִם, אָמַר לוֹ מְעַיֵּן הָיִיתִי, אָמַר לוֹ מֵעִיד אֲנִי עָלַי שָׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ שֶׁאֵינִי זָז מִכָּאן עַד שֶׁתּוֹדִיעֵנִי מֵאַיִן הָרַגְלַיִם. אָמַר לוֹ מִסְתַּכֵּל הָיִיתִי בְּמַעֲשֵׂה בְרֵאשִׁית, וְלֹא הָיָה בֵּין מַיִם הָעֶלְיוֹנִים לַמַּיִם הַתַּחְתּוֹנִים אֶלָּא כִּשְׁתַּיִם וְשָׁלשׁ אֶצְבָּעוֹת, וְרוּחַ אֱלֹהִים מְנַשֶּׁבֶת אֵין כְּתִיב כָּאן אֶלָּא מְרַחֶפֶת, כָּעוֹף הַזֶּה שֶׁהוּא מְרַפְרֵף בִּכְנָפָיו וּכְנָפָיו נוֹגְעוֹת וְאֵינָן נוֹגְעוֹת. נֶהְפַּךְ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וְאָמַר לְתַלְמִידָיו, הָלַךְ לוֹ בֶּן זוֹמָא, וְלֹא שָׁהוּ יָמִים מֻעָטִים וּבֶן זוֹמָא בָּעוֹלָם. Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish interpreted the verses regarding the [four] kingdoms. “The earth was emptiness” – this is the Babylonian kingdom, as it is stated: “I have seen the land, and behold, it was emptiness and disorder” (Jeremiah 4:23). “And disorder [vavohu]” – this is the Median kingdom, [as it is stated:] “They hastened [vayavhilu] to bring Haman” (Esther 6:14). “And darkness”– this is the Greek kingdom, which darkened Israel’s eyes with their edicts, as they used to say to them: ‘Write on the horn of a bull that you have no portion in the God of Israel.’ “Upon the face of the depths” – this is the evil kingdom [Edom], which cannot be calculated, like the depths; just as the depths cannot be calculated, so is it with [the wickedness of] the wicked. “ And the spirit of God was hovering” – this is the spirit of the messianic king, as it says: “The spirit of the Lord will rest upon him” (Isaiah 11:2). By what merit will it [the Messianic kingdom] come? “Hovering over the surface of the water” – by the merit of repentance, that is likened to water, as it is stated: “Pour out your heart like water [before the face of the Lord]” (Lamentations 2:19). Rabbi Ḥagai said in the name of Rabbi Pedat: A covenant is made with the water, that even when the weather is hot, the wind blows over it. *To cool it off. This is why the word for “hovered” is written meraḥefet, in the present tense. It happened once that Rabbi Shimon ben Zoma was sitting, entranced in thought. Rabbi Yehoshua passed and greeted him once, twice, but he did not answer him. The third time, he answered him with a start. He said to him: ‘Ben Zoma, where were your thoughts?’ He said to him: ‘I have been contemplating.’ He said to him: ‘As the heavens and the earth are my witnesses, I shall not move from here until you inform me where your thoughts were.’ He said to him: ‘I was looking at the act of Creation, and [I saw that] between the upper waters and the lower waters there were only two or three fingerbreadths. “The spirit of the Lord was blowing” is not written, but rather, “was hovering” – like a bird that flaps its wings, *As it hovers over its nest. they touch [the nest] but do not quite touch.’ Rabbi Yehoshua turned and said to his disciples: Ben Zoma is gone. *Having experienced such supernal revelations, he is no longer of this world. Not even a few days passed with ben Zoma still in the world. ​ רַבִּי אַבָּהוּ וְרַבִּי חִיָּא רַבָּה, רַבִּי אַבָּהוּ אָמַר מִתְּחִלַּת בְּרִיָּתוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם צָפָה הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בְּמַעֲשֵׂיהֶן שֶׁל צַדִּיקִים וּמַעֲשֵׂיהֶן שֶׁל רְשָׁעִים, הֲדָא הוּא דִּכְתִיב (תהלים א, ו): כִּי יוֹדֵעַ ה' דֶּרֶךְ צַדִּיקִים וְדֶרֶךְ רְשָׁעִים תֹּאבֵד. וְהָאָרֶץ הָיְתָה תֹהוּ וָבֹהוּ, אֵלּוּ מַעֲשֵׂיהֶן שֶׁל רְשָׁעִים, וַיֹּאמֶר אֱלֹהִים יְהִי אוֹר, אֵלּוּ מַעֲשֵׂיהֶן שֶׁל צַדִּיקִים, אֲבָל אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ בְּאֵיזֶה מֵהֶם חָפֵץ, אִם בְּמַעֲשֵׂה אֵלּוּ אִם בְּמַעֲשֵׂה אֵלּוּ, כֵּיוָן דִּכְתִיב וַיַּרְא אֱלֹהִים אֶת הָאוֹר כִּי טוֹב, הֱוֵי בְּמַעֲשֵׂיהֶן שֶׁל צַדִּיקִים חָפֵץ, וְאֵינוֹ חָפֵץ בְּמַעֲשֵׂיהֶן שֶׁל רְשָׁעִים. אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּא רַבָּה, מִתְּחִלַּת בְּרִיָּתוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם צָפָה הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ בָּנוּי וְחָרֵב וּבָנוּי, בְּרֵאשִׁית בָּרָא אֱלֹהִים, הֲרֵי בָּנוּי, הֵיאַךְ מָה דְּאַתְּ אָמַר (ישעיה נא, טז): לִנְטֹעַ שָׁמַיִם וְלִיסֹד אָרֶץ וְלֵאמֹר לְצִיּוֹן עַמִּי אָתָּה. וְהָאָרֶץ הָיְתָה תֹהוּ וָבֹהוּ, הֲרֵי חָרֵב, הֵיךְ מָה דְּאַתְּ אָמַר (ירמיה ד, כג): רָאִיתִי אֶת הָאָרֶץ וְהִנֵּה תֹהוּ וָבֹהוּ. וַיֹּאמֶר אֱלֹהִים יְהִי אוֹר, הֲרֵי בָּנוּי וּמְשֻׁכְלָל לֶעָתִיד לָבֹא, הֵיאַךְ מָה דְּאַתְּ אָמַר (ישעיה ס, א): קוּמִי אוֹרִי כִּי בָא אוֹרֵךְ, וּכְתִיב (ישעיה ס, כ): כִּי הִנֵּה הַחשֶׁךְ יְכַסֶּה אֶרֶץ וַעֲרָפֶל לְאֻמִּים וְעָלַיִךְ יִזְרַח ה' וּכְבוֹדוֹ עָלַיִךְ יֵרָאֶה. Rabbi Abahu and Rabbi Ḥiyya the Great, Rabbi Abahu said: Right from the beginning of the creation of the world, the Holy One blessed be He foresaw the actions of the righteous and the actions of the wicked. That is what is written: “For the Lord knows the way of the righteous, but the way of the wicked will perish” (Psalms 1:6). “The earth was emptiness and disorder” – these are the actions of the wicked. “God said: Let there be light” – these are the actions of the righteous. But I do not know which He desires, whether it is the actions of these, or the actions of those. When it is written: “God saw the light, that it was good” (Genesis 1:4) – this shows that He desires the actions of the righteous, and does not desire the actions of the wicked. ​ See that the spiritual wars of these times between Yaakov/YisraEl, Esav, me, and those aligned with Edom are among the first things created, adding to the Divine Epicness ​ - ​ Also, pigs: if you send another fork at me God forbid and God slay you if so! and I will say its obviously a political war like how you and Witchary or Yosef Died-en ripped each other apart with your tongues and cursed each other, yet you were "sending fingers" and were therefore liable for death according to Torah Law if you knew what you were doing. I literally sit at home all day anyway and I will just keep perpetually cursing and judging you by waving my fingernails in my harsh wrath until you go insane and release me back to Gan Ayden so I can take a hike or something once in awhile and get away from your vile rotten vegetables and catfish. ​ Dvarim 33:11 בָּרֵ֤ךְ יְהֹוָה֙ חֵיל֔וֹ וּפֹ֥עַל יָדָ֖יו תִּרְצֶ֑ה מְחַ֨ץ מׇתְנַ֧יִם קָמָ֛יו וּמְשַׂנְאָ֖יו מִן־יְקוּמֽוּן׃ {ס} Bless, יהוה, his (Levi's) substance, And the work of his hands, favor. However, any prohibited labor [in general or] involved in the mitzva of circumcision itself that cannot be performed on Shabbat eve overrides Shabbat. ​ He gives this opinion elsewhere in the Mishnah (Pesachim 6:2) and in the Gemara he specifies that one needs to be extremely thoughtful on every Mitzvah he does like this, whether he would be able to accomplish it before Shabbat starts Friday evening. ​​ ​ אמת ​ Emeth, (Emet), Truth, can be read, Aym Thaf - Your mother is the Ugliness to the Perfection of Torah (with a Taf, representing Perfect Beauty) ​ As Ohr HaChaim says on Chayyah being called Aym Col Chay, the Mother of all Life after the sin and not Chayyah, her name like Adam was called, Adam's sin was unintentional and Chayyah tried to kill him Heaven save us. ​ If you think that during Shabbat when liable idolatrous people get executed by one witness when Tzion extends to the whole world, the Rooster says "Do not love putting teeth (Shayne or Shayna) to sleep lest you be impoverished and plowed with no fruits. Actually I think a sweet crabapple like the Wickson (but not cultivated like it) for example is actually the most valuable tree since it feeds you (smaller that one doesn't waste) fruits, they are dominant in the forest (certain areas of forests can have crabapples that pollinate each other to have sweet fruits), and if you need to you can rip your shirt, make it into a sling and kill a wizard who still has his wild donkey (flesh) if you need to H'F' ​ -- ​ ​If you were doubting me this is what ChatGPT says (I wasn't positive until now either) ​ Yes, you can make a basic sling like David’s sling from just a shirt. Here's how you could do it: Steps to make a makeshift sling from a shirt: Tear or cut the shirt into a long strip. You want a strip about 2 to 3 feet long (around 60–90 cm). If the shirt is sturdy, like thick cotton or flannel, even better. Make the pouch: In the middle of the strip, widen the fabric a little (like bunch it up less tightly) to form a small "pouch" that will hold the stone. OR: If the shirt is thin, you can tie a small loose knot in the center to create a "cup" where the stone sits. Form the release and anchor cords: One end of the strip: Tie a small loop (this will go around your finger — typically the middle finger). Other end: Leave it loose — this is the side you’ll let go when you launch the stone. Load and use: Place a smallish round stone in the pouch part. Hold the looped end on your finger. Hold the loose end between your thumb and forefinger. Swing the sling in a few circles (horizontal or vertical plane) and release the loose end at the right moment to launch. Quick sketch of how the setup works: scss CopyEdit [Loop]---------{Pouch with stone}---------Loose end (finger) (let go) Notes: The shirt material must be strong enough not to tear mid-swing. T-shirt cotton may stretch too much, but ripping along the grain will help. Ideal rocks: Round, about the size of a golf ball or smaller. It takes practice to aim — David wasn’t a beginner! ​ (It also gave the method of 4 strips tied to a pouch) ​ Since David HaMelech originally wrote the Song of the Apple in Perek Shira, apply this to him since he was a man of war taking many (too many Heaven save us) Yefet Toarot. Maybe he was tasting from many wild apples for his dessert and his slingshot ammo in the battle camps, and that's why is says "And his fruit was sweet to my palate". Shouldn't it be obvious that apples are sweet? Therefore I think it is clearly alluding to wild battlefield apples when one has to make forest camps. ​ This is a version on Sefaria ​ תַּפּוּחַ אוֹמֵר. כְּתַפּוּחַ בַּעֲצֵי הַיַּעַר כֵּן דּוֹדִי בֵּין הַבָּנִים בְּצִלּוֹ חִמַּדְתִּי וְיָשַׁבְתִּי וּפִרְיוֹ מָתוֹק לְחִכִּי: (שיר השירים ב ג) The Apricot is saying, “Like the apricot tree among the trees of the [forest]wood, so is my beloved among young men. I sat down under his shadow with delight, and his fruit was sweet to my taste.” ​ calling it a stone fruit. Establishing a general moral principle, the Sages the school of Rabbi Yannai said: A lion does not roar standing over a basket of straw from which he derives no pleasure, but he roars standing over a basket of meat, as he only roars when satiated. ​ You should be salivating when the goyim ghosts send their finest meats and cheeses, their living wizard/witch wild donkey Giboarim, not crying and 'feming H'F' ​ ------- ​ ***Free Treasure Alert*** ​ Berachot 5:5 הַמִּתְפַּלֵּל וְטָעָה, סִימָן רַע לוֹ. וְאִם שְׁלִיחַ צִבּוּר הוּא, סִימָן רַע לְשׁוֹלְחָיו, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁשְּׁלוּחוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם כְּמוֹתוֹ. אָמְרוּ עָלָיו עַל רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶן דּוֹסָא, כְּשֶׁהָיָה מִתְפַּלֵּל עַל הַחוֹלִים וְאוֹמֵר, זֶה חַי וְזֶה מֵת. אָמְרוּ לוֹ, מִנַּיִן אַתָּה יוֹדֵעַ. אָמַר לָהֶם, אִם שְׁגוּרָה תְפִלָּתִי בְּפִי, יוֹדֵעַ אֲנִי שֶׁהוּא מְקֻבָּל. וְאִם לָאו, יוֹדֵעַ אֲנִי שֶׁהוּא מְטֹרָף: Concluding its discussion of the halakhot of prayer, the mishna discusses less practical aspects of prayer. One who prays and realizes that he erred in his prayer, it is a bad omen for him; it indicates to him that his prayer was not accepted. And if he who erred is the communal prayer leader, it is a bad omen for those who sent him, because a person’s agent has legal status equivalent to his own. On a similar note, they said about Rabbi Ḥanina ben Dosa that he would pray on behalf of the sick and immediately after his prayer he would say: This one shall recover from his illness and live and this one shall die. When they said to him: From where do you know? He said to them: If my prayer is fluent in my mouth as I recite it and there are no errors, I know that my prayer is accepted. And if not, I know that my prayer is rejected. ​ I've been tracking this for years and it is very very consistent. That is why I said at the beginning of AyshDaat on the curse in YeshaYahu 65:15 "If it is fluent in your mouth". There is an opinion in the Gemara in Berachot that one need not even recite the 3 paragraphs of Benching after bread. He can just say "Blessed is The Master of this bread/food". I don't make it that short but I essentially rely on this opinion in order not to be analyzed and artificially stumbled during prayer and then tazed Heaven save us! I say the regular introduction, Baruch Ata.. (Blessed are you Lord our God King of the Universe) who sustains the whole world in grace, kindness, and mercy. He gives bread to all flesh, indeed His Kindness is Eternal (the first two sentences). ​ -By the way, I once saw a study in college that smoking cannabis before the age of 19 or 20 (when the 3rd level of soul, the Neshama comes in and a person becomes liable in the Heavenly court) can permanently alter the brain (possibly in a good way?). Anyway you should definitely do extensive research before smoking anything before the age of 20 or drinking anything other than light wine or beer (that the Torah strongly discourages anyway). Also the Sages in Pesachim 107a have a very low opinion of beer and say one should not recite Kiddush or Havdalah on it. This is (/was hopefully) the favorite beverage of the "hidden kings of the nations" (Pennsylvania is latin for Penn's woods, representing the kings/gods of the nations and it seems everyone here is secretly royal bloods). Fitting for HaShem's opinion of them. ​ If you think about it, wheat is not even a perennial plant like native vegetables. It is an annual that needs replanted every year. Wine comes from grapes (or other fruits. For example the wine Noach got drunk on after the flood was fig wine) and there is no need to restate all of the significant spiritual parables and practical/scientific benefits of fruit trees. ​ -- ​ A thought about plants "parenting/ruling over" the fish and birds and beasts and man since they were created a day(s) before: ​ It is easy to eat meat, even wild bull/ram/deer meat, if a person practices slinging rocks at a boulder with a used cloth he found in the trash or something and knows how to make a makeshift fire from youtube or boy scouts etc. (or can afford or steal [for his survival needs] a bic lighter or box of matches). Or even nowadays if he can afford a $15 slingshot on ebay and metal ammo. Even better the Kosher way would be to set a trap and Kosher slaughter with a perfectly sharp knife. ​ However, all who have tried to sow even vegetables from seed know it is extremely hard for the sprouts to survive. If you get too excited and sow before the last frost they all die and you have to sow again. Then it takes a months of carefully watching the plants to make sure they don't dry out. And in the end one plant only gets you 1 to a few meals. ​ The point is that "the fruit", as its written "HaPeirot Toratecha" "Is the fruit not Your Torah?" is actually much harder to attain than meat, compared to Gemara/Tree war Machloket battles. Fruit/bread is compared to regular Written Torah. If a person doesn't know how to properly analyze the Hebrew to get all of or multiple of the "Faces", it is much better to read Gemara in order to learn how and get more real life, practical examples of expressing Torah. But remember Rambam says one should only eat meat if he/she desires it. ​ -- ​ Iyar 3 ​ When the disposable cannabis wax vape cartridges in 2019 became popular, my friends at the furniture store I was working at started warning that there are things in them that are not good. Avot 2:10 הֵם אָמְרוּ שְׁלשָׁה דְבָרִים. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר, יְהִי כְבוֹד חֲבֵרְךָ חָבִיב עָלֶיךָ כְּשֶׁלָּךְ, וְאַל תְּהִי נוֹחַ לִכְעֹס. וְשׁוּב יוֹם אֶחָד לִפְנֵי מִיתָתְךָ. וֶהֱוֵי מִתְחַמֵּם כְּנֶגֶד אוּרָן שֶׁל חֲכָמִים, וֶהֱוֵי זָהִיר בְּגַחַלְתָּן שֶׁלֹּא תִכָּוֶה, שֶׁנְּשִׁיכָתָן נְשִׁיכַת שׁוּעָל, וַעֲקִיצָתָן עֲקִיצַת עַקְרָב, וּלְחִישָׁתָן לְחִישַׁת שָׂרָף, וְכָל דִּבְרֵיהֶם כְּגַחֲלֵי אֵשׁ: ​ They [each] said three things: Rabbi Eliezer said: Let the honor of your friend be as dear to you as your own; And be not easily provoked to anger; And repent one day before your death. And [he also said:] warm yourself before the fire of the wise, but beware of being singed by their glowing coals, for their bite is the bite of a fox , and their sting is the sting of a scorpion, and their hiss is the hiss of a serpent, and all their words are like coals of fire. ​ See that sages "bite, eat" like a fox. Bahir says the 12 Elemental letters (not Aleph Mem and Shin the Mothers and not the 7 Double letters, for example how Beit can also be Veit) correspond to the world of Atzilut, the Yud of YH-VH and the world of ChochMah, Wisdom. They consist of 6 names that parallel the 6 directions of space (the compass rose and up and down). ​ Below each of the 12 Elemental letters, the diagonal paths on the Tree of Life; ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​there are 12 corresponding "Directors" in the world of BeriYah, Binah (Understanding) the first H of YH-VH. These are the archangels from Isaiah 6:1-2 that were the Seraphim (archangels) above G-d each having 6 wings.​ ​ The 6 wings of the archangels correspond to 6 Powers in the world of Yetzirah-Formation, the Vav. 6 times 12 is 72 and therefore these 72 Powers are corresponding to the 72 Languages of the 72 (root) Nations. ​ He continues and says the 72 Languages each have a root in God's name of 72 elements and therefore any one of these 72 languages can be used for Ruach HaKodesh - Holy Spirit. ​ He concludes saying that these 72 elements exist in all 4 universes making a total of 288 - the significance of the 288 sparks of Holiness that exist in Creation (Etz Chaim, Shaar RaPach Netzutzin) (if you are larger than me). ​ Anyway since today there are thousands of languages spoken, maybe the 72 correspond to the "parent" languages. First-fruits ; [The offerings brought] on appearing [at the Temple on the three pilgrimage festivals]. The performance of righteous deeds; And the study of the torah. The following are the things for which a man enjoys the fruits in this world while the principal remains for him in the world to come: Honoring one’s father and mother; The performance of righteous deeds; And the making of peace between a person and his friend; And the study of the torah is equal to them all. ​ וְהַבִּכּוּרִים Bikurim, first fruits, is also the word for first borns. (or if you are in a sticky ambidextrous situation like me I just "reel" people in with either hand by pushing and pulling in a circular motion continuously and then when I feel/hear its enough, lightly squeeze unless there is a "rod of rebuke") based on an idea from the Tzadi. I actually decided a few months later that since I couldn't prove my mother's mother's lineage and couldn't find a single valid witness I had to accept being a Noahide until I could find one and forced myself to stop even thinking about hands for maybe 2 years. Then I decided it was obvious and a Noahide would be able to figure it out themselves. Also the Halacha was since Noahides couldn't learn this Kabbalah they were allowed to do sorcery for the sake of saving their lives so I just started ripping people up like a wolf until I saw that I was actually the Baal HaBayit ​ Why did it take me 2 years so realize it was obvious? After the first few teeth and me looking at them and thinking I would be liable for death for dwelling more, people "put their swords" away. Also I was recently imprisoned in another psych ward and I was taking a lot of severe tasers although it was most were more like hard rose thorns (some were definitely police tasers may they all cease to be forever) and I was laughing on Tanakh with Rashi a lot (so I was wondering whether they would actually be 'medication'). However I was "spaghetti charged", as in when the pigs just pile as many charges up on you as they can to see what sticks and how much money they can fine you, and was on probation for a year or so and court ordered to take the meds. Also I had to work 8 hours a day since I had a lot of debt and didn't know what country to flee to and didn't want to swing and miss and end up in a bigger pit. This was before I was skilled in tech sales and the "stepping stone" job I was at was a "boiler room" job, way too intense compared to remote sales culture where no one cares about it and you can work 2 hours a day. ​ Anyway it was really like going back in time for 2 years to before the age of 20 and I basically just worked like a donkey, ate and smoked, and barely had any energy for Torah study, I got by on Facebook group gleanings (that were actually very delicious). ​ Don't worry about my finances unless you are very rich and can really help, as I ended up getting the full unemployment amount that should carry me at minimum 6 months, however I neglected a credit card since I didn't feel like marketing, selling, and mailing my gold and silver away, especially when Redemption is here and I have them all designated for a Beit HaMikdash donation, and the ~25% credit rate just pounded me so now I find myself as another American homeowner in ounces (some people many ounces) of gold's worth of debt that I may have to eventually flee to Asia or the Bahamas about or see what bankruptcy would take from me H'F' ​ If you thought I was rich, I did make $94k in 2023 but the Philly taxes are like 50% and sales commission taxes are also brutal. So I did end up getting out of debt and buying a $62k house in the "sticks" (on a mortgage with $4.5k of seller's assist to closing costs) with maybe $2 or 3k left over after putting $10k away for my student loan to completely pay off. However I spent it all on "campaigning" while I was in Israel and trying to get the "Seat" instead of going back to the "field". ​ If you are outside my house screaming the b word at me for not giving your slave masters everything I have, here is your (c)verse, Isaiah 33:1 ה֣וֹי שׁוֹדֵ֗ד וְאַתָּה֙ לֹ֣א שָׁד֔וּד וּבוֹגֵ֖ד וְלֹא־בָ֣גְדוּ ב֑וֹ כַּהֲתִֽמְךָ֤ שׁוֹדֵד֙ תּוּשַּׁ֔ד כַּנְּלֹתְךָ֥ לִבְגֹּ֖ד יִבְגְּדוּ־בָֽךְ׃ {ס} Ha, you ravager who are not ravaged, You betrayer who have not been betrayed! When you have done ravaging, you shall be ravaged; When you have finished betraying, you shall be betrayed. ​ Remember the West is called the land of treacherous ravaging crickets in 18:1 and in 2 that the rivers, the kings of the nations, have ravaged our people. So yes now I see why people call you "boot lickers" since only wicked nazis wear boots to trap their souls and anger themselves for more brutal curses (unless its cold out), and Lord Gods slay them all forever and smash the loins of all of their "salespeople" and supporters. ​ Also your neo-JC Daniel TorAm has Shallal'ed (stolen) from you/us how many millions/billions through bankruptcy snakeries? ​ As mentioned before when I was "too" rich and trying to decide where to buy a house, I saw my bank account drop $500 dollars in one day with no explanation or trace. ​ Here is a fact checker from the Washington Post (yes its liberal but nevertheless, who else will point it out?) saying that king you chose upon me stole billions from you surreptitiously. Its forbidden to even accumulate that much money in the first place. ​ Isaiah 56:9 כֹּ֖ל חַיְת֣וֹ שָׂדָ֑י אֵתָ֕יוּ לֶאֱכֹ֥ל כׇּל־חַיְת֖וֹ בַּיָּֽעַר׃ {פ} All ye beasts of the field, come to devour, Yea, all ye beasts in the forest. ​ Rashi: All the beasts of the field: All the proselytes of the heathens ([Mss. and K’li Paz:] All the nations) come and draw near to Me, and you shall devour all the beasts in the forest, the mighty of the heathens ([Mss. and K’li Paz:] the mighty of the nations) who hardened their heart and refrained from converting. ​ the beasts of the field: [The beast of the field is not as strong as the beast of the forest.] The beast of the field is weaker and of weaker strength than the beast of the forest. Since he stated, “I will yet gather others to him,” he stated this verse. v.10 צֹ פָ֞ו עִוְרִ֤ים כֻּלָּם֙ לֹ֣א יָדָ֔עוּ כֻּלָּם֙ כְּלָבִ֣ים אִלְּמִ֔ים לֹ֥א יוּכְל֖וּ לִנְבֹּ֑חַ הֹזִים֙ שֹֽׁכְבִ֔ים אֹהֲבֵ֖י לָנֽוּם׃ His watchmen are all blind, Without knowledge; They are all dumb dogs, They cannot bark; Raving, lying down, loving to slumber. ​ If you are afraid of tzfat hitler H'F', see that the first word צֹ פָ֞ו has an enlarged Tzadi to hint at the evil northern kingdom in צְ פָ֞ת֖, Tzfat ​ -- ​ Tehillim 109:6 הַפְקֵ֣ד עָלָ֣יו רָשָׁ֑ע וְ֝שָׂטָ֗ן יַעֲמֹ֥ד עַל־יְמִינֽוֹ׃ ’Set Thou a wicked man over him; And let an adversary (Satin) stand at his right hand. ​ This has become one of my favorite curses. Because they submitted to the rabbinic decrees (added forbidden commandments) and the absurd magid torah of the shulchan aruch, "routine commands of man" according to the Prophet, and cleaved on to Torah like a concrete cord and likely got conquered because of it, as when I stubbornly held on to all of the "rabbinic mitzvot" I was also conquerable Heaven save us. ​ Its necessary to scrutinize every Rabbinic Prohibition to see if it is tastefully logical like washing 3 times alternating in the morning to reduce harmful spirits and applying zugot to all foods since the tradition was lost on it and one could transgress a Biblical commandment if not. ​ Counter examples would be the set routine extremely long prayers, eating birds and milk (there are other ways to guard mixing red meat and milk without depriving us of this luxury), only one wife for world Jewry, etc. ​ As for running in the street (frantically not exercising), one could make the argument that if you don't have a valid reason then you are disgracing the whole Place and setting everyone on edge for no reason. I see you're really boar/pig-pen cancer ​ הלך רץ See the difference between Halach-Walk and Ratz-Run Halach is very similar to Melech-King, Moloch-Angel, or Melach-Salt. Or Lech, as in when HaShem told Avraham, Lech Lecha - "Go to yourself" Also Avot says to depart with people by saying "Lech LeShalom" (Go to Peace, opposed to Lech BeShalom - in/with Peace) Ratz on the other hand is like Peretz, to break forth or I guess in English, "Rats!" It is a Reish, for wicked grass bent on evil "facing" the final Tzadi, the heaviest letter, the Baal Teshuvah (Owner of Repentance, that "Knows"). Reish is already 200 then plus 900 makes it 1100, making the "Place" extremely heavy for all the other Kings that wanted a light walk in Gehinnom (the streets) ​ If you are wondering why an Upright person would ever want a light walk in Gehinnom, according to Perek Shira, Its song is: גֵּיהִנֹּם אוֹמֵר. כִּי הִשְׂבִּיעַ נֶפֶשׁ שֹׁקֵקָה וְנֶפֶשׁ רְעֵבָה מִלֵּא טוֹב: (תהילים קז ט) Gehinnom is saying: “For he has satisfied the longing soul, and has filled the hungry soul with good.” Maybe s/he was "hot" and wanted to see if the underworld would fell his/her Sarah or Avraham. Or maybe s/he was hungry and didn't want to cook or was out of food. ​ Bahir says "The chariot will not stay in one place" Maybe they were tired of fulfilling the verse in Isaiah "They are a people trapped in pits!" and having not a single ray of sunlight, living in "Elohim", Gevurot, and wanted some vitamins and fresh air. As my mother used to say, "go get the stink blown off you" - You need some crabapple pollen at least if you want to fruit any apples this year (or ever!) ​ Also if you are a woman in the West (G-d please save you) or a man gaining your sea legs and still need more shade, I recommend getting a ~15 dollar plant light on Amazon (at minimum) like they do in the far North during Winter for artificial sunlight vitamins ​ Yes although I have quoted Isaiah that it is the Tiferet of Adam to dwell in his house, this is most of the time. There are 10 Sefirot not only Tiferet, and I will again quote the Rooster "Do not love sleep (in your pit) lest you be plowed/impoverished (with no fruits of Torah to offer in TWTC'). Open up your people with your Wellspring and be sated with the bread of war - Lachem (them repenting and fulfilling the Song of Wheat and also you becoming more rich and possibly getting your bread as in your wife) ​ Mishlei-Provers 18:1 לְֽ֭תַאֲוָה יְבַקֵּ֣שׁ נִפְרָ֑ד בְּכׇל־תּ֝וּשִׁיָּ֗ה יִתְגַּלָּֽע׃ He that separateth himself seeketh his own desire, And snarlest against all sound wisdom. ​ Why do I usually spend my time in "Heaven" meditating on concepts of Binah (Understanding) rather than plowing more field/Earth for myself through studying Mishnah/Gemara/Rambam? ​ I think there is a better Mishlei but here is an example from 4:7 רֵאשִׁ֣ית חׇ֭כְמָה קְנֵ֣ה חׇכְמָ֑ה וּבְכׇל־קִ֝נְיָנְךָ֗ קְנֵ֣ה בִינָֽה׃ The beginning of wisdom is—acquire wisdom; With all your acquisitions, acquire discernment. ​ Rashi: The beginning of wisdom [is to] acquire wisdom: At the beginning of your wisdom, learn from others and acquire for yourself the tradition from the mouth of the teacher, and afterwards with all your possession acquire understanding. Concentrate on it by yourself to understand the reasons, thereby deriving one thing from another. ​ This is much more pleasurable, as Tehillim (Psalms) 1:1 doesn't say that "Happy is s/he who avoids wicked company and reads Torah day and night", but rather "meditates" on his/her Torah day and night. Nevertheless I've been in the "vineyard" (Yeshiva) for almost an entire year where I was able to get Halachic insights on everything instantly so for most of you, you need to start at the Beginning and acquire Wisdom first. ​ The Rebbe said for Baalei Teshuvot and Converts, it is ideal to spend ~1 year in Yeshivah to start their journey so they can see how all of the Mitzvot are practically done today to "bulk up the wood on their Tree". If you do this I would recommend "snaking" a little and not forcing yourself to do the routine prayers multiples times a day every day but just learn Torah or the Siddur while they get fried by heathen concrete tasers. When 3 more days, or the fire, Aysh (another Parable of Shin) come for you when you burn the incense. A person can on average last about 3 days with no water. ​ --- ​ When I was in high school my friends showed me that one can make their own sushi with grocery store bought salmon. Basically it is already made, you just cut it into Sashimi strips and dip it into soy sauce or salt. If you want the rice bed, its very time consuming making sticky rice. I would recommend a rice cooker like the Asian people do nowadays. I forgot to throw my salmon on the Blech before Shabbat so I ended up dipping her right into salt raw and it was amazing. If you get fish from a grocery store I think there still needs to be part of the skin with the scales attached and you need to scrape the cut parts significantly or cut a thin piece off with your Kosher knife. I just got it from Kosh.com since you never know if a heathen might inject some dust or HGH into it or something when they see me driving my donkey from afar H'F' ​ -- ​ Shemot 23:28-29 ​ וְשָׁלַחְתִּ֥י אֶת־הַצִּרְעָ֖ה לְפָנֶ֑יךָ וְגֵרְשָׁ֗ה אֶת־הַחִוִּ֧י אֶת־הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֛י וְאֶת־הַחִתִּ֖י מִלְּפָנֶֽיךָ׃ I will send a plague ahead of you, and it shall drive out before you the Hivites, the Canaanites, and the Hittites. ​ לֹ֧א אֲגָרְשֶׁ֛נּוּ מִפָּנֶ֖יךָ בְּשָׁנָ֣ה אֶחָ֑ת פֶּן־תִּהְיֶ֤ה הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ שְׁמָמָ֔ה וְרַבָּ֥ה עָלֶ֖יךָ חַיַּ֥ת הַשָּׂדֶֽה׃ I will not drive them out before you in a single year, lest the land become desolate and the wild beasts multiply to your hurt. ​ I have been thinking after seeing that there was a whole random heathen tribe living a few miles from my house blindly in the dark like medieval times, maybe its better to "creep" the fire slowly like the first thing HaShem told Adam. Since the "creeping living animals" were last, we can associate this with Shabbat, also since one needs to often "creep" on Shabbat to not break Melachot. ​ וְגֵרְשָׁ֗ה VeGeirshah "And drive them out" - see that this is like Ger Seh - "sheep converts" out of them ​ EzekiEl 34:25 וְכָרַתִּ֤י לָהֶם֙ בְּרִ֣ית שָׁל֔וֹם וְהִשְׁבַּתִּ֥י חַיָּֽה־רָעָ֖ה מִן־הָאָ֑רֶץ וְיָשְׁב֤וּ בַמִּדְבָּר֙ לָבֶ֔טַח וְיָשְׁנ֖וּ בַּיְּעָרִֽים׃ And I will grant them a covenant of friendship. I will banish vicious beasts from their land, and they shall live secure in the wasteland, they shall even sleep in the woodland. ​ Therefore the "Forest Trees of the Penn", the fruitful ones, need to eat the evil shade forest trees that have conquered all of the cities and towns and force them into their waste/woodland without hot showers and kitchens etc. ​ Bereisheit 1:28 וַיְבָ֣רֶךְ אֹתָם֮ אֱלֹהִים֒ וַיֹּ֨אמֶר לָהֶ֜ם אֱלֹהִ֗ים פְּר֥וּ וּרְב֛וּ וּמִלְא֥וּ אֶת־הָאָ֖רֶץ וְכִבְשֻׁ֑הָ וּרְד֞וּ בִּדְגַ֤ת הַיָּם֙ וּבְע֣וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וּבְכׇל־חַיָּ֖ה הָֽרֹמֶ֥שֶׂת עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃ God blessed them and God said to them, “Be fertile and increase, fill the earth and master it; and rule the fish of the sea, the birds of the sky, and all the living things that creep on earth.” ​ פְּר֥וּ וּרְב֛וּ Peru Urvu - Be fruitful and multiply - the first step is to be like a fruit tree and desire relations. The sages teach someone who doesn't desire sex is not capable of loving HaShem Heaven forbid. This is like Yom Rishon (Sunday), corresponding to Chesed/Kindness ​ וְכִבְשֻׁ֑הָ veChivshuhah - And dominate like a כִבְשֻׁ֑ Ceves (different vowels), sheep Yom Sheini, Gevurah/Severity/Judgement. The fact that we have to submit to our Divine Slavery of the Yoke of Heaven and observe Halachot. ​ וּרְד֞וּ בִּדְגַ֤ת הַיָּם֙ Urdu Bidgat Hayam - and rule over them by being a fish of the sea, or with your/the fish of the sea (greatest Torah scholar of the generation) Yom Shelishi, Tiferet/Beauty/Balance. The Fish are Singing "The voice of HaShem is upon the waters (Chesed/pleasures). The voice of HaShem thunders! (Gevurah). The voice of HaShem is upon many waters! (Chesed multiplied through Gevurah). Frequently, in the order of Zeraim, thin branches are called "sa'ar"—"[He] overturned the branches," "If the branches meshed." ​​ See that "Seratah", in the underbrush, is like "Seir", another name for the West/Esav. Ironically there is a ton of these brush like highly dense forests in Seir, at least in the East. From Google: Electrical resistance is measured in ohms, represented by the symbol Ω. One Ω represents the electrical resistance between two points when a voltage of one volt applied across the points results in a current of one ampere, or amp. ​​​ Jasper and inexpensive stones I got on Etsy showing pure resistance: ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​Here's a war nickel showing complete conductivity (all metals do this) ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​​ ​ ​ ​ ​These are some Shungite stone chips, the "pseudoscience" grounding stone showing a second of a random reading before going to complete resistance. ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​And here you can see a Shoham (onyx) brass ring giving the same effect as Shungite stones and the metal part giving full conductivity. ​​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ Again, this is not for the rich that can fly bugs into our ears and microplastics into our waters and control our minds H'F'.
