Why? The examples given are nuts that have a very strong peel (they are strongly clothed in satin), eggs when the Parable of Pokemon comes from the Halacha of "sending away the mother bird (satin/wizard) before taking the eggs", and cucumbers that are a vegetable with two final, fallen Nun's and a Shin for fire - Kishuin. ​ Therefore it may not apply to perfect fruits but nevertheless a good way to eat smaller fruits and nuts is to first eat one and then two at a time. And remember for eggs you can just scramble them since it is completed  "by human hands" and the same with coffee since you have to "brew" it by mixing hot water and ground beans. ​ I once read in the Mishnah that the payment for some form of damage compensation is the wage of "one who watches/guards a cucumber field" and I realized every job I've ever had has been me watching a cucumber field lol. ​ Bava Kamma 8:1 ​ ​ הַחוֹבֵל בַּחֲבֵרוֹ חַיָּב עָלָיו מִשּׁוּם חֲמִשָּׁה דְבָרִים, בְּנֶזֶק, בְּצַעַר, בְּרִפּוּי, בְּשֶׁבֶת, וּבְבֹשֶׁת. בְּנֶזֶק כֵּיצַד. סִמָּא אֶת עֵינוֹ, קָטַע אֶת יָדוֹ, שִׁבֵּר אֶת רַגְלוֹ, רוֹאִין אוֹתוֹ כְּאִלּוּ הוּא עֶבֶד נִמְכָּר בַּשּׁוּק וְשָׁמִין כַּמָּה הָיָה יָפֶה וְכַמָּה הוּא יָפֶה. צַעַר, כְּוָאוֹ בְשַׁפּוּד אוֹ בְמַסְמֵר, וַאֲפִלּוּ עַל צִפָּרְנוֹ, מְקוֹם שֶׁאֵינוֹ עוֹשֶׂה חַבּוּרָה, אוֹמְדִין כַּמָּה אָדָם כַּיּוֹצֵא בָזֶה רוֹצֶה לִטֹּל לִהְיוֹת מִצְטַעֵר כָּךְ. רִפּוּי, הִכָּהוּ חַיָּב לְרַפְּאֹתוֹ. עָלוּ בוֹ צְמָחִים, אִם מֵחֲמַת הַמַּכָּה, חַיָּב. שֶׁלֹּא מֵחֲמַת הַמַּכָּה, פָּטוּר. חָיְתָה וְנִסְתְּרָה, חָיְתָה וְנִסְתְּרָה, חַיָּב לְרַפְּאֹתוֹ. חָיְתָה כָל צָרְכָּהּ, אֵינוֹ חַיָּב לְרַפְּאֹתוֹ. שֶׁבֶת, רוֹאִין אוֹתוֹ כְּאִלוּ הוּא שׁוֹמֵר קִשּׁוּאִין, שֶׁכְּבָר נָתַן לוֹ דְמֵי יָדוֹ וּדְמֵי רַגְלוֹ. בֹּשֶׁת, הַכֹּל לְפִי הַמְבַיֵּשׁ וְהַמִּתְבַּיֵּשׁ. הַמְבַיֵּשׁ אֶת הֶעָרֹם, הַמְבַיֵּשׁ אֶת הַסּוּמָא, וְהַמְבַיֵּשׁ אֶת הַיָּשֵׁן, חַיָּב. וְיָשֵׁן שֶׁבִּיֵּשׁ, פָּטוּר. נָפַל מִן הַגָּג, וְהִזִּיק וּבִיֵּשׁ, חַיָּב עַל הַנֶּזֶק וּפָטוּר עַל הַבֹּשֶׁת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר (דברים כה) וְשָׁלְחָה יָדָהּ וְהֶחֱזִיקָה בִּמְבֻשָׁיו, אֵינוֹ חַיָּב עַל הַבֹּשֶׁת עַד שֶׁיְהֵא מִתְכַּוֵּן: ​ He who wounds his fellow (Chaveiro - even "fruitful/fragrant herbs") is liable to compensate him on five counts: for injury, for pain, for healing, for loss of income and for indignity. ‘For injury’: How so? If he blinded his fellow’s eye, cut off his hand or broke his foot, [his fellow] is looked upon as if he was a slave to be sold in the market and they assess how much he was worth and how much he is worth. ‘For pain’? If he burned him with a spit or a nail, even though it was on his fingernail, a place where it leaves no wound, they estimate how much money such a man would be willing to take to suffer so. ‘Healing’? If he struck him he is liable to pay the cost of his healing. If sores arise on him on account of the blow, he is liable [for the cost of their healing]. If not on account of the blow, he is not liable. If the wound healed and then opened and healed and then opened, he is liable for the cost of the healing. If it healed completely, he is no longer liable to pay the cost of the healing. ‘Loss of income’: He is looked upon as a watchman of a cucumber field, since he already gave him compensation for the loss of his hand or foot. ‘Indignity’: All is according to the status of the one that inflicts indignity and the status of the one that suffers indignity. If a man inflicted indignity on a naked man, or a blind man, or a sleeping man, he is [still] liable. If a sleeping man inflicted indignity, he is exempt. If a man fell from the roof and caused injury and inflicted indignity, he is liable for the injury but not for the indignity, as it says, “And she puts forth her hand and grabs him by the private parts”, a man is liable only when he intended [to inflict indignity]. ​ ​ See that all you wispy branches that came and chirped me for 20+ years while I was asleep need to come pay me my ransom for your souls. Also its forbidden (even according to US laws) to look into peoples private property, how much more so take pictures? So I want all of my "scouted" photos deleted immediately and compensated with a check or cash in my mailbox or it will be Shallal'ed by the rivers H'F' ​ However I could still see Zugot applying to grapes (perfect) as the Song of the Vine is singing about saving the sweet new wine in the vile cluster and weak vine. Who would throw away fine gold coins and bars? ​ ' ​ The Sages teach that one who studies Perek Shira (Chapter of Song) everyday merits a portion of The World to Come. Since a name of Torah is "The Parable of The Ancient One" or "The Ancient Parable", I see why, since a person is able to "put the pieces together" and see the giant, beautiful picture of Creation. ​ -- ​ As for the behind-the-back river charity, I would apply what my friends in college taught me was the rule of the forest: "leave no trace" and I would add "take only what you need" which is actually the Halacha of Hefker (public) items, and also you cannot take so much where you leave an environmental impact or I believe even a lack for others. ​ On a side note I think you can actually leave a trace in the forest if you have compostable paper items or leftover fruit peels etc. If you know a lot of other people are around probably better to bury them so the frail withered ones don't curse you about their "stinging eye store". ​ Maasarot 1:2-3 ​ מֵאֵימָתַי הַפֵּרוֹת חַיָּבוֹת בַּמַּעַשְׂרוֹת. הַתְּאֵנִים, מִשֶּׁיַּבְחִילוּ. הָעֲנָבִים וְהָאֳבָשִׁים, מִשֶּׁהִבְאִישׁוּ. הָאוֹג וְהַתּוּתִים, מִשֶּׁיַּאְדִּימוּ. וְכָל הָאֲדֻמִּים, מִשֶּׁיַּאְדִּימוּ. הָרִמּוֹנִים, מִשֶּׁיִּמַּסּוּ. הַתְּמָרִים, מִשֶּׁיָּטִּילוּ שְׂאֹר. הָאֲפַרְסְקִים, מִשֶּׁיָּטִּילוּ גִידִים. הָאֱגוֹזִים, מִשֶּׁיַּעֲשׂוּ מְגוּרָה. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר, הָאֱגוֹזִים וְהַשְּׁקֵדִים, מִשֶּׁיַּעֲשׂוּ קְלִפָּה: When do fruits become liable for tithes?Figs from the time they begin to ripe. Grapes and wild grapes in the early stages of ripening. Sumac and mulberries after they become red; [similarly] all red fruits, after they become red. Pomegranates, when the insides become soft. Dates when they begin to swell. Peaches when [red] veins begin to show. Walnuts when the nuts are separate from the shell. Rabbi Judah says: walnuts and almonds, after their inner skins have been formed. ​ I once read this on a bus in YiruShalayim and told the Bochur next to me he was the Anavim and I was the Avashim (grapes and wild grapes) and we both had a good laugh. See that the "Hairy Edomites", the red fruits that loved football and MMA, are liable when they get "red". ​ ​ הֶחָרוּבִין, מִשֶּׁיִּנָּקֵדוּ. וְכָל הַשְּׁחוֹרִים, מִשֶּׁיִּנָּקְדוּ. הָאֲגָסִים וְהַקְּרֻסְטוֹמֵלִין וְהַפָּרִישִׁין וְהָעֻזְרָדִים, מִשֶּׁיִּקָּרֵחוּ. וְכָל הַלְּבָנִים, מִשֶּׁיִּקָּרֵחוּ. הַתִּלְתָּן, מִשֶּׁתְּצַמֵּחַ. הַתְּבוּאָה וְהַזֵּיתִים, מִשֶּׁיַּכְנִיסוּ שְׁלִישׁ: Carobs [are liable to] tithes after they form dark spots; similarly all black fruits after they form dark spots. Pears and crustumenian pears, quinces, and medlars [are liable to tithes] after their surface begins to grow smooth; similarly all white fruits, after their surface begins to grow smooth. Fenugreek [is liable to tithe] when the seeds [can be planted and] will grow. Grain and olives after they are one-third ripe. ​ White fruits are like the other Westerners that are more like Yefet, white, beautiful, and sensitive. See that they are liable for their service on the Altar when they "become smooth" ​ 4 וּבַיָּרָק, הַקִּשּׁוּאִין וְהַדְּלוּעִים וְהָאֲבַטִּיחִים וְהַמְּלָפְפוֹנוֹת, הַתַּפּוּחִים וְהָאֶתְרוֹגִין, חַיָּבִים גְּדוֹלִים וּקְטַנִּים. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן פּוֹטֵר אֶת הָאֶתְרוֹגִים בְּקָטְנָן. הַחַיָּב בַּשְּׁקֵדִים הַמָּרִים, פָּטוּר בַּמְּתוּקִים, הַחַיָּב בַּמְּתוּקִים, פָּטוּר בַּמָּרִים: With regard to when vegetables [are liable to tithes]:Cucumbers, gourds, water-melons, cucumber-melons, apples and etrogs are liable [for tithes], whether gathered in the earlier or later stages of ripening. Rabbi Shimon exempts the etrog in the earlier stages. The condition in which bitter almonds are liable [to tithes] is exempt in the case of sweet almonds, and the condition in which sweet almonds are liable [to tithe] is exempt in the case of bitter almonds. ​ I see that as the apple/etrog in a cucumber field, we were all liable for tithing even as children, except when I was too bitter/peely as an etrog. ​ It seems the more crazy/bitter "nuts" are liable for tithing in different ways than the sweet ones. ​ The Gemara teaches that HaShem is portrayed as having black hair when acting like a warrior and white hair when studying Torah. ​ Maybe the black fruits and carobs (repentants) become liable after someone lets them know that there is "always a bigger fish" even up to the size of giants since black is associated with fire/Gevurah and darker skinned and haired people are naturally more warrior-like, as in the verse "The Caananite was Gibor (mighty/a warrior) in the land". Also Artscroll Stone Edition says Yefet was blessed with beauty and sensitivity, and Cham (Patriarch of Africa) was blessed with strength. After a "Gibor" gets physically plowed by a greater "Gibor" or "Eish", it humbles him greatly (speaking from experience) ​ Chagigah 14a ​ כָּתוּב אֶחָד אוֹמֵר: ״לְבוּשֵׁיהּ כִּתְלַג חִיוָּר וּשְׂעַר רֵישֵׁיהּ כַּעֲמַר נְקֵא״. וּכְתִיב: ״קְוֻצּוֹתָיו תַּלְתַּלִּים שְׁחוֹרוֹת כָּעוֹרֵב״! לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בִּישִׁיבָה, כָּאן בַּמִּלְחָמָה. דְּאָמַר מָר: אֵין לְךָ נָאֶה בִּישִׁיבָה אֶלָּא זָקֵן, וְאֵין לְךָ נָאֶה בַּמִּלְחָמָה אֶלָּא בָּחוּר. ​ One verse says, "His garment was as bright snow, and the hair [of His head] was as pure wool (Daniel 7:9)," and it is written, "His locks are curls, black as a raven (Song of Songs 5:11)." [Is His hair white or black?] This is not a contradiction. This one (ie. the white hair) is in the assembly, and this one (ie. the black hair) is in battle. For Master said, "There is none better in the assembly than an elder, and there is none better than a young man in battle." ​ Maybe since its written "His Beauty/Truth (Tiferet) will be like the olive" I became liable recently after getting to 1/3 of my natural years. ​ Hosea 14:6-7 ​ אֶהְיֶ֤ה כַטַּל֙ לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל יִפְרַ֖ח כַּשּׁוֹשַׁנָּ֑ה וְיַ֥ךְ שׇׁרָשָׁ֖יו כַּלְּבָנֽוֹן׃ I will be to Israel like dew; He shall blossom like the lily, He shall strike root like a Lebanon tree. **Very wise to speak this verse out loud and you need to if you learn it in Hebrew anyway. ​ Rashi: like the Lebanon: like the roots of the trees of the Lebanon, which are large. ​ יֵֽלְכוּ֙ יֹֽנְקוֹתָ֔יו וִיהִ֥י כַזַּ֖יִת הוֹד֑וֹ וְרֵ֥יחַֽ ל֖וֹ כַּלְּבָנֽוֹן׃ His boughs shall spread out far, His beauty shall be like the olive tree’s, His fragrance like that of Lebanon. ​ Rashi: Its branches shall go forth: Sons and daughters shall increase and it shall be Their beauty shall be like the beauty of the menorah of the Temple, and their fragrance like the fragrance of the incense. ​ Actually it says Hodo, His splendor, "Hod" (left leg/foot), not his Tiferet (body) ​ In Israel there are olive trees all over the main cities, even Tzfat. I even squeezed some fallen ones on the street and used it to fulfill the verse "May your head never lack oil". ​ However it was very red, not light clear yellow, so it was a little crazy but I knew I was in a cricket field so I thought it was funny as an allusion to YeshaYahu 63 ​ By the way if you wear glasses or want to wear sunglasses avocado oil gives the most friction out of olive and coconut. I don't remember about vegetable oil I always use the trees. ​ -- ​ When using the "force of the mouth, hands and legs" its always important to remember your Sefirah of Keter, the Crown, that is you can't act against HaShem's Will or the choices He gives you or else you could end up plowed or with your blood poured out H'F'. Since the "tazer fire" is crazy to begin with I like to call it the "pre-set filter" that if I start waving at someone that HaShem wants to keep that it actually be like just waving some air to cool them off or something positive, the amount of pushing and pulling they need. This is also why its good to actually recite a verse like YeshaYahu 65:15 or a Tehillim or any other similar verse so that if needed HaShem can change it to Torah study. ​ One time, an older Bochur in the room across from me at Dvar YeruShalayim named Tzvi "Deer, Desire" told me a story that the Vilna Gaon once saw an evil government marching into his town and he recited a Tehillim (Psalm) verse and the bridge collapsed under them. ​ -- ​ There are actually multiple verses in Torah and Tanakh where HaShem is referenced by Hey Shin Mem but this is the one I was referring to above is Dvarim 28:58 ​ אִם־לֹ֨א תִשְׁמֹ֜ר לַעֲשׂ֗וֹת אֶת־כׇּל־דִּבְרֵי֙ הַתּוֹרָ֣ה הַזֹּ֔את הַכְּתֻבִ֖ים בַּסֵּ֣פֶר הַזֶּ֑ה לְ֠יִרְאָ֠ה אֶת־הַשֵּׁ֞ם הַנִּכְבָּ֤ד וְהַנּוֹרָא֙ הַזֶּ֔ה אֵ֖ת יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃ If you fail to observe faithfully all the terms of this Teaching that are written in this book, to reverence this honored and awesome Name, your God יהוה, ​ Here is the rest of the chapter from on to see that God really is a Mighty Warrior: ​ וְהִפְלָ֤א יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־מַכֹּ֣תְךָ֔ וְאֵ֖ת מַכּ֣וֹת זַרְעֶ֑ךָ מַכּ֤וֹת גְּדֹלֹת֙ וְנֶ֣אֱמָנ֔וֹת וׇחֳלָיִ֖ם רָעִ֥ים וְנֶאֱמָנִֽים׃ יהוה will inflict extraordinary plagues upon you and your offspring, strange and lasting plagues, malignant and chronic diseases— ​ וְהֵשִׁ֣יב בְּךָ֗ אֵ֚ת כׇּל־מַדְוֵ֣ה מִצְרַ֔יִם אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָגֹ֖רְתָּ מִפְּנֵיהֶ֑ם וְדָבְק֖וּ בָּֽךְ׃ bringing back upon you all the sicknesses of Egypt that you dreaded so, and they shall cling to you. ​ גַּ֤ם כׇּל־חֳלִי֙ וְכׇל־מַכָּ֔ה אֲשֶׁר֙ לֹ֣א כָת֔וּב בְּסֵ֖פֶר הַתּוֹרָ֣ה הַזֹּ֑את יַעְלֵ֤ם יְהֹוָה֙ עָלֶ֔יךָ עַ֖ד הִשָּׁמְדָֽךְ׃ Moreover, יהוה will bring upon you all the other diseases and plagues that are not mentioned in this book of Teaching, until you are wiped out. ​ וְנִשְׁאַרְתֶּם֙ בִּמְתֵ֣י מְעָ֔ט תַּ֚חַת אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֱיִיתֶ֔ם כְּכוֹכְבֵ֥י הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם לָרֹ֑ב כִּֽי־לֹ֣א שָׁמַ֔עְתָּ בְּק֖וֹל יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃ You shall be left a scant few, after having been as numerous as the stars in the skies, because you did not heed the command of your God יהוה. ​ וְ֠הָיָ֠ה כַּאֲשֶׁר־שָׂ֨שׂ יְהֹוָ֜ה עֲלֵיכֶ֗ם לְהֵיטִ֣יב אֶתְכֶם֮ וּלְהַרְבּ֣וֹת אֶתְכֶם֒ כֵּ֣ן יָשִׂ֤ישׂ יְהֹוָה֙ עֲלֵיכֶ֔ם לְהַאֲבִ֥יד אֶתְכֶ֖ם וּלְהַשְׁמִ֣יד אֶתְכֶ֑ם וְנִסַּחְתֶּם֙ מֵעַ֣ל הָאֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־אַתָּ֥ה בָא־שָׁ֖מָּה לְרִשְׁתָּֽהּ׃ And as יהוה once delighted in making you prosperous and many, so will יהוה now delight in causing you to perish and in wiping you out; you shall be torn from the land that you are about to enter and possess. ​ וֶהֱפִֽיצְךָ֤ יְהֹוָה֙ בְּכׇל־הָ֣עַמִּ֔ים מִקְצֵ֥ה הָאָ֖רֶץ וְעַד־קְצֵ֣ה הָאָ֑רֶץ וְעָבַ֨דְתָּ שָּׁ֜ם אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֧ר לֹא־יָדַ֛עְתָּ אַתָּ֥ה וַאֲבֹתֶ֖יךָ עֵ֥ץ וָאָֽבֶן׃ יהוה will scatter you among all the peoples from one end of the earth to the other, and there you shall serve other gods, wood and stone, whom neither you nor your ancestors have experienced. ​ וּבַגּוֹיִ֤ם הָהֵם֙ לֹ֣א תַרְגִּ֔יעַ וְלֹא־יִהְיֶ֥ה מָנ֖וֹחַ לְכַף־רַגְלֶ֑ךָ וְנָתַן֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה לְךָ֥ שָׁם֙ לֵ֣ב רַגָּ֔ז וְכִלְי֥וֹן עֵינַ֖יִם וְדַאֲב֥וֹן נָֽפֶשׁ׃ Yet even among those nations you shall find no peace, nor shall your foot find a place to rest. יהוה will give you there an anguished heart and eyes that pine and a despondent spirit. ​ וְהָי֣וּ חַיֶּ֔יךָ תְּלֻאִ֥ים לְךָ֖ מִנֶּ֑גֶד וּפָֽחַדְתָּ֙ לַ֣יְלָה וְיוֹמָ֔ם וְלֹ֥א תַאֲמִ֖ין בְּחַיֶּֽיךָ׃ The life you face shall be precarious; you shall be in terror, night and day, with no assurance of survival. ​ בַּבֹּ֤קֶר תֹּאמַר֙ מִֽי־יִתֵּ֣ן עֶ֔רֶב וּבָעֶ֥רֶב תֹּאמַ֖ר מִֽי־יִתֵּ֣ן בֹּ֑קֶר מִפַּ֤חַד לְבָֽבְךָ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּפְחָ֔ד וּמִמַּרְאֵ֥ה עֵינֶ֖יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּרְאֶֽה׃ In the morning you shall say, “If only it were evening!” and in the evening you shall say, “If only it were morning!”—because of what your heart shall dread and your eyes shall see. ​ וֶהֱשִֽׁיבְךָ֨ יְהֹוָ֥ה ׀ מִצְרַ֘יִם֮ בׇּאֳנִיּוֹת֒ בַּדֶּ֙רֶךְ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָמַ֣רְתִּֽי לְךָ֔ לֹא־תֹסִ֥יף ע֖וֹד לִרְאֹתָ֑הּ וְהִתְמַכַּרְתֶּ֨ם שָׁ֧ם לְאֹיְבֶ֛יךָ לַעֲבָדִ֥ים וְלִשְׁפָח֖וֹת וְאֵ֥ין קֹנֶֽה׃ {ס} יהוה will send you back to Egypt in galleys, by a route which I told you you should not see again. There you shall offer yourselves for sale to your enemies as male and female slaves, but none will buy. ​ אֵ֩לֶּה֩ דִבְרֵ֨י הַבְּרִ֜ית אֲֽשֶׁר־צִוָּ֧ה יְהֹוָ֣ה אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֗ה לִכְרֹ֛ת אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מוֹאָ֑ב מִלְּבַ֣ד הַבְּרִ֔ית אֲשֶׁר־כָּרַ֥ת אִתָּ֖ם בְּחֹרֵֽב׃ {פ} These are the terms of the covenant which יהוה commanded Moses to conclude with the Israelites in the land of Moab, in addition to the covenant which was made with them at Horeb. ​ ***This whole chapter is extremely important to increase in Fear of HaShem to merit Eternal Good so here is the rest of Ch 28 to verse 58 ​ וְהָיָ֗ה אִם־שָׁמ֤וֹעַ תִּשְׁמַע֙ בְּקוֹל֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ לִשְׁמֹ֤ר לַעֲשׂוֹת֙ אֶת־כׇּל־מִצְוֺתָ֔יו אֲשֶׁ֛ר אָנֹכִ֥י מְצַוְּךָ֖ הַיּ֑וֹם וּנְתָ֨נְךָ֜ יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ עֶלְי֔וֹן עַ֖ל כׇּל־גּוֹיֵ֥י הָאָֽרֶץ׃ Now, if you obey your God יהוה, to observe faithfully all the divine commandments which I enjoin upon you this day, your God יהוה will set you high above all the nations of the earth. וּבָ֧אוּ עָלֶ֛יךָ כׇּל־הַבְּרָכ֥וֹת הָאֵ֖לֶּה וְהִשִּׂיגֻ֑ךָ כִּ֣י תִשְׁמַ֔ע בְּק֖וֹל יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃ All these blessings shall come upon you and take effect, if you will but heed the word of your God יהוה: בָּר֥וּךְ אַתָּ֖ה בָּעִ֑יר וּבָר֥וּךְ אַתָּ֖ה בַּשָּׂדֶֽה׃ Blessed shall you be in the city and blessed shall you be in the country. בָּר֧וּךְ פְּרִֽי־בִטְנְךָ֛ וּפְרִ֥י אַדְמָתְךָ֖ וּפְרִ֣י בְהֶמְתֶּ֑ךָ שְׁגַ֥ר אֲלָפֶ֖יךָ וְעַשְׁתְּר֥וֹת צֹאנֶֽךָ׃ Blessed shall be your issue from the womb, your produce from the soil, and the offspring of your cattle, the calving of your herd and the lambing of your flock. בָּר֥וּךְ טַנְאֲךָ֖ וּמִשְׁאַרְתֶּֽךָ׃ Blessed shall be your basket and your kneading bowl. בָּר֥וּךְ אַתָּ֖ה בְּבֹאֶ֑ךָ וּבָר֥וּךְ אַתָּ֖ה בְּצֵאתֶֽךָ׃ Blessed shall you be in your comings and blessed shall you be in your goings. יִתֵּ֨ן יְהֹוָ֤ה אֶת־אֹיְבֶ֙יךָ֙ הַקָּמִ֣ים עָלֶ֔יךָ נִגָּפִ֖ים לְפָנֶ֑יךָ בְּדֶ֤רֶךְ אֶחָד֙ יֵצְא֣וּ אֵלֶ֔יךָ וּבְשִׁבְעָ֥ה דְרָכִ֖ים יָנ֥וּסוּ לְפָנֶֽיךָ׃ יהוה will put to rout before [your army] the enemies who attack you; they will march out against you by a single road, but flee from you by many roads. יְצַ֨ו יְהֹוָ֤ה אִתְּךָ֙ אֶת־הַבְּרָכָ֔ה בַּאֲסָמֶ֕יךָ וּבְכֹ֖ל מִשְׁלַ֣ח יָדֶ֑ךָ וּבֵ֣רַכְךָ֔ בָּאָ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לָֽךְ׃ יהוה will ordain blessings for you upon your barns and upon all your undertakings: you will be blessed in the land that your God יהוה is giving you. יְקִֽימְךָ֨ יְהֹוָ֥ה לוֹ֙ לְעַ֣ם קָד֔וֹשׁ כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר נִֽשְׁבַּֽע־לָ֑ךְ כִּ֣י תִשְׁמֹ֗ר אֶת־מִצְוֺת֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ וְהָלַכְתָּ֖ בִּדְרָכָֽיו׃ יהוה will establish you as God’s holy people, as was sworn to you, if you keep the commandments of your God יהוה and walk in God’s ways. וְרָאוּ֙ כׇּל־עַמֵּ֣י הָאָ֔רֶץ כִּ֛י שֵׁ֥ם יְהֹוָ֖ה נִקְרָ֣א עָלֶ֑יךָ וְיָֽרְא֖וּ מִמֶּֽךָּ׃ And all the peoples of the earth shall see that יהוה’s name is proclaimed over you, and they shall stand in fear of you. וְהוֹתִרְךָ֤ יְהֹוָה֙ לְטוֹבָ֔ה בִּפְרִ֧י בִטְנְךָ֛ וּבִפְרִ֥י בְהֶמְתְּךָ֖ וּבִפְרִ֣י אַדְמָתֶ֑ךָ עַ֚ל הָאֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר נִשְׁבַּ֧ע יְהֹוָ֛ה לַאֲבֹתֶ֖יךָ לָ֥תֶת לָֽךְ׃ יהוה will give you abounding prosperity in your issue from the womb, the offspring of your cattle, and the produce of your soil in the land that יהוה swore to your fathers to assign to you. יִפְתַּ֣ח יְהֹוָ֣ה ׀ לְ֠ךָ֠ אֶת־אוֹצָר֨וֹ הַטּ֜וֹב אֶת־הַשָּׁמַ֗יִם לָתֵ֤ת מְטַֽר־אַרְצְךָ֙ בְּעִתּ֔וֹ וּלְבָרֵ֕ךְ אֵ֖ת כׇּל־מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה יָדֶ֑ךָ וְהִלְוִ֙יתָ֙ גּוֹיִ֣ם רַבִּ֔ים וְאַתָּ֖ה לֹ֥א תִלְוֶֽה׃ יהוה will open for you that bounteous store, the heavens, to provide rain for your land in season and to bless all your undertakings. You will be creditor to many nations, but debtor to none. וּנְתָֽנְךָ֨ יְהֹוָ֤ה לְרֹאשׁ֙ וְלֹ֣א לְזָנָ֔ב וְהָיִ֙יתָ֙ רַ֣ק לְמַ֔עְלָה וְלֹ֥א תִהְיֶ֖ה לְמָ֑טָּה כִּֽי־תִשְׁמַ֞ע אֶל־מִצְוֺ֣ת ׀ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ אֲשֶׁ֨ר אָנֹכִ֧י מְצַוְּךָ֛ הַיּ֖וֹם לִשְׁמֹ֥ר וְלַעֲשֽׂוֹת׃ יהוה will make you the head, not the tail; you will always be at the top and never at the bottom—if only you obey and faithfully observe the commandments of your God יהוה that I enjoin upon you this day, וְלֹ֣א תָס֗וּר מִכׇּל־הַדְּבָרִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר אָנֹכִ֜י מְצַוֶּ֥ה אֶתְכֶ֛ם הַיּ֖וֹם יָמִ֣ין וּשְׂמֹ֑אול לָלֶ֗כֶת אַחֲרֵ֛י אֱלֹהִ֥ים אֲחֵרִ֖ים לְעׇבְדָֽם׃ {פ} and do not deviate to the right or to the left from any of the commandments that I enjoin upon you this day and turn to the worship of other gods. וְהָיָ֗ה אִם־לֹ֤א תִשְׁמַע֙ בְּקוֹל֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ לִשְׁמֹ֤ר לַעֲשׂוֹת֙ אֶת־כׇּל־מִצְוֺתָ֣יו וְחֻקֹּתָ֔יו אֲשֶׁ֛ר אָנֹכִ֥י מְצַוְּךָ֖ הַיּ֑וֹם וּבָ֧אוּ עָלֶ֛יךָ כׇּל־הַקְּלָל֥וֹת הָאֵ֖לֶּה וְהִשִּׂיגֽוּךָ׃ But if you do not obey your God יהוה to observe faithfully all the commandments and laws which I enjoin upon you this day, all these curses shall come upon you and take effect: אָר֥וּר אַתָּ֖ה בָּעִ֑יר וְאָר֥וּר אַתָּ֖ה בַּשָּׂדֶֽה׃ Cursed shall you be in the city and cursed shall you be in the country. אָר֥וּר טַנְאֲךָ֖ וּמִשְׁאַרְתֶּֽךָ׃ Cursed shall be your basket and your kneading bowl. אָר֥וּר פְּרִֽי־בִטְנְךָ֖ וּפְרִ֣י אַדְמָתֶ֑ךָ שְׁגַ֥ר אֲלָפֶ֖יךָ וְעַשְׁתְּרֹ֥ת צֹאנֶֽךָ׃ Cursed shall be your issue from the womb and your produce from the soil, the calving of your herd and the lambing of your flock. אָר֥וּר אַתָּ֖ה בְּבֹאֶ֑ךָ וְאָר֥וּר אַתָּ֖ה בְּצֵאתֶֽךָ׃ Cursed shall you be in your comings and cursed shall you be in your goings. יְשַׁלַּ֣ח יְהֹוָ֣ה ׀ בְּ֠ךָ֠ אֶת־הַמְּאֵרָ֤ה אֶת־הַמְּהוּמָה֙ וְאֶת־הַמִּגְעֶ֔רֶת בְּכׇל־מִשְׁלַ֥ח יָדְךָ֖ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תַּעֲשֶׂ֑ה עַ֣ד הִשָּׁמֶדְךָ֤ וְעַד־אֲבׇדְךָ֙ מַהֵ֔ר מִפְּנֵ֛י רֹ֥עַ מַֽעֲלָלֶ֖יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר עֲזַבְתָּֽנִי׃ יהוה will let loose against you calamity, panic, and frustration in all the enterprises you undertake, so that you shall soon be utterly wiped out because of your evildoing in forsaking Me. יַדְבֵּ֧ק יְהֹוָ֛ה בְּךָ֖ אֶת־הַדָּ֑בֶר עַ֚ד כַּלֹּת֣וֹ אֹֽתְךָ֔ מֵעַל֙ הָאֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־אַתָּ֥ה בָא־שָׁ֖מָּה לְרִשְׁתָּֽהּ׃ יהוה will make pestilence cling to you, until putting an end to you in the land that you are entering to possess. יַכְּכָ֣ה יְ֠הֹוָ֠ה בַּשַּׁחֶ֨פֶת וּבַקַּדַּ֜חַת וּבַדַּלֶּ֗קֶת וּבַֽחַרְחֻר֙ וּבַחֶ֔רֶב וּבַשִּׁדָּפ֖וֹן וּבַיֵּרָק֑וֹן וּרְדָפ֖וּךָ עַ֥ד אׇבְדֶֽךָ׃ יהוה will strike you with consumption, fever, and inflammation, with scorching heat and drought, with blight and mildew; they shall hound you until you perish. וְהָי֥וּ שָׁמֶ֛יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר עַל־רֹאשְׁךָ֖ נְחֹ֑שֶׁת וְהָאָ֥רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־תַּחְתֶּ֖יךָ בַּרְזֶֽל׃ The skies above your head shall be copper and the earth under you iron. יִתֵּ֧ן יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־מְטַ֥ר אַרְצְךָ֖ אָבָ֣ק וְעָפָ֑ר מִן־הַשָּׁמַ֙יִם֙ יֵרֵ֣ד עָלֶ֔יךָ עַ֖ד הִשָּׁמְדָֽךְ׃ יהוה will make the rain of your land dust, and sand shall drop on you from the sky, until you are wiped out. יִתֶּנְךָ֨ יְהֹוָ֥ה ׀ נִגָּף֮ לִפְנֵ֣י אֹיְבֶ֒יךָ֒ בְּדֶ֤רֶךְ אֶחָד֙ תֵּצֵ֣א אֵלָ֔יו וּבְשִׁבְעָ֥ה דְרָכִ֖ים תָּנ֣וּס לְפָנָ֑יו וְהָיִ֣יתָ לְזַֽעֲוָ֔ה לְכֹ֖ל מַמְלְכ֥וֹת הָאָֽרֶץ׃ יהוה will put you to rout before your enemies; you shall march out against them by a single road, but flee from them by many roads; and you shall become a horror to all the kingdoms of the earth. וְהָיְתָ֤ה נִבְלָֽתְךָ֙ לְמַֽאֲכָ֔ל לְכׇל־ע֥וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם וּלְבֶהֱמַ֣ת הָאָ֑רֶץ וְאֵ֖ין מַחֲרִֽיד׃ Your carcasses shall become food for all the birds of the sky and all the beasts of the earth, with none to frighten them off. יַכְּכָ֨ה יְהֹוָ֜ה בִּשְׁחִ֤ין מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ (ובעפלים) [וּבַטְּחֹרִ֔ים] וּבַגָּרָ֖ב וּבֶחָ֑רֶס אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־תוּכַ֖ל לְהֵרָפֵֽא׃ יהוה will strike you with the Egyptian inflammation, with hemorrhoids, boil-scars, and itch, from which you shall never recover. יַכְּכָ֣ה יְהֹוָ֔ה בְּשִׁגָּע֖וֹן וּבְעִוָּר֑וֹן וּבְתִמְה֖וֹן לֵבָֽב׃ יהוה will strike you with madness, blindness, and dismay. וְהָיִ֜יתָ מְמַשֵּׁ֣שׁ בַּֽצׇּהֳרַ֗יִם כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר יְמַשֵּׁ֤שׁ הַֽעִוֵּר֙ בָּאֲפֵלָ֔ה וְלֹ֥א תַצְלִ֖יחַ אֶת־דְּרָכֶ֑יךָ וְהָיִ֜יתָ אַ֣ךְ עָשׁ֧וּק וְגָז֛וּל כׇּל־הַיָּמִ֖ים וְאֵ֥ין מוֹשִֽׁיעַ׃ You shall grope at noon as the blind grope in the dark; you shall not prosper in your ventures, but shall be constantly abused and robbed, with none to give help. אִשָּׁ֣ה תְאָרֵ֗שׂ וְאִ֤ישׁ אַחֵר֙ (ישגלנה) [יִשְׁכָּבֶ֔נָּה] בַּ֥יִת תִּבְנֶ֖ה וְלֹא־תֵשֵׁ֣ב בּ֑וֹ כֶּ֥רֶם תִּטַּ֖ע וְלֹ֥א תְחַלְּלֶֽנּוּ׃ If you [a man] pay the bride-price for a wife, another man shall enjoy her. If you build a house, you shall not live in it. If you plant a vineyard, you shall not harvest it. שׁוֹרְךָ֞ טָב֣וּחַ לְעֵינֶ֗יךָ וְלֹ֣א תֹאכַל֮ מִמֶּ֒נּוּ֒ חֲמֹֽרְךָ֙ גָּז֣וּל מִלְּפָנֶ֔יךָ וְלֹ֥א יָשׁ֖וּב לָ֑ךְ צֹֽאנְךָ֙ נְתֻנ֣וֹת לְאֹיְבֶ֔יךָ וְאֵ֥ין לְךָ֖ מוֹשִֽׁיעַ׃ Your ox shall be slaughtered before your eyes, but you shall not eat of it; your ass shall be seized in front of you, and it shall not be returned to you; your flock shall be delivered to your enemies, with none to help you. בָּנֶ֨יךָ וּבְנֹתֶ֜יךָ נְתֻנִ֨ים לְעַ֤ם אַחֵר֙ וְעֵינֶ֣יךָ רֹא֔וֹת וְכָל֥וֹת אֲלֵיהֶ֖ם כׇּל־הַיּ֑וֹם וְאֵ֥ין לְאֵ֖ל יָדֶֽךָ׃ Your sons and daughters shall be delivered to another people, while you look on; and your eyes shall strain for them constantly, but you shall be helpless. פְּרִ֤י אַדְמָֽתְךָ֙ וְכׇל־יְגִ֣יעֲךָ֔ יֹאכַ֥ל עַ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־יָדָ֑עְתָּ וְהָיִ֗יתָ רַ֛ק עָשׁ֥וּק וְרָצ֖וּץ כׇּל־הַיָּמִֽים׃ A people you do not know shall eat up the produce of your soil and all your gains; you shall be abused and downtrodden continually, וְהָיִ֖יתָ מְשֻׁגָּ֑ע מִמַּרְאֵ֥ה עֵינֶ֖יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּרְאֶֽה׃ until you are driven mad by what your eyes behold. יַכְּכָ֨ה יְהֹוָ֜ה בִּשְׁחִ֣ין רָ֗ע עַל־הַבִּרְכַּ֙יִם֙ וְעַל־הַשֹּׁקַ֔יִם אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־תוּכַ֖ל לְהֵרָפֵ֑א מִכַּ֥ף רַגְלְךָ֖ וְעַ֥ד קׇדְקֳדֶֽךָ׃ יהוה will afflict you at the knees and thighs with a severe inflammation, from which you shall never recover—from the sole of your foot to the crown of your head. יוֹלֵ֨ךְ יְהֹוָ֜ה אֹתְךָ֗ וְאֶֽת־מַלְכְּךָ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תָּקִ֣ים עָלֶ֔יךָ אֶל־גּ֕וֹי אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־יָדַ֖עְתָּ אַתָּ֣ה וַאֲבֹתֶ֑יךָ וְעָבַ֥דְתָּ שָּׁ֛ם אֱלֹהִ֥ים אֲחֵרִ֖ים עֵ֥ץ וָאָֽבֶן׃ יהוה will drive you, and the king you have set over you, to a nation unknown to you or your ancestors, where you shall serve other gods, of wood and stone. וְהָיִ֣יתָ לְשַׁמָּ֔ה לְמָשָׁ֖ל וְלִשְׁנִינָ֑ה בְּכֹל֙ הָֽעַמִּ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־יְנַהֶגְךָ֥ יְהֹוָ֖ה שָֽׁמָּה׃ You shall be a consternation, a proverb, and a byword among all the peoples to which יהוה will drive you. זֶ֥רַע רַ֖ב תּוֹצִ֣יא הַשָּׂדֶ֑ה וּמְעַ֣ט תֶּאֱסֹ֔ף כִּ֥י יַחְסְלֶ֖נּוּ הָאַרְבֶּֽה׃ Though you take much seed out to the field, you shall gather in little, for the locust shall consume it. כְּרָמִ֥ים תִּטַּ֖ע וְעָבָ֑דְתָּ וְיַ֤יִן לֹֽא־תִשְׁתֶּה֙ וְלֹ֣א תֶאֱגֹ֔ר כִּ֥י תֹאכְלֶ֖נּוּ הַתֹּלָֽעַת׃ Though you plant vineyards and till them, you shall have no wine to drink or store, for the worm shall devour them. זֵיתִ֛ים יִהְי֥וּ לְךָ֖ בְּכׇל־גְּבוּלֶ֑ךָ וְשֶׁ֙מֶן֙ לֹ֣א תָס֔וּךְ כִּ֥י יִשַּׁ֖ל זֵיתֶֽךָ׃ Though you have olive trees throughout your territory, you shall have no oil for anointment, for your olives shall drop off. בָּנִ֥ים וּבָנ֖וֹת תּוֹלִ֑יד וְלֹא־יִהְי֣וּ לָ֔ךְ כִּ֥י יֵלְכ֖וּ בַּשֶּֽׁבִי׃ Though you beget sons and daughters, they shall not remain with you, for they shall go into captivity. כׇּל־עֵצְךָ֖ וּפְרִ֣י אַדְמָתֶ֑ךָ יְיָרֵ֖שׁ הַצְּלָצַֽל׃ The cricket shall take over all the trees and produce of your land. הַגֵּר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּקִרְבְּךָ֔ יַעֲלֶ֥ה עָלֶ֖יךָ מַ֣עְלָה מָּ֑עְלָה וְאַתָּ֥ה תֵרֵ֖ד מַ֥טָּה מָּֽטָּה׃ The strangers in your midst shall rise above you higher and higher, while you sink lower and lower: ה֣וּא יַלְוְךָ֔ וְאַתָּ֖ה לֹ֣א תַלְוֶ֑נּוּ ה֚וּא יִהְיֶ֣ה לְרֹ֔אשׁ וְאַתָּ֖ה תִּֽהְיֶ֥ה לְזָנָֽב׃ they shall be your creditors, but you shall not be theirs; they shall be the head and you the tail. וּבָ֨אוּ עָלֶ֜יךָ כׇּל־הַקְּלָל֣וֹת הָאֵ֗לֶּה וּרְדָפ֙וּךָ֙ וְהִשִּׂיג֔וּךָ עַ֖ד הִשָּׁמְדָ֑ךְ כִּי־לֹ֣א שָׁמַ֗עְתָּ בְּקוֹל֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ לִשְׁמֹ֛ר מִצְוֺתָ֥יו וְחֻקֹּתָ֖יו אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוָּֽךְ׃ All these curses shall befall you; they shall pursue you and overtake you, until you are wiped out, because you did not heed your God יהוה and keep the commandments and laws that were enjoined upon you. וְהָי֣וּ בְךָ֔ לְא֖וֹת וּלְמוֹפֵ֑ת וּֽבְזַרְעֲךָ֖ עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃ They shall serve as signs and proofs against you and your offspring for all time. תַּ֗חַת אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹא־עָבַ֙דְתָּ֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ בְּשִׂמְחָ֖ה וּבְט֣וּב לֵבָ֑ב מֵרֹ֖ב כֹּֽל׃ Because you would not serve your God יהוה in joy and gladness over the abundance of everything, וְעָבַדְתָּ֣ אֶת־אֹיְבֶ֗יךָ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יְשַׁלְּחֶ֤נּוּ יְהֹוָה֙ בָּ֔ךְ בְּרָעָ֧ב וּבְצָמָ֛א וּבְעֵירֹ֖ם וּבְחֹ֣סֶר כֹּ֑ל וְנָתַ֞ן עֹ֤ל בַּרְזֶל֙ עַל־צַוָּארֶ֔ךָ עַ֥ד הִשְׁמִיד֖וֹ אֹתָֽךְ׃ you shall have to serve—in hunger and thirst, naked and lacking everything—the enemies whom יהוה will let loose against you. [God] will put an iron yoke upon your neck until you are wiped out. יִשָּׂ֣א יְהֹוָה֩ עָלֶ֨יךָ גּ֤וֹי מֵֽרָחֹק֙ מִקְצֵ֣ה הָאָ֔רֶץ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר יִדְאֶ֖ה הַנָּ֑שֶׁר גּ֕וֹי אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־תִשְׁמַ֖ע לְשֹׁנֽוֹ׃ יהוה will bring a nation against you from afar, from the end of the earth, which will swoop down like the eagle—a nation whose language you do not understand, גּ֖וֹי עַ֣ז פָּנִ֑ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר לֹא־יִשָּׂ֤א פָנִים֙ לְזָקֵ֔ן וְנַ֖עַר לֹ֥א יָחֹֽן׃ a ruthless nation, that will show the influential no regard and the vulnerable no mercy. וְ֠אָכַ֠ל פְּרִ֨י בְהֶמְתְּךָ֥ וּפְרִֽי־אַדְמָתְךָ֮ עַ֣ד הִשָּׁמְדָךְ֒ אֲשֶׁ֨ר לֹא־יַשְׁאִ֜יר לְךָ֗ דָּגָן֙ תִּיר֣וֹשׁ וְיִצְהָ֔ר שְׁגַ֥ר אֲלָפֶ֖יךָ וְעַשְׁתְּרֹ֣ת צֹאנֶ֑ךָ עַ֥ד הַאֲבִיד֖וֹ אֹתָֽךְ׃ It shall devour the offspring of your cattle and the produce of your soil, until you have been wiped out, leaving you nothing of new grain, wine, or oil, of the calving of your herds and the lambing of your flocks, until it has brought you to ruin. וְהֵצַ֨ר לְךָ֜ בְּכׇל־שְׁעָרֶ֗יךָ עַ֣ד רֶ֤דֶת חֹמֹתֶ֙יךָ֙ הַגְּבֹהֹ֣ת וְהַבְּצֻר֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַתָּ֛ה בֹּטֵ֥חַ בָּהֵ֖ן בְּכׇל־אַרְצֶ֑ךָ וְהֵצַ֤ר לְךָ֙ בְּכׇל־שְׁעָרֶ֔יךָ בְּכׇ֨ל־אַרְצְךָ֔ אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָתַ֛ן יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ לָֽךְ׃ It shall shut you up in all your towns throughout your land until every mighty, towering wall in which you trust has come down. And when you are shut up in all your towns throughout your land that your God יהוה has assigned to you, וְאָכַלְתָּ֣ פְרִֽי־בִטְנְךָ֗ בְּשַׂ֤ר בָּנֶ֙יךָ֙ וּבְנֹתֶ֔יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָתַן־לְךָ֖ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ בְּמָצוֹר֙ וּבְמָצ֔וֹק אֲשֶׁר־יָצִ֥יק לְךָ֖ אֹיְבֶֽךָ׃ you shall eat your own issue, the flesh of your sons and daughters that your God יהוה has assigned to you, because of the desperate straits to which your enemy shall reduce you. הָאִישׁ֙ הָרַ֣ךְ בְּךָ֔ וְהֶעָנֹ֖ג מְאֹ֑ד תֵּרַ֨ע עֵינ֤וֹ בְאָחִיו֙ וּבְאֵ֣שֶׁת חֵיק֔וֹ וּבְיֶ֥תֶר בָּנָ֖יו אֲשֶׁ֥ר יוֹתִֽיר׃ The householder who is most tender and fastidious among you shall be too mean to his brother and the wife of his bosom and the children he has spared מִתֵּ֣ת ׀ לְאַחַ֣ד מֵהֶ֗ם מִבְּשַׂ֤ר בָּנָיו֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יֹאכֵ֔ל מִבְּלִ֥י הִשְׁאִֽיר־ל֖וֹ כֹּ֑ל בְּמָצוֹר֙ וּבְמָצ֔וֹק אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָצִ֥יק לְךָ֛ אֹיִבְךָ֖ בְּכׇל־שְׁעָרֶֽיךָ׃ to share with any of them the flesh of the children that he eats, because he has nothing else left as a result of the desperate straits to which your enemy shall reduce you in all your towns. הָרַכָּ֨ה בְךָ֜ וְהָעֲנֻגָּ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר לֹֽא־נִסְּתָ֤ה כַף־רַגְלָהּ֙ הַצֵּ֣ג עַל־הָאָ֔רֶץ מֵהִתְעַנֵּ֖ג וּמֵרֹ֑ךְ תֵּרַ֤ע עֵינָהּ֙ בְּאִ֣ישׁ חֵיקָ֔הּ וּבִבְנָ֖הּ וּבְבִתָּֽהּ׃ And she who is most tender and dainty among you, so tender and dainty that she would never venture to set a foot on the ground, shall begrudge the husband of her bosom, and her son and her daughter, וּֽבְשִׁלְיָתָ֞הּ הַיּוֹצֵ֣ת ׀ מִבֵּ֣ין רַגְלֶ֗יהָ וּבְבָנֶ֙יהָ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תֵּלֵ֔ד כִּֽי־תֹאכְלֵ֥ם בְּחֹסֶר־כֹּ֖ל בַּסָּ֑תֶר בְּמָצוֹר֙ וּבְמָצ֔וֹק אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָצִ֥יק לְךָ֛ אֹיִבְךָ֖ בִּשְׁעָרֶֽיךָ׃ the afterbirth that issues from between her legs and the babies she bears; she shall eat them secretly, because of utter want, in the desperate straits to which your enemy shall reduce you in your towns. ​ ​ ​ See that parents really did eat their children in starvation in the holocaust recently ​ And may this Torah study also act as a curse upon Our enemies! ​ --- ​ Iyar 8 ​ I think about this Gemara from Berachot 10b often as it is great advice to be a "disciple of Shmuel": ​ אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי יִצְחָק: הָרוֹצֶה לֵהָנוֹת — יֵהָנֶה, כֶּאֱלִישָׁע. וְשֶׁאֵינוֹ רוֹצֶה לֵהָנוֹת — אַל יֵהָנֶה, כִּשְׁמוּאֵל הָרָמָתִי. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּתְשׁוּבָתוֹ הָרָמָתָה כִּי שָׁם בֵּיתוֹ״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שֶׁכָּל מָקוֹם שֶׁהָלַךְ שָׁם — בֵּיתוֹ עִמּוֹ. Abaye, and some say Rabbi Yitzḥak, said: A great man who seeks to enjoy the contributions of those who seek to honor him may enjoy those gifts, as Elisha enjoyed gifts given him by the woman from Shunem, among others. And one who does not seek to enjoy these gifts should not enjoy them, as was the practice of the prophet Samuel from Rama, who would not accept gifts from anyone at all. From where do we know that this was Samuel’s custom? As it is stated: “And he returned to Rama, for there was his house, and there he judged Israel, and he built an altar to the Lord” (I Samuel 7:17). And similarly, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Every place where Samuel went, his house was with him, so he would have everything that he needed and not be forced to benefit from public contributions. One may opt to conduct himself in accordance with either of these paths. ​ ״וַתֹּאמֶר אֶל אִישָׁהּ הִנֵּה נָא יָדַעְתִּי כִּי אִישׁ אֱלֹהִים קָדוֹשׁ הוּא״, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מִכָּאן שֶׁהָאִשָּׁה מַכֶּרֶת בְּאוֹרְחִין יוֹתֵר מִן הָאִישׁ. Regarding the woman from Shunem [about Elisha]: “And she said to her husband: Behold now, I perceive that he is a holy man of God who passes by us continually” (II Kings 4:9). Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: From here, where the woman from Shunem perceived the prophet’s greatness before her husband did, derive that a woman recognizes the character of her guests more than a man does. ​ ״קָדוֹשׁ הוּא״: מְנָא יָדְעָה? רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל. חַד אָמַר: שֶׁלֹּא רָאֲתָה זְבוּב עוֹבֵר עַל שֻׁלְחָנוֹ, וְחַד אָמַר: סָדִין שֶׁל פִּשְׁתָּן הִצִּיעָה עַל מִטָּתוֹ וְלֹא רָאֲתָה קֶרִי עָלָיו. The Gemara notes that the woman from Shunem said that “he is holy.” The Gemara asks: From where did she know that he was holy? Rav and Shmuel disagreed over this. One of them said: She never saw a fly pass over his table; and the other said: She spread a white linen sheet on his bed, and despite that even the smallest stain is visible on white linen, and nocturnal seminal emissions are not uncommon, she never saw the residue of a seminal emission on it. ​ ״קָדוֹשׁ הוּא״ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: הוּא קָדוֹשׁ וּמְשָׁרְתוֹ אֵינוֹ קָדוֹשׁ. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּגַּשׁ גֵּיחֲזִי לְהָדְפָהּ״, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: שֶׁאֲחָזָהּ בְּהוֹד יָפְיָהּ. With regard to the verse: “He is holy,” Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: The woman from Shunem intimated that: He is holy, but his attendant, Geihazi, is not holy, as she saw no indication of holiness in him (Iyyun Ya’akov). Here too, she correctly perceived the character of her guest, as it is later stated: “And Geihazi approached her to push her away [lehodfa]” (II Kings 4:27). And Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: He grabbed her by the majesty of her beauty [hod yofya], meaning that when he pushed her he grabbed her breasts in a licentious manner. ​ ״עוֹבֵר עָלֵינוּ תָּמִיד״, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב: כָּל הַמְאָרֵחַ תַּלְמִיד חָכָם בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ וּמְהַנֵּהוּ מִנְּכָסָיו — מַעֲלֶה עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב כְּאִילּוּ מַקְרִיב תְּמִידִין. With regard to the phrasing of the verse: “He is a holy man of God who passes by us continually,” Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said in the name of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov: From this verse we derive that one who hosts a Torah scholar in his home and lets him enjoy his possessions, the verse ascribes to him credit as if he is sacrificing the daily [tamid] offering, as the verse states: “Passes by us continually [tamid].” ​ וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב: אַל יַעֲמוֹד אָדָם בְּמָקוֹם גָּבוֹהַּ וְיִתְפַּלֵּל, אֶלָּא בְּמָקוֹם נָמוּךְ וְיִתְפַּלֵּל. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִמַּעֲמַקִּים קְרָאתִיךָ ה׳״. With regard to the halakhot of prayer, Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said in the name of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov: A person should not stand in a high place and pray; rather, he should stand in a low place and pray, as it is stated: “I called to You, Lord, from the depths” (Psalms 130:1). ​ תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: לֹא יַעֲמוֹד אָדָם לֹא עַל גַּבֵּי כִּסֵּא, וְלֹא עַל גַּבֵּי שְׁרַפְרַף, וְלֹא בְּמָקוֹם גָּבוֹהַּ, וְיִתְפַּלֵּל, אֶלָּא בְּמָקוֹם נָמוּךְ, וְיִתְפַּלֵּל. לְפִי שֶׁאֵין גַּבְהוּת לִפְנֵי הַמָּקוֹם. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״מִמַּעֲמַקִּים קְרָאתִיךָ ה׳״. וּכְתִיב: ״תְּפִלָּה לְעָנִי כִי יַעֲטֹף״. That was also taught in a baraita: One should neither stand upon a chair nor upon a stool, nor in a high place and pray. Rather, one should stand in a low place and pray, for there is no haughtiness before God. As it is stated: “I called to You, Lord, from the depths” and it is written: “A prayer for the impoverished, when he is faint and pours out his complaint before God” (Psalms 102:1). It is appropriate to feel impoverished when praying and make one’s requests humbly. ​ וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב: הַמִּתְפַּלֵּל צָרִיךְ שֶׁיְּכַוֵּין אֶת רַגְלָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְרַגְלֵיהֶם רֶגֶל יְשָׁרָה״. And Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said in the name of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov: When praying, one should align his feet next to each other, as a single foot, in order to model oneself after the angels, with regard to whom it is stated: “And their feet were a straight foot” (Ezekiel 1:7). ​ (אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן) וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב: מַאי דִּכְתִיב, ״לֹא תֹאכְלוּ עַל הַדָּם״ — לֹא תֹאכְלוּ קוֹדֶם שֶׁתִּתְפַּלְּלוּ עַל דִּמְכֶם. Rabbi Yitzḥak said that Rabbi Yoḥanan said and Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said in the name of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov: What is the meaning of that which is written: “You shall not eat with the blood” (Leviticus 19:26)? You may not eat before you pray for your blood. One may not eat before he prays. ​ אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב: כָּל הָאוֹכֵל וְשׁוֹתֶה, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מִתְפַּלֵּל עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״וְאֹתִי הִשְׁלַכְתָּ אַחֲרֵי גַוֶּךָ״, אַל תִּקְרֵי ״גַּוֶּיךָ״ אֶלָּא ״גֵּאֶיךָ״. אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: לְאַחַר שֶׁנִּתְגָּאָה זֶה קִבֵּל עָלָיו מַלְכוּת שָׁמַיִם. Others say that Rabbi Yitzḥak said that Rabbi Yoḥanan said that Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said in the name of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov: One who eats and drinks and later prays, about him the verse states the rebuke of the prophet in the name of God: “And Me you have cast behind your back” (I Kings 14:9). One who sees to his own bodily needs by eating and drinking before prayer casts God aside, according his arrogance and ego priority over God (Maharsha). Indeed, do not read your back [gavekha]; rather, your pride [ge’ekha]. The Holy One, Blessed be He, said: After this one has become arrogant and engaged in satisfying his own needs, he only then accepted upon himself the kingdom of Heaven. ​​ ​ ​ Why better to follow Shmuel's path than Elisha's? Especially nowadays with the breakthroughs in technology and anyone can learn coding online and make their own "in house software solutions", better to forage what you need from nature (if you are strong) or if you are like me just buy it with your own money as anonymously as possible from large internet stores like eBay and Amazon. As soon as the payment is confirmed, that item transfers into your possession. Also I've heard Rabbi Michael Schulman once say on Asknoah that when a person does something for someone for free or gives a free gift, there is a natural feeling of "debt" -and the vinegar wizards will act on this feeling and extract their "favor" from you H'F' ​ Also its very important if you shop for your needs to always look at the name of the brand and the images on the labels that are giving hints to how they will treat us. ​ -- ​ Mishlei 8:21-22 ​ מָ֣וֶת וְ֭חַיִּים בְּיַד־לָשׁ֑וֹן וְ֝אֹהֲבֶ֗יהָ יֹאכַ֥ל פִּרְיָֽהּ׃ Death and life are in the power of the tongue; Those who love it will eat its fruit. ​ It literally says "Death and Life [are] in/with the hand-toungue and those who love Her will eat Her Fruit" ​ See many faces here, including that one can get "pointed" to death in silence H'F'. Also another layer on people not desiring relations not being capable of loving HaShem. Rambam says one shouldn't eat many fruits often, however that grapes and almonds are exceptions and specifically very nutritious. When I realized everyone was dea(d/th) with a dybbuk, I started only having an appetite for wheat. Rabbi Baruch HarOrot (Horowitz) of Dvar YeruShalayim commented that "the wheat only diet is a great diet" and its probably how I survived the coming onslaught of the northern zombie kingdom, from the Wheat singing its Song as a part of my body "From the depths I have cried to You HaShem! You have not/Do not forake(n) me!" ​ מָצָ֣א אִ֭שָּׁה מָ֣צָא ט֑וֹב וַיָּ֥פֶק רָ֝צ֗וֹן מֵיְהֹוָֽה׃ He who finds a wife has found happiness And has won the favor of the LORD. ​ -A good way to gauge your current Heavenly "grade" ​ Western women have chirped for many years a metaphor of "being married" for "being religious" since if you are a woman you can't act like an oak tree in war anyway lest you be a fruitless Zonah (sterile whore) according to the opinion of Rabbi Yehudah in the Mishnah ​ I once got an insight from one of the volumes of "The Wisdom of the Zohar" into the Other Side. It was saying something about there being a hierarchy of "knots" on a rope representing each heathen "team/clan" and on top of them all was a rock, representing the Satin and also the Jewish ones' punishments - to be stoned to death. See that the heathen clans don't have insights into each others evil "projects" ​ -- ​ This morning I drove to HarPat (Food Mountain) aka Pittsburgh to try to test the waters and see if I could take a Yeshiva. I first went to the Chabad and the guard said its school hours and to come back before 10:30 and told me to go to the Kollel. I got there and rang the doorbell and after awhile walked away. After maybe 50 feet someone answered the door and we had a good greeting and he said I could come in and learn (didn't even ask about me not having a Kippah) and I gave him the links to these websites. I sat down in the middle with a man within my Dalet Amot and a few outside. I started learning Mishnayot and the demons in/around the man near me were popping but outside the ~7 feet they were still buzzing. ​ I went to get a cup of coffee and gameplan and a nice terrified man came and asked me my Jewish background and I told him I grew up Conservative Jewish but after turning 20 became religious and went to different Yeshivot and gave him some different Divrei Torah and he was accepting it and walked away after getting some water in the coffee machine for me. ​ The climax: I went back right into the thicket of the thornbush and they were having a heated discussion and someone lifted his finger to the sky. I interrupted and said "I have a question!" and they stopped and let me ask and I said "The Mishnah says when a tree gets cut down if it is still a Tefach (4 fingers) high it is still a tree." The "mother bird" had his left hand over his right and set the rose bush on fire in my Sukkah (I got a little hot/uncomfortable). I forget what he said maybe he also asked about my background and asked what I wanted and I quoted the verse about Enosh being as rare as fine gold and Adam (who observes Torah) being as rare as the Gold of Ophir and that I was looking for Adam's or valid witnesses. He essentially said what you don't like fine gold? And I said I will take that too and after maybe 15 seconds of being hot I said "what are you the chief wizard?" And he literally answered "Yes something like that" or something along those lines lol. and he continued what is my question? I said if it is written in Isaiah "If you do not send the finger and speak iniquitously, your light will be like noon day", does pointing fingers and lifting the hand to curse [giving "first blood"] like you are now not make one liable for death? ​ He said in circumstances, yes. I said right, with two valid witnesses and I looked at the 3 young men next to me and said is anyone a valid witness here? And I put my glasses on and they looked juicy, not perfect beauty like Ken-doll-Shane but definitely a good amount of fear of HaShem in their eyes. ​ The chief wizard kept trying to push the conversation and after bear/cat/lion/wolf clawing (at) him with my left (stronger) hand's fingernails, I decided to just curse him (in Hebrew) "And The Lord God slay you. Indeed the grass gets plowed and she flies away. There is no Universe but One." and he threw his hands in the air, maybe saying like he wanted to uphold the 10 Sefirot, and said (for the second time) I don't think we can help you here. ​ I had been pushing and pulling with my hand but it was my first time trying to take a "dove cote" so I thought maybe I need to plow this mother bird first. After cursing him and putting my glasses on I was able to see the men and they were essentially telling me to trust the story of Laban and Yaakov in Bereisheit. ​ Maybe I should have tried to ask one to come with me as an Eliezer/Segan to help me do the manual labor around the house and to learn with and get instant feedback. However its written "Daughters made a wild ass (x2) of his bull upon the [evil and video/camera] eye" and a bull is a metaphor for one's field/property as well. And I am trying to use him as my "bull", as in my spiritual level, a teacher/brother in Torah. ​ ​ -- ​ Another thought ​​ Sukkot are associated with Peace as in the phrase "Sukkat Shalom". Houses are associated with Bina and Berachot, at Beit (the letter) is similar to Bayit (word for house). Tents, like a kricket klan kolony, is like living in Elohim, the name of Gevurah/Severity/Judgement, since it is an anagram for Ohelim.​ ​ However if you are like Moshe and live in a single Ohel, tent, this is like the word Eloha (a name of God between Ayl and Elohim). Ayl is the name of Chesed/Kindness. Therefore if you are a forest klan tree H'F' and want to rid yourself of Gevurot, like cutting your hair for a man, a good idea would be to be like a lone wolf and live alone in the woods or desert in a single tent. ​ --- ​ Rambam says roses (even though they have sweet hips) are like other Aylonot (non fruitful trees including oaks, beeches, hickory etc). Therefore I never finished a doctorate in environmental science but I know the Eastern US forests used to be dominated (33%) by the American Chestnut (an actual fruit tree) and here all over Ir Yehochanan (Johnstown) there are black raspberries that are like roses but actually "fruit trees", that is Torah scholars. So I would promote planting blight resistant 95% American Chestnut hybrids, walnuts, mulberries, persimmons, plums, and other native fruits that thrive without human help (same for other native plants in other lands) to speed Redemption along. ​ Why? Since Malchut (the World) is always connected to Yesod (The Foundation, the 6 orders of the Mishnah), it seems that the parable the heathens use of fruit trees near Torah scholars is not just a dumb donkey (as in Chomer [same word in Hebrew], dumb matter) but since "One is created above the other", that is everything is this world has a heavenly angelic counterpart guiding it above, dominating the "Aylanot" (wood/shade trees) with Aytzei Peirot, fruitful trees, is a great practical idea. ​ Western boars complain that is causes bugs and animals but I have personally witnessed giant mulberries in Philadelphia with no problem other than some fruit flies on the ground for a week or two from no one harvesting them H'F' and an apple tree (growing with a crab apple beside/through him) in Ayltovnu (altoona) on the main street with no issues while it had fruit on it. Also the neighbor of the McDonalds near my current house has a huge red apple that was unharvested last year and I barely saw any bugs every time that I looked at it (maybe 10 times - Apple trees keep their fruit on for a long time) ​ **The fruit flies were a complete non-issue for anyone that isn't a polished-turd-pig ​ Also, when you increase in fruit trees you increase in bird food and deer food so that more people can trap deer and wild turkeys and it increases the overall world food supply and reduces food prices (from lack of demand from people being able to eat for free). ​ increasing fruit flies also increases the amount of fish in the streams (with fruit trees near them) that can eat them off the water. (ChatGPT agrees) ​ Yes you may argue that it increases lions and bears, but nowadays anyone can get bear spray for 10 dollars on Amazon or a shotgun for ~$200 or really any weapon inexpensively online, even a $15 slingshot with lead/metal ammo on eBay (I doubt a crabapple would kill a bear like it could a human ***see a little below) and practicing a few times as I have described would kill a bear immediately. ​ So too farmers have increased technology to defend from wolves and boars. I have seen videos of a farmer sniping wolves with an infrared camera at night. ​ Also videos of farmers flying in choppers and mowing down boar packs with turrets in their fields, what a time that would be lol. ​ Another point is that fruit trees make the Earth more fertile and even sweeter. Before concluding that its forbidden to eat dirt according to Rambam, I was starting to taste different soils to build up my farming knowledge. In Tzfat under a random fig tree by a highway, the dirt was actually sweet. ​ Since people seem interested, the dirt around central PA smells looks and tastes like miracle gro, and the dirt around Cyprus (an island West of Israel) was classroom chalky. The West of Israel near the coast I can't exactly remember but I think it was very average/plain. The soil in Jerusalem was thick and clumpy, my least favorite, probably from the masses of witchcraft that goes on there and maybe I took a bite of something disgusting H'F'. ​ ​--- ​ Before becoming king of Israel, Moshe named one of his children Gersham, "stranger/traveler/alien/convert there". The meaning is that Moshe felt as a Ger in this world and his true home was Heaven. ​ Right before Moshe's death at the end of Dvarim, the Midrash relates a story that Moshe put forth an extensive argument to HaShem, even beat the Satin back with his staff with HaShem's name on it, and pleaded with HaShem that He let him be like a bird or animal in this world if he could not enter Israel with the Jewish people. ​ Therefore I've decided to have as little involvement and be revealed to the public as little as possible, and take counsel from Yitro and the Rooster and "stand Tzadikim to have a doubled portion of TWTC" in order to keep my spiritual level. ​ Maybe this is a HarPat flavor expressing himself. ​ -- ​ Just to warn you, ChatGPT is saying lead ammo in a sling would not be likely to kill a bear. It would more likely stun it and if not then provoke aggression so you may want the bear spray if you're a forest person. ​ If you're brave maybe practice rapid firing and honestly I doubt even a giant could take multiple lead blasts from a modern metal and rubber slingshot. David killed Goliath who was a giant much larger than a bear with a stone and basic sling. ​ If you're wondering, 1 Samuel 17:4 וַיֵּצֵ֤א אִֽישׁ־הַבֵּנַ֙יִם֙ מִמַּחֲנ֣וֹת פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים גׇּלְיָ֥ת שְׁמ֖וֹ מִגַּ֑ת גׇּבְה֕וֹ שֵׁ֥שׁ אַמּ֖וֹת וָזָֽרֶת׃ A champion of the Philistine forces stepped forward; his name was Goliath of Gath, and he was six cubits and a span tall. ​ A cubit is the distance from the elbow to the fingertip. BDB says a span is the distance from the thumb to little finger on a spread hand, that is half a cubit. My cubit is about 17 inches so therefore he was around 9 feet tall, almost definitely the offspring of Nephilim (angels and human hybrids). -and I think I've learned this once ​ --- ​ It is really inadvisable and probably Halachically forbidden to buy plastic and styrofoam silverware and plates without need since it costs energy and resources to recycle the plastic and they aren't biodegradable. If you are living in "Ohela/im" and don't want to carry plates bowls and cups or have to share a sink then I would advise bamboo and paper/wooden utensils. Also its completely inadvisable to cut down fruit trees like cherry, walnut, and chestnut for wood when there are so many Aylonot for wood available that need replaced anyway. It's also advisable to use the dead pruning branches for wood (not essential building woods but paper/cardboard) before killing the "altars of HaShem" if not necessary. ​ Notice that the plural of Aylonot is feminine as opposed to Aylonim saying that shade trees are "Mimenah" - the lesbian conspiracy against HaShem's Crown Heaven save us. ​ -- ​ One of the P'shat commentators, I think either Rashi or Ohr HaChaim, says that HaShem commanded every tree to be entirely fruitful, not just have some fruitful aspect. Only the fig tree made perfect fruits and edible leaves and wood and therefore was the only tree not punished and is (or at least part of according to Rabbi Ephfraim Palvanov) the Tree of Knowledge of Good and Evil ​ Bereisheit 1:11 וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֗ים תַּֽדְשֵׁ֤א הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ דֶּ֗שֶׁא עֵ֚שֶׂב מַזְרִ֣יעַ זֶ֔רַע עֵ֣ץ פְּרִ֞י עֹ֤שֶׂה פְּרִי֙ לְמִינ֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר זַרְעוֹ־ב֖וֹ עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַֽיְהִי־כֵֽן׃ And God said, “Let the earth sprout vegetation: seed-bearing plants, fruit trees of every kind on earth that bear fruit with the seed in it.” And it was so. ​ Rashi: עץ פרי FRUIT TREE — that the taste of the tree be exactly the same as that of the fruit. It did not, however, do this, but (v. 12) “the earth brought forth a tree yielding fruit” and the tree itself was not a fruit; therefore when Adam was cursed on account of his sin, it (the earth) was also visited (because of its sin) and was cursed also (Genesis Rabbah 5:9). ​ 3:7 וַתִּפָּ קַ֙חְנָה֙ עֵינֵ֣י שְׁנֵיהֶ֔ם וַיֵּ֣דְע֔וּ כִּ֥י עֵֽירֻמִּ֖ם הֵ֑ם וַֽיִּתְפְּרוּ֙ עֲלֵ֣ה תְאֵנָ֔ה וַיַּעֲשׂ֥וּ לָהֶ֖ם חֲגֹרֹֽת׃ Then the eyes of both of them were opened and they perceived that they were naked; and they sewed together fig leaves and made themselves loincloths. ​ Ohr HaChaim In fact, the explanation of [these] things is that the earth was exacting about the wisdom of God with which He founded it, as it is written (Proverbs 3:19), "with wisdom did He found the earth." It was exact about the proclamation of God to it, that it should bring forth "a fruit tree, that makes fruit," [since] it can [be understood] in two different ways: the first is that the taste of the tree be like the taste of the fruit, hence the intention would be that the tree should be fruit and also make fruit. But from its stating, "that makes fruit," [the earth] explained it in a different way; that the intention would be in the following manner; 'the fruit tree' would be one thing and 'that makes fruit' would be another thing, the explanation [of which is] a tree that makes fruit that are different than the [tree] and they are two separate [things]; and the reason it did not state, "and that makes fruit" with a [conjunctive letter] vav, is so as not be understood that the tree itself be a fruit, as well as making fruit. There are also two ways of understanding fruit tree: the first is that the tree itself is a fruit; and the second is that it is fitting to make fruit but does not [actually] make fruit. And due to its great alacrity, the ground attempted to be wise and put out three [different] types [of tree] that can be understood from the words of God: the first are trees that make fruit and the taste of its tree is not like the taste of its fruit; the second are [trees] that make fruit and the taste of its tree is like the taste of its fruit, and that is the tree of knowledge of good and evil, about which they, of blessed memory, said (Bereishit Rabbah 15:7) that the taste of its tree was like the taste of its fruit; and the third is a tree that is similar to a fruit tree, and these are the fruitless trees. And behold, [the earth] responded with alacrity to do everything that [could be] understood [from the words of the verse]. And that is [why] the verse states, "And the earth brought forth grasses, etc. and a tree that makes fruit;" it was exact to state "and a tree" with the addition of a [conjunctive letter] vav for no [apparent] reason, which is how the adjacent verse [about the] words of God is expressed [without the vav] and did not [find a] need to state, "and a tree" with the addition of a vav. The verse intended to say that besides the other trees that it brought forth, it also brought forth another tree that makes fruit, and [with this] it included the fruit-tree, as they, of blessed memory said, that the taste of the tree of knowledge was like the taste of its fruit. And it is possible that it also included trees that do not make fruit that exist in the world, if we will say that they [existed] before the curse of the ground. And I will explain in its place, with the help of Heaven, the reason that God cursed the ground, according to the opinion that it was because it deviated [from His command]. ​ Rashi: עלה תאנה FIG LEAVES — This was the tree of which they had eaten; by the very thing through which their ruin had been caused was some improvement effected in their condition (Sanhedrin 70b). The other trees however prevented them from taking of their leaves. And why is not the name of the tree clearly mentioned? Because the Holy One, blessed be He, never wishes to grieve anything He has created: hence its name is not mentioned in order that it might not be put to shame by people saying, “This is the tree through which the world suffered” (Midrash R. Tanchuma 1:4:14). ​ Although the internet will tell you fig wood isn't edible, I have eaten my fig tree's (thin girdling) roots before and they were sweet. In reference to this we read (in Taanit 27b): On the fourth day of the week they used to fast to avert croup from the children (Yerushalmi Taanit 4:3). ​ See also from this that sun moon and star worshippers live to eat our blood, that is to curse us for their lights - Meeirot for their Orot Heaven save us! I said may they become like their plowed grass fields. ​ Here is an apple peel for the pig acorn-peel people from ChatGPT ​ benefits of not mowing ones yard for the environment ChatGPT said: Not mowing your yard — or mowing less frequently — offers major environmental benefits, both for biodiversity and soil health. Here's a full look at what happens when you let your lawn go a bit wild: ​ 🌿 Environmental Benefits of Not Mowing Your Yard 1. Supports Pollinators (Bees, Butterflies, etc.) Unmowed lawns allow flowering "weeds" like dandelions, clover, violets, and self-heal to bloom. These early and continuous flowers provide critical nectar and pollen for: 🐝 Native bees 🦋 Butterflies 🪲 Other beneficial insects 🌼 "No Mow May" is a real campaign that promotes skipping mowing in spring to help pollinators. ​ 2. Increases Biodiversity Letting grass grow invites a wider variety of: Plants (wildflowers, herbs, native grasses) Insects (including natural pest control species) Birds and small animals (who feed on insects or seeds) A wilder yard becomes a mini-habitat or “micro-wilderness” in urban/suburban areas. ​ 3. Improves Soil Health Longer grass = deeper roots, which: Reduce erosion Improve water retention Build soil organic matter Decomposing plant matter adds nutrients and carbon back to the soil naturally. ​ 4. Reduces Carbon Emissions Gas-powered mowers contribute significantly to air pollution: 1 hour of mowing = 1 hour of car driving in emissions (EPA). Less mowing = less fossil fuel use and fewer emissions. ​ 5. Saves Water Longer grass shades the soil, reducing evaporation. Yards that are partially or fully wild require far less watering than manicured lawns. ​ 6. Reduces Noise Pollution and Disturbance Less mowing means less noise and less stress on wildlife, especially birds and mammals. Avoiding mowing in nesting or fledgling seasons helps ground-dwelling animals ​ May "no mow May" go viral Ana Na! ​ Since I have a ton of strawberries and fruit trees, I use a scythe/sickle anyway since my land is only 2/3 an acre and I have a house and garage on it (not a large garden remaining especially after the fruits) ​ To continue the xlic story, my neighbor is a complete puppet to them and a day after I carefully trimmed my grass and it looked very mild even for a cleaning vinegar pig, they said I need to cut it because its a code violation. Standard DNA tests (like those used in paternity or ancestry testing) analyze common genetic markers, which will be the same for identical twins. ✅ But Here's the Key: Even identical twins are not truly 100% genetically identical. Why? 🔍 Post-zygotic Mutations: After the fertilized egg splits into two embryos, tiny mutations (called somatic mutations) begin to accumulate independently in each twin. These mutations are usually not inherited and are unique to each twin's cells. 🧪 Advanced DNA Sequencing Can Detect This: Using whole genome sequencing (WGS) — especially ultra-deep sequencing — scientists can detect these rare, single-nucleotide variations. A 2021 study published in Nature Genetics found an average of about 5 early genetic differences between identical twins. Forensics Example: In criminal cases involving one of a pair of twins, standard DNA cannot tell them apart. But forensic labs can now use deep sequencing to detect those unique mutations, and differentiate between the twins. ​ It clicked - Uncle Sam! ​ -- ​ Also even for the "wicked Field-people" as in the kingdom of dirts, you should also push for environmentalism and "No Mo May" (No more excessive waters -another jesty face) seeing that this reduces soil erosion ​ What is the implication? He probably knew much more but this is the beginning example ​ Another gardening lesson is that my father was being forced by karen x-lick (the pig house) to pressure me to plant older several year old trees that are much more expensive, maybe 10x the price of an Etsy sapling or cuttings. This is not a good idea and here is why according to ChatGPT ​ Yes — planting young saplings often results in a stronger, healthier root foundation over time compared to planting older, more mature trees. Here’s why: 🌱 Why Saplings Usually Develop Better Root Systems 1. Root Establishment is Easier Young trees adapt quickly to the soil they’re planted in. Their roots spread naturally and fully into native soil, establishing a wide, stable base. Older trees often have roots that were circling in a pot or burlap, leading to girdling roots or stunted growth after transplanting. 2. Less Transplant Shock Saplings suffer less stress when planted. They bounce back faster from the move and resume growing quickly, both above and below ground. 3. Long-Term Growth Advantage Studies show that saplings often catch up to or surpass the size of older planted trees within a few years — because they root better, grow more evenly, and are less prone to transplant complications. ​ ​ You do not want to see your root balled 3 year old apple tree blow over after watching him grow for 10 years or get an infection from not having a stronger root foundation etc H'F'. Also its more satisfying to watch the saplings take off like the palm tree ​ For inspiration for this message here is one of my honeycrisp/fuji hybrid saplings I planted last Autumn that was only a stick maybe a Tefach high just two months ago. ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​​ ​ **If you are cricketing my house H'F' even though I explained that its forbidden to gaze into peoples property without a good Halachic reason, yes I know I have the heirloom goldrushes planted too close and I plan on moving them to give more space. Here are some examples ​ Yoma 8:6 ​ מִי שֶׁאֲחָזוֹ בֻלְמוּס, מַאֲכִילִין אוֹתוֹ אֲפִלּוּ דְבָרִים טְמֵאִים, עַד שֶׁיֵּאוֹרוּ עֵינָיו. מִי שֶׁנְּשָׁכוֹ כֶלֶב שׁוֹטֶה, אֵין מַאֲכִילִין אוֹתוֹ מֵחֲצַר כָּבֵד שֶׁלוֹ, וְרַבִּי מַתְיָא בֶן חָרָשׁ מַתִּיר. וְעוֹד אָמַר רַבִּי מַתְיָא בֶן חָרָשׁ, הַחוֹשֵׁשׁ בִּגְרוֹנוֹ, מַטִּילִין לוֹ סַם בְּתוֹךְ פִּיו בְּשַׁבָּת, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא סְפֵק נְפָשׁוֹת, וְכָל סְפֵק נְפָשׁוֹת דּוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת: ​ In the case of one who is seized with the life-threatening illness bulmos, causing him hunger pangs and impaired vision, one may feed him even impure foods on Yom Kippur or any other day until his eyes recover, as the return of his sight indicates that he is recovering. In the case of one whom a mad dog bit, one may not feed him from the lobe of the dog’s liver. This was thought to be a remedy for the bite, but the Rabbis deem it ineffective. And Rabbi Matya ben Ḥarash permits feeding it to him, as he deems it effective. And furthermore, Rabbi Matya ben Ḥarash said: With regard to one who suffers pain in his throat, one may place medicine inside his mouth on Shabbat, although administering a remedy is prohibited on Shabbat. This is because there is uncertainty whether or not it is a life-threatening situation for him, as it is difficult to ascertain the severity of internal pain. And a case of uncertainty concerning a life-threatening situation overrides Shabbat. ​ (medicine is only Rabbinic to begin with since people used to have to grind herbs) בֻלְמוּס Volmus (Bulmos they have it here) is ravenous hunger, like how people can shock us H'F' to be extremely hungry out of nowhere. ​ What are the exceptions to "dropping branches (Mitzvot)" in hard times? ​ The 3 "cardinal sins" are murder, bloodshed, and forbidden relations. Also any sin if there are 10 non-idolatrous Jewish people witnessing ​ In these cases one is required to sacrifice his/her life to sanctify HaShem rather than do such a thing. ​ Here is a Chabad article about it (***disregard the last paragraph that is not HaShem's Torah) ​ Also there are parts of the Torah that are out of order and actually HaShem may have declared that he was coming to Sat-n the Derech before He sent the snakes to bite the people and told Moshe to make an image of a snake to act as a cure. The adult men were nice but some kids came up to me and we had a language barrier and they asked if I was Jewish in Hebrew and I said Yes I'm Mashiach and he started slapping and kicking me until I ran 20 feet and then I thought I may as well hide in the hotel but another kid came and slapped my backpack so I just ran back to the gate to the Jewish section border. ​ **These were maybe 11 and 7  year old kids, not a real threat, just some thorns and not worth hitting them and risking death H'F' Yaakov was punished in the incident of meeting Esav for "grabbing the dog by the ears" and not avoiding him en route according to Rabbi Natan Scherman in Artscroll ​ Actually maybe I would put the "Islands of the West" before Asia according to Isaiah since if you lack self restraint you can easily "fall to sleep/teeth" in Asia I remember seeing in Bereishit once. A G-d fearing woman (to HaShem, both male and female people), she is to be praised"? ​ YechezkEl 18:24 וּבְשׁ֨וּב צַדִּ֤יק מִצִּדְקָתוֹ֙ וְעָ֣שָׂה עָ֔וֶל כְּכֹ֨ל הַתּוֹעֵב֜וֹת אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֧ה הָרָשָׁ֛ע יַעֲשֶׂ֖ה וָחָ֑י כׇּל־צִדְקֹתָ֤ו אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂה֙ לֹ֣א תִזָּכַ֔רְנָה בְּמַעֲל֧וֹ אֲשֶׁר־מָעַ֛ל וּבְחַטָּאת֥וֹ אֲשֶׁר־חָטָ֖א בָּ֥ם יָמֽוּת׃ So, too, if someone righteous turns away from righteousness and does wrong, practicing the very abominations that the wicked person practiced, shall they live? None of the righteous deeds that they did shall be remembered; because of the treachery they have practiced and the sins they have committed—because of these, they shall die. ​ So too Menachem David of Artscroll says of Moshe's Tehillim 90:10 יְמֵֽי־שְׁנוֹתֵ֨ינוּ בָהֶ֥ם שִׁבְעִ֪ים שָׁנָ֡ה וְאִ֤ם בִּגְבוּרֹ֨ת ׀ שְׁמ֘וֹנִ֤ים שָׁנָ֗ה וְ֭רׇהְבָּם עָמָ֣ל וָאָ֑וֶן כִּי־גָ֥ז חִ֝֗ישׁ וַנָּעֻֽפָה׃ The span of our life is seventy years, or, given the strength, eighty years; but the best of them-b are trouble and sorrow. They pass by speedily, and we are in darkness.-c ​ כִּי־גָ֥ז חִ֝֗ישׁ וַנָּעֻֽפָה (also a great curse especially after setting the Opposer upon a person to set them free of their yoke) Indeed the plow quickly passes and she flies away ​ As in, indeed, the grass and even flowers and some vegetables quickly get plowed to Panu Derech Ad-onai "Face/clear the way for/of HaShem" (Wild Goose's Song) so we can plant our Gan Ayden Pardes (Garden of Eden Orchad) carefully according to the most skilled environmental farmers. ​ Sorry Menachem David says  ~"When they plow cuts them off and she flies away, all her reward goes with her." ​ -- ​ Dvarim 25:17 Remember (every day) do not forget what Amalek did to you when they cooled you (your spiritual level) on the way... Destroy every remembrance of Amalek from under the Heavens, do not forget! ​ Since the Heavens are like one's thoughts compared to one's deeds, the Earth, as its written in YeshaYahu 55:8-9 ​ כִּ֣י לֹ֤א מַחְשְׁבוֹתַי֙ מַחְשְׁב֣וֹתֵיכֶ֔ם וְלֹ֥א דַרְכֵיכֶ֖ם דְּרָכָ֑י נְאֻ֖ם יְהֹוָֽה׃ For My plans are not your plans, Nor are My ways your ways —declares GOD. ​ כִּֽי־גָבְה֥וּ שָׁמַ֖יִם מֵאָ֑רֶץ כֵּ֣ן גָּבְה֤וּ דְרָכַי֙ מִדַּרְכֵיכֶ֔ם וּמַחְשְׁבֹתַ֖י מִמַּחְשְׁבֹֽתֵיכֶֽם׃ But as the heavens are high above the earth, So are My ways high above your ways And My plans above your plans. ​ --this may be a completely crazy thought and "shattered vessel from Aharon" (Mishnah Yadayim) but maybe we should slowly uproot the Aylanot in Har Tuth-Aylon (Laurel Ridge) and replace them with walnuts and perfected chestnuts and plums (the greatest of the "black fruits") berries persimmons etc. and similarly with the rest of the world and not recycle their wood into our fields ​ Here are all the natives at least the harvest from ChatGPT to SW PinaShalomYah ​ 🍇 Native Fruits of Southwestern Pennsylvania 🍎 Trees ​ Pawpaw (Asimina triloba)Largest native fruit; tropical flavor (banana-mango-like); grows in shady understories Wild Plum (Prunus americana)Tart, astringent fresh but good for jams/jellies Chickasaw Plum (Prunus angustifolia)Smaller, often shrubbier; sweet-tart fruit Black Cherry (Prunus serotina)Small dark fruits; good for wildlife, jams American Persimmon (Diospyros virginiana)Sweet when fully ripe (astringent if not) Crabapple (Malus coronaria, native species)Tart, aromatic; used for cider or jelly ​ 🍇 Shrubs and Small Trees ​ FruitNotes Allegheny Serviceberry (Amelanchier laevis)Sweet, blueberry-like berries; also called Juneberry Downy Serviceberry (Amelanchier arborea)Similar to Allegheny; grows in woods and hillsides Black Haw (Viburnum prunifolium)Blue-black fruits; sweetish when fully ripe Nannyberry (Viburnum lentago)Similar to black haw; larger fruits Eastern Red Mulberry (Morus rubra)Soft, sweet fruits; good for fresh eating and pies American Hazelnut (Corylus americana)Edible nuts encased in bracts; technically not a fruit, but often grouped with wild edibles ​ 🍓 Vines and Ground Fruits ​ FruitNotes Wild Grapes (Vitis riparia, Vitis labrusca)Fox grapes and riverbank grapes; used in jelly, wine Mayapple (Podophyllum peltatum)Edible only when fully ripe and yellow (unripe parts toxic) Ground Cherry (Physalis spp., native species)Sweet-tart, in papery husk; like small tomatillos Passionflower / Maypop (Passiflora incarnata)Rare in PA but native to southern edge; fruits are edible and fragrant Virginia Creeper (Parthenocissus quinquefolia)Produces fruit, but not edible for humans (included for awareness) ​ 🍓 Brambles (Rubus spp.) ​ Black Raspberry (Rubus occidentalis)Common and delicious Red Raspberry (Rubus strigosus)Native version; also very flavorful Blackberry (Rubus allegheniensis)Larger, glossy black fruit Dewberry (Rubus flagellaris)Low-growing vine-like blackberry relative ​ 🫐 Others ​ Elderberry (Sambucus canadensis)Small dark berries; needs cooking (raw can upset stomach) Highbush Blueberry (Vaccinium corymbosum)Common in acidic woods or bogs Lowbush Blueberry (Vaccinium angustifolium)Smaller fruit, ground cover 🌳 Special Notes Many of these support pollinators and wildlife. Some are edible raw, others need cooking or processing (e.g., elderberries, mayapples). Always correctly identify wild plants before eating — some have toxic look-alikes. ​ Again I think apples are an exception and also I thought my Peterson's field guide that I read in the restroom according to Rambam to distract my thoughts from Torah says we have native wild very sweet strawberries. ​ Also if you plant crabapples please research or taste a sweet forest garden/grove of them and make sure people can eat them without spitting. ​ Cherries are another large Aylon (oak, hickory, beech etc) like forest shade provider and mulberries are probably the kings of the TapuachaiYah (Apples of Y-h, or My apples are Y-h) Tap-oo-ach-ai-Y*h (instead of AppleachiA, the impure beast of burden making language) shade giving trees (ChatGPT agrees) ​ As for pine trees only the white pine could be argued reasonably to be considered a fruit tree if you like tea but I really don't know and again I never got a doctorate in enviro science to be commenting on whether pines are necessary here but I hope not. As you can see here: כֹּ֖ל חַיְת֣וֹ שָׂדָ֑י אֵתָ֕יוּ לֶאֱכֹ֥ל כׇּל־חַיְת֖וֹ בַּיָּֽעַר׃ {פ} All ye beasts of the field, come to devour, Yea, all ye beasts in the forest. ​ All heathen forests peoples are referred to as "beasts of the forest (singular)" ​ ​​ ​ ​ You should know all eggs are Kosher even without a mark on the package but you need to crack them in a bowl and look for blood spots. I used to throw them away when I saw dark red but cRc says this: ​ " Once you crack the eggs, you should check them for blood spots. The common practice is that if you find a bloodspot, the entire egg is discarded. [Call your rabbi if you notice the blood spot after the eggs was already mixed into other foods.]  Brown eggs often have “protein spots” which are different than blood spots. Blood spots are red, symmetrically shaped, and tend to be on the yolk. In contrast, protein spots are actually pieces of egg white that absorbed pigment from the shell, so they tend to be brown, asymmetrically shaped, and are always in the white part of the egg. Protein spots are permitted and do not need to be removed. Another caveat is that it is only whole, raw eggs, still in their shell, that one can buy from any source. But liquid eggs or powdered eggs should only be bought with certification, to ensure that all additives are kosher, and that nothing non-kosher is processed on the same equipment." ​​ -- ​ In contrast to the beasts of the forest (singluar) beasts of the field is written Sadai, possessive, My field(s) ​ Therefore we are essentially replacing the forests with Gan Ayden (Garden of Eden) ​ -- ​ By the way when heathens hijack my cat and try to voodoo curse me with her I immediately just remember that she's my property in my sight and I have her and no one is holding her and their curse doesn't work at all since one cannot testify against him/herself and she eats of her own snake venom. Sometimes she chews at/on me and it looks like and I hear she breaks her jaw. ​ -- ​ Why did HaShem design raspberries and blackberries with thorns? ​ To plant them around your windows and borders for protection from weak desolates since there will likely be more than two "sheep offerings" a day to slaughter here in the NW. ​ Sineh, thornbush in Hebrew can be novelized Shein Hay, the Teeth (strength) of HaShem. Then you need to really focus on how you feel, you may need to eat Kosher for 3 weeks to a month first to be able to be spiritually sensitive. Usually I like to reel in 2 or three times and then softly close my hands (do one reel at a time because Yadayim says we do not rinse on the purified), taking your fingers, your "horns, forks" to the center of your Altar. If he is spiritually sensitive he will let you know if he is with Us. If he is a donkey (doesn't have a bull as in his spiritual level -Ohr HaChaim) then you need to say G-d is One. You can teach additional Torah until you get tired but since they have been purified by your hands and your Torah (according to Mishnah Yadayim) if they are acting wild you can "chew them out" with YeshaYahu 65:15 and then whatever you want to say. There is no Universe but One" and you'll be safe. ​ After they accept you you should take counsel from the "Song of the Fish" who sings "The voice of HaShem is upon the waters (pleasures. Then its written "The voice of HaShem is upon many waters" and since they are a fresh fall you should bless them with your hand and possibly purify their teeth a second time if needed. A voice should let you know since you are "pleasing to look at" (Bereisheit on when HaShem created trees and called them that). ​ As for whether they need "pushed and pulled" or just "pulled/blessed" I like to "reel" and intend it to be pushing and pulling if they need or just blessing if that would be better. This is why pepper spray, slingshot, or a gun if you can is essential to not mix your oils and get their dusts on you H'F' ​ --- ​ Berachot 6:3 עַל דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין גִּדּוּלוֹ מִן הָאָרֶץ אוֹמֵר שֶׁהַכֹּל. עַל הַחֹמֶץ וְעַל הַנּוֹבְלוֹת וְעַל הַגּוֹבַאי אוֹמֵר שֶׁהַכֹּל. עַל הֶחָלָב וְעַל הַגְּבִינָה וְעַל הַבֵּיצִים אוֹמֵר שֶׁהַכֹּל. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר, כָּל שֶׁהוּא מִין קְלָלָה אֵין מְבָרְכִין עָלָיו: And over a food item whose growth is not from the ground, one recites: By whose word all things came to be. And over vinegar, wine that fermented and spoiled, and over novelot, dates that spoiled, and over locusts, one recites: By whose word all things came to be. So too, over milk, and over cheese, and over eggs, one recites: By whose word all things came to be. Rabbi Yehuda says: Over any food item that is a type resulting from a curse, one does not recite a blessing over it at all. None of the items listed exist under normal conditions, and they come about as the result of a curse. ​ Since the nations oppose Israel according to their sins, see that the nazi norway maple sprouted to satin us for "The rivers (Wisdoms) of Cush (Cham who reduced our "flavors" by raping and castrating Noach after the Flood Heaven save us from such a thing)" ​ Also see another example other than that when one eats "salted foods" (Kosher locusts are usually prepared brined by the Sephardim who still eat them) before bread, one does not even bless on the bread although it is the "king" of food item blessings (Wine/grape juice is the "king" of beverages and when one blesses on wine s/he doesn't need to bless on other beverages) ​ The message being that salted locusts are an insane dainty. ​ One of the ways the Sages novelize the Torah is in hierarchy according to lists. For example when the children of Noach are listed as Shem, Cham, and Yefet, Ohr HaChaim says they were listed in order of intelligence here. There are other example(s) in the Gemara ​ What is an example of a food that does not grow from the ground?
