Plum: European varieties are hardier. Pear: Seckel, Moonglow – disease-resistant types. ​I asked if it these pears were native and it said no but still beneficial here. ​ 3. Shrub & Vine Layer (~20%) Important for pollinators, wildlife, and fast food yield. Elderberry: Great for wildlife and syrups. Raspberry, Blackberry: Prolific and good for forest edge. Blueberry: Needs acidic soil. Grape (native and hybrid): Select disease-resistant vines. ​ 4. Ground Layer (~10%)** Nitrogen fixers and beneficial plants. Comfrey: Dynamic accumulator. Clover: Ground cover and nitrogen fixer. Wild strawberry: Edible ground cover. Ferns, ramps, mushrooms: Native and foraged products. ​ **I guess straw and other berries can't be everywhere or we would be trampling kings with every step H'F'. Although I probed my yard with my multimeter and it looked "hot" Heaven save us Ana Na ​ Here's what ChatGPT says on this: ​ Gardening barefoot and connecting with the earth in a more direct way has been linked to several health and happiness benefits, both physical and mental. This practice, often referred to as earthing or grounding, is based on the idea that direct contact with the earth’s surface allows for positive exchanges between the body and the environment. Here’s a breakdown of the key benefits: ​ 🌱 1. Improved Mood and Mental Health Reduced Stress: Studies suggest that walking barefoot on grass or soil can have a calming effect on the nervous system, reducing cortisol levels (a stress hormone) and promoting relaxation. Better Sleep: Grounding can help regulate the body’s circadian rhythm, leading to more restful sleep. Enhanced Happiness: The natural connection with the earth helps people feel more grounded and centered, leading to improved overall mood and emotional well-being. ​ 🌍 2. Connection with Nature Sense of Belonging: Walking barefoot on the earth allows you to feel more connected to the natural world, fostering a sense of belonging and harmony with your environment. Mindfulness: The physical sensation of soil, grass, or dirt beneath your feet promotes mindfulness and presence in the moment, reducing feelings of anxiety or overwhelm. (**probably alluding to the neural network of plants you mix with) ​ 🌿 3. Physical Health Benefits Improved Circulation: Walking barefoot stimulates pressure points on the feet, which can improve circulation and blood flow throughout the body. Reduced Inflammation: Research has shown that grounding can help reduce inflammation in the body, potentially alleviating pain and swelling. Boosted Immune Function: By connecting directly to the earth, it's thought that electrons from the earth may help neutralize free radicals in the body, boosting immunity and overall health. ​ 🦶 4. Enhanced Foot Health Strengthening Foot Muscles: Going barefoot strengthens the muscles in your feet and legs, helping to improve balance and prevent foot deformities. Improved Posture: Barefoot gardening encourages a more natural posture, which can help align your body and reduce back or joint pain. Better Foot Sensitivity: The tactile feedback from walking barefoot on different surfaces enhances proprioception (awareness of your body’s position in space), which can improve coordination and stability. ​ 5. Grounding with Earth’s Energy Electrons from the Earth: The theory of grounding suggests that walking barefoot allows the body to absorb free electrons from the earth, which can neutralize harmful free radicals in the body, potentially reducing oxidative stress. Increased Vitality: Many people report feeling a sense of vitality and energy after grounding, possibly due to the balance of electrical charges between the body and the earth. ​ 🌻 6. Connection to the Cycle of Growth Empathy and Mindfulness in Gardening: By gardening barefoot, you might feel more attuned to the life cycle of plants and the soil, which can increase the joy and satisfaction derived from gardening. It’s a reminder that we are part of a greater cycle of growth and renewal. Nurturing and Healing: Just as the earth nurtures plants, we are nurtured by the act of gardening, and this physical connection can enhance a sense of healing and personal growth. ​ 🌼 7. Environmental Benefits Reduced Need for Footwear: Going barefoot reduces reliance on shoes, which often contribute to plastic waste and environmental degradation. Soil Health: Walking on soil can help aerate it and allow for better water retention, indirectly benefiting your garden as well. ​ ​ Avraham used to wash his guests feet since it was common to worship the dirt of one's feet back then lol ​ My brother BenYamin once was walking on gravel rocks when we were kids and said although it hurts now, your feet will form calloses and eventually you won't feel it. ​ --- ​ As for two real neighbors next to each other and one has a video camera that can see parts of the other's property, I think this is fine if they need it to see an angle of their own property as long as they never open and watch the footage to gaze at their neighbors property without necessity (like a thief culprit starting from there or something). There is a concept of "like dissolves like", as in magnetically/electrically polarized molecules like water, H2O, dissolve other ones like that. On the other hand, oils are "nonpolar" molecules bind to each other and not polar ones. Soap is special in that it binds to water on one end and oil on the other, so when one washes with water first, then soap+water, then rinses it off with water, s/he unbinds all the oils from his/her skin and clothes. However using too much (too often) dries out the skin and one can get "inflamed" H'F' ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​​ ​ ​ ​ By the way there is an app called Yuka that gives good "seasonings" (logics) on the different chemicals and their safeties if you scan the bar code (or if you donate $10 a year you can search) ​ - ​ On another note I got a steel and lab ruby ring for a few bucks somewhere online that finally came today. Vilti can also mean "to mix", as in to mix up all the dusts within Us like He did to the tower of Babel and made all the dusty tongues when everyone was speaking Hebrew before that. ​ Bahir says on this verse: ​ Rabbi Rahumai said: Illumination preceeded the world, since it is written (Psalm 97:2), "Cloud and gloom surround Him." It is thus written (Genesis 1:3), "And God said, 'let there be light,' and there was light." They said to Him, "Before the creation of Israel your son, will you then make him a crown?" He replied yes. What does this resemble? A king yearned for a son. One day he found a beautiful, precious crown, and he said, "This is fitting for my son's head." They said to him, "Are you then certain that your son will be worthy of this crown?" He replied, "Be still. This is what arises in thought." It is thus written (2 Samuel 14:14), “He thinks thoughts.” ​ Bonus Rabbi Amorai sat and expounded: Why is the letter א at the beginning? Because it was before everything, even the Torah. ולמה בי"ת קרובה לה, מפני שהיא היתה תחילה, ולמה יש לה זנב, להראות מאיזה מקום היתה, וי"א שמשם נתקיים העולם: Why does ב follow it? Because it was first. Why does it have a tail? To point to the place from which it came. Some say, from there the world is sustained. ולמה גימ"ל שלישית, מפני שהיא שלישית, ולהודיע שהיא גומלת חסדים. והלוא ר' עקיבא אמר למה ג שלישית מפני שגומלת ומתגדלת ומתקיימת כמה דאת אמר (בראשית כא ח) ויגדל הילד ויגמל, א"ל הוא דבריי כי הוא גודל וגומל חסד לשכנו עמו ואמון אצלו: Why is ג third? It has three parts, teaching us that it bestows (גּוֹמֶלֶת) kindness. But did Rabbi Akiva not say that ג has three parts because it bestows, grows, and sustains? It is thus written (Genesis 21:8), "The lad grew and was bestowed." He said: He says the same as I do. He grew and bestowed kindness to his neighbours and to those entrusted to him. ​ What was the point? "Turn away from Evil and do Good!" Actually after holding my hand up, much more tan than the image in the video lol ​ You can see the "field worms" start coming at the end Heaven save us. ​ Here is some crazy knowledge I just learned from ChatGPT. Remember nowadays you can go 20 feet into the forest, kick your shovel into the dirt and come up with multiple worms: ​ Yes—ideally, native forests in Pennsylvania and the northeastern U.S. should have no earthworms at all. Here's why: 🧬 Pre-Settlement Forests Had No Earthworms During the last Ice Age (~10,000+ years ago), glaciers scraped away the topsoil and native earthworms across the northern U.S., including Pennsylvania. Since then, forests evolved without earthworms, developing a thick layer of slowly decomposing leaf litter (called the duff layer) which: Protected tree seedlings (especially sugar maple, hemlock, etc.) Provided habitat for native fungi, insects, amphibians, and ground-nesting birds Maintained cool, moist, and fungal-dominated soil ecosystems 🪱 Invasive Earthworms Are Ecological Disruptors When European and Asian settlers brought worms (accidentally via soil, plants, and fishing bait), they: Rapidly consumed the leaf litter Disrupted mycorrhizal fungal networks Released nutrients too quickly for deep-rooted forest plants to use Encouraged invasive plants like garlic mustard and Japanese stiltgrass Changed habitats for species like salamanders, wood thrushes, and forest floor insects 🌲 In Forests: No Worms = Healthy Soil Old-growth forests in glaciated regions historically had no earthworms, and they thrived. Today, areas that still lack worms (e.g., some parts of the Adirondacks, northern Minnesota) serve as ecological reference zones. ​ ​ Also just as the Gemara repeats important things, I want us to chew over how treacherous the Norway maple is here. Unlike the Chinese chestnut that is still a semi useful replacement and only took out one species (although the most important), the norway maple is strangling everyone out here, taking no prisoners! Heaven save us! ​ ​ -- ​ Bereisheit 3:21-24 ​ וַיַּ֩עַשׂ֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהִ֜ים לְאָדָ֧ם וּלְאִשְׁתּ֛וֹ כׇּתְנ֥וֹת ע֖וֹר וַיַּלְבִּשֵֽׁם׃ {פ} And God יהוה made garments of skins for Adam and his wife, and clothed them. (a great clothing option, old school black mulberry leather) ​ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ׀ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהִ֗ים הֵ֤ן הָֽאָדָם֙ הָיָה֙ כְּאַחַ֣ד מִמֶּ֔נּוּ לָדַ֖עַת ט֣וֹב וָרָ֑ע וְעַתָּ֣ה ׀ פֶּן־יִשְׁלַ֣ח יָד֗וֹ וְלָקַח֙ גַּ֚ם מֵעֵ֣ץ הַֽחַיִּ֔ים וְאָכַ֖ל וָחַ֥י לְעֹלָֽם׃ And God יהוה said, “Now that humankind has become like any of us, knowing good and bad, what if one should stretch out a hand and take also from the tree of life and eat, and live forever!” ​ וַֽיְשַׁלְּחֵ֛הוּ יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהִ֖ים מִגַּן־עֵ֑דֶן לַֽעֲבֹד֙ אֶת־הָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֻקַּ֖ח מִשָּֽׁם׃ So God יהוה banished humankind from the garden of Eden, to till the humus from which it was taken: ​ וַיְגָ֖רֶשׁ אֶת־הָֽאָדָ֑ם וַיַּשְׁכֵּן֩ מִקֶּ֨דֶם לְגַן־עֵ֜דֶן אֶת־הַכְּרֻבִ֗ים וְאֵ֨ת לַ֤הַט הַחֶ֙רֶב֙ הַמִּתְהַפֶּ֔כֶת לִשְׁמֹ֕ר אֶת־דֶּ֖רֶךְ עֵ֥ץ הַֽחַיִּֽים׃ {ס} it was driven out; and east of the garden of Eden were stationed the cherubim and the fiery ever-turning sword, to guard the way to the tree of life. ​ וַֽיְשַׁלְּחֵ֛הוּ יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהִ֖ים מִגַּן־עֵ֑דֶן This can also be read that Adam sent HaShem Elokim from his garden to till the clay women (clay feminine) that he was taken from (be a spiritual lesbian H'F') ​ וַיְגָ֖רֶשׁ אֶת־הָֽאָדָ֑ם וַיַּשְׁכֵּן֩ מִקֶּ֨דֶם And all of Adam's [city] (his body, i.e. the evil inclination won the battle over the good HSU') drove out, or was driven out, and he dwelled to the East (VYH according to Sefer Yetzirah, meaning he put himself in front of H'). So too, HaShem set Gan Ayden to the East since if one is able to go to Asia (or Jerusalem since the world is reflecting Eretz Yisrael and YiruShalayim is on the Eastern edge) and be a perfect man there despite the Ceruvim and fiery ever turning sword there, it is the highest fulfillment since the man, the Vav, is given the most power there as opposed to the West, VHY, where the woman gets the final say over the Yud, the Wisdom, all 10 Sefirot of Creation, HaShem's Place for us. ​ The point being that everything Rambam deems an Aylon, even roses, are getting driven out of our Garden since they are too selfish and egotistical to work on fruits for us. ​ However when I was cutting Appalachian roses for pencil-long cuttings to root that have cherry-like hips a few months ago, Jewish voices were saying "that's clearly a Tuth (berry, not a rose)" ​ Evil comes from the North, the open side of the Beit, since it is HVY that spells Hoy! Also how are people going to bring first fruits to the Temple if they don't own their own "world", as in property with a garden or farm, to grow them? ​ "YisraEl and Yehudah dwelled securely, each man under his own fig tree and grape vine" ​​ Shemot 22:28 for you saltier than salt vinegars: ​ מְלֵאָתְךָ֥ וְדִמְעֲךָ֖ לֹ֣א תְאַחֵ֑ר בְּכ֥וֹר בָּנֶ֖יךָ תִּתֶּן־לִֽי׃ You shall not put off the skimming of the first yield of your vats. You shall give Me the male first-born among your children. ​ בכור בניך תתן לי THE FIRST BORN OF THY SONS SHALT THOU GIVE UNTO ME — by redeeming him from the priest by the payment of five Sela’im. Scripture, it is true, has already given an ordinance concerning him (the firstborn) in another passage (Numbers 18:16), but it is stated here again in order to bring it into juxtaposition with the next verse: “Likewise shalt thou do with that of thine ox”, and to illustrate the latter command by the former. How is it in the case of a human being? He (the father) redeems it after thirty days, for it is said, (Numbers 18:16) “and those that are to be redeemed, from a month old shalt thou redeem”! So, too, has the owner of small cattle to look after it for 30 days and only afterwards must he give it to the priest (cf. Mekhilta and Bekhorot 26b). Unless you would rather give us your first borns as slaves.. I will take them and make them into great apple trees. Although I don't even think that's allowed (one has to redeem them with money) ​ As you can calculate according to this Halachapedia article , a Shekel is a little over 20 bucks ​ Numbers 18:16 וּפְדוּיָו֙ מִבֶּן־חֹ֣דֶשׁ תִּפְדֶּ֔ה בְּעֶ֨רְכְּךָ֔ כֶּ֛סֶף חֲמֵ֥שֶׁת שְׁקָלִ֖ים בְּשֶׁ֣קֶל הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ עֶשְׂרִ֥ים גֵּרָ֖ה הֽוּא׃ And you shall redeem him, from 1 month old he shall be redeemed, the monetary equivalent of 5 Shekels in the Holy Shekel, he is 20 Geirah's ​ crazy thought but maybe by lasting a month as a real baby he converts at least 20 wicked creeping watching women into Geirah's lol ​ ​​​​​ ​ ​​​ Since I jested them, really if you need strength, especially if you are a "red fruit", you can try putting some vinegar in the center of your table.. ​ I did this when cleaning and getting into it with my father and shortly after we almost got grassy H'F' and I haven't screamed at someone that loud in a long time lol. ​ Also if you want the heathens to shower you with their spencers s*x therapy tazer toys (don't let them around the crotch or even thighs if sensitive), owning floating avocado seedlings in water seems to do it for me. ​ If you want some head cover, I just got this l eather visor on Etsy ​​ Also I once warned of Zennis but Kits was even worse quality and is heavy and falls off my face. There was another mast year in 2019 right before the Covid breakdown for example for us "cat people" ​ Actually they produce some acorns every year (how most years are dry and people barely eat) but white oaks have mast years of heavy fruit every 2-5 years and red oaks 3-7. Therefore when we have all berries, persimmons, plums, grapes, apples, chestnuts etc there will be an abundance of foods (pleasures) channeled to us spiritually as opposed to these nutty acorn people that you have to shell and boil to extract their Torah from Heaven save us. ​ Also please don't plant commercial fruits like I did with the strawberries and grapes (got concord since I couldn't find fox or the other native) as they are doing the most poorly out of any of my trees, even the apples. One leafed but then withered and the other never leafed. So the point is its really not that great of a difference but maybe saplings are very sensitive (I don't have a ton of gardening experience yet) ​ --Iyar 15 ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ Here's some funny dust from Amazon as I've been Shallalling them since I've been talking about those witch holes in my yard HSU' ​ Anyone that watches such movies and really TV at all except a few select science videos is getting curses piled up on them for the whole 30 minutes to 3+ hours Heaven save us. Se that Ematz is close to Matzah, that can also mean "to find", another expression used for learning Torah. ​ Soon after the Berachah from Moshe Rebbeinu, Yehoshua got married to Rahab who was an "eternally falling loaf of bread woman prostitute" (Mishlei)​ ​​ What is the holy version in Judaism opposite of "street meat"? ​ On Tu B'av the bachelorette Jewish women would dance in the vineyards and sing to the men "Grace is a lie and beauty is vain, a G-d fearing woman is to be praised. Men come and choose for yourself what you desire" or something like that and the bachelor Jewish men would pick their grapes. ​ Alternatively if you are in a real community your Rabbi would probably matchmake you to the best fit that he is mentoring/gardening. ​ -- ​ I was learning Mishnah Bava Batra 1 and realized there are very important building lessons on how to ward off zombies ​ הַשֻּׁתָּפִין שֶׁרָצוּ לַעֲשׂוֹת מְחִצָּה בֶּחָצֵר, בּוֹנִין אֶת הַכֹּתֶל בָּאֶמְצַע. מְקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ לִבְנוֹת גָּוִיל, גָּזִית, כְּפִיסִין, לְבֵנִים, בּוֹנִים, הַכֹּל כְּמִנְהַג הַמְּדִינָה. בְּגָוִיל, זֶה נוֹתֵן שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים, וְזֶה נוֹתֵן שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים. בְּגָזִית, זֶה נוֹתֵן טְפָחַיִם וּמֶחֱצָה, וְזֶה נוֹתֵן טְפָחַיִם וּמֶחֱצָה. בִּכְפִיסִין, זֶה נוֹתֵן טְפָחַיִם, וְזֶה נוֹתֵן טְפָחַיִם. בִּלְבֵנִים, זֶה נוֹתֵן טֶפַח וּמֶחֱצָה, וְזֶה נוֹתֵן טֶפַח וּמֶחֱצָה. לְפִיכָךְ אִם נָפַל הַכֹּתֶל, הַמָּקוֹם וְהָאֲבָנִים שֶׁל שְׁנֵיהֶם: Partners who wished to make a partition [meḥitza] in a jointly owned courtyard build the wall for the partition in the middle of the courtyard. What is this wall fashioned from? In a place where it is customary to build such a wall with non-chiseled stone [gevil] (rough stones), or chiseled stone [gazit] (smooth), or small bricks [kefisin], or large bricks [leveinim], they must build the wall with that material. ​ The large bricks can be taken out more easily (Leveinim, like how Laban is a giant rock, even gemstones) and replaced for a bigger evil window than the small bricks (Kefisin, like Kishufim, witchcraft, or Cesef, silver [since witchcraft succeeding on you is like receiving free silver on where to patch your spiritual flaw.) ​ ​ -- ​ Why did HaShem appear in a flaming rosebush to Moshe when Scripture elsewhere compares Him to an apple tree and a leafy juniper? During the flaming rosebush episode Israel was in Egyptian exile like now how the dollar is powerful and has an egyptian pyramid on it Heaven save us. Therefore it is not time to act like a leafy juniper or sweet apple lest the fire consume you, as HaShem is not found on Earth here without the Ceruvim on the Ark from where His voice emanates. Has anyone seen the Beit Hamikdash or is it still a plot of forest behind the Western Wall? ​ Therefore one needs to act like Shimshon, the Copper Snake (I've heard from Rabbi Ephraim PoAylBaNa (Palvanov) that the verse "Dan is a snake upon the road" is referring to Shimshon who came from Dan) in this exile in order not to be consumed by HaShem's insinuating fire HSU' ​ YirimiY-h 8:11 ​ וַיְרַפּ֞וּ אֶת־שֶׁ֤בֶר בַּת־עַמִּי֙ עַל־נְקַלָּ֔ה לֵאמֹ֖ר שָׁל֣וֹם ׀ שָׁל֑וֹם וְאֵ֖ין שָׁלֽוֹם׃ ​ "And they offer false healing to the hurt of the daughter of My people lightly, Saying: ‘Peace, peace’, when there is no peace." ​ -- ​ Judges 7:4-5 ​ וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־גִּדְע֗וֹן עוֹד֮ הָעָ֣ם רָב֒ הוֹרֵ֤ד אוֹתָם֙ אֶל־הַמַּ֔יִם וְאֶצְרְפֶ֥נּוּ לְךָ֖ שָׁ֑ם וְהָיָ֡ה אֲשֶׁר֩ אֹמַ֨ר אֵלֶ֜יךָ זֶ֣ה ׀ יֵלֵ֣ךְ אִתָּ֗ךְ ה֚וּא יֵלֵ֣ךְ אִתָּ֔ךְ וְכֹ֨ל אֲשֶׁר־אֹמַ֜ר אֵלֶ֗יךָ זֶ֚ה לֹא־יֵלֵ֣ךְ עִמָּ֔ךְ ה֖וּא לֹ֥א יֵלֵֽךְ׃ “There are still too many troops,” GOD said to Gideon. “Take them down to the water and I will sift them for you there. Anyone of whom I tell you, ‘This one is to go with you,’ that one shall go with you; and anyone of whom I tell you, ‘This one is not to go with you,’ that one shall not go.” ​ וַיּ֥וֹרֶד אֶת־הָעָ֖ם אֶל־הַמָּ֑יִם וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־גִּדְע֗וֹן כֹּ֣ל אֲשֶׁר־יָלֹק֩ בִּלְשׁוֹנ֨וֹ מִן־הַמַּ֜יִם כַּאֲשֶׁ֧ר יָלֹ֣ק הַכֶּ֗לֶב תַּצִּ֤יג אוֹתוֹ֙ לְבָ֔ד וְכֹ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־יִכְרַ֥ע עַל־בִּרְכָּ֖יו לִשְׁתּֽוֹת׃ So he took the troops down to the water. Then GOD said to Gideon, “Set apart all those who lap up the water with their tongues like dogs from all those who get down on their knees to drink.” ​ Rashi says those who bent forward to lap the water up were practiced in bowing to idolatry. ​ (This is when Israel could purify themselves, but nowadays lapping the water may actually be better since the hands are subject to impurity and everyone has the highest level, Tumat Meit, dead/zombie impurity, whereas the body from the wrist up is not -also a good idea to wipe ones face/nose if possible with the arm instead of the hand for this reason. Mishlei: "Better a living dog than a dead lion [when the kingdom of evil's oils on your hands that are impossible to get off kill your high spiritual level compared to a lion when you consume them on your hands H'F']") ​ Psalms/Tehillim "Who may approach HaShem? Those with clean hands and a pure heart" ​ The soldiers that didn't need to bow down to drink were likely keeping their hands clean and also wanted the additional blessing of the Donkey: "When you eat of the strenuous labor of your own palms, you're rich/fortunate and its good for you!" ​ Ironically those who were chosen for battle were those who fulfilled the first half Song of the Dog and "Kneeled" אֲשֶׁר־יִכְרַ֥ע עַל־בִּרְכָּ֖יו (but did not fulfill the second part and prostrate like the idolators). See that kneeling on one's knees, Bercaiv, is a blessing, like Berachah so you don't have to get the rest of your body dirty/dusty H'F' ​ Verse 4 וְאֶצְרְפֶ֥נּוּ לְךָ֖ שָׁ֑ם And HaShem will sift Us them there. Sift us, Etzrefenu, is like Etzbaot, fingers, as in Tehillim "He prepares my fingers for war", so HaShem was choosing those practiced in slaying through the Avir Yaakov, "Eagles/Lions" rather than choosing a giant clay donkey and a low level bull bloodbath. ​ - ​ Another funny idea, carry a bottle of dollar store white or apple cider vinegar around to shake at witches ​ -- ​ One of the first things I learned in Hadar HaTorah either through Rambam or a Gemara Sheer (class), is that we learn from the fact that there is a concept of a "warned bull", one that is accustomed to goring 3 times, that changes Halachot for its owner if it gores again. 'The our fruit', or you can concoct your own flavor (please) ​ Shemot 28:36 Kehot Chumash וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ צִּ֖יץ זָהָ֣ב טָה֑וֹר וּפִתַּחְתָּ֤ עָלָיו֙ פִּתּוּחֵ֣י חֹתָ֔ם קֹ֖דֶשׁ לַֽיהֹוָֽה׃ The Forehead-Plate You must have the artisans make a Forehead-plate of pure gold, two fingerbreadths wide and extending from ear to ear across the forehead. Have them emboss the words ‘Holy unto GOD’ on it as on a signet ring by pressing the letters into the back of the plate so they protrude from its front. *Mishneh Torah, Kelei HaMikdash 9:2, based on Gitin 20a. Due to its holiness, the Name of God should be given precedence, so write it above the word for ‘Holy unto.’ *Rashi on Shabbat 63b, s.v. Yud Hei; cf. Rabbi Shlomo ben Aderet (Rashba), Rabbi Yom Tov ben Avraham (Ritva), and Rabbi Nissim Gerondi (Ran) ad loc.; Tosafot on Sukah 5a, s.v. Yud Hei mileMa’lah. ​ Tzitz צִּ֖יץ (Forehead-plate) is also the exact same word for Flower/Bloom/Shining ​​ - ​ If you're trying to bunker down, you should know your animals will also act as "eyes/screens" as hosts to their spirits and such but you can scratch your animal and curse them out of them nearly immediately if you want a "Chai Sa'arah" Living Hairs (as opposed to the verse "Chai Sarah, ...the years of the 'Life of Sarah'" that is actually a weekly Torah study portion in the yearly cycle) for "snuggle bread" ​ on the other hand I think my cat has plowed more souls than me possibly.. ​ Again the Gemara says the only thing forbidden with an animal is actual sexual relations. ​ -- ​ Rabbi HarGal of Dvar YiruShalayim once taught me to inspect fresh (not pitted) dates extremely carefully for bugs (same goes for figs). If he rinsed with it vessels which had already been rinsed or new vessels, it is valid. Rabbi Yose declares [the water] invalid if they were new vessels. ​ הֵדִיחַ בָּהֶם אֶת הַכֵּלִים אוֹ שֶׁמִּחָה בָהֶם אֶת הַמִּדּוֹת, פְּסוּלִים.​ If he scrubbed all of the dogs or made them rejoice, it is invalid. ​ And what the Rooster was warning us, not to love teaching Shaynah our Torah before eating her bread ​ הַמַּיִם שֶׁהַנַּחְתּוֹם מַטְבִּיל בָּהֶם אֶת הַגְּלֻסְקִין, פְּסוּלִים The waters (of Torah) that are pleasant/ that the baker dips his loaves in is invalid. ​ וּכְשֶׁהוּא מֵדִיחַ אֶת יָדָיו בָּהֶן, כְּשֵׁרִים. If he seduces her with his hands, it is valid (to make making her his bread easier). When one pours water over one's hands their need to be 2 pourings. For the first pouring the water must go up to the joint, which is interpreted either as the second joint of the fingers or the joint attaching the fingers to the hand (we will see this in 2:3). The problem is that his fingers now defile the water that is on them. To fix this problem he then washes off the water with more water. We will learn more about this process in chapter two. If the first washing didn't reach all the way to the joint, he is not allowed to pour the second pouring in a place where the first one didn't reach. Rather, he would have to redo the whole thing.  [i.e. dry his hands off and repour] But if the second pouring didn't reach the joint, he can just add water to the spots he missed. ​ Again this is talking literally about ritual purity in the times to come with the Ashes of the Red Heifer. ​ But see the Face that we do not rinse on the Champion Rishonim when pushing lightly and pulling closer, 'reeling in', but one reel at a time. ​(the other Faces I made months ago are on AyshDaat near the top.) ​ Also see that the "sword Sukkah services" of just trying to plow as many dogs as possible is also invalid lol sorry about that. ​ Its a good question whether a right handed person with both hands free should push away with the left and bring close with the right simultaneously instead of having the push be by itself, but I hear yes. ​ For left handed "fallen fish" like me since people are extra salty and the vinegar is on HGH causing increased arrogance, see this as extra incentive to strengthen the right and I also think we should still be "fisherman" so crazyann doesn't start hitting people and manipulating their thoughts into thinking you satined them. ​ Also crazyann was/is liable for death as a gentile for hitting people into being right handed since Halacha says this is valid (to be left handed) and a gentile that strikes someone without a good reason is liable for death by the sword in the way of the Kingdom (the governments or soon to be Tzion)!! ​ An interesting Halacha from Sanhedrin 29b אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. אֲמַר לְהוּ: כִּי אָמְרִינַן ״אָדָם עָשׂוּי שֶׁלֹּא לְהַשְׂבִּיעַ אֶת עַצְמוֹ״, הָנֵי מִילֵּי מֵחַיִּים, אֲבָל לְאַחַר מִיתָה – לָא. They came to judgment before Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei. He said to them: When we say a person is prone to make false statements so as not to make himself appear sated, this statement applies to an admission during his lifetime. But after death, i.e., on his deathbed, this does not apply; rather, we presume he told the truth. ​ -- ​ Rashi says at the beginning of Bereisheit that Israel is the "Animal of HaShem" Chavah (Eve)'s original name was Chayyah, beast/animal. Therefore Edom, though he met them with the sword was not to be abhorred utterly, and similarly the Egyptians who drowned them (their male children), while those (the Ammonites and Moabites) who caused them to sin were to be utterly abhorred (Sifrei Devarim 252:3). ​ -- ​ Although plowing the dogs, Celavim, Col Lev, those who are all heart and no head is not Kosher, I think we can still do the Sukkah plowing service-like swingings on the pigs crickets and snakes etc (just shaking a sword or bat etc in all 6 directions -or just waving or doing 'snow angels') and maybe you should push and pull closer in a Sukkah-like service for the dogs to get them off you in a Kosher manner. To whom expound a message? To those newly weaned from milk, Just taken away from the breast? ​ כִּ֣י צַ֤ו לָצָו֙ צַ֣ו לָצָ֔ו קַ֥ו לָקָ֖ו קַ֣ו לָקָ֑ו זְעֵ֥יר שָׁ֖ם זְעֵ֥יר שָֽׁם׃ That same mutter upon mutter, Murmur upon murmur, Now here, now there!” ​ כִּ֚י בְּלַעֲגֵ֣י שָׂפָ֔ה וּבְלָשׁ֖וֹן אַחֶ֑רֶת יְדַבֵּ֖ר אֶל־הָעָ֥ם הַזֶּֽה׃ Truly, as one who speaks to that people in a stammering jargon and an alien tongue ​ אֲשֶׁ֣ר ׀ אָמַ֣ר אֲלֵיהֶ֗ם זֹ֤את הַמְּנוּחָה֙ הָנִ֣יחוּ לֶעָיֵ֔ף וְזֹ֖את הַמַּרְגֵּעָ֑ה וְלֹ֥א אָב֖וּא שְׁמֽוֹעַ׃ is he who declares to them, “This is the resting place, let the weary rest; this is the place of repose.” They refuse to listen. ​ וְהָיָ֨ה לָהֶ֜ם דְּבַר־יְהֹוָ֗ה צַ֣ו לָצָ֞ו צַ֤ו לָצָו֙ קַ֤ו לָקָו֙ קַ֣ו לָקָ֔ו זְעֵ֥יר שָׁ֖ם זְעֵ֣יר שָׁ֑ם לְמַ֨עַן יֵלְכ֜וּ וְכָשְׁל֤וּ אָחוֹר֙ וְנִשְׁבָּ֔רוּ וְנוֹקְשׁ֖וּ וְנִלְכָּֽדוּ׃ {פ} To them the word of GOD is: “Mutter upon mutter, Murmur upon murmur, Now here, now there.” And so they will march, But they shall fall backward, And be injured and snared and captured. ​ לָכֵ֛ן שִׁמְע֥וּ דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אַנְשֵׁ֣י לָצ֑וֹן מֹֽשְׁלֵי֙ הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר בִּירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃ Hear now the word of GOD, You scoffers, Who govern that people In Jerusalem! כִּ֣י אֲמַרְתֶּ֗ם כָּרַ֤תְנֽוּ בְרִית֙ אֶת־מָ֔וֶת וְעִם־שְׁא֖וֹל עָשִׂ֣ינוּ חֹזֶ֑ה (שיט) [שׁ֣וֹט] שׁוֹטֵ֤ף כִּי־[יַֽעֲבֹר֙] (עבר) לֹ֣א יְבוֹאֵ֔נוּ כִּ֣י שַׂ֧מְנוּ כָזָ֛ב מַחְסֵ֖נוּ וּבַשֶּׁ֥קֶר נִסְתָּֽרְנוּ׃ {פ} ​ For you have said, “We have made a covenant with Death, Concluded a pact with Sheol. When the sweeping flood passes through, It shall not reach us; For we have made falsehood our refuge, Taken shelter in treachery.” ​ לָכֵ֗ן כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה הִנְנִ֛י יִסַּ֥ד בְּצִיּ֖וֹן אָ֑בֶן אֶ֣בֶן בֹּ֜חַן פִּנַּ֤ת יִקְרַת֙ מוּסָ֣ד מוּסָּ֔ד הַֽמַּאֲמִ֖ין לֹ֥א יָחִֽישׁ׃ Assuredly, Thus said the Sovereign GOD: “Behold, I will found in Zion, Stone by stone, A tower of precious cornerstones, Exceedingly firm; One who trusts need not fear (the plow, Chish) ​ וְשַׂמְתִּ֤י מִשְׁפָּט֙ לְקָ֔ו וּצְדָקָ֖ה לְמִשְׁקָ֑לֶת וְיָעָ֤ה בָרָד֙ מַחְסֵ֣ה כָזָ֔ב וְסֵ֥תֶר מַ֖יִם יִשְׁטֹֽפוּ׃ {ס} But I will apply judgment as a measuring line And retribution as weights; Hail shall sweep away the refuge of falsehood, And flood-waters engulf your shelter. ​ וְכֻפַּ֤ר בְּרִֽיתְכֶם֙ אֶת־מָ֔וֶת וְחָזוּתְכֶ֥ם אֶת־שְׁא֖וֹל לֹ֣א תָק֑וּם שׁ֤וֹט שׁוֹטֵף֙ כִּ֣י יַֽעֲבֹ֔ר וִהְיִ֥יתֶם ל֖וֹ לְמִרְמָֽס׃ Your covenant with Death shall be annulled, Your pact with Sheol shall not endure; When the sweeping flood passes through, You shall be its victims. ​ מִדֵּ֤י עׇבְרוֹ֙ יִקַּ֣ח אֶתְכֶ֔ם כִּֽי־בַבֹּ֧קֶר בַּבֹּ֛קֶר יַעֲבֹ֖ר בַּיּ֣וֹם וּבַלָּ֑יְלָה וְהָיָ֥ה רַק־זְוָעָ֖ה הָבִ֥ין שְׁמוּעָֽה׃ It shall catch you Every time it passes through; It shall pass through every morning, Every day and every night. For I would render you consecrated.” Such things make My anger rage, Like fire blazing all day long. ​ הִנֵּ֥ה כְתוּבָ֖ה לְפָנָ֑י לֹ֤א אֶֽחֱשֶׁה֙ כִּ֣י אִם־שִׁלַּ֔מְתִּי וְשִׁלַּמְתִּ֖י עַל־חֵיקָֽם׃ See, this is recorded before Me; I will not stand idly by, but will repay, Deliver their sins into their bosom, ​ עֲ֠וֺנֹֽתֵיכֶ֠ם וַעֲוֺנֹ֨ת אֲבוֹתֵיכֶ֤ם יַחְדָּו֙ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר קִטְּרוּ֙ עַל־הֶ֣הָרִ֔ים וְעַל־הַגְּבָע֖וֹת חֵרְפ֑וּנִי וּמַדֹּתִ֧י פְעֻלָּתָ֛ם רִאשֹׁנָ֖ה (על) [אֶל־]חֵיקָֽם׃ {ס} And the sins of their ancestors as well —said GOD— For they made offerings upon the mountains And affronted Me upon the hills. I will count out their recompense in full, Into their bosoms. ​ כֹּ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר יִמָּצֵ֤א הַתִּירוֹשׁ֙ בָּֽאֶשְׁכּ֔וֹל וְאָמַר֙ אַל־תַּשְׁחִיתֵ֔הוּ כִּ֥י בְרָכָ֖ה בּ֑וֹ כֵּ֤ן אֶֽעֱשֶׂה֙ לְמַ֣עַן עֲבָדַ֔י לְבִלְתִּ֖י הַֽשְׁחִ֥ית הַכֹּֽל׃ Thus said GOD: As, when new wine is present in the cluster, One says, “Don’t destroy it; there’s good in it,” So will I do for the sake of My servants, And not destroy everything. ​ ​ ​ What is the explanation of the mountains and hills? I would like to propose that it was just the original fig tree or even the figs we have today. How? And for the wheat, since Rashi says the fig tree made its wood entirely edible, one could theoretically make grain with fig wood. ​ For the Tree of Life, I suggest the grape vine since this is compared to one's wife (Perek Shira song of the Lizards), it is the only tree fruit used on Altar services every day except for the Bikkurim services (I think), and we use it to fulfill the Mitzvah of Sanctifying Shabbat and Yom Tovim (if you don't have wine or juice you can just use your bread. Targum; lit. “children.” of the aliens. *For they are full [of practices] from the East, / And of soothsaying like the Philistines; / They abound in customs of the aliens Emendation yields “For they are full of divination / and have abundance of soothsaying, / Like Philistines / And like alien folk.” ​ When I was in the psych ward before my father brought some books of Torah I saw there was a man's documentary book of a trip to Tibet. Chestnuts! ​ הַצַּדִּ֣יק אָבָ֔ד וְאֵ֥ין אִ֖ישׁ שָׂ֣ם עַל־לֵ֑ב וְאַנְשֵׁי־חֶ֤סֶד נֶאֱסָפִים֙ בְּאֵ֣ין מֵבִ֔ין כִּֽי־מִפְּנֵ֥י הָרָעָ֖ה נֶאֱסַ֥ף הַצַּדִּֽיק׃ The righteous perisheth, And no man layeth it to heart, And godly men are taken away, None considering That the righteous is taken away from the evil to come. יָב֣וֹא שָׁל֔וֹם יָנ֖וּחוּ עַל־מִשְׁכְּבוֹתָ֑ם הֹלֵ֖ךְ נְכֹחֽוֹ׃ {ס} He entereth into peace, They rest in their beds, Each one that walketh in his uprightness. וְאַתֶּ֥ם קִרְבוּ־הֵ֖נָּה בְּנֵ֣י עֹנְנָ֑ה זֶ֥רַע מְנָאֵ֖ף וַתִּזְנֶֽה׃ But draw near hither, Ye sons of the sorceress, The seed of the adulterer and the harlot. ​ עַל־מִי֙ תִּתְעַנָּ֔גוּ עַל־מִ֛י תַּרְחִ֥יבוּ פֶ֖ה תַּאֲרִ֣יכוּ לָשׁ֑וֹן הֲלוֹא־אַתֶּ֥ם יִלְדֵי־פֶ֖שַׁע זֶ֥רַע שָֽׁקֶר׃ Against whom do ye sport yourselves? Against whom make ye a wide mouth, And draw out the tongue? Are ye not children of transgression, A seed of falsehood, (***bathroom-water-babies) ​ הַנֵּֽחָמִים֙ בָּאֵלִ֔ים תַּ֖חַת כׇּל־עֵ֣ץ רַעֲנָ֑ן שֹׁחֲטֵ֤י הַיְלָדִים֙ בַּנְּחָלִ֔ים תַּ֖חַת סְעִפֵ֥י הַסְּלָעִֽים׃ Ye that inflame yourselves among the terebinths, Under every leafy tree; That slay the children in the valleys, Under the clefts of the rocks? ​ בְּחַלְּקֵי־נַ֣חַל חֶלְקֵ֔ךְ הֵ֥ם הֵ֖ם גּוֹרָלֵ֑ךְ גַּם־לָהֶ֞ם שָׁפַ֥כְתְּ נֶ֙סֶךְ֙ הֶעֱלִ֣ית מִנְחָ֔ה הַ֥עַל אֵ֖לֶּה אֶנָּחֵֽם׃ Among the smooth stones of the valley is thy portion; They, they are thy lot; Even to them hast thou poured a drink-offering, Thou hast offered a meal-offering. Should I pacify Myself for these things? ​ עַ֤ל הַר־גָּבֹ֙הַּ֙ וְנִשָּׂ֔א שַׂ֖מְתְּ מִשְׁכָּבֵ֑ךְ גַּם־שָׁ֥ם עָלִ֖ית לִזְבֹּ֥חַ זָֽבַח׃ Upon a high and lofty mountain Hast thou set thy bed; Thither also wentest thou up To offer sacrifice. ​ וְאַחַ֤ר הַדֶּ֙לֶת֙ וְהַמְּזוּזָ֔ה שַׂ֖מְתְּ זִכְרוֹנֵ֑ךְ כִּ֣י מֵאִתִּ֞י גִּלִּ֣ית וַֽתַּעֲלִ֗י הִרְחַ֤בְתְּ מִשְׁכָּבֵךְ֙ וַתִּכְרׇת־לָ֣ךְ מֵהֶ֔ם אָהַ֥בְתְּ מִשְׁכָּבָ֖ם יָ֥ד חָזִֽית׃ And behind the doors and the posts Hast thou set up thy symbol; For thou hast uncovered, and art gone up from Me, Thou hast enlarged thy bed, And chosen thee of them Whose bed thou lovedst, Whose hand thou sawest. ​ וַתָּשֻׁ֤רִי לַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ בַּשֶּׁ֔מֶן וַתַּרְבִּ֖י רִקֻּחָ֑יִךְ וַתְּשַׁלְּחִ֤י צִרַ֙יִךְ֙ עַד־מֵ֣רָחֹ֔ק וַתַּשְׁפִּ֖ילִי עַד־שְׁאֽוֹל׃ And thou wentest to the king with ointment, And didst increase thy perfumes, And didst send thine ambassadors far off, Even down to the nether-world. ​ בְּרֹ֤ב דַּרְכֵּךְ֙ יָגַ֔עַתְּ לֹ֥א אָמַ֖רְתְּ נוֹאָ֑שׁ חַיַּ֤ת יָדֵךְ֙ מָצָ֔את עַל־כֵּ֖ן לֹ֥א חָלִֽית׃ Thou wast wearied with the length of thy way; yet saidst thou not: ‘There is no hope’; thou didst find a renewal of thy strength, therefore thou wast not affected. ​ וְאֶת־מִ֞י דָּאַ֤גְתְּ וַתִּֽירְאִי֙ כִּ֣י תְכַזֵּ֔בִי וְאוֹתִי֙ לֹ֣א זָכַ֔רְתְּ לֹא־שַׂ֖מְתְּ עַל־לִבֵּ֑ךְ הֲלֹ֨א אֲנִ֤י מַחְשֶׁה֙ וּמֵ֣עֹלָ֔ם וְאוֹתִ֖י לֹ֥א תִירָֽאִי׃ And of whom hast thou been afraid and in fear, that thou wouldest fail? And as for Me, thou hast not remembered Me, nor laid it to thy heart. Have not I held My peace even of long time? Therefore thou fearest Me not. ​ אֲנִ֥י אַגִּ֖יד צִדְקָתֵ֑ךְ וְאֶֽת־מַעֲשַׂ֖יִךְ וְלֹ֥א יוֹעִילֽוּךְ׃ I will declare thy righteousness; thy works also—they shall not profit thee. ​ בְּזַֽעֲקֵךְ֙ יַצִּילֻ֣ךְ קִבּוּצַ֔יִךְ וְאֶת־כֻּלָּ֥ם יִשָּׂא־ר֖וּחַ יִקַּח־הָ֑בֶל וְהַחוֹסֶ֥ה בִי֙ יִנְחַל־אֶ֔רֶץ וְיִירַ֖שׁ הַר־קׇדְשִֽׁי׃ When thou criest, let them that thou hast gathered deliver thee; but the wind shall carry them all away, a breath shall bear them off; but he that taketh refuge in Me shall possess the land, and shall inherit My holy mountain. ​ וְאָמַ֥ר סֹֽלּוּ־סֹ֖לּוּ פַּנּוּ־דָ֑רֶךְ הָרִ֥ימוּ מִכְשׁ֖וֹל מִדֶּ֥רֶךְ עַמִּֽי׃ {ס} And He will say: Cast ye up, cast ye up, clear the way, Take up the stumbling block out of the way of My people. ​ כִּי֩ כֹ֨ה אָמַ֜ר רָ֣ם וְנִשָּׂ֗א שֹׁכֵ֥ן עַד֙ וְקָד֣וֹשׁ שְׁמ֔וֹ מָר֥וֹם וְקָד֖וֹשׁ אֶשְׁכּ֑וֹן וְאֶת־דַּכָּא֙ וּשְׁפַל־ר֔וּחַ לְהַחֲיוֹת֙ ר֣וּחַ שְׁפָלִ֔ים וּֽלְהַחֲי֖וֹת לֵ֥ב נִדְכָּאִֽים׃ For thus saith the High and Lofty One That inhabiteth eternity, whose name is Holy: I dwell in the high and holy place, With him also that is of a contrite and humble spirit, To revive the spirit of the humble, And to revive the heart of the contrite ones. ​ כִּ֣י לֹ֤א לְעוֹלָם֙ אָרִ֔יב וְלֹ֥א לָנֶ֖צַח אֶקְצ֑וֹף כִּי־ר֙וּחַ֙ מִלְּפָנַ֣י יַעֲט֔וֹף וּנְשָׁמ֖וֹת אֲנִ֥י עָשִֽׂיתִי׃ For I will not contend for ever, Neither will I be always wroth; For the spirit that enwrappeth itself is from Me, And the souls which I have made. ​ בַּעֲוֺ֥ן בִּצְע֛וֹ קָצַ֥פְתִּי וְאַכֵּ֖הוּ הַסְתֵּ֣ר וְאֶקְצֹ֑ף וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ שׁוֹבָ֖ב בְּדֶ֥רֶךְ לִבּֽוֹ׃ For the iniquity of his covetousness was I wroth and smote him, I hid Me and was wroth; And he went on frowardly in the way of his heart. ​ דְּרָכָ֥יו רָאִ֖יתִי וְאֶרְפָּאֵ֑הוּ וְאַנְחֵ֕הוּ וַאֲשַׁלֵּ֧ם נִחֻמִ֛ים ל֖וֹ וְלַאֲבֵלָֽיו׃ I have seen his ways, and will heal him; I will lead him also, and requite with comforts him and his mourners. ​ בּוֹרֵ֖א (נוב) [נִ֣יב] שְׂפָתָ֑יִם שָׁל֨וֹם ׀ שָׁל֜וֹם לָרָח֧וֹק וְלַקָּר֛וֹב אָמַ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה וּרְפָאתִֽיו׃ Peace, peace, to him that is far off and to him that is near, Saith the LORD that createth the fruit of the lips; And I will heal him. (One of the Songs of the Fly in Perek Shira) ​ וְהָרְשָׁעִ֖ים כַּיָּ֣ם נִגְרָ֑שׁ כִּ֤י הַשְׁקֵט֙ לֹ֣א יוּכָ֔ל וַיִּגְרְשׁ֥וּ מֵימָ֖יו רֶ֥פֶשׁ וָטִֽיט׃ But the wicked are like the troubled sea; For it cannot rest, and its waters cast up mire and dirt. ​ אֵ֣ין שָׁל֔וֹם אָמַ֥ר אֱלֹהַ֖י לָרְשָׁעִֽים׃ {פ} There is no peace, Saith my God concerning the wicked. ​ ​​ Anyway while I'm wearing the tranq off some sister trees that I recommend are basically anyone but alon anava, as its written "Smash the loins of his (Levi's) enemies and may those who hate him rise no more!" Since the chief redwood wizards today are extremely powerful it seems like they have figured out a plan or fake repentance of some sort against the curse Vehemithcha Adon-ai Elokim in YeshaYaHu 65. Therefore I started adding Ay-l Sha-dai before Ado-nai and its locked everyone up pretty much immediately. Ado-nai is the name of HaShem expressed through the Malchut/Kingdom, meaning "My Masters" and therefore can be subject to impurity as His Servants can rebel HSU'. Elokim is the name expressed through Gevurah/Severity where the Zohar says evil comes from and is therefore also susceptive to impurity from their witchcrafts G'F'. Ay-l is the name expressed through Chesed/Kindness and Sha-dai is Yesod/Foundation (where Peace is hidden) and these two Sefirot/Names are not susceptive to any yoke-casting-off impurities. ​ I think I posted this before but here is an epic Chabad article where you can see the different Names and corresponding Sefirot/Attributes. ​ We could probably just add Tzeva'oth after Ado-nai Elokim to make it the name corresponding to Hod instead of Gevurah. ​ I prefer the Gra's Tree of Life where Tifereth is above Chesed and Gevurah. Why? Copper is more useful and much greater in abundance than silver and gold. Also the hands, corresponding to Chesed and Gevurah, right and left, are dirrectly being hung from the body, Tifereth, and are directly dependent on it. Also one can live without hands but not without a torso. However I think the letter path's that the Arizal gives in his Aytz Chayim are more logical. I am going to post a picture now since not everyone bought Sefer Yetzirah with Aryeh Kaplan. ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ Although I like the combination of the Gra's Sefirot order with the Arizal's Letter-Path order,​ It gets a little mixed up around Tifereth/Yesod. I will have to draw my own soon. However they were older and much greater in Kabbalah than I. The 32 paths are the 32 Paths of Wisdom corresponding to the 32 teeth, the 10 Sefirot and 22 Hebrew Letters that one can probe the depths of infinitely. This is our Staff of Infinite Flavors/Pleasures as these are the building blocks for Hebrew words that we can now analyze every letter and every vowel (remember the vowels correspond to the Sefirot) and even make our own words and novelties on existing words in Scripture.​​​​​​​​​​​​​ ​ Tehillim/Psalms 147:4 מוֹנֶ֣ה מִ֭סְפָּר לַכּוֹכָבִ֑ים לְ֝כֻלָּ֗ם שֵׁמ֥וֹת יִקְרָֽא׃ He counts the number of the stars; he calls them all by their names. ​ Google on how many stars are in our Universe: "According to astronomers, there are approximately 200 billion trillion stars in our observable universe." ​ And these are just the logical conceivable names that are actually given to the stars. We can infinitely "play" with the names and make novelties on them by adjusting letters and vowels. ​ Maybe we can just lift the Ari's Tifereth to number 4 and keep it connected to Hod/Yesod as I once read, maybe from Bahir, that Yaakov takes "the whole Tree" by taking the Sefirah of Tifereth. And Yesod and Malchut are always connected - the man and his soul mate. Remember, knowledge of the Sefiroth is hidden in Kabbalistic texts like the Zohar by HaShem to conceal it from wicked witches and wizards and also to make it a more valuable treasure when we build the strength to climb Har Sinai and eat from Her fruits at the top. ​ Also remember that although Keter is listed as 1 and Malchut as 10, there is a Machlokus (debate) whether Malchut is actually 1 since "The end is bound to the beginning" like a flame is tied directly to a hot coal. I am currently holding, not to sound arrogant, that Malchut is the greatest Sefirah because it is the culmination of HaShem's Expressed Will, and based on the verse in Mishlei "and far from your innermost is her worth (a valiant wife)." Malchuth is a feminine Sefirah and Keter is masculine. ​ --- ​ Through the trojan horse and having my cards locked and no cash I figured out how easy it is to make hot fresh matzah bread. You just pre heat the oven to 350, mix flour, sugar (I use organic from Amazon), salt and water in a bowl and knead it with your hand, adding flour or water to get a good dough consistency (takes like 1-2 minutes). Press it flat with your palm on the baking sheet and poke holes with your fingers, then bake for about 8-10 minutes depending on how big it is. I find that making sourdough starter with flour and water and letting it sit and then adding it does make the bread a little softer and chewier, however it adds on baking time. I like it with butter as its written "Butter and honey he shall eat" (Isaiah). ​ In the words of Moshe to Yehoshua in Dvarim "Chazak VeEmatz/VeMatzah" Be strong and resolute, or Be strong and eat Matzah/like Matzah!! Although with sugar I think its technically a matzah-cake but without sugar its not really good. ​ Remember, Rambam says not to eat Matzot fried in oil often. However after you bake them dry you could smother them in oil like HaShem did/will do in the Beit HaMikdash ​ -- ​ Sefer Yetzirah Gra Version 1:12 ​ בירר שלש אותיות מן הפשוטות בסוד שלש אמות אמ"ש וקבעם בשמו הגדול וחתם בהם ששה קצוות. חמש חתם רום ופנה למעלה וחתמו ביה"ו. שש חתם תחת ופנה למטה וחתמו בהי"ו. שבע חתם מזרח ופנה לפניו וחתמו בוי"ה. שמונה חתם מערב ופנה לאחריו וחתמו בוה"י. תשע חתם דרום ופנה לימינו וחתמו ביו"ה. עשר חתם צפון ופנה לשמאלו וחתמו בהו"י: ​ He chose three letters/ from among the Elementals/ [in the mystery of the three mothers/ Alef Mem Shin (אמש)]/ And He set them in His great Name/ and with them, He sealed six extremities./ Five: He sealed "above" and faced upward/ and sealed it with Yud Hey Vav (יהו)./ Six: He sealed "below" and faced downward/ and sealed it with Heh Yud Vav (היו)./ Seven: He sealed "east" and faced straight ahead/ and sealed it with Vav Yud Heh (ויה)./ Eight: He sealed "west" and faced backward/ and sealed it with Vav Heh Yud (והי)./ Nine: He sealed "south" and faced to the right/ and sealed it with Yud Vav Heh (יוה)./ Ten: He sealed "north" and faced to the left/ and selaed it with Heh Vav Yud (הוי). ​ ​ יהו ​ Yud Hey Vav. Think of these like HaShem, the man and woman respectively. Now you can understand your directions and turning your desk, table, and bed will affect you spiritually in these different ways. One should not sleep facing straight upwards as this is arrogant and can cause a seminal emission. Also if your toilet faces E-W and you live in the West or East from Jerusalem, you should slant yourself to the side a little when you use the restroom (so too with N-S). I like to face my desk East or South since the Eastern gate is especially holy and has the perpetual fire. Here is a nice sheet I found on Sefaria on HaShem's Holy House ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​​​ ​​ ​​​ ​ ​ ​ The "Left, Right" etc. that the Sefer Yetzirah is talking about is the Letter boxes. North is actually to the left of the Teivah, Letter Box, and South is the the right. ​ This is why ב Beit, is open on the North. Since its written in the Prophets "From the North I will bring evil upon the world", it is our job to "seal it up" according to the Bahir (Beit represents a house, the same word) ​ --- ​ If you have a job and think you can rely on unemployment if you get let go, I just got denied unemployment for being 10 minutes late one day and an hour and a half 2 weeks later when my alarm didn't wake me up out of the 3 months I worked for the place. ​ --- ​ If you get tired of instrumental music and the handful of good Jewish artists I've found and shared that are at least findable on Youtube, my father once put me on to yacht rock. Therefore this is part of my and my parents' sales efforts to stop the HGH and stretching burn out epidemic ​ -- ​ The Rooster ​ בְּקוֹל שִׁישִּׁי אוֹמֵר. אַל תֶּאֱהַב שֵׁנָה פֶּן תִּוָּרֵשׁ פְּקַח עֵינֶיךָ שְׂבַע לָחֶם: (משלי כ יג) ​ In its sixth call, it is saying, “Do not love sleep, lest you come to poverty; open your eyes, and you shall be satisfied with bread.” ​ Ainecha, eye, can be your teeth that allude to the 32 paths of WIsdom, everything you see and percieve in your mind. If you bring the Yud down and make it Amecha, your person/people, see that all of your nation and family have names made from languages (see on TMC where we saw that the languages are all names of HaShem from the Bahir) where they are all commentaries of Hebrew, your 32 teeth. ​ Instead of Seva, sated, read Sheva, 7. ​ Therefore since witches send drones to mess our teeth up H'S'U' I like to clench my jaw for 7 seconds or 7 times for a second to realign my teeth after brushing them every day ​ -- I saw this beautiful beech in the forest and made the blessing "...who has thus in His World" although its dead and wanted to share if you're still too afraid to leave your pit H'F' ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ The bird is saying:​ ​ צִפּוֹר אוֹמֵר. גַּם צִפּוֹר מָצְאָה בַיִת וּדְרוֹר קֵן לָהּ אֲשֶׁר שָׁתָה אֶפְרֹחֶיהָ אֶת מִזְבְּחוֹתֶיךָ יי צְבָאוֹת מַלְכִּי וֵאלֹהָי: (תהילים פד ד) ​ The Songbird is saying, “The songbird has also found her home, and the sparrow a nest for herself, where she may lay her young – Your altars, YHVH Tseva’ot, my King and my elo’ah.” ​ -- ​ By the way, I want to forbid it Biblically to study Psalm 90 unless you fulfill the commandment to be an Adam, that is fully observant to everything you have learned and taking care to fill the gaps. ​ Why? ​ Wizards are saying Cein Hoda as a curse to inspire HaShem to hurt us H'F'. I started reading Chabad's chapter of Rambam a day to keep the fire unextinguished and the 4 Amot of the Shechinah constantly in my room (through the study of Halacha -Bavli Berachoth) and highly recommend it. Today's chapter is here but its a little longer. Its also a great way to practice Hebrew because although Rambam wrote it for the layman, that was when people were greater and its still pretty difficult for me. ​ Chazakah is automatic acquisition after 3 years of undisturbed use, Hagbihah is acquisition by lifting, and Meshichah is by pushing towards you. ​ I think the sages fence is especially important today with online shipping so pirates don't go rampant on buyers. ​ -- ​ Shoftim/Judges 1:4-7 ​ וַיַּ֣עַל יְהוּדָ֔ה וַיִּתֵּ֧ן יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־הַכְּנַעֲנִ֥י וְהַפְּרִזִּ֖י בְּיָדָ֑ם וַיַּכּ֣וּם בְּבֶ֔זֶק עֲשֶׂ֥רֶת אֲלָפִ֖ים אִֽישׁ׃ When Judah advanced, GOD delivered the Canaanites and the Perizzites into their hands, and they defeated ten thousand of them at Bezek. ​ וַֽ֠יִּמְצְא֠וּ אֶת־אֲדֹנִ֥י בֶ֙זֶק֙ בְּבֶ֔זֶק וַיִּֽלָּחֲמ֖וּ בּ֑וֹ וַיַּכּ֕וּ אֶת־הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֖י וְאֶת־הַפְּרִזִּֽי׃ At Bezek, they encountered Adoni-bezek, engaged him in battle, and defeated the Canaanites and the Perizzites. ​ וַיָּ֙נׇס֙ אֲדֹ֣נִי בֶ֔זֶק וַֽיִּרְדְּפ֖וּ אַחֲרָ֑יו וַיֹּאחֲז֣וּ אוֹת֔וֹ וַֽיְקַצְּצ֔וּ אֶת־בְּהֹנ֥וֹת יָדָ֖יו וְרַגְלָֽיו׃ Adoni-bezek fled, but they pursued him and captured him; and they cut off his thumbs and his big toes. ​ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲדֹֽנִי־בֶ֗זֶק שִׁבְעִ֣ים ׀ מְלָכִ֡ים בְּֽהֹנוֹת֩ יְדֵיהֶ֨ם וְרַגְלֵיהֶ֜ם מְקֻצָּצִ֗ים הָי֤וּ מְלַקְּטִים֙ תַּ֣חַת שֻׁלְחָנִ֔י כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשִׂ֔יתִי כֵּ֥ן שִׁלַּם־לִ֖י אֱלֹהִ֑ים וַיְבִיאֻ֥הוּ יְרֽוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם וַיָּ֥מׇת שָֽׁם׃ {פ} And Adoni-bezek said, “Seventy kings, with thumbs and big toes cut off, used to pick up scraps under my table; as I have done, so God has requited me.” They brought him to Jerusalem and he died there. ​ learn from this the thumbs and big toes are our greatest "dark waters" weapons and to beware when wizards start lifting their thumbs on you - it directly affects your head/thoughts ​ -- ​ A novelty on Bereisheit. When Adam commanded Chayyah not to touch the fig tree, although this was Rabbinic, this was a proper fence and even a Biblical command since there could have been water/oil (from the snake) on the tree and remember anointing is like drinking Biblically!! Therefore the snake was not commanded in not eating of the tree and he pushed Chayyah into the tree making her not liable. Its written that she saw the tree was good for the eyes. I once heard R Manis Friedman say that she chose intentionally  knowing to eat of the tree because she wanted Baalei Teshuvoth as children, Gematrioth of 900 instead of the bent Tzadikkim, 90. This is fitting with the Words "Good for the eyes" since Owners of Repentence have more fear of HaShem that is based in Gevurah, corresponding to the eyes. Heaven save us from this deathly choice!! "Choose Life" and live!!!!!!! ​ 3:6 JPS '06 ​ וַתֵּ֣רֶא הָֽאִשָּׁ֡ה כִּ֣י טוֹב֩ הָעֵ֨ץ לְמַאֲכָ֜ל וְכִ֧י תַֽאֲוָה־ה֣וּא לָעֵינַ֗יִם וְנֶחְמָ֤ד הָעֵץ֙ לְהַשְׂכִּ֔יל וַתִּקַּ֥ח מִפִּרְי֖וֹ וַתֹּאכַ֑ל וַתִּתֵּ֧ן גַּם־לְאִישָׁ֛הּ עִמָּ֖הּ וַיֹּאכַֽל׃ ​ When the woman saw that the tree was good for eating and a delight to the eyes, and that the tree was desirable as a source of wisdom, she took of its fruit and ate. She also gave some to her husband, and he ate. ​ וַתֵּ֣רֶא הָֽאִשָּׁ֡ה כִּ֣י טוֹב֩ הָעֵ֨ץ This can also be understood as feared, Yireh, instead of Teireh. Why? Then if a witch/wizard gets a plastic drone between your fingers, instead of locking them in, having them open leaves you open to more help. This is why the Dalet דֵ is open on its back side. Although the Mishnah says vessels with an opening make them subject to impurity, the Reish ר is a Dalet without an opening, and represents Wicked ones, Reshaim, Grasses, Esav. The Dalet is open on the back because it represents that poor man reaching back to the Gimmel גִּ, the letter before it, representing a rich man running to give charity. If you do not live in the Alef during this crushing exile and just cast everything off, you acquire a spiritual debt that you have to pay for with repentance and or suffering. "There shall be no prostitute among the daughters or sons of Israel". If you are a falling woman and prostitute yourself to the wrong man that will not marry you or is not a righteous Kohen, you will very likely never make it back up. ​ As Tanya says in its beginning, before we all were born we took an oath to be righteous and not wicked. I would propose its that all of the fruits can be derived from the one's given. ​ תַּפּוּחַ אוֹמֵר. כְּתַפּוּחַ בַּעֲצֵי הַיַּעַר כֵּן דּוֹדִי בֵּין הַבָּנִים בְּצִלּוֹ חִמַּדְתִּי וְיָשַׁבְתִּי וּפִרְיוֹ מָתוֹק לְחִכִּי: (שיר השירים ב ג) The Apricot is saying, “Like the apricot tree among the trees of the wood, so is my beloved among young men. I sat down under his shadow with delight, and his fruit was sweet to my taste.” ​ Its actually Tapuach, apple, but this is part of the point. Artscroll says this song can also apply to the citrus fruits. The song of the Olive and Pomegranate would also apply to fruits with an edible exterior but a pit and vice versa and the song of the Grape to the vine fruits ​ For example, the fig, although it has its own song, is, "like an apple" in that its similar sized and perfectly edible, and actually the song is more fitting for it since one would much rather desire fig shade than apple shade on a hot summer day like coming up in the NE US ​ -- ​ Sivan 26 ​ I once read in the Gemara that someone who acts crazy sometimes and is normal other times - he/she is exempt from judgement when they are acting crazy and liable when they are normal. ​ Nowadays with drones and Ohms flying/tunneling all over the place it is hard to imagine that most people are liable for their sins unless they continue in the path that is not good. For example I was tazed into a few minor blasphemies but after a few seconds to a minute the electricity turned down and I immediately repented. ​ In the words of a Rabbi I've seen post on Facebook, "Man's guilt is not that he sins, for he was not created strong enough to withstand the temptation. His guilt is that he does not immediately repent for his sins." ​ -- ​ Some clothes I thought of. ​ If you ever enter a new situation and are tired of the "new vessels" endlessly coming to Chassle you H'F', maybe just say "Sah-tahn" but drink, that is intend in your mind the verse Psalms 109:6 "Set a wicked man over him and may Satin stand at his right hand". The word Sah-tahn has a Tet in the middle, that is its guts are snake guts and as it says in Bereisheit the snake is the most cunning of the beasts. Therefore combined with you also acting as a snake (since they will think you are a satin/sun worshipper) this may be a good way to win Peace easily. I think I'm too famous at this point for this to work for me unless I travel a decent distance. ​ Actually there is a verse in Torah that says its my job to destroy all of the wicked peoples/heathen nations from the world so I don't think I can do this since I used to wrestle and play football H'F' so acting like a she bear waving my arms is nothing to me ​ Plus I have the wrath of Levi as its written at the end of Genesis "A curse in their wrath, indeed it is harsh" ​​ ​ --- ​ During these dog days of summer I want to share my first pizza I ever made, a matzah pizza. It took me about 10-15 minutes from when I turned the oven on to finish. I mixed wheat sugar salt and water to get a dough, mixed crushed tomatoes, italian seasoning, and dill in another bowl, and grated cheese on top. It was phenominal much better than 95% of delivery pizza I used to buy. I used a lot of sugar and the sauce tasted like Pizza Hut ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ Now there's no need to live in a brined cricket city to enjoy fresh pizza​ ​ -- ​ Another thing, don't be distraught if you are not a Rishon or Sheini (someone requiring only one or two rinses rather than 7 to 8 and in between) since "The end of a matter is everything" and you could end up at the heights of the Crown. ​ Its written in the Midrash that the Torah is black fire written on white fire. Therefore above the crown is really fire. This is alluded by the last two letters of the Alef-Beit, Shin-Taf שת. The Shin is the fire and tooth, and the Taf is Torah and Truth (Taf/Thaf). What is the difference? The ideal Torah needs to be situationally adjusted over time as I have given my commentary. That's why the Rooster sings, "Don't love the Mishnah, Witness My death there. Open up your people/person (me) and be sated with the bread of the Torah war" since I can tell you the most realistically on how Halachoth should best be applied today, at least after some research on the things I don't yet know. ​ The fire is greater than the Crown actually. This is alluded to by Caf alluding to Ceter being 20 in Gematria and Shin being 300. The Shin is facing the Taf/Thaf because the only way to "keep the fire on the altar - not to be extinguished" (5 Books of Moshe) is to constantly face the Torah, i.e. be meditating on it and reviewing one's learning or increasing the boundaries of your field by plowing more unknown Torah, like how I recommended to Google Chabad daily Rambam every day and at least read it in English (also to bring the ~7 ft of the Shechinah into your Place). ​ Therefore even if you are a Sheva or Shemona rinsed one (you needed pushed lightly and pulled close 7-8 times, the limit - 8 being if they are in your eye on your way or your family. 7 being if they are a random voice that asks for help or gives something good other than a tooth) then do not despair as in the image of the man representing HaShem in this world in EzekiEl had electrum (Chashmal in Hebrew) for the torso up and fire from the waist down. Therefore even if you are down at the heels/toes, the last acceptable portion of HaShem, then you could rise higher than the crown to infinite levels, like how AyliYaHu rose to Heaven in a chariot of fire, representing obtaining higher and higher levels. Not uplifting someone that a voice says needs 8 rinses that is in your face while doing something necessary/Torah related and plowing instead is like cutting HaShem's (allegorical) feet off H'F' ​​ -- ​ שָׁמַיִם אוֹמְרִים: הַשָּׁמַיִם מְסַפְּרִים כְּבוֹד אֵל וּמַעֲשֵׂה יָדָיו מַגִּיד הָרָקִיעַ: (תהילים יט ב) The Heavens are saying: “The heavens speak of El’s kavod, and the skies tell of his handiwork.” ​ But if we are forbidden to read the clouds as a Mitzvah of not divining, how can we reconcile them telling of His handiwork? ​ Again with Mishnah Yadayim saying if animal spit fell in your ground water it is valid but you cannot have your cup out for it. ​ The sages in Berachoth teach that a cloudy day is extremely difficult and that they aren't good for prayers. So too when we hear thunder we made the Berachoth on the "fruit", "Who's strength and might fill the entire world" and see lightning "Who does the works of creation". These are alluding to the fact that "The Heaven's are speaking of HaShem's glory and the skies of his handiwork". The hands representing revealed riches/severity (since its right in your face). ​ Also don't think rain is a curse since rain is really a blessing (unless it is Sukkoth) since we need rain for our fruits. ​ About this we can apply a face on our Rooster's Call "Do not love sleep/teeth (enjoying watching bright clouds or staring into the blue too much, i.e. spiritual lesbianism) lest you be impoverished/plowed. Open up your eye for 7 seconds or minutes total throughout the day and be sated with bread of the wars of Heaven." ​ No need to count out 7 seconds and minutes you can just estimate or it ruins the point. ​ I should note that staring into the skies has always gotten me some great Torah novelties to descend into my mind later in the day. ​ אֶרֶץ אוֹמֶרֶת. לְדָוִד מִזְמוֹר לַיי הָאָרֶץ וּמְלוֹאָהּ תֵּבֵל וְיֹשְׁבֵי בָּה: (תהילים כד א) The Earth is saying: “The earth and every thing in it are YHVH’s; the inhabited area and all that dwell within it.” ​ My Bubbe said one of her direct ancestors had red hair and I've heard David had red hair. One Face of this is that since the Earth is really David's the Earth is singing to Crown the King! Give the Earth back to HaShem through proper observance of Torah and be not like his wicked descendants starting with shlugmo. ​ "[Since the Earth is] to David, Sing to HaShem! [Then will] the Earth and its fulness/dwellers and those who inhabit it (those who are still riding their donkeys). Otherwise dark times occur H'F' as I'm sure we all know the pains of the exile.. ​ ואומר. מִכְּנַף הָאָרֶץ זְמִרֹת שָׁמַעְנוּ צְבִי לַצָדִיק: (ישעיהו כד טז) And it is saying: “From the wings/corners of the land we have heard song, glory to the righteous.” ​ Its also saying "Deer/desire to the righteous" as in a message to the righteous to act like a deer, treading carefully when exiled to the forest (the kings/gods of the nations). Why? HaShem was studying the Torah for 2000 years before He even created the world! Therefore He was well aware that Chayyah was going to end up as Chavah (snake instead of Living for G-d, the same word as Beast). Why? ​ A parable. A king was extremely rich and someone offered him a lot of silver or the same value of gold. The king didn't want to spend the resources taking from his kingdom securing the large quantity of silver so he took the gold (also silver tarnishes). ​ Therefore HaShem told Moshe when He appeared in the flaming rose/thornbush "I will be that I will be" and that, Asher, is the same root as Rich, Osher. HaShem created this World in one Face to "mine gold", that is find the men and women that are going to be strong and valiant, "Wives of Valor" instead of the easy to find silver "water babies" that wither easily in the hot sun or freezing cold (natural states for most parts of the world). ​ If Chayyah would have never become Chavah, HaShem would have been left with a ton more silver when He wants to be more rich, He wants strong children! Therefore in the words of the Book of Job, "Gird your loins like a Gibor (strong person, the 2/4 title of man)" ​ Anyway since HaShem knew that the world was going to be dark HSU', the Earth is singing that the righteous one's need to act like a deer to be glorified. That is, go out as little as possible and rely on HaShem to save us in the night. Also the deer are vicious warriors as well. They actually kill the most humans in the forest. ​ גַּן עֵדֶן אוֹמֵר. עוּרִי צָפוֹן וּבוֹאִי תֵימָן הָפִיחִי גַנִּי יִזְּלוּ בְשָׂמָיו יָבֹא דוֹדִי לְגַנּוֹ וְיֹאכַל פְּרִי מְגָדַיו: (שיר השירים ד טז) The Garden of Eden is saying: “Arouse yourself, O north [wind], and come, O south! Blow upon my garden, let its spices flow out; let my Beloved come to his garden and eat of its precious fruit.” ​ This is an additional commentary on the Earth, when its not dark and we don't need to act like deer and you all wake up and put warlocks to the guillotine or the executor's blade so we can enjoy His Staff of Infinite flavors in Peace. If you didn't know, there are more than the 10 fruits and vegetables you see in the grocery store. I've once seen a picture of a chart of all sorts of exotic fruits I've never seen before. Google says you could eat a new fruit every day for 100 years and not run out. ​ Now consider mixing all these flavors together for even more tastes. This is what the evil governments are suppressing from us and what technology was limiting us before (due to spoilage and shipping). This parallels the 32 Paths of Wisdom, that is the 22 Hebrew letters and 10 Sefirot that correspond to the 10 vowels. You can continue adding and mixing these "flavors" "without limit!" ​ גֵּיהִנֹּם אוֹמֵר. כִּי הִשְׂבִּיעַ נֶפֶשׁ שֹׁקֵקָה וְנֶפֶשׁ רְעֵבָה מִלֵּא טוֹב: (תהילים קז ט) Gehinnom is saying: “For he has satisfied the longing soul, and has filled the hungry soul with good.” ​ Gehinnom is actually in this world, as Ohr HaChaim says on the extra words "in the land of Canaan (Africa)" that the extra words here are alluding to the fact that this world is called the Sat-n. Rabbi Avigdor Miller specifically says the streets (and I would add websites like reddit and youtube and facebook) are also a Gehinnom. Actually he says its a Gehinnom that's in Gehinnom nowadays, alluding to the fact that the whole world is now Gehinnom since no one is safe anywhere with modern technology. ​ Therefore the streets or your internet or window are alluding to my novelty on the "Falling woman prostitute is the eternal perpetual loaf of bread" and taking her as a Yefeth Toar since she became a borderline satinist (but first converting her if you are a Kohen). ​ Additionally it is alluding to the fact of what the Bahir says "Come my beloved, for the chariot will not stay in one place" Sometimes you just need to get out and walk around a little and see the Earth and be satisfied with Her lights! Not sure about women doing this nowadays, maybe she should choose a sunny window as the Proverb says. ​ מִדְבַּר אוֹמֵר. יְשֻׂשׂוּם מִדְבָּר וְצִיָּה וְתָגֵל עֲרָבָה וְתִפְרַח כַּחֲבַצָּלֶת: (ישעיהו לה א) The Wilderness is saying: “The wilderness and the desert shall rejoice, and the arid region shall exult, and blossom like the meadow-saffron.” ​ We will soon be cultivating these arid regions into farmland with modern farming technology. Therefore although now they are refuges for wayfarers as is written in the Prophets, soon they too will be providing us with fruits and spices and even homes. ​ שָׂדוֹת אוֹמְרִים. יי בְּחָכְמָה יָסַד אָרֶץ כּוֹנֵן שָׁמַיִם בִּתְבוּנָה: (משלי ג יט) The Fields are saying: “YHVH founded the land with wisdom; He established the heavens with understanding.” ​ Think of this as the children of Esav's song, the "field people" as I've referenced Rashi on Bereisheit many times. They are constantly probing my Wisdom to prick me/fry me H'S'U' by any slips in my foot (in the way of the pig, with a split hoof but acid stomach) and the only way out is to learn Rambam to get a foothold in the Earth, that is basic seeds of Wisdom. In order to enjoy the field and make it to Heaven, a person has to learn enough Torah to where he can reach the level of Understanding, that is derive one thing from another. Then he can be "The man (HaAdam), a tree in the field to go before My face in a siege" (5 Books of Torah) ​ This is why the world was given over to the children of Esav until now where I am reclaiming it. Because Israel and Noahides needed to plow their fields and study Halachoth! The Bahir gives a parable. A king gave some bread to his servants so that they would grow strong in their service. They didn't eat it and months later the king came back and saw it moldy. He said now instead of wasting it you have to scrape the mold off and eat it! and lashed them (I added the last part) ​ The bread is Halacha through me and Rambam and Tanakh with Pshat (simple) commentary!!!!! So too it is studying Pardes, as Rabbi Yehudah Fetayah says in Minchat Yehudah that if one misses one section of Pardes (that is Pshat, Remez [hints], Drash [expoundings], and Sod [secrets]) then he has to reincarnate!!! ​ Another Face: If you want ground cover, you need at least the basic wisdom of planting natives and how far apart. Also if you do not study any Torah, HaShem will not bring the rain and if there is no Wisdom there is no rain, as the Sages teach "Ain Kemach, Ain Torah" No flour, no Torah (and it can be novelized vice versa). However if you want to grow a giant field of a towering orchard or huge vegetables, you need to be an Eish Adamah (master farmer) like Noach. Frankly I think just typing in ChatGPT how much space to give each native tree/vegetable or righteous convert (tricky) and you will be golden as long as you study Torah and observe It. ​ מַיִם אוֹמְרִים. לְקֹול תִּתֹּו הֲמֹון מַיִם בַּשָּׁמַיִם וַיַּעַל נְשִׂאִים מִקְצֵה אָרֶץ בְּרָקִים לַמָּטָר עָשָׂה וַיֹּצֵא רוּחַ מֵאֹצְרֹתָיו: (ירמיה נא טז) The Waters are saying: “When his voice resounds with a great mass of water in the heavens, and he raises vapors from the ends of the Earth; when he makes lightning amongst the rain, and he brings out the wind from its storehouses.” ​ 5 Books of Moshe: "This is the Torah, indeed a man will die in a tent." ​ When you are calmly studying the Waters of Torah in your tent, you figure out the witchcraft of electricity underground and above and behind you and even in your eye that are constantly "cooking" all of us H'S'U'. Then the whole world becomes much heavier than before, realizing you are constantly on His Altar. ​ יָמִים אוֹמְרִים. מִקֹּלוֹת מַיִם רַבִּים אַדִּירִים מִשְׁבְּרֵי יָם אַדִּיר בַּמָּרוֹם יי: (תהילים צג ד) The Seas are saying: “More than the voices of many waters, than the mighty waves of the sea, YHVH on high is mighty.” ​​ The Zohar compares the last 2000 years to a spiritual flood like how HaShem flooded the Egyptian army in the Sea of Reeds. Therefore the only way to be above this sea is to "fly like the eagle", that is meditate on and study the Words of the Living God, His Infinite Will and Wisdom (Torah) ​ נַהֲרוֹת אוֹמְרִים. נְהָרוֹת יִמְחֲאוּ כָף יַחַד הָרִים יְרַנֵּנוּ (תהילים צח ח) The Rivers are saying: Let the rivers clap their hands, let the mountains sing for joy together!” ​ These are in future tense since right now, the "rivers and mountains", parables for the kings and gods of the nations, are distressed over every one of their visible citizens being warlocks. I think the Trees of the Field sing a similar song about rejoicing in the future. ​​ מַעְיָנוֹת אוֹמְרִים. וְשָׁרִים כְּחֹלְלִים כָּל מַעְיָנַי בָּךְ: (תהילים פז ז) The Wellsprings are saying: “And as singers who are like dancers are all those who study you.” In Avot, one of the sages is referred to as a wellspring growing ever stronger. Therefore we can use the Parable of a great Torah scholar as a wellspring. We have "fish guts" in that we do not stop chewing our cud after 7 times but rather live in the waters of Torah constantly. כָּל מַעְיָנַי בָּךְ Instead of "all those who study you" it can be read as "all my innards/guts are in You" ​ **** I want to again stress the importance of the verse "May your head never lack oil". I was feeling dry and irritated without strength for Torah and hadn't put oil on my head in over a day and when I put avocado oil on, I cranked out all those commentaries immediately Chapter 2 coming soon.​ ​ As for the use of petroleum jelly instead of tree/vegetable oil; its helpful for people with glasses but its damaging to the environment and also it causes beard hairs to rub out (too much friction). Unfortunately after I remembered to drop them before checking for bugs I started noticing bugs but a lot of them were good.​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ Sivan 27​ ​ Bereisheit 48:7 וַאֲנִ֣י ׀ בְּבֹאִ֣י מִפַּדָּ֗ן מֵ֩תָה֩ עָלַ֨י רָחֵ֜ל בְּאֶ֤רֶץ כְּנַ֙עַן֙ בַּדֶּ֔רֶךְ And I, when I came from Padan, Racheil (the sheep) died upon me in the land of Canaad in the way. ​ If you were a good sheep for 30+ years and just died on me in the morning of the day that you fall on me, I don't treat german sheephards kindly just to let you know and I will wage my spiritual war on you and extinguish you like the rest of the other side. (if you are more than 8 rinses or if I give you your rinsing and you fall back down) ​ -- ​ Although my raspberry bush is only about 3 feet tall, after tasting a handful of non grocery store berries again this year, I think of him more highly than the tallest oak champion ​ -- ​ Perek Shira chapter 2 ​ יוֹם אוֹמֵר. יוֹם לְיוֹם יַבִּיעַ אֹמֶר וְלַיְלָה לְּלַיְלָה יְחַוֶּה דָּעַת: (תהילים יט ג) The Day is saying: “Day to day utters speech, and night to night relates knowledge.” ​ I have once seen a Kabbalist write that before one goes to sleep at night, he/she should meditate on all the actions h/she went through throughout the day, "chewing the day over". The Day is relating this principle, that the day is for doing, for actions, and the night is for recollections and making "Knowledge" out of the Wisdom/Understanding, the Father/Mother that s/he collected throughout the day. ​ Psalms 16:7​ אֲבָרֵ֗ךְ אֶת־יְ֭הֹוָה אֲשֶׁ֣ר יְעָצָ֑נִי אַף־לֵ֝יל֗וֹת יִסְּר֥וּנִי כִלְיוֹתָֽי׃ I bless the LORD who has guided me; my conscience *Lit. “kidneys.” admonishes me at night. ​​ לַיְלָה אוֹמֵר. לְהַגִּיד בַּבֹּקֶר חַסְדֶּךָ וֶאֱמוּנָתְךָ בַּלֵילוֹת: (תהילים צב ג) The Night is saying: “To speak of his kindness in the morning, and of his faithfulness by nights.” ​ Night is a metaphor for exile. Therefore the night is a test of faithfulness to HaShem (that almost all of you are failing H'S'U') when we wait for the rays of dawn to lighten things up. ​ שֶׁמֶשׁ אוֹמֵר. שֶׁמֶשׁ יָרֵחַ עָמַד זְבֻלָה לְאוֹר חִצֶּיךָ יְהַלֵּכוּ לְנֹגַהּ בְּרַק חֲנִיתֶּךָ: (חבקוק ג יא) The Sun is saying: “The sun, [when covered by] the moon, stood in its abode; they speed at the light of your arrows, and at the shining of your glittering spear.” ​ In one face, the sun is the satin, as its written "I will destroy your sun and moon idols!" The sun/satin is always trying to get people to go to war on the innocent through "arrows and spears", this is the whole job of the satins, to test people to see who is going to crack on us and do something horrendous. Especially when the moon, the smaller satin (his son) is "ruling" over him. ​ In another face the sun is Mashiach, me, and I am contantly telling everyone that you at least need to enter a spiritual she-bear war against the wicked nations if you want to see the spiritual Dawn, the morning of Shabbath. Isaiah 63: "I looked long and hard and there was no man, so my own hand brought salvation" ​ יָרֵחַ אוֹמֶרֶת. עָשָׂה יָרֵחַ לְמוֹעֲדִים שֶׁמֶשׁ יָדַע מְבוֹאוֹ: (תהילים קד יט) The Moon is saying: “He made the Moon for the festivals; the Sun knows the time of its coming.” ​ If you have been "dead" like me for years now, you know that Ash-medai, the satins firstborn sun and compared to the moon is much more pious and studies a lot of Torah. Therefore he is singing about how the moon, his parable during exile, is for reminding people to get to work!! The Torah rolls with the lunar and solar calendars combined that we need to constantly be checking (like how I missed Shavuoth after being in the hospital for 11 days) ​​ כּוֹכָבִים אוֹמְרִים. אַתָּה הוּא יי לְבַדֶּךָ אַתָּה עָשִׂיתָ אֶת הַשָּׁמַיִם שְׁמֵי הַשָּׁמַיִם וְכָל צְבָאָם הָאָרֶץ וְכָל אֲשֶׁר עָלֶיהָ הַיַּמִּים וְכָל אֲשֶׁר בָּהֶם וְאַתָּה מְחַיֶּה אֶת כֻּלָּם וּצְבָא הַשָּׁמַיִם לְךָ מִשְׁתַּחֲוִים: (נחמיה ט ו) The Stars are saying, “You, only you, are YHVH; You made heaven, the heaven of heavens, with all their host; the earth, and everything that is in it; the seas, and everything that is in them; and you preserve them all; and the host of heaven prostrate themselves to you. ​ Since there are so many goyim worshipping stars out there, the stars are there to remind us that all of them are really serving HaShem along with everything else in the world that is not a human with free choice to not do so H'S'U' ​​ עָבִים אוֹמְרִים. יָשֶׁת חֹשֶׁךְ סִתְרוֹ סְבִיבוֹתָיו סֻכָּתוֹ חֶשְׁכַת מַיִם עָבֵי שְׁחָקִים: (תהילים יח יב) The Thick Clouds are saying, “He made darkness his secret place; His pavilion around him was dark with waters and thick clouds of the skies.” ​ I have commented on this already on TMC or Ayshdaat but this is talking about when being put into darkness, exile, a Sukkah that you can see right through (apple shade), then your screen, your Sukkah, is dark waters and clouds of dust - you have to act like a she bear and clear the air. ​ Alternatively the dark waters are HaShem's secret place. He hides himself through darkness in order to provide the miracle of a test in this world. Really, there should be no tests since our hearts should constantly be hooked on High and we should realize that everything comes from HaShem and is good. This is until a person stubs a toe or breaks a limb H'F' and things get severe and the tests start and the Divine cameras start rolling (they are always rolling but you get the point) to see how hard we can cleave to Him and if you will blaspheme H'F'. ​ עַנְנֵי כָּבוֹד אוֹמְרִים. אַף בְּרִי יַטְרִיחַ עָב יָפִיץ עֲנַן אוֹרוֹ: (איוב לז יא) The Light Clouds are saying, “Also he burdens the thick cloud with an overflow; the cloud scatters its light.” ​ Looking at clouds of glory (or a successful Tzadik) makes Divine service look easy. Therefore the Clouds of Glory are singing that really they are burdened and in pain and are struggling to successfully fulfill their Heavenly duties! "HaShem desired for the sake of His/Israel's Righteousness to make the Torah great and glorious." Torah is definitely not light work and "The righteous will fall 7 times" (at least). Therefore I think I have heard before and it makes sense that righteous converts and native religious Jews will get the first portions of the land of Israel that has an elevated spiritual status according to the Mishnah (so too does the walls of the old city of Jerusalem and it increases all the way up to the Holy of Holies) ​ בְּרָקִים אוֹמְרִים. בְּרָקִים לַמָּטָר עָשָׂה מוֹצֵא רוּחַ מֵאוֹצְרוֹתָיו: (תהילים קלה ז) The Lightning Bolts are saying, “…He makes lightning for the rain; He brings forth the wind from his storehouses.” ​ Everyone that lives in a house or is making a Chazak stake in the Chefker wilderness knows that lightning is a treat because it waters our gardens and scares heathens off, not to mention looking epic. And we are all safe in our stick built houses/nice tents or homes. If only it would lightning more and terrify you peoples!! (and me) ​ טַל אוֹמֵר. אֶהְיֶה כַטַּל לְיִשְׂרָאֵל יִפְרַח כַּשּׁוֹשַׁנָּה וְיַךְ שָׁרָשָׁיו כַּלְּבָנוֹן: (הושע יד ו) The Dew is saying: “I shall be as the dew to Yisra’el, he shall blossom as a rose, he shall spread forth his roots as the Lebanon.” ​ ChatGPT says dew appears between midnight and sunrise with it most heavily forming just before sunrise. This is because at midnight (using the Parable of night coming first for Redemption and then dawn, same as a Jewish day) most people are woken up, whereas everyone will be woken up right before sunrise (maybe why its said to be the best time for Shema) ​ גְּשָׁמִים אוֹמְרִים. גֶּשֶׁם נְדָבוֹת תָּנִיף אֱלֹהִים נַחֲלָתְךָ וְנִלְאָה אַתָּה כוֹנַנְתָּהּ (תהילים סח י) The Rains are saying, “You, Elohim, poured a generous rain, to strengthen your heritage when it languished.” ​ Rain comes in point-like droplets, alluding to the fact that the have an aspect of severity, as no one wants to be "caught out in the cold rain".
