You can see him as alon anava on Youtube and compare to your "teacher" ​ ג׳ אִילָנוֹת שֶׁבְּשָׂדֶה אוֹמְרִים. אָז יְרַנְּנוּ עֲצֵי הַיָּעַר מִלִּפְנֵי יי כִּי בָא לִשְׁפּוֹט אֶת הָאָרֶץ: (דברי הימים א טז לג) ​ Trees that are in the field are singing (Adam's): Then will sing the woods of the forest from before HaShem indeed he (will) comes to judge all the Earth. ​ This is like the  Rivers' Song since both are metaphors for the kings and gods of the nations who are sickened by their people that they govern due to their obnoxious uncontrollable behaviours. As its written in Isaiah "Is there a Redeemer other than Me?" Alternatively if they are fruitful ones (apples grow smaller in the forest and aren't as kingly) then we are oppressed like the Dove and we are waiting for HaShem to "champion the cause of peoples" (Isaiah). ​ גֶּפֶן אוֹמֶרֶת. כֹּה אָמַר יי כַּאֲשֶׁר יִמָּצֵא הַתִּירוֹשׁ בָּאֶשְׁכּוֹל וְאָמַר אַל תַּשְׁחִיתֵהוּ כִּי בְרָכָה בּוֹ כֵּן אֶעֱשֶׂה לְמַעַן עֲבָדַי לְבִלְתִּי הַשְׁחִית הַכֹּל: (ישעיה סה ח) ​ I like Ohr Somayach's commentary on this that even in a rotten vile cluster with a weak withered vine, a farmer will still tend to it for the fresh wine he can make with it. Alternatively, the vine is the Tree of Life and one can only continue existing if we serve HaShem!!! Selah!!!! (forever!) תְּאֵנָה אוֹמֶרֶת. נֹצֵר תְּאֵנָה יֹאכַל פִּרְיָהּ: (משלי כז יח) ​ The fig is saying, whoever watches the fig will eat of her fruits. ​ This used to be the case before the Mishnah was cricketed and everyone became a powerful warlock 2000 years ago at the Roman exile. It used to be a big secret. Nowadays we must "strengthen the hand of the poor" since people are dying (spiritually and physically. spiritually being much worse) everywhere always H'S'U'. ​ Another face, whoever watches my websites and Torah will eat of Her (the Shechinah's) fruits! ​ Since Ohr HaChaim says all the other trees are sister trees/suckers of the fig, we can apply all the other trees songs to the Fig. רִמּוֹן אוֹמֵר. כְּפֶלַח הָרִמּוֹן רַקָּתֵךְ מִבַּעַד לְצַמָּתֵךְ: (שיר השירים ד ג) The Pomegranate is singing: Like the work/a slice of the pomegranate is your temple behind your veil. ​ My brother planted a pomegranate in Philadelphia (probably a blass H'S'U' since they don't do well in severe cold that Philly can experience) when I urged him to plant the native plum and now his girlfriend is very nice but wears a "veil" of makeup and heavy clothes of Esav. The pomegranate has a rough exterior and also parts of a "pitty" interior like an avocado. They are extremely strong and resistant to bruising that is very good in these harsh times (just not where they could possibly split in a winter storm) . ​ תָּמָר אוֹמֵר. צַדִּיק כַּתָּמָר יִפְרָח כְּאֶרֶז בַּלְּבָנוֹן יִשְׂגֶּה: (תהילים צב יג) The (date but alluding to all palms) The righteous one like the palm tree will flourish, like the cedar of Levanon will grow (Rashi: as they regrow themselves) The palm tree has shallow roots alluding to faith and deeds yet you only need to give a date palm 10 feet by 10 feet to have it reach a decent "flourishing" height. Palm branches always wither because the palm tree needs more faith and more good deeds! He needs to get out and Pekach Ainecha/Amecha - trust in HaShem for success in his Kiruv and business endeavors out in Gehinnom Shebegehinnom, the streets! ​ ​ תַּפּוּחַ אוֹמֵר. כְּתַפּוּחַ בַּעֲצֵי הַיַּעַר כֵּן דּוֹדִי בֵּין הַבָּנִים בְּצִלּוֹ חִמַּדְתִּי וְיָשַׁבְתִּי וּפִרְיוֹ מָתוֹק לְחִכִּי: (שיר השירים ב ג) The Apple is saying: Like an apple in the trees of the forest, yes, my beloved between the sons! In his shadow I desired and sat and his fruit was sweet to my palate. ​ The apple tree is alluding to men on the level of Adam, as the throat of a man is called an Adam's Apple. You can find such people all over the world, people who are not doing anything wrong in their own opinion, non-intentional sinners. If they are not Noachides at least then they will likely need to reincarnate unless HaShem deems what their opinions were to be too treacherous and snuffs them H'F'. The other trees of the forest are nothing like an apple or those that are "like an apple", that is persimmons, plums, figs, even berries. Would you rather find another oak tree and boil acorns or stumble upon a wild yellow apple if you were ever forced out to the forest on a boiling summer day like today and starving H'F'?? ​ שִׁבֹּלֶת חִטִּים אוֹמֶרֶת. שִׁיר הַמַּעֲלוֹת מִמַּעֲמַקִּים קְרָאתִיךָ יי (תהילים קל א) The Sheaves of Wheat are singing: A Song of ascents! From the depths I have called HaShem! ​ Wheat is an annual plant that you have to sow every year. This is opposed to root vegetables that "live forever" in that they keep regenerating. ChatGPT says Jerusalem artichokes can survive indefinitely underground. Therefore the merit of those who are "wheat" and are truly on the altar in that they could not sprout next season (die forever) is that they call out to HaShem in their distress. שִׁבֹּלֶת שְׂעוֹרִים אוֹמֶרֶת. תְּפִלָּה לְעָנִי כִי יַעֲטֹף וְלִפְנֵי יי יִשְׁפֹּךְ שִׂיחוֹ (תהילים קב א) Sheaves of Barley are singing: A pryaer to the poor man indeed he swoons and before HaShem pours out speech. ​ In ancient societies, and still today barley was considered lower status than wheat. "Peasant bread." If you look at the Hebrew its a prayer "to" the poor man. In that the poor man needs to "bend" and pour prayer out to HaShem like the wheat. A "wake up call" to those who are not wheat. ​ שְׁאַר שִׁבּוֹלִים אוֹמְרִים. לָבְשׁוּ כָרִים הַצֹּאן וַעֲמָקִים יַעַטְפוּ בָר יִתְרוֹעֲעוּ אַף יָשִׁירוּ (תהילים סה יד) ​ The other sheaves (like spelt for example) are saying: The vineyard is coated with sheep and the valleys are enveloped with grain. They will shout for joy, even sing! ​ This is like the level of a Tzadik to a Baal Teshuvah. This is someone who was constantly righteous and never fell to "the depths" as us who have been there know how horrible life can get (essentially severe hell). יְרָקוֹת שֶׁבַּשָּׂדֶה אוֹמְרִים. תְּלָמֶיהָ רַוֵּה נַחֵת גְּדוּדֶהָ בִּרְבִיבִים תְּמֹגְגֶנָּה צִמְחָהּ תְּבָרֵךְ: (תהילים סה יא) The Vegetables of the Field are saying, “You water its furrows abundantly; you settle its ridges; you make it soft with showers; You bless its growth.” ​ Vegetables don't have a strong woody stem that outlives the winter and extreme heat like tree fruits. Therefore they are praising HaShem for "His Pleasures/Staff" as its written "Your rod and Your staff, they shall comfort me." in Psalms. The sages didn't think highly of vegetables and I think of them kind of like people that you meet that you have to uplift with your hands by pushing and pulling closer or by boiling in words of Torah (no one wants to lift a hand like that when we are meditating on Torah) ​ דְּשָׁאִים אוֹמְרִים. יְהִי כְבוֹד יי לְעוֹלָם יִשְׂמַח יי בְּמַעֲשָׂיו: (תהילים קד לא) The Herbages are Singing: May the glory of HaShem be forever. May HaShem rejoice in His deeds. ​ If one wants to be considered a people (have many children), he has to be humble and lowly like herbage, as the Song of the Fly is "Indeed, the people is herbage/a meadow. ​ S/he also needs to rejoice in the beauty of creation. Like Rabbi Avigdor Miller says, just to perceive thoughts, sounds, or colors is such an unimaginable delight. The Mishnah teaches anything that grows from or is attached to (like a perforated or clay pot) the ground is not susceptive to ritual impurity (due to the neural networking of the plant kingdom). Therefore even if you are small and weak like withering grass and flowers, you are not susceptive to impurity and you have your "eyes on the prize", that is eternal life and good for you! ​ ד׳ תַּרְנְגוֹל אוֹמֵר. בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁבָּא הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא אֵצֶל הַצַּדִּיקִים בְּגַן עֵדֶן, זוֹלְפִים כֹּל אִילָנֵי גַּן עֵדֶן בְּשָׂמִים, וּמְרַנְּנִים וּמְשַׁבְּחִים, וְאָז גַּם הוּא מִתְעוֹרֵר וּמְשַׁבֵּחַ: The Rooster is saying: In the hour that comes HKBH' beside the righteous ones in Gan Ayden, all of the trees of Gan Ayden apread their incense, and He too is aroused and gets bright, and then also He arouses Himself and praises. ​ See that righteous one's, Tzadikkim, are associated with Aylonim, that are usually used to describe larger trees like oaks, as in the Prophecy "Choshen CeAylon" "Strong/Rich like the oak". However Rambam says in Hilchoth Kilayim that roses in a vineyard "are like other Aylonim". Roses can get massive and even more vicious for the wood chopper than redwoods. At a point if one does not have a large machine, the only way to deal with a huge rose bush is controlled burning. That's why HaShem appeared in the Sineh, thorny rosebush, like Shayne Hey, the teeth/strength of HaShem. Anyway this goes back to my novelty that we should only be planting native fruits and righteous convert fruits that will be vigorous growers without watering and be like Aylonim. ​ See that also a person on the level of HaShem, as a complete bull blood extension of Him as His servant 24/7/365 fulfill the verse Psalms 121:5 יְהֹוָ֥ה שֹׁמְרֶ֑ךָ יְהֹוָ֥ה צִ֝לְּךָ֗ עַל־יַ֥ד יְמִינֶֽךָ׃ The L rd is your Keeper. The L rd is your shade on your right hand. in that we treat people how they treat us. If someone does not swoon and pour speech out to me for rinsing(s) and only gives me a curse then I just plow them too. If they bless me then I fulfill the Proverb "Do not withhold good from one who deserves it" and bless them too. בְּקוֹל רִאשׁוֹן אוֹמֵר. זֶה דּוֹר דֹּרְשָׁו מְבַקְשֵׁי פָנֶיךָ יַעֲקֹב סֶלָה: שְׂאוּ שְׁעָרִים רָאשֵׁיכֶם וְהִנָּשְׂאוּ פִּתְחֵי עוֹלָם וְיָבוֹא מֶלֶךְ הַכָּבוֹד: מִי זֶה מֶלֶךְ הַכָּבוֹד יי עִזּוּז וְגִבּוֹר יי גִּבּוֹר מִלְחָמָה: (תהילים כד ז-ח) ​ In its first call it says: This is the generation that seeks to request Your face(,) Yaakov forever! Open the gates of your heads/the heads of your gates and enter in the opening of Eternity will come the King of Glory. Who is this King of Clord? HaShem strong and mighty, HaShem, mighty in war. ​ As I have said before the rooster is suggesting to lift the gates on one's mind since people are stealing your thoughts all the time anyways with modern technology, but put a 1 minute filter for your "Eishim", your branches/masters (even if they are "hiding behind a fence" in the words of the Mishnah on how to catch a seducer to idolatry and you don't know about them) to filter them for you depending on the person. Then HaShem will enter when the world is filled with thoughts of Torah!! בְּקוֹל שֵׁנִי אוֹמֵר. שְׂאוּ שְׁעָרִים רָאשֵׁיכֶם וּשְׂאוּ פִּתְחֵי עוֹלָם וְיָבֹא מֶלֶךְ הַכָּבוֹד: מִי הוּא זֶה מֶלֶךְ הַכָּבוֹד יי צְבָאוֹת הוּא מֶלֶךְ הַכָּבוֹד סֶלָה: (תהילים כד ט-י) This is a repetition, a Mishneh, the main subject of the Rooster ​ בְּקוֹל שְׁלִישִׁי אוֹמֵר עִמְדוּ צַדִּיקִים וְעִסְקוּ בַּתּוֹרָה, כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּהְיֶה שְׂכַרְכֶם כָּפוּל לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא: In its third call it sings: Stand, righteous ones, and involve yourselves in Torah so that your reward will be doubled in the World to Come ​ This is a warning to the Tzadikim not to love sleeping in and taking naps but rather to "banish sleep from their eyes to study Torah" in the words of Rashi, to enjoy more perception and a higher reward. בְּקוֹל רְבִיעִי אוֹמֵר. לִישׁוּעָתְךָ קִוִּיתִי יי: (בראשית מט יח) 4th call: To Your Salvation I have hoped/collected HaShem ​ This is the point when a person needs to get out of bed or he/she will start being punished with at least evil speech. ​ In another face, until you are redeemed and have your AI robot assistant doing everything for you, you need to be collecting HaShem. As in doing Kiruv and uplifting the fallen sparks of holiness in the wicked and in betweeners. בְּקוֹל חֲמִישִׁי אוֹמֵר. עַד מָתַי עָצֵל תִּשְׁכָּב מָתַי תָּקוּם מִשְּׁנָתֶךָ: (משלי ו ט) בְּקוֹל שִׁישִּׁי אוֹמֵר. אַל תֶּאֱהַב שֵׁנָה פֶּן תִּוָּרֵשׁ פְּקַח עֵינֶיךָ שְׂבַע לָחֶם: (משלי כ יג) I have commented a lot on this but to add, when you go on your daily excursion during the week to uplift your people so you don't get sent to a psych ward H'F', before you start plowing new vessels, uplift 7 people within rinsing range (7-8 depending on if they're in your eye) ​ ​ בְּקוֹל שְׁבִיעִי אוֹמֵר. עֵת לַעֲשׂוֹת לַיי הֵפֵרוּ תּוֹרָתֶךָ: (תהילים קיט קכו) ​ תַּרְנְגֹלֶת אוֹמֶרֶת. נֹתֵן לֶחֶם לְכָל בָּשָׂר כִּי לְעוֹלָם חַסְדּוֹ: (תהילים קלו כה) The chicken is saying He gives bread to all flesh, indeed forever is His Kindness. ​ Or Natan will make bread of all flesh ​ In the first face, chickens are extremely defenseless and a huge expression of kindness as they don't require as much food as a mammal but produce tons of eggs and also other chickens for food. They are the perfect starter animal for a starter homestead. ​ In the second face, I have been reading in my Peterson's field guide (when I use the restroom according to the advice of Rambam to not focus on Torah) that many trees, for example the spruce, can be ground into flour and made into bread like the fig tree. Therefore as we perfect science we need to make trees completely edible with no peel or pit. Edible as in be able to be made into flour and the leaves used for salads. ​ יוֹנָה אוֹמֶרֶת. כְּסוּס עָגוּר כֵּן אֲצַפְצֵף אֶהְגֶּה כַּיּוֹנָה דַּלּוּ עֵינַי לַמָּרוֹם אֲדֹנָי עָשְׁקָה לִּי עָרְבֵנִי: (ישעיה לח יד) אוֹמֶרֶת יוֹנָה לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלַם, יִהְיוּ מְזוֹנוֹתַי מְרוֹרִים כְּזַיִת בְּיָדְךָ, וְאַל יִהְיוּ מְתוּקִים כִּדְבַשׁ, עַל יְדֵי בָּשָׂר וָדָם: נֶשֶׁר אוֹמֵר. וְאַתָּה יי אֱלֹהִים צְבָאוֹת אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל הָקִיצָה לִפְקֹד כָּל הַגּוֹיִם אַל תָּחֹן כָּל בֹּגְדֵי אָוֶן סֶלָה: (תהילים נט ו) עָגוּר אוֹמֵר. הוֹדוּ לַיי בְּכִנּוֹר בְּנֵבֶל עָשׂוֹר זַמְּרוּ לוֹ: (תהילים לג ב) צִפּוֹר אוֹמֵר. גַּם צִפּוֹר מָצְאָה בַיִת וּדְרוֹר קֵן לָהּ אֲשֶׁר שָׁתָה אֶפְרֹחֶיהָ אֶת מִזְבְּחוֹתֶיךָ יי צְבָאוֹת מַלְכִּי וֵאלֹהָי: (תהילים פד ד) סְנוּנִית אוֹמֶרֶת. לְמַעַן יְזַמֶּרְךָ כָבוֹד וְלֹא יִדֹּם יי אֱלֹהַי לְעוֹלָם אוֹדֶךָּ: (תהילים ל יג) טַסִּית אוֹמֶרֶת. עֶזְרִי מֵעִם יי עֹשֵׂה שָׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ: (תהילים קכא ב) צִיָּה אוֹמֶרֶת. אוֹר זָרֻעַ לַצַּדִּיק וּלְיִשְׁרֵי לֵב שִׂמְחָה: (תהילים צז יב) רְצִפִי אוֹמֵר. נַחֲמוּ נַחֲמוּ עַמִּי יֹאמַר אֱלֹהֵיכֶם: (ישעיה מ א) חֲסִידָה אוֹמֶרֶת. דַּבְּרוּ עַל לֵב יְרוּשָׁלִַם וְקִרְאוּ אֵלֶיהָ כִּי מָלְאָה צְבָאָהּ כִּי נִרְצָה עֲוֹנָהּ כִּי לָקְחָה מִיַּד יי כִּפְלַיִם בְּכָל חַטֹּאתֶיהָ: (ישעיה מ ב) עוֹרֵב אוֹמֵר. מִי יָכִין לָעֹרֵב צֵידוֹ כִּי יְלָדָיו אֶל אֵל יְשַׁוֵּעוּ: (איוב לח מא) זַרְזִיר אוֹמֵר: נוֹדַע בַּגּוֹיִם זַרְעָם וְצֶאֱצָאֵיהֶם בְּתוֹךְ הָעַמִּים כָּל רֹאֵיהֶם יַכִּירוּם כִּי הֵם זֶרַע בֵּרַךְ יי: (ישעיה סא ט) אֲוַז שֶׁבַּבַּיִת אוֹמֶרֶת. הוֹדוּ לַיי קִרְאוּ בִשְׁמוֹ הוֹדִיעוּ בָעַמִּים עֲלִילוֹתָיו: שִׁירוּ לוֹ זַמְּרוּ לוֹ שִׂיחוּ בְּכָל נִפְלְאוֹתָיו: (תהילים קה א-ב) אֲוַז הַבָּר הַמְּשׁוֹטֶטֶת בַּמִּדְבָּר. כְּשֶׁרוֹאֵה אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל עוֹסְקִים בַּתּוֹרָה אוֹמֶרֶת. קוֹל קוֹרֵא בַּמִּדְבָּר, פָּנוּ דֶּרֶךְ יי, יַשְׁרוּ בַּעֲרָבָה מְסִלָּה לֶאֱלֹהֵינוּ, וְעַל מְצִיאוּת מְזוֹנוֹתֶיהָ בַּמִּדְבָּר אוֹמֶרֶת. אָרוּר הַגֶּבֶר אַשֵּׁר יִבְטַח בָּאָדָם, בָּרוּךְ הַגֶּבֶר אֲשֶׁר יִבְטַח בְּיי וְהָיָה יי מִבְטָחוֹ: פְרוֹגִיוֹת אוֹמְרִים. בִּטְחוּ בַיי עֲדֵי עַד כִּי בְּיָהּ יי צוּר עוֹלָמִים: (ישעיה כו ד) רַחֲמָהּ אוֹמֶרֶת. אֶשְׁרְקָה לָהֶם וַאֲקַבְּצֵם כִּי פְדִיתִים וְרָבוּ כְּמוֹ רָבוּ: (זכריה י ח) צִפֹּרֶת כְּרָמִים אוֹמֶרֶת. אֶשָּׂא עֵינַי אֵל הֶהָרִים מֵאַיִן יָבֹא עֶזְרִי: (תהילים קכא א) חָסִיל אוֹמֵר. יי אֱלֹהַי אַתָּה אֲרוֹמִמְךָ אוֹדֶה שִׁמְךָ כִּי עָשִׂיתָ פֶּלֶא עֵצוֹת מֵרָחוֹק אֱמוּנָה אֹמֶן: (ישעיה כה א) שְׂמָמִית אוֹמֶרֶת. הַלְלוּהוּ בְצִלְצְלֵי שָׁמַע הַלְלוּהוּ בְּצִלְצְלֵי תְרוּעָה: (תהילים קנ ה) זְבוּב אוֹמֵר. בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁאֵין יִשְׂרָאֵל עוֹסְקִים בַּתּוֹרָה, קוֹל אֹמֵר קְרָא וְאָמַר מָה אֶקְרָא כָּל הַבָּשָׂר חָצִיר וְכָל חַסְדּוֹ כְּצִיץ הַשָּׂדֶה: יָבֵשׁ חָצִיר נָבֵל צִיץ כִּי רוּחַ יי נָשְׁבָה בּוֹ אָכֵן חָצִיר הָעָם: יָבֵשׁ חָצִיר נָבֵל צִיץ וּדְבַר אֱלֹהֵינוּ יָקוּם לְעוֹלָם: (ישעיה מ ו-ח) בּוֹרֵא נִיב שְׂפָתָיִם שָׁלוֹם שָׁלוֹם לָרָחוֹק וְלַקָּרוֹב אָמַר יי וּרְפָאתִיו: (ישעיה נז יט) תַּנִּינִים אוֹמְרִים. הַלְלוּ אֶת יי מִן הָאָרֶץ תַּנִּינִים וְכָל תְּהֹמוֹת: (תהילים קמח ז) לִוְיָתַן אוֹמֵר. הוֹדוּ לַיי כִּי טוֹב כִּי לְעוֹלָם חַסְדּוֹ: (תהילים קלו א) דָּגִים אוֹמְרִים. קוֹל יי עַל הַמָּיִם אֵל הַכָּבוֹד הִרְעִים יי עַל מַיִם רַבִּים: (תהילים כט ג) צְפַרְדֵּעַ אוֹמֶרֶת. בָּרוּךְ שֵׁם כְּבוֹד מַלְכוּתוֹ לְעוֹלַם וָעֶד: ה׳ בְּהֵמָה דַּקָּה טְהוֹרָה אוֹמֶרֶת. מִי כָמֹכָה בָּאֵלִם יי מִי כָּמֹכָה נֶאְדָּר בַּקֹּדֶשׁ נוֹרָא תְהִלֹּת עֹשֵׂה פֶלֶא: (שמות טו יא) בְּהֵמָה גַּסָּה טְהוֹרָה אוֹמֶרֶת. הַרְנִינוּ לֵאלֹהִים עוּזֵּנוּ הָרִיעוּ לֵאלֹהֵי יַעֲקֹב: (תהילים פא ב) בְּהֵמָה דַּקָּה טְמֵאָה אוֹמֶרֶת. הֵיטִיבָה יְיָ לַטּוֹבִים וְלִישָׁרִים בְּלִבּוֹתָם: (תהילים קכה ד) בְּהֵמָה גַּסָּה טְמֵאָה אוֹמֶרֶת. יְגִיעַ כַּפֶּיךָ כִּי תֹאכֵל אַשְׁרֶיךָ וְטוֹב לָךְ: (תהילים קכח ב) גַּמַּל אוֹמֵר. יי מִמָּרוֹם יִשְׁאָג וּמִמְּעוֹן קָדְשׁוֹ יִתֵּן קוֹלוֹ שָׁאֹג יִשְׁאַג עַל נָוֵהוּ: (ירמיה כה ל) סוּס אוֹמֵר. הִנֵּה כְעֵינֵי עֲבָדִים אֶל יַד אֲדוֹנֵיהֶם כְּעֵינֵי שִׁפְחָה אֶל יַד גְּבִרְתָּהּ כֵּן עֵינֵינוּ אֶל יי אֱלֹהֵינוּ עַד שֶׁיְּחָנֵּנוּ: (תהילים קכג ב) פֶּרֶד אוֹמֵר. יוֹדוּךָ יְיָ כָּל מַלְכֵי אָרֶץ כִּי שָׁמְעוּ אִמְרֵי פִיךָ: (תהילים קלח ד) חֲמוֹר אוֹמֵר. לְךָ יְיָ הַגְּדֻלָּה וְהַגְּבוּרָה וְהַתִּפְאֶרֶת וְהַנֵּצַח וְהַהוֹד כִּי כֹל בַּשָּׁמַיִם וּבָאָרֶץ לְךָ יְיָ הַמַּמְלָכָה וְהַמִּתְנַשֵּׂא לְכֹל לְרֹאשׁ: (דברי הימים א' כט יא) שׁוֹר אוֹמֵר. אָז יָשִׁיר משֶׁה וּבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶת הַשִּׁירָה הַזֹּאת לַיי וַיֹּאמְרוּ לֵאמֹר אָשִׁירָה לַּיְיָ כִּי גָאֹה גָּאָה סוּס וְרֹכְבוֹ רָמָה בַיָּם: (שמות טו א) חַיּוֹת הַשָּׂדֶה אוֹמְרִים. בָּרוּךְ הַטּוֹב וְהַמֵּטִיב: צְבִי אוֹמֵר. וַאֲנִי אָשִׁיר עֻזֶּךָ וַאֲרַנֵּן לַבֹּקֶר חַסְדֶּךָ כִּי הָיִיתָ מִשְׂגָּב לִי וּמָנוֹס בְּיוֹם צַר לִי: (תהילים נט יז) פִּיל אוֹמֵר. מַה גָּדְלוּ מַעֲשֶׂיךָ יְיָ מְאֹד עָמְקוּ מַחְשְׁבֹתֶיךָ: (תהילים צב ו) אַרְיֵה אוֹמֵר יְיָ כַּגִּבּוֹר יֵצֵא כְּאִישׁ מִלְחָמוֹת יָעִיר קִנְאָה יָרִיעַ אַף יַצְרִיחַ עַל אֹיְבָיו יִתְגַּבָּר: (ישעיה מב יג) דֹּב אוֹמֵר יִשְׂאוּ מִדְבָּר וְעָרָיו חֲצֵרִים תֵּשֵׁב קֵדָר יָרֹנּוּ ישְׁבֵי סֶלַע מֵרֹאשׁ הָרִים יִצְוָחוּ: (ישעיה מב יא) זְאֵב אוֹמֵר. עַל כָּל דְּבַר פֶּשַׁע עַל שׁוֹר עַל חֲמוֹר עַל שֶׂה עַל שַׂלְמָה עַל כָּל אֲבֵדָה אֲשֶׁר יֹאמַר כִּי הוּא זֶה עַד הָאֱלֹהִים יָבֹא דְּבַר שְׁנֵיהֶם אֲשֶׁר יַרְשִׁיעֻן אֱלֹהִים יְשַׁלֵּם שְׁנַיִם לְרֵעֵהוּ: (שמות כב ח) שׁוּעַל אוֹמֵר. הוֹי בֹּנֶה בֵיתוֹ בְּלֹא צֶדֶק וַעֲלִיּוֹתָיו בְּלֹא מִשְׁפָּט בְּרֵעֵהוּ יַעֲבֹד חִנָּם וּפֹעֲלוֹ לֹא יִתֶּן לוֹ: (ירמיה כב יג) זַרְזִיר אוֹמֵר. רַנְּנוּ צַדִּיקִים בַּיְיָ לַיְשָׁרִים נָאוָה תְהִלָּה: (תהילים לג א) עַכְבָּר אוֹמֵר. אֲרוֹמִמְךָ יְיָ כִּי דִלִּיתָנִי וְלֹא־שִׂמַּחְתָּ אֹיְבַי לִי׃ (תהלים ל ב) חָתוּל אוֹמֵר. אִם־תַּגְבִּיהַּ כַּנֶּשֶׁר וְאִם־בֵּין כּֽוֹכָבִים שִׂים קִנֶּךָ מִשָּׁם אוֹרִֽידְךָ נְאֻם־יְיָ׃ (עובדיה א ד) וּכְשֶׁמַגִיעוֹ אוֹמֵר. אֶרְדּוֹף אוֹיְבַי וְאַשִּׂיגֵם וְלֹא־אָשׁוּב עַד־כַּלּוֹתָם׃ (תהלים יח לח) וְעַכְבָּר אוֹמֵר. וְאַתָּה צַדִּיק עַל כׇּל־הַבָּא עָלַי כִּי־אֱמֶת עָשִׂיתָ וַאֲנִי הִרְשָֽׁעְתִּי׃ (ע"פ נחמיה ט לג) ו׳ שְׁרָצִים אוֹמְרִים. יִשְׂמַח יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּעֹשָׂיו בְּנֵי צִיּוֹן יָגִילוּ בְמַלְכָּם: (תהילים קמט ב) אֵלִים שֶׁבַּשְּׁרָצִים אוֹמְרִים. אֶשְׁתְּךָ כְּגֶפֶן פֹּרִיָּה בְּיַרְכְּתֵי בֵיתֶךָ בָּנֶיךָ כִּשְׁתִלֵי זֵיתִים סָבִיב לְשֻׁלְחָנֶךָ: (תהילים קכח ג) נָחָשׁ אוֹמֵר. סוֹמֵךְ יְיָ לְכָל הַנֹּפְלִים וְזוֹקֵף לְכָל הַכְּפוּפִים: (תהילים קמה טו) עַקְרַב אוֹמֵר. טוֹב יְיָ לַכֹּל וְרַחֲמָיו עַל כָּל מַעֲשָׂיו: (תהילים קמה ט) שַׁבְּלוּל אוֹמֵר. כְּמוֹ שַׁבְּלוּל תֶּמֶס יַהֲלֹךְ נֵפֶל אֵשֶׁת בַּל חָזוּ שָׁמֶשׁ: (תהילים נח ט) נְמָלָה אוֹמֶרֶת. לֵךְ אֶל נְמָלָה עָצֵל רְאֵה דְרָכֶיהָ וַחֲכָם: (ספר משלי ו ו) חֻלְדָּה אוֹמֶרֶת. כֹּל הַנְּשָׁמָה תְּהַלֵּל יָהּ הַלְלוּיָהּ. (תהילים קנ ו) כְּלָבִים אוֹמְרִים. בֹּאוּ נִשְׁתַּחֲוֶה וְנִכְרָעָה נִבְרְכָה לִפְנֵי יְיָ עֹשֵׂנוּ: (תהילים צה ו) (ילקוט שמעוני פרשת בא רמז קפז) רַבִּי יְשַׁעְיָה תַּלְמִידוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן דּוֹסָא הִתְעַנָּה חָמֵשׁ וּשְׁמוֹנִים תַּעֲנִיּוֹת. אָמַר כְּלָבִים שֶׁכָּתוּב בָּהֶם (ישעיה נו יא) וְהַכְּלָבִים עַזֵּי נֶפֶשׁ לֹא יָדְעוּ שָׂבְעָה, יִזְכּוּ לוֹמַר שִׁירָה. עָנָה לוֹ מַלְאָךְ מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם וְאָמַר לוֹ יְשַעְיָה עַד מָתַי אַתָּה מִתְעַנֶּה עַל זֶה הַדָּבָר. שְׁבוּעָה הִיא מִלִּפְנֵי הַמָּקוֹם בָּרוּךְ הוּא מִיּוֹם שֶׁגִּילָּה סוֹדוֹ לַחֲבַקּוּק הַנָּבִיא לֹא גִלָּה דָבָר זֶה לְשׁוּם בְּרִיאָה בָּעוֹלָם. אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִיל שֶׁתַּלְמִידוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם גָּדוֹל אַתָּה שְׁלָחוּנִי מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם לִזְדַקֵּק אֵלֶיךָ לְהַגִיד לְךָ בַּמֶה זָכוּ הַכְּלָבִים לוֹמַר שִׁירָה. לְפִי שֶׁכָּתוּב בָּהֶם (שמות יא ז) וּלְכֹל בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לֹא יֶחֱרַץ כֶּלֶב לְשׁוֹנוֹ. וְלֹא עוֹד אֶלָּא שֶׁזָכוּ לְעַבֵּד עוֹרוֹת מִצּוֹאָתָם שֶׁכּוֹתְבִים בָּהֶם תְּפִילִּין וּמְזוּזוֹת וְסִפְרֵי תּוֹרָה. עַל כֵּן זָכוּ לוֹמַר שִׁירָה. וּלְעִנְיַן הַשְׁאֵלָה שֶּׁשָּׁאַלְתָּ חֲזוֹר לַאֲחֹרֶיךָ וְאַל תּוֹסִיף בַּדָּבָר הַזֶּה עוֹד, כְּמוֹ שֶׁכָּתוּב (משלי כא כג) שׁוֹמֵר פִּיו וּלְשׁוֹנוֹ שׁוֹמֵר מִצָּרוֹת נַפְשׁוֹ. בָּרוּךְ יְיָ לְעוֹלָם אָמֵן וְאָמֵן׃ תפילה לאחר פרק שירה בַּקָּשָׁה לְאַחַר אֲמִירַת פֶּרֶק שִׁירָה רִבּוֹן כֹּל הָעוֹלָמִים, יְהִי רָצוֹן מִלְּפָנֶיךָ יי אֱלֹהַי וֶאֱלֹהֵי אֲבוֹתַי, שֶׁבִּזְכוּת "פֶּרֶק שִׁירָה שֶׁקָּרָאתִי, שֶׁהוּא שִׁירַת הַדּוֹמֵם הַצּוֹמֵחַ וְהַחַי, וְהַמַּלְאָכִים הַמְּמֻנִּים עֲלֵיהֶם מֵאֵת ד' יִתְבָּרֵךְ, שֶׁתְּהֵא אֲמִירָתוֹ כְּהַקְרָבַת קָרְבָּן עַל גַּבֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ. שֶׁתְּהֵא שָׁעָה זוּ שְׁעַת רַחֲמִים, שְׁעַת הַקְשָׁבָה, שְׁעַת הַאֲזָנָה, וְנִקְרָאֲךָ וּתְעַנִּינוּ, נַעְתִּיר לְךָ וְהֵעָתֵר לָנוּ. שֶׁתִּהְיֶה עוֹלָה לְפָנֶיךָ אֲמִירַת פֶּרֶק שִׁירָה כְּאִלּוּ הִשַּׂגְנוּ כֹּל הַסּוֹדוֹת הַנִּפְלָאוֹת וְהַנּוֹרָאוֹת אֲשֶׁר הֵם חֲתוּמִים בּוֹ בְּכֹל תְּנָאָיו. הַחְזִירֵנוּ בִּתְשׁוּבָה שְׁלֵמָה לְפָנֶיךָ, וְנִזְכֶּה לְמָקוֹם שֶׁהַנְּפָשׁוֹת הָרוּחוֹת וְהַנְשָׁמוֹת נֶחְצָבוֹת מִשַּׁם, וּכְאִלּוּ עָשִׂינוּ כֹּל אַשֵּׁר מוּטָל עָלֵינוּ לְהַשִּׂיג, בֵּין בְּגִלְגּוּל זֶה בֵּין בְּגִלְגּוּלִים אֲחֵרִים, וּמַלֵּא כֹּל מִשְׁאֲלוֹת לִבֵּנוּ לְטוֹבָה (כָּאן יוֹסִיף בִּפְרָטִיּוּת מַה שֶׁנִּצְרַךְ) וְתִשְׁלַח בְּרָכָה הַצְלָחָה וְהַרְוָחָה בְּכֹל מֵעֲשֵׂה יָדֵינוּ, וְנִזְכֶּה לְשׁוֹרֵר לַעֲתִיד לָבוֹא, וְתַשִּׁיב שְׁכִינָתְךָ לְעִיר קָדְשְׁךָ בִּמְהֵרָה בְּיָמֵינוּ אָמֵן. "The Rock (salts)! [Be flavorful in/] Perfect is His works!" Being a Rabbi is like being a chef and deciding on Halachoth is like cooking food. Salt is the key ingredient as it brings the natural flavor out of foods. If you use too much the food gets bitter and too little, bland. Therefore when deciding on Halachoth and coming at a crossroads, one should choose the most tasteful route. ​​ ' ​ In the summer of '16 when I was in college, I spent it on Nantucket (a very very rich) island at a chef's house. He told me simple advice: "The key to cooking is improving the taste of food" ​ His son showed me in our dorm building that you can chef up regular things like tuna fish by putting it on an electric griddle with butter and seasonings and toasting bread in butter on it to make simple "peasant" foods very good. Another example would be adding a lightly boiled egg and parmesan and fresh dill (Daiy Ayl - God is Sufficient) from the garden (even if you just have a pot and a 15 dollar plant light) to ramen ​ --- ​ Recently a young man in Tzfat called me a dog for defending collared shirts and after thinking about it, I think the collar is to protect one's collarbone. A person's collarbone never smells like body odor. I think EzekiEl 13:18 is talking about how nowadays all shirts have sleeves that traps the armpit gasses whereas in Biblical times, people would wear large 4 cornered garments so that their "sides" could breathe. ​ -- ​ You should know everyone mowing all the time to do evil Kabbalah and even if you're mowing to cut down the wicked, this is treacherous to our Foundation, the environment, as it increases the temperature and allows for less rainfall. Here is ChatGPT on the matter: ​ 🔥 How Excessive Mowing Adds to Heat Less Shade and Cooling Taller grass shades the soil and retains more moisture. Short, frequently mowed grass exposes bare soil to the sun, increasing surface temperatures. Reduced Evapotranspiration Plants (including grasses) cool the air by releasing water vapor (evapotranspiration). Mowing cuts off the blades that drive this cooling process, reducing local humidity and rainfall potential. Soil Degradation Constant mowing compacts soil and reduces organic matter, making it less able to hold water. Drier soil heats up more and reflects more solar radiation. 🌧️ Impact on Rain and Moisture Evapotranspiration plays a big role in triggering cloud formation and rainfall, especially in summer. When lawns and fields are mowed too short, that cycle weakens. With less moisture going back into the air, there's less fuel for local rainstorms. 🏙️ Urban Heat Islands (UHIs) In cities and suburbs, lots of pavement + short, dry lawns = a heat-retaining combo. Natural areas with taller grasses, shrubs, and trees stay cooler and more humid. ✅ What Helps? Letting grass grow taller (3–4 inches) cools the yard and retains moisture. Planting native grasses or meadows instead of traditional turf can reduce mowing and support rain cycles. Using mulching mowers and skipping cuts during drought helps soil health. ​ Another idea on left handed people ruling over the whole world since we have a "staff in our (left) hand" -Mishnah Avodah Zarah ​ For motor control tasks (not thinking according to ChatGPT), the brain is crossed in that the right brain controls the left side and vice versa. This is probably why I was athletic growing up and a good fighter and now why I have the "Yad-Shadaiy", the Almighty Hand when it comes to she-bear cursing warfare. ​ Why is the lion the king of the beasts when its much smaller than elephants and in the west, bears? ​ I was wondering how tough my cat was last week and when I was walking out of my room she slipped in front of me and positioned her body to catch in between my toes. Basically letting me know how dexterous she is and that she could "snipe" me any time by slashing my neck with her claw H'S'U'. Therefore its really the "sling" aspect of the lion, in that it hides from the tall grass and can take an elephant's or bear's neck out by surprise. Maybe we could say a large eagle could do the same but I doubt their talons and body are big enough to kill an elephant or large bear, and chatGPT agrees. ​ Actually it says that lions could only kill smaller elephants and that large elephants would easily kill any lion and only suffer damage from being crouched upon. Maybe this is why elephants are called Peel, like Pele, a name of Mashiach, Pele Yoaytz, Wondrous Counsel, since nothing is taking us down ​ YeshaYaHu/Isaiah 40:15-17 ​ הֵ֤ן גּוֹיִם֙ כְּמַ֣ר מִדְּלִ֔י וּכְשַׁ֥חַק מֹאזְנַ֖יִם נֶחְשָׁ֑בוּ הֵ֥ן אִיִּ֖ים כַּדַּ֥ק יִטּֽוֹל׃ The nations are but a drop in a bucket, Reckoned as dust on a balance; The very coastlands are lifted like motes. ​ וּלְבָנ֕וֹן אֵ֥ין דֵּ֖י בָּעֵ֑ר וְחַ֨יָּת֔וֹ אֵ֥ין דֵּ֖י עוֹלָֽה׃ {פ} Lebanon is not fuel enough, Nor its beasts enough for sacrifice. ​ כׇּל־הַגּוֹיִ֖ם כְּאַ֣יִן נֶגְדּ֑וֹ מֵאֶ֥פֶס וָתֹ֖הוּ נֶחְשְׁבוּ־לֽוֹ׃ All nations are as naught in God’s sight, Who accounts them as less than nothing. ​This is talking about idolatrous nations as HaShem, Israel, and the Torah are all One according to the Zohar. The message is to leave acting like the satin to the children of Esav, the grass, since they also come from the vine, Yitzhak and Avraham and can be sweet whereas for black people, black fruits, they already come from a "horrible/fearsome/but beautiful culture (MRH) and no one wants their vinegar as its written "The Caananite was Gibor (mighty) in the land" ​ People steroided out and acting high handed are only good as "cleaning vinegar", that is to act as a dark water pupper(t) master and send at your enemies. Otherwise they wither under your sight and "fall on you" H'S'U'. I have noticed that the smaller people are much more modest and stick it out with me much better. Like herding sheep as opposed to wild donkeys ​ No one wants cricket meat, if we have to taste a person spiritually who is fallen let it be bacon, the head of the "other side" ​ If you already did steroids do not fear as once you repent HaShem will send His Earthly Physicians to send their drones to stabilize your heart and hormones etc. The second song of the Fly: בּוֹרֵא נִיב שְׂפָתָיִם שָׁלוֹם שָׁלוֹם לָרָחוֹק וְלַקָּרוֹב אָמַר יי וּרְפָאתִיו: (ישעיה נז יט) ‘“I will create a new expression of the lips; Peace, peace for him who is far off and for him who is near, says YHVH; and I will heal him .’” ​ I think I already said this on TMC but just like the Gemara repeats important things because its so large and not everyone studies the whole thing, we are at around 750 pages in standard essay format and well over 1000 for regular small sized books ​ -- ​ The text box is filled but when I said at the beginning that the Tree of Life is the grape vine and your wife, supporting examples are that the man has to agree to the woman that he will provide food, shelter, clothing, and marital relations at least once a week (if his occupation allows), whereas the woman is basically a queen and just should not withhold sex for over a week if her husband desires it. Another example is when HaShem separated Chayyah from Adam's side (they were siamese twins -Ohr HaChaim), He said he created her to help him or to oppose him. Rashi says help if he is worthy and oppose if he is worthy of that. Therefore she is essentially a primary extension of the Torah!! Just like much wine was and will be necessary for the Temple offerings whereas figs were only offered once a year as acceptable gifts to the priests during the Bikkurim (First Fruits) service. ​ Yet if you visit Israel, you will see that figs are by far the most valuable trees as they support the poor and desolate with a ton of fruit and shade, and are just "like an apple" but even juicer (in their native region). I think the corresponding native fig in America is the persimmon and for the apple its the plum. ​ I think the apple is the Parable for the satin as they are sun colored and everyone loves them over plums and persimmons for some reason (just like reality) despite them being non natives. Proof is that Tapuchoth, abominations, is similar to Tapuach, apple. Also although the satin is here and revealed to everyone I've ever seen (I think), as the Verse says "Is there no rock I do not know" Rashi says only HaShem inspires the other gods to do harm. So the satin and his son are like men on the level of Adam but high in Torah. They can also be parables for actual men on the level of Adam among the nations since they live completely within the Satin and most are unaware and are going about their business like the movie the Truman Show. Apples are not an Israeli fruit and do not get a special after-blessing like figs, dates, poms, grapes etc. ​ Since Ohr HaChaim says that the snake gave Eve the arguement that all the other trees of the Garden (Earth) were sister trees/suckers and extensions of the fig tree, she had already eaten from it, we can apply all of the other trees in Perek Shira as commentaries on the fig tree. ​ ​The Song of the Fig is written third after the Trees of the Field and the Grape. This is signifying that people that live in the West, the "plowed field" are the greatest "trees", followed by an "Ayshet Chayil", a woman of valor, a wife that treats you "good all of your days and not evil", followed by people that are on the level of Mashiach, the figs. Also Rashi says the fig tree is the portal between the higher and lower world at the beginning of Bereisheth. Therefore if you have an extra 15 bucks I recommend getting a bonsai fig tree on Etsy to put your hand out of your Shabbath domain to the poor idolators who will take from your hand and bless you with the Upper Worlds on its behalf. -- שָּׁרֹ֔ון Rose Another proof of Sineh, as in the Flaming Thornbush, being the Shein Hey, the teeth, the strength, of HaShem. Interpret it as Shaar Oan, the gate of strength. When It says "And the bush was not consumed", this is alluding to the fact that although we want to burn roses because of their thorns, they have a portion of The World to Come since they produce sweet hips. The one's near me taste like cherries. -- I once read the Halacha maybe it was Rambam based on the verse at the top that one should teach Torah with one's right hand. There are some Mitzvoth we do with the right hand that even lefties do with the right. Here is an example about the lulav and holding food while reciting Berachoth. This is another reason why a lefty should rule over the world and strengthen his right so that either one can become the dominant hand depending on what you're "drinking". I decided its definitely not food to designate the left and right as right and left for lefties working on their right during Shabbath. If you're a righty it still is a good idea to exercise your left however don't be doing it just as greed for Our Horse (our Malchut, Kingdom)!! Do it to rule over the kingdom of evil and be able to use either hand whenever you want for disgusting tasks and also for food and some Mitzvoth. I hold food in my right unless I need my left or my right gets tired. Actually since this is so I am probably obligated to do disgusting tasks with my left, however I can designate the Sefiroth in either hand at any point in time.. -- Tamuz 3 Psalms 147:17-18 מַשְׁלִ֣יךְ קַֽרְח֣וֹ כְפִתִּ֑ים לִפְנֵ֥י קָ֝רָת֗וֹ מִ֣י יַעֲמֹֽד׃ He tosses down hail like crumbs— who can endure His icy cold? ​ יִשְׁלַ֣ח דְּבָר֣וֹ וְיַמְסֵ֑ם יַשֵּׁ֥ב ר֝וּח֗וֹ יִזְּלוּ־מָֽיִם׃ He issues a command—it melts them; He breathes—the waters flow. ​ Yadayim 1:3 הַמַּיִם שֶׁנִּפְסְלוּ מִשְּׁתִיַּת הַבְּהֵמָה, בְּכֵלִים, פְּסוּלִים. וּבְקַרְקָעוֹת, כְּשֵׁרִים. Water that became valid to drink for the animal, in vessels, invalid. In groundwaters, valid. ​ See another proof that "His wrath lasts but a moment" so when you hear a decree that even the animals, angels, and coarse regular flower people can't handle, wait for the water to flow on the next Face of HaShem ​ Genesis 16:5 וַתֹּ֨אמֶר שָׂרַ֣י אֶל־אַבְרָם֮ חֲמָסִ֣י עָלֶ֒יךָ֒ אָנֹכִ֗י נָתַ֤תִּי שִׁפְחָתִי֙ בְּחֵיקֶ֔ךָ וַתֵּ֙רֶא֙ כִּ֣י הָרָ֔תָה וָאֵקַ֖ל בְּעֵינֶ֑יהָ יִשְׁפֹּ֥ט יְהֹוָ֖ה בֵּינִ֥י וּבֵינֶֽיׄךָ׃ And Sarai said to Abram, “The wrong done me is your fault! I myself put my maid in your bosom; now that she sees that she is pregnant, I am lowered in her esteem. יהוה decide between you and me!” ​ See that when Avraham and Sarah had an argument, Sarah didn't lift her hand to pour out wine for Avraham like literally everyone does nowadays H'S'U'. She spoke the judgement with her mouth, much softer as it corresponds to Malchuth and the lips Netzach and Hod rather than the hands that correspond to Gevurah (even the right hand that is Chesed contains Gevurah). "Behold! The Hand of HaShem hits!!" (Exodus). ​ --- ​ End of Berachoth 8a Steinsaltz רַב שֵׁשֶׁת מַהְדַּר אַפֵּיהּ וְגָרֵיס. אָמַר: אֲנַן בְּדִידַן וְאִינְהוּ בְּדִידְהוּ. The Gemara relates that Rav Sheshet would turn his face away from the Torah while it was being read and study. Explaining this practice, he said: We are engaged in ours, the study of the Oral Torah and they are engaged in theirs, listening to the Written Torah. Since Rav Sheshet was engaged in Torah study, he is not considered one who forsakes the Lord. ​ It is not a Biblical obligation to study the Torah twice in Hebrew and once in Aramaic or Rashi/Friends every year. Actually if you have had your Wisdom teeth pulled and only have half the supernal ones in like me, it could be extremely torturous to plow through this much Earth, Seeds of Wisdom. ​ ​ Chodesh Tov and Shabbat Shalom​ ​ Updated Tamuz 3 10:26 ET ​ There is a covenant with your lips (Talmud) and the mouth is corresponding to the Holy of Holies!! Just as HaShem appears as Elohim when He is Angry and Ayl when he is Kind so too I like to change my name depending on how my horse (my Malchut, you all) is treating me. What do I want to be all the time? Nathan AyliYaHu Yad-Shadaiy. The first two my mother used to call me (giving it 3 of 3 in importance according to the Gemara) and the third is a play on the last name my parents gave me. Instead of HarShadaiy I went Yad since I would rather be like the "Hand of the King" as in His Segan, His "Right Hand Man" than look like Mount Tzion does right now (infested with metaphorical crickets).
